description:
Super Duper Burger is one of my favorite spots to go to in SF! I feel like it's the only place left in the city where I can get a burger and fries and pay less than $10 for it all. And the quality is superb!

The burgers are great to eat, the milkshakes are delicious (especially spiked), and their veggie burger keeps my vegetarian girlfriend coming back with me every time :)

It's simple food of course, but well worth a visit! I may lose some California points for saying this but it may even beat In N Out
author: Arya B.

description:
Came here with a friend while I was visiting SF. Had never been to a Super Duper before. 

I ordered a mini burger with cheese and the garlic fries with the sauces. He had a mini burger and ordered a chocolate shake to share. 

The burger was very good (I love sesame buns) but the patty itself was far too salty. I thought the size was perfect.

The garlic fries were far too greasy. The garlic flavor was strong, which I liked, but I could've skipped the cheese on top. Wasn't wild about the sauces. If I were to come back, would just order the plain fries and miss the sauces out. 

The shake was only ok. Wasn't as chocolatey as I normally prefer. I'd say the main stand out for me was the free homemade cucumber pickles they had near the drink fountains. So good!
author: Ashtar B.

description:
Great burgers, decent price, fast service. (Also great pickles). 

If you've never been here, stand in line, order at the counter, pay, bring your buzzer to a table, wait for it to buzz then grab your food from the counter. Pickles can be obtained next to the drink machines, in the large glass jars. They also have happy hour sometime, but I don't drink, so I've never actually done the happy hour. 

Super Duper is just an SF classic. The burgers are juicy and wonderful (I always get everything + chilies, and the grab the pickles on the side). The milkshakes are actually super good (I get chocolate w/ strawberries, which is a great combo). 

This particular location was clean, service was fast, and overall, a great experience.
author: Sophie W.

description:
I always get the market st and this location mixed up. This has to be my 3rd visit since this place has opened up in the city. Before my recent visit, I had thought the burgers were overpriced for the quality.

Now to re-evaluate:

Service is pretty fast pace. Nothing to complain about. You order and they hand you a beeper and you get your food on an aluminum tray.

You do have to pay extra for cheese. Pretty ridiculous. Anyway:

Double burger: delicious! Patties were nice and salty, a good mix of fat and lean meat. But mostly fat. If you are a health nut, I recommend the chicken burger...

Chicken burger: I was very disappointed, since I assumed it was a deep fried burger. Aside from that, it was good. Big chunk of grilled chicken marinated in chipotle sauce. I originally ordered that, but switch burgers with my bf.

Fries: taste crisp and fresh. Super bomb!

Okay place to stop by if you want to treat yourself to a gourmet burger. If not, there's a Burger King nearby.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Finally used the gift card I got from attending the Yelp Elite event at the Berkeley location.  I ordered the veggie burger with lettuce sans the bun with avocado and a side of fries.  It was just as good as the first time I had it!  This location is more touristy since it's in the heart of Downtown definitely for those walking or Uber/Lyfting. I was driving and had to park a few blocks away and walk over.  

Seating is ample both outside and inside.  I didn't take advantage of either since I took my order to go.  Service was great, it was busy but the line moved fast and my food was ready after I took a quick trip to the clean, well kept bathrooms which is for customers only and requires a code. They say you can tell the cleanliness of a restaurant by their bathroom.  Well gold star for Super Duper Burger on Market!
author: Cianni E.

description:
Can there be a Super Duper Burgers chain in Los Angeles already????

So you walk in, wait in line and you order your food at the register. They give you a buzzer and you pick up your food at the counter. They actually have a lot of seating. There are tables outside, inside, and a medium section on the second floor.

The garlic fries and chicken sandwich are AMAZING. Probably one of the best garlic friends and chicken sandwich I've ever had. I just didn't want it to end! The chicken wasn't dry at all. They're very generous with their proportions. Everything was just right. For the quality of food, the price was definitely worth it. 

I took off a star because this location had a lot of homeless people walking in and out of the restaurant. I didn't exactly feel safe as I was trying to enjoy my meal. Also, the tables weren't really kept clean. We had to wipe off the mess on our tables. It would have been nice if the staff were a bit more attentive.
author: Regine D.

description:
There is something about these burgers that keeps me coming back for more. The ratio of bun, meat, cheese, ketchup is always on point and the patties are always juicy. I particularly enjoy partaking in the unlimited, free pickles. 

During my last visit here, I finally tried the chocolate dipped soft serve which was simply amazing.
author: Simon S.

description:
This is my second time at Super Duper Burgers and I am a big fan. Greats prices and great food. The first time I went, I ordered a super burger with two 4oz patties, a beer and garlic fries. The super burger is enormous for $8 which was way too much food for me - I was stuffed, but it was really good! I asked for everything on it (but no cheese - which is extra $) and grabbed some pickles on the side. All of the pickles are available next to the organic ketchup to be tonged from a pickle jar. The garlic fries had plenty of garlic and cheese, the portion was big and they tasted really good. The fries themselves were very crispy. The beer is also a great deal at $5. 

My second trip included a mini burger which was much more my size, regular french fries, an adult sized twisted cone and a kid sized twisted shake. I actually ordered a kids twisted cone and they made me the kids shake on accident, so they told me to keep the shake and additionally gave me an adult sized cone to make up the cost difference. Even though I really didn't want this much ice cream, I thought the customer service was great! 

The location itself has tons of seating upstairs and downstairs, even a few tables outside as well. I thought the restaurant was clean, as were the bathrooms. This is officially one of my favorite lunch spots when I'm in the financial district/at work.
author: Bri T.

description:
Pretty good burger place in San Francisco. More reasonably priced than other places around (since everything is just stupid expensive). They have a good deal during Happy Hour, $15 for a pitcher of beer and some fries. Was good to sit outside and chat.

Not a bad place to hangout for a short time.
author: Taylor Z.

description:
Came here right after my check-in @ the hotel.

I know.. the burgers are made from vegetarian fed beef but damn.. nearly $6 for a mini burger? Thats almost equivalent to a meal at In-n-out!

So yes the burgers here are a a tad bit pricey but they are quite tasty, so yes i would definitely return to try their other items on the menu.

Oh & their garlic fries are bomb dot com! Definitely order one of those if you've made your way here, you wont be disappointed.. trust.
author: Steven H.

description:
This by far my favorite non-table-service burger in town (sorry In-N-Out).  It is a bit pricier than fast food, costing about $14 if you want the Super Duper Combo w/ Cheese.  A bargain compared to eating at restaurants in San Francisco, but definitely higher priced than Value Meals.  But it's totally worth it for the quality upgrade.

Super Duper Burger w/ Cheese: The patties are thick and juicy, with a brilliant sear on each side.  Infused with a nice fat-to-meat ratio, the mild cheddar cheese adds some extra richness to the experience.  I always get everything on it, plus jalapeños.  I've tried the specialty burger flavors, but something about the original format just makes it my favorite.

Fries: These have definitely improved over the years.  I remember their fries used to be disappointing like In-N-Out fries.  Now they're better, though not quite at McDonald's fries level yet.

Pickles: I absolutely love sour pickles (...though find sweet bread & butter pickles pretty nasty).  They taste fresh (for a pickle), not like they've been sitting around in vinegar for months.  So I can down quite a few spears while my burger is getting ready.  And then the pickle party continues during my burger to help cleanse the palate of all that rich fat between bites.
author: Adam B.

description: First time here and it is okay.  Someone just reviewed it and said it might beat In N Out. -- NOT NOT.  But I did like the burger.  I got a single combo burger with cheese.   Fries were good and crispy.   They did not have BBq sauce.  Small drink cups.  Ice tea was ok.  I tried a pickle and it was okay.  Glad I tried it though as I live in S. CA and really like IN N Out and Habit Burger much better.   It was loud and loud music here.
author: Bruce M.

description: I stopped off here twice for milk shakes - first time was the cookies and cream and the second time was the vanilla shake. The cookies and cream was pretty good but I don't think that it is worth the added cost, and it seemed to melt rather quickly. The vanilla was good but I was left with the heavy dairy feeling afterwords. The staff does a good job of getting people through the line quickly. I had every intention of getting a burger and fries for lunch but I never made it happen; although the food does look good. They offer two patty sizes: 4 and 8 oz. Fries are hand-cut and looked pretty darn enticing.
author: John C.

description:
Any place that has self serve, all you want pickles is going to be a great place in my opinion. However, this place has great burgers and tasty fries to go with this slightly spiced pickles. 

I tried the Mini combo, which is a single patty and the right amount of food for me. If you're wanting more, they offer a double patty option as well. 

The food was fresh and delicious, definitely a family friendly choice and worth the walk.
author: Chris D.

description:
Stopped here for some lunch and it was good! Believe the hype! 

You walk in and order at the counter and then choose your seats. There are seats upstairs and down and both have napkin stations. The pickles at this station are great! 

I had a cheeseburger and it was amazing! The burger was cooked perfectly and the vegetables were fresh. The staff walking around were very helpful and did a great job at making sure it was kept clean and ready for the next customer. 

It was so good i didnt one picture
author: Jenny W.

description:
Super Duper Burger  
When we say THIS is our go to spot, we mean it. Nothing feels better than the cheese on the soft meat of super duper! A must try in the city  
Super Burger (with cheese)- $8.25
Garlic Fries- $3.25
Regular Fries- $2.75
author: Couple E.

description:
Decided to try it out yesterday because I saw Harvey K's mouth watering french fry pics from another location. 

Ordered a mini burger and small french fries. Lady misheard me and I got a super burger instead. Ordered some donuts, but they don't sell 'em past 11 am. I ended up getting them for free!! WOW!

Anywho, I needed a pile of napkins because the burger was far too juicy. Oil kept dripping down my hand every time I bit into the burger. 

Fries nice and crispy, not limp like McD's. Ate a couple of fries, but gave them away to the nice homeless man because I was stuffed silly from the burger, matcha latte, and free donut.
author: Anna L.

description:
Can always count on a good burger and fries here.

My go to are the garlic fries and a mini burger at this chain. Both were delicious and inhaled upon sitting down. I can't say I've ever been disappointed. Fresh ingredients are always a plus.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Oh My Damn!  The four cheese burger is one of the best burgers I've had....EVER and the Vanilla shake actually tastes Vanilla!!
Quick and courteous service.  Can't recommend this spot highly enough.  Let it happen to you~
author: Van H.

description:
If looking for a solid burger in the city, it is hard to beat going to Super Duper. I like to describe it as a much better Five Guys, with Beer. And for those that haven't had Five Guys, these burgers might be too good for you.

Though because this is the Market Street location, expect schizophrenic yelling outside and aggressive homeless panhandling inside! And depending on time also long lines, confused Asian tourists 

That shouldn't drive you away, however. The food speaks for itself. While they have salads and chicken sandwiches, the place is called Super Duper BURGERS. So you should probably get one of those. Split between the single "Mini" and the double "Super Duper" you can get them standalone or in a combo; they have seasonal specials like the Ceasar and the 4 Cheese. 

While I've felt like a fatty getting the Super Duper Combo and a Milkshake before, as my metabolism and lactose tolerance isn't as strong anymore, I usually get a Mini combo, adding cheese and bacon and including all the extras - lettuce, tomato, onion, sauce. This will usually be just enough and easily inhale the tasty burger. Don't forget the napkin dispensers because you will need them! If you like pickles, ketchup, and mustard, they have that available as well. 

I'm a fan and will usually hit them up once a year. While you do have Roam and Umami for fancier burgers, hard to beat Super Duper for quick and tasty.
author: Michael C.

description:
I can always appreciate a burger joint.

Was looking to get a snack around the city with my roommate until we came across this place. He raved about how good this place was every time he went so this really got my expectations up a little bit. 

I ended getting a Super Burger and a side order of garlic fries. Initial thought was it looked incredibly mouth watering however I thought the portions were pretty small for what I paid for in comparison to what you would get for the same amount at Five Guys. Taking a bite in, it just tasted like regular burger. I didn't really taste that super sauce they were talking about the register. The garlic fries were pretty good actually, but the serving size was kind of small.

Overall, I still prefer Five Guys over this place with portion size and taste being my main factors.
author: Timothy D.

description:
A Bay Area stable of sustainable locally sourced hamburger goodness!   The cost is a little high, but the best was never the cheapest!  

Love the all you can eat pickles.  I am a huge fan of Straus Farms.  Their milk products are great.  

What did I learn today?  Straus chocolate milk has to be the best chocolate milk on the planet.
author: Ryan C.

description:
First time here and I opted for the mini-burger with a cookies and cream milkshake while my wife chose a mini-burger with egg and cheese and a strawberry milkshake. We shared garlic fries and picked up some pickles from the self-serve area.

The mini-burger was a good proportion and the fries can definitely be shared. The only thing I would caution is that the egg can get a bit messy, but it is still delicious.

This location is also home to some amazing customer service and an extremely friendly staff/manager. I would highly recommend trying this place out, I've seen it several times and kept passing on it, but that was a huge mistake.
author: Kareem G.

description:
A-freakin'-MAZIN'. I literally went here twice in one week since I just started working down the street, and coworkers recommended it.

Where to begin...I came here at lunch time both times, the line seemed long but they are efficient AF here; I got my food in about ten minutes. I ordered the mini burger meal ($~12) which comes with a burger with fries and a drink (pretty standard) but you gotta pay extra for cheese - sad, but worth it. 

Also I think it's EXTREMELY important to mention that:
1) their ranch dressing is bomb.com (trust me, I know good ranch) 
2) there are the kindest workers carrying around free donut samples that you must try
3) their ranch is really good (so good it was worth mentioning again)

Overall, seriously one of the best "fast-food" burgers I've had; the burgers are seasoned so good, fries are on fleek (not too thin..not too thicc) and finally: THEIR RANCH. Go. And try their ranch.
author: Jamie J.

description:
Came here on a Sunday around 6:30pm we were starving after walking ALL OVER San Francisco all day long, a good burger sounded nice and we heard good things about this place.  There was a small line, and just enough seating when we arrived.

Ordered 2 Super Burgers w/Cheese and Bacon and a side of Garlic cheese fries.
-Price-  
Super Burgers: 8.25
Bacon: 1.25 extra
Cheese: .75 extra. 
Garlic fries: 3.50
And of course we had to try their "3 fry dips" which was another: 1.50

3 dips included: "Super Sauce, "House made Mayo", and "Chipotle" sauce.  I actually didn't have a favorite because they all tasted so good.  I probably ate more of the super sauce and mayo though.  

The burgers themselves were pretty delicious.  The cheese really stands out and the bacon is cooked perfectly.  They wrap your burger really nicely so that the grease that oozes out of the bottom doesn't make too much of a mess, which is a small downside because i'm not a big fan of super greasy foods and this was really greasy! 

A decent burger.  Will definitely come back!  I see all the reviews for the shakes as well and saw a lot of people ordering them.  When we do come back we will need to try though... (Yum)!
author: Tori G.

description:
The burgers here are great. Kind of reminds me of Good Stuff Eatery on the east coast in DC in terms of menu and restaurant design. 

I got a deluxe burger meal, and added avocado (don't waste your money the burger is so stuffing you can't even taste it smashed on the bottom layer). I also replaced my fountain drink with fresh juices orange juice (well worth it). It's fast and cheap. You can get a very filling meal for $15-$20.
author: Nikki J.

description: Great burger and fry place. For guys, you'll probably want to order the super duper burger, comes with 2- 4oz patties instead of one. Lettuce, tomato and red onions are automatically included. You can get grilled onions and pickles in request. Their condiment bar consist of ketchup, mustard, sweet & sour and homemade pickles. They have heavenly garlic fries which need no sauce. It's pretty loud in there so don't expect to carry on conversations. They play weird music though, doesn't fit the atmosphere. Food is made fast and hot. This is a great place to take a break while shopping in Union Square.
author: Mai D.

description: So my cousins came to visit so I decided to take them to super Duber Burgers for some milkshake and burgers. On our way home, they kept talking about the size and how yummy they were. I love their food.
author: James S.

description: Came here on a busy weekday because of Dreamforce event.  It was super packed so I can't really comment on other days, but it was so hard to find a seat for 4.  They have additional seating upstairs, but still that wasn't enough.  I waited about 10 min to get my food.  Ordered the mini burger and my husband ordered the super burger with that extra patty.  The burger was so juicy and delicious I finished it quick and could have probably went up for seconds.  Their pickles are home made and made to perfection.  Their fries were crispy.  Overall, their burger was real good and juicy, I'll be checking out their other locations.
author: KB B.

description: I had a wonderful experience with super duper burgers.  Their prices are quite affordable. I had their chocolate milkshake, fries, and a mini burger. Everything was fresh and the taste was absolutely heavenly. I would come here again and definitely recommend this place to my friends.
author: Emily T.

description:
Came on a Friday at 6pm with no wait and available tables - score!

Mini burger, everything on it, add cheese ($6.25) - decent burger, meat was very moist, but nothing special and a little pricier than what I would like to have paid
Garlic fries ($3.50) - enjoyed the 6 month aged cheddar, would have been cool if the cheese was slightly more melted
Fresh strawberries organic shake ($5.75) - shake was good and definitely didn't taste artificial like other places

Fast service, ingredients tasted fresh, and I appreciate that they have nice self-serve crunchy pickles in jars. But I'd still choose In-N-Out's burger any day, even if price wasn't a factor.
author: Nicole M.

description:
9/13/2018

Gio & I got 2 mini (4oz.? patty) with cheese  can't compare to In N Out!! sloppy presentation...funky tasting beef...asked for sauce on the side...  nope! requested xtra crispy fries no again....won't return!!
author: Bob W.

description:
WOW!  I guess i should not be surprised since they have 2,000+ reviews at 4 stars but wow!

We got the super duper burger (2 patties) with everything and an order of garlic fries which came out to be about $15.  ($14 and some change to be exact.). 

The burger tasted super fresh, as if it was made right when we ordered it (i think it was actually.). The beef patties were very juicy and flavorful although i think it could have been a bit bigger.  

However, the order of fries were pretty big, fresh, and very garlic-y.  (My fiancee keeps talking to me and i cant hear a word she's saying bc all i smell is her garlic breath!)

The price is a bit steep for burger & fries but it's well worth it.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Jang N.

description:
Decided to try a different branch of super duper burger after trying the Castro branch.  This one seemed to be an improvement as the burgers seemed much less greasy.  

This branch has a lot of foot traffic because it is located downtown near metreon and Westfield mall.  They have two floors for seating and they give you a buzzer to pick up your food from the counter when it is ready.

I had their burger, and a spiked chocolate shake.  I also shared some of their garlic fries and sauces with a friend.  The burger was a lot less greasy which was good and also more flavorful. Perhaps the Castro branch was just having an off day.  The spiked shake was alright. Didn't really taste the booze as much, but you can't really expect much from a "fast food" burger joint.  The fries were decent, and the sauces(which cost extra) were good.  

They have a comdiments area where you can get some ketchup, mustard, and homemade pickles.  The pickles were good, so if you like them, definitely try some.  The ketchup is different from other places and  actually tasted like tomato sauce instead of pure sugar which was good.
author: Jacky C.

description: Super Duper Oily burger and Garlic fries!! I literally felt like eating 3/4 tea spoons of extra oil. Definitely not good for dinner.The burger was just okay ( I found it less tasty and healthy than InNOut & Five guys). Super burger is just as big as InNOut's double double with almost double price($8 approx). There is nothing special in the toppings as well( onion,lettuce, tomato),very basic.
author: Symon Z.

description:
First time trying this place and it's hands down my favorite burger place.
I ordered a mini cheeseburger and added grilled onions and Porto Bella mushrooms. 
The burger was sooooo good! I also ordered garlic fries and they were made to perfection.
To drink I ordered a vanilla shake and it was also good. 
I will for sure come back to this place.
author: Mayumi H.

description:
It isn't gourmet, but it's a darn good burger.

I came here late night with some friends after a banquet for a non-profit fundraiser and we were starving.  Thankfully this is one of the few places that is open late, and being that it was my first night out back in September in my new home city, it was a nice welcoming admittedly.  Things that I tried included the single burger with an added fried egg (c'mon, you can't say no to a fried egg!) as well as garlic fries to share for the table.

Burger With Fried Egg
PROS
- amazing: the egg was cooked perfectly (over easy) and the flavors of the dripping yolk over the meat was the best combination I've had so far.
- great quantity: it wasn't a small burger by far
- good flavor: not overly dressed with sauce or toppings
- able to have additions like avocado, etc.
CONS
- none that I can find with a quick burger joing

Garlic Cheese Fries
PROS
- great quantity to share
- good flavors: definitely garlicky - don't bring your date here unless you are both fans of garlic!
- good amount of cheese on top!
CONS
- gets cold fast - this isn't so much a con but it doesn't quite go down as well when the cheese gets cold along with the fries it's sitting on.

I'd definitely come here again for a burger.  Thankfully this location is pretty close to me.  One of the things that I love is that it's open late.  Having just recently moved from New York, I'm always looking for late night food joints.  Feeling super good about this one!
author: Vera L.

description: Yum! Great spot, and one of my favorite fast food burgers. The meat is good and for the price and speed, it's a good deal.
author: Michelle B.

description:
it's a very greasy burger
the kind u do take home to dinner
it will never eat ur spirits down
once u get delivery

burger is pretty wild now
the super duper grease!
kinda burger u read about
in new food blog postings
burger is pretty cheesy
a super duper grease!
i rly love to taste it
every time i eat

it's aite it's aite
burger's alright w meee ya
super duper grease, super grease!
it's super greasehhh yaw!
author: Dan B.

description: I visited here for the first time. I know it is a famous hamburger restaurant in San Francisco. It was really delicious. Slightly greasy but it was also fascinating. There are a few people and there is a table up to the second floor. Try visiting this place!
author: Jiyeon L.

description:
"I still eat a burger at a counter with ketchup dripping down my face." - Scarlett Johansson

Mmm. Who doesn't like a burger, or better who doesn't love a good, fresh burger, dripping hot right off the grill?! I have to admit the burger at Super Duper Burgers was tastier than I expected. Okay, maybe it was my midnight flight from Honolulu to Salt Lake City and eventually to San Francisco that made my taste buds burst with joy, but I'm gonna say something controversial... it's way better than In-N-Out!

There I said it. Don't get me wrong I love In-N-Out too, and I've been to several locations on the west coast - the best coast, but my first visit to Super Duper has me convinced that what I just consumed, between two fresh buns, was superior to whatever I had at In-N-Out. And sorry, my only proof is my crumpled eco-friendly napkins & a very satisfied stomach. Oh my was it good for you too, Scarlett?

The nanosecond I walked-in I felt safe & knew I belonged. Maybe it was the attractive hapa counter gal taking my combo order with fries & iced tea that started me up, or maybe it was a Mr. Spike Lee (see pic) challenging me on the east coast is the best coast theory, but the casual vibe with hand painted signs everywhere, and recyclable everything made it so right. Heck, good ol' friend Spike was too busy inhaling his soft cone to argue his Yo Knicks or Do The Right Thing, circa 1989 with me... no matter because it was all about the burgers, but not just any burger... a Super Duper Burger! And did I mention happy hour they have with b-e-e-r on tap!? Not a beer drinker? How about wine on tap, or a killer milkshake, or even Spike(d) shake! Just ask! 

So if I'm correct, excuse Spike still grubbing away, this is a Bay Area phenomenon. The best burger on any coast is here, well under ten bucks! I mean I can debate Scarlett & Spike on how for $300, Le Burger Extravagant from New York's Serendipity 3 might be better, and yea it's a ten-ounce Wagyu beef patty infused with 10-herb white truffle butter, seasoned with Alderwood smoked sea salt, topped with Montgomery cheddar cheese, shaved black truffles, and a fried quail egg, served on a white truffle buttered 24K gold flecked Campagna roll, which is topped with a blini crème fraiche and Kaluga caviar. Yo! Let's just respectfully bury the coast talk with Tupac & Biggie, R.I.P. Besides rich folks... who spends $300 on burgers? And no, Spike Lee is not Chinese! Yo, who even cares because to me I just found the best burger ever under a Hamilton! That's ten bucks on you! 

*walks out with Scarlett Johansson smiling from ear to ear* And I don't want to brag, but... it was more than my Super Duper... To be continued...
author: Eric R.

description:
PROS: 

- Pretty good burgers
- Fries were delicious
- Garlic fries were also delicious
- A la carte pickles
- Organic ketchup? 
- Decent amount of space and seats inside

CONS: 

- Pretty much a 5 guys clone
author: Chong Y.

description:
Ayyyy, Super Duper Burger is where it's at!

Ever since my favorite burger joint in Portland burned down I've been struggling to find a burger place that just knows how to get it perfect. 
Super Duper Burger definitely exceeded my expectations.

The restaurant itself is in a good location, clean and sunny. Service was top. Although we had never been there before - which made us that annoying couple that couldn't make up their mind - the cashier was super friendly and helpful.

Now food: Oh man, I'm literally the worst when it comes to eating any sort of meat and am extremely picky but Super Duper Burgers blew it out of the park. Imagine a juicy burger, cooked to perfection that's crispy on the outside but full of juices once you take your first bite! Their signature sauce and fresh toppings were just a cherry on top. 
Even the fries were just so crispy and perfectly cooked. 
Being the lame tourists that visit Cali and want to eat at In and Out we had no plans on eating burgers anywhere else but since we were so hungry we decided to "settle" for Super Duper Burger. 
Now lemme tell you, this was by far one of the best burgers I have ever had and when I still hit up In and Out a few days later I was greatly disappointed by how boring In and Out tasted in comparison to Super Duper.
author: Sarah T.

description:
My friend and I were visiting SF and our first stop was SFMOMA! In between appreciating art, we found ourselves getting hungry and used Yelp to figure out what was nearby with good reviews. We decided on Super Duper Burgers as we'd also heard a local friend describe this place as 'In-N-Out but organic'. I love In-N-Out so I knew I had to try it!

I got the Mini Burger and it was still really filling. Every bite felt fresh and I could taste the quality of the ingredients. The real star was the house-made ketchup though! I love that it didn't taste as sweet as mass-produced ketchup and it was the perfect condiment to elevate the burger. My friend got the Chicken Sandwich and it was huge and yummy. The chipotle aioli definitely leans on the spicier side so I wouldn't suggest it if you can't take some heat.

We also shared the garlic fries and they were perfectly crispy. Seating was a bit limited as this place was packed but we managed to hover around and find something decently fast. Would recommend if you're in the area and want something quick but delicious.
author: Ariel L.

description:
Walking around financial district past 5pm, it can be hard at times to find a decent meal at a decent price if places are open. My friends and I were on our way to the Century theatre to watch the movie "It" and we came here for a quick dinner stop. 

For a Friday night it wasn't too busy and they have indoor and outdoor seating available. I ended up getting the super burger with everything on it and jalapeños with added cheese for a dollar. The burger was super filling. I also got garlic fries with their three sauces on the side and it was the perfect portion to share with another person! 

My favorite part about this place was their serve yourself pickles!!!! They were sooooo good and I would honestly come back here for a burger just so I could eat some more of their pickles. 

Pricing is pretty decent for the juicy and high quality burger that you get. I would definitely come back again for another burger!
author: Emily T.

description:
Super Duper Burgers offers the standard burgers, shakes and fries at a fast food pace with mid-range prices. 

Price: 
I ordered the super burger, no cheese with everything else included (onions, lettuce, tomatoes) ($7) with a side of garlic parmesan fries ($4) and a kid sized chocolate dipped cone ($4). My total came out to around $16 including tax. 

Food:
The burger was really good! I kind of wished it had a little more seasoning on the meat itself but the bun, lettuce and tomato were all really fresh! The fries were really crunchy and rich - a little heavier on the cheese than garlic flavor, but good nonetheless - just maybe don't market it as garlic fries if they're not going to taste garlicky! 

Weirdly enough the ice cream was my favorite part! Tasted like a classic chocolate dipped cone from the drive-thrus of my childhood. Would definitely recommend you save room for dessert to try one of these, whatever chocolate they use is really sweet and complements the mild vanilla flavor of the ice cream well.

Service:
They were so fast and helpful! The cashier asked if it was my first time there and explained how big the patties were and recommended a few options to me. Food came out about five minutes after we ordered, was impressed with the speed and quality of service.

Overall, good place - burger and fries weren't amazing but they were definitely good! Would recommend you try it if you're in the area!
author: Janice C.

description:
We were craving a juicy meaty burger and fires, so we decided on this place. This place is pretty cool in a very busy neighborhood as is every other place in SF. I've got to say this place makes you feel at ease and puts you in a good mood. 

Decor-nice, industrial modern looking restaurant with hints of country. Multiple dining levels with bench and table seating. We sat downstairs and enjoyed a couple rounds of foosball, very fun!

Service-not much to say, you order at the counter and pick up at counter. Cashier was helpful, not very happy. 

Food-not very impressed with burgers. Nothing out of the norm, didn't have cool burgers with BBQ sauce or onion rings. Just simple patties that you could add bacon and cheese to. Fries were again standard and garlic were average as well. Was really hoping for a super duper burger not an average burger with just a patty, cheese, and bacon. 

Tip-cool place to hang out and play foosball with super duper average burgers.
author: German R.

description: The burgers are great to fill your belly after a few solid drinks, burgers are full of that crave satisfying flavor Ess. And are worth the wait and price . Watch out your hands and fingers will get to taste the burgers as well, literally finger licking good!
author: Juan G.

description:
Instead of 4-Stars, it would be more accurate to give them a 3.5-Star rating; but since their burgers are delicious, they do round up, although their portions are on the small size. 

I've been here twice now, and they're a nice unique burger place to go to if you're in this part of the SF area of Market St. They are located right next to the Powell BART station, so they're easy to get to. Even though they have additional seating upstairs, seating is limited, as they do get very busy. They do have restrooms inside, but you'll need a passcode, which is available on the receipt after you order. 

As for their food, they're good; but their prices are pretty expensive and their portions are definitely on the smaller size, although you are getting everything cooked on the fresh & healthier side. If you want their Mini Burger, it is really small; whereas their Super Burger is closer to a regular sized burger. Even if you want a mini burger combo meal, it will cost you over $11 after taxes. 

I ordered their Chicken Sandwich with aioli, which was very good. You do get the quality that you pay for, but I was disappointed with the sizes of their sandwiches.
author: Johnny W.

description: Delicious burgers!! Better than In and Out. Similar in appearance to shake shack in nyc but tastes better! Juicy burgers. Delicious rich shakes.
author: Ranjeeta S.

description:
I came here on a Sunday and it does get crowded at lunch, at about 12. Modern space, staff is friendly, the combo price can be a little high.

I got the veggie burger, which turned out alright. It's not the biggest patty, but it's sufficient for a decent sized lunch. I was excited for the garlic fries, but they came out slightly under lukewarm, so by the time I was finishing I had cold fries. There is cheese on top as well, but it doesn't melt since the temp isn't high enough (if that's your thing).

Overall, I think it's an okay place to grab a bite to eat, but the freshness & temp of the fries is the main concern here.
author: Spencer H.

description: Amazing! Very affordable, fast service! If you want a fresh, handmade burger, you must try this. The garlic fries are awesome and the super salad too. 100% loves everything!
author: Samuel F.

description:
When I came to SF I didn't think the best place would be a burger joint! Juicy, tasty and the lines move quick. Ate at the market location. You HAVE to try the homemade pickles. Garlic fries were great the first time, second time could have been stronger.


Shakes and beer too. What's not to love
author: Layla E.

description:
I find it hilarious reading my colleagues recaps of Super Duper from year's past. It seems the issue is that some people ABSOLUTELY LOVE (IN ALL CAPS) this SF fast casual burger staple, however the hype ends up being too over the top, and expectations aren't met. 

Here's the sitch: Post Gym / Pre Beer Share. What do I do? Find a quick and affordable option in walking distance of my hotel. I open up my Yelp app to discover Super Duper right around the corner. Having missed out on visits with my teammates, I decided it was time. 

The order: Super Burger (add cheese) + Garlic Fries. 

The verdict: Oh yeahhh, this was a deliciously tasty burger! Two four oz. patties with excellent char glued together with melty cheese, topped with LTO and yummy sauce, in between a soft, sesame seed bun. I appreciate the hell out of this old school recipe executed wonderfully. 

For me, the fries were a bit much. They were rich as hell due to the aged cheddar. Honestly, I probably should have opted for the classic fries. Can I get a holla for those house made pickles though?! I could snack on these puppies for days.

Overall, I find Super Duper to be a west coast spin on many of the fast casual burger joints in my neck of the woods. Over 2000 reviews and a four star rating is nothing to sneeze at. Well I'll be damned, I'm a fan.
author: Matthew C.

description: I'd been hearing about this local burger chain for a while. We were shopping in the area and stopped in for dinner. There's not too many places open on a weekend in this financial district area. But luckily Super Duper is. The menu is pretty small, which is fine with me. Since it was my first time (and I wasn't very hungry), I just got a plain mini burger.  My bf, being the hungry beast he is, he had the super burger, which is two patties and added the bacon and cheese. With all the add-on's, it's a $10+ burger. And that's just the burger. If you want fries and a drink, that's more. I don't think the combos save you any money. I mean sure, it was good burger. Veggies seemed fresh and the meat had a good beef flavor. We also split a basket of fries. Fries were ok. You also order and pay at the counter, and they give you a beeper to pick up your food. Easy meal
author: Alison W.

description:
Stopped in here for a quick snack recently and enjoyed it! Service was quick and I really liked the milkshake. 

The fries weren't overly delicious, but since they were less than $3 I can't complain too much. 

The cookies and cream shake is your best bet!
author: Sarah G.

description: Super Duper has been quite a hit or miss place for me. Visited this branch on Market street with a group of friends for a Friday dinner, and ordered their burger and fries combo. The burger was decent -- the patty was quite juicy, but the portion size was small for the price. The garlic fries were tasty but unfortunately a bit too greasy for me.
author: Alvin W.

description:
Great burgers!!!! Yummy Garlic Fries!!!!yummmmmmmmmmmmmmm


Yummy burgers with must have Garlic Fries!!!
author: Vinod A.

description:
Veggie burger was fine, and so were the fries.

A+++ for the chocolate dipped soft serve!!
author: Vivian K.

description: Yes!  Great burger at a great price!  Probably the best veggie burger I have ever had.  They serve their veggie burger with hummus and cucumber slices, you can also add avocado and/or cheese.  The veggie burger and fries were eleven dollars & some change.  They also have beef burgers and chicken sandwiches, as well and salads.  To wash it all down you can choose from organic ice tea, beer, wine, or organic shakes to name a few.  For dessert they offer soft serve ice cream, and you even get a dipped cone!  It's a busy place, so be prepared to wait.  Grab your customer pager, stalk that couple in the corner finishing their last bites so you can pounce on the newly freed table, and wait.  Oh so worth it!
author: Chira E.

description:
Pro: Food tastes great and is in the realm off In-n-Out.

Con: Minimal seating given how crowded it can get (and outdoor seating is pretty shoddy) and no great parking option (although understandable given it's location in the city).

Food is tasty enough for me to return though given any downsides!
author: Zainab S.

description:
Walking into here, I knew I was in for a great surprise. I am from the LA area, and I wanted to try a delicious burger in the San Francisco area. I would totally compare this restaurant burger chain to the Habit or the Stand! Just because there are so many end it is authentic just buy their own. There was a long line but it went by quickly, My cousin and I ordered two regular cheeseburgers and we shared the garlic fries. When we ordered we were waiting for our food for 10 minutes and me and my cousin were wondering what is taking so long. My cousin went up to the person that's ever ordered and they told us there were some reason our order was not in the system. This made me really mad because we were waiting for food and for a long time and now we have to wait even longer, and we were also very hungry. They refunded my money, or you guys should be totally on top of me things. I am thankful that you guys gave me my money back and with the free food.


Now going towards the food, the food was a bit too greasy. It was really sweet which I enjoyed and the garlic fries had too many toppings on the top and it was basically regular fries in the middle and bottom! The burgers are really small so don't be expecting to be full by the end of your meal. All in all it was like a regular meal.
author: Cameron G.

description:
Came here for the first time and got their chicken sandwich while my sis got a burger. We both ordered garlic fries. 

Mmmmm....

So good. So juicy. So cheesy. So tasty.

Can't believe I never heard of this place before!!! It was bomb dot com.
author: Angelina Ariana A.

description:
SO. GOOD.

This place was recommended to us by our Lyft driver from LA, said we had to try this place-- bomb ass food! We took his advice and came on Christmas eve for dinner and it was pretty busy. We ordered a protein Super Burger, a regular Super Burger and two fries (one garlic). Let me just say: The prices here are NUTS. Wtf. Almost $9.00 after tax for a burger (about $25 for 2 burgers and 2 fries). Not to mention it's fucking tiny. Portion to price ratio is for real helter-skelter. (C'mon In-n-Out double protein burger is less than $3.00)

THANKFULLY the burger tasted AMAZING. If it weren't for that fact I'd give this place a lower rating. The patty meat was moist, tender and so flavorful, loved whatever it is they used to season their patties with. It wasn't too salty and it definitely wasn't bland. Juices were just dripping from my fingers as I devoured my burger. Best. Thing. EVAR.

Definitely would come again. I'd just swallow the pain of the prices. LOL.
author: Stacy C.

description:
I was craving for a burger when is saw my friend's snap chat and they had shake shack. I tried to search for a shake shack and they had none in San Francisco. The only thing that popped up in my google search was "Super Duper Burgers", and it did not disappoint me because it was one of the best burgers I have ever eaten before. 

Every bite i take the patty melted in my mouth typing this review making my mouth all watery again. I love this burger a lot, i can never forget because it was really good. I also got the garlic firies on the side, and it was really good too. The only thing i was thinking during this meal was what not to finish first the burger or the fires. It is well worth traveling here for a burger, will come back again when i am back in San Fran.

Overall: 5/5
author: Jackie Hk G.

description: I was craving a burger while wandering around SF and I'm so glad I stopped by Super Duper Burgers! For $15 I got a burger, fries, and a beer. The vibe was nice and the cashier was friendly. I couldn't have asked for more.
author: Kristin W.

description: I think these are the best burgers I've ever had. I went there 3 days in a row while in town for a conference nearby. Their garlic fries and breakfast sandwiches are also top notch. The ingredients, which are organic, are clearly very high quality which along with their perfect food prep, makes this place a standout. We need these in the Midwest!
author: Amy L.

description:
The whole sustainable thing is nice, but Super Duper Burger carries itself super duper well with just the quality of food, service, and environment. 

Service is quick and friendly. They use one of those disc things that vibrate and light up to let you know when your order is ready. I was also reminded after picking up my order to enjoy the unlimited pickles! 

I ordered the mini burger with cheese (single patty) combo, which comes with fries and a drink. Best burger I've ever had? No, but a very well made one for the price. The fries were also ALL nice and crispy! None of the soggy ones. Was very satisfied with the meal I got.

Decor here is an industrial modern look which is common, but still works. The place is very spacious and has plenty of seating. Place is kept really clean!

Definitely would recommend!
author: Viet T.

description: So yummy! I ordered a mini burger, fries with a chocolate milkshake. Everything was served quickly. All was tasty and hot except for my freezing chocolate milkshake. Quick, delicious. And reasonably priced.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Recently visited with the family during our stay in San Francisco.  Good burgers and fries.  A bit pricey for a burger, but fully understand cost is for the quality and wholesome ingredients.  Burgers are messy, in a good way. Very savory, flavorful, and cooked perfectly.  Fries, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside - very good.  Food was Good!

Different experiences with personnel - at time of ordering, the person taking our order wasn't very friendly and seemed like she was simply going through the motions, almost like she was walking through a script - responses were short, abrupt, and impatient.  (Note - we were the only people in line and it wasn't crowded).  Not the best message as this was the first impression of Super Duper burgers.  It got better, the individual that gave us our food was friendly, polite, and kindly answered a few questions.  This was much better especially in the service industry. 

Overall, good food and experience, would recommended trying if you haven't before.
author: Mike F.

description:
This Super Duper really hits the spot.  The food like at all Super Dupers is great and premium for a reasonable price.  The location in the heart of the financial district makes this a very convenient location for lunch and dinner.

If you go downstairs, there is more seating and a bunch of board games.  This location is open fairly late on weeknights and is open on weekends.  Truly a better burger restaurant.
author: Mark C.

description: Great good organic chicken sandwiches which are so delicious.  Fries okay, and there's shakes and malts, what more can you ask for.  Plus
author: Rudy S.

description: Best burgers in San Francisco. Mini combo such a great deal. With everything including "super sauce" is insanely delicious! You have to special request to swap fries for the garlic fries which are NOT to be skipped. Better be ready to walk off the home made pickles and organic catsup.
author: Julie F.

description:
Just like the name implies this burger is Super Duper. What a funny name I certainly wondered how they decided to come up with that name until I tried the burger then it became abundantly clear. If anybody follows my reviews they know that I am quick to hit a restaurant that has burger and it's name. The first thing I did when I got to San Francisco was look for the best burger around me. I came across Super Duper burgers and it had an awesome Yelp reviews so I thought I would give it a try. It was around around 5 o'clock on a Thursday and the line was manageable it took about five minutes to get to the front with about 10 people ahead of me. I navigated through the menu and landed on the Super Duper burger and garlic fries. We sat down and was pleasantly surprised to find out that pickles were free.Kind of like other restaurants would offer peanuts or chips for free. I took full advantage of this and damn near and got full on pickles. They were spicy and fresh. I am a pickle fiend and loved every bite. 

Now the good part. It took about 10 minutes for food to come and it looks amazing so I quickly got excited. I took one bite and quickly thought "Why don't we have one of these in my hometown!"It was absolutely amazing! The burger was juicy and cheesy (extra napkins are required) and the fries were absolutely to die for. Sprinkled with garlic and cheese. My wife was full and could not eat all of her fries so I pigged on those as well:) I was one of those meals where I felt sad after the first bite that this is going to end. If anyone knows how to ship a burger to Arizona please feel free to:)
author: Eric S.

description:
Not sure how I haven't reviewed this Super Duper before. I've been here a few times and as always their food is fantastic. Super Duper remains near the top of burgers I have tried in SF so far. 

As far as this specific location, it is generally clean and well maintained. There was plenty of seating, including an upstairs "loft" which overlooked the rest of the store. There was a small patio area outside which seemed like it would be too busy to be comfortable with all the foot traffic and crazy of downtown SF rushing by. 

Great burger, convenient location, good staff. This is a staple to SF.
author: John W.

description:
We got to SF hella early for a giants game and wanted to find a good burger to crave our hunger -- and hold us over till we could get into ATT park for their food.

We wanted to go to SAMS but they didn't open till 4pm and it was 2 pm and we were starving. I looked for another burger joint in the area and it was super duper burgers.

We walked close to a mile before arriving to the location. It was busy but we didn't have to wait long to order. I ordered the mini burger added cheese, bacon, avo, and jalapeños of course. Plus everything else but tomatoes. My husband got their double burger. And we ordered the garlic fries. 

We got our food and it looked and smelled so good. The burger patty was thick enough to satisfy and the toppings were fresh. The garlic fries were to die for. In my opinion I liked them more than the gilroy garlic fries in the park. 

The lady at the register was nice, asked us if we had been before and when we said no, she welcomed us and said we came at a good time. They are super busy at lunch hour. 

The milkshakes  and dipped cones looked bomb! 

Hope to come back!
author: Julie P.

description: Super good service and the food was bomb!! i definitely recommend coming here if you're in the SF area. Only downside to this place is the burgers are super greasy but they were good! and the ice cream was great
author: Nancy C.

description:
Good burger! A little greasy. Cool restaurant. Dicey!  Floors are slick with burger grease, including stairs and the tables. This place breathes "burger!" 

The burger has a good char on it. But the menu reads all burgers cooked medium, not necessarily what I expected. But still tasty. -1 star. The bacon is wicked! Get it. 

I got a choco shake, blah. Didn't order fries but the garlic cheddar looks good. My table neighbor had them. 

VERY limited seating. There are some community tables of your comfortable with eating around people you don't know. I am.
author: Troy C.

description: I walked for this place all the way from Golden Gate Bridge last on Labor Day weekend- while visiting SF. Burger is phenomenal. The fact that you can add whatever you want to it is solid. It does get pretty pricey pretty quick. I do recommend this place as long as you are OK dropping $15-25 for a burger w fries and soda. Give them a try.
author: Farzan M.

description:
Got their mini burger with everything in it, and added bacon to it. The size of this is perfect! Also got their garlic fries which are amazing! I love their ketchup too! They also have home made pickles which I love! 

This place was packed when I came on a Sunday night at around 7pm. Waited in line for about 10 mins, ordered and food was ready in like 7 mins so service is fast.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
This review is for a to-go experience rather than a sit-down experience. I had dropped by to grab a quick bite with some friends since it was in a convenient location.

The only thing I ordered was the mini burger, which actually was enough food for me personally. The difference between a super duper burger and the mini burger is just the super duper burger has two patties. 

Even though it's a burger place, it's not as fast as I expect. But it's not necessarily a bad thing since I think they make the burgers on the spot, so the burger ends up being really fresh and tasty. I personally really enjoyed my mini burger and would definitely come back for more!

My friend who comes here regularly also highly recommended the veggie burger (even though she's not vegetarian) because she said it tastes amazing. That's definitely something I want to try the next time I visit!
author: Nina W.

description: Wow, first time. This place is rocking. So fresh. Everything is made from scratch. Nice people too. Pickles for days.
author: Mcrag M.

description: Good american burgers. But for me as European way to fat. Service is great and the shakes are fantastic.
author: Dominik B.

description: I didn't give tips, but I forgot to write 0 tips. I finally have been charged 3 dollars tips from my credit card, it's so bad!!
author: 思

description: I've had the Super Duper egg sandwiches multiple times and they've always been delicious. My boyfriend had never been, so we came for lunch. I had the mini, he had the super, and we also got some regular fries. Service was friendly and quick, and we got our food relatively fast. Even though we decided to bring it home and eat it 20 min later, the food was still very delicious. We were disappointed in the odd tasting pickles, but had an overall yummy lunch at a reasonable price!
author: Kristine M.

description: I got the Super Duper Burger with cheese and bacon on it. It's definitely not bad but just ok. Nothing special. I know I shouldn't but I cannot stop comparing it with In-N-Out and I didn't like the patty which was super dry.
author: Keerthi C.

description:
With the SF MoMA being cornered by Super Duper Burgers, it's almost always guaranteed a viewing of contemporary art will be followed by delicious burgers, pickles, and Kensington ketchup. This location feels a lot more open than the other location just a few minutes walk away. It doesn't feel as packed and that makes the meal much more enjoyable for me and my fellow claustrophobes and messy eaters.

While the food is super duper--it is a Super Duper Burger joint--it was the act of kindness I witnessed that made me sure that this was the Super Duper I'd be going to. Eating today, I noticed a handicapped person wanting to order what he could with the little money he had in his hand. The management quickly gave him the meal on the house and it warmed my heart to see them do it so instinctively.

This Super Duper cares and I like that. They'll get me as a customer every time I'm in town for burgers.
author: Renneth D.

description:
Great spot for a quick lunch along Market Street!

I attended a conference at a hotel right around the corner so a few of us went to Super Duper for lunch. The line was to the door around 12:30 but staff handed out menus to those in line, and the line went fast.

I opted for a Super Duper combo - a burger, fries and fountain drink for $13. Pretty affordable lunch for SF. I ordered it to go, but some tables opened up so my group opted to dine in.

The burger was hefty (and kind of messy - grab napkins!) but delicious, as were the fries. Nothing out of this world, but really good for a fast food place. I like the simplicity of the menu which makes it easy to make a lunch decision.

Tip: sit upstairs for a bird's eye view of the action.
author: Katie U.

description:
I was really pumped to try a Super Duper burger, but it didn't meet my expectations.

In my mind, I wanted a juicy burger with a nicely-toasted bun. But what I actually got was a slightly-overcooked beef patty sandwiched between soggy bread. *sad face* Not to mention that I was also underwhelmed by the lack of customer service. When I ordered with my parents, my dad wanted a combo meal with a soda. The cashier told us that we would be given our soda once our meal was ready. I also requested my super sauce on the side. When we were ready to pick up our order at the counter, we didn't get our soda or my sauce on the side. I asked the server, and he rudely tossed me the sauce on the counter and rebuked that we should have gotten our soda from the cashier.

Maybe it was the fact that we went to Super Duper Burgers during peak hours for dinner, but I was really frustrated that neither the meal nor the customer service lived up to the chain's reputation. You would really need to convince me to give this place another shot, although funnily enough, I would rather come here for burgers than In n Out. (Surprise surprise.)
author: Connie X.

description: Was surprised very good , in San Francisco for weekend & son took me there . Burger & fries was excellent and a cold beer , wish they were on east coast
author: Doug O.

description: Hands down the best burger chain in San Francisco..! The food is flavorful, freshly prepared, and absolutely filling. Greasy, yeah, but it's a burger place? I'm reassured knowing they choose quality ingredients. Their organic ketchup is also soo perfect alongside cut fries. As long as I live in SF, I'll be going to Super Duper! Good job guys!
author: Jer G.

description:
I'm on the fence when it comes to Super Duper. It's not the best hamburger joint but certainly not the worst. I've visited multiple times and have been genuinely pleased. On occasion my burger will be dripping with griddle grease. I know some folks are a fan but I'll gladly pass on the leftover bits. 

On the other hand, Chocolate shakes are always on point! For the price, it's definitely an honest burger. Fries could definitely use some help. For me they always seem to taste dry and stale. I do like enjoy the help yourself pickles. Big value add. All in all, if you're hungry count on Super Duper to get you through until your next meal.
author: Ralph A.

description:
I have heard many good things about Super Duper Burgers, but I never have time to stop at the one in Novato and never tried any of them in SF. Well, I was in the city for a tech event at the Moscone Center and had a short lunch break, so I figured this was the perfect time to try this semi fast food joint. 

Got there around 11:30 and there was already a line forming, which took me about 15 minutes to get through, but gave me enough time to figure out what I wanted. Luckily found a seat at the bar where I got to enjoy the action of the kitchen (Made me even more hungry before my meal). Ended up going with the mini burger and some regular fries. Burger was on point and as many have mentioned, very juicy, and cooked to perfection. Fries were crispy and not limp and soggy, well worth the affordable price. As for the sides, nothing spectacular, but the pickles were pretty tasty. I honestly wish I would've gotten a spiked shake, but I needed to be on my game for work, so next time it is definitely happening! As for the interior, it offers a new aesthetically pleasing feel with a second floor to accommodate the traffic of consumers. I saw a lot getting to go due to the fact that the seats filled up quick after 12:00. 

So, was it worth the hype, I think so! I would honestly put it on par with Five Guys, fresh, affordable, tasty, and efficient. Cannot wait to come back and explore more of the menu.
author: Ryan A.

description:
A fine burger and decent fries, though it is indeed a bit pricey.

I got the Super Duper Combo which was a Super Burger, fries, and a drink (and saves you $0.50 off of ordering all 3 separately). I added cheese to my Super Burger and while it was a tasty, nice quality, double cheeseburger with standard toppings plus jalapenos, it wasn't much better quality than many other burger places nearby, including In N Out (which is what the burger most reminded me of, except no 1000 Island sauce). There were a decent amount fries and they were perfectly fine, and there was only ketchup and mustard as condiments.

All in all it was good, not great, and a bit expensive.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Pretty close rip off of Shake Shack and they do it well. But not as well as Shake Shack. I'm talking literally the same font on the outside of the restaurant, the food is served on the same little silver trays, and very similar decor that exchanges green accents for orange. 

It's funny to see the Californians not realizing that they're getting burgers and a concept stolen from a much larger and much tastier burger joint, but it's all good. The food is still decent. 

Super Duper is about a half step above fast food when it comes to quality and the restaurant itself but about 15 steps up when it comes to the food. Tasty burgers and McDonalds'esque fries. 

Oh yeah, the other thing they stole from Shake Shack is the extremely inflated prices. A burger combo with fries and a drink will set you back like $11. YIKES! 

Unoriginal and nothing to write home about but I'd come back ;)
author: Kyle W.

description:
Upgrading to 5 stars. Super Duper has grown on me since I moved to the Bay Area over 7 years ago. Even though they have outlets all over town these days, it's one of those local success stories that you've got to root for as they turn into mini-chains, because the food and service are so good and so consistent. 

In particular, this prominently located Market Street outlet is one of my go-tos for a quick, satisfying, meaty bite while I'm in the area and am pressed for time. As busy as it can get, there's generally plenty of seating both downstairs and up. Service is also fast, friendly, and efficient. 

Super Duper holds its own against Five Guys and even In and Out, in my opinion, and I wouldn't mind seeing more branches everywhere.
author: Vincent L.

description: Compare to all the other branch, this is the most crowded and least space for sitting. Not to mention the chocolate milk shake ain't thick enough for me to dip my fries in.
author: Patrick T.

description:
I came back after a year and you can't imagine how excited I was! After a nice bike ride from the Ferry building to the Golden Gate Bridge and back.. it was time to grub!

My boyfriend and I was in the mood to fill our empty stomachs with great food and we both agreed super duper burgers would fulfill the hunger. Oh my goodness.. It was BETTER than what I remembered the time before. My boyfriend and I each got a burger and we shared garlic fries and each got a cookies 'n cream shake.. we deserved it after that long bike ride! This was the BEST burger I've ever had!

Super Duper burgers will be on my list whenever I visit San Francisco. I'm drooling just thinking about it now.
author: Thuyen P.

description:
I kind of don't like this location on Market. It attracts a lot of people and is messy. That said, the burgers are solid.

We both got a Super Burger with cheese, bacon, and avocado. He ordered a side of fries and an Allagash white, I had their lemonade. The burgers were juicy and tasty. I wonder if it had been a while since I've had a burger because this one tasted extremely good to me. I'm not a fries person but since it was on the table, I had a few.

I have the say that the lemonade was not good. I'm ok with tart but this one took it to another level. It was hard to drink. Overall, it was a satisfying quick dinner before we walked across the street to Museum of Ice Cream.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Super duper burgers is the real deal.  I had a double cheeseburger, garlic fries, and a shit load of pickles.  Plus!  I met a cute and nice cashier from Richmond.

The burger was hearty and had a solid meaty flavor.  I ordered it with blue cheese and grilled onions.  I could tell it was made with good quality beef.

The fries were VERY garlicy and had lots cheese on top.  They were crisp and had good flavor.  The staff​ gave me plenty of free ranch to go with them.

There were jars and jars of free pickles by the soda fountain.  The pickles had a spicy bite to them which I really enjoyed.  

Overall it was a good meal.
author: Brian K.

description: What's not to like about this place! Always consistent and great quality meat and produce. I will recommend this place over in n out anytime and come here every time I'm in the area! Thank you
author: Cameron L.

description:
I've always heard about it from friends when interning in San Francisco but never ate here for lunch until this past Sunday after touring Museum of Ice Cream which is just a block away! I understand why people say such good things about it now. I got the regular burger and it was just right. Juicy, cheesy, delicious! I got the garlic fries too and it was satisfying. Super cheesy and flavorful. Only thing I'd say that I wouldn't like so much is how the upstairs smelled of cleaning supplies. But I understand it gets really busy there.

- price $
- crowded, not too much seating
- bomb burgers and garlic fries
author: Eric C.

description: Came for the first time today. A for effort and very cost friendly. This place clearly tries to serve fresh ingredients, they have a very clean location with very friendly people. My cashier didn't fit that so well but everyone else was great so I'm gonna ignore her. I would definitely come back. The burger could have been thicker and I wish the veggies weren't seasoned so much but overall I was very happy with the experience.
author: A B.

description:
It's a great burger joint!  You can get mini (still big) one patty burger or 2 patties.. The patties are juicy, and each one is just the perfect size.  Not too big, not too thick. The garlic fries were covered in legit raw garlic and delicious! and topped with lots of cheese. If you love burgers, this is a must eat. They do have veggie burger option for those who don't eat meat. As well as soft serves. 

They keep house made pickles open for takes with condiments.
author: Christine J.

description: Great burgers considering it's a chain. They also have really good milkshakes but the amount of calories in those is over 9000!
author: Sahil S.

description:
Way too greasy!! Bun was soaked through 
In n out is way better
Way too greasy!! Bun was soaked through 
In n out is way better

Edit: 
Thanks for the response. Definitely don't plan to be back though!
author: Becca R.

description: Garlic fries are a must!! They have self served pickles that go great with your burger; there's a kick to them too! The ketchup is even good! Not the big name brand types. The cook guys know what they are doing, constantly tossing out the burgers and fries. Love the workers, they really care about the place and enjoy what they do.
author: Kayli T.

description:
Great burgers! I got one on two separate occasions and both times the meat was perfectly cooked: pink in the middle and caramelized and crispy on the outside. Easily the best "fast food" burger I've ever had. 

My sister got the veggie burger and she also was impressed with it. She's generally pretty hard to get food for because of food sensitivity and she didn't have any issues! 

I didn't try the fries so I can't tell you how they are, but unlimited pickles are free and they had a certain spiciness to them that was great!

Lots of places to sit, but it can get pretty crowded depending on the time of day.
author: William B.

description:
Fact - Ground fresh daily patties
Fact - Smashed burgers with a well seasoned, crispy exterior
Fact - Delicious soft toasted sesame seed bun 
Fact - Hot and crispy fries
Fact - Compostable package
Fact - Friendly service
Fact - Compostable packaging
Fact - Slightly sweet, slightly sour housemade pickles 
Fact - Healthier condiments and a sweet lineup of free toppings

This is the total fast-casual burger place, and it's the bomb! 

Open later, always rocking, and super delicious! Find one where ever you are and have this experience!

Don't miss the pickles!
author: Michael T.

description:
I ordered the mini-burger with cheese (4 oz patty for $5.75 + cheese .50) with french fries ($2.75), no drink. With tax, the tab came to just under $10 for both items.

Pros: All in all, the burger tastes fantastic. The beef patty is delicious and cooked really well. I love the sesame seed bun, it is a real champ and holds the patty and fixings without falling apart. Bonus the buns are made locally, therefore they are fresh. I know I am making a big deal out of the bun and not the burger, but burger lovers know this matters a lot. The condiments bar offers complimentary pickles which are house made and also quite delicious. The fries are also really good and somehow the potato flavor really stands out.

Cons: the mini-burger is a bit too small for the price. Next time I will just go for the super burger with cheese (which is basically a double patty burger) as it seems like the better deal for $2.75 more.
author: Quiet R.

description: Yummy mini burger with everything on it plus an egg ! Me and my hubby split the garlic fries which are soooo flavorful and enough to share :)Plus the service is excellent manager was really friendly and gave us new comers free ice cream vouchers!!!
author: Christina G.

description: mini burgers, garlic fries and chocolate dipped vanilla soft serve were all super duper
author: Soojeong H.

description:
Thought that this place would just be like any other burger chain, but it's so much better! The garlic fries are to die for - garlic and parmesan cheese toppings are absolutely delicious!! 

I'm also oddly addicted to their "ketchup." It's not the typical processed red tomato sauce, but it's kind of like a tomato puree that tastes amazing! Good thing they place little bowls instead of little condiment cups next to the dispenser. 

I know this place prizes itself with their "super" burger, but I found the mini burger (which is really a normal-sized burger) to suffice. My friend got a milkshake and loved it as well. Probably not the healthiest, but everything in moderation right?
author: Kris C.

description: Burgers are good but really greasy.  Nice wine and beer. I love the pickles.  Soft serve was decent. Fries are also oaky
author: Andy P.

description:
Best burgers forever!!! Me and my fiancé are super fans of super duper!
For me it's really important to have real and organic food, and this is all that, plus greaaaaat flavor and best quality!!!!

The service is also really great and they're all really friendly , so 5 stars for you guys, don't change anything
author: Sabrina V.

description: Mini burger combo- more than enough for a meal. Burger is good- ask for extra jalapeños because I think they went  "white girl" on me   No offense I am a white girl but like my jalapeños! Fries are good- I need to try the garlic ones next time. Tasty and reasonably priced- definitely recommend! I'm
author: jeany p.

description: I always have to stop by Super Duper! Crew are really nice and inviting! Shoutout to my cashier today, Taylor! She hooked it up with the garlic aioli sauces and your really pretty. Hit me if you see this. IG: Dagsalda92 fashooooooooo
author: Darryn A.

description: Delicious. Ate this superb cheeseburger and garlic fries two days in a row. If you're near one of their locations, I'd highly recommend giving them a try.
author: vib s.

description:
I am going to this place from last 3 years. One of the my favorite place to have Vegetarian burger. 
Also Their happy hours Beer pitchers with Free Fries are awesome. 
Don't forget to try their Ice-cream.

I am giving one star less for following reasons :
1. Limited selection for Beers
2. Waiting time for burgers. 
3. In past few visits, I noticed that their garlic fries are not good as earlier.
author: Akshay K.

description: Great chicken sandwich and veggie burger.  Love the pickles too.  Seems like a knockoff shake shack
author: Aimee R.

description: Love it each time we come here. Single or double patty with cheese or not. Mmm, it's so good and tasty. The sauce they put on is like crack. Love it when it's greasy. Taste even better with the dripping grease. The garlic fries are great. Must get with the 3 sauces! Delicious! Salivating right now. Can't wait to be back. If only, there's one in the East Bay.
author: Amy H.

description: Thank you Super Duper Burgers for one of the best meals in San Francisco! Who knew I would actually enjoy a $10 burger more than dishes at a Michelin star restaurant. I absolutely loved my chicken sandwich. I added the jack cheese topping for $0.5. The garlic fries were tasty, too. I hope they expand to Canada!
author: Chris J.

description: I ordered the deluxe meal with cheese came out $15.73 because I ordered garlic fries and added cheese to the burger the fries were cold and the burger was greasy and half of the bun was missing from the bottom. The beef patties  were actually very good. Couldn't find a napkin to save my life lol. The people were kind and there's a lot of space.
author: Christina D.

description:
I have been wanting to try Super Duper Burgers for a while so was in the area today and decided to stop in.  I ordered a "specialty" Caesar with the works to go.  Imagine my surprise when I opened the bin and realized I had paid a premium price for just a regular cheese burger: there weren't even onions, lol.  So, alas, thus the 2 Star Review.

Pros - Meat is above par;
            Bun soft and fresh;
            Fries fresh tasting and good sized serving
            Condiments fresh pickles a nice touch

Cons - Dinning area could be cleaner
             (which is why I went with to go option)
              Check your order for completeness
author: C B.

description: Holy breakfast. SO good, hash browns, donuts sandwiches galore. This is right next to my office and makes every morning so much better!
author: Alexandria D.

description: Extremely slow drive thru, not professional, ran by a bunch of inexperienced kids. Will not come back.
author: Nave A.

description: Delicious burger, tasty Pinot noir.  Fair prices.  So glad we popped in for a super duper burger!
author: Casey R.

description: I stopped going to Super Duper after the new manager started. They refused to make the breakfast sandwich as they had been making it since they opened.  I found a spot with a MUCH better burger too: Popsons (Market Street and 6th). Do yourself a favor and try San Francisco's best burger first.  If you don't think that Popsons is the best burger that you have ever had, I will buy you a burger from Super Duper ( even though I refuse to eat there anymore).
author: Dre D.

description: I was starving and ready to eat by the time I got to Super Duper Burgers. But even then, I wasn't too impressed their quality. I ordered a Mini Burger with the typical lettuce, tomato, and pickles that I usually add in. The patty was on the dry side and didn't have as much flavor as I had hoped. I didn't feel that there was anything unique about Super Duper Burgers, but the prices are fair considering its location in a dense area right on Market Street. There was a long wait for ordering and for picking up my order, but they have those light-up buzzers that will notify you when your food is ready. That way you can walk outside and wander around closeby if you wanted to since there's almost no walking room inside and seats are extremely limited.
author: Winnie Y.

description: The burgers are amazing and so are the fries. Prices are very reasonable. This is a very friendly atmosphere and I really liked that they give glass cups for fountain refills, not plastic cups. You can balcony dine, sit indoors or enjoy the street view from the outdoor dining.
author: Michael W.

description: I really enjoyed the atmosphere the burgers were made perfect to my tasting I even tried the garlic fries they were good but the 6 month aged cheese was melted but that's OK because everything else was just perfect
author: P A.

description: I was really pleased with the service at this fast food like joint.  The manager came out and gave free donuts to all the people waiting for their order.  Their pickles are self service and taste amazing. I grabbed a bunch.  The fries were tasty and overall I had a great experience.
author: Jordan S.

description:
These burgers were super! 

After adding an egg and cheese and bacon to my super burger it comes out to be like 11 bucks or something I forget but it comes out super big and juicy (twss). I could've prolly been satisfied with a mini instead of getting a double. Also the garlic fries is a must! This place reminds me a lot of smash burger in San Diego.
author: Hoang V.

description: One of my favorite burger place in San Francisco. Burgers are tasty and juicy. Must try the garlic fries. And the shakes are always a hit too! My kids and I enjoy eating at the this place. Friendly staff and fast service! Wish they have one in southern cal where we live. But we'll have to wait next time we are visiting SF!
author: Lalaine F.

description:
I've loved super Duper since the day I moved to San Francisco! There are a few choices around me especially near downtown and I recently started indulging myself at the market location. It's just easy.
