This review is long overdue because it tends to be easier, friendly, fast and I've always had great service. The reason I'm writing this review today is because I had a mistake in my order and getting To-go lost my receipt, however when I return she asked for my receipt and I offered the bank transaction and my card number. Without question they fixed my order and special thanks to the Supervisor Taylor for helping me feed my hungry boyfriend! #SuperDuper


Will be back very soon! As if I had a choice!
author: John-David F.

description: The ingredients are fresh and the patty is cooked well. The bun is toasted but still soft. The bacon is just right amount of thickness. I love their garlic fries, crispy and cheesy. Service is pretty friendly. It's a good choice for a burger.
author: Eve C.

description: A friend recommended me this spot, and I thought it was great. Got the veggie burger with avocados and not bad. I'm not much of a burger person but it did fill me up for the time being. The line's extremely long but the employees there are all cool. The atmosphere is minimalist so I give them props for that. Maybe that's why the burger is so good: They don't need to show off, because they know they're good.
author: Vincent V.

description: Super delicious! Love the Super Burger and of course the sauce flight for the fries (+ for the garlic fries!) The house-made pickles have a very balanced taste while delivering a good "snap" - everything's solid overall. Have gone to a few of the locations around the Bay and all of them are consistently good, but a special shout out to the Market Street team here for the awesome care and service!
author: Adam C.

description: This is my 4th time coming at this location, however first time to get my garlic fries soaked and floating with oil at the bottom! I hope next time I come back it'll not be like this again.
author: Tae N.

description:
Best veggie burger in town!!

Love their,
1) Sunny side up
2) Chocolate swirl with chocolate dip cone ice cream
3) Fresh lemonades

Don't forget their dipping sauces!!

For meat lovers, they have all organic & grass fed varieties. Especially there double patty hamburgers are quite popular.
author: Deebs M.

description:
There are lots of Super Duper Burger joints around San Fran so I wanted to check it out, but unfortunately was not too impressed with the joint. It can get very busy in here so finding a seat was a little difficult at first but we managed to get a table as someone was leaving. 

The menu is pretty simple. They offer hamburgers single or double with various fixin's and fries. 
I wish I had ordered the garlic fries but unfortunately had them plain and they were just okay. The hamburger was good but a little greasy and not too small like at Shake Shack. I'm still a fan of the In-and-Out burgers on the west coast however.
author: Lisa A.

description: A tourist trap burger place. It'll get the job done if you have a craving but you'd be better off at In-N-Out. This location given its placement right on market st is usually busy with tourists. The saving grace here is the milkshakes and soft serve. Fries are average and while i understand the need to be organic, there just something missing when you don't have proper ketchup. The burgers here are made fresh but are lacking seasoning and while they are juicy just too greasy.
author: Peter P.

description:
I've been here 3 times: Not anything to write home about. The food is super greasy and tastes, in my opinion, not as good as fast food chains like Wendy's and McDonalds.

Also, because this location is so close to Target and a bunch of other shops, it's always packed.

I thought the service was really nice, though! The employees are very friendly, the food presentation is neat, and the establishment is very clean/modern.
author: Josh M.

description: The fries were cold and the quality of the burger was half decent. Nice clean environment though.
author: Wesley S.

description: The food was great. We had the chicken burger  & Super burger . The line was long but they worked fast. Right down the street from our hotel. Lots of onions & jalapeños. The garlic fries  are to die for.
author: Angel C.

description: Stayed at the Marriott Marquis a couple blocks down from here and this was the best takeout. Definitely worth trying again. Milkshakes are really good.
author: Melissa A.

description: I was visiting San Fran for a week. I went here twice and was happy both times! The burgers were great, tasted fresh, and were prepared promptly. This will definitely be a place I return to the next time I am in town.
author: Greg C.

description: Prettttty great and quick service especially for the lunch hour. Employees were friendly, even asking if I'd been there before and welcoming me back. I love their shakes, especially the cookies and cream mix. Fries are pretty good and not too salty. The burgers weren't as juicy as I'd expect a niche burger place to be. Still good, just not a standout burger.
author: Liz B.

description: Welcome to the greasiest burger in town. The patty, bun and fries were so greasy that I had difficulty holding them. Really could not eat the burger since every bite was like 80% fat. Taste was ok. Second floor loft seating was nice.
author: Ava R.

description:
Holy Crap! Best burger and fries EVER! Came here off the recommendation from a friend. I did the Super Burger with all the toppings and Bacon and a side of garlic fries with the 3 dipping sauces. The meat was juicy and full of flavor and the fries were to die for.

My daughter, who is 13, was with me and her eyes lit up when she took her first bite of her plain burger.

Will definitely be back next time I'm in the bay.
author: J F.

description: A friend recommended this place when I was visiting SF. The burgers were super tasty and the garlic fries were good too. The girl at the register could have been a little friendlier bit overall a good experience.
author: Tracey L.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is a pretty solid place to fulfill any type of craving you may have.  They offer burgers, salads, soft serve ice cream, shakes, even beer!  Oh my goodness, and their Garlic Fries are TO DIE FOR!!! (Orrr to kill with because if you're trying to kill a vampire then Super Duper Burgers has your back with the amount of garlic in there).

Anywhooo, this location of Super Duper Burgers is on the side of the Metreon facing the church.  It has plenty of seating because there is an upstairs, cleanliness is not an issue here, and their workers are very friendly and helpful.

Their Chicken Sandwich is BOMB'DIGGS!!!  It is huuuuge and I proudly admit to finishing every last bit of it.  Their Chicken Sandwich starts with a lightly toasted Ciabatta bread that is crisp on the outside yet soft and fluffy on the inside.  The chicken in this sandwich is grilled, I believe.  I don't know how they do it but they manage to make the edges of the chicken crispy while keeping the inside moist and juicy. && the Chipotle aioli that goes with it definitely adds a bunch of flavor.  Although it seems pretty simple, this sandwich is well thought out because all the ingredients mix together beautifully without one overpowering another.

Their Super Burger has a lot of flavor as well but be prepared to get down and dirty with this one.  It's either really juicy or really greasy or a mixture of both because there is no clean way to eat this thing haha.  You will enjoy it but make sure to grab some napkins beforehand.

You have to pay extra for certain toppings so it can get pricey but I really can't find a con other than that.  Definitely try this place out!
author: Rossel C.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is one of the reasons why San Francisco is still a better place to live than Los Angeles and New York. Whether you're getting a burger (yeah, they're a little greasy, but in a good way), a chicken sandwich (bacon and cheese please!), or one of the best veggie burgers in the city, it's hard to make a bad choice here.

Don't even get me started about the their breakfast deals...I get very emotional X-o
author: M G.

description: By far the best burger place I have ever ever been too. The fries, shakes, burgers, pickles and whatever else is on the menu just slay the burger joint game. They are also well-priced. Strongly recommend.
author: Matthew S.

description: This place is the BOMB! They definitely deserve a full 5-stars. Lip-smackingly rich, delicious, mouth-watering burgers laden with melted cheese and all the toppings. The garlic fries are similarly exquisite (but the burger is the star).
author: Grizzle J.

description: BEST BURGER EVER! Absolute freshness all around. From the buns, lettuce, tomatoes, and the meat! I took a bite out of the burger and i was truly overwhelmed by the fact that i could taste every bit of seasoning in that meat, i can taste every bit of that whole burger. Would totally recommend this place to everyone! Oh yeah, fries were bomb too Lol
author: Jason L.

description:
I really wanted them to say, "Have a super duper day!" after they took our order, but oh, well. I didn't get a burger here, but opted for the garlic fries + three sauces and the strawberry shake. The fries were perfectly crispy with melted cheese and I liked their super sauce the best of the three. The shake was one of the best I've had. I liked it because it wasn't too thick and it was definitely very strawberry. It's fast food but with higher quality and a more hip interior.

The service was friendly and quick. You take a buzzer for your order but we barely had to wait until our order was ready. We happened upon the spot but glad we had a chance to try it.
author: Courtney H.

description:
Solid, inexpensive burgers. I don't eat them but thats what I hear every time I go. Seems higher quality than a place like In-N-Out. 

I can vouch for their breakfast sandwiches though. Delicious and I think runs around $3.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
Dear SDB,

I give your homemade (half sour) pickles a 5 star review!  I feel like I need to get there soon and buy a jar because I read a Yelp that indicated you're experimenting with recipes - so please save that one.

Your pickles made up for our burger orders being messed up.  I thought your meat was cardboard tough and tasted funny (as if it had taken an acrid smoke bath), but the problem turned out to be bacon.  Horrible bacon, don't buy that stuff again.  Hubby's burger didn't have bacon on it, so I got to taste what mine could have been and it was much better.  I also was meh about the lemonade.  It didn't live up to expectations, fortunately some water and a few ice cubes improved it.  In spite of the problems, I'll give you another chance but I'll order a shake next time.  I don't think the Super Bowl crowds threw you off today, because Yelp reviews say you're usually crowded during lunch and dinner.  I think it was just bad luck on my part because there are bound to be mistakes when you're dealing in such volume hour after hour.

I really want to compliment the staff.  I spoke to several and they were unfailingly courteous and helpful.
author: Barbara L.

description: Loud and noisy.  Dirty tables and beverage station.  I found my burger drowning in enough fat and grease that I could have used it for an oil change in my car.  The counter wait person was disconnected, perfunctory, cold, and sterile in demeanor - never as much as cracked a smile or made eye contact with me never thanking me for my order.  Wait time:  routine.  French fries: salted to a fault despite asking for no salt and greasy.  Given the fact that we are obligated by law to pay for employees' health care and a 'living wage', we would get better service.  I think not San Francisco Supervisors.  Can I get my money back?  I couldn't WAIT to get out of the place.
author: Bill S.

description: The fact that you can add an egg to your burger reminds me of Malaysia where they do that all the time. I usually get the smallest burger they have, then split the fries with my eating partner. The prices are reasonable for San Francisco standards and you won't leave hungry.  Not a good place for vegans.
author: Paul S.

description: I was very disappointed. I ordered through Postmates and when I received my order, it was not what I ordered bad enough I paid $26 for a shitty burger, garlic fries and a coke that spilled. I was better off not eating.
author: Selina B.

description:
When I lived in the bay area, my friends in Seattle would ask if I got In and Out and if it was as good as everyone said it was. Truth be told, Super Duper Burgers is WAY better. I will always remember the first time I got Super Duper Burgers and it was by accident. I had just moved to SF and was walking around aimlessly downtown with my husband, and the aroma caught our attention. We went inside and I will never regret it. 

I typically order the super burger with bacon and a fried egg, garlic fries and a strawberry shake. Everything is FRESH. Hands down the best fast food burger in the bay area. They even get the bun right on the burger, it has the right amount of crisp and when you bite into that crispy bun with the perfectly cooked patty with that amazing sauce and 'everything on it', it's like fireworks going off in your mouth. I know I'm trying to sell this really hard, but that's only because it is really that good. Also, the garlic fries - amazing! Just enough garlic with cheese that melts on top from the heat of the fries. And the strawberry shake - tastes exactly like real deal strawberries. 

Whenever I come back to the bay, Super Duper will always be on my list to stop by.
author: Marian D.

description: I bookmarked this spot after watching in DDD in food channel - finally made it last month!!! Man, burger is amazing - fries and pickles we're just awesome as well. I will sure go again.
author: The Food L.

description: I tried the chicken burger and it was really really good. I loved their sauce that they put inside the burger. I also tried the organic orange juice which I think was average.
author: Supriya L.

description: we were visiting san fran for vacation & found this spot.. Super yummy burgers! packed with flavor and it's organic! (i've never felt guilty eating something organice before, heheh) it's a pretty basic menu so not hard to choose what you want. i ordered a double with bacon & added their chipotle sauce, delish. hubby ordered the same but w the garlic fries which were fireee. it's funny because all we did was just look on yelp for a fast lunch spot and we came across it not realizing we found burger heaven. my son even loved it and he rarely eats meat so much flavor. def check it out but grab a table fast cus it is super packed for lunch!!
author: Natalie R.

description: Good burgers but a little pricey for the amount of food you get. It is similar to a Five Guys and maybe a step above In N Out with a better atmosphere.
author: Dan F.

description:
Not that I even need to write a review, but this is the place where I first fell in love with Super Duper. I was lucky enough that my coworkers at the time wanted to all have lunch here. 

While the menu can seem a bit hectic, stick with the small burger if you want to get a shake or fries too. If you get a burger, don't forget to add an egg. If you get fries, don't forget to order garlic fries. And before you sit down to eat, don't forget to grab a small tray full of pickles. That's all that you really need to know. I've been telling myself that I need to try the shakes here still. I'm no burger connoisseur so maybe you won't love this place. Who knows? Just give it a try and then you'll never be left wondering why there's always a line. 

I recently took a friend here who was visiting from LA and we had the best lunch. Happy burger eating!
author: Venna Q. T.

description: Great burger joint! The burgers were pretty novel, probably a little on the unhealthy side, but excellent tasting nonetheless. The staff were friendly and the food prep was quick (pager notification system). My only complaint is that the tables can benefit from an occasional wipe down.
author: Vinson M.

description:
Came here with my wife while visiting San Francisco. It was within minutes from our hotel and came here right after checking in because of how hungry we were from the plane ride!

As soon as we walked in we knew it was going to be good by looking at how busy it was and all the delicious looking food everyone was eating. Both my wife and I ordered the super burger combo. The meat was nice and tender and full of flavor. They use all organic ingredients which doesn't make you feel as bad eating a huge burger haha the ketchup is all organic as well which I wasn't the biggest fan of, but still was good! 

Service was good and they keep the place nice and clean which is always a plus!
author: Brandon I.

description:
Wow wow wow! First time I tried this place I already fell in love ! Quality of the burger is amazing and made right before you so you know what's going on . 
Garlic fries are To Die For . Try em get em you WILL love them ! Oh.. and also the pickles .... AMAZING ! What a perfect combo .
My husband and I made it our tradition to visit this place every time we are in town. Super duper burger never disappoints! 
I wish they had one in Sacramento!!  I would be there alwayssss
PS the lines might look long and it might be crowded but have no fear they move fast !! 
Enjoy your super Duper amazing burger
author: Alina P.

description:
While most people get excited about eating a Double Double at an In-n-Out whenever they're in California, I get excited every time I visit San Francisco because I get to eat a Super Burger! Sure it costs about twice as much as the In-n-Out, but it is a way better burger! The Super Duper Burger is a lot juicier and more flavorful because they use better ingredients. Their beef is humanely-raised, 100% vegetarian-fed, ground fresh daily, and sourced from family-owned ranches.

*Super Burger with everything added cheese and fried egg*
This is my typical order and it comes out to $10 before tax. The fried egg really makes the burger even better.

Ordering is incredibly easy. Just follow the instructions on the simple menu. After you pay for your food, they give you a pager to notify you when your order is ready. Remember to get some of their pickles. They're good!

If the place is super crowded, and it usually is, you can always take your order to-go!
author: Emil C.

description: Not really and organic enthusiast but the food was good ice cream was great. The price was pretty reasonable too.
author: Cynthia Y.

description: Oh hell nah. Where do these people get off calling their burgers super duper? They were tiny! We were still hungry after finishing off a combo.
author: G S.

description: This place is delicious! I've gone there for lunch and breakfast, and have not been disappointed. Even the drive-thru was on point... Sean was amazing and got my order correct! I will be returning for some more of that great service.
author: Jasmean W.

description: We had quick lunch such as chicken sandwich and mini combo. It's really tasty than my expectation.
author: Crystal Y.

description:
I actually really love super duper. The burger, the fries, and the music.

This is based on my experience yesterday from this location. Dined here yesterday, August 12, 2016 around 4:15pm PST. I ordered my mini combo and garlic fries. I enjoyed my meal and while I was eating my garlic fries, I see this hair strand! Hair strand on my garlic fries. I was pissed off! I wanted to vomit. 
I calmly asked for the manager. I asked the manager if the the back of the house are wearing hair nets and he said yes. I I looked at them and thier basically just wearing thier baseball caps. Mind you, a few of the men had long hair. I told him if if they were wearing a hair net then how did this hair strand get into my food? He apologized and wanted to refund my meal. 
I basically told him, I don't want a refund. I want you guys to follow proper procedures when preparing food as this is totally unacceptable. Food and safety should be your number one priority. 

I left after that.. so upset and also heart broken because I fuckin love Super Duper.

I'll mostly visit again but not the one in Market Street.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Super Duper is a big statement and frankly, a lot to live up to. Is this burger super duper? Not really. Is it good? Yes.

It is a good burger, just not a "super duper" one. They were kind enough to give me a sample of their donuts as well and I have to say the price was right but it too was a "decent" donut, just not a super duper one.

Let me be clear... this IS a good burger.
author: Chris D.

description:
In the heart of union square, it was bound to be busy, but a 40 min wait seemed a little much.

The chicken sandwich was very tasty and the chicken was juicy, but the wait was a let down. 

It's cool that they make their own pickles and leave them in an open jar for you to help yourself.

I really enjoyed the garlic fries! They're a must. 

Overall, I'd come back if there was no wait.
author: Nikki R.

description: I think there is definitely some over hype here. The food was fine, but nothing to right home about as far as burgers go. I noticed there was an excessive amount of pink in my well done burger. The ambiance is definitely grab and go.
author: Khalid J.

description: Basic burgers in two available sizes. Mini burger is surely big enough to satisfy normal hunger despite of the name. Blue cheese mini burger was overall ok - not too much mayonnaise and the roll was especially good. Also it has to be mentioned that they have special beers on tap. The prices are comfy, too.
author: Sanni H.

description:
I was craving burgers on a Friday evening and decided to check out Super Duper Burgers since its a 4 star business with a whopping 2000 reviews. 

The first thing I noticed after walking in was that both of their burgers were beef based and that there were no chicken options (they do have a chicken sandwich). I almost turned around and walked out when I had the inkling to check the reviews for the chicken sandwich and boy did it seem highly rated. I decided to try the sandwich along with regular fries and I am so glad I stayed back. 

The chicken was really juicy and was perfectly done. Will come back!
author: Gaurav K.

description:
B E S T 
B U R G E R 
DWN TOWN S F 

I always get the super burger with cheese & bacon, regular fries w/ dipping sauces, and definitely the lemonade at this location.
author: Joaquin N.

description: I was a little worried about being in San Francisco for the day in regards to food due to keto, I read online that this was a good place so I decided to give it a try! I ordered a lettuce wrapped burger with tomato, onion, bacon, cheese and avocado, the only down said is that I also asked for no type of dressing and they still put dressing on my burger so I had to send it back but they fixed it fairly quickly! My boyfriend ordered a regular burger and fries and it looked delicious and I'm sure it was since he finished it in about one big bite ! Definitely the BEST burger I've had! The meat is SOOOO good and it's just amazing! The bacon is so crispy and my goodness! Recommend to keto and non keto !!
author: Alondra M.

description:
Always a fan of this place! The garlic fries are fantastic and my go is the chicken sandwich. The beer on tap is also pretty cheap.

Great place to stop by for food and drinks on a night out.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Only got the milkshake but it's really good! I ended up getting the kids size and added some malt.
author: Mira B.

description:
My burger tasted good but the amount of grease was disturbing. The wrapper it came in was completely soaked through with grease and even my fries were excessively oily, but the amount of garlic and cheese was nice, gave them great flavor. I really didn't care for their type of ketchup served there. The homemade pickles were good, not the best. I'll more than likely give them another try because my coworker claimed his chicken sandwich was great, but I won't try another burger due to the level of grease.
They claim 100% of the paper used for food wrapping is used as compost... I can appreciate that.
author: Michael S.

description:
Super choice for quality burgers in The City!

Reasonably priced for being right on Market St, good for grabbing lunch if you can avoid rush hour or just dining later gives you slightly less of a crowd. 

Their garlic fries are on point & beer selection isn't bad at all for those who want a burger & brew. 

Line moves fairly quickly though, it just comes down to how quick can you grab your table before the next person. Teamwork is key here!

Make sure you request veggies or whatever you want on your burger, since it'll just come as is unless you specify.
author: Roger D.

description:
This place is seriously such a solid fast burger joint. Something that I absolutely love about this place is their pickles. I believe they make it themselves and store it in jars for the taking. How great is that? An unlimited supply of pickles with your meal! The pickles are a little bit spicy and just so delicious. 

I ordered the mini burger with bacon and a side of garlic fries. Everything was good. I like how they put a lot of cheese on top of the garlic fries. The price was decent as well.
author: Annie H.

description: Perfect for when I'm hungover from over indulgence the night before. Fries were fresh and seasoned just right. Definitely will be back for a more in-depth analysis of the other items on the menu.
author: Jasper B.

description: Super Duper = Bomb diggity! Sped walked here with a colleague (yes, I said sped walked) because we were hangry! I've never tried it before so I was excited and it surely didn't disappoint. I'm sure I will be back!
author: Candice J.

description: Garlic Fries!  For all my garlic lovers...this item is definitely for YOU!  They were delish!  I've never tasted anything like this.  The burgers were fresh and flavorful.  If you love pickles, this place have them everywhere!  I give Super Duper the big thumbs up!
author: Anissa G.

description:
For me personally I'm always in the mood for a burger. 

My friend and I were walking around the mall and got hungry and since we didn't really want mall food we went over to Super Duper. 

The menu and everything is very straightforward. 

My friend and I both ordered the Mini Burger Combo, the mini burger has one patty as opposed to the Super Burger with two patty's. We ordered ours with cheese and everything on it. One thing I really liked was how thinly sliced the onion was. I personally don't like super thick onions in my burgers. 

The burger was so good. It was really buttery and just great so was the fries. 

The service was really great and the wait for the food was pretty fast.
author: Yinja L.

description: I have nothing bad to say about Super Duper Burger. I got a burger with bacon, egg, cheese and the super sauce and it was messy, but delicious. The place was clean and they definitely use fresh ingredients
author: Trevor N.

description:
"Am I just hungover or is this the best burger I've ever had?" my sis pondered as she sank her teeth into a double cheeseburger from her hotel bed. She wasn't just hungover - it was actually the best burger I ever had, too.

Super Duper had gotten even better since the last time I had it last year. Lesson learned: stick either the red onions that come on the signature burger instead of substituting my beloved grilled onions. The flavor combination is perfect just the way Super Duper intended. Believe them.

The garlic fries are also more delicious now, with melted (cheddar?) cheese and what seems like a bit less garlic for the perfect balance. Let's not forget the vanilla shake, which is perfectly light and sweet with a pure vanilla flavor. 

Forget In N Out, and dare I say, Shake Shack. Super Duper officially has the best burger in town.
author: Yasmin S.

description: Best burgers and best service! Doesn't matter how long is the line, the staffs always make sure to check on your order. Highly recommended!
author: Hai Yen H.

description: What happened? This time the burger was flavorless. It's such a hit or miss feeling with this company. They definitely do the shakes right however. The fries were ok, a little crisp and the ketchup is bland as well. I guess that's what healthier options get you.
author: Guisela L.

description: I liked that you can get as many pickles as you want, but the vibe there was really uncertain and a tad sad, dad.
author: dan p.

description:
Breakfast: great sandos and their itty bitty donuts are just so good when you're in a rush, but need a carb overload

Their burgers are also fantastic. 

Star: the swirl soft serve. yum yum! The kid's size is always more than enough for me - so sometimes I'll just ask for 1/2 of the kid's size so I don't feel as guilty
author: Shelley K.

description: Super duper average. Burger is subpar, fries are average and low quantity, and ketchup does not taste like heinz
author: Abhay D.

description: Great burgers! They were a liiiitle bit too greasy/oily but that's just out of personal preference, I know a lot of people do enjoy that. Other than that they were super yum (I ordered the mini burger with everything on it except for red onions and then a side of garlic fries). The garlic fries were pretty good, not the most amazing I've ever tasted but they would do the job for anyone craving some garlic-lovin' that day. Overall I went from hungry monster to a satisfied gal and I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the city!
author: Hidra S.

description: Oh wow!  Amazing!  Looking for a quick late lunch just before the museum of ice cream.  This place was perfect!  Mini burgers were amazing... and perfect size!   Kids loved the brown sugar lemonade ... I loved the blue cheese mini burger it also has mushrooms!  You can get pickle spears at the ketchup station... by the way the ketchup was also amazing ( seems like I've never noticed ketchup before... maybe they make their own?). And the line was long as we entered but it went quickly and food was served up faster than I could use the bathroom!!  Can't wait to go back!  I will sit outside next time!   This was the highlight to our museum of ice cream visit!!
author: Paulette M.

description: Breakfast sandwiches are so tasty but the last two times we bought a box of doughnuts they tasted like rancid oil. It was super gross. I wish they would change out their oil more often because they are generally really good!
author: Mag W.

description: I would give them 4 stars or more, but their ketchup is truly vile. If you bring your own, its awesome. For me the ketchup is important, and what they are serving sucks. Watery, sweet garbage. Way to ruin a great burger, guys!
author: Christopher R.

description: Loved it until I saw an unauthorized charge on my bill of $2. It is not regarding $2, it is regarding UNAUTHORIZED. I did not give you the permission to charge that $2. Next time I visit you, I will be very careful and may be you don't want me to visit you again!?!
author: V V.

description: Been here twice now.  It's always been busy, if you come around prime time you'll be fighting for tables.  Dig the complimentary pickles.  The fries are good and the burgers are super juicy and tasty.  If you ask for it bun-less they'll give you a fork and knife, which you will need because it's messy.  Also, they don't do free fries for happy hour but if you're two white guys who complain loudly enough, the manager will give it to you.
author: Walerz B.

description:
Maybe I was just really craving a burger, but I had a really good burger from Super Duper. 

For my first time, I had a great experience. Their menu isn't really huge, but it is big enough to allow for customization. They have options where you can get a burger with one or two patties, and even an option to get chicken or veggie patties. The free options of things to add onto your burgers were pretty good, especially the pickles that you can grab, but my favorite part was that you can add avocado and egg. The egg is always a winner if you ask me, but I felt like they could have added more avocado to my burger for the extra dollar I was paying, but it was still delicious nonetheless. The burger was really nice and juicy and I kind of wish I got the second patty, but at least I know for next time. I want hungry before eating, but I got hungry afterwards so I kind of regret not getting their fries, especially their garlic fries since I heard so much about it. 

Overall, great food and I would have done things differently myself. If you're hungry, get another patty and get some fries!
author: John O.

description: So I've yet to be let down by this place. I really enjoy the food here. Seriously, my favorite garlic fries I've ever had. Wish they sold these at the ballpark! Burgers are always hot and juicy. Tried the special 4 cheese burger and all the cheeses were nice and melty. If you're just looking for a good burger you can't really go wrong with Super Duper Burgers.
author: Alex P.

description:
If this rating is about the Super Duper franchise, five stars is not enough. So if you don't already know, let me break this down:

1) the beef here is not steroid injected mutated cows. It's grass fed. Remember, what they eat is what you eat.

2) it's local. The little money you spend here is placed back in the community you live in. Think real hard about this if this is a new concept. Now, don't forget to tip.

3) it's cheaper than most fast food chain. When you have tasted the burgers here, it's hard to believe it. 

4) condiments are free. Try the pickles...it's $&@&en good and it's free.

They serve breakfast, garlic fries, wine, beer and it all comes at a value that should put all fast food places to shame. I don't work there nor do I know anyone that does. I just know when I come here, the people are great, the place is clean, it is buzzing and I am good on my way out.
author: Hyon L.

description:
Burger game changer. 

All my coworkers have been telling me to try Super Duper because I've NEVER EVER tried it. We have literally been talking about this for a few months now lol. So today after a hard ass workout at Cardio Tone I bit the bullet and decided to stop by with two of my said coworkers for a bite. 

We got there at around 6:15pm on a Friday. We got lucky and beat the stream of people who came in after us. We also got the last big table. It smells so freaking good when you walk in. 

I was told to get a mini burger with cheese. I obliged and also added grilled onions because a burger always needs grilled onions. We shared an order of garlic fries as well. 

Seating-a lot of two people tables! See if you can push them together if you're 3+. We actually sat upstairs where they had a long wooden table that can accommodate a party of 6 ish. It's a nice area that overlooks the entire restaurant. There are munchkin tables outside. Some tall tables downstairs. 

Mini cheese burger-DELICIOUS. I think super duper knocks out In N Out... The pattie was so juicy and tender and perfectly cooked. It was a very good medium well. Just the tiniest amount of pink. It was perf! The cheddar was melted beautiful. Ugh. I can't believe I waited so long to try this place. 

Garlic parm fries-so much parm and garlic. Sooooo much parm. I love it. Keep adding more parm! lol 

Their homemade pickles are self serve. Have a bowl. It's got a slight kick to them. I enjoyed eating them. 

I love the way they have everything set up. If you're upstairs you don't have to go all the way down to get ketchup, napkins, pickles, etc. 

TL;DR-BETTER than In N Out, cheese burger and parm fries you won't be sorry! P. S. they have spiked milkshakes. (;
author: Dianna C.

description: This place is great!! Burgers are delicious  and u must try the garlic Parmesan fries ( garlicky goodness!) I think they are my second fave burger place now. It's pretty small place , so big groups will have a hard time sitting together but these burgers are worth standing for! Didn't have to tho lol it's fast service kinda reminds me of the in&out set up. Kinda wanted another burger but it was a good size and with the fries and the house made pickles it was just right  not a big fan of pickles but these I would totally go back for!
author: Emily M.

description: Good food, friendly staff. Even when it was packed at lunch we got our food fast.
author: Barrett L.

description:
Sooooo... I forgot that I left my phone in my lap while stepping out of the car and broke yet *another* phone screen just prior to heading into Super Duper  (hence, no photos of my grub per usuaI; also, it's become evident I need a Vi-Proof phone case like -- yesterday). However, I still distinctly recall my mini-burger being incredibly juicy and surprisingly well seasoned, as any good piece of meat should be. The fries/cheese/garlic situation was on point (one order is plenty to share between two people) and the shakes were luciously thick, ice-creamy goodness.

Verdict? Me-likes. And yet another eatery has been checked off the "Whaaaat? You've Never Been There?" (SF Edition) list. Yey!
author: Vi T.

description: My friends and I stopped in for a quick bite to eat due to seeing this place had 4 stars on yelp. I did not have a burger but I did have the grilled chicken sandwich which was fairly priced for what it is and a better deal than most in San Francisco. The sandwich was good and fresh, and filling. I would give it 4 stars on yelp for being a good place to grab a quick, fairly priced bite in the financial district.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Walking around the Castro can work up an appetite. Popped in for a quick bite to eat. Prices seem high, but quality of food and portions are totally on point. Great food, well flavoured, and hot and fresh. Friendly, fast service. Ingredients are high quality. Burgers are hand created. No pre-fab frozen moo patties here.

Popular place, but plenty of seating. Great iced tea!!
author: Captain C. Branagain G.

description: Burgers are nice and juicy. They are organic. The fries are also tasty. What really stands out about this place is the handmade pickles!! They are so good. They are like sour but a bit spicy. So good wish I could buy a jar of pickles. Complements the burger well and they are like thick pieces not slices. You get to serve them yourself. Pretty nice location right. Very popular. Good liked it ate here twice while I was visiting San Francisco.
author: Estefania C.

description:
I'm generally a fan of the SD chain however this location falls short for me. 

It's a busy area so there are always a ton of people and snagging a table can be a challenge. However, it's the food quality that I find a little disappointing here compared to a few other locations. Today my burger was dry and tasted like it may have sat for a while. Last visit, my order was lost altogether and it literally look about 15 mins to get my burger and fries. And the pickles - which I usually inhale- weren't marinated the same way, not even a hint of sweetness or heat that i've grown accustomed to.

This isn't the worst you could do on Market but I'll stick to the better locations.
author: Nina M.

description: Awesome burgers. Great Parmesan fries. The place was packed at 2 in the afternoon which means you know it's good. Worth the trip. Had a double with grilled onion, jalapeños and super duper sauce. Wish they had a gluten free bun option though.
author: Jason H.

description:
Good burger here. Nothing crazy to say but this is a solid burger. Garlic fries were way too much garlic for me after the first couple bites but they weren't bad. 
I would recommend this burger place to fellow travelers in the area that are looking for something a little different but still pretty close to a classic burger. 

Meat was cooked well, seasonings are good but the bacon wasn't my favorite type of bacon. They were small rubbery types of bacon that don't break with a bite and instead pull out completely with each bite taken. Other then that I was pleased with my food and my service here. 

Pickles are a cool touch that you can help yourself and to as many home made pickles as you want. They are a little different in taste that I've tried at so many places but they are still good.
author: Ryan S.

description: No. Just no. It's so greasy everything just starts to fall apart. UGH. Just thinking about it makes me gag. Sorry...but greasing up your burgers to "taste good" isn't my thing. Garlic. fries were ok....just...a whole bunch of grease.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Save yourself some time and money and find an in n out or something for burger cravings. The garlic fries were absolutely disappointing - I felt like I was eating dried potato skin instead of fries! They were dry and drenched in oil. Not to mention, the cheese on top wasn't even melted and would just fall off the individual fry when I tried to pick it up.

The burger was a bit better. It had a good flavor and texture but there was just WAY TOO MUCH OIL. Mind me, there's a difference between being juicy and being oily. And on top of that, there wasn't enough lettuce or tomato to counterbalance the grease either. My body felt so disgusting afterwards. 

This place is so overrated
author: Catherine C.

description: They are doing burgers right! The buns were amazing. Enjoyed some local beer and the free house made pickles. But you need to splurge and try the garlic fries. Really enjoyed them. Small spot so seating was difficult, but the food was delicious. The single patty burger was actually really filling even though it is advertised as a mini.
author: Zachary W.

description:
Super Duper is the best fast food burger joint I've ever been. I don't like many burgers in this world, and I especially do not care for the McDonals, Burger Kings, etc version of burgers. I'd rather starve than eat a fast food burger.

BUT! Thanks to a Yelp Elite (South Bay) event I got to experience SDB and boy, do I feel blessed. The veggie burg, cheese burg, and chicken sandwich are all so good! 

At this particular location, I tried their breakfast sandwich on a morning I was particularly starving. My morning smoothie wasn't going to cut it so I indulged in an egg, sausage, cheese and tomato sammy. OMG. So bomb.

Also, with hunger swirling my brain around, I got swindled into getting the ultimate breakfast package which included a large coffee and THREE donuts. I certainly did not need all that but I am also glad it happened because holy cow those donuts were good. They were crispy and warm and sweet and I need one now.
author: Kelly G.

description: Really quick service, forgot a couple toppings that I asked for but wasn't a deal breaking. Really good, juicy burger. Id come back for a quick bite.
author: Jeshuah M.

description: SUPER DOOPER YUMMY! Gave this place 5 star since I was impressed by the simplicity of the burger but has a flare of flavor for burgers. It could be bec of the grassfed beef patty or the organic ketchup that they use. Not to mention the artisan bun that's freshly baked everyday for their burgers. Im glad we visited this place. Something to look forward too when we come visit Norcal.                Note: Garlic Fries is something to die for!
author: Celestine T.

description: Good burgers but I keep coming back for the awesome and endless pickles.  I'll order a burger but instead of fries I'll get a side of pickles.. Probably not so great for my blood pressure but oh well it's not every day you get to taste one of SF's better burger establishments.  Keep up the super duper work!
author: Dan O.

description: The fact that I go to San Francisco once a year and I have five check-ins here speaks for itself-- I'm a fan! Super Duper is right by the hotel I normally stay at, it makes for the perfect quick lunch after I've flown across the country. Literally when I land I dream about a tasty burger and chocolate shake. I'm a sucker for a cheeseburger and chocolate shake at all burger places that has said combo, but man Super Duper really hits the spot. Even if there is a line it always moves fast and they always make sure your order is just right. If you are looking for a tasty simple cheeseburger at a good price walk right in to Super Duper. In San Francisco you will certainly have zero problem tracking one down!
author: Holly K.

description:
After almost a whole weekend of Chinese food with my family, my boyfriend was just craving for a burger. Decided to do a search on yelp and then decided to go to the joint with the most reviews. Ta-da, our choice was Super Duper! 

Super Duper's set up reminds me of Shake Shack. The quality is better than a typical fast food burger but it's still categorized as fast food. The prices are higher than your typical fast food burger as well. It's in that gray area between fast food and restaurant style. 

You go up, you order, and you sit down with a buzzer. The buzzer buzzes when your food is ready and that's when you go up and get it. 

My boyfriend decided to share one of their combos that included a double patty burger with cheese, garlic fries, and a drink. The whole thing came out to be about $14 with tax. Definitely a little pricey, especially if this is all for just one person. At least this was split between two people so it's decent for us. 

The burger itself was DELICIOUS. It was juicy and seasoned really really well. If I was any hungrier, I would've definitely loved to eat one all by myself! There's also options to add avocado and/or an egg to your burger but we didn't see that until after. Maybe next time! 

As for the garlic fries, it was like sheer perfection. You can smell it! I'm not sure how they go about doing these fries but it has a super garlic taste to it. Plus, they have shredded cheese on top to go with it so the garlic won't punch you in the face if you're not used to it. It was reallllly yummmmmy. 

For dessert, we tried their soft serve! You can definitely taste the vanilla really well and it is definitely a notch above any other fast food soft serve. The texture is slightly different and it actually reminded me of the texture of gelato. 

This particular location can be good or bad. If you're just walking around then it's perfect but parking will always be a pain. We came on a Sunday night so it wasn't bad at all but I can't imagine how it'll be like during the afternoon on a weekend. Ooomph. 

But I'll DEFINITELY be back when we're visiting San Francisco again.
author: Doriee D.

description:
This. Eat this. Forget the other burger place California is known for, go here. 

Ordered the "mini" and shared garlic fries--this was plenty. 

Is it mind blowing? No. Delicious? Hits the burger craving? yes and yes.
author: Melissa K.

description:
Yep, this is the Bay area's Shake Shack copycat. From the menu selection down to the metal trays, it's all very familiar. One of my roomies has resolved to save more money in 2017, so he told me to pick an affordable place for dinner (not exactly easy to do in SF). I figured this was reasonable and classier than McDonald's. 

I had the mini burger (half sized 4 oz. patty) with cheese (additional cost), lettuce, tomato, and grilled onions (free!). He had the grilled chicken sandwich- eating healthy is another one of his New Year's resolutions. We both skipped the fries and shakes, which pained me, but was the right thing to do. 

The burger was good for the price, and definitely several steps above a typical fast food joint, but not quite as good as Shake Shack IMO. I don't get the point of sesame seeds on a bun- just empty calories with zero value added, and makes it look like a Big Mac. I tried a bite of his sandwich, and it was surprisingly really tender and juicy. They did a fine job of elevating a boring grilled chicken sandwich (something I'd never think to order).

The real star of the show was actually the house made pickles. Seriously. If you enjoy pickles (insert dirty joke here), you'll LOVE these. And it just sits in a jar by the condiments, so you can eat as many as you'd like!
author: Karen S.

description: Although I loathe most fast food and the greasy variety too, this place is far from your average chain. All food is made-to-order, meaning your burger, egg sammie, or fries will always come out fresh and piping hot. They use fresh ingredients and everything is portioned well (not overkill like many burger joints). I will admit it can get a little pricey if you add on a lot of toppings (example, cheese is 50 cents extra) but you really pay for a catered experience, friendly service, and a clean venue. Great breakfast deals too! You can get an egg and cheese sandwich with a small Dyanamo donut and coffee for $5.50. They sell Dynamo donuts by the dozen, $8 for 1 and $15 for 2. They do great bulk orders too in case you need to order a lot for an office shindig.
author: Alison A.

description: The manager messaged me directly and didn't follow through on what HE offered. Not only does this location not value customers, the manager is also a liar. Never eating at super duper again.
author: Sequoia H.

description:
What do you do when you're exhausted from a long day of travel, it's raining and you're not in for a long trek out for good food? Burgers are the answer! I did a quick search for dinner options close to my hotel and Super Duper Burgers showed up, I saw some of my Yelp friends had written positive reviews and since I love a good burger I figured why not?!

I went with the basic combo but looking at the board afterwards there are lots of different choices you can go with, the buns were delicious, everything was fresh and at the drink/condiment bar you can stock up on a side of pickles which I thought was an awesome add on. 

The inside is industrial and trendy but there's lots of seating since there's an upstairs area as well to accommodate additional guests. For a rainy Sunday night the place was packed with a long line forming while I ate. Signs on the wall indicate the local and organic ingredients that they source which I thought was a great initiative.
author: Miranda R.

description: Veggie burg is bomb, workers are friendly and place has a cool atmosphere. Cookies and cream shake
author: Quinn V.

description: Great burger joint. Very similar to flavor of a burger mini chain in Toronto called burgers priest. This place has home made everything for condiments including ketchup mustard and pickles. I usually have a zero tolerance for ketchup as it must be standard Heinz ketchup but this place is good. Great burgers and check out the free mini donuts at the counter.
author: J P.

description:
Got me some super duper burger. It was a pretty good burger where I got bacon, cheese, and everything on it. It doesn't deserve a five because there isn't anything that's super special about it. While IN n Out is like McDonald's this is more like a Shake Shack kind of vibe. After eating a couple bites of the burger I hit this conundrum where the oil was spilling onto my hands and I needed napkins. But because it didn't come with napkins, I had to go get it myself, but in order to get up and walk to the napkins I had to stow my phone away into my pocket, but I couldn't stow my phone away because of the napkin problem and the oil just starting to dribble. 

It was a catch-22 which then reminded me to finish reading catch-22, which was on my kindle, which I couldn't get because of the oil yet again. What a concept!
author: Willy X.

description: Amazing burgers. Seriously good burgers for a more casual spot. My wife really enjoyed her chicken burger too. The garlic fries were great if a bit cold when it arrived. Service was pretty friendly too. Overall a great burger spot.
author: David L.

description:
Phenomenal burgers! I'll admit I got the double with blue cheese, onions, and bacon and enjoyed every bite! 

Their burgers are what I try to make at home, but even better. 

A very unique burger experience while I was in San Francisco!

I hope they come east!
author: Jason S.

description:
Yeah, this place really is Super Duper. With such a cheesy name like Super Duper Burgers, you may have some reservations about this popular burger joint on Market Street. Once inside, you understand why they are popular. The restaurant has counter service with a rather large two-level dining area. Drinks and condiments are self-serve to help speed up the process.

I chose the Mini Burger, which is really a decent 1/4 natural beef patty with the fixings. Paired with perfectly cooked French fries, this burger hit the spot. The rich flavor of the meat cut through the complementary grilled onions and optional cheddar cheese. The burger is nice and juicy with a loose texture indicative of fresh ground meat. The fries are near perfect with a great crisp texture and soft interior.

You can easily add up the toppings and go overboard with extra sides, but I found the basics were nearly perfect which is a great sign. Even though they are very busy, they are fast and accurate with the orders. You can easily get a quick and wholesome burger fix here, and even an organic soft-serve cone after! Highly recommended.
author: Kristian D.

description: YUMMMM! Just went with the mini burger combo with everything on it! Cooked perfectly, juicy, seasoned well. All around good burger. The food came out really fast which I was surprised at because it was soo busy. Kid friendly, my daughter ate her burger faster than I did, apparently she liked it!  My other daughter ordered a grilled cheese, which isn't listed on their menu, but they were able to make. Fast and friendly service. I can't wait to go back!
author: Brie D.

description:
Easily the best burger I've ever had! My husband and I had just left the Giants game and wanted to grab a bite to eat before heading back to Dublin. We aren't from the area and are only staying in the Bay Area for the summer so we had no idea where to eat. 

We pulled up the yelp app and saw these awesome reviews and gave it a try! Honestly it was an incredible burger, we both got the Super Burger. It was perfectly juicy and the bun was amazing! Their beef is ground fresh everyday and from vegetarian feed cows! The buns are from a local bakery and you can tell. The service was fast but quality and everyone on staff was friendly and seemed to enjoy their job and offered great recommendations! You can bet we will be back before the summer ends!! 
Very impressed!
author: Lindsey H.

description: The first stop for food I made during my trip to San Fran 3 years ago and loved it. I distinctly remember the fries being amazing with the unique toppings. Great spot to go in a great location which is easily walkable from many office buildings.
author: David B.

description:
I like their cheeseburgers because the are always cooked fresh and taste good. Sometimes I get french fries and they're tasty too. The homemade pickles are good and crunchy.

I must admit the guy who swept around my table and feet while I was eating really annoyed me. I get it. Try and keep the place clean but while I'm eating?
author: Loo J.

description:
Super Duper Burgers seems to be the Bay Area's homegrown equivalent of Shake Shack or Five Guys, a gourmet fast food burger chain where you can have an unfussy meal with alcohol and a decent sit-down atmosphere. All of these places are more expensive and less viscerally satisfying than In-N-Out, in my opinion, but I always appreciate them anyway.

My husband and I met my friend Yangchen C. and her family for a casual lunch when we were in San Francisco. Yangchen suggested the place because she has a toddler who likes to explore, and Super Duper Burgers is relaxed enough that no one really cares if a baby is doing some light climbing at the next table. We walked from our hotel in Union Square, and no one cared that we had our luggage with us either. The space was pleasant, cheerful and open, and we occupied a row of tables by the windowed wall facing onto the street. We ordered at the counter, and service was fast and friendly.

I got a Super Burger, a hefty fast food burger with two 4-oz. patties and Super Sauce, with cheese for an extra 75¢. I got some of the free toppings--grilled onions, jalapeños, and housemade pickles--and sprung for the avocado for another dollar. Ended up being almost a $10 burger without fries, but fine enough for a sit-down lunch. My husband got a Super Burger with bacon, and we split an order of the French fries, and supplemented with strawberry and vanilla shakes. The food was solid, if not especially memorable. I enjoyed my burger and fries, and the shakes were thick and creamy.

My husband loves his burgers, so I have a feeling Super Duper Burgers would be in our rotation if we lived in the Bay. It's a likable place with good fast food, a nice default for a cheap sit-down meal where you can still get a beer.
author: Steph C.

description: juicy burgers and excellent garlic fries ! great staff and manager too. very friendly.
author: Gui F.

description:
Super Duper Burgers; YOU ARE SUPER DUPER! 

Hands down, one of my favorite burger joints there is. From the burgers to the garlic fries and to the shakes; everything about this place is so delicious! 

Located in the mist of the shopping areas of Union Square, this is my favorite place to stop by. 

I usually get the mini burger which isn't mini at all. The difference between the mini and the super duper is that mini has one 4 oz. patty and the super duper has two 4 oz. patties. Hungry? Then get the super duper! Add the cheese for $0.50 extra because you won't regret it. It's perfectly melted onto the juicy patty. TOTALLY MOUTH WATERING GOODNESS. There are free toppings that you can add on such as lettuce, tomato, red onions, super sauce, jalapeno peppers, grilled onions and pickles. If you love to add an egg to your burgers, it's an extra $1.50 and it goes perfectly with the burger. My boyfriend usually gets the chicken sandwich which he completely loved. The chicken for the sandwich was perfectly grilled and super juicy. Pepper jack cheese goes great with it! Definitely would recommend you getting that if you're not much of a beef person. 

The garlic fries here...bomb. They have a generous topping of cheese and the garlic isn't overpowering. The shakes here are super tasty as well. My favorites are the vanilla or fresh strawberry shake. They come in a big glass cup that fills you up & it's organic! Try dipping your fries in your shake because it's actually pretty good.. if its not weird. 

For all you pickle lovers, they have homemade pickled jars for you to enjoy with your meal! Eat as much as you want! 

Service here is great. Even when it seems crowded, the lines move up pretty fast and your food is ready in about 5-10 minutes with the buzzer to tell you when it's ready. I wouldn't recommend taking your car to get here because it's crazy in this part of SF. 

All in all, definitely would recommend trying Super Duper even in any other locations they may have. Everything tastes super fresh and I literally love everything here!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
I love this place. Although I always get the chicken sandwich, (I know it's a burger place but I just love chicken sandwiches!) it never seems to disappoint. 

I love that they give you complimentary homemade pickles and they also have beer and wine. I, of course, also have to always get the garlic fries with the extra sauces. Food is always spot on and although the place is always packed, you can still manage to find a seat.
author: Katlyn H.

description:
Coworker and I worked late tonite so we decided to grab dinner afterwards. We were on our way to the ramen restaurant and then I suddenly spotted Super Duper and I said "I wanna eat here instead!!"

My first time here after hearing rave reviews from just about everybody I know. I can't believe I waited so long to try this place.

I got the Mini Burger (which is not so Mini) with bacon and cheese. Oh man, I forgot to add the egg too :(
We also shared garlic fries and a cookie.

The beef was very juicy and it was a pretty YUM burger. Now I get why everybody loves it.
Don't know how much my burger cost since my coworker paid :)
author: Linda W.

description: I walked to Super Duper Burgers from my hotel, a quick 10-minute walk! When I got there, I realized how "super" this place really was; the line was almost out of the door! But, when there is a long line, there is good food, right! So, I waited patiently in line and perused the menu. I decided on the Super Burger with everything ($7.75 - Two 4 oz. patties, with Super Sauce with cheese +75¢) and an order of French Fries ($2.75) with a water. The staff was super friendly, and you got a buzzer to let you know when your food was ready. I grabbed my water and a seat at the counter bar, which directly faces the kitchen and their handy work. I only had to wait about 10 minutes before my buzzer informed me that my Super Burger was ready! YAY! I grabbed my food and headed over to the condiment area. Now, I firmly believe in not messing with the chef's creation, so, I put a little mustard in a dish and grabbed a couple house made pickles and went back to the counter to enjoy my meal. My first bite was filled with delicious beef, cheese, and all the fixings. Did it melt in my mouth, yes, yes it did! And those fried though, man, crisped to perfection and not too fat, not too skinny! Super Burger filled all my burger dreams and more. The burger was huge, and maybe too much for me, but, I struggled through and finished my meal with a big fat smile on my face. Go check them out!
author: Leeann C.

description: Fave spot for a good and affordable meal with the fam and many combinations to please with a beer.
author: Val d.

description: Ate here last weekend while walking to Union Square. Pretty decent burger joint. Had the chicken sandwich with the fries...comes to about $11. Felt the portions were small for the prices on the menu.
author: Jatin M.

description:
Definitely not your average burger joint. What I love most is the service-- employees seem like they're genuinely treated well and as a result, treat YOU well. The basic, no-frills burgers are everything a burger should be and hits the spot without breaking the bank. They're juicy, fresh, satisfying, but doesn't leave you feeling sluggish. I also appreciate the multiple "kids size" options that allow you to cut back a bit if you need to watch what you're eating.
In the desserts realm, the shakes here are delicious and the little chunks of chocolate chips sprinkled throughout bring extra delight with every sip. I had the dipped cone as well, but seriously struggled to eat it. The soft serve underneath started leaking out right away, and I was constantly scrambling to keep things under control. Unfortunately I didn't love the texture of the soft serve either.
author: Amy C.

description:
Having only been to the one in Novato, I was glad to check out this location in Union Square.  Line was out the door on this late Saturday evening (about 10pm) and we were only there for dessert but I'm glad we waited.   
We had a bunch of Super Duper Burger newbies so I got them to try the pickles whilst we waited.   They were happy and in love before we even made it to the counter.Great pickles.  LOL
  
Our group of 15 each tried one variance of cone or milkshake and everyone walked away happy.   Literally. Walked away because there's no place for 15 people to sit. :)
My chocolate-dipped soft serve was perfect.
author: Heidi D.

description:
Super Duper are my favorite chain of fast food style burgers and shakes in the country.

The original location of Shake Shack in NYC is very good, but no other Shake Shack I've been to is nearly as good. Five Guys is great, but extremely unhealthy and I consider the "aftermath" of a meal as part of my consideration of great food. In-N-Out is a solid baseline, but not exceptional at anything really.

Every single Super Duper I've eaten at has had exceptional ingredients, great flavor, and that consistency is what makes them #1 for me. The place is more expensive than other fast food joints, but it's worth it for me.
author: Corry F.

description: Best Burger EVER!!!!! It's soooo worthy of its fame! The beef is so meaty, juicy, and yummy! Lettuce and tomatoes together with buttered buns makes it mouthwatering! Garlic cheese fries goes perfectly w/ BEER! Make sure you order one!
author: Miffy C.

description: The burger was perfectly cooked and the garlic fries and shake were delicious. Would've been 5 stars, but portions are a bit small for the price and the service was not as great as I would've expected. When they made a mistake on our order there was no apology or even an acknowledgement of it. Nonetheless, it was probably a one off and the food was worth it.
author: Sam S.

description: Really enjoyed my double burger- the food was excellent quality and served hot. Liked that you can see into the kitchen. Don't miss out on the homemade pickles - they were outstanding
author: Aly E.

description: Not great but not awful either, would certainly do in a pinch.  It's noisy as hell and it doesn't help that the cashier was speaking as tho he was auditioning for a micro machines commercial.  When asked to repeat the beer selection, it was no louder or slower so I ordered the only beer I managed to hear.  (Not so helpful Jonathan!). Finally, there's no American cheese or ability to cook your burger to anything but medium, which was too done for my tastes.
author: Harmon P.

description: A+ Veggie Burgers in my opinion. Super Duper also has great shakes and has one of the best restaurant branded sauces. Definitely recommend
author: Sade B.

description: Classy glassys for water I'm impressed. They have wine on tap here which also ups the fancy factor. As expected, veggie burgers were delicious. I think Super Duper may just become an SF staple for me.
author: Jakob Eats Alone ..

description:
I checked out this location while staying in the area. Service was super friendly and helpful. I ordered the Super Duper combo with the big burger, fries, and a drink and it was about $13. It was a good amount of food for the price and everything was super fresh and super good. My meal came out in about 5 minutes, which was really quick considering it was really busy inside. I'll definitely be back! 

Ohhh and the pickles! ;)
author: Birdie C.

description:
If you are in the mood for a big juicy burger, its hard to beat Super Duper Burgers.

Yes, they are kinda fatty/oily, but thats why they taste so good.
author: David T.

description:
Must get: garlic parmesan fries!

This place was packed when we came on a Friday night- a good sign for delicious food but also near impossible to find a place to sit. We opted to get our food to go instead of breathing down people's neck for their table. 

We got a super burger which is pretty much a double patty burger and a side of garlic parmesan fries. The fries were definitely the highlight of the meal. So satisfyingly garlicky that I wanted to come back the very next day. Best fries I had for a great value. 

The burger was decent but the patties were thin and a bit dry. Decent burger but compared to the fries.. Get the fries.
author: Eva I.

description: So when you want a fast meal after shopping can't beat this place. I always order the super combo with a extra order order of fries. Today though I opted to get a chicken meal. Who ever heard of a square chicken? I enjoyed the fries. Burger King is second best when it comes to fries. Avoid the healthier chicken sandwich though didn't impress me much. Haven't had a cone yet but soon lol.
author: Rey B.

description: The part I miss about working in San Francisco the most is this place ! It is sooooo good (a tad greasy by what do you expect) ! The burger is good, the garlic fries are bomb, and the chicken sandwich is my fav. I hear the veggie burger is good but I can't speak from firsthand experience.
author: Renee F.

description:
My first charbroiledsuper duper double burger was beyond well done.  I was told that they are all cooked medium unless specified.

Jules who was working the counter was nice enough to hook me up with a medium burger after my burger initially was so charred beyond the point that it had a burnt aftertaste.  Thankfully those complimentary pickles helped to cleanse my palate from the burntness.  

I like to have like 10 paper towels handy...trust me you'll use them all....to absorb the waterfall of fat that just runs down when you squeeze into a super duper burger....yes it can be a hot mess but it's all love.  If your going to get fries here....goooo with the garlic fries.....no extra charge for more garlic FTW!
author: David C.

description: The burgers are fresh and the fries are tasty. Just be aware that the lines can get busy around lunch time during working hours. Definitely worth a try if you are a burger lover.
author: Andrew P.

description:
I've had Super duper before at a another location (castro), and it was delicious. I couldn't wait to come back to San Francisco and eat another burger..

But something bad has happened now. My burger this time was not good or my garlic fries! I was super duper disappointed, also the pickles didn't taste the same. One star!

My bread was soggy, meat wasn't as juicy and They were skimpy for the extra toppings. Pickles are more sour and texture was soft! I will try to give them another shot, but this location sucks! Quality has gone down!
author: Lila M.

description: Great food!  Great service!!  Thank you Super Duper!
author: Reno D.

description: Burger was juicy, fries were fresh, vanilla shake was perfect consistency. Excellent customer service. Busy location. Very organized. Will definitely be back soon!!!
author: Angela D.

description:
Our first trip to San Francisco, after a delayed flight, little food and not so great snacks on the plane my husband decides he just wants a "really good burger." So we looked at few places and eventually saw that this place had over 2,000 reviews and decided to try it out. It was a GREAT decision. My husband got a double and I got a single, we shared an order of garlic fries (they give you plenty). And we found it hard to stop eating, the burgers are cooked medium-well and they are juicy, the toppings are fresh and the buns are perfection. I usually pass on ALL sauces but the "super sauce" they add to their burgers was great - it wasn't messy or overbearing in taste.

I HIGHLY recommend this place. Be prepared to wait (they have a sign about it when you walk in) but we went on a Thursday night around 8pm and got our food within 10 minutes. And finally, their employees are great and super friendly with the tourists. You want a burger? Go here!
author: Brittney J.

description:
Decently fast at lunch for the crowd size, food knocks it out of the park and decently priced

Love the special menu burgers and fries with dipping sauces
author: Robin H.

description:
Loved it : I had the Mini burger and I loved it. It was juicy (but still manageable :-)), very good and the meat was perfect. I have high standards regarding burgers, so I was quite happy to find this place. 
My husband took the veggie burger and he also loved it.
Will definitely be back :-)
author: Caroline P.

description:
I was drunk. And hungry. And this hit the spot perfectly. 

My review might change if I ever come back here sober. But until that day comes, I will forever basque in how deliciously dreamy this burger was.
author: Mikkel J.

description:
Great burger place in the city! I came here with a friend and didn't expect it to be so darn good. 

I love how the burgers are cooked medium and you can can tell they use quality meats. They are so juicy and can be messy to eat because of that fact. I usually end up using a pile of napkins because it does get a bit greasy. I usually get a mini burger since I always add garlic fries on the side. If i'm feeling extra hungry I add their delicious shakes as well. The garlic fries are so crispy and full of garlic that they are a MUST. The shakes are creamy and thick that you can easily share it with people.

A solid burger joint in the city and a MUST TRY if you've never been.
author: Keizzel C.

description: I had my first visit to a Super Duper Burgers last week on my family's trip to SF and maybe I'm being over dramatic but I seriously thought this was the best burger I've ever had. Is this not how a burger is supposed to taste? I'm an In N Out fan and those are my go to choice for burgers, but SDB wins the battle of the burger. I loved it so much I had to have it again the following day. I too thought the burgers were a bit more on the greasy side (bottom bun was over run with grease by the time was finishing up the burger) but it was still an amazing tasting burger. Will definitely be my go to stop for burgers when in SF.
author: Ryan S.

description:
So today we felt like a good burger and, I thought "super duper, of-course
Delicious burger and milk shake!
author: Maria M.

description: Ok, I eat hamburgers about twice a year but when I do have one it's gotta be good.  I ordered the mini burger, garlic fries and a chocolate shake.  The mini burger and fries were greasy and divine.  Meat, bun, veggies were fresh and good.  The fries were really good.  The shake was one of the best I've had in a long time.  AND then there are the pickles!  OMG they are amazing.  I don't eat this way often but when I do...then it needs to taste just like this!
author: Kimba L.

description: My burger was closer to rare. It came out to quick, I should of sent back but it was a great burger. I'll go back again and again but I'll take an extra Prilosec.My wife had the single patty cheeseburger. Next time for me it's a single with bacon and avocado. Fries a great, love the atmosphere. Perfect stop before a Giants game.
author: Jimmy T.

description:
Rating all for breakfast sandwiches... $2.50 for a killer breakfast sandwich (english muffin, egg, chipotle sauce). Add avocado and cheese and you're winning!

The best part of the breakfast sandwich is there is never a line or a wait, and it's made to order.
author: Kerry G.

description:
When I was a student, it was a really goo restaurant for me because of two reasons. 

First, their burger is best. It is the best!

Second, the price was not super expensive. compared to other restaurant it is expensive, but now super expensive. It is not bad. 

The important thing is that they sell very delicious beer!

Beer and Burger! it is the best couple!
author: Luke S.

description: We were on a vacation to San Francisco and absolutely loved the burgers. Hands down the best burger I have ever had. Liked the casual feel of the restaurant and some excellent time with my family playing foosball.
author: Jinsi P.

description:
Delicious burgers in SF!  Meat is super juicy and the garlic fries are bomb.  We came here on a recommendation from a friend calling Super Duper the Shake Shack of SF.  I was down for a good burger and Super Duper provided for me.

I ordered the mini (1 patty) and garlic fries.  My friend told me to order the patty medium rare to guarantee that it isn't overcooked.  It was the perfect pinkness and juiciness!  I like that the burgers have tomato and lettuce.  The garlic fries have chunks of garlic and parmesan all over so be prepared to reek of garlic after this meal.  

Seating is difficult at this busy location at peak hours.  You gotta kinda stalk people and share tables if need be.  

A great burger chain in the bay!  Pretty darn good fast food... I'm starting to drool again.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I expected too much from this place. The vegetarian burger is just average. The fries weren't that great either. For me this place did not reach my expectations!
author: Srinija K.

description:
This review goes out to the terrible customer service provided by Aliyah who displayed in my opinion unprofessional and unfriendly service. 

The place wasn't even busy yet she somehow gave my buzzer to someone else and left me waiting 20+ minutes for a simple order.

She offered no apology for the fact that someone else took my order because of her mistakes and instead was rude and short with me. 

Because of the type of customer service displayed by this particular worker, I will not be coming back.
author: Annie V.

description: Delicious Burgers will most definitely be going back again. Best French Fries and fried pickles go great with any burger. I really loved that this place actually seasons there food. I can't tell you how many bland no seasoning not even seaming like they use Salt and Pepper restaurants I have been subject to and I'm beyond sick of it. I find I have to make burgers myself if I want some flavor so it's nice to now have a place I can get a good flavorful burger at without having to make it myself! Whooohooo
author: Kim K.

description:
I love me a burger. So, when I was famished and just arrived in San Fran, I found the closest highly rate burger spot. They were super yum! 

I ordered a burger and a strawberry oreo milshake. The burger was good sized, hot, and savory! It was also super greasy. Not a place I would frequent often for heart health purposes! The milshake was thick, creamy and had a great combo of flavors! 

The feel of the place was super casual and fun! I would totally go back anytime!
author: Cheyenne C.

description: I had the Blue cheese burger and garlic fries. Both were great, but the burger was quite "juicy." If you're not into oily food, I would skip out....but realistically you're eating burger and fries and it's going to be greasy lol. #GoodEats
author: Marlena R.

description: Vastly inferior food to shake shake and similar in price, perhaps a bit more expensive. They don't even put the effort into melting the cheese on the cheese fries. Burger patty was grainy, bun was uninspired, and they forgot to add the toppings. This place just isn't worth it. I don't understand how it has 4 stars.
author: Scott K.

description: You can't loose here. We always want to try new places yet if I see a Super Burger there's no need to keep driving. Great Veggie burger also. Friendly service and great food.
author: Melvin S.

description: I have been to San Francisco plenty of times and never stopped in to Super Duper Burgers. Yesterday my girlfriend and I finally went to eat there and it was by far one of the best small chain burgers I've had. We ordered the Super Duper burger with garlic fries and a chicken sandwich with regular fries. The hamburger was delicious, I appreciate a good smash style beef patty and the garlic fries were great as well. The chicken was juicy and had good flavor, but it's called Super Duper BURGER, not Super Super Chicken. 10/10 on the burger.
author: Evan M.

description: Great burgers and fries. I usually get the super duper burger with cheese and side of garlic fries. One of the better smash burgers I've had at a burger place. Prices are a bit higher but it's worth it.
author: Matthew K.

description:
tl;dr - The only thing "super duper" about this burger place is the name. The burgers were dry and flavorless and the garlic fries  cold and soggy. For $11 I would recommend getting 2x In-n-Out's double patty burgers with animal fries. 

"Super duper" burger: The 8oz double patty burger comes with lettuce and tomatoes between two toasted buns. The "medium" cooked burger was overly well done and very dry.
