The first two bites were like chalk dust and it only got marginally better once I bit into the mildly sauced middle. It didn't help that the burger was lukewarm (do they not make them fresh?) and almost greaseless (I'm not expecting a salad here). This burger falls far from its namesake.

Garlic fries: Cold. Soggy. Kind of like fries you'd left overnight on the counter and then doused with some flavor to cover up the staleness. The garlic flavor was strong which I really liked but the snowy layer of cheese slid off like it didn't belong.
author: Carrie X.

description: Wow. I just had the best experience at Super Duper Burger. It was incredible. The burger, delicious. The fries, crispy and on point. Garlic fries, amazing!!! (Get the garlic fries, you won't regret it!) Milkshake, on point. The food also came out super fast. Service was great. My friends and I loved it and we will definitely be coming back.
author: Melinda W.

description:
Another SF visit. Another trip to a Super Duper. Why is this SD so close to the other one? But for my handy dandy Yelp app, I would have thought that I'd reviewed this location. Well, I suppose things can change in three years. Whereas earlier I was smitten by Super Duper, this time around and in the location, I was okayed.

I ordered the same thing as before: 4 oz. with bacon & cheese (no mayo), cheese garlic fries and a beer. This time, there was no spark. Granted, this visit was during the lunch rush and not during the (more) relaxed evening hours. The folks behind the bar poured the wrong beer but, to their credit, they let me keep the erroneous brew and poured me the correct one. 2 for 1 beers is always awesome... except when your doctor buddy is on your a$$ about watching carbs and your expanding waistline. #butilovebeer

The food was ready a short time later. My burger was more burnt than charbroiled and rather than melty, garlicky fries, these were lukewarm fries topped with shredded cheese and garlic bits. Like, parts of cloves. As in, unpleasant to bite down on in the absence of high heat and some type of sauce. Were things like this on Mission Street? Did I remember wrong? Is this the little girl I carried? As you can tell, I was confused. I am confused. My Gary Cooper, Puttin' On The Ritz razzle dazzle dancing had been replaced by some iteration of contemplative, angry Alanis... and that hasn't been good since the '90s. At the end of the day, it's a burger, fries and a beer. Even when it's bad (unless it's baaad), it's okay. Thing is, I vaguely remember it really really dang good. I want that Super Duper back. Hmm, maybe Mission has the magic?
author: Johnny T.

description:
In an era of Shake Shack and Umami spreading their delicious tentacles across the country, Super Duper Burgers has kept under the radar a bit - at least outside of the Bay area. However, only a few hours on the ground had me convinced that I had to check it out, and check it out I did. Worth it. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

If you've been to more or less any of the fast casual spots that have sprung up around the country, you'll appreciate the service and atmosphere here at Super Duper Burgers. One noteworthy difference; however, is that you're more than likely to encounter a line here at SDB that well into the double digits. I lucked out and waited only ten or so minutes around 9PM on a Friday, but seating was a whole separate ballgame, and you'll without question be hard-pressed to find seating for more than maybe just a single. With that in mind, service won't take more than ten minutes, which is impressive given that these burgers are made fresh to order. Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

For $6.50 I landed myself a mini burger with cheese, which was about the size of a medium fast food burger. While you'd need more to hold you over for a big meal, this was satisfying, and the full burgers are still priced under $10. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

Foof! There's nothing fancy about them per se, but Super Duper Burger has fresh and flavorful ingredients that will have you coming back for more. The bun? Very good and light, the patty? Flavorful, and the toppings? Freshly cut and did their job of bringing it all together. I didn't get to sample the fries or milkshakes, but it was overly apparently that everyone around me was enjoying just about everything on the menu. Well done indeed. Dual Stars Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

I'm tempted here for sure and for certain, but I can't say with a straight face that Super Duper Burgers is better than say Umami, which I've also given four stars. Having said that, you need to come here, and don't be surprised if in the next few years you see a Super Duper Burgers pop up in your city. No Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description: We hit this location for lunch occasionally. Friendly staff, and I'm always surprised at how quickly they get the food out. The flow of people is good, so even though its busy we pretty much always find a seat.
author: Jason W.

description: Super fast and great service here. I really appreciate the manager (bald guy in blue shirt) running around but with the biggest smile on his face and it actually looks like he enjoys his job! The food is super affordable considering it is in San Francisco. The wait time was around 3-4 minutes (not bad considering it was busy). They also offer pickles for free and condiments. The manager came by giving out donut samples which were super good. I love that the place is clean and modern. Overall really good experience.
author: Enya N.

description:
Mmm mmm, guilty guilty guilty!  Yep, I just downed me a big juicy Super Burger, and that in turn produced that greasy "Soooo damn good" feeling haha!

Quick highlights: 
~ Easy to find with that orange sign along Market St.  Between 3rd and 4th. 
~ The pattie is cooked medium, yippee!  Why would you want a well-done burger anyways,  bleh.  It's gotta be pink and ripe!
~ Comparison:  The Super Burger ($7.75) with it's two 4 ounce patties is similar to a Five Guys burger, only I feel the Super Burger looks and tastes slightly cleaner.  And I ordered mine with grilled onions and cheese (+$0.75);  So freakin' meaty and juicy!  But not as healthy clean as a double char at The Habit Burger.   
~ The Mini Burger ($5.50) was basically the same burger only with one less hamburger pattie.
~ Loved the free 'homemade' pickles on the side too.
~ With the Mini Burger, we just made it a combo ($10.25) with garlic fries.  The fries were nice and freshly cut, not overly garlicy as well.  I loved their fries.
~ The dining is typical with small wooden tables and aluminum chairs.  They've got a small patio as well.  
~ Service was excellent.  The cashier gave some yummy suggestions, and the guy delivering our order helped us out with whatever we needed.    

Yeah, I gotta go back...  I already regret not doing my yelp duty by taking yelp pics.  Next time, I'm trying their breakfast sandwich and donuts.  Or even their Chicken Sandwich with a Spiked Chocolate Malt.  Ohhhh, yeah, gotta go back!  I've seen others order that and they just look phenomenal!  I'll be back!
author: Ron R.

description: This is a place I would recommend to anyone looking for a simple but delicious burger. I always tend to get a super burger(double Patty) with grilled onions and pickles on the burger. This is actually the spot that I took my now girlfriend for a first date.
author: Anthony R.

description:
So they have a deal. Get the mini burger + french fries + drink for $9.25 (before tax). I regret not going with that deal. My assk wanted to wait on a drink...because I wanted to get boba after I ate. My mini burger +cheese and fry order came out to $9-something after tax. Just do the Deal..pay the extra dollar so you can quench your thirst. 

Came here during the busiest time-- lunch hour. So it took a while for my order to be up. After about 10-15 min, my coaster looking vibrator went off and I swooped my order. First things first..the mini burger is not mini at all. When I think mini burger..I think the size of a McDonald's cheeseburger..but NEIN! It's kinda like an above average size burger. So it'll definitely fill you up. The burger was okay..not dry, lightweight juicy. Grease Game was strong tho..so have napkins on hand. The burger was slightly above standards? I'd say. I wanted to add egg and avocado but I didn't feel like being a baller shot caller--.I had to save my moolah for other good eats/treats nearby! Pickles at the condiment counter were a bit on the sour vinegar-y side. Fries were good, but I received mostly the potato skin ends. 

I also had their vanilla/chocolate swirl at their other location which is very close by. You can get the kid size or regular for a few bucks and its ORGAN-NIC. Added some malt crumbles on top and yum. 'twas quite good in the cold breezy city. 

Overall, SDB is pretty A-okizay. Good food, service was good, and prices were reasonable. Yeah, I'd come back...
author: Vicky L.

description:
I used to come here all the time, but it just continually gets worse. First, I had to stop ordering vegetables on the burgers because their quality was so bad.

Of course, garlic fries are best eaten hot -- so I had to start ordering them specifically fresh and hot. Today, I watched the guy at the counter even type the words "fresh and hot" in the computer. 

The fries arrived cold. I sent them back. The fries arrived cold again! Truly bizarre.

As the manager gave me my money back, he tried to ham-handedly lie that the fries are served cold because the oil for the fries is cold. Why bother, man -- just refund the customer his money -- of course, I'd eaten hot fries there dozens of times before. Never again.
author: Adam Z.

description:
Double patties were soggy 
Tomatoe was smooshy
Lettuce was rough and chewy
Nothing fresh
Nothing authencity anymore of this place
Stringy onion and old
What happen here
Where is gordon ramsey
author: Chef C.

description:
I've eaten  here at least ten times. We live near by

The fries are either soaked in oil or are cold. Or they are perfect, hit or miss

The chicken sandwich is okay. It also was not hot

The burgers are good.  It was the only hot item.  I'm guessing the cook made the fries and chicken sandwich first, and they sat on our tray 5-10 minutes until the burger was done . The burger was the only hot item on the tray, when they called us to pick up our order

I really like their veggie burger
author: Foodlover B.

description: Service was fast, but the burger was a little too salty. Didn't taste as great as the first time I came about a year ago. Oh well hopefully my taste buds were were off this time
author: Ahmed H.

description: Good tasting burgers and fries oh and homemade pickles
author: George C.

description:
First time @ Super Duper this morning to try their breakfast, as I saw it was a "Go To Spot" for breakfast on an SF site recently. A couple good things about this place to note;
1) Great Location
2) Spacious
3) Clean
4) No Line in the morning for breakfast
I really enjoyed my organic egg, sausage w/ light Chiptole sauce on a bun!!
author: Rhett B.

description:
Seriously, how can you NOT dine here if you're in Union Square? Loved it enough to eat here again the next day, judgment accepted.

I ordered the Super Duper Combo: two 4 oz. patties with cheese and a side of French fries, and a fountain drink. The burgers were super juicy, the cheese wasn't overpowering or too salty, and damn, I even ordered it with the burger bun! Definitely worth the cheat meal because the bun didn't break up and wasn't soggy even through the last bite. Super fresh burgers with amazingly crispy fries (order it well done!). I mean, just look at that rich green lettuce! It's a case of the "looks exactly like the photos and tastes just as good" scenario. The photos are not deceiving! Real talk, I'm a SoCal native, and will have to say that this place is a tie with In n Out as my top fast food burger... It's hard to choose because although they both offer a simple menu, they both are unique enough (subject to my cravings) that I refuse to choose. Why not have both? Why not zoidberg?

Price-wise, you're paying a premium compared to other fast-food places, but the quality is there and the portion is generous, so the pricing isn't too bad considering the location. I appreciate their focus on locally-sourced vegetarian-fed beef and efforts on sustainability. Coupled with friendly service, this is recipe for an excellent experience without the hefty price tag ($$$).

The interior feels more industrial with high ceilings and dimmer lights. They do have an upstairs deck for additional seating, which is great because we all know downtown SF is built upwards, similar to Hong Kong and Tokyo.

You best believe I'm hitting Super Duper Burgers up after running the Nike Women's Half Marathon in October.
author: Christina T.

description: Was visiting SF and had a craving for a burger and a friend heard of this place so we had to try, at first the place didn't look so special but after trying the burger I'd have to say it was hands down the best burgers! MUST TRY!
author: Maryam A.

description:
Do you like burgers?  Start here.  Really, this place is awesome.  I walked into this location thinking it would be an average burger joint, but it got my attention instantly.  Okay okay, maybe it was the fact that you could get a beer here, but the food is really good.
  This location was pretty cool.  It felt a bit hectic and over crowded at first, but you can find seating quickly.  We didn't have to wait long.  The staff was really nice and helpful.  That was the first good sign that this restaurant would be good.  Our cashier made great suggestions and explained what everything was in detail.  
  We got some beer and a couple of their burgers.  Boy, were we surprised how good these burgers tasted.  From bite one, it was like a race to finish each.  The quality of the ingredients, the taste, and the price all work out well.  The fresh lettuce has a nice crunch to it, then it gets complemented by the tomato slice and the sauces.  When you finally get that tasty meat taste, in all of that awesome veg crunch, you'll realize this place is worth a stop every time.
  I liked this place so much, I stopped at their other location within an hour of trying it the first time.  I love me some burgers, and this is one of the winners when visiting good old San Francisco.  If you're a tourist or local, you should be trying this place.  Preferably more than once.  Enjoy, and you're welcome.  Thank you Super Duper Burgers, your name says it all.
author: Carlos T.

description: I had a Double bacon cheese burger. It was good, I appreciate that the burgers aren't dry but a bit too greasy  for me. The ketchup they have there is amazing. Thick and the perfect taste. The fries were perfect too, fried but not too fried. Only reason they didn't get 5 stars was a bit too greasy and needs a little more seasoning on the patty. I will for sure be going back
author: Jessica U.

description: Garlic fries are the best! I bought 2 just for me.  highly recommend. Burgers are good too.
author: Esperanza C.

description:
After trying a burger here I realized that just because it's oily and really greasy doesn't mean the patty is going to be juicy. I felt like the patty was a little dry and felt a little cheated to have paid extra for bacon to only get two tiny pieces that I couldn't even taste :( However, I really enjoyed the pickles and the caramelized onions.

I thought the garlic fries had a great tang but a little hesitant because the cheese didn't really melt into the fries. If I come back, I'll definitely be getting a single patty and try out the milkshake!
author: David H.

description:
I've come around on this burger chain. It's the best and most consistent burger in the city.

My first impression was not so great but now after visiting on multiple occasions I have seen the light, and it is good.

These burgers are great. Have you had the cheese burger with an egg on top? You need to try it! The way the the juicy burger melts into the fried egg and cheese is excellent. This is a tasty burger.

The fries are average but with the cheese and garlic they are a marvel to behold. Honestly after trying their plain fries I wan't interested in ever having them again but someone got mixed up and gave me the wrong order. When I opened my bag their garlic fries opened my mind.
author: Justin S.

description:
I guess people that have given this hamburger a 5 srar rating like greasy burgers. I think the fries would have been a 5 star if we hadn't ordered the garlic fries. The fries were crispy like we ordered but we couldn't get pass the oily garlic. There was no garlic pieces so we have to assume the use some type of garlic infused oil on the fries to give them the garlic taste. 
Over priced for a grease burger and fries. Nice place though.
author: Terry W.

description:
Had a really nice time eating here with my girl after walking around downtown SF. I ordered a super burger with bacon and avocado, garlic fries, and a cookies and cream shake. Everything tasted really good but the garlic fries were the best part of the order. The shake was also really good and I'd highly recommend it. 

What really stood out to me was the service. As we were eating our meal, a manager approached us and asked how everything was. I could tell that he was a manager based on his attire. He mentioned his name was Gary and was so enthusiastic when speaking about Super Duper burger. He was very friendly and kind to us and we conversed for a while about more than just our meal. I really enjoyed our conversation and think that it's extraordinary customer service for a manager to approach customers to ensure satisfaction while eating at their establishment. You would expect this gesture to be done at an expensive restaurant, but a nice surprise at a quick bite place.

I'll definitely be back and will be sure to say hi to my new friend Gary!
author: Marc L.

description: First time here. Everything was done very nicely. Order a bacon cheese burger wanted to add BBQ sauce but they didn't have that. Burger was very presentable but didn't have a lot of taste to it even with ketchup and mustard added. My boyfriend got a regular chicken sandwich add jalapeño which he thought was awesome! Their garlic fries were super yummy with their creamy ranch! Full house and food didn't take long
author: Jeannette C.

description:
Continuing my quest to find the best burger around AZ and through all my travels. I was told this is one of the best burgers in town. Better than In-N-Out. Well let's see. 

Huge place downtown with outdoor seating, in-door seating, up-stairs seating, and counter seating. Even with all that seating there wasn't enough seating. Everyone fighting for seats. Anyways you order at the register and they give you a buzzer to tell you when your order is ready so you can pick up. We ate in so we wanted water and they gave us glass cups. Very interesting. This gives you some time to fight for a seat. 

Anyways, my son ordered the mini burger with bacon & no cheese which is basically a single pattie. I ordered a super duper with cheese which is a double pattie and garlic fries. They give you lettuce, tomato, onion, with their special sauce. 

I thought the meat was tasteless and the topping had not much flavor. A great burger has meat with taste and the topping are what make the burger explode with flavor in your mouth. This burger didn't do it for me. The garlic fries where just their fries with garlic and chives on top. Couldn't even taste the garlic on the fries. This didn't do anything for me. When the fries got cold which was really fast it made the fries taste even worst. Very unimpressed. 

Oh yea after we ate my son thought the burger was pretty good. So that's positive. 

I have to say this burger doesn't stand a chance against AZ burgers like Parasise Valley Burger Company, Hop Doddy, and Chuckbox. Also, Mo's Grill in SF is better which is in North Beach on Grant Street. So didn't pass my test. 

Would I be back? Well I always give a place a second chance so maybe. We'll see.
author: Doug T.

description:
Came here yesterday with my fella. I have had Super Duper Burgers bookmarked foreeeeever. And happened to be starving and in the area, and a killer cheeseburger and fries sounded like perfection.
Ordered a small cheeseburger with everything and added grilled onions. 
The onions made my burger a greasy sponge. Like they were boiled in oil and spooned on my burger. Not grilled at all. Not only oily, but completely flavorless. From the meat to the grilled onions to the special sauce, there was just no flavor.
Fries were cold from the time they handed them to us. 
We told the manager. She gave us a refund and offered to make us *better burgers*. We declined because.....that is what we should have been given in the first place. 
So bummed, man. I fucking love cheeseburgers. And this is literally the worst burger I have ever had. Reminded me of the frozen microwave burgers from Costco.
author: Kat R.

description:
Holy hungover food heaven. Ever wake up after a night of (over) indulging in libations and just know you're going to need something meaty, greasy, and delicious to bring you back to life? YEAH. Super Duper Burgers is where it's at.

This place is like a well oiled machine. At about 12:30 on a Tuesday the line was almost out the door. I'm happy to report that the process of ordering actually was quite speedy.

The menu is simple and you can order items a la carte or they have two convenient combos - the mini burger (1 patty) or super (2 patties) both come with fries and a drink. I had to scan the room to figure out just how super this double patty situation was (I was pretty hungry), but once spotted I realized this burger isn't messing around. It's big! I opted for the mini and it was the perfect size. Also, only in America is a "mini" a legit sized beefy patty - nothing mini about it let me tell ya!

Now the fries... If you have some mints or gum for after your meal, I definitely suggest getting the garlic fries! A-maze-ing. My fellow co-worker got a milkshake which looked pretty bomb dot com, so next time I plan to go the extra mile and tack on some sweets to my order.

If you're looking for something fast and casual but still delish (and don't mind a bit of grease), Super Duper Burgers is the spot for you.
author: Jacqueline B.

description:
If you're looking for a decent juicy burger while on the go then this is the spot for you. They have the waiting system down to a T. Don't let the lines fool you as they can handle a line extended to the doors in under ten minutes.

They feature a single or double patty burger, chicken sandwiches, milkshakes, fries, and craft beer.

Seating may be a little scarce during lunch time but that comes with the territory.

I personally had the super duper burger and loved how juicy it was. Make sure to stick with their recommendation of the neat being cooked medium as that displays the flavors perfectly. The cows who provide the meat are fed 100% vegetarian diets and they show great pride in that.

Their garlic fries were superb! If you're going to enjoy these tasty fellas topped off with cheddar cheese crumbles make sure to have a breath mint on ya. Trust me it's worth it though!

Fun stop for a quick bite I must say!
author: Tomas R.

description: My chicken sandwich had no cheese when I was charge for the cheese. They put Jalapeños in my chicken sandwich when it should be on the hamburger my wife got. I couldn't eat it so it went straight to the trash. It was late at night when we order it to go. Too bad for us, out of town, I really wanted to give it another try.
author: Leo L.

description:
Yes In and Out is great, but Super Duper is better and it's also kind of incomparable. I came here my second time completely toasted from drinking way too much Sake - like shots and shots. My appetite was ravenous. I got a double patty with bacon and cheese and the garlic fries. My partner also got a double patty and TWO orders of fries. 

Please see picture below that I hope you find helpful in making your decision to come here. 

Fresh ingredients, juicy ass burgers. Fresh garlic and cheese ALL OVA your french fries. It's so  so good. It's so so bad for you. It's also priced right for the quality ingredients. 

How could I let two little precious crumbled of ground meat just drop on the table like that? Refer to picture again.
author: Priti K.

description:
I was actually kinda surprised that the food here is really good. I ordered the single hamburger (with bacon [+$1.00], cheese [+0.50], tomatoes, lettuce, jalapeño peppers, and grilled onions). It was surprisingly good and the toppings didn't really overwhelm the flavor of the beef. The garlic fries were ok, nothing too fancy honestly. The regular fries probably tasted better. But the ketchup is another story. Not sure what ketchup they use but it is GOOOOOOD. And the pickles are delicious as well. My only complaint is that the burgers are really, really greasy, so beware if any oil drips down (hopefully not on your clothes). 

Would definitely come back :) (soooo so much better than In-N-Out)
author: Andrew O.

description: This is the second time I have been to a super duper burger and I am still infatuated. I am a HUGE fan of sour tastes and the unlimited homemade pickles and incredible. They have a great tang and compliment their amazing burgers. Although I do not always add it, the portobello mushroom is of an average portion and tastes great. What really blew me away this visit was the garlic fries. They top these fries with a great cheese and the garlic taste is infused all throughout. The fries were also incredibly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Definitely a quick bite place for me whenever I am going to be on the SF area. Caution, many super dupers close at different times so double check before you go.
author: Joshua L.

description: Went to this Super Duper because I was around Union Square. I have been to the one two blocks away twice. A lady from Super Duper sent me a $15 gift card because I wrote a Yelp review, so I used it today to get a chicken sandwich. I love the pickles at Super Duper. That's the best part of the Super Duper experience. I also received some cards to get free ice cream cones with burger or sandwich purchase, so I used one and had the chocolate cone for the first time. The chicken sandwich was okay. It was somewhat smoked. It seemed healthy. It's not fried...maybe that would be better lol. It was a good meal.
author: Denise C.

description:
This review is really a comparison to TrueBurger in Oakland, and I might otherwise rate it higher. Based on the burger, I just can't do it! 

I got the mini-burger with cheese, which is just one patty and supposed to be cooked medium. I added caramelized onions as a free topping. This is identical to what I get at TrueBurger, but it didn't taste identical.

The meat at Super Duper is VERY well seasoned, and all I could taste was salt. Some people may appreciate this. But I really couldn't taste the beef or the caramelized onions -- just the salty seasoning. The burger also didn't have the juiciness I've come to expect from this type of burger place.

What I DID love was the milkshakes. This isn't the only place in the Bay that serves great milkshakes, but it's the only place I've found that offers them spiked! I added a shot of vodka to my Cookies & Cream milkshake -- incredibly good.
author: Sheri W.

description:
LOVE LOVE their garlic fries! They were super crispy and the sprinkle of cheese is definitely a great finish.

I had their burger and added an egg on it. It was pretty good, however I still prefer in and out. Somehow I didn't feel my burger had like much taste to it, it was pretty plain in my opinion. However, I like how you can grab as many pickles as you want :) they are homemade!

Next time I want to try their ice cream, I was too full already to get to dessert!
author: Natalie L.

description:
This place is amazing!! The GARLIC fries are SO crispy delicious and that cheese on top induces some heavy salivation.
Price is very affordable. $5.50 base for a mini burger. I added the fancy schmancy cheese (tasted like blue cheese & Brie mixed omfg) & bacon. $8 burger total. My bf got the mini burger + cheese for $6 total. We ordered extra fries after eating some of them- we loved them so much! Free pickle spears. Great. Oh, and our burgers had everything. All of the free stuff. Onion on onions. Beautiful meal.
Pickles are that mild, sweetish, homemade spears. Not my cup of tea, but I still ate some!!
author: Anmy V.

description: Okay so first off I ordered from Postmates. And this review is only for Super Duper. I lived in SF my whole life and honestly super duper use to be the spot! When they first opened I fell in love with their burgers. And for about 2 yrs now I've lived in Pinole Ca. And recently on a visit to my folks my sister mentioned she was craving a burger. I said YES let's ordered Super Duper. What i thought was a good idea turn out to be tumbs down!!! First off they forgot one of my garlic fries, then I realized they didn't pack the 3 special sauces. but that was easily fixed since they refund that money. But once I took a bite of my burger it tasted like dirt!! It was oily! Flavorless! Jalapeño had lack of flavor. Avocado? Uuh, not worth your money. Bacon was under cooked, mostly fat and it had a weird color. Yea definitely don't recommend this place no more! I that case I rather just order from Mc Donald's.
author: Silvia C.

description: Been here a few times but it has been quite a while. This past Saturday was the first time we've taken Miles to San Francisco and look forward to sharing it with him for many more years to come. I had to share this place with my wife but every time I've tried something else would come up but it's safe to say this is my go to burger joint in The City. I always get the Double along with a shake. My wife ordered the mini and was delighted with how the burger tasted. Niman ranch beef and just absolutely succulently delicious with every bite. The burger is quite messy,but so freaking worth it. Love the location, great for people watching, love the shakes/fries/ice cream/burgers and price is so awesome for San Francisco, which usually is over the top. 5 stars for Super Duper!!!
author: Ben D.

description: I ordered their veggie burger with jack cheese on it a few weeks ago and it was nothing spectacular. I heard a few people raving about it, so I gave it a try. I'll definitely come back eventually, but mostly because I loved the way that the restaurant was set up.
author: Annie W.

description: This is the place I will come back to for sure. My favorite spot while I was up there. For my visit of four days I ended up going there three times. The only complaint would be the price but overall really good can't wait to go back
author: Hassan Q.

description:
This is my personal brunch time stop in SF!! The veg patty with blue cheeze & the garlic fries are must have & finished off with some orea shake .. it will definetely get you going  
Best for vegetarians who want to try american food .
author: Meghna K.

description: The burger was pretty damn good. Close to in and out and shake shack quality. Garlic fries was a bit overwhelming but still tasty. Don't eat that if you're on a date.
author: Yama H.

description: Consistently amazing burgers and shakes! Every Super Duper location I've been has been great. In fact, this has become my go to spot. One time they messed up an order (gave me 2 chicken sandwiches instead of a chicken sandwich and a burger) and made a fresh burger on the fly; they let me keep the chicken sandwich for free. High quality place and staff!
author: Christopher Dominic D.

description:
Went here for the first time last weekend. The line was very long around 1:30pm on a Sunday. The food was ready pretty quick after we ordered. I got the Chicken Sandwich and then the Garlic Fries. Both were delicious and pretty sinful where you feel terrible for eating it, but so glad you did. In the future the garlic fries are probably big enough to share. 
I can't wait to come again!
author: Larissa S.

description: I loved this place.  I had a chicken sandwich which was off the hook.  The garlic fries were excellent.  Definitely recommended if you are around in area and craving for a good lunch meal.
author: Chi H.

description: Decided to stop over here to eat before bar hopping. The place can get packed, and a little difficult to find a seat for a group. The burger was delicious, but the fries I believed to be alright. With the location and the quality of the burger I would go here again
author: Alex M.

description: The veggie burger was delicious!!! The fries were great as well, loved the fact that I  could have as many pickles as I wanted!!!
author: Hina R.

description:
Very good smell from the garlic fries and beef. Great atmosphere.
If it's cheaper, would be better.
author: Nana H.

description: Was great. Garlic fries had a pretty intense garlic taste which stuck with me for a while.
author: Gointo I.

description: Great burgers and shakes! Cool vibe and quick service. Will definitely recommend to others in the future
author: Laura D.

description:
Too greasy? Aren't burgers supposed to be greasy? I'll take a little too greasy over too dry.
Thank you. & Yum.
When Super Duper first showed up on Market St., I thought, 'Cool, a new place to try for lunch.' Fast forward a few years, Super Duper is the fast casual burger chain that is taking over SF. 

My usual order is the Mini Burger with Cheese - $5.50, $0.50 to add cheese. Other than cheese, I only add lettuce and tomatoes. The first time I ate at Super Duper, I went with the Mini, because I just wanted to give it a try before committing to their Super Burger. When I received my order and chomped my way through it, I realized that a 4 oz. patty is a very good size for a typical lunch. If I were famished or somehow skipped a meal, I would go for the Super Burger - $7.75.
The burgers are all cooked medium. The patty is very juicy and thin with cheese melted over the patty. The sesame bun is perfectly toasted. The lettuce and tomatoes always taste fresh. I find the Super Sauce to be very creamy with a mild flavor that doesn't compete with the flavor of the patty. When it comes to a good burger, this one hits all the criteria I'm looking for...
1) juicy beef patty
2) cheese melted over patty
3) toasted bun
4) fresh lettuce & tomatoes (no iceberg lettuce)
Check, check, check, check. Great!

Most toppings, like pickles & grilled onions, are free if you request them. Others, like avocado and egg, cost an extra $1 - $1.50. So extra toppings can really add up. But I usually just like a simple burger and don't go for too many add-ons, except for an egg.

Mr. Joy says Super Duper is just okay, because it is too greasy. I was surprised to hear this from the fried chicken & French fry connoisseur.
Well, the sauce and the meat juices from the patty give way to gravity, so that explains the grease factor. But what good burger is not greasy? Like I mentioned above, aren't burgers supposed to be greasy? As long as it is not swimming in a pool of oil, I'm happy.

$3.25 Garlic Fries - fresh garlic & 6-mon. aged cheddar:
very tasty, thin, & crispy. The shredded cheddar adds great flavor, but it doesn't stick to the fries, so it's a little easier to eat with a fork or spoon to get a bite of fries & cheddar together.

$5.75 Super Shake:
Their dairy is made with Straus products. I have only tried a shake once, but it was way too sweet for me. I may go for a cone instead in the future. 

After my first couple of times eating here, I noticed Super Duper has very long lines at lunch. I usually try to get lunch by 11:30 to avoid lines. After you order and receive your beeper, it takes about another 10 minutes to get your food.
Overall, Super Duper is pretty great, very tasty & affordable. But, cheese costs extra. I realize that is ubiquitous for most burger places nowadays, but I think burger + cheese go hand in hand, like bread & butter, or pb & j. How can you have one without the other?
Other than that, I have no complaints.
author: Joy W.

description: Beef is sooo good ! I would skip the garlic fries next time because alittle too much for me . Gotta get the pickles !!
author: Melissa G.

description:
Ingredients seemed fresh but the taste of the burger did not justify how messy it was to eat.

Flavor-wise, I'd just get Burger King, honestly. Ambiance-wise, this place is a step above. Prices are fair though I'm not thrilled with tipping for counter service.
author: Barack O.

description: Cashier were friendly when I ordered my burger. Food came out reasonably fast and the milkshake was delicious. Plenty of seat after lunch hour. Place was kept clean. Great training from the manager and especially the store mgr. Have the place running efficiently.
author: Allan T.

description: Zero stars . One of the worst things I every try to eat. I eat here about a year ago. It wasn't that bad. Quality seems to have fallen way down. Really need to have some quality control.
author: Emmet H.

description:
SDB is really packed during the weekday lunch hour. People like dem burgers, fries, and shakes. And with the affordable prices and customizable options- I'll join the queue. No really, there's a long queue during peak hours- with about a 15/20 minute wait. I'm impressed at how friendly the service is here, despite how busy they are. 

If you want a lunch for less than $10 in the FiDi, come here! Oh, and free pickle condiments- ha, that's enough to convince me!
author: Joanna L.

description:
Unbelievable greasy food, have had rank oil aftertaste for several hours.
Mini burger was absolutely unappetizing and flat. Garlic fries were literally soaked in oil. Eww, never again.
author: Evgenii G.

description: The burgers are delicious. The vegan burger is one of the best and chicken sandwiches too. Def go for a visit if you're in SF
author: Tori T.

description:
This is a really good burger spot in the city. I had a double and man, someone should've talked me out of that. The patties are thick, juicy and well seasoned. They are cooked medium and topped with your choice of various toppings - but they don't get crazy with choices, which is nice because I can get overwhelmed :|

Anyhow, service was excellent, food was awesome, location is prime (across the street from Market St. BART station) - I would return.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Super Duper Burgers has got me hooked and is a good viable option next to Union Square and they have other locations in San Francisco. Upon walking in, I immediately thought to myself, "Is this Shake Shack?" with their shake options and seemingly similar set up. I will say that Super Duper is probably an extension and higher level version of your normal In-N-Out/Five Guys, and is at par with Shake Shack in terms of ingredient quality.  

FOOD: Late at night, I did not want to eat much so I only got the Mini-burger with cheese and grilled onions. The burger quality was good with a "secret sauce" on it, which was quite delicious. The burger was cooked medium (as they advertise on the wall), which is great for me. The ingredients also tasted quite well, but I will say that the meat they use at Super Duper is not as lean as I would have hoped for, but still good nonetheless. A little messy, but what is a good burger without a little bit of the mess? My colleagues got the lemonade and did like it as well. 

Overall, I would say this is an affordable option when coming in San Francisco and if you are looking for something quick, come here.
author: Albert H.

description:
It is so insanely audacious to put sauce on a burger when it was requested without sauce. Thank god my friend saw it before she put their burger in her mouth. This could have ended with a trip to the hospital and a massive bill.

If I want my order ignored (after double checking to make sure it would be correct) I'll hit up the McDonald's drive through at 3 AM.

VEGANS BEWARE THIS PLACE DOES NOT WANT YOU THERE (this coming from a red-meat eating carnivore).
author: Daniel M.

description:
I honestly have spent the past 5 minutes debating whether to give 3 stars or 4, but the burger is ultimately what saves the day (or review, in this case). 

I've walked passed a few different locations dozens of times when visiting SF, but it never crossed my mind to try it until today. It seemed empty enough on the patio but don't be fooled - this place is pretty deep so the line was craftily hidden in the back at the order counter. 

After waiting for a good 15-20 minutes, we finally reached the most unenthusiastic employee of all time. This girl looked and sounded like she might actually die of boredom. After ordering, we lucked out and swooped in on a table inside while tons of other people were hovering around, still waiting. 

I didn't like my organic milkshake, and I didn't like their homemade spicy pickle that was way way too vinegary. I did, however, really like their burger and the fact that I could get it in mini size (4oz). It can't be compared to In-N-Out because it's just too different stylistically but it's pretty damn delicious. Their fries are definitely better than In-N-Out's sad, skinny potatoes. Overall, the burger is worth stopping by, but maybe in a different location.
author: Kate K.

description: Burgers were good and greasy, fries had good flavor and the chocolate shake was on point.  Perfect place for a hangover.  My only complaint is $34 for our meal.  I'm from the valley so we don't get bent over like that too often.  The its walking distance from union square/chinatown area.  We like to sit outside an people watch.
author: Donnie R.

description: My wife had the chicken salad she loved it. The ingredients were fresh. The chicken was warm with just the right amount of spice. She LOVED it! Garlic fries were KILLER!
author: john g.

description: super duper oily burger and oily fries. Sad food. I think  the burgers are expensive coz of the oil content.
author: Raghavendra T.

description:
I came in here today, and ordered a chicken burger. My order went through at 2:09pm (time on receipt). While I was waiting, I noticed people I recognized from line getting their orders fairly quickly. I paused and thought maybe it's just because chicken takes longer to cook. 

After a little over 10 minutes, I checked in with someone about my order. I watched the employee go to the kitchen checking the order receipts, but clearly having trouble finding it. Then he asked the cooks, and they just shrugged. After he talked to them briefly, he came back and said that they've got the order, but they're just backed up on chicken orders... I look over to the grill, and don't see any chicken breasts on there; just a bunch of beef patties for people who ordered after me since at this point, everyone that ordered ahead of me was long gone. After about a minute or two, I then notice a cook put the chicken breast onto the grill (so never even started the order until then). 

It was especially frustrating because I was working today, and was on my 30-minute lunch. By the time I got my food, I confirmed it had been 21 minutes to get it. My lunch was up before I even got back to work.
author: Stacey L.

description:
When visiting San Francisco, there there are so many great choices for dining out that a burger place is usually not on most people's list. Much less if that place is a chain. However, there are some times when you want something simple and fast. Those are the times that I will head to Super Duper Burgers. 

Their menu is pretty simple, containing burgers and chicken sandwiches along with shakes and fries. They also have breakfast, but I haven't been there for that yet.

You can get your burger with many of the classic toppings (cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, etc.) and some special additions like upgraded cheese (Maytag blue), and the fries are plain or topped with garlic and cheese -- a shredded parmesan, I think.

I usually get the Super Duper Burger, which comes out as two perfectly cooked and juicy patties, with cheese and lettuce/tomato/onion/pickles. Don't forget the pickles. They make them in-house and they're tasty: not too sour and not too sweet. You can get some extras from the jars they keep by the soda machine, and you can get some of the pickled chilies from the jar, too. 

Service is pretty quick and food comes out hot and fresh. 

In my experience, the shakes take a little extra time, but they are tasty and worth the wait.
author: Doug B.

description:
I tried the veggie burger and it was so yummy and juicy!
Their pickles are to die for!
Fries are so good and crispy!
One complaint though, the portions are a bit too small! Hope they make them bigger at some point. But overall it was a good experience!
author: Sarah M.

description: I would give it -1 star if I could.  Rude cashier who was disinterested in having this task, got our order wrong. The burger was a dried out pile of meat, dried out cheese and stale bun. Fries were ok, super salad is not super by any means. Small and plain. I would have been happier with Burger King and would have spent half the money and would have enjoyed it.  Do not waste your time eating here.
author: Adriann F.

description: This place is gross. They kept vetting peoples orders wrong. My fries were cold and the burger was way over cooked. It was also dirty. Nobody wiping tables down or cleaning up. Wont be coming back.
author: Trudy W.

description: OMG this hit the spot. We literally had just finished eating at a overpriced restaurant and was not satisfied. We came here and was happy and don't miss out on the cookies.
author: La Niecia V.

description: Quick, real hand patties. Had the double bacon cheeseburger with fries and coke for 14 dollars
author: Thomas P.

description:
I visited Super Duper Burger with a couple of friends last night and it was my second time there so I was very excited for my friends who hadn't been there before to try it! This place gets a lot of recognition and is known to have delicious burgers; they have a generally positive reputation. 

However, last night my friend was happily eating her burger when she bit down on something hard. She was originally confused, but her tooth began to hurt. 
She asked me, "does your burger have these hard chunks too?" I said no, because my burger seemed fine. 

She continued eating and found several other harder pieces until she realized they were bones! That's disgusting. She hurt her tooth, was repulsed, and didn't have the appetite to finish her burger. This was disappointing for me because I expected more from this chain as they have a nicer reputation. I realize this might not happen regularly, but for people that try this for the first time and have a negative experience, they'll never want to come back. I was extremely disappointed that this happened. 

I gave two stars instead of one because Super Duper continues to have some of the best fries I've ever had. They're garlic fries are a little two strong for me because they load on raw garlic slivers, not small pieces. However, they're regular are cooked to perfect the balance between crispiness on the outside and softness on the inside.
author: Aastha S.

description: This is hands down the most overrated burger in SF. I want to say everyone who rates this place highly either doesn't eat burgers very often or has limited places they've tried. The burger is so greasy there is a layer of hardened fat on the tray after you finish eating it. The 'special' sauce is fair at best and the only thing good about the ensemble is the bun which is embarrassing for a place that charges $20 for a burger fries and drink. In-n-out puts this place to absolute shame. Wendy's has a better burger and you only pay $5 for it. DO NOT go there if your looking for a good burger. There are multiple places that have good burgers in SF and this place is a waste of time and money.
author: Stephen W.

description:
Brought my family here..

It was the most silent meal together as everyone was too busy to talk as we had a delicious burgers in our faces!

Best burger in Bat Area by far you can  taste the freshness.
author: Trey C.

description: Super duper filthy burger. The restaurant is poorly managed and unsanitary. The bathrooms are disgusting and dirty. The tables need to be wiped down but you pretty much need to do it yourself. The burgers are delicious though. I would go back but not to this location.
author: Bee F.

description: Greasy, expensive, but so so good! If you want a great burger, you can't go wrong here. A little pricy, but I'm sure you could pay a lot more money for a lot worse elsewhere in this city.
author: E K.

description:
The burger itself was absolutely delicious - I got the double patty with a bunch of toppings (some were free, some were extra). Meat was perfectly medium rare, and I loved seeing all the cheese ooze out of my burger. A messy meal for sure, but so good, and so well-deserved after a day of walking up and down those damn hills!  I also got their cheesy garlic fries - crispy, cheesy, garlicky goodness.

This joint is very comparable to Shake Shack in the East Coast, and for good reason! Prices are very similar to each other, although Super Duper offers a lot more additional options that Shake Shack does not. This is a place I'd really like to see on the East Coast!
author: Tashnuva E.

description: Super Duper Burgers are great!  The Burgers and Chicken Sandwiches were very juicy!  The Shakes were really good!  A great stop in San Francisco when you are on the go!!!!!
author: Malisa R.

description: Always great food. Always crowded! But always fast service. OH YEA... Did I say the food is great?
author: Steve W.

description: I'm not a big burger person, but I was really craving fries when I went to Super Duper Burgers. I got the chicken sandwich with garlic fries and it was delicious. I was happily full and very satisfied by the end of my meal. Also, free pickles!! :)
author: Lucine O.

description:
From first sight, Super Duper Burger seemed like a tourist trap because of its name and location (on Market, at the heart of shopping district). But I guess I was just being shallow!

Came on a Sunday afternoon after a long shopping day. There were about 15 people in line. The menu is very simple - just "Super Burger" and "Mini Burger" with 2 and 1 patty respectively. Lettuce, tomato, red onion, jalapeño peppers, grilled onions, pickles and "super sauce" can all be added for free; cheese, bacon, avocado, roasted portobello, egg, and cambozola can be added with cost.

Super Duper Burger: A.
I ordered this with lettuce, tomato, red onion, super sauce, egg. Very nicely done. The patties were delicious - these are branded as "all natural" beef and I could definitely taste the difference comparing with those from big chain burger joints. Not only the meat quality, but those medium rare patties were extremely tender and juicy - yes it's super messy to eat but definitely worth it. The Super Sauce actually enhanced the burger taste even more. If you feel hungry, adding an egg would be a brilliant idea. This specific combination of egg and beef in a burger was not something I have experienced before.

Fries with 3 dips: A
The three dips (chipotle, mayo, super sauce) cost $1.5 and came in three small cups. Nothing special about them though, I won't get those next time. The fries were in thick-cut shape; simply put, it's thick version of In-N-Out fries, slightly more crispy, and the same strong natural potato flavor. Love it!

There are a lot more locations for Super Duper but this is probably the most convenient. When I want to grab something quick after long hours shopping, this is the place to go!
author: Simon C.

description:
A little pricey for a fast food burger but way better than the competition, Super Duper Burgers cooks a ridiculously juicy and tasty burger. We spent about 13 dollars on a double patty burger with cheese on top, garlic fries, and a drink, which wasn't so bad considering it was enough to feed two. I was pleasantly surprised by the intensity of the flavor and the melted cheese. Often cheese overwhelms the flavor, but this cheese melted into the burger making it even more delicious.

The garlic fries had some cheese and lots of garlic flavor. Easily the best garlic fries I've had in a burger place. I think the cheese really makes it work. I didn't have a chance to try a shake but I'll undoubtedly be back to a Super Duper Burgers sometime soon.
author: Kevin L.

description:
The perfect drunken night stop!

My first time here was when we had a little too much fun at SFMOMA for their late night Thursday and I had skipped dinner. But it was totally worth it when we stopped by for a burger before going home.

I don't know how I was even capable of reading the menu at the time but I got the mini with cheese and bacon. If I could give my drunken self a high five right now, I would! It's always a good call to get bacon and cheese! I think the best part is the size of the burger, it's just the right amount of goodness without making me feel obese.

Next time I'm getting an ice cream, too!
author: Nitar L.

description:
One of my favorite cheap places when I'm craving an oily, juicy burger, which does happen every so often! I've actually been to a few different locations, but I just happened to be at this one most recently.

My standard order is a mini burger + cheese + mushrooms and garlic fries. The burger is always juicy, messy, and delicious; they tend to be a bit stingy with the garlic on the fries though. The cookies and cream shake is also thick and delicious, but I try not to be too much of a fatty every single time. I've also tried their chicken sandwich, which was actually surprisingly good but only offered at certain locations.

I recently discovered that they serve breakfast too! I tried the egg sandwich + sausage and a mini glazed donut. The egg sandwich hit the spot exactly. The mini donut, though, was a bit oily and tasted too much like fried dough vs a donut. And yes, I know, a donut IS essentially fried dough, but the good ones are fluffy and have a particular taste - sweeter and more similar to a pastry. They also have fresh-squeezed orange juice for breakfast, if you want to try and feel healthier.

I don't come here often, but it's exactly what I'm looking for when I'm craving a quick and dirty burger!
author: Tiffany P.

description:
My boyfriend is addicted and as a loyal girlfriend I come eat here more often than I would choose to. I admit these burgers are tasty and there are healthy choices too. 

His usual order: mini burger combo - solid value for a good burger, drink and fries - oh and of course a cookies and cream milk shake too. Burger meat is a little on the greasy side but some may just call it juicy. 

My order: chicken sandwich on a ciabatta bun. It's grilled and comes with a giant lettuce leaf and I often use the leaf as my "bun" - in essence I eat a naked chicken sandwich. My boyfriend loves the ciabatta bun so he doubles up on his bun game. Chicken portion sizes vary, but the quality is never too dry. 

Add pickles because they're bomb as well. 

Only qualm is the wait for the order - it ranges from anywhere from 5 mins to upwards of 10 mins. At least they have an efficient way of informing you of your order with the portable buzzers. 

Eat here.
author: Janice K.

description:
Oh yes, Super Duper Burgers. A burger staple in San Francisco.

Sure, it's not my favorite. I don't go out of my way for it, unlike many other people I know in the city do.
I prefer The Counter & Veggie Grill in the South Bay.
But they make a mean veggie burger here.

Housemade vegan patty topped with hummus & cucumbers. Delicious crisp patty is full of grains and corn. Ask for "everything on it" which includes lettuce, tomato, and red onions. Hold the sauce. Add grilled onions (because it's free!). Avocado is $1 extra, but I say skip it since they give you a miserable amount of it. (like..2 slices).

Go for a side of fries and a pint of beer and you got a complete meal that will fill you up, leave you happy, and satisfy that heavy burger craving I know all you veg heads out there get. (You can only eat kale for so long...)

This location gets ridiculously packed so leave yourself time, or go in between rush hours. Good luck finding a seat. 

Good thing they have a few other locations nearby so you don't always have to go to this one.
author: Lanie L.

description:
I love this place! I was really hungry around 9 pm, and a lot of places nearby weren't open anymore, so I turned to Yelp and found this place! They close at 10 pm by the way.

Super Duper looks like a tourist trap, but it's not!!! Place is great. Reminds of me Shake Shack in New York, and HopDoddys in Texas. The lines are usually long, but it goes faster than you think. 

I ordered:
super burger 8 oz 
garlic fries
cookies and cream shake 
 I got some of the free homemade pickles as well which were quite good! 

THE BURGER [5/5]:
You can order the Super Burger (8 oz of beef) or the Mini Burger ( 4 oz of beef). The burgers were delicious! The meat is perfect and juicy. I split a super burger but after finishing it, I wish I just ordered one for myself :) The sauce on this burger was SO good.

THE FRIES [4.5/5]:
Really garlic-y but they were really good!! Towards the end, they were a little soggy and overwhelmingly garlicy so I stopped eating them :/ Still one of the best garlic fries I've had though.

THE SHAKE [3/5]:
Honestly the shake was just ok. Not memorable - I've had way better.

VERDICT:
Overall, the burgers here are top notch and I just want to go back again!
author: Alicia L.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here around 5:30 pm I believe, and it was pretty crowded! That means we knew we were at a good place to get some delicious burgers.

The only thing I could think they could improve on is getting more options for burgers. I was a little confused on how the menu worked, but the staff was friendly and welcomed us for being first-timers. 

I got the veggie burger, which was SO GOOD! Probably the best veggie burger I've had. The black bean/corn patty was kind of crispy around the edges and softer towards the middle, which I love. The hummus was just a classic hummus, which paired nicely with the whole taste of the burger. The bun was nice and fluffy too. Nothing too memorable about the bun, but it was the perfect ratio of bun-to-filling.

The inside of the place looked cool too. They even had an upstairs where my boyfriend and I sat, and it was cool looking down at the whole restaurant. It was nice and clean too.

I would come again if I was craving just a simple burger/simple menu to choose from.
author: Hana B.

description: Several milkshake flavors. But you'll both get the cookies and cream because it's best. Burgers are bomb and unlimited pickles. No Heinz ketchup.
author: S S.

description:
OK burger chain that is known less for its burgers than its other menu items.

==FOOD==
Super Duper Burger (8oz) w/ Cheese + Free Toppings: $7.75 || 2.5/5
Thin beef patty. Not super juicy.
Bun deflated quickly.
Skimped on toppings quantity.
Pricey for a standard burger.

Garlic Fries: $3.00 || 3/5
Not given much garlic, cheese, or fries.
Unevenly fried. Some fries dripping in oil.

==VIBE==
Casual, busy, full of yuppies.
Hard to find a place to sit during dinner hours.
Tables are left messy and largely unattended to.

==SERVICE==
Couple mins wait time to order.
Burger & fries served within 5 mins.

==YAY/NAY==
Nay. Not super or duper. Just normal burger & fries.
No exceptional flavors or signature items.
Save your $$ and buy an In-n-Out Double-Double for half the price and double the satisfaction.
Want a good soft-serve? Go get a McFlurry.
Garlic fries? Go to the local county fair for the real deal.
author: Hillary T.

description:
cheap egg sandwiches + avocado + four barrel coffee? count me in. can't go wrong with fried egg, fresh avocado and thick sliced cheddar.

$6 for a bfast combo and they've got cheap homemade donuts too (those were a bit too oily + sweet for me though)

will have to come back to try their lunch
author: Kristie C.

description:
Went in with some friends around 7pm for dinner a few weeks ago. The place was already packed (tables filled and a line starting to form). I got the Super Burger with cheese. My only complaint was the amount of oil that was drenched on the buns. I know it's normal to have some grease on a burger but this one had me shaking my head. However, the burger was delicious. The beef was cooked well. The fries were alright, nothing special.

There's additional dining spaces upstairs as well if the tables downstairs are full. Parking would be difficult since the restaurant is located on a busy Market Street. I would come back but I personally think there's better options in the city for a burger.
author: Tony C.

description:
Burgers are ok.
Low rating because they refuse to make a burger how the customer wants.

They want to sell their "super sauce", which I hate. Even if you're ordering to go and the burger gets wrapped/bagged, they won't add ketchup for you.

Edit:
They direct message me to suggest I speak to a manager next time this happens. Unfortunately, last time I came here, I did speak to a manager and was told the same thing "Ketchup is not in the back, you can add it to your burger on your own."

Even if the manager did help, I'd rather not have to speak to a manager every time I want a burger made with my preferred condiment. I'm removing a star for even worse customer support than I thought.
author: Tylor L.

description: Burgers and fries are slightly expensive for their size, but oh man, they're tasty. The burger was juicy and flavorful while the fries were crispy and not salty or greasy. There's a good selection of beers for a great price: $5 for a pint of beer on tap. There pickles are a little too cucumbery for me, but they were pretty good when paired with the burger and beer. This location is a little small, so it was hard finding seating, but we did have a large group. The spiked milkshake is a rip off; you couldn't taste any of the booze, so it might as well have been a regular shake.
author: Brittany B.

description:
Solid burger joint that rivals In-N-Out, Habit, and Shack. The beef patty is juicy and tasty. Love their genuine garlic fries with fresh grinded garlic with aged cheese. Their all you can eat pickle is a major plus. 

Once the meal is done, you can also opt for the organic soft serve to complete the meal experience. 

This is another must eat place when I'm in SF.
author: Xing M.

description: Hot and juicy burgers. Thick milk shakes. Tasty garlic fries. Busy place. Table space is limited, but worth the wait.
author: Peter M.

description: Extremely juicy burger and fresh tasting beef and ingredients. Staff is very friendly. Only complaint is that the bun doesn't hold up when the juices are flowing from the burger, causing a mess when eating.
author: Brian N.

description: Great burger! So worth the trek to find it and so worth the long line. The bar has been set.
author: John K.

description:
Went here with friends because I heard of good reviews. I have to say it did not disappoint. Gourmet burgers in a fast food environment was definitely the feel I got. They had the best garlic fries I've ever eaten and I wish they had a chain here in San Diego. They have two sizes: Super and Mini which you can customize to however you want. Which is a great thing because you can have whatever you want. For the prices you definitely get more than what you paid for. 

If you order a burger you should add one of the organic eggs because it really is one of the only places ive seen that you can add an egg. It just tops your burger experience! 

Also must try: the garlic fries! 

When I go back to SF this is one of the places I will visit again.
author: Michelle M.

description:
In SF on a long weekend vacation, and we were jetlagged, tired, and looking for something quick and easy and cheap-ish.

Did some investigating and found Super Duper burger about a 5 minute walk from our hotel. 8 pm on a Friday night and it was busy, but not nuts. Managed to snag a table after ordering. 

We both had the Super Burger, garlic fries, and shared a chocolate malt. Burgers were excellent -- fairly well done but still very juicy, smash-style. Fries bordered on almost too much garlic, but I don't mean that as a negative in the least. Malt was very solid. 

Not what I'd consider super cheap, but not terribly priced for the quality and location.
author: Chad T.

description: Burger was cooked as requested.  Meat was tender. BUT... the entire product was DROWNING in a TSUNAMI of FAT and dripping like Niagara Falls.  I held the burger upright for nearly 2 minutes to let it drain.  There was enough fat on my plate for a swim.  NOISY.  Poor seating... just stools.  Dirty tables.  Inadequate condiments availability.  Staff was surly with expressionless faces - just robots taking orders, collecting money.  Pricey.  I threw out the fries - entirely - as they were cold, salted to a fault and inedible.  Believe me, In and Out is a FAR better deal.  I would have requested a replacement, but the service was a slow as the traffic crossing the Bay Bridge on a Friday afternoon.
author: William S.

description: I love the shakes. I stop by like 3 times a week to get one and its always perfect. The cashiers are always so helpful and up beat. Great music and even better food.
author: Cynthia C.

description: Burgers are super Juciy. We love their garlic fries! The place is really nice! I like how you can pick your toppings on your burger! It's just the best burger place my boyfriend and I been to! Definitely going back
author: Rochelle A.

description: Go here. No joke. one of the juiciest, most delicious burgers I've ever eaten. Also, go for the garlic fries!
author: David S.

description: A mini burger was more than enough for me. But I had to order the garlic fries and the shake of course! The shake was decent and way bigger than I expected. The fries were quite delicious and overall I was pretty happy with my experience at super duper.
author: Kaitlyn E.

description:
"So instead of a super duper burger, can I just have a super burger bc I'm not that hungry?!"

Brownie points (or compliments and votes since this Yelp!) if you can catch the reference. ANYWAY, I do agree the burgers here are pretty solid. For fast food, that is. But hey, I'll take it.

FOOD - The "Super Duper" burger is essentially a double-double, so if you aren't about dem #gainz, go for the Mini which has one patty. You can add toppings such as cheese, bacon, eggs etc. I equally enjoyed my Mini burger ($5.50) and my friend's chicken sandwich. :)

As for fries, the regular ones are good ($2.50) but I wasn't a big fan of the garlic fries (overload for me). They do have several dipping sauces though, which are: buttermilk ranch, chipotle, mayo, and one more that I need to figure out but for now will name secret sauce.

Additionally, they've got soft serve!!!! Looked soo good. Couldn't try it this time but next time, I'll be about it.

THE SPACE - There is plenty of seating downstairs and a lil bit upstairs, but there is plenty of people. Designate a swooper in your group if you can.

Thanks for a cheap and filling meal, SD. I'll be thinking about that soft serve now.
author: Connie H.

description:
AMAZING Burgers, fries and chicken sandwiches.

I was visiting San Francisco for the first time and I was drawn in by the smell of the burgers cooking on the grill, boy was I happy that I walked into this place!

Typically not a fan of ANY chain restaurants but this is definitely an exception.

Ordered the french fries with the garlic & cheese mixture - sooooo good! Do not expect to kiss or speak to anyone for days but so worth it.

Ordered Cheese burger and the chicken sandwich, both were out of this world!! Definitely on par with Shake Shack from the North East and definitely worth the price.
author: Bonnie P.

description: We just ate at Super Duper Burgers for the very first time. Both of us had then  chicken sandwich with the chipotle aioli sauce and it was amazing. It  comes on a focaccia roll that's perfectly soft. The fries are nothing special but we didn't order anything extra on them, so maybe we missed out. Still, wed go back.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great, friendly service. Cool spot. Good burgers but bit on a small side. French fries were bit colder than I expected. Would try again
author: Paul D.

description:
I really enjoyed the customer experience at this local burger joint. What amazed me was not only the food but how environmentally friendly they are. All of their materials that they used to serve your food are compostable , and the ingredients used are natural organic and farm-grown

Burgers with quite juicy the artisan bread was great , and the and the garlic fries were very appealing and tasteful overall I would recommend this burger joint the burgers are Hardy , and satisfy your hunger. This place is really affordable and he must visit.
author: Mysterious B.

description:
My third time to a SuperDuper and I was just as impressed as the last two times. I was with my father and kids and we needed a quick bite to eat. We were there during the holidays and, since this is right on market by all of the retail, it was SUPER busy. Whatever. The short wait (say 10 minutes) was WELL WORTH IT. 

Dishes: I had the super duper burger with bacon and avocado - and fries. Yummy. Soft but grilled bun, crispy AND juicy burgers. Yummy sauce. The fries were good, not too salty and crisp. I really liked the dill pickles you could munch on while you were waiting.
author: David S.

description:
Ordered two mini burgers, both with cheese + one with bacon. They were the size of my fists lol. I personally think it taste better without the bacon. We got one regular fry & one garlic. Total of 1$19.03.

THE GARLIC FRIES ARE SOOOOO GOOOOOD!!!!!!!!!! GET THEM OR LIVE A LIFE FULL OF REGRET. The choice is yours.
author: Leana E.

description: Solid fries, had the big burger with cheese, grilled onion, and bacon! This was my first time, but not my last! Also, the cookie and cream milk shake was one of the best shakes I've had.
author: Marc K.

description:
The burgers here are delicious! I strongly recommend adding bacon to your burger as this greatly enhances the flavor and the bacon does NOT have a cheap quality taste like bacon at other restaurants. I normally would want to leave a four star review purely because the french fries at Super Duper Burgers are just "ok." They're not bad and I still enjoy them, but they just not quite on par with other fries as they have that "mass produced" kind of flavor. But, again, I still enjoy them.

The reason why I don't give it a four star review is that I believe Super Duper is absolutely worthy of a five star review due to their fantastic customer service. All the employees are very helpful and most are super friendly and consistently smiling. But the burgers are the main selling point. They are definitely mouth watering delicious. Just my opinion. And their milkshakes taste damn good as well. I'm definitely a repeat customer!  :)
author: Peter C.

description:
THEIR DONUTS ARE TO DIE FOR - literally. 

They're perfectly crisp on the outside & soft on the inside, I die a little every time I see them in the office.

This week - I tried their mini burger (1 patty) with an egg and it was amazing - definitely get the egg & guac (if you want to splurge). It was really tasty, with their buns perfectly toasted! 

Will be back to try more!!

... but seriously... GO TRY THEIR DONUTS.
author: Carrie L.

description:
Really yummy veggie burger with hummus and cucumbers! Fries are good- they serve beer  
Can get busy - but worth it. DOG FRIENDLY (inside and outside)
author: Merylynn V.

description:
I've been coming to this place ever since they opened almost 6 years ago and they are one of the best burgers I've had. I only ever get the burger, and with a fried egg on top.

The burgers tend to be very juicy and the buns will disintegrate on you because of how messy the burger can get, but I almost always have to come here when I'm in SF.

If I had to criticize anything, it's that the place has become really popular and famous so it's always busy and crowded, so getting a seat might be tough.
author: William L.

description: Been going here for about a month or two now. Never have an issue and the food is delicious. Dare I say best fresh tasting juices burger I've had in God knows how long. Love this franchise now!
author: Leel W.

description:
I guess I was really hungry when I got the burger from Super Duper Burgers, because man, the burger was so delicious.  Got the double-pattied burger with everything on it--so mouthwatering delicious, and fairly inexpensive for the price of it.  Went in with a friend of mine, and wasn't crowded at all--seating could be a bit difficult, but all in all, a fine place to grab a bite.  Service was great too--can't complain~!

Overall grade: A
author: Bobby K.

description:
Wow, I'm Super Duper disappointed. I've been here about 3-4 times but they got my order wrong today. I ordered a Super burger (two patties) with bacon and received a Mini burger (one patty) with bacon and cheese. Additionally, my garlic fries were cold. I've had good experiences with them in the past, but it almost seemed like they either gave me someone else's order or had this one lying around and decided to give it to me.

I got the order to go and didn't realize it until I started eating it in my office, so I didn't bother to go back. I'll chalk this up to an error and will consider returning, but I recommend checking your order in the store before walking out.
author: Allan L.

description: I got their 'mini' burger and it was sill huge for me. I love their garlic fries because it comes with cheese and you just have to try it. I wasn't planning on getting burgers on this trip but im glad I did.
author: Deanelle M.

description: I loved the food! Great atmosphere! Oh and great service! Stumbled upon this place while searching for places to eat near our hotel. One more thing, this places serves beer!
author: Criszalin P.

description: It's a 7 on my scale. 10 being perfect. Burger meat was juicy but under seasoned, but I guess that's what ketchup is for. Environment was clean, modern. Staff friendly.  Loved the pickles in the jar.
author: Min D.

description: One of the most decent burger chains in SF.  If you're looking for just a hearty, no frills, well-made burger,  this is the place!  I can't get anymore descriptive than that.   The shakes are also well made.  I wouldn't say it's an in-n-out killer, but I would say you just can't go wrong here.  You get free pickles which is nice.
author: Joe V.

description:
Best burger I've had in sooooo long. The line was pretty lengthy when we walked up but to our pleasant surprise it went by super quick. There's a good amount of seating throughout the place but due to popularity, you might have to keep an eye out to snag a table while waiting for your burger. The staff is super friendly and they really keep it clean!

Now on to the food! I ordered a cheeseburger - simple, but fresh and sooo flavorful and the garlic fries are a garlic lover's dream. Super Duper Burgers makes me wish even more that I lived in SF. They've definitely set a new burger standard for me.
author: Simone M.

description:
Oh my gahhhhhhh...

So I visited SDB in 2013 with some friends. My experience at that time was okay. Nothing too good or bad. It actually wasn't very memorable. I spent a few days in Scottsdale and had an okay burger on two occasions so when I first got to Downtown San Francisco I was really having a burger craving. Knowing I was going to consume some calories, I worked out pretty hard in the hotel gym. Work out hard and eat like a fat kid? Eat like a fat kid and then work out hard? Either way, I was going to earn this burger.

A long line awaits me. It's moving quickly though. My thoughts of going somewhere else immediately went away. I get up there to order. The craving is kicking in... I want the super burger (two 4 oz. patties)... With fries... With bacon...  With everything with it. Add an order of fries... Make it garlic fries. Fresh garlic and six-month aged cheddar? Of course.

I grab a seat. Eating alone is the best thing, by the way. You can stuff your face and not have to worry about carrying a conversation. Also, if people catch you eating like a pig and you're alone... Well, it probably explains why you're eating alone in the first place.

The first bite was orgasmic. The fries were amazing. Every bite was orgasmic. Whoever came up with the idea of their garlic fries deserves an award. I don't care what award. Those things were off the hook.

I contemplated ordering another burger and fries. After all, I worked out hard, right? It was that amazing. My first meh experience was erased. I walked away happier than a pig rolling around in poop. And I cannot wait to go there again.
author: Xerxes N.

description: First time here and super duper grateful that they have a tasty vegetarian/vegan option (just found out that the buns are not vegan but you can replace with their ciabatta bread). Although my patty was a little burnt, it still had the right flavors & texture. Of course, I added avocado in mine, which made it even better. All of this for about $11, which is more than your usual fast food. We'll be coming back!
author: M L.

description:
Chris K. and I were drained of all our energy from biking all day around town and looking for a place still open at 10:30pm that was walking distance from our hotel, so Super Duper it was!

Hits:
* The burger here, while pricier ($6.50 base), tastes almost as good as In-N-Out's burgers and the patties are still pretty pink... B-U-T-ful as Bruce Almighty would say -- plus... you have the option to add bacon! A huge selling point as my life philosophy is that everything is always better with bacon
* All packaging here is either compostable or reusable -- because of this, all trash bins are designated as compost collection bins... Can I move to SF already?
* Nice and smooth R&B jams serenading me in the background to get me in the groove to consume my burger
* Garlic Parmesan Fries ($3) are pretty great, especially sprinkled with coarsely chopped parsley, and incredibly pungent garlic -- don't expect to kiss anyone after eating an order of these suckers
* The Combo ($8.50) and Super Combo ($11.25) are considerably good deals
* Even though we were mindful about a potential last-call before closing time, the awesome cashier guys don't stop serving until the actual closing time... or whenever the employees go home, whichever is later
* Awesome servers!!
* Food comes out so fast -- another great execution of fancy fast food, like Chipotle
* It's always nice dining with a young, hip crowd, but then again, this is the crowd I expect when having dinner past 10pm
* There's no shortage of seating -- indoor, upstairs, outdoor patio 

Lessons Learned:
* From the outside, I did not expect this burger joint to be this hipster!
author: Eileen L.
