description: I really like the burgers with the pickles. I would say you can't really taste their "special sauce". The fries are okay my boyfriend said they were better last time so they may taste different next time. Also I love the peppers  with the burger. It gets pretty busy so I would say come around 5.
author: Brooke W.

description:
Right in the middle of downtown SF so don't think about driving hoping to find parking anywhere. You better just Bart it.

Loved the large open space with outdoor seating (though very limited). It had a very fresh, clean feel to it, which is what they're going for.

Pretty good burgers. Pretty greasy as well. And decent shakes. The garlic fries were pretty terrible though.

The burgers though not the size of your head, is a healthy (or not so healthy) portion that will get you full and satisfied. The meat had great flavors (aka meat) which means they're cooking it just right and not using much any sauces to cover up for any lack of meat cooking skills which is essential for a successful burger IMO. Skip the garlic fries and opt for just the regular fries since they're much better.

Though this place is pretty good, I didn't think it was good enough to my Top 10 Burger List (listed below).

Their burgers are very juicy so be prepared to roll up them sleeves and napkins stocked up next to you.

This is my all-time top 10 favorite burger joints around the world:

1. Burger Bar, Las Vegas (NV)
2. Healthy Junk, Anaheim (CA)
3. GBurger, La Habra (CA)
4. Left Coast Artisan Burgers, Seoul (KR)
5. Abbey's Burger Bistro, Baltimore (MD)
6. Shake Shack, NYC (NY)
7. Gourmet Burger Kitchen, London (UK)
8. Burger's Priest, Toronto (CANADA)
9. Root Down DIA, Denver (CO)
10. In-N-Out, California (CA)

Price: $8+ per person
Wait: 5-10 mins after ordering
author: Pourio L.

description:
Everybody, except the manager (apparently), had a terrible attitude.
The food tasted okay, but the service was definitely a turn off.
I was also let down by the fact that I was sold an item they did not have, and one of the waiters rudely told us to sit on the second floor, which would have been perfectly fine, but the way we were approached made me feel as if we shouldn't be here. It was almost as if they were doing US a favor by serving us.
Ridiculous.
I'll be taking my business elsewhere.
author: Kegan G.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE.  One of my all time favorite spots in the bay area.

First off - the garlic fries are unreal.  They are one of the greatest things I have ever eaten (I sound like I'm exaggerating, I'm not).  They don't skimp on the garlic, so be sure to eat an entire box of mints afterwards!

Also, I love the fact that they have a chicken sandwich!  This is perfect for me (a non-red meat eater), and so many burger joints don't have this option.  The sandwich could not be better.  My boyfriend orders a regular burger, which he also says is amazing.

The soft serve dipped in chocolate is a great end to the night... Although it's extremely messy, it's worth ordering at least once.  Next time I'd probably skip the chocolate dip so I could leave with clean hands, but maybe not.. It's worth it!

They have free house made pickles for free while you wait or with your meal, and plenty of seating (including an upstairs).  Sitting upstairs is pretty fun because you can do a little people watching if you're near the edge.
author: Kenna H.

description:
Not a lot to say that hasn't already been said before --- this place is legit and holds its own against any fast-casual burger joint I've been to (including In-and-Out, Shake Shack and The Habit). 

What I love...

Great service, line always out the door at this location but moves fast and the staff is great. 

Hand pressed burgers with a great ratio of fat and always cooked perfectly - lots of add ons too; bacon, egg, avocado, jalapeños that kick and I love their buns, fresh and buttery. 

Fries; high-five! 

Oh, they serve IPA's and wine as well, which to me gives it an edge over most fast-casual burger joints. Who doesn't like a hoppy IPA with a tasty burger?

They have salads and other fare as well but if I'm waiting in line it's for a double cheese with bacon, jalapeños, lettuce, tomatoes and special sauce - the bomb!

The end.
author: Jeff S.

description: Awesome burgers! I love the veggie burger. The crisp fries are to die for esp garlic ones
author: Lohit S.

description:
Had a delicious super duper burger. My first impression was that the burger was smaller than I had anticipated. I mean, it's SF so inflated prices are typical. Anywho, the burger was satisfying and flavors were on point. I like how the whole kitchen area is out in the open; you get to keep an eye on the workers. No funny business going on back there; just pure burger flips. 

I'd come back again if I was in the mood.
author: Amanda T.

description: I had the mini burger with cheese, bacon, fried onions. An order of fries and soda. First, I think ts crazy it cost EXTRA to get cheese on a hamburger. AND then it actually costs $.50! I understand bacon cost extra, but cheese? Really?   I was very disappointed. I think this place was even worse than shake shack. When you have 5 guys or In N Out  to choose from............don't bother with this place. I cant believe people think this is a good burger joint. very sub par. Just walk on by!
author: M P.

description:
The food wasn't hot. It was dinnertime on a Sunday. They kitchen looked like they were churning out food pretty quickly, but the food was lukewarm at best. 

I got the mini burger and garlic fries. Burger could've used more salt, and could barely taste the "special sauce". If you want pickles, they're self-serve from an open pickle jar...seemed unsanitary tbh. The garlic fries tasted fine (tho nothing special) minus the temperature issue.
author: Kirsten V.

description:
I didn't think I'd find a worthy competitor and substitute for Shake Shack in SF, but Super Duper is it (Super Duper is probably a tiny bit fancier than Shake Shack). Got a burger with garlic fries and enjoyed myself way too much. 

I'll definitely be coming back!

Do note that this location has an above average number of tourists, which may call for occasional long lines and some waiting time for tables (nothing too bad though).
author: Claudia C.

description: Honestly it's nothing super duper to me....it's a pretty plain burger with some additionally toppings you can add to it, I think in n out is way better than this place....maybe we didn't get the par fries but it's just a regular burger joint and mediocre beef
author: Arcadian B.

description: Killer veggie burger and vanilla shake! Quick service and friendly staff; open late to help hungry post-drinks crowd.
author: Srinidhi S.

description:
Super...Duper, yummy in my tummy.  A modern burger joint with a simple menu.
I had the Mini Burger w/ cheese & everything  on it (lettuce, tomato, Red onions, Super Sauce) but grilled onions & added jalapeño.  My husband had the Mini Burger w/ cheese & everything on it & added bacon.  Mmmmm ...bacon.  We shared an order of garlic fries w/ aged cheddar & house made pickles.  Delicious!  To wash it down?  Beer on tap!  We need one of these in Los Angeles!  Come on down!
author: Joyce V.

description:
This review is based solely on breakfast as we all know the quality of the burgers that are served here. Swung by here with a co-worker after having the breakfast knowledge bestowed upon us by a fellow Yelper. 

We stepped in the door and we were greeted and asked what we would like. Ordered up a bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sammie and a glass of fresh lemonade. Took a seat and waited for our buzzer to go off to alert us to head back up to snag our tray of morning love. 

 This sandwich is basically something you can get at that place with the golden arches but far superior. A nicely toasted English muffin, crisp, well done thick cut bacon (or a sausage patty), and a slab of melted cheddar cheese on top of, get this... A REAL fried egg. Not the typical carton poured egg white egg that a majority of the breakfast serving places in the area serve up. This egg was seasoned and fried on a flattop and not shoved in the microwave for 20 seconds. This is what we all think about when we jumped out of bed and need something to fill the void of last nights debauchery. All of this for under five bucks?

Did I mention they make amazing donuts from scratch? Glazed or chocolate, and they serve them up as a combo with a cup of artisan coffee. What more can you ask for?
author: Josh H.

description:
TL;DR - Best burgers I've had in the bay (from a chain)

I'm a sucker for burgers. 

My only complaint is that the patty was a tad salty and the burgers are too varied in size (ie, my super burger was wayy smaller than the orders before mine....)

But yeah, check out the pickles and the soft serve. Definitely a good choice for grub around union square!
author: Crystal Z.

description: Great value and outstanding burgers. Casual restaurant. The burger patties are always so juicy and flavorful! Decor inside is cool. Seating upstairs and downstairs. Love their pickles too!!!
author: Daisy S.

description:
The fries...get the garlic fries.  Freshly aged parmesan...you can't go wrong. 

I got the veggie burger and it was delicious :)
author: Marissa R.

description: The food here is so delicious. I'm not usually a burger person - but my husband is so I decided to give this place a try. I was so pleasantly surprised. I actually had a burger and it didnt make me feel gross. I just enjoyed all the flavors including but not limited to the jalapenos, the bacon, and cheese but most importantly the super duper sauce...that was hella delish. I will definitely be coming back!
author: Melissa P.

description: I love coming to this place! My husband & I discovered it two years ago while visiting from Vegas and now every trip we make to San Francisco we have to stop here. I get the chicken sandwich and he gets the burger both great options!
author: Crystal Z.

description:
Let's start off the review with saying I ate a few hours before, so I guess you can say I wasn't Super Duper hungry *ba dum tssss*. Aside from the bad jokes, there was nothing bad about this place. Came in Friday night and the line went fast. I got the mini burger and my friend got the garlic fries. I was trying to (heh should have tried harder) to cut back on the carbs so I only stole a little bit of her fries but it was covered with shredded parm and I honestly thought it
was delicious-only downside was the portion, but I guess it matched being only 3$? Maybe they should come up with different sizes cause I would've wanted more. Good burger-next time I would want to come back with an appetite to try the super duper and also add an egg.
author: Linde H.

description:
Excellent burger spot in SF that far exceeds fast food chains without being overpriced. I loved the Super Duper burger with cheese and avocado. The meat was tasty, fresh, and obviously not overly processed. The garlic fries with aged cheddar were delicious. I enjoyed the homemade pickles too. 

Great restaurant for a quick, reasonably priced lunch. Seating can be limited during busy times though.
author: Lindsay H.

description:
"The best place for burgers in town"

Before my first burger at Super Duper, I firmly believed that the best burgers are at In-n-Out. It all changed after my first bite of a Super Duper burger. Obviously comparing Super Duper to In-n-Out is comparing apples to oranges, but if you love In-n-Out, you really have to try Super Duper.
author: Jim L.

description:
Burger- 2/5

My boyfriend had the super burger while I had the mini one with avocado. We were both starving so we were excited to eat these so called "juicy burgers". I mean, look at the photo. It looked so good, it had to be good!!!

Both burgers were dry and there was no juice. And we got them in medium rare. My starving bf refused to eat anymore and filled his stomach with fries--which were awesome. I finished mine because the avocado helped me slide the dry meat down my throat. I was so hungry, it tasted decent to me. But I won't be coming back again. 

Also, one of the cashiers thought it would be fun to guess my boyfriend and I's ethnicity. Do we look like fucking carnival games to u? :-) lmao
author: Michelle K.

description:
I make a point of coming back to Super Duper each time I'm in SF. I love the burgers here - I think one of the best things about the flavor must be the sauce!

Today I had the Mini (Cheese) Burger and Cookies & Cream shake. Even though I was coming in at around 3 pm, it was still super busy and most of the tables were filled up! I took a seat at the bar, overlooking the kitchen. All the burgers are made fresh to order and served up on a fluffy bun with lettuce, tomatoes, onions and Super Sauce, unless you tell them otherwise. The wait for the food was under 10 minutes, but the burger came out hot and fresh. They cook the burgers to medium and it's pretty much perfect, with everything melting together.

The milkshake was average - a little too thick and not very flavorful (I've had better at Mel's or Potbelly's, which we unfortunately don't have in SF). Next time I'm going to go with fries instead.

Love it!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Happy with my server and the service. Milkshakes were extremely thick-need a spoon basically. The chocolate one we got was really good. We ordered the super burger and the meat was super juicy and delicious. The amount of lettuce and tomato was adequate. Its a messy burger kind of place. You can expect to get your hands dirty with these, so get a lot of napkins.

The Garlic Parmesan fries were pretty good but only if they're fresh. We got lukewarm ones=not wonderful. Very garlicky because they put fresh minced garlic in.
author: Leah L.

description: hands down my favorite burger AND favorite veggie burger. I'm not a vegetarian, but i'll go out of my way to order a veggie burger here. This places gives that great comfort food feeling, after getting caught up in the city, this is one of my favorite places to wind down too especially on the weekend, followed by the BEST soft serve on the West Coast.
author: Cristian T.

description: Awesome burgers n beers, the fries are a bit greasy for me. Staff were very friendly n attentive. I will go back again for sure!!!
author: Reyna W.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is definitely the Shake Shack of the West Coast, specializing in burgers and shakes/ice cream. It's more expensive than In-N-Out, but not enough for you to stay away.

food
+ SUPER BURGER & EGG ($9.25)
+ MINI BURGER ($5.50) with grilled onions, lettuce, tomato, & house made pickles
The burgers are cooked and seasoned well, and the sesame bun is heartier than Shake Shack/In-N-Out without masking the flavors.
+ GARLIC FRIES ($3.25): I usually stay clear of these types of fries because it tends to get to heavy with all of the garlic/cream-like flavors. However, Super Duper does this really well! The garlic flavors were on the fries without being too salty or heavy. The fries are crispy thin, just how I like them.
+ SOFT SERVE: We got the chocolate dipped cone, and I was in heaven. Imagine a McDonald's soft serve that doesn't give you a weird chemical after taste after you are done devouring it. That's what this soft serve is, but real and made of good ingredients. The chocolate shell pretty much kept it's shape, and I would definitely come back and get their soft serve again.
author: Sophie P.

description: It is not in and out but still a good burger!  My super duper burger was huge and tasty!!  I was full for the rest of the day!  It is a greasy burger but that's what makes it good!  The upstairs has seating.
author: Abbas B.

description:
I was a tourist in SF looking for burgers, so i went on yelp! haha and this place had 2k reviews so i had to come

Food
- I got the mini burger with all the free stuff and an egg! I also go garlic fries
- The burger was pretty bomb!, I regret getting the egg though because it made the burger very messy and wet. 
- The garlic fries were very bomb but it wasnt as garlicy as i wanted it to be.

Service/Wait
- The cashiers were very helpful in helping me choose my burgers and which toppings i should get. 
- The wait time wasnt bad we waited in line for less than 15 minutes

Parking
- I took an uber but parking

Recommendation
- I would recommend this place at about 70-80% it was pretty bomb but kind of pricey!
author: Alexander C.

description:
Typically love this spot as well as the one in the Castro, their garlic+aged parm fries are delicious as are their burgers, drinks, milkshakes, and soft serve.

Most of my experiences with the staff are rushed, and I get it. It's a high turn over setting with lots of hungry people who aren't the best at ordering. I always make a point of tipping a couple bucks because I've worked in the service industry, and I get it. When I came here tonight, over an hour before close, I was surprised by the brusqueness of the person taking my order.

Before I even began to order, she seemed impatient with my presence. Then when I began to order, she loudly said "I'M SORRY HONEY I CAN'T HEAR A WORD YOU'RE SAYING". It's a loud place, fair enough. But each time I tried to continue with placing my order, she would assume I was done and try to wrap things up as quickly as possible. Normally I don't feel so off guard when placing orders--I'm actually pretty good at it because I've taken them myself so many times. Didn't bother getting add-ons to my burger or requesting the garlic fries because she just seemed so displeased with my presence. 

It's 10pm. I'm tired, you're tired. Still not okay to treat me like an unwelcome guest.
author: Megan D.

description:
A coworker kindly offered to go across the street to get us breakfast sandwiches. At the mention of Super duper, I said yes please! 

She came back with a sausage, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich. I couldn't wait to dig in! The sausage was savory, the egg was cooked nicely and the cheese was all melty. Everything here is organic and free range which makes it feel a little less guilty eating? My only small gripe was I wish the sausage had a little more seasoning. The patty on it's own was a little bland. 

Anytime I'm in need of some breakfast, Super duper is here to come to the rescue. Especially those morning where a breakfast sandwich is needed! (Yes, I'm referring to the mornings where I may have been a little too friendly with Mr. Alkie the night before!)
author: Elena N.

description:
After checking in to my hotel, Parc 55, this was the first spot I went too. The walk was not far at all. Two people I know who our food fanatics told me I must come to this place when I'm in SF. I'm so happy I listened to them both because this place is so good!!! I loved it!

As a first timer, I thought it would just be a regular burger but it is definitely not something you find at other fast food restaurants. I think it was the sauce that totally completed the burger. The fries and garlic fries were delicious as well! They also served beer on tap, but wasn't in the mood for a drink so I'll try some next time. 

This place was pretty crowded for a Monday. Wasn't sure if me and my friends had a place to sit but luckily we found a seat right after we ordered. The line was pretty short and waiting for our food didn't take that long either. We got our drinks and extra sauces and our order was ready after a few more mins.

Overall, I will definitely come back and most likely order what I had the first time. (It was just that good!) This place was quick, not too expensive, and close to Union Square for all you tourists like me.
author: Christine A.

description:
Stumbled upon this place on accident while I was walking to the mall. 

Quick run down: 
* Atmosphere was casual.
* prices were decent.
* wait wasn't too long.
* their garlic fries are a MUST! 
* veggie burger was delicious. 
* played some really good tunes while I was waiting for food.
* downstairs and upstairs seating. 
* cashiers were very nice. The guy who had tattoos was a sweetie. 


Even though there was a long line, the line went very quick and my order took about 5-10 minutes. I'm not really in the area that much but this is definitely a place I wouldn't mind coming back to.
author: Grace Anne D.

description: I am a proud supporter and customer of Super Duper. I love their burgers and fries, although I do understand that the reason behind their costs comes from their quality. I usually order a Mini burger lunch combination, or just the Mini burger and garlic fries separately. After using the ketchup dispenser, I noticed that the cap for my plastic container wasn't closing. I then decided to get another cap and see if it would fit on perfectly. It ended up coming loose in my bag and spilling over my food. I don't understand how burgers can range from $5.50-$7.75, but even the simplest things like a cap not fitting on a condiments container isn't being fixed?
author: Erica K.

description: All I can say is that was a damn good burger. I never go get a burger because honestly I can cook way better burgers at home on the grill. But this place was delicious and the fries were perfectly crispy!
author: Maureen S.

description:
After a long day of walking from union square to chinatown to little italy to fishermans, I worked up an appetite for a burger for dinner! A local friend of mine recommended this burger place if I wanted a quick bite so I stopped by around ~9PM on a Sunday night and there wasn't a long line (but right after we ordered, the line extended to near the door).

I've read a couple of reviews that said the mini burger was really big.. so I didn't want to get one myself so I shared a Super Duper combo with a friend and another friend got a Chicken sandwich. The Super Duper burger was just the mini burger with an added patty, which tasted amazing but the portion is a bit smaller for two people to share. I think if I ordered a mini combo for myself, I would be more full... But it's okay to end with a satisfied feeling instead of completely stuffed feeling. The chicken sandwich was really good too. Thus, for the main entrees / food, I would give it 4/5 based on taste and the amount of food to price ratio.

BUT THE REAL REASON WHY I GAVE IT AN OVERALL 5/5 STARS:
LET ME JUST SAY, I love pickles and when I found out they had homemade pickles with a spicy kick to it, instant love for this place. FIVE OUT OF FIVE FOR THE PICKLES!
The Super Duper combo also came with garlic fries. I love garlic fries and I had really shitty garlic fries by fisherman's wharf earlier in the day so when I put these fries in my mouth-- I can't even put the sensation and the description of my emotions into words of that exact moment LOL. SO, ANOTHER FIVE OUT OF FIVE FOR THE GARLIC FRIES!!.

I would apologize for capping that last paragraph but that was honestly my excitement when eating at Super Duper. I would definitely return when I come back to SF.
author: Jasmine L.

description:
Story: 2 days in, I was still in desire of fulfilling my french fries fix. Seeing good reviews about this place on Yelp, this felt like this spot would save my french fry fix.

Ambiance: 
* Parking | Good luck with parking. This is in the bottom of market street and quite a busy area.
* Seating | This place has a lot of options with inside, outside, bar and upstairs seating. I can envision it being busy during main hours but off hours, it's pretty open.
* Feels | Lines come in flashes. The place is very cool and spacious. The music is very funk James Brown-esque like. Nothing but good vibes here.

Food:
* Super Burger | I was warned that this burger would be fulfilling and indeed they were right. Good thing I protein styled it so I had the opportunity to enjoy the juice (not water) of the beef more. You can significantly tell if it's organic or not and this was truly an organic bite.
* Garlic Fries | FINALLY my craving was satisfied. The fries were semi thick and crunchy. In addition, the garlic gave it a great kick and the cheese was a great compliment.

Customer Service: Our orders were served quick. The price of the burgers were on the high end of the $ but understandable since it is organic.

Overall: 
4 stars. The price was reasonable, service was good, the food was delicious, and the feel was comforting.I couldn't give it 5 stars because it lacked a grand famous signature. Thank you Super Duper Burgers for ending my SF trip on a good note.

Advice:
* Good place for a quality organic burger.Protein style it if you want to be carb friendly and to prevent that food coma.
* Ask for everything on it so you can get you pay for.
author: Leland S.

description:
Well made yummy burgers and tasty garlic fries. I was curious about this "Super Duper" burger place and what the hype was all about. This place is super hip and the feel of it definitely belongs in SF. There is plenty of seating inside and a small patio. There's also a 2nd floor! You order at the counter and pick up your food there too.

We were able to split a super burger between 2 people and we added avocado to spoil ourselves. The patty was juice and flavorful. I really liked their house made pickles. The garlic fries were the best. Yum!
author: Cindy K.

description:
If Shake Shack is the burger of NYC and In-N-Out is the burger of SoCal, then Super Duper Burgers is the burger of SF! I wouldn't have gotten a burger in SF if it weren't for a friend of a friend who took our group here!

My boyfriend had the super duper burger (2 patties) while I had the mini burger with cheese and added avocado to it; we also had a side of garlic fries to share. Both of us had our burgers cooked medium rare and they came out perfectly! The mini burger ain't mini; it's as hefty as an average sized burger at a restaurant. It definitely filled me up. The burger was juicy, but not to the point where grease was oozing out of the burger. But you do need a ton of napkins though! We asked for extra Super Duper Sauce on the side to dip our fries in; sooooo good!

I could have done without the garlic fries though. They literally just added cheese, garlic, andherbs on top of the fries. I had to rip off bits of cheese just to make sure I could evenly distribute it to all the fries. Their fries were super crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside; I'm a fries fanatic so this screams YES.

Their homemade pickles were interesting. They were more vinegar-y which isn't my preference but they are pretty good pickles.

The restaurant has an industrial feel with high ceilings and dim lighting as you move farther into the store. Seating is difficult at this location but they do have an upstairs deck for additional seating that is much quieter than the first floor.

Overall, you're getting fresh and flavorful burgers with huge portions at a great price. I have yet to try the milkshakes but I'll definitely come back when I'm in SF again!
author: Teresa N.

description: Pretty darned good. Love the soft serve. Get the child size, trust me, it's big enough. Devouring a chocolate dipped cone while walking by the water on a hot summer day is pure happiness. The breakfast sandwich is another great treat. Those eggs are really good. The burger, oddly enough, was the most disappointing thing I tried, but even that was ok.
author: Shoole S.

description:
Based purely on the shake alone, Super Duper Burgers gets my vote.  I tried the Double Chocolate & Chips "Super Shake" after a bust of a meal at Bun Mee, and damn, this was close to perfect.  Actually, I would have preferred to feel like I do after having shakes most days, when the thing is heavy, bad for you happiness.  Instead, I finished this shake and mostly went about my day, after of course consuming all of the crumbled cookie scattered throughout the cup.  $6 and change was about right for this serving size and the line moved just as fast as the service to make the shake, so I was in and out (but thankfully not at In and Out, where the shakes are only good, not amazing) in less than 10 minutes at the end of a busy lunch hour serving Dreamforce customers.

Wishing this could be added to my rotation in Chicago, but I'll live with it being a really good option for future visits.
author: Justin B.

description:
I'm stumped, I really am.......
My GF has said for a long time that we have to go to Super Duper Burgers during one of our trips.  She's had them bookmarked, there's a massive amount of positive reviews....and we just tried literally the worst burgers we've ever had!
It was free museum day in Sf and we had been to two places, time for a quick bite.  A look on Yelp and we're rewarded with SDB being just around the corner!  My gal got the mini, I ordered the super/fries/and a beer.  Burgers come out and something is just off.....My gal added grilled onions which barely seemed cooked, just raw and swimming in oil.  The burgers were flavorless, not a sign of salt or seasoning, combined with cold french fries.  My 2 patty burger came with one piece of wilted/oily lettuce that was mostly shoved in the bottom of the paper wrap and not on the burger.  'Secret Sauce'?  It's mayo with nothing added to it.  I also love pickles.  I'm not sure what was going on with their brine, but these were just horrible!
I had taken about 2 bites of my burger and decided to just give it to the homeless outside.  The manager asked what was wrong when I went to the counter for a togo container.  She was kind enough to refund our money and offered to make us 'better burgers' for free.  We said no.  Shouldn't we have gotten 'good burgers' to begin with?  (and honestly what were they gonna do different?)  
My GF is a burger fiend.......This is the first time I've EVER heard her say a burger made her 'sad'!  She compared these to frozen angus burgers from Costco that you microwave.  I say the Costco ones are better!
I will be a champion for making sure no one I know EVER eats at one of these places!
Good bye, good riddance SDB!
author: Jim P.

description: It's a good burger joint to go and hang out or grab a bite to eat if your craving burgers. Recommend adding extra toppings for more flavors. Came here to carbo load for the SF Marathon and it satisfied my diet on point!
author: Aleth W.

description:
I was super duper hungry late one evening and wanted a super duper awesome snack. Luckily, the fiance was on top of his game and had this place picked out. We walked over from our hotel and found ourselves in the midst of what resembled a college cafeteria serving "late night". Reminded me of the good old days actually. But with way better food. 

We shared a burger and fries, and loaded up on the house made pickles. There's seriously something amazing in their pickles. Throw in a fresh strawberry milkshake and I'm a happy camper. Sounds like a recipe for satisfying an eight month pregnant chick. But really its just that good. 

As we sat there scarfing down our odd (not odd) combination of items, we realized no words were said in those 15 minutes of mastication. That's some serious eating, folks. 

We left pleased with our find and content with our meditative masticating.
author: McKenzie S.

description:
If Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers, a peck of pickled peppers Peter Piper picked. If Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers he probably made pickles and brought them to Super Duper Burgers.

Dude, I love pickles. Like, I'd probably date a guy named Peter just because he will probably bring me a peck of pickled peppers. Jk, but Super Duper Burgers has the most pickles I've ever seen at a burger place. Not necessarily the best, but yeah... I can really only speak for the pickles and fries cause that's all I tried.

My friends and I were hungry and waiting for the hour long seating time at Tropesueno so we decided to get garlic fries at Super Duper. This place is pretty chill. I didn't think the garlic fries were OMG good. They were ok. I'd probably come again to try their burger, but if I were craving garlic fries, I'd look for somewhere else to go.
author: Krystle T.

description:
The No1DP was in town again and we were wanting to eat a lighter lunch due to upcoming dinner plans. After picking up my new iPhone 5 from the nearby Apple store we stopped by here as the No1DP wanted a good burger. As for me I heard about it as it is currently listed in the Eater 38 (as of the latest writing in April 2014).

Even though we stopped by towards the end of the lunch rush during a weekday when the Apple WWDC conference was taking place, the line was reasonable and went by pretty quickly. There's also two floors of this burger joint and the 2nd floor is an excellent vantage point to people-watch. 

Their spiel is that their beef is 100% Niman Ranch all natural beef ground fresh each day.

We both got mini burgers ($5) with additional cheese (0.50) and "everything on it" (lettuce/tomato/red onions/super sauce). We shared an order of garlic fries ($3), which contains fresh garlic and 6 month aged cheddar. 
- The patty was nicely toasted and the burger had a decent amount of cheese. The vegetables were fresh and adequately soaked up any of the meat juice. 
- Garlic fries are some of the best garlic fries I've tasted. The fries are thick yet crunchy (which is quite hard for thick-cut fries) and there's ample amount of garlic and cheese. For one person this can be a meal in itself and is made for sharing with at least 2 people. Next time I'll have to try a burger/fry combo with one of their shakes.

Although this isn't taking over my place as my favorite burger joint (Burger Lounge of SD), this can serve up a delicious burger and if I ever get a burger craving in the city I wouldn't mind stopping here to satisfy the craving.
author: Isabella B.

description:
The burgers really ARE super duper! I ordered the "mini" burger which is really a normal sized burger with one patty instead of two (super duper burger). I added an organic egg and also got a side of garlic fries. The burger was delicious!!!! The buns were perfectly toasted and the patty was juicy and meaty. The burger was pretty greasy and I had egg yolk and sauce dripping down my hands as I ate. The egg was a great addition to the burger. It definitely satisfied my craving for a fat, juicy burger. The garlic fries were also deliciously tasty. They were LOADED with garlic and cheese and possibly had more garlic than actual fries! 

A cool thing about this place is that they also serve wine and beer on tap. You can also get your milkshake SPIKED!! I didn't have any alcohol or milkshakes, but I like the fact that they serve them. It was also neat that they had pickles out next to the condiments and you could take as much as you wanted. The pickles weren't my fave, but who doesn't love free and unlimited food?!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Was craving for burgers and beer after work and it was my first time checking out Super Duper. Aside from it being conveniently settled in downtown, it's close by Yerba Buena Park! I ordered the mini burger with cheese and had garlic and cheese fries on the side. I had a light beer too. Cost wise, it seemed pretty fair. If you love pickles like me, you could totally have them over their condiments counter. Staff was ok. The cashier was friendly but I felt rushed eating since one of the guys would literally ask often if they could take my tray. It was 830 so I guess they were getting ready for close?? 

The Mini Burger was ok, quantity wise, it's perfect to leave you feeling full without being overwhelmed. The sesame bun complemented the meat. The patty was a little dry though, could have marinated the meat more to push its flavor. It was juicy yes, but without the bun and everything else it wouldn't strike as much. The garlic fries were better. So, the fries had aged cheese which I loved, and the fries were just cooked right without being soggy or too crisp. It came off a bit greasy but at least I had beer to wash it down. Can't wait to try their milkshake/ ice cream though. Hopefully, that would give me a more lasting impression.
author: Andie H.

description:
It's become a ritual for me now. If I'm in the city for a Giants game or some shopping, gotta stop by Super Duper Burgers! 

Their burgers are delicious as ever. When you bite into the burger, the juiciness is immediately apparent. Not so juicy that you have grease running down your hands, but just enough to make the burger nice and moist. Every time I've been to SDB, the burger has had the perfect light pink center. My last visit they skimped on the Super Duper Sauce. C'mon, you gotta load that baby up with tangy deiliciousness. Simply put, they know how to do burgers here.

The plain fries are just that. Plain, boring fries. I always share an order because they do give you a lot. A mini burger combo is what I usually get. You get a burger, fries, and drink for just under $10. Good deal for the size of the burger and amount of fries you get.

The atmosphere is not super hectic for such a busy place. My last visit I came around 6pm and I must've gotten there just before the rush because I barely waited in line and didn't have any trouble finding a seat.

As long as SDB keeps serving up those perfect burgers, I will continue to make it one of my first stops anytime I visit the city.
author: Emily C.

description:
The burgers here are grass feed meat, so it tasted pretty organic! I had the super duper with bacon, grilled onions, and extra veggies. It tasted GREAT! The only problem is that it's a baby burger.. Wish the size was a little bit bigger. The best thing about this place is the GARLIC FRIES! It's a must when coming to Super Duper Burger!
Also get the pickles next to the condiments, in-house made which tastes amazing!
As for the atmosphere, it's nice and hipster like. I would definitely recommend this place to any burger fanatics like myself.
author: Andre B.

description:
I don't understand the hype for SUPER DUPER. I've had them bookmarked for quite some time. I finally got to try the Market Street location and was highly disappointed. 

Besides it being the most greasy disgusting burger I've ever had in my life, the workers were aloof and made mistakes left and right. I literally repeated my order to the cashier four times until he got it right as he slowly pecked away at his screen, and the order still came out wrong. I swear it wasn't complicated either. (Two super burgers with everything, one super burger with jalapeño, one mini burger combo with lemonade, and two milkshakes). Got to the pickup counter and the shakes weren't made and the fries weren't included. Had to wait for them to cook the fries, and argued whether or not we ordered and paid for the shakes.

Finally sat down to eat and I swear, the grease doesn't drip out of their burger, it pours out. About half way through, my gut was already churning and gurgling. Three of the four of us gave up and didn't finish. It was pure garbage. 

We walked by a BK and a Carl's on the way there. Both would have been about half the price, and both would have been better options as far as health and taste go. 

Pretty simple - the burger is probably the hardest meal in America to fuck up. Super Duper managed to serve me the worst burger I've ever had.

1 generous star.
author: Joel V.

description: Grabbing a quick dinner before the game, this place was convenient for us on Market Street.  I ordered a mini sized burger, which was a decent size for me.  Nothing to complain about, although it wasn't juicy enough for me, maybe I should have ordered an egg with it.  Loved the crunchy fries more.
author: Karen L.

description:
One of the top burger spots I've ever been to.  I know this is blasphemy, but I like these burgers better than in and out - they're that good.  I've even tried the veggie burger (I was one a vegetarian kick for the week), and when you top it with an egg and some avocado, it blew my mind (they add cucumber and hummus to veggie burgers which is a nice touch).  

My number one reason for coming here is not the burgers - it's the garlic fries.  Super Duper makes some of (if not THE) best garlic fries I've had.  Better than AT&T Park, better than Gotts.  The only issue is that the garlic fries are a bit inconsistent.  Sometimes, you'll get lots of cheese and only a little bit of garlic, other times you'll get heaping spoonfuls of both with a healthy dash of fresh parsley.  Regardless, the aged cheese and fresh parsley makes all the difference in the world.  

The fact that Super Duper offers great beer and wine on tap, dipped cones, and great house made pickles is just icing on the cake.  I highly recommend any and all Super Duper Burger locations.
author: Tom G.

description: Been here several times and the staff is always courteous with good service. Never been disappointed with the burgers or shakes! Can get crowded though...
author: Ron I.

description: Great beefy burger! Fresh tasting juicy double burger with bacon. Fries were pretty decent. Fresh strawberries shake was milk and smooth. Will definitely come back here!
author: マイク

description:
Moving from SD to SF, at first I was a little upset that there weren't that many In n outs in the city area. But now I understand why...because of the great tasting super duper burgers!

Although the burgers themselves maybe a little bit on the pricey side around 8-11$ (depending on if you get the tasty garlic fries), the quality of the food is great. The burger tastes super duper fresh and the meat is deliciously juicy. 

I will definitely be coming back every other week to quench my burger thirst. Also the service is great, aside from the long lines. But hey you gotta wait to get the good stuff!
author: Edward C.

description:
I know... more burgers.  But,  this one is really juicy! There's no way you can eat this and not have to wash your hands when you're done.  Their chicken burger is really moist too! 

Don't forget to grab some of their spicy pickles!  They are on point.  I didn't get to grab a shake,  but heard they're worth the calories. 

it's a great place to stop by during a shopping day!  ;)
author: Frances C.

description: I forgot I've eaten at Super Duper before, I ate at the Santa Clara location inside Westfield Shopping mall. And it is still the best burger I've ever had. It is so juicy, meaty and delicious. I have find another one close by. It was my lawyer who I visited today that recommended Super Duper. I decided to look back at my old yelp reviews and realized I've eaten at Super Duper before. Again, way better than In N Out.
author: Bill M.

description:
We were craving food and SDB popped up on the Yelp appy and off we went. 

We came on a Friday afternoon and the place was packed. As soon as you walk into the door there was a long line. Holy cow! There was a sign that marks 5-8 min wait from this point to order, and believe it or not, it was literally less than a 5 min wait. 

We were very surprised as to how efficient the line was and how quickly the turnover here is. Super duper fast!!!

I ordered the single burger with cheese, garlic fries and a child's chocolate milkshake. They have a combo special for a single burger, fries and drink for $10. Kinda expensive, but it's good food.

The food is great and the service is really friendly. Don't be afraid of the line or the wait for a table. People eat fast or take their food to go. There are additional tables upstairs, but only about 10. Condiments are located on both floors which makes it convenient.
author: Maria C.

description:
Y'all, I know you know about the burgers, but the MINI DONUTS at Super Duper are delightful. I got the egg sandwich + donuts + coffee deal -- filling enough that I skipped lunch. Real eggs'n'all, but I found it less exciting (possibly because I didn't pay extra for bacon). So let's talk doughnuts: a trio of glazed, cinnamon sugar and chocolate coated. Cinnamon sugar: reminded me of old school state fairs (almost, not quite, hitting the East Coast cider donut circuit). Chocolate: just the right amount and not very melty. Glazed: always. 

East Coast Dunkers, no iced coffee here, but Four Barrel coffee which means taking your coffee black is totes fine.
author: Heidi L.

description: No tables to eat at.  Food is average so there's really. No reason to go back.  If you do go, here's a tip: the secret sauce is disgusting.
author: Andrew F.

description:
I ordered the mini-burger because I was intimidated by the Super Duper name of the restaurant. I nixed the cheese, had the bacon and grilled onions. Can I say YUMM?? I also had the garlic fries and ordered the dips to go with it. My favorite is ALWAYS the chipotle, all the time. I tried a bit of the other two and didn't bother with a second helping. If the burger wasn't enough, I also ordered the strawberry shake, which was rich in flavor and texture, but I couldn't finish even half of it. I felt guilty having to throw it away when I left. 

I had lunch with my two sister-in-laws and had great conversation. If not the food, then the company! The lines were long, unfortunately they arrived after I did and got stuck in a long lunch line. However we got our orders around the same time, so the wait isn't bad at all!
author: Sharon B.

description:
Super Duper better than In n Out? No way, had to find out for myself.

My first time checking this place out was on a Saturday around lunch time and luckily beat the rush. I had the mini super duper burger with cheese and bacon and a share of the garlic fries. My boyfriend and I grabbed a table upstairs and had a Sprite while we waited. Something must be wrong with their soda fountain because our Sprite tasted like carbonated water with a splash of Sprite in it.

The pickles were nice and juicy and I liked having them conveniently next to the condiments rather than asking for them at the counter. The burger was pretty juicy, almost borderline too greasy though. Either my bacon wasn't cooked thoroughly or I just had a bad slice, but it tasted like I was just biting into fat. I started to question if it'd taste any better if I added a fried egg, but I think that would just make it taste more soggy...and greasier than it already was. The garlic fries were crispy and weren't overly garlic-y, which was good.

Verdict: In n Out still wins.
Sorry to disappoint. The burgers were good, but not super duper good. I think I'd enjoy it more if I was super duper hungover and needed something greasy to set me straight. Still worth trying though.
author: Georgina G.

description:
Conveniently located near Union Square.

This burger joint is recently price for SF food; however be warned that the portions are SMALL. One burger will probably not fill a normal person up. Luckily, a side of garlic fries is only $3.

The garlic fries were really good. They put A LOT of fresh garlic. The portion is also small, but for $3, what else would you expect?

I ordered the veggie burger, which to my surprise, I actually enjoyed. I like that they use hummus, which essentially made the burger taste like a Mediterranean dish.

Overall, definitely a good place to grab a quick (and affordable, in SF terms) bite.
author: Emily C.

description:
#2 favorite burger in the city after 4505 Meats. Love all the free add-ons (lettuce, tomato, red onions, jalapenos, grilled onions & housemade pickles). Would've given Super Duper Burgers 5 stars if they hadn't overcooked my egg ;( I'll give them the benefit of the doubt though that this was a one-time occurrence, and only happened because my visit coincided with Gay Pride (and there was a line out the door at their Castro branch).

Word to the wise: If you're debating whether to get a mini burger or a super burger, go for the former (unless you're really, really hungry). Mini burger is not mini by any means, it's more of a regular-sized burger and it'll fill you up nice and good, especially if you get all the fixings.

Also, DEFINITELY order the garlic fries. The burger's tasty, but my friends and I agreed the fries were even better. Arguably made the meal.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
This place is phenomenal!  It's so rare to find a good burger joint that I left a little surprised. The bun, the meat, the lettuce (real romaine), and all the other toppings are top quality. They have homemade pickles for your picking, real glass drinking glasses, and some of the best fries I've ever had (try the garlic and cheese!). 

You can't go wrong. It is a little expensive, but it's absolutely worth the price!
author: Levi H.

description: First time here and I'm from out of town and must I say this place is so good! I want this place in San Diego we need more burger places other then in n out, five guys, and burger lounge. San Francisco had such awesome places to eat, bring some down south ! But overall I loved it here service was great and knowledgeable, your food is ready really quick I went on a Saturday around 7 it was busy so if you see a line and you're hungry, don't worry it'll go by fast.
author: Gaby V.

description:
Super duper burger is super indeed! I loved everything about this fast-casual eatery. From the jar of homemade pickles near the soda machine (as many as you want!!) to the juicy, delicious burger patty, I was in straight up burger heaven.

I got the "mini" combo, which included a burger, fries, and a drink, none of which were mini in any way. I guess their normal burger must be a double patty? Either way, I was so stuffed I could only eat about half of my burger, and ohhh how that saddened me, because I wanted to devour the whole thing! 

The burger patty was delicious, I got it topped with cheese, bacon (duh), lettuce, tomato, onion, and their special super duper sauce stuff. Yum-o doesn't even begin to cover it. The fries were good -- hot and crisp -- but once I saw one of my dining companions with a serving of their garlic parmesan fries, I knew I'd made a mistake. Now THOSE are where it's at!

And lest we gloss over those delicious homemade pickles, they are like pickle perfection. Not overly sour Vlassics or any such nonsense, but more like crisp, quick-pickled delights. Totally crunchy and nomworthy. 

Next time I'm back in San Francisco, you know where to find me -- at the front of the Super Duper Burger line, ready for another fix.
author: Gretchen F.

description: Good burger. Decent fries. Really good garlic fries (hot, crispy, tasty). Ketchup tasted very "natural". Pickles were fine, too. The burger has a very beefy taste to it. The menu does say the sandwiches are very very juicy, so be careful if you're wearing any clothes you wouldn't want stained. Loud vibes, but good vibes. I'll be back with my non-vegetarian friends!
author: Mirko M.

description: Had the Super Combo which includes a double burger, fries, and drinks.  It was a very good burger and if I'm ever back in San Francisco, I will be back and next time get a shake.
author: Garner S.

description:
Upon walking in this place we noticed that it was packed. One thing I could conclude was this place was probably good or it was a tourist trap  based upon the central location. 

We walked up to the counter to place our order. The menu you was simple so it really wasn't hard to decide what we wanted. We placed our order and were given a pager thing to let us know when our food order was ready. While waiting I had to use my secret agent skills to obtain a table. The table location was in a bad spot  because it was right next to the growing line of people trying to place their order. 

Our food did take awhile to be cooked but we were  not in a hurry and enjoyed the rest from a days worth of walking the city. My meal was the super salad, dressing on the side and a beef patty. It was a fresh tasting salad that reminded me of my parent's garden in Ohio. My husband ordered the a bacon cheese burger with garlic fries. The garlic fries seemed promising but they disappointed both of us. His burger was on point.

I loved this place because everything is pretty much recycled. Also there are free pickles. :)
author: Amanda K.

description:
The burgers here are just okay in my opinion. It's not that it's bad, I just wasn't blown away. The hamburger meat is similar to Smash Burger where the patty is flattened. The burger itself is on the smaller side and I took out the large leaf of lettuce because it was dry and hard to eat. 

I ordered a "mini combo ": Single patty Super Duper burger with fries and a drink for a just over $9. Pretty moderately priced burger. 

It's also a busy location but they seemed to have a good system to get orders out in decent time.
author: Shanna M.

description: Very disappointing. Ordered Burger came out dry and was not tasty. Although my friends advised to try it here.
author: Ava P.

description:
I actually ate here last time I was in SF but I was pretty drunk and could barely remember the experience, hence no review. This time I was 100% sober and ready to eat. 

Super Duper is a pretty grotty kind of place. On a Saturday night it's a mess, they really need more staff tidying up tables and sweeping the floors. If you can get past that, you might like it. I ordered the mini burger meal and upgraded to garlic fries and got the trio of dips. Nearly $20 but I was starving and didn't care. You get free refills of soft drinks and they hand you a buzzer so you can collect your food when it's ready. 

I'm not going to lie, I didn't rate my burger. I would describe it as pretty bland (something I think seems to be kind of common with US burgers, I also think the same of In n Out and Five Guys. Get some meat with flavour please and slap some burger sauce on there!). It had nice lettuce and tomato on it though, and it was cooked med-rate. It filled the hole I had after standing in line for 3 hours at passport control to get into the US (still crying). 

What I DID rate was the garlic fries. These are EPIC. I love the little chunks of cheese over them and of course they are super garlicky. Sorry to anyone I see today. I would consider going back to get a really big portion of the garlic fries and not even bother with a burger.
author: Briony C.

description:
This place straight up made me want to turn vegetarian. I'm not lying! I had a terribly unhealthy lunch and after a mean workout, I was strolling around trying to find a healthy dinner option. I don't eat actual burgers (not a fan of ground meat), but I popped in to see if they had a chicken option. I noticed they had a veggie burger and figured I was in San Francisco, which, if you're ever in the mood to try some healthy vegetarian food, San Francisco is the place to do it.

I ordered a veggie burger which comes with hummus and cucumber in it. DELISH. I had one bite and honestly was like this is 100x better than meat. What am I doing with my life? All kidding aside, it was DELICIOUS (deserving of all caps).

I wish they were in New York City (insert sad face here). This is my new go-to place when I'm in San Francisco for work!!
author: Melanie A.

description:
Super Duper was not super as I've never had a more tasteless burger in my life in addition of not having a place to sit due to more than a few dirty tables not being bussed. Fries were good but an over all disappointing experience.
Yelp got it wrong ,very wrong
author: Matthew M.

description: I love the super duper burger chain.  When I visited this location everything was going smooth they had pretty good service. I came with 7 other people and I was the ONLY one without food for a very long time.  Everyone in my party got their food within 5 minutes of ordering. I did not get my food for almost 40 minutes.  They must have forgotten.  However the food was good once I received it
author: Kristen W.

description:
I have fond memories of this place because it was a convenient place for my deceased friend and I to meet up. I have been here about a dozen times. This place is fairly popular and at their busier hours, the seating can get scarce. They have seating in the front, at the counter, and upstairs. They have bathrooms way in the back and you have to ask the people behind the counter for the code (R.I.P. free bathrooms) to punch in.

They have beef, chicken, and vegetarian burgers. They even have sliders (mini burgers). In addition to burgers, they have salads, milkshakes, regular fries, garlic fries, house made lemonade, and ice cream cones. They have a breakfast menu limited to morning hours. I never tried any of their breakfast items so I can't comment on it. Super Duper Burgers are a bit on the pricier side for a burger joint but in almost all of the times I have visited, I have been happy with the quality of the food. 

There are refrigerated bottled drinks, drinks by tap, and a fountain drink machine. Instead of regular napkins, there are paper towel dispensers. There is compost bin in addition to a regular trash bin. They have mustard, ketchup, and I think mayonnaise condiment containers with pumps next to the fountain machine. You can get complimentary house made pickles from the plastic barrel container near by the condiments. The pickles are slightly spicy so you will need some water. They make a nice substitute if you are not interested in a side of fries. 

I had their veggie burger twice and enjoyed it. It comes with hummus and cucumbers. Both times, I had it with the everything option. I prefer it without the cucumbers. The patty is flavorful and sturdy (not mushy or fragile to the point where it comes all apart in your hand and pieces are on your lap). I love their fries because they are always hot and perfectly fried (crispy and crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside). Quality and quantity has been consistent except for the last visit. This last visit, I somehow ended up with a small portion and the fries were not as hot as I would have liked. 

I have only tried their fresh strawberry milkshake to go. It came in a 16 oz container. It was creamy with bits of real strawberry pieces. Next time, I will try their cookies and cream milkshake. Overall this place is pretty good and a solid choice for me to go to if I am in the area with a hungry belly.
author: S A.

description: I heard about this local burger joint, so decided to stop in today for a quick lunch. Super friendly staff, lively atmosphere and delicious food.  I enjoyed a mini burger with cheese, pickles, super sauce, onions and tomato with a side of french fries.  This place seems to be busy all the time, but they crank out the food pretty quick - don't be discouraged by the lines!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Super Duper makes a great burger - juicy, flavorful, and delicious. They also have a surprisingly awesome veggie burger. They're able to churn them out pretty quickly, too. Generally I love the chain and hope they expand even more. Unfortunately sometimes you just end up with a cashier who's having a bad day or something - today I ordered a veggie burger with "everything on it" (an option they have on the menu, with jalapeños , grilled onions, and pickles below it - with all of those toppings listed as free). The cashier, Yesenia, repeated back to me that the burgers come with lettuce, tomato, and their special sauce, "What else would you like on it?" I explained I just wanted everything on it (like the menu listed). Then she asked me the same question again, lecturing that the burgers come with lettuce, tomato, and special sauce. I told her I was confused because I wanted the option on the menu and again she repeated the same refrain to me. She got pretty short and frustrated with me and all I wanted was something listed on the menu. She made me feel stupid for it knowing exactly how I had to order it, and she was condescendingly gelling me they never put some of those things on the burger. Bummer, guess I'm going elsewhere next time.
author: Craig D.

description: A must try for anyone living in or visiting SF. This burger is so good. Their shakes are so good. Their fries are so good. There is always a long line up, but sooo worth the wait. Recommend!
author: Kay P.

description:
It's so tough to rate a burger place like Super Duper -- basically a fast food place that is aspiring to a better version of fast food. You can't compare it to the fancy burger you'd get at a great restaurant; and you can't compare it the lousy burger you get at a generic burger place like McDonalds. You can only compare it to other new-and-improved burger places, like Shake Shack or Portland's Burgerville.

And in that pantheon, Super Duper does well. Its burgers are solid and delicious, but it doesn't have nearly as many options as you find at Shake Shack or Burgerville, so you I can't give it a five-star rating. If you're dining with a non-burger-eater, there's really nothing for them here.

But if you are seeking a good, basic, fast burger, it's great!
author: Alexandra S.

description:
I didn't know what to expect. The sign on the outside made me think it was a dive.

On the inside though.. MIND BLOWN!

The scent of garlic fries hit me like a ton of bricks and I was won over instantly! We ordered a burger each with cheese and bacon, that was all that mine had on it, the husbeastie added -everything- and included jalapeño peppers too!  We also split an order of Garlic/cheese fries - these are SUPER DUPER!

We came in 30 minutes before closing, usually a DON'T, but they were hopping, so the food came out quickly, it was hot and fresh, and so very, very good! The burgers were so greasy and tasty, the bacon was just right, and of course the fries.. They're the beginning of a new addiction, I'm thinking. 

Since the price is right, we'll be back as long as we're in San Fran.
author: Dianna B.

description:
I must admit I am smitten.

I feel about Super Duper Burgers what many SoCal folks (and folks elsewhere) feel about In-And-Out. I like In-And-Out, but I absolutely love and crave Super Duper Burger.

Why? First, because their burgers are delightfully juicy. Guessing it's partly the blend of beef, partly the thickness of the burgers, partly the fact that they cook them to Medium. They're super flavorful and juicy for sure.

Second, because the toppings are all top notch. Lettuce, Tomato, (House Made) pickles, Super Duper Sauce, are all perfect. Not to mention the bacon and available premium blue cheese...

Third, because for the quality they're quite affordable. No, this isn't Burger King, thank GOD. But IMHO their quality is as good or better than many $11 burger joints for $8.

Fourth, their garlic cheese fries are amazing. Just don't eat them without the permission or participation of your S.O. Trust me.
author: Paul D.

description: The chicken chipotle burger is amazing; very flavorful. The staff, especially the young man at the register (8-6-2017 @ appx 8:30 or 9 pm) was very friendly and hospitable. The young man went out of his way to ask how our day was and if we wanted water cups while we waited. Will definitely return, it was a pleasurable experience.
author: Mercedes J.

description: Great burgers and fries.  Love that use organic products and care about packaging. I would recommend this place for a quick easy lunch.
author: Natalee G.

description:
I don't exactly recall how long ago I had my first taste of a Super Duper Burger, but I remember my reaction went something along like this:

OMFG! This is absolutely f*ckin' good. 

My co-worker brought it to work and he had ordered the double burger with cheese and topped with an egg. 

Holy Jesus Mother of Virgin Mary as I was about to commit a sin. 

I've been sinning ever since. 

My go-to burger joint will always be In-N-Out. But if I wanted to splurge on something devilishly good, it's Super Duper to the rescue. 

Don't call if fast food either. These are not your patties from McVomit or Booger King. They know where their meats come from and it's not flash frozen for mass consumption. The meats are juicy and succulent. You can taste that it was a happy cow. Well, it was happy until it was slaughtered. Hey, that's why we're on top of the food chain. 

Not only are the burgers good, but the Garlic Fries and Shakes are on par with their burgers. Get the Organic Strawberry Shake...you won't regret it. 

Every Super Duper Burger has a kryptonite. It's the person who is about to devour it straight to their belly. 

Cheesy, right?

Yes...with plenty of CHEESE!
author: John G.

description: This place has a great San Francisco feel and I like the fast environment inside. I've here after work, for lunch on the weekends, and for eating on the go. But the reality is, the burgers are really greasy and heavy. Not a huge fan of the food itself but it's a solid establishment
author: Kevin B.

description: I'm PISSED! When you request "turkey burger" in yelp they are the first to come up. Walking up here on my lunch break I find out they don't have turkey burgers. How you gone be a burger place in downtown San Francisco and not serve turkey burgers?! Grilled chicken breast sandwich is mot the same. Only reason they get one star is cuz I have to rate so you can read my comment
author: Nhp C.

description:
Two words: COLD FRIES. I happened to sit in the bar seats near the back where you could see the food prep and I understood why -- fries were being made in huge batches and dumped into individual containers and left to sit for ages. I timed two servings of garlic fries, which sat for over 10 min. Not to say that these guys weren't working HARD-- the place is almost always busy. But I have noticed that the quality overall of SD burger has gone down since it opened, when it was tasty and good value.

I'm trying to avoid it if at all possible from here on out. I can get better burgers and hot fries for nearly the same price at other places in the fidi.
author: mo m.

description: Great vegetarian burger options.  I ate there twice with husband and kids in one week while visiting San Francisco.  It's a good relatively quick meal option.
author: Mandy L.

description: Texas has the best burgers ever. But I can't believe I'm saying this: THE BEST BURGER EVER.
author: Ashley D.

description: Really good fresh burgers, garlic fries, and pickles! Non GMO, organic, grass fed, etc.  I loved the homemade pickles and you can take as many as you want. Awesome food.
author: Jim C.

description:
Came here with my husband . This place is delicious and fresh. My favorite thing is the strawberry milkshakes that they make from scratch. I also like the openness of the room so that there is ventilation and you don't smell like a burger afterwards. The environment is friendly and customer service is very hospitable as well. Anybody that tries this place should definitely come back to this place one more time for another burger. 

They stay open really late so after you have a shopping spree this is a good go to place for a quick meal.
author: April G.

description:
I wouldn't call it Super Duper... I wouldn't even settle on just the Super. This was a good burger... don't get me wrong. But I was really expecting a GREAT burger with the reviews that I read.

The homemade pickles were really good. That was the one part that was really good to me. The choices of toppings and freedom with your burger was also good. The bun was hot and fresh along with the fries. Everything about this experience was really good, but the meat was just not that well flavored. Maybe it was a leaner mix... and if that is your thing, then this will be that GREAT burger for you.

If I lived in San Francisco I would definitely go back here. But I probably won't go back since it wasn't over the top good. And San Francisco is the place to go and eat!
author: Will B.

description: Delicious juicy burgers and crispy fries. Ambience is cute, food comes quick. I want to try the salad next time!
author: Sheila S.

description: Pretty good burgers. A bit small for my taste but I am a big water. The garlic fries were great!! I like their free pickles a lot too! We were able to get seating for 6 at lunchtime on a weekday, I think we got lucky.
author: Lisa F.

description:
On the way back home, I needed to refuel after a warm day shopping in Union Square. I haven't been here yet, and I hear it's better than In & Out (yea....right), so it was a must try. 

Ordered up the regular burger w/o cheese and no fries. Kept it simple and I gotta say it's pretty legit. It's juicy and the sauce they use is damn good. Oh and they have free....FREE homemade pickles. Hella yes I'm there! Pickles were awesome. I think I went back for thirds! 

They have some good stuff on the menu and I'll be back for choc. dipped ice cream cone and to add an egg to my next burger. Is it better than In & Out.....not quite. It's good but you can't take down the champ!
author: Andrew S.

description: If u like juicy meat patties for your burger, super duper will not disappoint. Ordered with bacon and cheese. Size was super but the real deal is the burger is jus normal size. Can't eat it alone but need my helping of tomato and mustard to go along. I am not a real burger connoisseur but this is pretty not bad for me.
author: Jeremy K.

description:
West Coast "Shake Shack"...but much better!

My "Super Burger" was made with quality ingredients and beef. 
I went ahead and added cheese and bacon. 
Also Added tomato, super sauce, grilled onions, and jalapeños. 

Had the garlic fries with all three sauces (chipotle/super sauce/ homemade mayo). 
Chipotle sauce was my fav. 

Everything was Incredibly delicious and getting a pint glass for the soda fountain was a nice touch. 

Great vibe. Location was very clean and well kept. 

My best description would be if the best "In n' Out" burger qualities merged with with the intensity of NYC's "Shake Shack" burger...  This burger is better than both.
author: JC M.

description: I wasn't even in the mood for a burger, but this place blew me away. Definitely one of the best burgers I've had for a great price. And the ketchup is THE BEST I've ever tasted!
author: Lindsey C.

description:
I'm just sitting here reading a review off on the side about someone being disappointed with the veggie burger here.  I guess you could argue that if they can't make a good veggie burger they shouldn't, but seriously, that's on the menu as a courtesy to vegetarians.  That's like complaining about a hot dog from a Mexican restaurant.

But that's beside the point.  Super Duper Burgers is a place I wish I had more time to explore, because the menu is intriguing.  As it stands I only had a chance to test out the Super Burger and fries, but the ice cream, shakes, garlic fries, and pickles sound good and I wish I had a chance to try them.

SDB follows the new tradition of restaurants having a very industrial décor.  There is a great deal of space in the two story food spot that it doesn't feel like seating or space would be much of a problem.  Prices aren't terrible, it's typical for being a step above fast food at around $10-15 per person.

As I said above, I just got the Super Burger with fries.  I had added cheese and an egg to the burger (must put an egg on it), and it was delicious.  It was fresh tasting and juicy and flavorful.  The only real disappointments were that the egg didn't really add anything and I got the thick part of the lettuce, which isn't always pleasant biting into.

I figured out about the egg, though.  All the pictures I saw seem to show a fried egg, capable of running away with your tongue.  Mine was done over hard, likely because it was a to-go order and you don't want the egg popping and leaking all throughout the box.  I understand why they have to do this...it just reduces the impact of the egg.

Fries were good, nice and crispy, not too salty.  Can someone please explain to me how In-N-Out still manages to get away with such crappy fries when so many other places know how to do it right?

I'd love to try out their malts and other menu items, though sadly I likely will not be back any time soon.  Cest la vie (I'm sure something is wrong with that, French people don't burn me).
author: Tim O.

description:
We had their shakes the other day and burgers this morning so I'll put the reviews in one. 

Strawberry shake - Really fresh. I think they make it themselves? You can really taste the strawberry flavor but I thought it was just okay. 

Spiked Cookies & Cream shake - This was really good. The cookie crumble throughout was perfecto. You can taste the alcohol too so they make it well. 

Mini homemade donuts - Yum! However, I'm not a sugar coated donut person. I liked glazed ones. They were very moist and not dry. Tastes like churros but more soft inside. 

Burgers - The beef is fresh. You can actually taste the quality. They ground their beef fresh daily. But other than the beef, the taste was standard. Their secret sauce didn't blow my mind. 

Overall, 4 stars!
author: Kristine T.

description:
Do you want a big fat burger? Of course you do!
You're on Market Street and want to avoid McD's or Burger King, I don't blame you.
You really don't fancy going ALL THE WAY to Fisherman's Wharf for an In-and-Out? Yeah, that was exactly my thought when I decided to go FULL ON burger during the last day of my trip.

And I went full out. And it was worth it.

The burger was juicy, the fries were tasty, the products were fresh. 

Just make sure you grab the napkins, yeah? Otherwise you'll have it all over :)
author: Charlotte K.

description: Amazing burgers (amazing for a fast food place) and nice outdoor seating on the street. Pickles are also good and they serve beer!! Service is fast and staff is nice.. highly recommended
author: Malek A.

description:
Despite the long line....we waited less than 10 minutes to place our order....we experienced some Great burgers!  
Good flavor, hot and altogether worth every penny!  Loved the garlic fries w/ cheese too!   It was a little hard to find a table-but we found one and it was clean and had plenty of room for the 4 of us.  We would definitely return!
author: Mama K.

description: Quick awesome burger but staff did forget my frys (No point crying over spill milk lol). Super friendly little spot with a easy menu to navigate.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Great hamburger lunch alternative to all the other burger places around. The menu is simple and the prices are good for the location in downtown SF.

The burgers are fried on a flat top and taste homemade and are delicious as are the french fries. 

The folks are nice and act like they are all owners. Our order came up quick.

Better get there early because once noontime comes around the line is long and the seating is tight.
author: Joel G.

description: I think this place is better than In-n-Out and maybe even The Habit. The mini burgers are the perfect size I think! The shakes and soft serve looks great, I will definitely have to try those one day. The people at the register were nice, nothing special though. Overall I love Super Duper and wish I could eat here all the time.
author: Daphne M.

description:
Me: I am thinking about how I want to start my review for Super Duper Burgers.

Zenda: (Head cants to the side with a small exhale of bliss) Ohhhhh that place was so good. 

Do I need to go on?  Double burger with bacon, cheese and a fried egg. Heaven. Let me tell you about the egg on this thing. This was no fried to rubbery deadness, this was perfection. The color of the yolk was a bright yellow again the stark whiteness of the.. well, whites. Placed with loving care atop a ... I am thinking about this burger and I am drooling... juicy patty. When you cover it with the top bun and press down gently the yolk breaks and creamy goodness oozes all over the bun and the lettuce and meat. 

Messy, messy, messy. Once you pick it up and bite into it, you can't put the burger down otherwise you won't be able to get it back into your hands in own piece. Don't even try to wipe your face. just sit there in your messiness while you smile the smile of the sated. 

Garlic fries are also a winner. If you are feeling particularly saucy, get a shake. They are worth the calories. Zenda says she would have preferred a malted.
author: Snow M.

description: When my group and I went to San Francisco, my uber driver recommended this place to us and I can't thank him enough. Will definitely go back to Super Duper Burgers when I visit San Fran again. I think I might just go to there for these burgers. I wish there was one in Socal!
author: Bona C.

description:
7/15/2016 -- DON'T JUDGE THE NAME, JUST GO IN --

We passed this place because of their name. "Another burger joint."  Despite that, just go in.  We shared a chicken with aioli burger and was deelish. Fries are fries but we ordered a salad to compensate.
author: An T.

description:
Great Gourmet burgers, love the bun and everything in between it!  Garlic fries are addicting.  fast casual eating at it's best.  Yes a little on the pricer side but your pallet is worth it! 

It gets packed but they move you in and out quickly!  outdoor seating as well. Do it right and order a milkshake! 

I would do it all over again
author: Mary S.

description: I'm not a big meat fan, but these burgers are so good. And music playlist on this location is excellent - Bee Gees, Michael Jackson and so on. Great spot!
author: Mariya D.

description: Great burgers. Go for the garlic fries. Expect long lines and longer wait at peak times.
author: Matt A C.

description:
I love Super Duper Burger. Whenever I'm out in the city and want something quick to eat I usually head to Super Duper Burger. It's one of my favorite burger spots, but man, did they let me down.

This weekend I was out in the city with my girlfriend and her sister and when it was time to grab something to eat I didn't hesitate to suggest going to super duper. My girlfriends sister never had a burger from there before so I made sure she had to try it. I kept raving and hyping it up because my past experiences there were always great.

Unfortunately, this experience was a disappointment. The burger was not as juicy as I remembered. Meat was a sad slab of overcooked. I thought they left out all the veggies and I had to open up the bun just to find measly pieces of lettuce and tomatoes. The pickles, which are my favorites there, were soft and seemed to have been pickled too long. The ones I remember eating were crunchy and complimented the burger very well, but these were bad. 

I'm actually pretty embarrassed to have suggested this place to my girlfriend's sister. She even said she would rather have in and out than this burger... And the funny thing is that I couldn't disagree with her. That burger I ate that day was definitely worse than an in and out burger. 

I don't know why this particular spot wasn't as good as the others I've been to but damn y'all let me down. 

On top of that, the orders were all mixed up and people before us got their orders first. I had to run up to the cashier and ask about my order.. 

Would I be back? After that experience I'm not sure especially when I pay a premium compared to other burger places. Bring back the good, familiar experience I've had before and I'll always come back..
author: Michael T.

description: I'm sure its gonna be good but we're approaching the 15 minute mark for a to go order of fries. Cmon!
author: Dan C.

description: Super Duper Burgers are exactly that, super duper!  The food is simple, but prepared well and very flavorful for a burger chain.  The burger itself is richly flavored and the other goodies are really tasty.  The environment is simple, but there is ample seating.
