The folks who take orders and prepare food are super duper helpful!  This is a really nice spot for a quick, easy dinner or lunch.  I also love the location right on Market Street, great while taking a walk.
author: George W.

description: Burger was fine. Similar to In and Out. Fries were not very good. Guy taking orders at the counter was unhelpful and rude. Actually made the husband angry which never happens. Food was good and I'm sure if someone else took our order it would be better.
author: Liz B.

description:
Thank you Super Duper Burger for making the best dang mini burger with an egg. It was delicious, it was juicy, it was gone before I realized it. Loved the atmosphere, loved the food. Garlic fries here are a garlic lovers dream. I however don't have that dream but liked them anyways. I'll make my BF get them so I can satisfy my craving of a few here and there. 

I will be back again and I hope this next time I'll have room to try the Organic Soft Serve Malt ooooh my gosh I could have liked the sign at your entrance when I saw it.... well I wouldn't have but I still want one.
author: Allison B.

description:
My sister and I split the chicken sandwich and mini cheeseburger. The mini burger was a good size and wasn't greasy or too heavy. Grilled onions came free on the burger and added a lot of flavor. The chipotle aoli really made the chicken sandwich, which was perfectly cooked and juicy, so it's a great alternative for someone who wants to eat healthier or doesn't like burgers.

We came during happy hour, so we were pleasantly surprised when we got free fries with our beers. Bring a mint if you plan on ordering garlic fries though, because they're really strong!

We went during prime dinner time but there were plenty of seats and the wait was less than 10 minutes. Pretty basic atmosphere but each table had jenga which was fun to play while we waited for our food.
author: Rachel K.

description: The burgers here are quality beef. Theyre not the ground beef that u get in a log like most places they grind their own meat here u can taste it.. Their garlic fries are to die for and they also server beer. Great place to hangout with your friends at. Ill be back whenever i visit frisco again!
author: Pu B.

description:
Thank you Super Duper Burger for making the best dang mini burger with an egg. It was delicious, it was juicy, it was gone before I realized it. Loved the atmosphere, loved the food. Garlic fries here are a garlic lovers dream. I however don't have that dream but liked them anyways. I'll make my BF get them so I can satisfy my craving of a few here and there. 

I will be back again and I hope this next time I'll have room to try the Organic Soft Serve Malt ooooh my gosh I could have liked the sign at your entrance when I saw it.... well I wouldn't have but I still want one.
author: Brooke B.

description:
Yes, I am a fat kid at heart. And I love eating burgers. From Shake Shack (I am a regular) to In N Out to Five Guys... to the Black Label Burger, I am always stuffing my face with a burger.
I was curious to try this place. I had been told by a friend that it was rather greasy, but told by another friend that it was fantastic. I decided to give it a shot.
I ordered the Super Duper Burger and the garlic fries, and waited for about 10 min. They finally called my number and handed me a paper bag that smelled like a wonderful burger and amazing fries. I walked back to my hotel and started devouring my food. 
The burger was delicious, but I would say that Shake Shack and In N Out have juicier burgers. The garlic fries really do stand out though. The garlic really enhances the flavor of the fries, and goes well with the ketchup. Just thinking about it makes me hungry now.
I would say Super Duper Burgers is pretty super, but falls behind Shake Shack and N In Out.
author: Stephanie Q.

description:
This is a very good burger, but a tad expensive!  I ordered a double burger with egg, grilled onions, cheese, and bacon along with a strawberry shake and garlic fries.  My bill was $22.  Wow that is a lot.  But sometimes you got to splurge.  

The server who took my order was very friendly.  The burger was juicy with good flavor.  I liked the char on the outside of the burger.  The garlic fries weren't too good.  They were kind of limp and lacked integrity.  

The strawberry shake was outstanding, possibly the best I ever had before.  I loved that they gave free pickles.  

Anyway, the burger was large and tasty, the shake was on point, and I got free pickles.  After $22, I left full and happy.
author: Dwayne Y.

description: Just like any standard burger joint of its kind, but we had a good first time experience. Order line went swiftly, staff was polite and friendly and seating was nice. I ordered a vegetarian burger and my son ordered a chicken burger- both were nice. Fries left more to be desired as they were a bit dry and bland but we still finished more than half :D All in all, great fast food joint.
author: Jaya H.

description:
The line can look daunting but it goes pretty quick. Mini cheeseburger and garlic fries were my selections today and I was expecting to be blown away based on all the reviews but that didn't happen.

We were going to sit upstairs but there was a significant unpleasant odor and it also felt quite hot. Turned around and went back downstairs to find a table. 

The burger was decent. It was plenty greasy and the toppings tasted fresh. I had a few bites that tasted quite good but overall I've had much better - even at this very reasonable price point. On to the fries, I love me some garlic but damn, this was like garlic with a side of fries. The garlic was overwhelming and overpowering. 

Check it out of you want some cheap eats but keep your expectations in check.
author: Sejal B.

description: look, i know i said sweet maples got the best burgers but, the best burger combo is right here. i met russell west brooke here once. if u want a shake and fries and a burgers for a reasonable sf price, maybe look somewhere else..... u might drop like $40 if u bring a date here which is a lil crazy but i'm a lil loco and u know, this the spot. the shake here is always tasty and sometimes u gotta 1v1 for a seat but it's all a part of the experience. also, idk y but the cashiers always gotta attitude and it make me feel like i'm back in brooklyn. i like that sht. so u know i always tip them mean i'm spending about $50 when i bring my girl here for sum fkn burgers but i like it. thank u guys, be back soon
author: Jose S.

description:
This is the best! The place is very clean and you have a code to the bathroom at the bottom of your receipt. The staff members are super friendly, nice, and, helpful. It's rare but I feel like they were really making my experience enjoyable and comfortable. 

They cleaned the table next to me right away. I asked for a cup to go because I wasn't able to finish the water in a glass. I'm becoming way more environmentally conscious now. Anyway, they are very responsive and polite.

I got the mini burger with aged cheddar and it's the best combo I've found yet!  Ohhhh the flavor!!  While it is a chain, this is the best one I've been to so far. The price is unbeatable. I have nothing negative to say about this place.
author: Lana W.

description: This place makes deliciously juicy burgers and has a good variety of options. They are busy at all times but despite the long lines you get your food quickly. Shakes are good here too. I would say these burgers are a bit heavier than an In N Out burger but not as heavy as Five Guys so a nice middle ground.
author: Schelly Y.

description:
Their burgers are so good!  That's an understatement. 

It is bomb!  

It is time to get messy when wrapping your hands around these burgers. 

They have added a new ingredient to the topping of the burger and that is an egg!  It makes it oh, so delicious!  Pack everything into this reasonably sized burger and the taste is phenomenal. 

Have it with a milkshake, fries, pickles on the side as condiments and the combo makes a hefty meal.

Super Duper Burgers for the win!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I had to rely on Yelp for figuring out my vegan options at Super Duper (get the veggie burger but no secret sauce and get it on ciabatta bread). 

I wish they made the secret sauce vegan (would swapping mayo with vegan mayo or whatever it is be noticeable in a blind taste test? I doubt it) - but more so I wish they labeled vegan options. 

The burger was pretty good, but not in the top 10 I've had, so that's A-OK but not Super Duper to me.
author: Stuart F.

description:
Why 4 stars? Because this is my favorite fast-casual spot in the area

   ---   ---   ---

I say that like I'm some kind of an expert on all things SOMA/Union Square, which I'm not. I've been 6 times in 4 years, so I do know the area more than most people who live across the country. Super Duper definitely fills a void in an area that seems to be dominated my less casual eateries. 

It's in the same realm as Shake Shack, or you could even a higher-end Five Guys. Regardless of how it's classified, it's a damn good burger for the price and convenience. It does seem to be crazy busy every time I walk by, so I'm sure empty chairs are hard to come by at peak hours. We found an empty table in the corner upstairs.

I'll definitely be back! After wanting to try Super Duper for years, I finally made it in, and they did not disappoint!
author: Brett N.

description:
Love waiting in long but fast lines? 
Enjoy being stared at by people that saved 2 tables for their peers?
Do you like bottomless homemade sour+spicy pickles?
Walk into any Super Duper and that's what you'll find.
Wait, did I mention they serve burgers?

I was attracted to this joint because of the soft serve sign posted outside. They are known for that as well but that is not what I ordered today. I ordered the mini burger (1 4oz patty) which came with lettuce, tomato, onion and their special sauce. I also asked for an organic egg added on top (about an extra $1 or so) with a side of garlic fries. As I waited for my food to come, I noticed that there were way too many people to the number of tables and chairs they provided. Strangers were muzzled up against each other and many awkward customers had to shyly ask multiple groups if their chairs were being used. Unfortunately, many stood up to enjoy this deliciousness. But that didn't stop them. 

My number buzzed and I finally got to try this delicious beast. The egg looked freshly cracked with a runny yolk. The thinly sliced tomatoes and lettuce made a great blanket to hold up the patty. The patty was thick (compared to other fast food joints). The burger buns were warm but thick and springy. The sauce was an absolute NEED for this burger. And I must say, the moment I placed my bun on top of the egg and watched the yolk run down like a waterfall was the best moment of this experience. (WARNING: If you are not into messy burgers, foods, hands, hair, shirt, pants, etc. don't bother ordering the egg, this shit was a fucking mess.) The burger was delicious upon first bite, but getting all the sauce swiped across my face was not cutting it for me. I ended up using a fork to eat my burger... so sad.. but still so delicious.
The garlic fries were meh. Pretty soggy, pretty garlicy, and somewhat cheesy.
They also gave out free samples of donuts!! WHOOT!

I left this place with burger sauce on my shirt, cheese and garlic in my hair, pickle juice on my pants and the regret of not buying a cone. Next time cone... I'll get you next time...
author: Linda K.

description: So. Good. Easily my favorite quick burger in SF. The mini is good if your not starving and the super burger is incredible when you're hungry. Good fries, good beer on tap, good prices. Highly recommend.
author: Chris B.

description: Still love the burgers here. Cheap, greasy, good.
author: Alton Y.

description: Went to sf in 2014 and fell in love with the food at Superduper. Now I'm back in 2017 and it was one of the first stop I added on my list of things todo. Happy to say the food was as good as I remember it. I'm leaving in a few days but will visit once more before heading to the airport
author: Calle W.

description: It was recommended by a friend, so I gave it a try. I had high expectations based on the recommendation, so probably that impacted my review. It is good, but nothing to write home about. Not as good as Shake Shack or The Habit. But service is great. There is good offering with drinks and ice cream.
author: Angel V.

description:
GIMME GIMME MY GARLIC FRIESSS!

Honestly, the best garlic fries I have ever had hehehhe. the closest super duper burgers is about a 30-minute walk from my place.

I woke up the other morning and was craving the garlic fries. (the burgers are super duper good too but i had just woken up so i didnt have a big enough appetite for a burger)

anyway, woke my boyfriend up and kept whining about wanting garlic fries. he wanted to sleep him and ignored me. so me being the stubborn girl i am, walked the 30 minutes to super duper burgers and bought not just one.... but TWO... garlic fries. i was sooo happy, literally skipped my way back to my house. 

and as i was eating it, the super duper good smell woke up my boyfriend and so he ate half.. then i got mad because i really wish i had gotten three....
author: Alex C.

description:
Very nice burger. I like this even better than In N Out at home. The patty is so juicy it looked as if i was drooling while eating. A messy business indeed, so avoid this place for your first date. The mini burger just have one patty while the super burger has two. I also tried the vanilla shake. Not as sweet as Johnny Rockets', which i like. Overall, thumbs up for the food.

The floor was sticky though, and i thought the restaurant was too dim. Minus one star.
author: Zuhadi Z.

description:
It should be a crime to give this place anything less than 4 stars.

From the title alone, I expected this place to be an average burger place with a family owned and run kind of feel. To my surprise, it wasn't! 

The restaurant is very modern with dim lighting. It's definitely very busy during lunch (11:30 - 1:30) so you'll be lucky to find seating/your own table. I'm crazy about their loft - I don't need a reason.

The food is great!  I had the chicken sandwich with bacon and garlic fries. Everything was well cooked and seasoned. The chicken had the perfect amount of juiciness. My bread was a little burnt on the edges but I didn't mind. The portions were great! If you come here you need to get the garlic fries! I've made garlic fries in the past. From that experience, I'm pretty sure their seasoning is freshly made (as well as their pickles)


You'd be a fool not to try this place at least once. I'm definitely coming back!

Additional comment: Is it me or does the guy that work there look like Paul Kim? I know he's not but the RESEMBLANCE! Google Paul Kim music if you don't know what I'm talking about haha!
author: Ida H.

description: Great food. Limited seating. While everyone was walking around looking for a seat, one of the cooks was on break for a good 30 minutes taking up a table for 4! Maddening!
author: Dia M.

description:
This is one of the nice burger joints in San Francisco.  Not a lot of veggie options.  I tried veggie burger (surprise!) and garlic fries.  It is very flavorful and tastes very good.  You can't customize the burger unlike five guys burger but, that's ok.  The out of the box one satisfies my preference very well.  There are pickles on the counter that you can add for anything you order.  Delivery speed is good.

This place is mostly busy.  After all, it is a great burger joint :)

Convenient location.  Decent ambience. Good food.  Worth trying!
author: Srinath S.

description: Quick lunch after a day of travel and in between here and there. Chicken sandwich was on point - slightly spicy with chipotle mayo and fresh unique bun. Friendly smiles from everyone and Journey on the juke box. Thumbs up b
author: Karen M.

description:
The burgers here are amazing,, the customer service is top notch..  Great to.see Michael wave to us as we walked in for the second.time and Samantha was smiles.from cheek to cheek..

Music was awesome
author: Ismael A.

description: My 5 star rating stands for a delicious breakfast. The breakfast combo ( breakfast sandwich, coffee, and donut) is THE BEST! The freshest egg, perfectly toasted English muffin with a tasty sausage patty, and cheese.   The house made donut is really good together with the mild flavored  Four Barrel coffee.
author: Carolyn L.

description: Came in knowing this is the best burger place in town, but still wasn't expecting this to be that good. Probably on par if not better than shake shack and smash burger on my all time "quick" burger place! Also remember to add an egg on top for some extra flavor!!
author: Jensen K.

description: Love the Super Burger...slice your pickles and put them on please.  Hold the tomato.   Delicious.  Sec better than In n Out...on par with Shake Shack. Juicy!
author: Jason M.

description:
"Can I get a Super Burger with cheese?"
"Sure.  You can get that with or without cheese."
*blank stare* "Umm...yeah with cheese."
"Yes...you can get that with or without cheese."
*blank stare and look over at the other cashier*  "I want it with cheese..."

LOL.  I think that cashier must have been new and flustered.  The name of this joint makes you curious to know what the food tastes like.  The burgers are good and don't taste like any regular fast food burger.  It isn't the best ever, but definitely better than any fast food chain out there. I also ordered a cookies and creme AND strawberry shake in one.  That was delicious!
author: Rae Marie Y.

description: I'd heard of this burger joint before I even moved to San Francisco, so naturally it was on my list of food places to check out and all I can say is that it did not disappoint. I got the super burger and garlic fries. Their burger patties are cooked medium so they're nice and juicy and the super burger comes with two of them, so you're getting double the protein and your gains will not suffer. The garlic fries were exactly what you'd expect: fries with garlic seasoning and cheese. They were crispy but soft on the inside, ie. perfectly prepared. I'd highly recommend this place and I'll be giving it another visit in the future.
author: Adam F.

description:
I stayed maybe a block away from Super Duper Burgers while I was in SF. I arrived at my hotel around 12:30 pm and immediately knew I needed to find a place to grab a quick bite. It was just before 1 on a weekday when I arrived and I was concerned it would be a zoo. It was definitely busy but I decided to take my food back to my hotel so I wasn't too concerned about seating.

I went with the mini burger combo (single burger, fires, and a fountain drink) and my total was around $11. The girl at the register and the man who gave me my food were both super friendly and seemed genuinely happy to be there, which is always a nice touch. 

I grabbed some of their pickles before heading out because you can't go wrong with pickles (especially home made pickles!). The size of the meal was perfect for me. I was super hungry but felt very satisfied. The burger was cooked perfectly (it seems medium is their "default") and I really liked whatever sauce they added. The pickles were unique (in a great way), too. The fries were still crispy and hot when I got back to my hotel room so they were clearly super freshly made.

This location could not have been more convenient for me and was a super satisfying meal at a great price.
author: Kristina K.

description: Went back again after my first review. This place is actually good. basic burger w fries and dips with icecream or a shake on the side with trendy surroundings. The buns are really good. Lol nothing that's gourmet about it but who really expects that's from a burger joint. I always get the veggie patty; so I can't speak on the taste of the beef patty. Enjoy!
author: Yvonne H.

description: I've eaten at some of the best burger joints in the world, and I must say...this place ranks near the TOP!!!  Had the Super Duper Burger w/ egg, portobello, & avocado...A-MA-ZING!!! Flavorful & juicy...and accompanied by a nice glass of red wine...the perfect lunch!
author: John D.

description:
for some reason my review was deleted saying I didn't eat here? we came here after we landed in San fran! was our first meal in san fran lol, walking distance from our hotel the sir francis drake. I only mentioned the east coast version of this place since they are the same owners..... just so odd to have a review deleted because of that? doesn't mean I didn't come here lol. so I like the other version better whatever.... 

anyway the seating is cool just definitely more aggressive bums here then we're used to. Never seen a dude beg for food and lean over our table to keep asking the other people for food..... I had a mini cheeseburger and it was okay. just prefer the other place lol..... nice place to stop into for a quick lunch and they take credit cards unlike another burger place in the area...... I also wish I had gotten the dipping sauce for fries but my darling hubs didn't read his text messages until after he ordered and came to sit down.....
author: Crystal P.

description:
YUMS!!  I've heard about Super Duper for a while, and have been meaning to go for a while, and only finally made it this weekend. Glad I did!

Burgers are super fresh, grilled to order, and not pre-formed patties.  Very tasty.  I got their Mini Burger (4 oz patty) w/ Cheese and everything on it (lettuce, tomatoes, special sauce) and grilled onions. Perfect portion size! Then my friends and I shared Garlic Fries with 3 Dipping Sauces.  I don't think I've ever had such good garlic fries!  These ones actually tasted like garlic, not just topped with garlic bits!

Another plus are their house made pickles! I'm not a huge pickle fan, but these pickles were crisp and yummy (and not just because they were free).

Can't wait to go back!
author: Audrey C.

description:
One of the best burger joints in the West Coast! I'm always down for a super duper burger.

Mini Burger (with grilled onions) + garlic fries (melty cheesy goodness on top). I also love helping myself to a couple trays of pickles from their pickle jars.
author: Lauren K.

description: This Bay Area chain makes one tasty cheeseburger! Mini cheeseburger came in just under $7. It's 4oz and comes with lettuce, tomato, thin sliced red onion and super sauce. It was very juicy and flavorful! For my first time, I had a great experience and I'd definitely recommend checking this spot out if you're in San Francisco and are wanting a burger. Also don't miss out on the free pickles, they are slightly spicy and went perfectly with the burger.
author: Matt D.

description:
I stopped here for lunch looking for a cheap meal. I paid 11.42 for a 4oz burger ( lettuce, tomato, sauce, and onion) plain fries, and a lemonade. The lemonade was warm, fries were bland, and burger had the very end of the tomato, and one tiny leaf of lettuce. I felt short-changed. 

You still have to clean up after yourself (and before yourself sometimes) so I can not rate the service that highly. 

The music is nice. 

I don't really recommend this restaurant.  I won't be eating here again.
author: Drago F.

description:
Nice burgers & location.
The line wasn't bad at all on a Saturday at noon. There was lots of room to eat upstairs, even outside (but not enough stools!!).

I personally had the vegetarian burger, made with chickpeas. It wasn't full of flavors like other veggie burgers can be but my friends' regular burgers were very good.

Love the homemade bread, garlic fries (yummmm!) and pickles!
author: Leslie S.

description:
Popped into the place for a quick lunch with my friends. 
No service, you'll have to pick up your drinks and food. 
I was extremely skeptical about the veggie burger but it was amazing - a corn and black bean patty with optional cheese, jalapeños etc. 
The garlic fries were also pretty great. 
One of my friends had the regular meat burger which he loved as well - no complaints there. 
A must visit if you're in the city looking for a quick lunch.
author: Malyatha K.

description:
Better than In-N-Out. There, I said it.

Boozy milkshakes bring ME to the yard. Don't know about ALL the boys, but I can only speak for myself.

Four stars not five because it's not quite as clean, and it's a bit louder and busier than the Castro location, but it's downtown, I get it... no tea no shade... but still docking a star because sometimes I like it a little less LOUD.
author: Sean B.

description:
Came here because we were in the area and looking for a quick lunch. Saw it was close and had over 2k reviews so decided to check it out. Had the double burger with everything on it (including jalapenos), garlic fries, and soda (combo). 

The burger was pretty good, maybe a little greasy for me. Might have to do with the fact I ordered the double? Jalapenos were a great addition. 

Garlic fries were also decent, but I feel like when you're in the bay area your garlic fry game should be pretty strong since the competition is fierce. I wish it had more garlic flavor (I didn't even notice any actual garlic on the fries?) The cheese on top was tasty though.

My favorite part of this place was actually the house made pickles. I'm not normally a pickle guy, but theirs were really crunchy and fresh, and also not too sour (my preference). More like a sweet-sour thing. 

Definitely better than an average fast food burger, but for a kind of fast-casual burger place, I still think TrueBurger is #1.
author: Eric B.

description:
tl;dr Slightly overpriced for the burgers. Go for the garlic fries. Expect to wait 10-12 min during peak hours if you dine in. Suggestion: Go for the garlic fries and then run to the nearest In-N-Out if you see it.

Full review:
I went to Super Duper for late lunch on a Thursday afternoon. It was busy and though service was swift, food cake really late. I had to wait 10 minutes after ordering to dine in. 

I had the Mini with cheese and bacon, and regular toppings. Nothing to rave about the burger. It's sloppy at best. Presentation was lazy (I suspect it's because of the traffic) and the actual food is just like any other burgers you would expect, at a cheaper price point. $5.50 for basic, $1 for bacon and $0.50 for cheese.

I also ordered the garlic fries at $3.25. Those are bomb. One star extra for that. They have a Mexican mix cheese topping for the fries. It was glorious.

Yes, I may be a bit harsh on ratings, but In-N-Out is much more superior in terms of pricing ($8 for a scrumptious meal), taste and service.
author: Justin V.

description:
My 5 Easy Steps to a Super Duper Experience at Super Duper Burger.

Step 1: Order My Burger.
I order the mini burger and ask for cheese. Then like a pro, I ask them to add that free range egg too. I can ball out an extra $1.50 for an aesthetic AND nutritious upgrade for my burger.

Step 2: Make it a combo!
I get the Garlic Fries but pass on the dipping sauces option. I won't need it. Then I order a Cookies&Cream milkshake and ask them to SPIKE it like a volleyball. As a law-abiding citizen, I also show them my ID so that they know that I am indeed over 21 years of age.

Step 3: Find a Seat!
I like sitting upstairs because walking up the steps helps to burn off a portion of the 2350972057 calories I am about to intake. But at night, I find that sitting outside is more fun. Laughs and High Fives won't intensely echo if you're outside. 

Step 4: Pimp My Burger
The reason why I don't need the dipping sauces for the fries is because I'll be stuffing my burger with the Garlic Fries. I make sure to get all those cheese and garlic crumbs straight into my burger too.

Step 5: Social Media
Giving big props to Super Duper for their interior lighting because it's PERFECT for Instagram. Snap your picture, post it, and enjoy your epic burger as you watch your 'Likes' pour in : )
(No kidding, i got over 60 likes from a Super Duper post #CareerHigh)

The only caveat is that Super Duper is a bit pricey for what it is. If you go through my 5 easy steps, your bill can easily run up to 16 or 17 bucks. It's worth it, but it's definitely a jump from Mickey D's.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Update:
It's better to try a locations best product:the one they are known for to give the better rating. In this case I went for the double patty burger with bacon-Delicious! it put them at the top of my list for burgers. The flavor was intense,fresh. Bun perfect and fries matched perfectly.


Older:The location is in the heart of the financial and tourist district,so be advised by 12:00PM the line is out the door. The burgers live up to their reputation,fresh flavor,delicious fries. I ordered the 4oz mini with cheese,a sure bet. Also they have good customer service. I would certainly go back..the burger space is extremely crowded and its a challenge to stand out in. Super Duper burgers is a great choice for anyone looking for a tasty gourmet burger.
author: Jimmy L.

description: Good burger with many options for add-ons such as avocado, bacon, and egg. The seasoned patty reminds me of the burgers at Shake Shack. Long lunch lines even at 2pm on a weekday. Mini burger is a single patty which was a good size for me. It was a tough decision choosing between garlic fries & cookies & cream shake. I opted for the latter which was ok, not the best shake I've had. For my next visit, I already have my eyes set on the garlic fries which looked really good!
author: Ruby C.

description:
Love their garlic fries! I couldn't stop eating these, and they went great with the burger. They complimented each other so well! I am currently salivating at the thought of those white cheddar (?) garlic-infused fries, so good.

Order is served in a cute tin tray, and friendly service.
author: Sara T.

description: The burgers were great, but are they super duper great? Mmmeh. They remind me of shake shack, but with perhaps a better menu? Burger is juicy but greasy. As I said, tasted good, but nothing outstanding. I really liked their separate pickle jar that I could take for my liking. I'd say go here just so you have and you can judge for yourself. I do think in n out is the better of the burger joint choices.
author: Aya P.

description:
Burgers are seriously one of the best I've ever had, they aren't kidding when it comes to a juicy beef patty!! Self-serving sides such as pickles was pretty neat, they're pretty good too!!! Burger is definitely fresh and so delicious! Love the toppings too, GRILLED ONIONS!!!! 

Garlic fries was the highlight however, of my visit. You definitely get that garlic kick in your crisp fries and that cheese?? I'm kind of a cheese snob and get disgusted by processed cheese (nothing beats the flavour of incubated cheese), but you're getting real aged cheese on your fries!!! I have literally returned back here solely for fries a couple of times, because they're just THAT good. I don't recall ever having fries as delicious as their Garlic Fries.
author: Irene L.

description:
Simply the Best Burger of My Life.  I am a serious INO fan, but Super Duper blows away all of the competition.  We live in the East Bay and it would be worth driving into the City just for these burgers. PLEASE SUPER DUPER OPEN IN THE EAST BAY!!!   

The meat is incredibly tasty, perfectly cooked and juicy.  The bun is fresh and tasty.  The fries are good - we had one order of regular and one order of garlic/cheese.  Both were excellent - but I did expect the cheese to be a little more melted, but it didn't matter.  They are very garlicky (in a good way) but we were glad we had plain fries to balance it out.
author: Michele O.

description:
Awesome juicy tasty burger. Clean and well lit location with a mezzanine that sits about 16 people. 

Dropped by for an early dinner and was very happy about our choice. It's just right around the corner from our hotel. Fast service, buss your own table kind of place. Friendly staff and totally helpful with their menu. It's pretty simple. You order, pay and they give you a buzzer and you go ahead and find your own table. Five minute wait and we're enjoying our burger"

 I was too full to try their soft serve and shake. But  judging from the the pic alone it did look promising enough to try next time when in the area.
author: Janet D.

description:
Came here with some friends after a long night of drinking on a weekday.

Dont' really remember the food, but I know we were really loud and I destroyed the entire burger so it must have been a great experience.
author: Mario P.

description:
Super Duper Burger is a high-mediocre quality burger. It's definitely better than a fast food burger, but not as good as a gourmet burger place. The prices are a little high given the quality and considering you don't get fries with it. A super duper burger is $7.75 and a mini burger is $5.50. 

The patties are juicy but there isn't anything really special about the burger itself. The milkshakes are also good, but overpriced for their size. The service was fast, especially considering I was there during the Super Bowl 50 celebration. Overall I give Super Duper burger 3 patties out of 5.
author: Chris M.

description: I really like the burger here, one of the best one I had. Also the garlic fries are the bomb. I love the garlic fries with the three dipping sauce. Also don't forget to get the shake!
author: Robert L.

description:
Consistently delicious! I have only had their minis with cheese and everything on top, which are pretty big in my opinion. Garlic fries have the perfect amount of garlic and greasiness.

Jars of pickles!! I only know of Super Duper and Pearl's that provide jars of all-you-can-eat pickles and that is enough to keep my loyalty!

In terms of fast food burger-tastiness, I'd rank Pearl's at the top, followed by Five Guys and Super Duper. But this Super Duper is only two blocks from where I live so they win!
author: Yan F.

description:
Worth to try!
The bread is slightly sweet and goes very well with the pate.
Don't forget to order garlic fries.
Love the chocolate shake as well.
author: Tomoko S.

description: I loved the burger, fries, and the vanilla shake here! I am from the east coast, and it reminded me of Shake Shack. The line was long but it was worth it! Will go again when I am craving burgers and fries.
author: Erika S.

description: Their burgers were good but what captured my heart were the garlic fries! Stopped by on a visit from orange county and I'll be craving these fries until the next time I'm visiting sf!
author: Abby D.

description: My new favorite burger joint! Stopped by the other day just to check it out and was floored by the efficiency of the staff. The line I waited in went by quickly and I waited no longer than five minutes for my meal. In regards to the food, everything tastes just right! Milkshake was great, garlic fries are especially good*, and overall, I had a wonderful experience and will definitely recommend them to my friends and family.
author: Randy D.

description:
Dear Super Duper Burgers,

Thank you for your cheerful, friendly staff who did not seem deterred by the long line of people in want of their burger dinners. Thank you for their prompt attention to each table immediately after a customer leaves it open so it is clean for the next customer. Thank you for their efficiency in keeping the line moving quickly.

Thank you for the tasty, not-too-overwhelmingly garlicky fries. Thank you for having perfected the balance of aged cheddar cheese and garlic that made them such a treat with every bite. They were one of the fries that were worth savoring. 

Thank you for the creamy, smooth organic soft serve swirl ice cream. Both the vanilla and the chocolate were delicious. Thank you for the fun effort of trying to (and failing most wonderfully) gracefully eat the chocolate-dipped vanilla ice cream. The giggle of delight from the daughter marveling at the sight of her otherwise impeccable mother struggling with a cone of ice cream is well worth the price of my dignity.

Most importantly, thank you for giving me faith in veggie burgers. Your veggie burger -- with the lovely combination of cucumber, hummus, and avocado (extra fee) -- is the first veggie burger that did not make me feel bad for vegetarians who can only eat veggie burgers in a burger place. The veggie patty did not remind me of eating a soaked piece of cardboard. Paired with your special pickles, it was a true burger delight. Thank you, really.

Gratefully yours,
Clarice
author: Clarice O.

description:
So, not long after writing this review, a manager reached out to offer me some gift certificates.  Cool, right?  

Yea, except it was a half ass attempt and yet ANOTHER bait and switch.  3 weeks later after replying and giving my address, I've received nothing.  I mean damn, if you're gonna try to win back customers, then do it.  Instead, you've made yourself look like shit, again.  

Even if you gave me a gift card at this point, I would not come back.  I bet Super Duper probably doesn't care to lose a few customers, hence the attitudes of the workers.

I'm glad these reviews live FOREVER on the internet.  Well deserved.

Another lame experience.  See the pictures attached of his olive branch attempt on January 6th and his reactive message after this post on January 27th.

Ed, you really need to be proactive, not just "oh shit! Need to type up some rebuttals!"  Hope other people didn't experience the same thing, but would not be surprised if my case is one of many.
author: Phillip L.

description: So it took me overnight to decide if I wanted to even write a review, but as a good patron I feel it's my duty to write a review on my experience so that others are aware. So based on the reviews I decided to give this place a try since I'm a burger person. 3 words for you Too Damn Greasy. I couldn't even eat it as the grease over powered the burger.
author: Koby G.

description: YUMMMMM! great juicy burgers and complimentary homemade pickles! Give their ice cream a try, so so good.
author: Stacy L.

description:
Bomb ass burger alert! I am soooooooooo glad I was brought here for a birthday gathering recently. We were having a hard time choosing an eatery (a problem that usually thrives in big group hangouts). A friend suggested this place, and we ended up choosing here really really last minute. That friend knew what's up because my mind and stomach was blown away by the juicy scrumptious burger and cheesy garlic fries. 

Being a total noob and inability to choose from the menu, I searched on yelp to see what's good. Thanks to the awesome pictures and reviews from fellow yelpers, I knew exactly what to get. 

I ordered the mini burger with cheese, bacon, avocado, egg, and jalapeno peppers. Without onions and tomato. Also got the garlic fries to share with a friend. I was worried that the mini burger would not make me full, but boy was I wrong! I've never had an egg on a burger before! But I wasn't too worried since I love egg. My burger was gigantic!! It came with a knife and a fork!! So that's saying something. I was wondering why I was the only one who received that but after comparing the sizes between my friends and mine, I knew why. I didn't even bother using the knife and fork. A burger is something to be eaten with your bare hands and to bite down and let all the juice flow down your hands, to be licked later. And that is exactly what I did. Although I did struggle fitting the first few bites in my mouth, I still managed to devour the entire burger with burger juice dripping down my hands the entire time. It's all a part of the experience and what makes eating burgers more enjoyable, in my opinion. The garlic fries were also amazing as well. An order is big enough to share between 2... 3 is a little bit too much. There will probably be some hand slapping going on if you share between 3 people. 

My friends just got the regular burgers with no additional add-ons. Honestly, I think that is a little boring hahaha. The cashier asked me if I've been here before after hearing my order. I told him it was my first time, and he was surprised because usually the regulars know how to customize their burgers like I did. And I brought up Yelp. 

They also have a jar of pickles that they made/grown/homemade, located by the fountain drink station. Also, there are some peppers for all my spicy lovers, if the jalapeno isn't enough hahaha. 

Parking is definitely the most horrendous thing ever; obviously it's because this location is literally located in SF downtown and what crazy soul loves driving in that mess of a traffic. Honestly, it is the only thing preventing me from coming here again. That and the drive because SF is so far from east bay. 

Definitely check this place out because it truly is worth it! =) five stars, here you go!
author: Alison K.

description:
Great place for a quick snack right by the bart train.

I came in alone and got good service and tasty food. They also carry well tasting beers.

Points for taste, service, location, waiting time.
author: Martin H.

description: I like Super Dupers easy menu. Pick burger by size or chicken sandwich with chipotle sauce. Fries. Drink. Dessert. Also, at this location, breakfast. Today I ordered a chicken sandwich, and they should label it w/ spicy chipotle because it was spicier than I would have liked. Chipotle always seems mild to me. French fries are good, but not as good as Inn N Outs. Shakes are fantastic. You can order vanilla or chocolate or both, and if you get a Super Nice Cashier, you can order a Neopolitan shake (they add strawberry topping with vanilla, chocolate blended). Perfect mix of sweet chocolate and sugary strawberry. And for those stressful days, you can order a Special Milkshake (yes with vodka!). The Castro restaurant definitely serves it, not sure here. Take out orders can take almost 10 minutes due to the FiDi workday crowds and tourists.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Quite possibly the best garlic fries I've ever had. Just the right amount of garlic (although is there such a thing as too much garlic?) and cheese, and it was well coated from top to bottom. Their burgers unfortunately leave a little something to be desired afterwards. There's nothing wrong with them and they're still pretty good, but if I'm going to pay $8+ for a burger sans fries, I want something a little more complex than your average burger, although the quality of ingredients is up to par. I'd come back (and I have) solely for the fries.

BONUS: Compliementary house-made pickles!
author: Evelyn C.

description:
Greasy deliciousness. 

The burgers are stacked thin patty style. I'd prefer a thick burger that takes a bit longer to char grill. Garlic fries were a waste of money. The flavor of the burger is the only saving grace, even if it turns the wrapping paper clear with grease.
author: Nick F.

description: THE GARLIC FRIES! I love their garlic fries and I have to get them whenever I'm in the area. I've been to this location but also the location in SJ at the Valley Fair food court. Their burgers are juicy, I just don't like that they're small, but it's worth it. I brought my boyfriend to this place since he had never tried it and he goes on occasion now, since he actually lives in SF. I'll continue to come to Super Duper Burgers and their other locations.
author: Diana V.

description:
My expectations from the outside were on par with another chain fast food burger shop. Only, there had to be some reason why it was a solid 4 stars on Yelp...

Turns out the masses speak the truth! I wasn't blown away by the food (personally, I'd take an In-n-Out burger over it any day), but the design, atmosphere, and service makes for a great experience overall. The high ceiling allows for a second floor seating area, which you can access via the stairs below a giant wood-paneled cow. The feel is very clean, modern, and hip. It's the little things like classic shake glasses (even the water cups are actual glasses) and smiling cashiers that lend Super Duper its inviting presence. My cashier asked if it was my first time eating here and gave me a huge "Welcome!" when I affirmed.

Alright. So I lied a little bit earlier. The Garlic Fries ALMOST knocked my ankle socks off. Even if you're like me and tend to avoid cheese whenever we can help it, the fries manage to soak up all its good aromas. Add a little chipotle sauce and - perfect flavor. 

Now, you'd expect that the bathrooms might be the one place where a busy fast food joint might start cracking under pressure. Not so - the two unisex bathrooms are large and pretty much empty other than the bright orange paint on the walls. Which lays bare all surfaces for inspection. Everything seemed to be in good condition, and even though I'm not one for air dryers, I'd happily take a Dyson Airblade over others.
author: Helen S.

description:
Mini Burger + Garlic Fries + Great White Beer = $13

That is the equation for a 4 star lunch spot, in the FiDi.  Super Duper is also super greasy, so I can't hit this place up too often, but for the occasional old school, burger and beer it really hits the spot.  The burger and garlic fries both are packed with flavor.  In all honesty, though, this place has Great White on tap and that's the reason I came in the first time and a large reason that I'll continue to come in. Yum!!!
author: Pablo O.

description:
They make some darn juicy burgers that tastes fresh and satisfying. Their garlic fries are bomb as well, so much melted cheese and that lasting garlicky breath is well worth it. Then, there's also that milkshake, omg the cookies n cream milkshake is off the hook! 

I give this place 5 stars because of customer service. I dropped my glass of water and it spilled everywhere, on the fries, on the table and on the floor. Two workers were quick to help me out. They told me that it was okay, and I tried to help them clean the space but they were just like 'No, don't worry.. this is my job!' They gave me a towel to clean myself off and even gave me a new order of garlic fries FOR FREE. Man, that was one of the best customer service experience I've had. Kudos to both of you workers!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Went to visit San Francisco for the weekend. Arrived to our hotel around 8am and after getting settled in we needed to eat. We wanted something quick since it was around 11am already with 0 food in our system so we searched for a good burger joint near our hotel. 

From the pictures and the reviews we were sold. We got our son ready and in the stroller and enjoyed the walk to the place. Found it easily and instantly liked the place. Everything looked clean and the food menu was simple and sounded great. 

We ordered burgers and regular fries. The wait? Maybe 3 mins MAX. By the time we filled our soda glasses and sat the food was ready. The burgers were DELICIOUS absolutely loved them and juiciness of the meat. I hate pickles but my husband said the pickles were delicious also good crunch and flavor (they have those on the side not in the burger so you have to go get them yourself) 

All in all we were both happy with our first meal in San Francisco. 
(Our son isn't a big fan of meat so he ate some fruit from another place, but he loved the fries from here)
author: Wendy F.

description: Wow. I had the feeling this would be great based on what I read, and it lives up to the hype! The burgers were just perfection. The "mini" was plenty for even my teenager. I had the garlic fries which were amazing but plan to have garlic mouth for 24 hours. The cookies and cream shake my son had was delicious. Fun ambience and good service. #MomSonDoSanFran
author: Molly M.

description:
I feel like San Francisco has a healthy selection of burgers from healthy to over the top decadence. I also think we have some of the best in the world. Super Duper could be a contender on a global scale. 

I know it might seem like a stretch but here's my reasoning. 
Local fresh ingredients that are high quality and it's super tasty.
Just the right balance of bun/produce/meat/sauce ratios. 
Keeping the menu simple keeps the focus on whats important, bacon or no bacon!

While it's a more healthy (still a burger though) it's got the perfect grease  to bun saturation level so that it drips just the right amount and melts into a gooey mass of deliciousness. I am amused a bit by the history here, and it's just what I heard so I could be wrong about this. Guy has a successful small chain of Italian restaurants in the bay area but is become unsatisfied with the fact it has strayed from his vision of a healthy dinning experience. Guy sells off chain and opens a new chain of burger joints. Thank you very much Sir, the city is in debt to you.
author: Ben M.

description:
11:37am 02/24/2016

Walked in and walked right out. This place is in need of a healt code violation.

An employee picked up a stack of metal trays right by the soda machine and used it to compress the trash in the compost bin. I thought he was going to wash these trays afterwards. That did not happen.

He just placed the trays behind the counter. These trays were used immediately for new orders.

The owners of this place need to check the cameras and fire the person who did this.
author: Moe S.

description:
This spot is so conveniently located right next to my work, how can I not make it my regular spot? If I'm feeling like a healthy something, I could get chicken or a salad, and when I want to indulge ( and let's face it, it's more often than not ) I can get a juicy burger with all the goodies. My usual is a mini burger with avocado and Jack. The garlic fries are very flavorful and definitely worth the extra cash.

One thing that keeps me coming back is the music I can really groove to and the friendly staff. Zarin is always around and very friendly ! He remembers you and is great at conversation while still staying very efficient and making everything run smoothly. The packers are always smiling and friendly and the ambiance is one of general good times. 

I haven't stayed to eat yet, but I might have to change that in the future when it's not during a busy hour !
author: Christine H.

description:
Came here for lunch and it was super duper busy haha...

Although the line was pretty long, it goes pretty fast since there were three registers open. The only thing that sucks about the menu is that the lettering is super tiny and for almost blind people, like myself, it is kind of hard to read what was on the menu.

I ordered a regular burger with bacon and got garlic fries and regular fries to try them out. They give you a buzzer and you pick up your food once it buzzes. It took about 5 minutes for our burgers to be made.

The patty was very juicy and cooked perfectly. Having an overdone patty is HUGE no no! The bacon was cooked PERFECTLY also. It wasn't too crispy or burnt, cooked enough so when you take a bite of the burger the whole bacon doesn't come out with it. The bacon wasn't the cheap thin bacon that you get at other fast food joints either, it was thick and had plenty of pieces so you get a piece in ever bite. The burger was  big, big enough  that I couldn't finish all of it. 

Now that I think of it, all of the ingredients were not your cheap ingredients like other fast food joints. From the cheddar to the patty, everything tasted more high end.

The garlic fries were pretty good, kind of wish they put a little more garlic. Next time I go, I will try a shake!
author: Jerrica N.

description:
I wanted to like it so bad!
Unfortunately, the patty is flavorless and undercooked. The whole burger itself is soggy and plain even though I ordered everything in it plus pickes. The fries were good and staff was nice so I gave it 2 stars
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Organic, grass-fed beef burgers...yes please! I tried the mini super duper burger (1 patty) with garlic fries and an ice cream swirl. The burger was very flavorful however it was really, really greasy. As I ate towards the bottom of the burger, which was tightly packed, the grease had made that crispy burger bun soggy. More attention to the greasy detail before they plate the food would be nice. However, the garlic fries were so full of fresh garlic, parmesan cheese & parsley that I'm sure the person across the street would be blown away by the post-fries breath. The fries were crispy which held up nicely against the heavy toppings. The ice cream swirl was refreshing and didn't feel like you were eating anything too heavy. Great for a hot day! Oh, and their right outside of the Montgomery BART entrance. If you forgot to eat while you were perusing San Fran this is a filling & convenient little stop.
author: Lolita B.

description:
As a vegan, I got the lettuce wrap with the veggie patty, hummus, cucumber, and tomatoes. And awesomeness. There's something about super duper burger that makes it so good. 
I would say it's the quality of the veggie patty. It's delicious, rich and unlike any I've tried before. I also love it because It's not SUPER heavy. I could probably grab this for lunch and not feel guilty about it. 
I would say with the bun, it probably wouldn't be that much heavier. 
I would highly recommend super duper burger if you haven't already! It might end up being  one of your favorite casual burger places :).
author: Shalini P.

description:
Fast, delicious and affordable burgers. Their buns are soft and lightly toasted, patty is moist and the produce is fresh. 

Don't get a mini (1/4 pounder/1 patty) do yourself a favor and get a super burger (1/2 pound/2 patties) sure it's more calories but so worth it! (I wish I did :( but there is always next time). Don't forget the garlic fries and free house made pickles.  

The place has plenty of seating with the upstairs area. Employees are nice and the food was ready pretty quickly. 

The total for a mini, super burger and garlic fries was $15.50. 

Super Duper is going to be a must for me when in the city.
author: Amber S.

description:
This place is a great idea. Unfortunately, when we visited it was only partly executed. 

I had a Super Duper. One of the patties was well-done, and the other was medium-rare. Otherwise, it was an okay sandwich. We all agreed the fries were boring. I do like a beer with my burger (though the Stone IPA keg was blown, so I had something else).

Sitting down was an issue. It was late afternoon, and we had to scramble to get a seat for three. We ended up outside amidst the sidewalk bustle and the garbage and remains of the previous diners. The place was a mess. A black-shirted dude eventually came and cleaned up, though we were halfway finished by then.

If I was in the area again, I doubt I'd go back.
author: Dean L.

description:
Obviously this place is super popular as you can tell from the reviews so I had to come and try it. I got the mini burger and garlic fries. 

The mini burger wasn't mini at all! It seemed like regular sized to me so I wonder what the regular burger would be like?! It was delicious but I didn't think it was anything absolutely spectacular. 

The garlic fries on the other hand was amazing! VERY garlicky so stay away if you're looking to kiss someone afterwards :). The fries were thin, crispy on the outside while still soft on the inside. Can't ask for better...besides that it can be less greasy. Can't keep coming back to eat super (duper) greasy fries if a girl wants to keep her figure!
author: Vio C.

description:
This burger joint has always delivered for me. They have a really nice set up, and kind of reminds me of a Chipotle Mexican Grill. They have two levels and the whole place is really spacious. They have bar tables right when you walk in and also plenty of tables both first and second floors.

Their burgers are really nice. You get to choose between mini burgers (1 patty) and super burger (2 patties). Of course, I went with super burger. Go big or go home right? Almost all of their toppings are free except for their bacon, cheese, avocado, mushrooms, and egg. With my order, I asked to have everything on it with bacon, cheese, and egg to top it off. My order is an open faced burger due to all my toppings added and it came out really good. The burger patties were cooked perfectly and the egg made it a lot better in my opinion.

You also need to try their garlic fries and MUST order the 3 dips with it. The additional charge for those 3 dips is worth it. You'll get super sauce, homemade mayo, and chipotle sauce. The chipotle and super sauce are perfect pair for their garlic fries. Trust me, you'll never regret it.

One more good thing about this burger join is that they have a station for their condiments. What I like about it is they have this homemade spicy pickles. It's a good thing to munch on every after bite on your burger, that is if you're not one of those people who hates pickles. 

I'm only giving this joint 4 stars because of their price. The burgers without additional toppings are priced just right but the price will get sorta out of hand once you start requesting for the other toppings that has additional charges. Regardless of the price being on the expensive side after the extra toppings, it is worth a try. If you don't mind the prices and would love to have a good burger with good customer service, this is a place for you to try.
author: Dennis M.

description:
Great burger (double patty with everything) and milkshake. Nothing fancy just your classic American burger. The service was fast and the price was good. 

Might want to get here early for lunch, now 1230 and there's a line out the door.
author: Justin H.

description:
Love the garlic fries! We ordered a 4oz burger with cheese, salad and a cookie&cream milkshake.

I would say that the burger tastes decent, but there's nothing special about it. I will just go back for the price though.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Wow! Great Super Duper burger. The garlic fries were also amazing (but expect to smell like garlic - a lot).  Would definitely come back!
author: Eric B.

description:
JUICIEST medium cooked patty!  The grilled onions are grilled to the point of crispiness which I actually liked and I also enjoyed the really melted cheese they use.  All the other toppings were very fresh as well.

Garlic fries are a bit misleading as you can barely taste any garlic.  The garlic-intensity of these fries are an ultimate shame to that of AT&T ballpark's.  I would order this again only for the cheese on top.

I couldn't resist seeing everyone with a cone so I got a kid's size vanilla ice cream cone dipped in chocolate.  They pump it out like Dairy Queen and it looks perfectly shaped.  The ice cream organic and tastes more like custard but with an ice cream texture.

What I'm docking a point off for is that the patty could use just a smidgen more flavor... just really slightly.  But with the super duper sauce and the mayo, you can easily overlook that.  I like that you can order a mini size (4 oz. patty) which is the perfect amount of burger with fries.
author: Shannon L.

description: Whenever I'm in the area near union square I have to grab one of these delicious burgers. The quality is amazing and as soon as you add a few toppings it can add up to a $17 burger...but it's worth every penny. Finger licking good. Oh...and the garlic parmesan fries are addictive. Consider yourself warned.
author: Brad B.

description:
Call me crazy or call me maybe but I'm just not that crazy about this place. We came on a weekday and there was a long line due to an electronic convention nearby. 

We ordered the super burger w tomatoes grilled onions lettuce special sauce jalapeños and a side of garlic fries.

Yes the burger was juicy and cooked to medium perfection, but it was way too watery. There really wasn't anything special about it aside from using organic vegetarian-diet non-hormonal beef. I would rather eat at in n out or five guys any day.

The garlic fries were good. Not overly drenched in oil like the kind served at baseball games.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
#2 favorite burger in the city after 4505 Meats. Love all the free add-ons (lettuce, tomato, red onions, jalapenos, grilled onions & housemade pickles). 

Word to the wise: If you're debating whether to get a mini burger or a super burger, go for the former (unless you're really, really hungry). Mini burger is not mini by any means, it's more of a regular-sized burger and it'll fill you up nice and good, especially if you get all the fixings.

Also, DEFINITELY order the garlic fries. The burger's tasty, but my friends and I agreed the fries were even better. Arguably made the meal.
author: Amy L.

description:
One of the best burgers I've had!

Food=5

I ordered a super burger and added on cheese, bacon, grilled onions, and an sunny side egg. I also got garlic fries, an oreo malt milkshake, and there trio of sauces. Head to toe: the burger was excellent. The bun wasn't soggy, but had a slight crunch. The sunny side egg was cooked perfectly; the edges weren't even the slightest bit burnt. The meat was medium rare, how I ordered it. The bacon was firm but not burnt. When I put the top of the bun on, the yolk oozed and bathed the entire burger. The richness from the cheese, meat, and egg was contrasted with the salty crunchy bacon and the aioli sauce they put on the bun.

The super sauce was my favorite of the three! The oreo milkshake taste just like Jack In the Box's, which isn't a bad thing because they're both really good.

Service=5

You order the burger at the register, they give you a ringing coaster thing, and you grab your order when it rings. Our food came out in like ~15 minutes.

Ambiance=4.5

The place was pretty busy, but had upstairs and downstairs seating. It was very clean and felt spacious.
author: Alex C.

description: Every burger here is delicious and the fries too. They have a really tasty homemade lemonade which I love :) I was there three times know and I would come back :)
author: Stefanie F.

description: The mini burger with avocado is amazing! My boyfriend and I had to try when the line was out the door! He got the super burger with added bacon and loved it! Great service and comes out fast and fresh!
author: Hayley H.

description: This place was next door to the hotel we were staying in so it immediately caught my eye. It's a little pricey, but the burger was top notch. I got mine well done and it was still juicy (their default is medium). The burger was put together perfectly. It wasn't sloppy or soggy. It had the perfect blend of topping and condiments. I say, if you want a good burger and you're in the area... this is the place to go!
author: Robb F.

description:
I was here last week with my friend. It was our first time. I've been wanted to eat here ever since I bookmarked this location. I was surprised that they make burgers for breakfast. 

We ordered 2 super burgers with everything and added bacon and cheese. It also included two 4oz meat patties which are cooked medium rare. The employee taking your order will let you know that their patties are medium rare. An order of fries and two soft drinks. 

The Super Burger is so big and juicy that the lower bun gets soggy from absorbing the all juices from the meat. It's so good that one bite isn't enough. The homemade pickles delicious and go well with the burger. You can even eat the pickles as an appetizer while you wait for your order to be ready which is what I did. The French fries were descent. It will fill you up good. 

Nice ambience and good music. I believe they were playing The Rolling Stones, Tom Petty & Phil Collins when I was here. My kind of music. Good spot to hang out with friends.

There is much more on the menu that I want to try out like their Oreo & strawberry milk shakes. I will definitely be back for more. If not to this same location. I'll visit one of their many establishments around the city.
author: Javier P.

description: The food was waaaaaaay under cooked. We got two cheese burgers and the meat was pink on the inside. The outer part was barley cooked. Won't be coming here again.
author: Allen B.

description:
YO. This burger was KILLER. We were hungry (wife and I). This definitely satisfied. I got the double party (8 oz) and smashed it. The meat was juicy and incredible. Lettuce was high quality. Cheese was melty. Buns were toasted and buttery but very soft. 

We split the garlic fries. These were pretty good! Definitely made with real garlic!! But lots of it. But garlic is healthy anyways right?? 

Lastly, I picked up a Cookies & Cream "Super Shake." Loved that thing!! Perfectly sweet. Texture was there - the crunchy Oreo cracker. Plus a sweet cream as well. Chunks weren't too big to go up my straw but I still got that satisfying chew on some great pieces. 

Service was annoyed at us because us and a bunch of others were standing in the line undecided (but letting others go ahead of us). They were all "(guh) I'LL TAKE WHOEVER's NEXT PLEASE." But I come here for the food so I'm over it ;). 

If you like burgers, hit this place up. We parked about a mile out on a Saturday at 1pm and it wasn't bad to find a spot.
author: Brady V.

description: Cool place to get a quick bite. They have so many locations all over the city that you will always be able to find a Super Duper close to where you are.They have plenty of seating, and a fun, peppy ambiance. I tried the lemonade, vegetarian burger and garlic fries, everything was delicious!
author: Reema B.

description: This is out first food experience in San Francisco and it's amazing! This food is ridiculously good and the garlic fries are to die for! Every bite left you wanting another!! The garlic fries had the right amount of zip however you might want to mouthwash afterwards! Great start to our trip!
author: Terence W.

description: The star of the super burger are the two patties. Even though the patties are quite oily, the flavour of the beef really comes through. The patties are very similar in flavour to those at Shake Shack. However, the presentation of the burger isn't as appealing. The shake is quite thick and creamy. The fries are crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Super Duper Burgers is a much more fair comparison to Shack Shack than In N Out is to Shack Shack, both in terms of quality and pricing.
author: James S.

description:
This is a good place to grab a quick burger. The food is ready reasonably quick. The patties are juicy, which they warn you about on the menu board, and flavorful. I was debating which size burger to get, since I usually order the double double when I am at In-n-Out. I went with the mini burger and once you add on the toppings you will most likely end up satisfied. Unless you typically enjoy larger portions of food. Be careful with the add-ons because although the general burger is a fair price, each additional ingredient is around $1 more. I added bacon, cheese, and avocado. I would have liked to add a fried egg but couldn't justify the extra $1.50. 

My friends also enjoyed the fries and the spiked shakes. The shake wasn't super strong but it was tasty. Additionally, the pickles are made in-house. They tasted too strongly of vinegar for my taste but you should try them out. Overall my impression is that these burgers are not on par with a gourmet burger from a restaurant but they are better than Five Guys an In-n-Out.
author: Morgan H.

description:
Since I've started working in FiDi three months ago, I haven't had a burger. There's no lack of restaurants with different cuisines in the city, but when I realized that I didn't have a burger in three months, I also started thinking about how much I missed going to In n Out/Five Guys/Habit. 

Thank goodness my coworker and my friend told me about Super Duper Burgers. 

I got the Super Combo with garlic fries and no fountain drink, and it came out to around $12. I got cheese and everything on my two-patty burger, and my oh my, I fell in love. The burger was just so damn juicy, and it had a distinct charcoal aftertaste to it that made me wish I had another one. It definitely didn't have the greasy feeling to it either. Eating it with the unlimited pickles was delicious as well, and if you're a pickle fan, you know you have to go for it!

But the real MVP of the day? THE GARLIC FRIES. Fries complimented with real garlic bits. The flavor is freakin' OUT OF THIS WORLD. It's true that this is the first time I've had garlic fries, and I'm sure there are other places that do it better, but if I had to make the 10 minute walk back to this place for ONE THING ONLY, it would be for these glorious, flavorful, lovely, savory garlic fries.
author: Viet N.

description:
Their beef - as they said, super juicy and could make a messy business. That's totally how I would describe the beef. Juicy. The fries are good too. But I was expecting a little more like a little crunchy buns (was I asking for too much?)  The place is 'fast-food' style. If you are taking away, it's a good place. Dining in is a different story. The place is not fully packed when I was there, but garbages are on every tables :( I blame shameless tourists, but still, it gives a bad vibe; especially their front door. The tables outside are literally covered in garbages. 

In short, I would say the place is ok, food is good. It's a good takeaway place. not recommended for eat in.
author: Giang L.

description:
YUM!

As a first timer i decided to get what the cashier recommended, which was the mini burger combo (with mini burger, fries, and a drink). Well, i was quite satisfied ($10 something after tax).

I got the burger protein style which added to the messiness of the meal, but no complaints here. The burger itself was simple. Nothing fancy smancy, but a good quality burger. They were a little light handed on the sauce, so honestly I didn't really taste the famous sauce, but overall the burger tasted good. The organic patty was lightly seasoned with salt, super juicy, and naturally flavorful. I had all the veggies and added the grilled onions which was a nice touch. Should've added the jalapeños  for some spice, but there's always next time. 

I can't say that the burger was life changing, but the best part was that after eating the  burger, I didn't get the gross, icky, overwhelming feeling that you would at a normal fast food joint. I even ate most of the fries which was nice and crispy.

I would have to say that my favorite part of the meal were the self serve pickles. Dear god, those things were amazing!
author: Diane T.

description:
The Bay Area prides itself on being a very health conscious. Recently, Berkeley passed a landmark tax on sugary drinks and San Francisco almost had enough votes to pass their own tax. While I can get behind wanting to promote a healthy lifestyle, I hate how I can't find a decent fast food burger anywhere in Berkeley. I almost feel like Berkeley isn't part of America sometimes. While San Francisco is not much better in terms of their burger offerings, there is one notable exception, one shining beacon of greasy goodness that defies that granola-munching SF stereotypes and proudly serves absolutely spectacular burgers, fries, and shakes: Super Duper Burgers.

Everything is exactly right about the food at Super Duper Burgers. The fries are on the thicker side and a little crispy. They are basically what the fries at Wendy's want to be when they grow up. The burgers certainly merit the title of being Super Duper. The patties are extra juicy and perfectly seasoned. All of the ingredients on the burger are fresh and flavorful and nestled between two soft buttery toasted buns. The shakes are thick, creamy, and not overly sweet. My mouth is watering just writing about the food. 

While Super Duper is head and shoulders above all burger places in SF, even on a national scale, they are still one of my favorite burger joints. If you are in downtown SF, I would highly recommend checking out Super Duper Burgers.
author: Ravi S.

description: I'm not usually a burger person, but these burgers were soooo good. Shoutout to our cashier, Jeremiah, for being helpful and charismatic. I got a mini burger and fries and they came out super fast, which was surprising considering that they were super busy. When I got my food, I forgot that I even ordered a mini burger because it was a pretttty decently sized burger. I'm a pretty small person so that by itself was pretty filling. The fries were alright, nothing special. My friend commented that she had wayyyy too much cheese on her garlic fries because she ended up having hella leftover cheese after eating all the fries. Overall it was pretty good if not a bit overpriced, I'll probably come back some day!
author: Abby A.

description: This is easily this best burger I've ever had. Super juicy and I get really full from a meal, so you know it's real food lol. Also, the young lady at the register was probably the nicest person I've ever talked to at a business. Either she really loves her job, or deserves an academy award. I love this place.
author: John L.

description:
My Wife, son and I stopped in, after going the SF MoMa. We had Burgers, Fries, Garlic Fries, sodas and Strawberry milkshakes. Let me just say, that EVERYTHING was on point, and EXCELLENT!!!

I will be coming back!!!
author: Martin R.

description: There was a lot of hype surrounding this place, so a couple friends and I decided to try it out. They ordered the mini burger with garlic fries, and I'm pretty sure the garlic fries rival the ball parks! The parmasean cheese was melted and the fries were crunchy! The garlic was noticeable, but not too overwhelming. I just ordered a cookie and cream milkshake, and after taxes, it seemed a little price regarding the size. The milkshake itself was really good, being a nice consistency that allowed me to drink it without feeling like I'm sucking my lungs out. The only downside is the service. I felt unaccomodated, and kinda pushed away. My buzzer for my order never rang, and I had to go up to check it myself. The cashier who gave me it was crude and just gave me a whatever vibe. Despite the service, food is good
author: Robby Y.

description:
Generally a decent burger, but if you go at lunch time be prepared for a long wait. As many have said the service could be better. If a customer doesn't know the menu it wouldn't hurt to explain it a little bit. 

Service and ambience aside the burger is good and hits the spot. No complaints with the fries and when in San Francisco, you can't not have the garlic fries.
author: Christopher C.

description:
I was in San Francisco for a few days in early July. I needed a quick bite before heading to bed because I had to get up early for an early flight. I yelped for simple and fast prepared food and came upon Super Duper Burgers. I decided to give it a try since it's not far from my hotel. 

It was very well made decision. Being this was my first time here ever, I thought the mini burger might be a better choice than the super duper burger and if I needed more food I can just order more food later. I ordered the mini burger combo. The burger was amazing, so good. Every bite was juicy and the flavor was great. The fries were just as great. And I am glad I ordered the mini burger rather because the mini burger was a decent size and with the fries it was filling. 

I really wish they would open in New York.
author: Margaret S.

description:
Pretty good! I looooove love that they have jars of homemade pickles out! Haha the burger was juicy and delicious. There isn't a ton of seating but we got a seat after waiting a couple mins for a couple to leave. I wasn't thrilled about the pricey extra charge for cheese, but I really wanted cheese lol
The fries were good, but for how much the combo is I really expected more fries, was a small portion. Over all I had a good experience though.
author: Sam P.

description:
How awesome is living in San Francisco and going to burger joints because San Francisco is so hip. Lol, I love my city! But besides that I also love this burger joint.

We went on a Sunday morning at 11AM, you're probably wondering "wtf? Burger at 11AM?" Well yeah... So what.... Ahahaha. 

I got a mini cheeseburger with grilled onions, and my dear lord. The bun is toasted to perfection, burgers all are cooked to medium. The burger itself is soft, and tastes fresh like all hamburger meat is supposed to. Grilled onions isn't too dry or too over cooked. 

THEN THE PARMESAN GARLIC FRIES
it's downed in butter and garlic, you may consider it greasy but it's all the garlic. The garlic will get your breathe smelling like a garlic field for dayzzzz... But yeah it's a definite must have if you're coming here. 

Only con is: price can be a little high for such small portions. This is no five guys or in n out.
author: Crystal C.

description: I had a chocolate shake, garlic fries,  and the mini with cheese, grilled onion and jalapeños. The burger was good. The shake was nothing special. I was severely disappointed in the garlic fries. The garlic tasted raw.
author: Kristen B.

description:
Quick and delicious. 
I was looking for a quick meal and stumbled upon SDB. I must say it was pretty good and fast. And the Miniburger is no joke.  I do recommend it.
author: Pablo G.

description:
Their garlic fries is amazing when you're trying to sober up while bar hopping. 

All in seriousness, hands down the best garlic fries I have ever had. The aged cheddar cheese was amazing and they did not skim on the garlic and cheese portions. If you're on the fence about the burgers, just get the fries! 

(+) Veggie Burger.  The burger was very fresh (you can definitely taste it through the toppings too, not just dead or old vegetables). The patty was crunchy and perfectly cooked. My food came out super fast even when the whole place was packed.This review might be a bit biased because everything tastes good after a couple of hours with beer....

10/10 would recommend after an early happy hour or if you're trying to fill yourself up before a night out in the city (;
author: Tram N.

description:
I need to make a stand! I need to rate 2 stars since it means "meh. I've experienced better." Sad thing is, I have experienced better BEFORE at Super Duper! This was my favorite burger place EVER!! After the last 5 or so visits with the bf, the patties are overdone! So the bf has banned this place :'(

We come during many different hours so I couldn't blame the lunch rush for the overdone burgers. I've also told and dragged countless people here since it's my favorite place to get a burger. 

So management, if you see this please take a look at the patties being sent out. It is no longer that wonderful juicy medium pink inside each patty. I along with a few other yelpers have been getting an overdone and sometimes dry patty :(
author: Jen L.

description: Always a good place for a burger. Tends to get crowded around lunch time, but they have a good selection which can be customized and offer mini burgers (yay!) if you tend to have a smaller appetite like I do. They also have really good shakes, as well as soft serve
author: Sara F.

description: I've only been here about 4 times when coming out here to visit San Francisco with my partner and the employees are professional, the vibe is pure, and the food is absolutely amazing!
