I never get thought any different of this place each visit. The line can be a bit long but it's totally worth the wait. At least I think so when it comes to a burger joint in the city. Always excited to be back here when I get hungry.
author: Johnny S.

description: Decided to walk here in the rain, this place has a great ambience and will satisfy the cravings of burger eaters new and old. Super duper music, super duper garlic fries, super duper burgers, totally worth it!
author: Roo G.

description: You can't go wrong with this place. The burgers are great, and I'd even go as far as saying there in my top 5 of the best burgers I've had...and I've had a lot of burgers! What I would definitely recommend from here are the garlic fries! You have to get them! They are the best fries I've had! The amount of cheese they put on top is amazing! Every bite is a bite of cheesy garlic heaven! If you go here for anything be sure you try the fries! You won't regret it!
author: Joseph C.

description:
Wow... This place comes dangerously close to being the best burger joint in my opinion.  

I split a Super duper burger with cheese with my gf and was very happy.  You can taste the quality of the meat and the mixture of the bun and other ingredients just went together very nicely.  

Fries were really good too.  

I hope they open one up in LA soon or else I might need to go back to SF just to get another burger.
author: Sennett L.

description:
Super really bad service over a n order of French fries..your late night crew argued with me over French fries .. OK ..  O really like your place.. But after this... NO MORE!!!!!!!!  Good bye!!
I hope u guys the best!..never ever going back !
author: Demanding T.

description: First time here and loved it! The homemade pickles are delicious. If you have a chance stop by to get some old fashioned cheeseburgers.
author: Cheryl B.

description: Vegetarian burger and strawberry shake - crispy patty and fresh shake. Very filling and can't get wrong when it comes to burgers and shakes!!
author: Bhavika P.

description:
If I'm in the Powell area I always go out of my way to walk down a few blocks to come here.

Their burgers are amazing! That's the best I can describe them. I always get the mini burgers but don't be fooled, they're not as mini as you think. One day I'll venture and try the super duper burgers. Also, all the burgers are freshly made.

Sometimes I get the vanilla shake which comes in a tall glass cup, super refreshing. The garlic fries are also pretty good as well as their soft serve. 

Note: it's additional cost for toppings.
author: Ingrid H.

description:
I've heard of this burger joint awhile ago and wanted to give it a try. Every time I've tried a new burger place I've been a little disappointed because the reviews never reflected the burger. But Super Duper Burgers is pretty spot on. It was one of the most tastiest, juiciest burgers I've ever had! I love how they use Niman Ranch beef which is natural, vegetarian fed, hormone and antibiotic beef! I have been looking for a place that has this. They use premium ingredients, even in their shakes! Their price reflects their quality. I would pay more for that any day  
Only had the super duper burger and garlic fries, which were all beyond my expectations. Next time I will try their shake. I really wanted to get it, but gotta watch the waistline.
author: Christie K.

description:
I went to Super Duper Burgers for a quick early dinner.  In general, I'm not a really big burger fan and I know Super Duper is a chain so I wasn't expecting much.  Immediately after entering, I found that there was no line and I was greeted with a smile.  

Everything on the menu is pretty affordable.  I ordered the single patty cheeseburger with garlic fries.  Condiments such as pickles, ketchup, and mustard are offered to the right of the register and they have plenty of seating.  You're able to add avocado, an egg, or bacon to your burger for an additional cost.  

The burger came and was pretty standard.  The burger was pretty filling without being overwhelmingly huge which I appreciated.  The garlic fries came with cheese on top which added a lot of flavor.  The cheese seemed like it overpowered the garlic to me.  

Overall, Super Duper Burgers is a great option if you're craving a good burger.  The workers at this location are very friendly and I would probably return to try one of their cones.
author: Christine D.

description:
Every so often I get a serious craving for an In-N-Out burger. It's some sort of weird in between desire for a burger that isn't quite gourmet but also isn't your typical garbage from mcdonald's or burger king. Unfortunately the nearest In-N-Out burger is all the way up by fisherman's wharf and there is absolutely no way I'm trekking up there to satisfy that need. This is where Super Duper is going to have to suffice.

The quality of the meat seems decent enough and I do like that you have a number of options to customize your burger including the ever important fried egg on top. Add on an order of garlic fries and a frosty shake and you have yourself a delicious cholesterol laden gut bomb. That will hit the spot.

Overall, "I'm a fan" because this place doesn't try to be the ultra fancy $15-20 burger that all of the other local top contenders offer and still delivers superior quality compared to all of the other affordable options available.
author: Mark O.

description: gotta say, one of the few good places that does a veggie burger right! seriously, even if you aren't a big meat eater it's GREAT. we stopped here on a whim and have to say it's fantastic at what it does-- makes super duper burgers!!
author: Emily K.

description:
I have tried the Marlowe burger (another favorite for best burger in SF), but I must say that the Super Duper cheeseburger is better.  Great bun, juicy patties, and well seasoned.  I am always amazed at how good this is when I eat it.

The fries are also very good.  They are slightly thicker than the ones you might get at In-n-Out, but they are nice and crispy.  You'll never want to ask them to cook them again here.  Oh, and the pickles that you can serve yourself at the condiment are really good too!  

One of these days, I will try their spiked milk shakes....but go for the super duper cheeseburger and fries.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Philbert W.

description:
Taking an overview of the quick serve burger options in the FiDi -- Gotts, Bistro, Ziggy's, Buckhorn -- I bet that you'd be hard pressed to find something better than Super Duper.  Only 4505 Meats holds a candle.  The burgers here are juicy, tasty, big, and sloppily good.  Plus the meats are humanely raised and they have an extensive assortment of organic offerings.  

The long lunch line moves fast and, combined with excellent service and fair prices, it's in the front end of my lunch rotation.
author: Angel S.

description:
This burger was very fresh and well cooked. The guy I ordered from was sooooo nice and funny! He really made sure that my complicated burger (I took away and added a few things) was going to be correct. The meat was really good and I was surprised the bacon was so "fresh", if I can put it like that. 
The only thing they dropped a star for was the price.. I thought it was a little bit overprice for a mini burger and fries - 13 dollars. And keep in mind this is a fast food place, no table service.
author: Jasmine A.

description: If you're from Texas the closest comparison would be Smash Burger, except this is better. Every ingredient seems thoughtfully selected and the result is a delicious treat. I usually get the mini burger (not mini at all) with a fried egg and avocado and everything on it. For fry dipping sauce you can ask for a side of their secret sauce, beats ketchup and makes the fries even better!
author: Jess L.

description:
In short, this place offers fine burgers with fast food price. The cost is just a little bit waiting time.

I have been visiting this place 3 dinner in a row recently tried different kinds of burgers served here. Not like other fast food stores like McDonald's or BK, the burger here tastes more like a dish cooked by chief instead of manufactured by factory. The meat is juicy and with fresh topping the burger tastes fantastic.

Given this place is super close to my work, I will definitely come back soon.
author: Wei X.

description:
They made me a (keto friendly!) lettuce-wrapped burger, no questions asked. Loaded up on the fats - cheese, bacon, avocado. Super duper delicious and surprisingly didn't drip everywhere.
Their secret sauce is on point.
author: Stu L.

description:
Nice place . We stoped by for lunch and forgot to order well done and requested after placing order of hamburgers. Nancy cook was not too happy. Messed up our order totally took way too long then handed us burned hamburgers after Long wait.

Cashier was very nice and helpful but still our stop was for quick good lunch here which they failed in.
Food is good but service to ask for change from cooking staff was terrible
author: Kuki D.

description:
Love this spot.

every visit to SF consists on a stop at super duper burgers.  The burgers are great and garlic fries are amazing. Also, the pickles at the condiment counter adds something extra that other burger places don't usually offer.  the service is always great and very reasonable prices for what you get.

we were even offered complimentary donuts to try which were good too.
author: April E.

description:
Today was a fun day at @SantaCon SF 2015, until our day was ruined by the workers/manager(partner) by their horrible mistreatment of our lost Iphone 6, and negligence in handling the entire situation.

We ate dinner at Super Duper Burger located at 721 Market St
San Francisco, CA 9410. Around 645-715 PM, after finishing our food, we went to, the Starbucks across the street, at around 740 we noticed our cell phone was gone and had left it at Super Duper Burger. After quickly returning to Super Duper Burger, we find the same people who were sitting at the table we were at and asked them about a lost phone. Which they then replied that they returned it to the cashier at the front of the store.

Thinking that we would be able to get our phone back, we quickly rush to the front to ask if there had been any lost phones. Which then they replied that no phones had been turned in at all. Which completely contradicts the other customers who specifically told us they turned in the phone.

A few minutes later, one cashier walks in from outside, who was conveniently on break, when our phone was lost. The worker then is asked whether or not he saw a lost phone, which then he says no he hasn't. And then when we brought the witness who said he turned in the phone, the employee then claimed that he accidentally gave the phone to another couple that said they had lost a white iphone. WITHOUT verifying at all whether or not it was actually theirs by passcode, details of the phone, or any proof of ownership. Then claiming that it is their store policy to treat lost phones that way. That if anybody tells them they lost something, they give it to that person no questions asked. Completely negligent and ridiculous business practice. 

So during the 25 minutes that we left to grab a coffee after dinner, our phone was turned, by WITNESSES, in to the cashier, and then he apparently negligently gave it to the first person who asked for a lost iphone, without any verification.

Here's where the story gets worse. At this point an Asian man, starts to get tempered. He claimed that he worked with corporate, and an assistant manager said that he was a partner of some kind. He starts to yell at me and my girlfriend and yells inside the store completely escalating the situation. There is video evidence of this man yelling in the store, berating me and my girlfriend, and yelling at random customers. Then every time somebody told him to calm down, he would get into the face of RANDOM CUSTOMERS. Every person that tried to calm him down got yelled at, berated, and completely disrespected by this man. I do not know what affiliation this man had with the store other than him claiming that he was part of corporate, none of the employees would disclose any information about the "man who is always here and is a partner with an owner." 

While all of this is happening, the assistant managers and employees on the floor acted in the rudest possible manner not taking ANY RESPONSIBILITY for their actions. They did not ONCE question the worker who took the phone, blaming me and my girlfriend, paying customers, for causing a commotion, while all we wanted was some justice. Instead of trying to solve the issue with the cashier, the instead put the blame on us.

We won't accuse the cashier who collected the phone of stealing, but we will accuse him of NEGLIGENCE if his story is true, that he gave it to the first person who asked for a lost white iPhone, WITHOUT asking for verification, passcode, or even seeing that the background was a picture of my girlfriend and I. That should not and is not common practice for items turned into any lost and found. And if I was a employee in his place, I would want to make sure the right owner had something that costs so much.

With that being said, it's suspicious that the phone was turned off, right after the other customers gave it to the cashier, then the cashier went on break, but right before he left he was able to give the phone to another couple "on accident." Not to mention he lied about receiving a lost phone in the first place.

I would like to be contacted by the corporate office of Super Duper Burgers to discuss this situation, because we believe that the employees of Super Duper Burger was negligent in treating a lost phone that was turned into the cashier, and lost with less than 20 minutes of handling time. We believe that because the iPhone 6 was in your employee's possession, he is responsible for the loss of the phone. It was irresponsible to give the phone to another person without any verification of ownership. And if this is common practice, AS YOUR OWN ASSISTANT MANAGERS STATED, you might want to let them know to use some common sense.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
Quick easy spot to grab a juicy burger! Mini burger was good - juicy patty, fresh lettuce and tomatoes, raw chopped onions, and a yummy thousand island-like sauce. My friend and I think it's way tastier than In and Out!

Place is spacious - lits of seating downstairs and upstairs. Order your burger, pay, find a table, wait for your buzzer, and get your food!
author: Sheena P.

description: I ate here at my last day of my San Francisco trip. Unfortunately, they don't have egg sandwich at the breakfast time. But then, my boyfriend and I try the super burger and chicken sandwich. Super burger is beef burger. Taste good. But chicken sandwich taste too spicy for me. But overall, good
author: Karman S.

description:
There's a lot of things that help this place live up to its name. One is location and hours. It's an ideal spot on Market Street close to Union Square and Financial District, good for lunch, afternoon snack, dinner, or, most importantly, second dinner! They also sell alcohol, which is pretty rare at burger joints.

Of course, the food is also super duper! The burger patties are perfectly grilled to a "medium" level, juicy and greasy and delicious. Add an egg because eggs make everything better. Get a mini burger and get fries on the side. The garlic fries in particular are amazing: a blast of garlic, cilantro, and cheese to top it off. (Don't forget to chew some gum after your meal.)

The prices are in the "mid-range" for burgers, which I'm defining as somewhere in between In-N-Out and Eureka. I suppose it's reasonable for this part of the city, which probably explains the lines at all hours of the day. Luckily, the line moves fast and the staff is friendly and efficient, so you'll have a super duper burger before you know it!
author: Brittany C.

description:
Ok, on second thought, it's just not a good as I thought it was. Been here a few more times and I just find that the burgers are pretty average and the fries are nothing special.  I continuously find that, compared to some of other the places, that the meat is way too dry.  Mediocre is not good enough for me.

I'd much rather go to Pearl's, but this is next to where I work so I kinda have to go with it.
author: Alexander Y.

description:
Super Duper indeed! Have been to Super Duper burgers more than a few times and have never been disappointed. Their chicken sandwich is super juicy and the flavors are just lovely. I have also tried their veggie burger and it is surprisingly good. The patty tastes very fresh and you can actually see bits of carrot and corn. 

Add in a fried egg and an order of the garlic fries and you are set!
author: Shriya P.

description: Every Super Duper place I've been too has always had their food consistently cooked. I always get their garlic fries here, super good and crispy.  Service is friendly and fast. This Super Duper is much busier than the one on Mission Street.  It's probably because there's much foot traffic. The seating here is very limited and if you have a large group of people you'll need to split up.
author: Ronald F.

description: Best burger in San Francisco!!! The place gets crowed but is worth it ! The burger is not greasy. The meat has a lot of flavor ! Is definitely a most if you're in town
author: Carolina M.

description: The mini burger is plenty big enough!  The burger itself is fairly good, and well prepared.  Who can complain, especially for ringing in at only 5 bucks in the center of San Francisco?  This place reminds me of Shake Shack.  Long story short, the restaurant is solid if you want to casually sit down and have a beer with your meal, or if you just want to pick it up for take out.  I wasn't a fan of the organic soft serve though...it tasted a bit too "organic" if that makes any sense.
author: Monica J.

description:
$13.42 for a Super Combo with bacon and a drink.

And the long lines that regularly form here during the week testify as to why this place is so popular. Fresh made 100% Niman Ranch all natural beef, tasty home-made pickles, compostable trays, even their chicken is free range. 

So I'm willing to pay more for food from a company that cares to do these kinds of things. AND: the burgers are really awesome--juicy with great flavor and served with fries that are great to the last one.

You can get cheaper burgers elsewhere but for the quality and flavor, this is one of the better, more consistent, places I've found.

Get here well before noon weekdays and you can easily cut that noon-time line in half!
author: Glenn H.

description:
I highly recommend this place for burger lovers.
I visited here with my friends. We had a super duper burger with bacon. It was very juicy and crispy. The garlic fries are heaven. Their homemade pickles are amazing. Enjoyed eating them. Environment was clean, Modern and friendly staff. Love this place.
author: Benito C.

description:
Stopped in for breakfast, got the egg sandwich (which is actually an egg mcmuffin). Add cheese, it's worth it! Delicious cheddar.

Staff is friendly. Coffees good.
author: Sadie L.

description: This Might be the best burger place...the meat is juicy but in a "dry" way if that makes sense. No dripping grease but still moist. Hard to explain but it's good! Chocolate shakes are fantastic. The fries are good too. The lines are long but it goes quick. Is IN N OUT is a 6, this place is at least a 9. :)
author: Ben L.

description: I hate to be ugly but damn this place sucks. The burger was very very greasy and unflavored. Service was ok but still could not make up for the disgusting taste in my mouth.
author: Slim L.

description: It's just a classically good burger at a reasonable price. The smaller version is enough to satisfy, and top it off with some fancies from the pickle bar, and you're good to go. Don't expect the moon, and you'll be pleased with every bite.
author: Andrew R.

description:
Dropped by here after a marathon jaunt to Union Square. I had the veggie burger with tomato, lettuce and garlic fries. I was impressed the veggie burger was nice and crispy and didn't fall apart like some veggie burgers do. Garlic fries were nice and crispy. 

I shared the organic soft serve swirl ice cream cone and wow it was so good!! A nice way to finish off a meal. I'm glad that it was close to Union Square so I could avoid places like Cheesecake Factory.
author: Nette T.

description:
Great burgers, nice and juicy and the garlic fries are to die for. Glad I made the walk over to this place. Seating is limited . The line can get busy, so by the time your food is ready a table will probably free up. 

Would come back again the next time I am in town
author: Parwez I.

description: Walking down Market St wanting to eat Thai food "supposedly", stumbled upon this great burger place! The smell was fantastic! And the Menu, well, simple and organized in a friendly and fast way! I went in and ordered myself the Mini Combo which is basically a 1 patty instead of 2 with fries on the side. It was delicious! Not only the burger tasted great but the fries were fried at the right level! + to make it complete they've included this homemade pickles that had a special taste in them :) I would definitely recommend this place for whatever occasion or if you need a really good burger :)!
author: Adel F.

description:
Awesome burgers, and great shakes!! I shouldn't have, but I couldn't resist. Glad I didn't. 

Very reasonable, and extremely casual. Two thumbs up!
author: Yatin R.

description: I went here for the second time with a friend, and was disappointed. The burger just wasn't as good. Incidentally, I came around 5pm, and the burger came out quicker than when I went at 11am the first time, and the lines were about the same. I did order garlic fries as well as they were fine. I guess it was just an off day, or this Super Duper is just inconsistent. Either way, I don't think I'll be back.
author: Edwina D.

description:
Always a super Gud #vegan burger #lunchtime !! The burgers here are hella Gud an the pickles are #yum !! The seating inside has a sweet design.. Balcony view is bomb :) this time round we opted for outdoors since its #beautiful outside an... We're hella hot from a looong #bike ride :) 
#loveit
author: Cherriesan P.

description: Burger was good but I loved the garlic fries. Tons of garlic that leaves you smelling like garlic for the rest of the day, just the way I want it!
author: Matthew L.

description: We came down from Oregon and were disappointed that our hotel wasn't anywhere near an In-n-Out. But then we found Super Duper Burger, disappointed no more! So much better! Also they were handing out their donuts since it was just getting too late to be breakfast time-and that will also win a place in my heart
author: Megan H.

description:
Quite a good burger for a fast food place, the fries are decent as well.
Everything else around it is pretty standard. Not a place to sit for too long and enjoy your evening but rather one for a quick, fine meal. And that's totally okay.
author: Tom K.

description:
I had high expectations coming into Super Duper. I ordered a 4oz burger, worried that the 8oz was too big. But boy was I wrong. I wasn't satisfied after devouring my greasy burger. The meat quality is on point, very fresh, and cooked to a perfect medium. Burger toppings (lettuce, tomato, etc) were very fresh and crisp, although skimpy. I only had one measly slice of tomato. Also, when I ordered my burger with avocado (additional $1), it seemed like they only gave one-fourth of an avocado -- very little. However, I love love love the free pickles!

The garlic fries are worth a try, but the portion is small. Both garlic fries and regular fries were EXTREMELY oily that I had to squeeze the excess oil out onto a napkin. I found it rather disgusting and unpleasant. And because the fries were so oily, they weren't as crispy as I hoped. The three sauces for additional $1 is worth a try, but I wouldn't get them again. It's just super super sauce (basically thousand island), chipotle, and mayo. Their shakes are really thick and sweet, but extremely over-priced. Super Duper also offers chicken burgers, veggie burgers, and salads... but really, who goes to Super Duper to order a salad?

Service is really fast. Cashiers are quick, though a bit rude. The place is always packed and sometimes the tables are left a mess by previous inconsiderate customers. Nonetheless, the staff tries their best to clean up regularly. I would eat at Super Duper again, but not too often or else I'd get a heart attack.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Just came for a simple brunch of egg-bacon sandwich. Got a simple brunch of egg-bacon sandwich and a cup of orange juice. I didn't order mine with cheese, so it was a little dry, but I think it would have been great if I'd just ordered it straight. Now I'm curious about their other menu items.
author: Jenny K.

description: I love my burgers, and these surpassed my expectations. The burgers were delicious and tasty! And, the garlic cheesy fries were worth every calorie. Top this off with a creamy strawberry shake, and all is good with my world. The service was also excellent! I will return!
author: Jennifer G.

description: I'm not a burger, burger fan... but after I had the burger here... I wanted to die.. SOOOOO freaking good. The free pickles were so awesome. Super crowded and if you are dining in, standing in line will have you chicken hawking for a table... It's one of those places, you just have to squeeze in to fit in! My mouth is watering thinking about the burgers there!
author: Jemma N.

description: Amazing burgers & fries. I tried the garlic fries with cheese & the regular super burger. Very satisfied for a great price. The surroundings are very nice as well.
author: Abdisalam H.

description: This was an amazing find, while searching for 7 eleven ( two doors down) I saw this place, rather I could inhale the smell of grilling burgers. Circled back just before lunch and had Super with cheese and a order of Garlic Fries. OMG the fries were just right Great Garlic and cheese and I virtually ate them all before I took my first bite of the burger then it was over. I have a new favorite Burger!!! This was the juiciest most flavorful I have found. I read reviews comparing to in n out and I believe if In N Out opened next door, Super Duper's business would double double!!! Love this Joint.
author: Jim P.

description: This is my favorite burger restaurant in San Francisco! I like it better than Umami Burger, In N Out, and Roam Artisan Burgers although the milkshakes at Roam are comparable. I love salt and the burgers here are perfectly salted for my taste and delicious. I always get the mini burger which is not very mini and packed with flavor. The milkshakes here are amazing and so are the garlic fries. Highly recommend coming here if you're in Union Square!
author: Karen L.

description:
You'd be forgiven for thinking that someone walked into a Shake Shack in New York and then came back to San Fran and opened Super Duper Burgers based on their experience.

The similarities in style, layout and materials are uncanny. Lucky for Super Duper, they decided to copy some tasty burgers. Not only does SD cook up a mean patty, they have solid fries and sauces as well.

One complaint is their house sauce. It's got... *something* in it that leaves an odd aftertaste. As a result I'm not really a fan. But their Chipotle mayo is excellent, as is the good ol' combo of ketchup and mayo.
author: Nick S.

description:
Awesome burgers! But i wish they were a bit bigger. The fries are so perfectly done!

I was waiting in a line for about 7 minutes but its totaly worth it
author: Denis Z.

description:
This week I've had a real issue with anything related to salt or the word "salt".  That story coming out of Florida about the guy taking bath salt and deciding to eat a man's face.  Gross.

Then my gf and I split a big bucket of popcorn and soda while watching Men in Black 3. She opened up I don't know how many salt packets and ruined the popcorn. Gross.

Then I came to Super Duper and ordered garlic fries with my meal.  And it was beyond salty.  Gross.

Despite my overdose of salt this week thankfully I had no thoughts of eating anybody's face but I did have thoughts of eating a double cheeseburger at Super Duper.  I ordered the combo:

Double Cheeseburger:  the burger was good. No complaints.  Cooked to medium unless specified otherwise.  I didn't feel like requesting medium rare like I usually do.  Perfectly acceptable burger for the price.  I believe I spent around $12 for the combo.

Garlic Fries:  these however were too salty for my taste.  Salty like Miley Cyrus ever increasing saltiness towards Justin Bieber. Maybe next time I'll order regular fries.  

A few things I found Super about this spot:

The homemade pickles.  Hella sour but I love pickles and I appreciate that they offer them.  The staff is friendly and seem to keep the place running smoothly.  Also the menu has shakes and soft serve ice cream which is really cool.  Overall Super Duper has my approval.  If I'm in the area I'd definitely come again.  

Dear Super Duper, my gf, and all you potential face eaters,

 LAY OFF THE SALT!!!!
author: Michael L.

description:
I was in the area for lunch and needed a quick bite before a meeting. A popped in and was welcomed by a warehouse type atmosphere. They have a large easy to follow menu with great sustainable choices. 

I ordered the chicken burger which was absolutely delicious. The milkshakes looked good too, but I didn't have time. Will definitely be going back.
author: Bevi K.

description: Great food, though the burgers are extremely greasy. I wish the patties weren't so thin and the garlic fries were a bit disappointing. But overall great value for the price.
author: Stephen Q.

description:
Underwhelmed.  Mini Burger, Garlic Fries & a Strawberry Shake.  

Burger was just okay, even though I added cheese and bacon.  I thought bacon makes everything better, but I guess that's not the case when the bacon is limp.  Really though, I thought I'd enjoy it more, especially since most things taster better than they actually are after a few drinks . . .

The garlic fries were just fine, but I was jealous that my friends garlic fries had disproportionately more aged cheddar.

Shake wasn't anything exceptional, but it did taste like it was composed of all fresh ingredients.  

Eh, I still prefer a good old In-N-Out Burger, animal style and still more extra sauce, of course!
author: Christina L.

description:
This was my thought process: "Super Duper Burgers? Sounds super duper. Let's try it!"

So that's how we went to Super Duper. The setup was pretty funny, with the long line of queue right at the middle of the whole installment. But the queue moved pretty quick, anyway. 

Quite intuitively I ordered a Super Duper Burger set meal... That's a mistake! Why, you'd ask. Because it didn't come with garlic fries! I had my usual fries with me (still pretty good), and stared right at my friend's garlic fries... he eventually gave me and shared with me. LOL guilt trap worked. 

The second time I visited, of course I requested for the garlic fries to come alongside my Super Duper Burger set meal. It was unreal. Both the burger and the fries. I could have them everyday in Hong Kong. I don't even think any burger joint offers medium-done beef as good as SDB. And to think that people here have been more crazy about In and Out.. Oh boy. Where are the good burgers in Hong Kong?
author: Kevin L.

description: Best burger that I have ever had! Great service, it was fast a easy. Will totally be coming back. The ketchup is even better here!
author: Abbey R.

description:
One of my favorite burger spots to go to! A simple "fast food" burger spot with juicy flavors, their "super sauce", homemade pickles and a nice crispy bun. They have a mini burger that is usually good for me (1 patty) or a super burger (2 patties) that will probably more suitable for a guy. 

In addition to their yummy burgers, the must tries are their garlic aioli fried with aged chedder - oh my gosh, delicious! the aged chedder adds a sharp flavor to the fries that is well balanced with the aioli. Their milkshakes and ice cream are also very good and a great way to end the meal with :)
author: Wendy Z.

description:
I came here during lunch on a Friday and the place was packed. However, the line moved pretty quickly and food came fast.

I got a vanilla soft serve cone and veggie burger, in that order. The soft serve was delicious and organic! The texture was smooth and creamy, definitely not chunky or watery like some I've tried. 

The veggie burger was very good as well. It was flavorful and not dry. They put cucumbers and hummus on it if you get it with everything, and I thought they were great additions.

Overall this is a great place to get burgers in the city- affordable and tasty!
author: Aimee Z.

description:
A burger place that's just a little bit more than what would expect.

I would say the burgers are comparable to that of In-N-Out's and I can't really say which is better. What really brings me here is the garlic fries. They are simply the best in ALL of California that I have every tried. Beware though, you breath will reek of garlic for a while.

Side note: Free pickles were also awesome
author: Francis R.

description: Not as good as Shake Shack, my favorite burger place, but this is pretty close. Been here many times and never have had a bad meal. They're always friendly, even during the busy times. We get the mini burger, which is really a regular burger, and the garlic fries. Yum!
author: Susan G.

description:
This place is pretty awesome! I would even go as far as to rank this as one of the best burgers spots, that I've ever had. 

Depending on where you go super duper Burger is usually packed with customers. Customers ready with anticipation to try amazing burgers, refreshing milkshakes and a wide assortment options to create a burger uniquely fitted to every individual's personality. One of my personal favorites is the super burger with everything on it, including, caramelized onions and an egg on top. The combination of perfectly melted American or Swiss cheese, combined with a sunny side up egg, creates just a delicious burger, that will definitely get you messy. Highly recommended at least seven or eight napkins for that meal.

Another perk of eating here is the fact that they give you the option of free crispy juicy pickles and jalapeno peppers to go along with your meal. Add it with ketchup or what I prefer, the Aioli mayo and the meal is complete. The process to get an order is pretty quick and convenient. The staff is very friendly and definitely helpful in regards to you making sure your burgers customized to how you like it. Overall I'm always happy with what I get and how I spend my time at superduper burger. Only downside is you generally will pay more money for you're meal then you would at a typical fast food chain location. But overall it's worth it and definitely a place that I will not hesitate to go back to.
author: Donald W.

description:
Well, I wouldn't call this place "Super Duper" 
The service was fine, very friendly. 
The fries were more like chips, which I like some crunch to my fries but not chip-like. As for the burgers, they tasted very bland, as if there was absolutely no seasoning whatsoever....I like a burger full of flavor! I suggest going elsewhere for a flavorful burger. Quite pricy for a tasteless burger.
author: Isabelle M.

description:
My coworker and I were in the area, and she recommended Super Duper Burgers because I've never been.  I don't eat beef anymore, so I decided to get a chicken burger with the chipotle aioli and regular fries.  I got my burger with lettuce, tomato, and grilled onions.  I like how there's a list of free toppings, which is basically everything you want in a burger.  As for my chicken, it wasn't dry and the chipotle gave it some heat.

It gets very busy during the lunch hour, and seating is limited.  So be prepared to sit with strangers.
author: Vira P.

description:
This is probably not one of my preferred locations to have Super Duper.  From a convenience standpoint, it is right on Market near BART stations so I can come and go quickly.  On the other hand, being on Market comes with the "usual" weirdness like random people talking to themselves and those aren't even the crazy ones.

I still love their food and especially their shakes.  I probably would rather have a shake from them over their fries anytime, any day of the week.  I mean if you're already eating a brick of salt from your burger, then why add on more with fries?

This location also has less seating than the Misson and Spear location.  The upstairs loft seating area is at least 10 degrees hotter due to it being warmed by meat steam and people heat.  I had to take my long sleeve off in order to avoid sweating like a pig.

Before that day, I didn't even know that Super Duper was here but now I do.  I most likely will prefer to go to Embarcadero location even if it means walking a bit farther.
author: Ben H L.

description:
What I got/get:
Garlic fries
Mini burger with cheese, avocado, and egg

The good news:
Oh mannn these burgers are delish! The vibe and food kind of remind me of Shake Shack in NY, but here you can put an EGG on your burger. Done deal. I got the mini burger (aka one patty) and I would actually consider it smaller than most burger places, but to me the size is perfect. You have to add the egg because they know how to cook it PERFECTLY! Avocado added a nice fresh texture to the mix and whatever's in that sauce...it's good. Overall, it's a perfectly cooked burger and the garlic fries topped with cheese are amazing as well. I was impressed with how fast the food came out and the way they organized the place! Also, don't forget to grab some pickles on the side.

The bad news:
Grab some napkins because this burger is a mess, especially with the egg that just ends up exploding onto my tray. The price may seem cheap at first when you're just looking at the price of the burger itself, but once you pile on those toppings...it'll easily be around a $10 burger.
author: Christine M.

description: This is the slowest Super Duper in the chain. Always count on a long wait. And they have more staff than any other.
author: David D.

description:
I didn't have my thinking cap on and got super duped into getting the super burger. It's listed at the top of their menu which made me think it was a regular burger. It's actually a double patty, 8 oz (half pound!) burger. Massive!  But delicious. For the sake of my waistline, I'm going for the 'mini' quarter pounder next time. 

All that to say, it's a great burger. Tender, juicy, just the right level of greasiness. I would have liked a bit more veg. The amount of meat overwhelmed the measly amount of lettuce, tomato and red onion. Nonetheless, I scarfed the whole thing down. 

Fries were decent but nothing to write home about. 

And thumbs up for the awful 80s pop music playing in the background. Fun!
author: Ada C.

description: My first time here and I'll definitely be back! I had the mini cheeseburger meal. All servers were really nice and helpful. The place was clean. There are even house pickles that you can help yourself to! I don't eat this type of food often but next time I'm craving it I'll come back here.
author: Jackie O.

description: Best burgers Ive ever had.  Great service and awesome food.  My wife and I were visiting SF last year and couldnt decide what to eat and just kept pacing back and forth to figure out what to get.  I really wasnt in the burger mood especially since there are a TON of place in SF to eat and didn't want to just walk into a burger joint; however, I'm glad I did.  The price was good and the food was amazing especially considering it's organic grass fed.  I would highly recommend this place and wish this could add some franchises in the south so I dont have to travel all that way just to eat there again.
author: Abdul Q.

description: great burgers... beat the shake shack... very juice burgers... the can improve order time... and line at registers
author: Pablo T.

description:
Great burgers, good fries, and decent garlic fries.  I like the fact that pickles are homemade and left in bottles on the counter so customers can help themselves. What would be better is to have an ice machine so you don't have to scoop the ice out of a bin.  When I was needed ice for my coke, the bin was mostly empty and was filled mostly with water.

The beef in the super burger was some of the freshest and the tastiest I've ever had in a burger.  Because they don't load you up on the lettuce, tomato, and onions, you can really taste the beef.

Prices are very reasonable, especially considering the astronomical rent in the area.  Although lines were long, they moved fast.  I would imagine parking is next to impossible and finding a table can get difficult.
author: Mark D.

description: My daughter recommended this place to me the next time I came to SF. Well, I finally came back to SF and wanted to try this place. First off, I love the atmosphere and secondly I love the location. It is close to shopping and Union Square. This place reminds me of Shake Shack but I wanted to see if the hamburger are similar as well. I ordered the double meat hamburger, fries, and Mexican coke. The burger was absolutely delicious and it did sort of taste like the burgers at Shake Shack. The pickles, lettuce, and onions was fresh. The French fries was good. I will certainly come back here again when I am in the bay area again. They have other locations but only in SF. I highly recommend this place to anyone that wants a good burger and in town. The staff is very nice and it may take a minute to get your food but its well worth the wait!
author: Ray B.

description:
Sometimes the soft-serve is too soft in the mornings, when not many people order cones and the machine hasn't had a chance to get going. They should let it run a bit before filling the order.

That's the only complaint I have for this location, so I guess overall they're doing a fine job.
author: tianyu l.

description:
I visited this place after working up an appetite from shopping. It wasn't too busy when we walked in, thank God 'cuz I was starving! The staff here seemed pretty friendly and down to earth. The guy that took our order had a great sense of humor!
We ordered their mini burger combos and added cheese (of course). They cook their burgers medium well/rare (I forget which one), so if you're like me and prefer well done, you have to request it. The burger and fries were delicious. The beef patty was juicy, but it was on the small size (4 oz). In fact, the burger was about the size of a Whopper Jr. (from Burger King, obviously). The portions are a bit on the small size for the amount you pay for, which is my only real complaint. Although you pay a little more for a burger, I do believe that it's worth it since the burgers are delicious. I wouldn't mind eating here again, whenever I'm back in the area.
author: Paulamertha A.

description:
***I did not get a chance to try Super Duper Burgers' tasty looking burgers and fries, but their Straus organic soft serve is very good and feels like a better value than the Straus organic soft serve available at nearby Gott's Roadside***

Super Duper Burgers is a very popular order-at-the-counter burger spot in San Francisco (they have several locations throughout the city).  This location is on Market Street near the Ferry Building and Union Square.  The restaurant is setup like a fast food joint where you order at the counter and the prices are not too bad--more expensive than other upscale fast food burger spots like The Habit, Five Guys Burgers and Fries and Fatburger but also less expensive than sit-down spots like Umami Burger and The Counter.

Burgers can be built like The Counter where you customize toppings to your liking.  Super Duper Burger touts the quality of their beef and chicken and their sandwiches looked good.  Unfortunately, I did not get a chance to try their burgers, but I did try their organic soft serve from Straus.

Their soft serve is available in cups and cones.  They have vanilla, chocolate and vanilla chocolate swirl.  You can also get their soft serve dipped in chocolate too.  I opted for their vanilla chocolate swirl and it was good.  The first thing that was really noticeable was just how pronounced the dairy was.  So many soft serve options out there have so much artificial flavoring that the dairy/milk/cream kind of gets lost in it.  You also get a nicely thick, dense and cold soft serve that is similar to Foster's Freeze and not the bright white, light soft serve of Dairy Queen, IKEA and McDonald's.

The vanilla flavor was good.  While it was not as good as a great vanilla bean ice cream, the vanilla flavor was noticeable and much more satisfying than the simply sweet cream flavors offered by many soft serve places.  The chocolate flavor was okay.  It was mild in flavor and not that rich or chocolatey.  Maybe it would have been better if I had just ordered the chocolate by itself and not in the swirl.

The cone was good too--light, crisp and fresh.

Super Duper Burgers' soft serve can also be used in several flavors of milkshakes here including strawberries and cookies and cream (in addition to vanilla and chocolate).

Service was excellent here--quick, polite and noticeably friendly.

Their soft serve prices are not bad.  Their soft serve is more expensive than a fast food joint (understandable though given that the quality is significantly better too).  Their soft serve is also slightly less expensive than the similar Straus soft serve at Gott's Roadside in the Ferry Building.

This Super Duper Burgers has a modern and industrial look and while there seems to be a fair amount of seating (including some tables outside), it gets really busy here and finding an open table can be difficult.

Super Duper Burgers' soft serve is a great and reasonably priced frozen treat.  It is one of the best soft serve cones I have had in a while.  Their burgers also look good and given the big crowds here, Super Duper Burgers is probably a good option for lunch in Union Square.

Due to its location near Union Square, there is not much parking around Super Duper Burgers.  There are a few pay parking structures and lots around here and they are pricey.  Metered street parking near the Ferry Building is also available.
author: Anthony N.

description: I'm rating it up. Actually only think of this place as a 3-star but didn't order a beer with my burger so I'm giving it an extra star for my oversight. But I did order a shake (cookies and cream) which stood up well. Would definitely go back to have a beer and burger. Went a little overboard with ordering one too many orders or garlic fries but did it out of eating with my eyes. Once again, my bad and not the restaurant's fault. Food didn't seem to be overly unhealthy like many other burger joints. Thumbs up for the quality ingredient. Can definitely tell!
author: Joni S.

description:
Love super duper burgers. They're incredibly tasty burgers, quality ingredients, and great amount of food! I highly recommend getting an egg on the burger, it really adds another level to their burgers.

The special sauce they have is delicious. I haven't tried their fries but I've known people who absolutely love their garlic fries. I'll definitely be going back.
author: John W.

description:
What can I say? The burgers are juicy, crispy around the edges and about as perfect as a griddled burger can be. Services is fast, efficient and friendly too, and the milk shakes? Mmmmmn, those are fabulous. 
Don't forget to help yourself to a house made pickle or two too, they're yummy.
author: J F.

description:
Summary: Overrated. The food is high quality, fresh, sustainable, organic, etc. As a result, it's expensive and trendy. The burgers have no flavor, though. Even when loaded up with toppings. There will be a line, and you will have to hunt for a table. I have no idea where to park to come here, but I didn't feel it was worth it. The garlic fries are good, but the extra sauces did not impress, nor did the homemade limp pickles.

I went here on a Tuesday evening after flying in to SF with my wife. The incredible number of positive reviews on Yelp immediately drew us here.  We waited about 5 minutes in line before we placed our order. Since I wanted to do a thorough review, I ordered the Super Duper Burger (which is the same as the mini, but with two patties), bacon, avocado, grilled onions, lettuce, tomato, cheese, jalapenos, and sauce. My wife got the mini burger with cheese and most of the sides, as well. We also got the garlic cheese fries with the three sauces and a glass of the old vine Zinfandel on tap. We had to stand around a bit before we pounced on a table that opened up.

Soon, our food was ready and we were diving in. First bite: ok. Maybe I missed some ingredients. Second bite: ok. Let me try this again. Third bite: ok. And that was that. The burgers are fresh and high quality, but they don't taste like much. It was shocking.  The garlic cheese fries are better, but super greasy and very strong flavored. The extra sauces were good, but can hardly justify $1.50. The total bill for everything was around $30, which was a bit on the high side given that it's like a Chipotle for burgers. The wine was good, the staff was friendly, but the experience was disappointing. We would not come again.
author: Jason K.

description:
It's not In N Out but it is really good and passes the no condiment test of good tasting quality meat. Don't forget to add bacon and cheese. 

Only bad thing is this full meal may cost you just under $20 for a burger fries and Beer/Shake/Soda. So sad because I want to eat here a lot.
author: Troy W.

description:
Decided to try this place out and I got helped
By a very nice and energized worker named Lisa. She recommended the super burger with cheese and avocado and let me tell you it was the best burger I've ever had. I will definitely be back and thank you to Lisa for helping me and giving me the best customer service!!!
author: Marissa G.

description:
I was really expecting a life changing burger from Super Duper, but I thought the burgers were pretty mediocre. Kinda oily/greasy if you ask me. Pretty messy to eat too... I got the mini burger and that was pretty filling. I thought it was going to be a slider. Line was pretty long on a Sunday afternoon, luckily there's a good amount of seating so you'll eventually find a place to sit and enjoy your burger. The bur

Overall, I wouldn't write off Super Duper, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. I think this location is probably one of the better ones scattered around the bay too.
author: Yannie S.

description: Nice review of Super Duper by former SF mayor Willie Brown in Sunday's San Francisco Chronicle March 16, 2014.  Awesome!!
author: David S.

description:
What do a herd of Community Managers want? Burgers! When do we want em? Now! 

You know it's been a long week when you're switching shoes with a co-worker to hobble yo paties to the nearest joint get a burger late into the night. Me and my ladies needed a bite, and we needed it ASAP. The trusty Yelp app put this place as the nearest bite to be had, so off we went. 

Service was slick and quick, our reputation had preceded us: A quick review of the check ins proved that everyone who's anyone had been into Super Duper that night. I ordered a single aaaannnnd and ice cream cone. I loved how fast it was and how organized the staff seemed to be, I also am a huge fan of people who are self starters. Meaning that no one was standing around, they were stocking, cleaning and keeping busy. Tight ship you run eh SDB? 

My burger was messy but pretty yummy, the ice cream cone was tasty too. The pickles are home-made, and that's totally my jam. 

Solid selection for those in need of a casual meal.
author: Trish S.

description:
Very odd experience at Super Duper this morning. Don't get me wrong food was good as usual. I always bring my out of town relatives/friends here and it easily becomes their favorite burger joint. But this morning I came in for breakfast and got a Mini Combo with sandwich (+cheese), mini donut, and small coffee. Price is advertised as $5.50... total comes out to $6.53. So I hand the cashier my card to pay and as I'm signing, I ask the cashier "are your prices still $5.50?" At this point I'm just curious since I already paid. 
Her: Are you talking to me?
Me: Yes...... 
Her: No, we raised them 
Me:But all your signs posted advertise $5.50
(She picks up the sign to look)
Her: Ohh you have to remember tax
Me: tax is only about 10%, so it should be 50 cents at most
no reply from her... She hands me my receipt and I walk away to wait for my food. I look at my itemized receipt as I wait and come to see that prices are still $5.50 as advertised, but cheese is an extra 50 cents and I also got charged for a bag I didn't ask for. Which is all fine, but i don't get why the cashier couldn't explain it to me.

Super Duper is still one of my favorite places and customer service is almost always excellent.   But today may have just been an off day...
author: Anna M.

description:
I remember my first visit at Super Duper very well:

I was with a friend and talking about how we'd try and live healthier, no fast food anymore, when we passed by this burger place and saw the offer of sliders. Quickly, our resolution changed to "oh, that's good, we can have a mini burger aka slider here and then grab a salad from somewhere else". As you may be able to guess, we ended up ordering a full meal with a burger and garlic fries and the homemade lemonade and all I can say is: Who needs salad when you can have burgers and especially garlic fries from Super Duper? Seriously, you need to try the garlic fries. The lemonade is a tad too sweet for my taste and yes, the burgers are greasy (but also tasty!), but nevertheless this is definitely one of the better burger places I've been to. The staff is cool, too.
Btw, I made Nicolas H. come here more often so he would give you the stars you deserve! ;)
author: Ilay I.

description: I've had the Super Burger and fries before and really enjoyed it.  This time around I ordered the Mini Burger. I expected to bite into a juicy, flavorful patty and was disappointed to find that it was REALLY dry and thin.  Not what I expected based on my previous experience.  Afterwards, I saw that the mini was only a 4 oz patty so I guess i can see how it could dry out...but still a bummer.   I'll give this place another shot but sticking to the Super Burger.
author: Kate G.

description:
Super Duper completely exceeded my expectations for the typical burger-fries-milkshake American meal. The location is so convenient (on Market, smack dab in the middle of Montgomery and Powell Bart), and it's definitely not as pedestrian as the Westfield food court or as touristy as anything right next to Union Square. 

The. Food. Is. Awesome. The patties here are all cooked to medium, and though I usually get medium rare, my medium patty was juicy and savory to the point of perfection. If you're here, you might as well get the whole shebang: garlic fries and a milkshake (please get the chocolate/strawberry swirl!) are a must. The free homemade pickles are crispy, fresh, and tasty. I don't even like pickles, and I enjoyed eating them here. 

**TIP** Get the egg. Seriously, if you like eggs and you've never tried it on a burger, I'm making this decision for you. Get the egg. Yes, it gets runny, and you might need about 10 extra napkins, but at the end of the day you'll be very satisfied with your (my) decision. They give you a fork and knife with the egg-burger too (I guess they know how messy it can get), but I'd advise just going for it with your hands. 

As for the service, I had a really great experience with the workers here -- they look happy to work here, and mine actually struck up a minute-long conversation with me! I rarely get that level of friendliness in any restaurant, let alone a burger joint, so I was very pleasantly surprised. 

One of the only negative aspects I can think of is how expensive the burger is. Maybe I just have some residual feelings from a childhood of cheap McDonald's and In-N-Out burgers... The base price for the single-patty mini burger isn't too bad ($5) but add-ons are pretty expensive (cheese is $.50, bacon/avocado/egg/etc are $1 each). I decided to go all out with my burger and added cheese, avocado, and egg -- the result was delicious, but made my wallet (and my arteries) cry. If you're feeling up to it, you can also order the "super burger" ($7), which is the same as the mini except with an extra patty.

The line also gets really long. We arrived around 6pm on a weekday and it wasn't too bad, but around 6:30 the line was almost out the door. Fortunately, the line moves quickly. It'll be difficult to get seating around that peak hours, too, although many people order to go. 

Overall, Super Duper is a wonderful place that definitely hits the spot for burger cravings. It's certainly worth a visit, especially if you're in the area!
author: Christine L.

description:
The total for me came to around $12-13 for a super duper burger with cheese and bacon, and garlic fries on the side. The bacon isn't the best bang for your dollar--it buys you about one chopped up piece of bacon sprinkled in the center of the burger. 

The real star of the show is the garlic fries, for sure. To make it the most cost effective trip, get a mini burger with cheese and use that extra $3 you saved from the super duper burger and bacon to buy EXTRA garlic fries. Seriously. We all know the burger is just there so you can take a break from eating the fries.
author: Joseph Y.

description:
This was my first time here.

Friendly welcoming staff!


My order was ready in less than 5 minutes and tasted AMAZING!
author: Ashley L.

description: Been here twice. Good solid burger, great fries, even better house pickles that you grab for yourself. This is my new hangout when I go downtown SF from now on!!!
author: Nancy T.

description:
I didn't try the burgers or fries here.

I just got a kids' cone of soft serve.  Holy moly.  For under $3.00, that's a LOT of soft serve.  

Creamy, ice cold, and delicious.  Addicting.   I'll be back.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I was with three friends on holidays in SF and we decided to give Super Duper Burguers a try after the great recommendtaions that we received about this place in the hostel that we were staying. We were starving and these burguers were a balsam to our soul. I had the mini burguer with Cheese and bacon (because I looooveeee bacon) and my friends tried the veggie burguer. Both options were amazing. 
If you are around the Union Square area or any other of its locations you should definitely try it. You won't regret it!!!
author: Laura C.

description: Our Bay Area friend took my boyfriend and me here after an evening of bar-hopping. I LOVED the burgers and fries here more than In-N-Out! I was able to choose my own toppings, which was similar to Five Guys on the East Coast. It was nice being able to sit and eat on the second floor. It was nearing closing time, so the tables and floors weren't as clean in between customers' use. I definitely would eat at Super Duper Burgers again during my next West Coast trip.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
First time there! I'll walk you through my experience.

I am walking toward the BART station and I see Super Duper Burgers. First, just the aesthetic was appealing. I love the look of the place and it just looked really clean. Well I realized I hadn't eaten all day so I decided to stop in and have a bite.

First thing I notice is that there are a lot of people and it's a bit crowded, but not too bad to the point where it turns me off. There was a very short line so that was nice. Well I look at the prices and while I have to admit the prices were a little bit high, they weren't ridiculous. I was hungry and I was willing to pay $100 for a sandwich.

So I get to the counter and I can absolutely say that the guy that rung me up was one of the nicest cashiers I've ordered from. I've had a lot of really nice cashiers and he was up there on my list.

Wait time took a little bit, it's not McDonalds, but it didn't take forever like other places I've been to. It was about average wait time. Just enough time to make me a little bit hungrier and getting my stomach ready.

My order is ready and I pick it up and the girl handing me the order was really nice to. I concluded that this food establishment has the best and nicest people working there. Truly lovely people.

Well I leave and eat my sandwich at the BART station. I ordered the Chicken Sandwich with Avocado. I took the first bite, and oh my goodness. The chipotle sauce (I think it was) was spicy but so delicious. I didn't expect such a spiciness, but it was totally worth it. The lettuce, tomatoes, onions, bread and everything in the sandwich looked and tasted so fresh. I was thoroughly surprised. I finished the sandwich so fast out of hunger and I am still in shock of how good it was. The spice is still lingering on my tongue and lips, but ahh I want more!

Amazing place I would go out of my way to go to. Seriously so good, and the friendly customer service was just the cherry on top (but still a big part of my review). 

Go here. You won't be disappointed.
author: Cameron K.

description: You can really feel the quality of the beef. Do add chess and bacon, it's worth the price. The fry wasn't that good but burger was excellent.
author: Master R.

description: This burger joint is definitely one of a kind and you need to order for here and enjoy the atmosphere inside. I ordered the typical super duper burger with garlic friends. That together is such a great staple from what everyone has told me about. Great location to eat at if you're not from the Bay area and are visiting SF.
author: Ray T.

description:
I had the chicken sandwich here with my family... both my brother-in-law and I felt it was one of the best chicken sandwiches we ever had.  My niece and nephew liked the burgers and fries - which I did not try.

Either way it was a pleasant surprise to have such a good experience at a place with such a goofy brand name
author: Raihan H.

description:
I tried all the.burger joints and Super Duper is up there. The patty quality is Super. Garlic fries are good also but goes well with a beer. 
The size of their mini burger was really as they say mini. They should put up pictures on their menu for the first comers.
author: Kevin C.

description:
I get such a random and powerful craving for Super Duper burgers and garlic fries, it's not even funny. The aged parm on the garlic fries, upon first taste and last bite, will have you thinking about these guys long after you embark onto your next adventure.

Oh, and those pickles. Man, oh man, they are perfection. Made in-house and placed around the drink area with little cardboard dishes, I can easily eat two trays to myself. The burgers are heavenly too. Salty, a good amount of greasiness, savory, filling. 

Sometimes they have donuts at the cash register, and I once asked what they were for, and the cashier straight up just gave me one, fo' free! I really want to try the portobello sandwich, but every time I smell the beef, all my previous plans go right out the window. Super Duper does it right.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Ordered the super burger, which is basically a double.

Too salty. Not juicy enough. The burger was not well balanced. The sweetness of the bun wasn't working well with the overly salty patties.

Yelp let me down on this one.

The journey continues, and Shake Shack is still king in this class.
author: Vinh C.

description: This place  never disappoints... I generally get the chicken sandwich with jalapeños, avocados, lettuce... Just wish there was more seating...
author: Sid G.

description:
I grabbed dinner here with my boyfriend before a Giants game today after seeing all the nice reviews on Yelp. Its location in Union Square was super convenient because we were looking for a cheaper, faster restaurant in the area to eat at. While there is usually a line, it moved fairly quickly. It's a bit tricky finding seating because there were so many people there, but there weren't too many people just standing around the restaurant waiting to sit. 

The guy who took our order was really nice - even asked about our day and what our plans were for the evening. Definitely a plus. My boyfriend ordered the Super Burger with cheese and a fried egg, and I got the Mini Burger with cheese. We also split an order of the garlic fries.

Everything was delicious. The patties were cooked exactly how I like my burger patties to be cooked - slightly pink in the middle. The buns were nice and filling, and the veggies were fresh as well. My boyfriend really liked the Super Sauce as well. Everything tasted flavorful and fresh, no complaints. The garlic fries were possibly the best fries I've ever had. They weren't too greasy and had so much aged cheddar on them, making them rich and delicious. They also weren't salty - something that I'm usually afraid of when I order fries with add-ons. Another plus were the house-made pickles they had in the jars next to the soda fountains. They were crunchy and delicious, and I got to snack on them before getting our order.

Definitely would come back here. It's not super cheap, but for the quality of food you get, I think it's worth it.
author: Bethany A.

description:
I stopped by this place with a friend because we were starving and didn't know where else to go that was good yet not madly expensive.

Nothing about this place has changed since my last visit. Service is still friendly and the place still gets quite busy. 

I chose to get a 4oz bacon cheeseburger with grilled onions and a fried egg and a spiked chocolate strawberry milkshake. This cost me a little less than $20. My friend got a 4oz burger too but I forgot what else he had in it. We split an order of garlic fries though.

Burgers are as good as always. I love that you can customize your burger (though it's at a price....). This was the first time I've had their spiked milkshakes. I wish I had ordered them sooner! Their milkshakes have always been good but spiked? Amazing. I thought they were gonna spike it with beer or something since that's what they have on tap, but they told me that the shake comes with a shot of vodka. Yes.

Delicious milkshake aside, my friend enjoyed his burger. We liked the fries yet we didn't...The garlic was fresh and it was there but the fries became limp and soggy after a few minutes. I hate when fries do that. I didn't have that problem with garlic fries from SD before so this was disappointing.

Still a great place to eat though. Definitely recommend the spiked shakes!
author: Sofia R.

description:
Went here for a late night burger ( about 9:30pm). It seemed crowded but I was impressed with how fast and friendly the service was.


Definitely order the mini burger: it is not mini at all: I was craving a burger and it easily satisfied my craving. I am a sucker for bacon burgers and the bacon was cooked perfectly, plus there was a lot of it. Worth the  extra 50 cents.

Also you must order the garlic fries. Not crazy heavy at all and to die for. The perfect amount of garlic and fresh shredded cheese, 


Now why after this great review do you see me giving this establishment 3 stars? The soft serve. I spontaneously decided to get a vanilla dipped cone on my way out. Worst decision I made all day. The cone was so poorly dipped and the chocolate and ice cream kept dropping: also the ice cream was terrible flavor. So watered and very little flavor. Not creamy at all. Honestly McDonald soft serve is better. Not worth the four dollars. I so regret not taking the extra walk to coldstone. 

If it wasn't for this ice cream SuperBurger would have gained a new Super Fan.
author: Alyssa D.

description:
Eh YUM.

So just to get it out of the way, as you know, the burger is nice. Good quality meat is the stand out trait. I'd say pretty lacking in the sauce department though and could do with being seasoned more - I didn't think the flavours were there to make it a GREAT burger that I'd be running back for, but it was good all the same. 

The star of the show in my eyes is the garlic chips. Sweet mother of potato. The chips are rough cut from the potato so still have some skin on there and are lovely and crunchy. They're then topped with garlic butter and cheese. My lord. They were just so tasty. Do yourself a favour and get the trio of sauces to go with it. They are immense. I'd go back just for them alone.

Top it all off with a chocolate malt milkshake and BOOM. You're not gonna be able to move for hours. Enjoy.
author: Emily C.

description: We honestly came here because it's literally across the street from our hotel and the 4 year old was demanding a cheeseburger (and I didn't want to pay $18 for one at the hotel restaurant). I wasn't expecting anything "super duper"...just a burger. Place was packed for a Wednesday evening, which should be a good sign, however I wasn't very impressed. The guy working the register was rude when we had a miscommunication. Food came out dine in when I asked for togo and the girl acted like I wanted the whole thing remade when I mentioned it. Got the order back to the room and it was totally wrong. Paid for the extra sauces and only one was any good, one honestly tasted like bananas? I have no clue what it was supposed to taste like but I have a feeling it wasn't bananas. Burger was fine, kinda greasy. Not super duper, more okey dokey.
author: Mar G.

description:
Impeccable customer service; juicy, succulent meat that melts in your mouth; tart pickles to loosen the clogged arteries; and a runny egg that brings a sweet meaning to "money shot".

John/Jon puts the "Super" and the "Duper" in "Super Duper Burger". He makes pigs fly (or in my case, he made the pigs stop flying so that I could make it home instead of chasing god-knows-what to god-knows-where).

Thank yo
U
author: Elaine N.

description:
Somehow, in my mind, when I think of San Francisco, I think of Super Duper. And man, do I miss this place.

This one was right around the corner from our hotel during our stay in SF and we made the "mistake" of going here when we first arrived. We took one bite of their veggie burger with extra avocado and free pickles and that's all it took to become completely addicted.

The burgers were a perfect size, and those garlic fries... Hell yeah!

Over the course of our stay we went back about 4 times. That might seem a bit outrageous, but the food was fast, tasty and just around the corner.

Whenever I come back to San Francisco, Super Duper will be first on the list!
author: Seya A.

description: This is hands down my favorite go-to burger place.  I don't often give five stars, however I love this place. Every couple of weeks or so my fellow Church friends who work in the city all get lunch on our lunch breaks. The service is always friendly and the food is phenomenal. First, the burger, I got a Super Duper and had it ordered well done, as they often cook the meat medium rare, with extra cheese and avocado. The burger had a hefty helping of meat and loaded with oooey gooey cheese, I also really love the garlic fries, which come with melted cheese, literally the best fries I have ever had. I also got a strawberry shake, which was good, but not amazing. Although Super Duper is a little on the pricey  side, it is worth it considering that the Super Duper and fries is a pretty filling meal, not to mention that lactose laden milkshake haha, I will be back soon :)
author: Alex M.

description: One of the best burgers I have ever tried since In N Out and Five Guys. The place is very popular so it was pretty crowded but service was very quick and my burger came out shortly after my order was placed. I always add cheese and bacon to my burger. I really like how the cheese and meat on the burger is so cheesy, which makes me more good. Really cool burger place in the Bay Area!
author: Keung P.

description: This place was amazing. Loved all the home made  pickles and delicious beef. It was so good and glad we got to go. I definitely recommend going here and trying if you love burgers!
author: misty o.

description: Super Combo and Garlic Fries with Racer 5 beer!!! On point. Just the Burger Alone was awesome!!!
author: Art E.

description:
so soooo glad we stumbled upon this gem. We would pass by it whenever we would leave/come back from our hotel! definitely the best cheap eat in SF by far. Also, undeniably comparable to shake shack!!

Love that the service is so quick and the place is so clean (kind of reminds me of chipotle), and the ingredients are of the highest quality. ordered a mini with cheese and garlic fries, and that did it for me. such a win. the patty was soo juicy and had that toasted exterior, melted american, tomatoes and a soft bun. simple yet so delectable.

wasn't it in my to do list for sf but would highly recommend it to everyone after trying it in soma!!
author: Chesca L.

description: This place is basically a less tasty version of Shake Shack. There are a ton of similarities (decor, menu item, food presentation).  It's a decent burger and fries.
author: Ravi G.

description: Really good; especially for a place on market where all the tourists are.  Good size and good food. It even has good seating area for a quick bite.
author: Daniel M.

description:
The good thing about this location is that there is ample seating and good service/customization options (such as putting sauces to the side). 

The not so good thing about this is that Super Duper Burgers are super duper greasy. I am a burger fanatic and this is one of the greasiest joints I've eaten at. Yes, burgers are naturally oily, but have you seen the way Shake Shack or In-n-Out or Smith & Wollensky prepare their burgers? Hint: the bottom bun is not so greasy/soggy to the extent that I am reminded of a wet diaper. This was the case for three Super Duper and Chicken Burgers.

I love indulging in the guilty pleasures of eating a cheeseburger, but when it reminds me of escalated risks of heart attacks then please count me out.
author: Lee T.

description: Omg garlic cheese fries are a must. The burger was good. Was disappointed they wouldn't grill my jalapeño but still good. Nice homemade pickles. Best part having a beer with my burger!
author: Lori P.

description: Maybe one of the best chicken sandwich I EVER had... This place was delicious. The burger was so good and juicy, the garlic fries were bomb. And the homemade pickles were delicious! The sauce they use in the chicken sandwich was delicious. Will definitely come back.
author: Peter O.

description:
I love burgers, and I'm in the city 75% of the week, so I figured I better get with the program and try this Super Duper place everyone's been hollering about. 

Well, it's pretty good! I like my meat cooked a certain way (light medium rare) which can be easily messed up on the line when the cooks are flipping dozens of burgers at a time. Luckily my burger was cooked perfectly both times I went. However, my husband ordered a Super Burger and both patties were overcooked and burned. Also, the two patties combined looked about the same size as my one Mini Burger patty, which is weird because supposedly all the patties are 4 oz. Anyway, the Mini Burger was enough food for me on both occasions but next time I might try the double patty. The fries were enjoyable from what I remember. I like my burgers relatively plain so I can't speak for the sauce, but my sister-in-law seems to really love it.

If you're a picky eater (like we are) just know that the burgers automatically come with sauce, lettuce, tomato, onion, jalapenos, and pickles, so if you want to alter that just let them know. You can also add avocado, mushroom, egg, and bleu cheese for an addition buck or buck and a half. Haven't tried the garlic fries or shakes but they look delicious so they're a must for next time.

Also, apparently they serve breakfast!? Breakfast sandwiches and donuts!? Where has this place been all my life? If it was located closer to my office I'd be 50 lbs heavier by now.
author: Ashley C.

description:
late review... never knew this existed!! stumbled upon it walking around the perimeter of union square area.. noticed lots of people walking in. in my mind I was thinking "it must be good"!!! and daaaaaang!!

I walk in and the line is already about 10 deep! whatda!!! (in a good way) anyway ordered a super duper. maaaaan was it big! I struggled to finish as I'd already had some food truck earlier... I think my record would have been 3 in one day in New York actually. anyway that's another story.... 

I wish my phone hadn't died to take photos as momento... but alas... it was big! Juicy and the cheese completes it as one of the best all rounders!!! damn it I just want a big bite now!! not the whole burger but just a bite!! okok maybe 2 bites.... 

you guys have it good there
author: Danny T.

description: The line looks intimidating but it goes by fast! The veggie burger is delicious! I added avocado and everything on it. It was really yummy, and the "dirty sauce" was a nice touch too. My friend had a bite of my veggie burger (she's a meat eater) and said that was one of the best veggie burgers she's tried. The garlic fries- omg! So delicious! I'd share the garlic fries with others though because it is a lot to consume... I shared with my friend and I still ate way too much garlic. I reeked the entire night. My friend got the regular fries. If I were to get those, I'd get the dipping sauce too. The plain fries are just whatever. The table situation is super cut throat... I actually wouldn't ever come back because of the table situation. Everyone was super rude and trying to snatch tables from people who were waiting. Thankfully I got lucky, but I was observing others deal with it and I felt so bad.
author: Kim P.

description:
Since I knew my 400th review was right around the corner (400 down, how many more to go?), I decided to save Super Duper for this very occasion.  I mean, with that kind of name, it seemed kinda fitting.  After all, it's not just any review...but a landmark, Super Duper review!  Har har har...

Assuming you're getting a burger, ordering is really like getting it your way - choose between the Mini (4 oz) or Super (8 oz), decide which condiments you want (or "Everything on It"), and pick whatever other add-on's you want (cheese, bacon, avocado, etc.).  Since the Mini seemed a bit small, I knew the Super Burger was the way to go.  However, since the place isn't just called "Super", I had to add the Duper to my burger.  So, after getting "Everything On It", I added on bacon, avocado, and cheese.  Oh, and garlic fries.  Cuz, you know, if you're going to go Duper, you might as well go DUPER.

After our orders came out, we grabbed our trays and headed upstairs to get a table on the balcony above the kitchen.  That way, not only could we smell our own food, but everyone else's as well.
