Although the burger wasn't quite perfect, it was pretty damn good.  Even with all the extras I added, you could taste that the patty had some flavor to it, and that it was pretty juicy without being oily.  The burger was good on its own, but the bacon, avocado, cheese, and grilled onions (included) just made it that much better.  And the garlic fries?  Loved them.  While some places can be too light/heavy with the garlic, this one was perfect.  Also, plus points for the service - despite my burger apparently missing the avocado (other than the small slice at the end), one of the workers was nice enough to give me more without making me prove it was missing.

For me, the only thing that really holds them back is the price.  The burger itself is not all that bad ($6.50 for the Super), but it sure can add up with the extras.  After throwing in the bacon, avocado, and cheese, I hit the $10 mark, which approaches "gourmet burger" territory.  Compared to a few of those in the city, Super Duper falls a little short.  Still, $10 isn't terrible for a good burger, and they definitely beat out places like Mel's in that price range.  Plus, gotta give them their due for using 100% compostable or reusable packaging/materials.

And by the way, did you know there are multiple locations now in SF?  I sure didn't.  That is, until after I had already circled the one in the Castro a near dozen times, parked (finally), walked in, called my friend, and then realized that she was actually at this location instead.  Whoops!  But even with that mishap, the burger made up for it...and then some.
author: Mike L.

description: Burgers weren't as good as I expected. Patties were too thin and cheese wasn't melted enough. Didn't like how they only put one leaf of lettuce in the burgers. Fries were decent. Umami and In n Out are better by far.
author: Tammy P.

description:
Another Yelp-win for the history books!

I wasn't quite sure what to expect from this generically-named burger joint on Market Street... Yelp reviews show it must be good, but is it a fancy, elitist burger joint, or just some hole-in-the-wall with good food?  They hit somewhere in the middle... I'd call it "casual hipster," I suppose.

The burger menu is simple, à la In-N-Out; no fancy toppings or crazy combinations, just burger or double-burger, cheese or no cheese, and the standard lettuce-tomato-onion-sauce fixin's.  and it's tasty.  You could definitely tell they used good ingredients, and knew what they were doing.  I was a little disappointed in the size, at first, but after all was said and done, it was actually very right-sized.  I was definitely stuffed by the end.

The chocolate milkshake was top-notch.  and the garlic fries?  The Mrs. claims they're even better than AT&T ... and it's hard to beat garlic fries that come with a Giants game!!

I'll definitely be back here, or to one of their other locations at least.  I'm sure it's only a matter of time before the word has spread and they expand throughout the Bay Area!
author: Chris Y.

description: Googled "burgers" in San Fran and decided on this place. Me and my boyfriend loved it. It reminds me a bit of in n out but like 10x better. I wish I could go back just to eat here. They're burgers were delicious and juicy and fries were really good too, as well as their shakes. Can't wait to go back!
author: Lupita C.

description:
I wasted my first burger in Cali on In-N-Out. Huge mistake. This place should be the staple West Coast burger place. Their burgers are indeed 'Super'.

First, they give you FREE pickles!! I'm not even a pickle fan but theirs are pretty good. Try eating them with the fries...just try it.
Next, their burgers:
Burgers are the size they should be, none of that kids meal crap
Burgers are cooked medium so they're still juicy AND delicious
Burger sauce is a good compliment
Last, their fries are cooked perfectly- not too soggy not too crunchy

I highly recommend. Skip In-N-Out altogether
author: Taru T.

description: If I had a dollar for every crappy veggie burger I've had I would have enough to pay for this delicious one. But really the veggie burger was the best I've had yet. Pricey but really good!
author: Sierra W.

description: Delicious food, kind of fast food but really yummy and healthy!!! Good prices. Little busy, but service goes amazingly smooth. Loved it!!
author: Ewelina D.

description: For a chain burger joint it's pretty good. Being from So Cal, In N Out is king! Shakes are pretty legit, service was good. If you're short on time and need to get a burger this place will do it for you.
author: Tony J.

description:
Others seem to enjoy Super Dupers' meat-based offerings, but I can say without a doubt that their veggie burger is among the worst ever offered, anywhere.  The patty is utterly flavorless, and hard as a rock.  That explains why they slather it with not just their "special sauce" (aka flavored mayonnaise), but also with hummus.  The burger comes out a hot mess, with way too much sauce that (I suppose thankfully) completely overpowers the hockey-puck burger.

The fries are standard fare, and everything is vastly overpriced.  I had been itching to check out Super Duper burger, but it proved to be Super Duper crappy.  I'll never set foot in the place again.
author: Cody V.

description:
Wanted to get a quick bite and was close by.  Burger was good, as well were the regular friends.  Pickles were spicy.  The only thing that was different was the lemon aid.  Just a different taste than I was use to.
The place had a nice vibe and was able to chat with a friend and have a burger.
author: John J.

description:
For a chain burger shop, this place rocks.  Super Duper is as good as any of the LA chain burger joints...like Umami and Smash.  Prices are also great.  Meat is seasoned well and cooked even better.  Good bun to meat ratio, garlic fries are pretty sick too.

Steve out
author: Steve M.

description: Good stuff. The service was good, burgers hot and juicy and their condiments flavorful. Their garlic fries weren't too garlic-y and the cheese went well with it. If you're interested in a good burger that's less than $10 then be sure to go here.
author: Suzy R.

description:
I gotta say, they make a good burger here.  And fast??!!??  My god, at the height of lunch time, they cooked my mini cheese w/bacon perfectly in under 5 minutes.  Hot fresh and cooked to perfection.  It's a tasty lil sucker too.

They do the shit right here, breh.

Ya feel me?
author: Johnny L.

description: Great burgers and fries. The 4oz patties were enough to satisfy my hunger. They have a pickle jar near the condiments. The ketchup tasted like pasta sauce so I imagine it was their special recipe.
author: W A.

description: We (myself, husband & son) were on our way to Johnny Rockets when we ran across Super Duper Burger & thought looks good let's try it! And we were all very happy we did thee freshest burger I've ever had we will definitely be back the vibe was chill & to see the steady stream of people coming in just proved that it was "Burger Heaven" (my son's word's)!
author: JandP V.

description:
I like that they're pretty sustainable however their burgers were definitely not "super". Their super sauce was too mayonnaise-ey to be anything special. The  chipotle sauce however, was pretty good; If eating here again I'd probably sub their super sauce for this.

The prices were pretty fair considering quantity and the little above average quality compared to the average fast food joint. 

Contrary to their sign their burgers were not juicy at all! If you have good quality meat why can't you cook it to a perfect medium rare? If not just make that shit greasy, just don't lie to me! 

The garlic fries were hellla good though! Very generous with the cheese. Shakes looked yummy as well .

Place is not bad but if you don't work in the city/not in a hurry and are craving a burger I'd suggest elsewhere...but maybe I just got unlucky and need to give them another chance!
author: Melissa C.

description:
For the Mini Combo (single patty, fries and a soda) it was a good price.

The burger was definitely fresh and tasted good but I felt like something was missing. Meat was tender and had a great meaty quality to it without feeling heavy.

I really, really wanted to like it more than In N Out but sadly, it just didn't make the cut. 

The fries were good and definitely done well. I have no complaints but if you were to ask me where is my go to burger spot it wouldn't be Super Duper.

Overall Thoughts

Super Duper was not for me but that doesn't mean it isn't a great burger joint
author: Eddie W.

description:
Super Duper makes tastebuds happy!

I usually order the cheese burger mini with garlic fries.  It is delicious!  But that's not all, make sure to grab as many as you can eat pickles near the condiment section.  You'll be sure to have a crunchy good time.  

If you get here at just the right time, you can avoid the mega long Disneyland lines during lunch hour.  Between 1130-1150AM, you'll be at the front of the line as you walk in.  But once 12pm pumpkin time hits, lines are out the door and sometimes wrap slightly... So, get your burger tushy there early to avoid the line.
author: Jenny T.

description: Pretty solid burgers. Line is a little long at times but worth the wait. Breakfast and donuts are also great too. You have to go with the milkshake.
author: Bryan M.

description: Good food. A little pricey, but you're in the city so what do you expect. The super burger with bacon and a fried egg is as good as previously anticipated, though be advised, the egg can be slightly under cooked in the whites of the egg, thus affecting the texture of the bun. Still, amazing place and I can't wait to go back again.
author: James M.

description:
The vanilla ice cream at this location was different from the one in valley fair. This location has better vanilla flavor, color was warmer/more yellow, and texture is nice & firm. The only in valley fair had soft texture like mcdonald's soft serve, melted too quickly, and didn't taste as good.

The burgers are consistently very good and the fries are solid too. Interesting that Super Duper has started to take over in the Bay Area, seems like a huge lost opportunity for Shake Shack (which is actually better than super duper)...they could've started here several years ago.
author: Philip L.

description: Delicious burgers! A little pricey but well worth it. They have a great selection of desserts too. And I would really want to come back to try the breakfast.
author: David C.

description: This wasn't a total love fest for me.  Maybe I shouldn't  order a chicken sandwich at a burger place, but I did so let's work through that.  In my experience, chicken sandwiches at these kind of places always hit the mark.  Today was the exception, however.  The chicken is marinated in something spicy--a sharp kick with each bite.  The bun was fresh and cheese/lettuce helped neutralize the kick from the chicken, however it was too much and I wasn't feeling it.  Of course I ate every bite and while it wasn't a love, I would definitely go back and try the burger. It's well-noted for my next visit.  And hello, they have breakfast sandwiches?? I'm all over it!
author: Christine T.

description: The hamburgers were juicy, chicken was seasoned well and spicy, restaurant was clean and service was good and speedy. I would recommend the mini burgers unless you really wanted a big super duper burger, it was big.
author: Steven P.

description: My second time for my meat craving. Super fast and delicious! I love the mini burger- just the right portion. They have an upstairs for seating.  The place was packed for a Saturday evening the place was cleaned by the staff. Floor on the second floor was slippery.
author: Stephanie C.

description: One of the best burgers. Get bacon in it too- makes it even better. It's so juicy, it's a little messy, but it tastes so wonderful, that's why it's messy. It's a bit of a trip here if you don't come tie this area often, but when you're in the area, you should definitely get a super duper burger.
author: Courtney D.

description: The burger is very delicious, but stay away from the garlic fries.. because your breath will be smelling all day
author: Aziza B.

description:
My friend and I ate here on our first night in San Francisco since it was about five minutes away from our hotel. I'm a huge fan of burgers, so I was excited about trying out Super Duper Burgers. I bought the super burger with garlic fries and really liked my meal. I didn't expect to have THAT much garlic on my fries (by looking at pictures, I easily mistook the minced garlic as shredded cheese), so I was eventually turned off from the fries after eating 2/3 of it. 

The environment was really cool and the location was very convenient and easy to access.
author: Sheena V.

description: Stayed at the palace hotel, within walking distance and the super burger was on the next level! I got it with bacon and cheese and I was beyond impressed. Best burger I've had in years!
author: William T.

description: Loveeee it! Their lemonade is super tasty and fresh. Their fries are delicious and that veggie burger is amazing! I always add cheese and avocado. Wish there was one in Bakersfield. Second visit. Friendly customer service as well.
author: A M.

description:
Really? This is what all the hype was about? I got a super burger with everything and grilled onions. The burger was delivered with 2 grilled onion strings on top. In general it was very dry; certainly not cooked to their prescribed medium. 

All the hype left me with high hopes but I was very disappointed. Maybe with an egg, bacon and extra sauce it would be respectable but as it stands it was a waste of $7
author: Matt J.

description:
Three teenage boys and I found this on Yelp after checking out A friend's art show on Sutter. Burgers was on the top of the list of food choices. Super Duper has super Yelp reviews so we plugged into the little map finder and the boys navigated us to Market Street where our noses took over as directional devices. I immediately liked the space, energy and menu. We got three large (double) cheeseburgers and milk shakes for the boys, a small/regular burger for me, three orders of regular fries and one garlic cheese fries and a soda for $60something and change.
Burgers were a messy hit. Garlic fries were devoured. Too many regular fries. Tasty but not very thick shakes. Four thumbs up.
author: Maria M.

description: Was in the area looking for something to eat and came across this GEM!!! I love my burgers and I like even more when they have come from a healthier stand point on how fresh and sustainable the menu is. I had the 8oz burger juicy burger added the grilled onions and jalapenos and it was amazing. I also got the combo with the garlic fries and drink. I wasn't to impressed with the fires something was lacking, I would definitely come back and get another burger in the future and skip the fries.
author: Ruben R.

description:
Hands down the best burger I have ever had! I got the garlic fries and the super burger. Ok the garlic fries had so much garlic, it was so delicious!! I wish I could have some right now. The burger was so juicy and just amazing. Just writing about it makes me want to eat there again. 
I would totally recommend it and I will be definitely coming back.
author: Ester U.

description:
This place is quite good.  It reminds me of BareBurger from home (New York). Juicy organic meat and veggies. We ordered the chicken salad and the super burger. I enjoyed their pickles, I love that it's open there for your choosing.

The burger was juicy, not too heavy, however, perhaps it was my patty, but it was overly salty. I wished we tried their garlic fries though! It was nice that you can order beer along with your meals. 

This was actually better than In and Out in my opinion.
author: Louise C.

description:
I've never eaten at Super Duper.

They recently put one a block away from my job and I now walk past it every morning.

On my way to work this morning, I finally walked in for coffee. I saw that they brewed four barrel and bought a cup--not bad. Later, few co-workers and I ordered lunch. I got the veggie burger with fries--not bad but not really worth the $12.52.

Anyways, I'm giving this place a 5 start due to their customer service! It's been a long time since I received excellent customer service like this; I'd go back just for that :)
author: This Is M E.

description:
Had the super burger with bacon and cheddar cheese, garlic fries, and a scrimshaw.

Burger was cooked well, service was quick and atmosphere was pleasant.
author: John P.

description:
It's like if FiveGuys graduated from college, moved out of their campus apartment, and got a real job!  If I'm in SF and I want a solid burger that's 100% everytime, I go to Super Duper.  This local chain is doing well for a reason people, give them your money!

The Burger is simple, but always on point.  You can customize to a point, but the options don't get outrageous.  I do recommend the bacon and fried egg.  The meat is always super juicy, and flavorful.  It does seems to be seasoned on the lighter side though, the only minus in my assessment.

The supporting cast members are very dependable as well.  Add the garlic and cheese to the fries...you deserve it!  Don't forget the pickles too, you'll regret it if you do.

Also, I had lunch with Lebron at Super Duper!  Ok, maybe it was more like I was eating lunch and he walked by...
author: Josh M.

description: It's definitely a place for burger lovers with reasons price. I love every bit of it. The only thing i recommend is to heat up the but a lil before serving.
author: Ming M.

description:
Avoid this location; Go to the one on Mission St!!!
3 times I've tried this location; The burgers are over-cooked (instead of medium). The burger toppings are missing something if you customize. 
Reason I feel is long lines and they are in a rush. Won't be back!
author: Philip T.

description:
My family stopped here for dinner after a day trip into the bay, taking the kids to the exploratorium. My son requested we eat here, since his father who works in the bay, raves about it all the time. The food tasted fresh and was well cooked. Everyone enjoyed their meal, but the garlic fries were the best! 
Unfortunately the service was sub-par! Our cashier seemed new to the job, as it was very aparent that she was annoyed when I changed my order from a burger to a chicken sandwich,  & she had to get a manager to assist her. She was unpleasant & mediocre at best. Thankfully the food made up for her  service!
author: Natasha R.

description:
I came into the city for lunch with a couple of friends before we went bouldering. Luckily, the friend who drove us knew of a nearby parking garage. When we got to the place, there was a line out the door. It was about a 30-minute wait to place our order. Finding seating during the SF financial district is an art in itself. One must be alert and anticipate movements.

I ordered the Super Combo that included a burger, fries, and a drink. I also ordered a Cookies and Cream shake. All this food totaled out to $20 which seemed way more than it was worth. The fries were OK and the burger was good but extremely greasy. But that might've been because of the grilled onions. My friend ordered the same thing and pools of oil wound up in her ketchup. The shake was amazing and the highlight of the meal. They also have complimentary pickles that were delicious.

The restaurant itself has a very rustic-chic design to it, very similar to Chipotle's. They have a couple beers on draught which is always a plus for any burger joint.

Overall:
Long lines and high prices for a bare-bones burger. Overhyped.
author: Danny A.

description:
Word on the street told me to come to this burger joint.  So i had to go try it for myself!

You can either get the single or the double patty, Honestly the single patty was enough if you're getting fries as well.  
The burger i have to say was amazing! I eat burgers pretty often so i know if a burger is good or not.  If i had to compare it to something, i would say the burgers here is much better than In-N-Out.  Don't hesitate to get toppings on your burger because it would just add to the tastyness of it!

Also, may i suggest upgrading the fries to the garlic fries!  Why get regular fries when you can get garlic fries for a dollarish more!  It is definitely worth getting, and it complements the burger fairly well i must say!

The place is pretty clean and hipsterish with dim lights.  There is a small upstairs seating as well.

Overall I would come here again if i was craving a upperclass burger.
author: Adam L.

description: Not quite a 4 stars, but more than 3 stars. So to say everything is good: bread, meat, lettuce, service, etc. This makes a good burger, not excellent, but good!
author: Alex G.

description:
So much late-night love for the Super Duper. This has become a bar-hopping rest stop many nights now, and it never gets old. The veggie burger here is so good, I haven't even worked my way into the other burgers yet. They put hummus and cucumbers on it, and everything is so FRESH. House-made pickles (for free!) only seal the deal for me. Fries are delicious, spiked shakes are insane, and they have beers on tap. 

Why would I ever leave?
author: Laura B.

description: I like ordering the mini burger and adding the free range egg to it. Although a mini may sound small, it is definitely enough to get me full along with my side order of garlic fries which are a MUST for me when I come here as well. Overall I've had a great experience every time I've come to Super Duper Burgers and I will definitely be back.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Seriously, if there's a single reason to come to Super Duper, it's for the cookies and cream soju milkshakes. Milkshakes are already one of my all time favorite indulgences, but add booze to the mix and you've got yourself something magical! 

Post script: don't be afraid to try the deep fried portabella sandwich. Not only do I think it's amazing, hordes of my usually meat-frenzied friends swear it's better than any beefy burger on their menu. There's life beyond the bovine, by friends.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
A place like this can work. It's got a cool, easy name and nice logo with a good looking typeface and color scheme. The wrappers have cute bichrome colored print. The walls have a patterned print too. Food is served on aluminum trays. And free, unlimited, housemade pickle wedges! I am in pickle heaven. Other things that I love about the place include completely compostableware and the nice wall hook block in the restroom.

There's all sorts of beverages here. There are about 4 wines on tap, 3 beers on tap, bottled soft drinks, regular fountain drinks, housemade lemonade with brown sugar, organic iced tea, shakes, and alcoholic shakes. There's a burger with two patties, a burger with one patty, chicken sandwich, a veggie burger, a portabello burger, and some salads. Menu with prices are online. I love that it's straightforward.

The burger was juicy and dripping with it and oil. I saw a tray of unformed patties being carried from the mezzanine seating and it looked mighty fresh. The burger bun claimed to be artisanal, but I found it bready and tough. It held well though, not like those limp buns that collapse under a good grip. The garlic fries were less garlic and more parm. They certainly don't need the special sauces. I'd try them with the regular fries. Haven't made it to the softserve cones yet, but I'll do so next time.

1 super burger, 1 mini burger, 1 garlic fries, and 1 fountain drink = $17
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Many of my admirers are curious about my development in a summer-like body. I think some of you want to see me with an Adonis-body.  

Well, to tell you the truth, I'm not quite there yet. But I haven't had a burger of any kind since my burger at Hall of Flame. But I have had other corrupt crap in between but nothing too bad. 

My first burger in nearly two months comes from the second Super Duper location, which is currently one of the hottest businesses at the moment. 

This place, which has been only opened one month, is a bigger location than the Castro location with mainly tourists and workers from financial district dining the new location. 

From the menu, I had the "Super Burger". For $6.50, I get a thick-ass 8oz Niman Ranch Beef patty with cheese ($.50 extra), lettuce, grilled onions and the restaurant's tangy "secret" sauce. I also added a side of Garlic fries for another $2.50. The burger was juicy with the grease dripping down my long sleeve. The grease went to my fries, in which adds a kick in my fries (you can see my picture of the thick and greasy patty). The thick patty: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zjlwTVZOyCU8OzzUPEavQQ?select=vcej9kYDwwf5smmlixbxhQ

I can't have a burger without a beer. And my first beer in a month, I took a 22oz glass of Racer5 IPA for $5.00. One sip of the local beer, my face was instantly glowing to a fiery red. 

The manager noticed my red face and my inebriated behavior. I appreciated his good work and his kind words. 

He also told me that there be two more locations coming within the next few months: Chestnut Street and another location in the city of Mill Valley (one of my "quick tips" posted from my app). 

When I heard the exciting news about the third location in the Marina District, I cheered like the Giants just won the World Series. 

You can tell I was "drunk"!

Now back to my diet!
author: Matt G.

description:
Mini burger = one patty. Super burger = 2 patties

BURGER
The mini burger was very good. We got it with a FRIED EGG and it made all the difference. The meat is tender and juicy, and the size of the mini burger is perfect. I actually shared this burger so that I could eat a dinner soon after. 

FRIES
I wanted to try the garlic fries, but since we were going to be socializing soon after, we got the regular fries instead. Good, crispy, yummy fries.
author: Debby L.

description:
Super Duper lived up to it's name.  I visited Super Duper my last night in San Francisco with a Co-worker and I am so glad that I did.  At first I was apprehensive because it was super packed but then I had to remind myself that I was not in my hometown and they seemed to have a pretty efficient method of dealing with the crowd.

   While I was waiting in line I notice that most people were walking around with these really big burgers and so when it was my turn to order I asked the cashier if then had a smaller version of what I was seeing.  Lucky for me they had a mini meal for $9.25.  So I order the mini  to go with grilled chicken sandwich and I substituted my fries for garlic fries.  It took about 10 minutes to get my food which was understandable given the crowd size.  

   Walking back to the hotel made me want to try the food even more because The aromas from the food kept emanating from the bag penetrating my nose.  Suffice it to say when I was settled back in my room I dove right into my food.  It was really good. It was dare I say...super duper.  

   I got full half way through my meal caught the itis and went to sleep.  If anyone would have saw me the next morning I would have been really embarrassed.  I woke up from a food coma, in my draws, with food wrappers laying next to me. Luckily I packed great toothpaste and bodywash because smelling like day old garlic fries is not cute.

Here's my advice for anyone contemplating eating at Super Duper:

1.) Don't think about it just live in the moment and buy that fat ass burger.
2.) Do not eat your meal near a bed because you may catch the itis and wake up from a food coma smelling like garlic fries.
3.) Have strong, mints, toothpaste whatever on deck for the after affects of your meal
4.) Stop reading reviews and go experience Super Duper!
author: Whitney J.

description:
Super Duper is a great burger joint. You'll take a hit and want to keep hitting it........

They cook everything on the spot, so you food might take a while to come out but, its super fresh. The patties are thick and juicy and cooked perfectly. The fries are great too, a bit on the thicker side. What's great is that they have home made pickles. They are laying around somewhere near the ketchup. Don't forget to get a paper bowl of these bad boys while getting your other sauces. 

Super Duper is slightly better than In & out in my opinion.
author: Allen C.

description: I don't usually eat burgers, I only ever started eating when I visited America this year and they have the best burgers I've had so far. Their secret sauce is awesome and the garlic fries are TO DIE FOR!!! Nothing compares. Their milkshakes are heaven too!! If you're looking for a budget friendly burger meal in SF, this is the place to go!
author: Janica G.

description:
I am SPEECHLESS. That was the best burger I have ever eaten! They have free pickles and (this may not be  big deal to some) the free water isn't from the tap! And, wow, the burgers are delicious. You can have a super duper burger (2 patties) or a mini burger (1 patty). There's also a wide variety of toppings that you can add.
      Super Duper has a very casual feel with very friendly workers. Note that the line gets long around 8 at night.
author: Chloe K.

description:
OKAY. This location is a lot better than the Castro one, but this place isn't ALL that great. 

So the menu: SUPER DUPER: TWO PATTIES basically and the rest of it are add-ons like egg and bacon. 

At first, my burger looked amazing. Don't get me wrong, with that egg on top of it makes it exceptionally appealing, but the fact the burger is just mediocre. After trying many other burger joints; I think I can be satisfied with in and out.

The garlic fires are good at the moment, but boy, I got so thirsty afterwards.

Oh, and this place isn't good during lunch time. The line is out the door and good luck trying to grab a bit within 30 minutes.   

This place is okay if you haven't tried it.
author: Adam J.

description: Yay for vegetarian options at Super Duper Burgers! I ordered the veggie burger and it came with hummus, cucumbers, and I added avocado for an additional dollar. The total for the burger was $7, and it was delicious! I liked the creaminess from the humus and the avocado. I also had a side of the garlic fries and it came with tons of parmesan cheese ($3). Filling meal for $10.
author: Jackie S.

description:
Went here the other week for dinner. The person I was with wanted a milkshake and supposedly Super Duper has really good milkshakes. But when we got there they told us that their ice cream machine was broken. Womp Womp. She didn't want to walk to another Super Duper which was a couple blocks away so we stayed. I hadn't eaten yet, so I got a burger with cheese, the normal produce, egg and grilled onions. Nothing really stood out about their burgers, usually it is the meat or the bun, but nothing here. It was better than average I guess? I know there are a lot of burger joints out there but personally think Smash Burger is better than this place, and even the girl I was with said she likes In N Out better lol. 
I might go back here to try the milk shakes though, because I did see they had Oreo milk shakes and I will always try an Oreo milk shake no matter where I am. =)
author: Dean S.

description:
Burger time! It definitely was Super Duper!

It's poppin' during lunch so try to get there early or a tad late to avoid the lunch rush and hovering over a table to snag it. The long line wasn't that ad when you get a taste of their french fries for free, nice touch. Very clean as well which is lovely especially for a fast food stop.

I went with a bacon burger and it was delicious. Cooked to perfection and extremely flavorful. The fries were pretty good too, salty just like I enjoy them and they are made fresh. Apparently they have amazing shakes, I didn't indulge, I should have, they looked yummy. But, huge win on the burger for a burger enthusiast like myself!

They make their own pickles, yum, don't miss them. They are free for all at the soda fountain.
author: Colleen B.

description:
After a lot of shopping in the Union Square district, my brother and I were hungry for a snack, so we decided to stop by Super Duper Burgers to share an order. Fortunately for us there was not much of a line at around 7:00pm, so we stopped in, ordered a Mini Burger to share, and took seats near the entrance. 

The restaurant itself has a trendy vibe and fun atmosphere. The burger itself was very good, but not the most amazing burger I've ever ordered. And the staff was friendly and efficient. 

Verdict: 
Pretty good burgers.
author: Laila A.

description:
Look!... Up in the sky!... It's a bird!.... No, it's a plane!... It's Super Duper!!... (SPLAT!)... nah, it's a bird. ...but a pretty tasty bird or wait, I mean a cow. I'm so confused. Honestly, Super Duper is pitched somewhere between super and duper, but at least it's a marked improvement over its smaller sister operation in the Castro. What you get here are pretty decent-priced burgers - messy, juicy 1/2-lb of meat that adds up when you request anything beyond the basic lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, and whatever their super sauce is (...distant cousin of Jack-in-the-Box's long-ago secret sauce perhaps?) - on your burger.

I call it the Joe's Cable Car nickel-and-dime-me-to-death approach, but alas, the practice looks to be more common with these specialty burger joints. Needless to say, I am all about the extras. I went to town and ordered the $6.50 Super Burger with the basics plus bacon, cheese, and an organic fried egg on top - each a dollar extra (see photo). It was a sloppy pile hard to pick up, but I assume I need to take accountability for that decision. It was tasty enough - far better than the flat, mealy patty I had at the Castro location some time back - but a lot of work with a lot of napkins. Not very green friendly, am I?

The $2 side of fries were an unconditional hit though (see photo). Piping hot and not greasy. The place is surprisingly spacious and crowds up quickly on a Friday evening, even the small loft section on the second floor. Jamie W. was thrilled about the $2 fountain Diet Cokes since the possibilities for refills were endless. We were tempted by the $3.25 soft serve cones but finally showed some discretion once we stuffed our faces. BTW - I hate the cheap aluminum chairs. However, the location is too convenient not to come back here. Super Duper? Not quite but good enough.

FOOD - 4 stars...good, messy burger even though the extras add up
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...space to make a mess, for sure
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...they smile a lot here
TOTAL - 4 stars...worth a stop when you hanker for some higher-end fast food
author: Ed U.

description:
It was nice to finally try Super Duper at their new spot near the FiDi.  The location is pretty nice though I find it kind of funny that they opened right next to Del Taco, but I think neither of them should feel threatened by each other.

The Burgers were okay.  I would probably compare their regular Super Burger's taste to that of In-N-Out's.  Simple, but has that fresh organic taste to it.

Believe it or not though, my favorite burger that I got to try is their Fried Portabello.  That was seriously good!  Watch out though, it can squirt out a lot of juice when you bite into it.  Keep plenty of napkins ready for that one.

And you definitely should get a Spiked Cookies N' Cream Shake with your burger.  It was so decadent!!

Super Duper may not be my favorite Burger spot in SF, but if I'm in the area and can somehow ignore Del Taco right next to it, I can probably drop by for some good eats.
author: Rodney H.

description: This place was probably one of the worst I've eaten at so I will consider myself lucky hat this is not our norm. The fries were mediocre, we were almost robbed finding the place, a homeless man stole a bunch of stuff from inside when dining... Confused how this got 4 stars?
author: Amanda J.

description:
Super duper burger YUm!
 I got bacon w.it and the bacon tasted like paint,  idk why.
Juicy burgers.

Garlic fries need a fork! They're yum! But serving is so tinyyyy...make it bigger! !!!

Thick shakes. Tasted my sister's coookies n creme. 
Line can get long but worth the wait!

Free water cups are a good size! Not the dinky tiny ones.
author: Alexandra A.

description: I still can't figure out why all the hype about this place. First I have to admit that the staff members are pretty attentive, the restaurant smells well and the bathrooms are kept in excellent sanitary conditions. That being said the truth is that the quality of the burgers this restaurant sells is barely above the quality of beef I get at MC or BK. Nothing special. I would say they deserve 3.5 stars but since it's a little pricey 3 stars is what Super Duper Burgers deserves.
author: Diana S.

description:
With an awesome name like super duper i had high expectations, wouldn't you? 

Especially with pictures from fellow yelpers the food here looks amazing!!! 

My bf and i ventured here for lunch and it was a huge pain because of the parking situation, but then again anywhere in san francisco would be the same especially because its located in union square. 

My bf and i ordered practically the same thing except mines had tomatoes and he had mushrooms. We ordered the small burger which was 4oz and the large was 8oz. We both added cheese, bacon, one organic egg, lettuce, and the special sauce. What we liked tremendously : Thick bacon. Perfectly cooked egg with yolk. Juicy and definitely messy. Everything seemed fresh and the portion was just right. Perfectly cooked medium. staff was really nice and patient. Simple yet modern decor. 

Why they didn't get a five star from us: meat wasn't super flavorful. Cheese wasn't perfectly melted. I had to tear off the sides. 

They have a variety of bottled drinks for you to choose from. Outdoor, upstairs, and just regular indoor seating. You gotta ask for utensils from the staff behind the counter if you need it. Self serve ketchup, napkins, etc. please dispose of your trash when you're done with your meal. 

One person per gender restrooms. For the female restroom they have hooks for you to place your purse or jackets which is really thought through.
author: Lisa D.

description: Really glad that I finally had a chance to visit this burger joint. I had the super duper burger with everything, minus the lettuce, added cheese and avocado. The meat was very tasty and it had just enough grease in it to add to the taste and moistness of the meat. Overall a very nice burger.
author: Dirty S.

description: Came in knowing this is one of the best burgers in town, but still wasn't expecting this to be that good. What surprised even more was the chicken sandwich with chipotle sauce. This place is on par with shakes shack and smash burger on my all time "quick" burger place. Always remember to add an egg for some extra flavor!!
author: Jensen K.

description: Food was just ok, I had such high expectations because the concept reminded me of Yeah!Burger in Atlanta. The mini burger, fries, and drink for $9 is a great deal. Upgrade to garlic fries you won't regret it. They also serve beer here. The burger itself is medium but mine was overcooked and greasy. I like the fact there a list of unlimited ingredients you can add and premium items for $1-2 more. 2 combos and 2 beers for $35 with numerous topping upgrades. Ambiance is crowded, basically waiting around to clear your own table. Worth trying once but not a must try SF destination.
author: Van N.

description:
Delicious not overcooked til hard chicken on a fresh, mild cibatta roll - perfect!

Quick service and near work.
author: Jenny L.

description: Best burger in San Fran. I always make it a point to stop by when visiting. Garlic fries are amazing and there homemade pickles. Mmm
author: Anita K.

description:
Super Duper lives up to its name,
mostly because of the size and the price.
It's a chain, as well as being off the chain.

The burgers are incredible and leave you with that burger juice 
that sometimes drips down
your arm that makes you want to try to attempt to lick your elbows.


Spiked shakes and Garlic fries, is something you can't hate on.
and I love a good cheeseburger I think its part of a daily diet In which I can't deny.

If your stuck between a rock and a hard place while chilling around the Jewish museum or even the Bloomingdales come by over here, it's quick and nice and the burgers are better than Mcdonalds, Wendys...

But as far as In and Out, In which is my favorite....I think gonna be a tough battle! ;)
author: Michael R.

description:
I came here at the peak of lunch hour it was really busy, but luckily there was no line. I was excited to try this place as it serves high quality meat (Niman Ranch), Strauss soft serve ice cream and shakes, and garlic fries! The menu is pretty simple serving 4 or 8oz burgers with various topping options. They have chicken and mushroom burger options as well.

The burger was average, I have tried better, it was good but not spectacular. Decent burger though! Be sure to put the super duper sauce on the burger to give it more flavor, it is also a good dipping sauce for the fries. Oh boy!  

What I really loved about this place was the garlic fries and dipping sauces. Awesome stuff. Where else can you get garlic fries outside of a sports arena? Really though, I don't know why more places don't have garlic fries. Obviously people love this stuff if they are willing to pay $10 at a stadium for it. The garlic fries are good by them selves but add in the Super Duper sauce and it is fricking amazing. To be honest I don't know what the Super Duper sauce is and I can't really describe it. Whatever, it's damn good...just get it for yourself. You will not be disappointed. 

Of course I had to try their Super Shake, got the Cookies and Cream one. Good consistency and a perfect way to beat the summer heat. A little steep at 5.75 almost as much as my burger.  Three and a half stars!
author: Maria M.

description: Expected something special. Burger just tasted like a messy big mac, fries were dry and bland. Probably great hangover food, but then McDonalds is too. Would not return unless drunk and out of options.
author: Josh J.

description: Garlic fried delicious! It is! But veggie burger is a bit hard and subtle. I want to eat more delicious veggie burger.
author: Miwa I.

description:
I so wanted to love you!
 but I'm pretty much a plant-based vegan so take that into stride with this review...
It's so rare when I eat meat even though my naturopath tells me I should now and again. Today I wandered by and saw the sign, Niman Ranch and organic milk shakes. Ok, on a whim I wander in...

The place was busy but you were fast.
 I asked about well-done but was talked out of it. I usually order meat well-done but I don't want blackened, and the kind soul at the register thought she was helping and strongly recommended medium-well.
I got raw red meat throughout. Yuck. I could not eat it.

The garlic fries were swimming in oil literally. I tried a couple but it was just too gross.

The organic chocolate milkshake was excellent. Though a meal it does not make.

Props for using quality ingredients and quick service, 
But my lunch was a $17 epic fail.
author: Jimmy F.

description:
Good quality burgers and fries!
I got the Mini burger (1 patty instead of 2) and garlic fries.
I wouldn't say this place tastes like anything I have tried (Innout, Shake Shack, Umami) which is a good thing. This place has good quality meat and ingredients and it really shows.
Line is long during lunch but service is quick.
Grab your own (house-made) pickles and ketchup while you are waiting for your food to be prepared.
author: Angela D.

description:
Alright people -- In my book, any place that offers a delicious burger for lunch AND a delicious egg sandwich for breakfast wins all the awards. 

I go to this Super Duper location for breakfast maybe once a week. While they have special donuts and special coffee on the menu, what I really appreciate is the breakfast sandwich. It comes in a toasty English muffin (good start), the egg is cooked and folded like an omelette is supposed to be cooked: on a griddle far away from a microwave, (more points), you have the option of adding cheese and/or bacon (more points), and it costs around $4 (the rest of the points). Most other breakfast sandwiches in this area will cost you $6-$8 and make you feel like a cheesed-out over-ingrediented anvil, rendering you useless for the remainder of the morning. This egg sammy is the perfect size to satisfy your salty breakfast needs and tide you over until lunch without making you crave a nap. 

The burgers are pretty darn good -- juicy, nice ingredients to choose from in order to create your ideal burger. I find the mini size is sufficient enough to fill me up, but you have the option of getting a larger slab of cow with the Super burger if you so please. If you aren't feeling like a slab of beef, I hear their chicken sandwich is quite good as well. Vegetarians can get into it too since their veggie burgers are delicious and come complete with hummus and yummy patties. 

Some fringe pros: 
- The fries are great -- not too thick and not too skinny. You have the option of getting garlic fries, too.
 - You get all the darn pickles that you can eat! 
- They have lemon slices and sparkling water to jazz up your "Just water, please" drink order. 

I'm hungry.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
Overall, great place to stop by to grab a bite to eat! It's super convenient, but can get busy during lunch hours! I got the meal, which came with the mini burger, fries and a drink. Also got an order of garlic fries too! Everything was super yummy, especially the garlic fries. :)

I will definitely be back!
author: Elaine C.

description:
I'm from NJ so when I stepped in this place, I said to myself "this is the shake shack of SF." But I actually like it better than shake shack! 

The burgers were really tasty. Very juicy and filling with one patty. Their super sauce is very similar to in-n-outs sauce. The fries were good also. The homemade pickles were crunchy and great with the meal.

I went here 2x the week I was in SF. Miss it already. Would definitely go back if I had a chance.
author: Racquel P.

description: Had the mini burger and it was the size of a regular burger so I can't imagine how big the original one is! The burger tasted so good and it looks like it came out of the tv. Try to go before noon because ppl do line up
author: Jennifer P.

description: There prices are great! I visited on my third day of being in San Francisco and it's the best meal I had! The mini burger was kind of small but perfect for my kids!! They have pickles that you can add to your burger!! Definitely recommend if you like burgers and are in the area.
author: Diana O.

description: Great place for a fast and affordable meal. I ordered the chicken burger and it was amazing. Its in a great location, easy meal.
author: Katha N.

description:
Love their garlic fries..it's the best I ever had ..also the veggie burger is good ..I've never had a veggie burger as good as this before ..
The service is also pretty quick ..I love this place ..It's been two months since I moved to sf and I've already been to super duper more than 10times..
author: Priya T.

description: There are plenty of gourmet burger places in SF. This one is a bit elusive as you have to go underground to the mostly Asian food court. But it's well worth the journey as you'll find thick juicy burgers here - the kind you used to get in the old days before McD's, Five Guys and In-N-Out took over the country. The service is top notch (read: super friendly) and unlike some places they are happy to let you mix-and-match toppings. Price seems right for downtown SF where everything costs more due to city mandates. Best burger I've had in a long time. And plenty of tables to enjoy your meal.
author: Boris G.

description: Not going to lie, I dream about their burgers when I haven't been here in a while. Love it.
author: Rose P.

description: The burger was amazingly good; hot & juicy, double patty with just standard sides.  Took the family, had a beer, it was better then I expected. Don't get me wrong it is not a gourmet burger. It gets a five b/c all the simple things were done well and it was good.
author: Rich D.

description: On vacation with my fiancé and decided to have a burger, looking for a burger joint we found super duper burger.  Well,  best decision we've ever made!  Delicious burger!!! So juicy and those garlic fries are to die for! It's real meat and not your regular frozen Patti. I want to go back!
author: Aurora C.

description:
I'm from So Cal so Tommy's and In N Out are my favorite burger spots.  But since I moved to the City, shit negro, these are some tasty burgers!  I mean, Jules Winfield from  Pulp Fiction would have left his vegetarian girlfriend for these mutha phukas. "MMMM, This is a Tasty Burger!"

Go for the Super Duper with Bacon and cheese.  You won't be disappointed.  They use quality beef on these bad bitches.  They know how to season it up too.  Very delicious.  The fries are really good too.  I love In N Out, but come on, those fries fuckin suck.  This place shits all over any of the competition for a burger.  A beer and Super Duper combo with cheese and bacon will run you 20 bucks with a tip if you're not a cheap bastard.

The staff is friendly too.  Which is impressive given how many people they feed every single damn day.  Two suggestions- 1) Get a killer Chili recipe and offer Chili burgers and 2)Expand to So Cal, please!
author: Patrick B.

description:
My lil sis, Tiff, and I were here last month.  We were walking to Union Square, but wanted to get lunch here first.  Tiff found it on yelp and it caught our attention.  Hard to refuse a highly rated burger.

We were both pleased with the service at the front, and the quality and taste of the food.  The lines are long, as this place is popular.  The expeditor forgot our sauces, so I had to remind him that it was missing.  He was probably swamped and overwhelmed.

I probably won't be up here for a year or so, but was glad to try this place once.
author: Winston S.

description: Lots of young folks go there but you can go there trying to be young.  Ravishing hamburger for the delight.  Pagers for the handout to let you know when it's done.  You do have to wait impatiently.  Meals do not cook themselves, people do.  Right on.
author: BanBan T.

description: amazing food!! Love the french fries... Price good and they have beer!!!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
The garlic fries were the best I have had. Ever. If you don't have a cute date definitely get those. But the burgers... they were super but not duper.
And the night I went they ran out of malt for milkshakes (how cruel).

Its better than average burger joint with a nice atmosphere. My burger was tasty but not memorable.
author: Omowale O.

description: Farnhan was super nice!  Awesome food. Great value!  Great atmosphere and fast!  Good time!! I'll be back!!
author: Lisa G.

description:
I'm a fan of this place! I ordered their chicken sandwich my first time here and thought it was a bit overwhelming. The ciabatta bread was too thick for my liking. On my second visit, I ordered a standard cheeseburger and it was pretty good. It's simple, fresh, and just the right portion size. The garlic parmesan fries are decent. 

Prices are decent, pricier than your average burger but you get what you pay for and it's also in the heart of SF. What do you expect!
author: Kirby P.

description:
I arrived to San Francisco tired....extremely tired - after a cross country flight and only 2 hours of sleep. I needed something good for my soul - not necessarily good FOR me. Super Duper, I found you!

Thanks to a co-worker who had previously been, we took a quick walk over from the hotel. Super friendly staff behind the counter. All the options written above you, nice and visible. They have seating upstairs too, which is cool.

I ordered a Super Burger with lettuce, tomato and red onions (added cheese and avocado of course).They had a "pickle bar" so I stacked those on as well. It was great, perfectly seasoned and hit the spot. I added a drink and some fries. The fries were crispy and fresh out the fryer. 

That was my first meal in a week long work conference and interestingly enough, my last meal. I popped in and ordered the same exact thing the last night I was there. However, this time since they were about to close the very nice lady behind the counter offered me up free cookies. God bless her.
author: Blue A.

description:
When someone asked if I wanted to hit up Super Duper Burgers, I had no idea what they were talking about until we got there.

"Ohhhhh. You mean Fake Shack."

That's what I've taken to calling SDB, because let's be serious: this is a Shake Shack clone. From the size of the patties to the sauce right down to the silver lettering on the awning. 

But I don't really care who they imitate. I just wanted a cheap, solid burger, and that's what I got. I love any place that offers a host of free toppings, and I highly recommend the garlic fries if you like tasty treats and offending people you see once a year with your breath for hours afterward.
author: Peter D.

description: After arriving in SF for a holiday weekend, we were looking for a quick bite and found this place as a top ranked restaurant in the area we were staying (The Palace). The reviews were strong and it lived up to the expectations.  Excellent quality burger and we really enjoyed the garlic fries.  I highly recommend it.  In fact, we had family join us the next day and I know there were 2-3 trips made throughout our stay.  Enjoy!
author: Russ M.

description: Fantastic burger and shake.  So good I had to order a second.  Looking forward to going back!
author: Colin J.

description:
Great, flavorful, juicy, burgers.  They were actually really good.

The fries were good too.  Again, really good.

The thing about this place was, the staff liked to tell each other, and apparently regulars/friends really awful stories.  Really loud.  While I ate at the counter top.  The stories made me not quite that hungry anymore...

I'll take my meal to-go next time, and think of this place as a 4/5 star burger joint when I do
author: Josh D.

description:
Visited San Francisco from San Diego and came with the spiel that I'd try a different place every meal I went out. I went to Super Duper Burger on my second day in the city and immediately broke my promise, going again the next day. Both times, the eight ounce burger was stunningly delicious. 

Understand that coming from San Diego I am a 'burger snob,' whether justified or not (probably not, but we all suffer from local exceptionalism right?). I thought In n Out and Slaters were the end all/be all. I was wrong. There's Super Duper Burgers.

P.S. Try the double chocolate shake.
author: Jonathan F.

description: We didn't get burgers but ordered the chicken sandwich and fries. The chicken sandwich was delicious with a spicy aioli! Very satisfied with this place.
author: Sarah S.

description:
So, it's Thursday night and you're sitting with a few friends at a trendy lounge on Market. You've all had just enough drinks to make the conversation sillier than usual, but not so many that you have to stop pretending to be adults. Everyone is having a great time but then it all goes to hell when you (yes, you!) utter those fateful words:

"I WANT FRIES."

What are you, a goddamn toddler? Who says that in the middle of a perfectly good conversation? You can't blame blackout drunkenness this time. There is no excuse.

Nevertheless, you've already put it out there, and you can't take it back, and Super Duper is luckily (?) just across the street, so that is where you and your unfortunate comrades go. You order the garlic fries, and the strawberry shake to dip them in for good measure. 

They arrive. They are perfection. 

You may have sent the evening in completely the wrong direction, but it was a delicious direction.

***

Morning-after revelations:

- The ideal crispiness/mushiness ratio of fries is hotly debated amongst drunk and sober fry-eaters alike, but at least for me, these were just right. A bit crispy on the outside, nice and soft on the inside.
- The garlic atop the fries really was incredible. Freshly minced, juicy, and astonishingly high in volume. You will probably smell like garlic for the rest of your life, and it will be worth it.
- Ordering the strawberry shake over the vanilla shake was a rash and ultimately disappointing chocie. When seeking to dip fries: always choose vanilla.
author: Angela L.

description: Juicy burgers! I tried the mini cheeseburger and garlic fries, which were actually fries generously sprinkled with raw garlic!  Yummy, but holy garlic breath! The burger with everything was delicious. I'm a fan!
author: S. S.

description: Super duper yummy! Couldn't even finish the mini burger w/ fries. Every time I pass this place, the lines are almost out the door. Got lucky and only waited a couple minutes. I'd go after 6pm to avoid this.
author: Hoku L.

description:
I finally returned to Super Duper and it was pretty awesome. It was later in the evening after several drinks, but I had not eaten dinner so I was feeling super hungry. After hemming and hawing over the menu, I eventually kept it pretty simple and ordered a bacon cheeseburger and fries with a couple different sauces on the side. The homemade pickles were also clutch. Total damage was around ten bucks. 

Back at my hotel room, I was pretty thrilled with my tasty burger and seemingly never-ending fries. The burger reminded me of In N Out, but with a bit more substance. Glad I finally got to try this place for what it does best. I'll likely return after another night on the town next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Michelle C.

description:
After sitting on a plane for 6 hours with only a pack of starburst and a smelly passager in the seat next to me, I needed a quick meal before I hit the hotel for the eve. Being a Sunday in SF, most eateries were closed, but SDB happened to be open at 9:45pm. 

A veggie burger, a boat of garlic fries and a drink cost me $11. Not bad. Especially bc the veggie burger was legittt. Covered in hummos, lettuce, cukes and avocado, this was easily one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had. The fries were garlicky, but not covered in oil, which is just how it should be. Oh, and don't miss the homemade pickles! Good, quick, inexpensive spot. 

Note: don't mind the homeless ninja man outside.
author: Drew A.

description:
Honestly wanted to try Super Duper Burger for the longest time now, however it was a big disappointment. I've had much better burger.

I tried the mini burger. Maybe it's just me but I wasn't very satisfied with the bun, it was a bit dried and had this cardboard feeling to it. Then the patty was also a big disappointment. I had asked for medium rare, but my patty was over cooked, a little burned, dry, and flavorless. Overall, the burger was not super or duper.

The two stars are honestly only for the garlic fries. It was delicious. It was perfect, the garlic flavor was obvious but it wasn't too salty and the fries were crunchy and crisp.

I would probably not try it again.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Got a mini combo with cheese and bacon (no onions). Came to about 11.50, not bad but definitely on the high end.

The burger was small, but very good (even if greasy). Fries were average, they definitely could step it up there.

For the price, the burger should be bigger, but the flavor is there.
author: Marcus F.

description:
The burgers are soooo good. They're like in-n-out on the next level. They also have awesome house made pickles that you can get on the side for free. 
I've been to Super Duper many times already, but today is the first time I tried the soft serve vanilla ice cream. It did not disappoint
author: Vivian W.

description:
I was told to eat here by a local. 
I was so amazed at the quality and taste of the food. 
The burger was top notch. The garlic fries... Oh my gosh!!!
The chocolate shake was perfect. I'm guessing there my have even been some Ovaltine in it.
I'm from so cal and I think they are better than in n out
author: Jason I.

description:
This place has fantastic reviews both on Yelp and posted outside their restaurant: voted burger of the year for 2013, rated #20 of 38 must try restaurants in San Francisco... all the hype made me try it, but to me their food was just okay.

Located in the Financial District, next to a Del Taco this seemed like a great spot to drop in for lunch. It was chilly outside and they kept the front door propped open, so it was chilly inside too. Luckily they had outdoor heaters that were on so we opted to sit on the patio.

After briefly reading the reviews, I ordered the Mini Burger because I didn't want 2 patties, my boyfriend went for the Chicken Sandwich and we shared an order of fries. If I didn't have to head back to work shortly after, I would have liked to have tried the garlic fries but I figured I better spare my coworkers the after breath.

The food came out reasonably fast and was good, but not wow me good. I actually liked the fries better than I liked my burger. It was on the greasy side which was a little disappointing. I tried my bf's chicken sandwich, I honestly think it was better than the burger. It had a spicy sauce, think bacon and a different bun.

This area of town has a TON of homeless and we quickly learned why we were the only people sitting out on the patio - we were constantly approached and asked for money. We did help out the first girl who approached us, however she got angry and threw a fit because we only gave her $2. Seriously?? The next 2 guys that approached didn't seem to want to leave us alone either. The manager actually called the police because the homeless were bothering the customers inside as well. Within minutes an officer was on site, at least they have little tolerance for how it may negatively impact business.

I'd possibly eat here again but I wouldn't call it Super Duper, nor would I rate it the best burger in 2013.
author: Kayla M.

description: Burgers are delicious! Taste super fresh, decent price and the ice cream is the best. Will be returning!
author: Veronica L.

description:
It really was SUPER DUPER!! 
I was in SF in January, but still talk about this burger.
Super duper burger is juicy. 
Garlic fries was super yum!
First time I went was a Saturday.  Had to go back on Sunday before the flight back to LA.  Walked from Hilton Union Square to this location.  Manager and staff super friendly.
author: Gretchen V.

description: Tired this place for the first time overall it was okay. Order the Garlic fries and it was okay nothing really stood out about it. The fries was fine but it lack garlic flavors. It just not worth going back.
author: Chris Y.

description:
Were here yesterday with my girlfriend. 
We came here because of all the great reviews. 
Wasn't that impressed to be honest. 
I loved the service and the ambiance but at the end it is a burger joint. The burger was juicy but I missed flavor in it, garlic fries with cheese were ok nothing to go crazy about. 
I say yes to stop there and try but that is it for me.
author: Shachar Y.

description: GOOOD ASSS BURGER. The patties were fresh and juicy, so so so juicy. I couldn't finish half of it because it was that big. This place is located in Chinatown and you can't miss it. The sign is pretty big! Btw, the bathroom is downstairs, kind of hidden.. But it will be on your right.
author: Tilia L.

description:
This is one of my new favorite burger places! 

I devoured my delicious burger and fries. I couldn't believe how good the food was! A little pricey but so worth it!

Go, you won't be disappointed!! :)
author: Steph L.

description:
They should call this place Super Duper Chicken too. I don't eat burgers but figures since this is California they would at least have a veggie burger. They do but I opted for the chicken sandwich and I couldn't be happier with my choice. The sandwich comes with a chipotle aioli that was delicious.  I had mine with lettuce tomato and I added bacon. Yum. I also had some fries and my fair share of the home made pickles. The pickles are a bit sweeter that I am used to but they were pretty tasty too. I also had the homemade lemonade made with brown sugar. Super tasty to wash it all
down.  Also of note you stand in line to order and then search for a table while
your order is being prepared. The kid who took my order couldn't have been nicer and he made sure I wanted everything that came on the sandwich.  I don't like onion, which comes standard, so I was super grateful that he asked. All in all a great quick meal so much better than any fast food you could get.
author: Debra R.

description: Found this place on yelp while looking for a late night dinner at around 11pm. I got the mini burger combo, which is a regular cheeseburger (super burger is double cheeseburger), with garlic fries and it came with a drink for about $10-11. The burger was super duper delicious. The bun was very light, almost like a sweet roll, and it didn't fill me up. The garlic fries were my favorite because it was very garlicky and I love garlic. It had that kick of garlic spice to it. Everything was great and it's a plus that it's open late.
author: Christine L.

description:
This is a good, solid burger joint. There are plenty of options without being overwhelming or adding things just for novelty's sake, and the ingredients are of good quality.

My girlfriend had a mini burger; I had a super burger. The difference, as it turned out, is that the super burger has two patties to the mini's one. The patties themselves are the same. We also shared an order of garlic fries--good, but be warned: they're VERY garlicky. They're also covered in grated cheese and sprinkled with chopped parsley.

The place was crowded when we arrived, and we had to wait in line to order. Once we placed out order, the food was prepared very quickly.
author: Nicholas D.

description: burgers are DELICIOUS! really fast service too! most def gonna drag my boyfriend here again. :)
author: Dhemie A.

description:
SHORT: The burger itself is good but the sauces and spiked milkshakes take the cake! 

LONG(ish): 
There are numerous locations for this place close to Moscone, Bart/Muni and anywhere in the downtown area which makes it easily accessible. 

The lunchtime rush usually results in a long line that goes out the door and the dining area isn't huge. However, there is also usually outside seating somewhere nearby.

The burgers are pretty good. They are juicy and fresh with enough topping options to give you the option of creating something interesting without being overwhelmed.

THE BEST PART: SAUCES!!! I love sauces, sauces to dip, sauces to coat, just saucy sauciness. The homemade mayo is meh, but the chipotle and secret sauce are where it's at. Get these with some garlic fries and your meal has just been made!

2ND BEST PART: Spiked milkshakes!!
author: Dana V.

description:
Ok this place is always super busy whenever I am nearby.  However, there was no line today!  I ordered a mini burger with garlic fries. The garlic fries were good!  Just enough fresh garlic in them to make them yummy.

Burger is sized just like a Mickey D hamburger.  It was a bit on the dry side.  Maybe I should have requested their special sauce.  Not bad and it didn't break my wallet either.
author: Wendy H.

description:
What I had:  Super Burger - no cheese- no bacon.
This was some kinda good for only $7.75  Pretty crowded at noon, but the line went fast in my opinion. (about 15 people ahead of me and it only took about 15 minutes from that point to get my food)
author: Al O.

description: Not a bad burger for the price!  It always juicy and tasty.  I like the garlic cheese fries.  They try to aim at local sustainable food.  We like coming here for a quick and easy meal when we visit.
author: Chad S.

description:
Found this place based off reviews and glad we did. Very good burger ! Added avocado n bacon. Fries were good too.
Always compare any burger to in n out which is still the best burger IMO, but this is more gourmet and pretty close to as good.
author: Pj P.

description:
Yum!!!! I love burgers with eggs. I was hesitant to order something that had a 'mini' in it, but actually, the miniburger was more than enough for me. It's just a regular hamburger size lol. The egg was cooked perfectly on it! Just enough so that when I took a bite the yolk would drip out and coat the meat in all its yolk-iness. hehe. 

I also had the garlic fries. These were awesome, because they just had a hint of garlic and parmesan that made the fries tasty but wouldn't leave your mouth smelling gross! 

Also, theres a self serve pickle container in the drink/condiment area .+1 for that lol
author: Christina L.

description:
"Foundation is everything, without a strong foundation you might as well look or steer away."

In other words, can they cook a plain medium rare hamburger with no special toppings. Can the burger stand on its own with just lettuce, tomato, and dash of ketchup & mustard in sesame seed bun? Super Duper Burgers-- i believe your small or regular size hamburger that i had on 1/16/15 had a phenomenal foundation (i.e. holy crap that is one delicious hamburger). 

This is my first visit and never heard of this restaurant before and was amazed how the place was busy around 10pm.  Then again, its was a Friday and peeps are getting ready to club and party.  The service and food was top notch, and if i had to compare you to other burger joints i would have to put 'Super Duper Burgers' at the top of the food chain.  

So to answer the question on foundation, i give Super Duper Burgers A+++ on foundation. Wow im kinda craving for a burger right now...@(O#*T%YHQ@OP:#%!!!

Note:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z7_2aMX8S7I (unrelated but stumbled upon this song  and realized the emotions you get from this song was very similar to my Super duper burgers experience)
author: Erwin B.

description: I love the grilic fries. And the burger is also juicy and yummy. You can also try the cone there. It's a good place for the people working around.
author: Qiusha D.

description:
I like it. I like it a lot.

Simple as that, Super Duper Burgers here is B-E-A-UTIFUL. There's plenty of seating here and there's an upper level with more benches and tables. The line here can get pretty lunch come dinner time...but it's well-worth the wait! I like how you can order different sizes of burgers AND you can order a beer or wine if you're feeling you want something more than a soda.

One thing you'll definitely have to eat is their pickles. They have jars of homemade pickles at the condiments stand and I always grab a good amount to nomnom on with my meal. The staff members are pretty friendly also, and they keep the line moving quickly.

If you work in the area or are thinking of where to eat before heading to a show nearby, definitely stop by here for some Super Duper Burgers.
author: Rachel C.

description: Great spot for a greasy burger. I really mean it, be careful when picking it up or biting into it. You could find grease on your shirt before the meal is over. Grab lots of napkins. The line during lunch is insane and out the front door at times, weekdays. I don't know about the weekend. It's really good, but my time is precious. :-)
author: Andrew S.

description: Hands down the BEST burger I've ever had. If you knew me, you'd know it takes a lot for me to say this but, it's even better than In and Out. Yeah, I said it. And before you start the flogging try it for yourself. Oh, side note, the garlic fries....lovepure love
author: Susie D.

description: The best Burgers ! I fell in love with Super Duper about 5 Years ago and it is still on my # 1 list. I am not sure if anything will be able to replace it as my # 1 :)
author: Jessica L.

description: I will leave out the fact that my girlfriend and I were sick all night long from this place.  If you think this is better than in n out or the habit I would have to strongly disagree.  The ingredients were simply not fresh, and the meat was seasoned mediocre at best.  It's your run of the mill burger, that may result in firing out of both ends for 6 hours.
author: Greg C.

description:
I came here with my friend after picking up my runner's packet for the NWM. I have to say I wasn't expecting much. 

Service:
Super friendly service. Can't ask for anything more. 

Food: 
Mini Burger - I had the mini burger and it was quite filling. And it super duper messy! But it was a good decent burger. The meat tasted great. The bun I didn't really care for. It was a bit dry in my opinion. But overall a good burger. 
Garlic Fries - I thought the fries weren't cooked enough since most of them were still kind of limp. But they had a good amount of cheese/ garlic on the fries. 
Sauce - I thought the secret sauce was quite good. The chipotle sauce was a little sweet for my taste.  

Overall:
Definitely would recommend this place to the burger lovers out there.
author: Christina L.

description:
Compared to places like jack-in-the-box or McDonalds, Super Duper is an awesome place!!

The burger is more plump, the bun never taste frozen and always nicely toasted. The lettuce is fresh and crisp. The patty is rich and juicy - you can actually tell it's beef and not some strange concoction. It's so juicy and the burger can get messy to eat at times and soggy if you dont eat yours fast enough. 

The garlic fries is fragrant and crispy with aged cheddar. I don't like the cheddar too much since it makes the meal a bit heavy. I love the garlic fries and the herb they add to it. I've tried ordering garlic fries without the cheese and they said they can do it but they forgot :(. Couldn't be bothered to change it. 

The soft serve is so amazing. I love the vanilla flavour. It melts in your mouth nicely without being overwhelmingly sweet. It's just so gooood. Sooooo good!! Oh my god like super goooooddd!!! Ahh. I love it. The kids size is super huge already. 

It's fun to add an egg to your burger too. Makes it messier but more fancy huh. Fried egg elevates everything though. People will look at you with envy, too. Haha

They have maple bacon glazed donuts. I really like it. It's awesome to take home and warm up less than 10seconds in the microwave. The bacon smell is just divine and the frosting makes it super awesome. Just magnificent sweet bacon goodness 

This place is very good for the quality of food you're getting. Everything feels fresh and healthy even when it isn't. The service is fast and efficient. It's so crowded whenever I'm there. Which is usually at night. Hard to get seats. The taste is not that special, it's nothing other places can't beat. The pricing is affordable. 

In conclusion: Burger - yup yup. Garlic fries - sure why not. Soft serve - hell yeah!! Add a fried egg - must try before you die.
author: Châu B.

description:
Fresh, simple and delish. 

My husband and I had a rare afternoon to ourselves so we headed out to SF for the day. We started at the Ferry Building and enjoyed the Farmer's Market, but nothing spoke to us for a sit down meal. Thanks to a quick search on Yelp the fabulous reviews led our feet about a mile from the waterfront to Super Duper Burger on Market. 

The interior is really cool and utilitarian - open, simple, clean. The menu was clear and offered a great variety. There is a portabello sandwich option for vegetarians and I have to say, if it wasn't for the siren song of the beef, I would have given it a whirl. They also have a veggie burger, chicken sandwich and salads. As a spectacle-wearer the menu behind the counter was also large and clear for reading. YAY! The service was friendly, fun and helpful. The prices were really reasonable considering it's organic, fresh and in the city. 

The burgers are Neiman Ranch beef. The fries are SUPER tasty as well. Sometimes when we go places it seems that one item is good, but the other is so-so. At Super Duper it's all, well, SUPER DUPER! The burger was cooked to a perfect and juicy medium. I ordered mine (the mini 4oz) with everything - including onion, tomato and lettuce. I also included the sauce (sort of thousand islandy) which was tasty and applied neither too thick or too thin - just right! The red onion was perfecto! I love a the zippy zing that sliced onions provide, but too often find that restaurants slice their onions too thick so it's all you can taste or have to spend a lot of time getting your fingers stinky picking off the right amount. Super Duper slices their red onion SUPER thin so you get that delicate zinginess without dragon breath or BO fingers. :D

One of the best parts for me was the pickle. I ALWAYS have to have pickle slices on my burgers. I think it's because most burgers are not that juicy/tasty without them and I love the extra crunch. I have to say that the Super Duper burger was so juicy and tasty that I didn't even need to add the pickles, however, I did help myself to many to crunch on because they are house-made and absolutely lip-smacking delish! I wonder if they would consider selling a small jar........? 

Since it was a date with my fella, he bought me a chocolate milkshake made with organic Straus creamery ice cream. :o) I was positively stuffed, but it was poifect!! 

A note to beer drinkers.... there is beer on tap. When we went Racer 5 (hubby's fave) and Scrimshaw were on tap. A pretty awesome beer selection, if you're so inclined. They are a Coke establishment, so if you're like me and prefer Pepsi, just know that in advance... you can have water, milkshake or a beer....or a milkshake! Wait, I said that already. 

Honestly, I have to say this is the best burger and fries I've had at a "fast food" place. I look forward to going back very soon!! Their only fault (and my waistline's saving grace) is they are only located in San Francisco and not closer to where I live. 

If you get the opportunity, I highly recommend running, not walking, to Super Duper!
author: Andrea R.

description:
So let me explain. The reason I'm only at 4 stars instead of 5 is because I was highly intoxicated at the time I came here. So I dont know if that makes my review invalid. Hah!

So after hitting brewcade down the street, we asked the bartender where to go and they pointed us to super duper burger. 

The burgers are pretty expensive but the meat is grass fed. So there's that.. At the time I didn't care, I'm super nice and generous when I have a little liquor in my system so I bought dinner for the two people I was with as well. Yikes. 

Anyways. Food came out really fast and it was DELICIOUS. The burger came out PERFECT. It was huge and juicy and made me sober up pretty quick after scarfing the whole thing down. 

The garlic fries were also amazing. A must try. ALMOST the best garlic fries I've ever tasted. 

Again, I was a little tipsy coming in here but to me, the food was amazing. I guess you'll all have to come in here and try it yourself. (;
author: Maddy B.

description: The burger was delicious! A short walk from Union Square and totally worth it!
author: Adriana M.

description:
