Local office workers starting to queue up for lunch at 10:45AM should tell you all you need to know about this place. 

Ordering is very easy as there's just one type of hamburger. 

This is what I had.
1. Super burger (the only other option is a mini burger which is exactly half a superburger) + Fries
2. Toppings: Everything on it+jalapeños+ grilled onions
3. Pickled cucumbers: Self serve

The burger was very juicy and tasty. No complaints whatsoever!
author: Sidhu H.

description: Good, fresh tasting food. I took it to go and the serving of garlic fries was so large I couldn't eat it without making a mess at my desk.
author: Robert R.

description:
I first went to Super Duper Burger with some co-workers while looking for a good burger to eat during lunch in the SoMa district. Being relatively new to the Bay Area my co-workers had ordered here several times while it was my first. Super Duper Burger is located on a relatively busy Market street between 3rd and 4th streets.

FREQUENCY: I've ordered at this establishment three times.

FOOD: Each time I've ordered at Super Duper Burger I've gotten the Vegetarian Burger. Let me start off with that I'm not a vegetarian. I've tried it before for a month and what I took away from that month is trying to eat less meat than I used to. I also found that vegetarian burger alternatives are often very delicious. Black bean burgers are some of the best I've ever had. Super Duper Burgers vegetarian option is also very delicious which is why I've ordered it several times. I do plan on eventually trying on of their normal burgers. You can either order for pick-up or sit down at the restaurant. They offer several add-ons and condiments for your burger. The also offer free pickle wedges to snack on while waiting for you order. I'm a huge pickle fan so I often indulge in several. I don't think Super Duper Burger is the best you'll ever have but I do think its a much better options than fast food burgers.

DRINK: Super Duper Burger offers a variety of fountain drinks and also has a bar with several beers on tap. They also have happy hour which I've heard is a very good deal but I haven't had the chance to stop by for it yet. I don't order drinks while at Super Duper since I just walk back to the office to eat so I can't personally review any of them.

ATMOSPHERE: I'd say Super Duper has a pretty standard restaurant atmosphere. Lots of people sitting down and talking while enjoying their food. A line of customers waiting to order. I guess it's a little larger than I normally expect for a burger joint since they offer a good amount of seating but I can't say anything sticks out about the atmosphere worth mentioning. Nothing special, just a normal enjoyable atmosphere.

STAFF: Even if you sit down to eat you do so after you've ordered your food so there is no waiter at the tables. I've never spoken to the staff more than just ordering my food or picking it up but those experiences have always been pleasant.

PAYMENT: Credit cards or cash were acceptable.

Super Duper Burger is a great place to stop if you're in the mood for a good burger that's definitely better than any fast food options. I find the price to be very reasonable for the food received. I've ended up here about once every 2-3 weeks and I think this trend will continue. There's also another location in the Financial district a few blocks down if you work in that area.
author: Christopher D.

description:
After the chief of the managers convinced me to give it a second try 
I did and wolala
It was like it used to be super friendly staff and it was as crowded as it was last time but the whole team looked super nice and busy 
The burger was magnificent and the fries were fresh and garlicky 
In short this was how I remember super duper to be just amazing 
I even got myself a egg this time and it was faby Taby great 
Now how do I avoid not trying to come everyday 
Yummy duppy
author: M. B.

description:
Dear Super duper,

This is one of the most unsettling experiences I have had from a manger at a restaurant! I came in tonight for a chicken sandwich dinner. I asked for glass of water, and they gave me a plastic cup. I said I really don't want to be wasteful, can I please have a "glass" cup. The response from the short-haired manager with glasses actually said "no I don't want to have to wash it!!!"  My response was that they were still putting beers and shakes in glasses, can I please have glass I really don't want to be wasteful and in a more stern voice he stil said "no, I don't want to have to wash it."

The manger/figure head of your business and the repressive was beyond rude to a simple customer request it was so shocking.

Sincerely,
A no longer loyal costumer 

Side note: I'm sorry his laziness has no regard for the environment  or this city and especially his customers for that matter.
author: More J.

description: Burger was very tasty and melted in my mouth. Sauce running down my fingers. Loved the burger. Has the garlic fries. The fries were too greasy for my taste. Would love to come back to have the burger again.
author: Linda F.

description: They do serve some tasty burgers and garlic fries. I wished they had a better beer selection, but they still had some quality brews on tap. This style of burger compares to what you find at The Habit in SoCal. I give Super Duper the edge. And The Habit hasn't served beer in years. And it was crappy domestic beer. But this isn't a review of The Habit. If you want some good food that is relatively cheap, Super Duper Burger hits the spot.
author: Ben K.

description: 1st time here. It was very busy and the girl that took our order at the counter seemed a little impatient that we didn't have our order down. We ordered a super burger with cheese and bacon, 2 chicken sandwiches- 1 with cheese and bacon and 1 with avocado, garlic fries, a cookies and cream malt, and two cokes; it was $40. The chicken sandwich with cheese and bacon was very good! The malt was also great. The burger was good but a little greasy for my taste. The fries were just ok- cheese wasn't melted and they were too oily for my taste. The space was very tight and we ended up sitting by the bathroom that had a line the whole time, not the best layout in that area. May give it another shot for that chicken sandwich.
author: Andrew D.

description: It's pricey, but amazing. This was our first time eating here while visiting San Fran. Excited to see if it comes down to LA. Garlic fries were incredibly delicious. And the burger was juicy and tasty!
author: Dayna S.

description: Food was Delicious! Line was out the door but everything came out hot and fresh! A bit pricey, but well worth it. Please open a store in Inland Empire!
author: Tiffany B.

description:
Came here after skating in union square. The burger was no better than any fast food joint and the service was disgraceful. 
   We came in with 3 tables full of people. Once our 1 table had finished we walked 3 ft to our friends who were still eating. Next thing we know we hear someone screaming "Who's table is this?!" We look over and an employee (Alondra? Was the name I was given) is yelling looking around the restaurant. We claim the table and she proceeds to scream (to the point the whole restaurant is staring. Wonderful.) that they just had a robbery and we are not to leave our things unattended. 
   Ummmm... FIRST: I'm 3ft away and the tables surrounding that are with us so I HIGHTLY DOUBT a thief would get out of there with our stuff and SECOND: that's up to us to decide. STOP SCREAMING. How dare you interupt other's dinner and cause a scene. Don't make us feel like criminals. We did nothing wrong. What kind of place allows this? So beyond rude. We all just grabbed our things and left. Unbelievable Alondra. Learn how to act.
author: Ellie T.

description: Happy with the service & the food. I had the mini burger(which really is a normal sized burger) , fries &  a drink. Quick and fast. Prices were good as well. I would definitely recommend this place and I plan on eating here again during my stay!
author: LadyBlaze T.

description:
Situated right in the heart of Union Square is where you will find this fine burger joint. This place is a little bit hipster, a little bit modern. They have an awesome menu of not just burgers and fries, but salads as well. (Just in case if you're aiming for something healthier.) 

A Super Duper Burger is 8oz with 2 patties, and a Mini Burger is 4oz with 1 patty. Let me tell you, their "Mini" is NOT mini at all.

 I ordered the Mini Burger with lettuce, tomato, grilled red onions, roasted portobello ($1.00 extra) and an organic egg ($1.50 extra). GET THE EGG! It makes all the difference in the world. It brightened up my burger like sprinkles to a cupcake.If you like mushrooms, get the portobello! It was delicious as well.

We also ordered a set of Garlic Fries and a Super Salad. The Garlic Fries had a generous amount of chopped garlic and aged cheddar - it rocked my world. The salad was fresh and refreshing. 

Super Duper's burgers are indeed, super duper! I miss it!
author: Karen N.

description:
Amazing veggieburger, I added the extra jack cheese for 0,50$ well worth it.

Chocolate milkshake was delicious!

This place work for vegans too! Except for the shakes sorry...
author: Anna L.

description:
Super Duper Burgers was...wait for the cliche...pretty darn super. 

The burgers here are pretty amazing. Best part about the burger is the slightly toasted bun. Seriously, why don't more restaurants toast their buns? Toasted buns are always better. The patty itself is very tender and juicy, but I wish it was cooked medium-rare instead of just straight up medium. I feel like that's really the only thing keeping this burger back from being one of the best of the best.

Fries were delicious. They're the kind of fries where you just can't stop eating them, no matter how much you want to stop. Addiction at it's finest and I was hooked from the first bite. The three dips aren't really worth it. $1.50 for three very small cups of dip, and the chipotle dip was the only one worth it. Being honest though, the fries here don't even need any dressings. They're perfect as is. 

Pretty nice place for a quick bite in the city. Love how close it is to all the shopping areas, so when your friends got you down from long hours of shopping, you can always turn to Super Duper Burgers to come in and save the day!
author: Sean H.

description:
Aside from Shake Shack in NYC and Gordon Ramsay BuRG in Vegas, Super Duper Burgers would have to the third best burger I've had during my trip to the land of the free and home of the brave. 

If I had to compare it to one of ours in the land down under; I'd have to say it's the sister burger joint of Grill'd - cool setup and upbeat music in the background and it's always busy and lively. 

I ate here a few times and I still think about every once in a while... Yes, I do! 

On all 3 or 4 occasions, I had the Super Combo burger - they were running a deal back then where (for about $12 I think), you got a burger w/ fries and a drink (free refill s'il vous plait!). It was brilliant. My burger was really nice everytime - juicy patty and good meat to bun ratio. Oh and the garlic fries... Wow......

This Super Duper joint is in the heart of town on Market Street next to the Westfield mall, which is really convenient and perfect for us visiting. They also have ice cream, shakes and beer as well as wine on tap.

When I return, one of the first thing I'll do is head in and grab a burger!
author: Kevin S.

description: It was quite by accident that while visiting a friend, an out of town guest ordered food to be delivered from Super Duper.  He expressed his dismay that he was unaware that there would be 4 for dinner and assured him I was good.  But when the food was delivered there was an extra burger in the bag which we believe to be completely by chance and so I had my first super duper burger that was complimented with a fried egg.  The flavor of the beef was outstanding as I rarely get to eat such quality red meat. The bag did not contain any fries but this burger was quite filling and I am still stuffed from it.  I will be going for another when I get paid.
author: William R.

description: Was attracted to this place cause the smell is incredible back in 2012.  Tried it and do not regret it the meat is fresh and patties are juicy.  French fries are also awesome and dipped and non dipped cones are amazing glad to have one now by my work.
author: Kathy C.

description:
I love my burger. A good one is hard to come by. I for one hate getting my burger fix at fancier restaurants. Especially when they charge me an arm and a leg for a 'gourmet' version made with silly things like wagyu patties and truffle oil. Burger should be what a burger is - quick and easy causal meal.

I envy New Yorkers for their Shake Shack. In-n-Out in west coast is simply playing an entirely different game. I want a reasonably priced burger with decent patties, good sauce and few gimmicks. No over-sized one pounder on some huge buns that no normal human being could eat with one hand. Super Duper is exactly what I was looking for.

Their patties were bouncy and juicy. All cooked to a perfect medium with a lot of pink inside. Even the so called 'mini' burgers have good thick 4oz patties. Just the basic version with only the free toppings already tasted excellent. Extra like bacon, mushroom and cheese were really just icing on the cake.

The only thing I still want is probably some crazy good veggie burger like the 'shroom burger from Shake Shack with the legendary cirsp-fried portobello 'patty'. The day Super Duper comes up with something just as good is the day I will throw Shake Shack to the back of my head.
author: Mona W.

description: Quick, deliciously fresh burger; no pretention, no fuss. What more can you ask for? Price is fair for what you get. I got the Super Burger and it was actually a bit too much so I'll be going for the Mini next time I'm here. Definitely throw in the egg but it will get seriously messy; be warned. The garlic fries is a must try for first timer but it is very strong... You should probably skip it if you have meetings the rest of the day. Ambience reminds me of Shake Shack on the east coast but flavor is different. They even serve shakes like Shake Shack. Enjoy!
author: Joseph S.

description:
The problem with me is I over-expect! Totally expected this place to be the bomb but was terribly disappointed. If you're wondering if it's better than In n Out Burger--- that would be a resounding "NO"!
I'll find me a great tasting burger yet...
author: Anacleto E.

description: Very delicious burgers and very juicy that's about it , not as great as they hype it up but it's was super juicy meat so that's good
author: Doug F.

description:
After a full conference day, I wanted to meet up with some pals for a bite downtown before the after party.  Most of the food downtown is mediocre and expensive so it can be hard to find something that my stomach can really appreciate.  The buzz on the street was that Super Duper was worth checking out so we decided to give it a try.

I ordered the super burger with cheese, which is basically a double cheeseburger, garlic fries, and a chocolate shake.  At about $15, this was a super expensive meal that is basically fast food.  The meat was extremely fresh and juicy and the shake was top notch.  However, the fries fell a bit flat for me.  The homemade pickles were tasty but a little chilling would add a crunch that would go a long way.

They've got a small patio outside where your dog can chill while you eat.  Remember to keep them outside the whole time though since they're not allowed inside.  Service is a little slow but the people are pretty nice, but the line moved quickly.  I like that they've got some breakout areas to enjoy your meal so it doesn't just feel like a cavernous space.  Overall, I'd go back for another.

Food: 8/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: What's the big deal?  Average burger, average fries, simple toppings.  What's the big deal, I ask?!?
author: Kamael S.

description: When the burger arrived, it looked like any other burger. When I investigated it and took a picture, it looked like any other burger. But when I picked it up... when I picked it up, I knew it was different. Grease and juice from the patty swimming at the bottom of the wrapper; a river of beef sweat pooling underneath. This was art. The meat was so delicate, my teeth slid through it with ease. The bread was soft and just fluffy enough to compliment the meat, but not drown it out. Overall, a magnificent burger. Only a 4-star because it was expensive for its size. But if you don't mind the price, this is a must try.
author: Jeff S.

description: These burgers are worth the wait. I went in around 7pm on Friday night and the place was packed. I got a cheeseburger with fries and was not disappointed! I would go there again for sure.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I have been craving Super Duper for a while now, but it's kind of out of my way... then I read an article yesterday about how they were giving away free burgers and fries today between 3-4 pm at all locations. "Sweet!", I thought, and cut out of work early so I could be there on time.

I arrived a little after 3, there was no one in line and three people behind the registers, talking to each other. After about 30 seconds of my standing there (I counted), one of them finally acknowledged me by nodding in the direction of the cashier to her left. I walked up to the counter and inquired about the free burgers... and was turned away. Apparently in order to get a free burger between 3-4pm, I would have had to come at 10am to get a "voucher".

Nice idea, Super Duper. Very poor execution. I think I'll have Umami Burger for dinner.
author: Reece W.

description:
For those times when you need to go to pound town on a burger!

As I was parusing the union square area on a free afternoon I was struck by an overwhelming desire to demolish a burger. Having heard good things about Super Duper I decided to check it out. 

It wasn't too full seeing as it was around 2 pm. 

I ordered the super combo (two patties, fries and a drink) and added bacon and cheese. It came out to just a bit over $12. Not that bad but the portions weren't that big, so a bit overpriced. 

But then again...damn that burger was good! It was super juicy (get some extra napkins) and perfectly cooked. The cheese was a perfect kind of melted and the bacon was...well...bacon! 

The fries were nothing special, but good. 

You can also help yourself to a variety of house pickles. I definitely had my fair share and they were dill-icious (ok, not my best work). 

You can add such toppings as a fried egg, and avocado to the burger for $1. Next time!!

You can alas get shakes and soft serve...also next time!!

I'm a fan and I think you'll be too! I'll be back for sure!!
author: Eli Y.

description: I got the mini burger with cheese and bacon and garlic fries and a lemonade with brown sugar. This place is legit good. Oh and the soft serve organic ice cream was yummy too.
author: Christine P.

description: Meh. $16 for a burger and fries that was just okay. If it was $5 cheaper, I'd be more impressed. Good, but not worth almost $20 good.
author: Bobby H.

description:
Super Duper is definitely Super Duper!

Fast, it is not. Especially during the lunch hour on a business day. Even though the sign at the door says you have 5-8 minutes from that point, it's more like 15 minutes and then at least another 15 for your food. So it's a 30+ minute wait for your "fast" food.

But...I can't complain. The Super Duper Salad with grilled chicken, avocado, bacon, and portabella mushrooms is AMAZING and super filling.

I only wish they had sweet potato fries and gluten free buns or at least the option to truly wrap a burger in lettuce. Right now you have to cut a bunless burger with a fork and knife because the lettuce pieces are too small to use as a wrap.
author: Alexis M.

description: I left my hotel on a mission to get some nourishment in my belly before boozing the night away at Karaoke with coworkers. I walked from my hotel in search of food that was fast but not fast food. I sauntered past a Subway & Micky D's until I saw the light of Super Duper Burger. It was a late dinner and not too crowded. I had a burger and fries. It was fine... better than fast food but not great either. The burger was very filling though. I ate a little more than half and was good to go. Maybe I just wanted to move on with the rest of my evening.
author: Scotty C.

description:
This place was great.
Not expensive and pretty mellow for a weekend lunch in the big city. 
I liked their burger it was really good, you can have unlimited pickles (if you are into that) and their special sauce it's pretty good.
Overall we had a good experience, I ordered the 4oz and my boyfriend ordered the 8oz. We both thought they were perfect size, very tasty. Fries are also good and we asked for some special sauce to deep them in and it was overall good food. 
They also have a few outdoor tables for nice days. 
I'm not giving 5 stars because it wasn't like OMG awesome. But it was good and the employees were polite. They need to work on their ventilation as it looked smoky in the eating area. 
They give you glass cups for soda which is nice and looks very eco friendly. 

It was about $20 for two burgers two sodas and 1 order of fries.
author: philip t.

description: the place was packed so we had to leave and come back. I understood very quickly why is was packed. I am still drooling thinking about this yummy flavorful hamburger. I got it the way they make it and it was pretty unforgettable and of course their pickles were delish!
author: Bonnie S.

description: I'll start by saying that all the ice cream and burger selections are REALLY good. However the chicken sandwich is strange, I didn't like it at all. The garlic fries were ok, until you eat the top off them and you just have a pile of regular fries (what's up with that?) As far as complaints, I definitely ordered pickles on my burger that were not there and dips for my fries that I paid for and never got. I'll be back for the occasional spiked milkshake and a mini burger but probably only on days they aren't jam packed so they get my order right.
author: Christopher J.

description:
Okay... Normally I love super duper. I've enjoyed eating at many different locations, but tonight the manager at this location (I think her name was Mia) served us the most pathetic cone I've ever seen.  

I get it, we ordered the kid's size and it was late... And we've done it before... But this was unacceptable. The machine light was blinking so it was clear that the ice cream was either low or not ready yet, but she insisted nothing was wrong as she kept mashing the button to force it out. 

We showed her the cone in disbelief and she defended it saying it was 3 swirls. Meanwhile all of the other coworkers looked at the cone in horror, clearly agreeing with us but afraid to speak up against their boss.

In order to shut us up she rudely told the cashier to refund us... Well all I wanted was an apology and a regular kids size cone. You can look at the picture for yourself.  She said she'd be proud of the cone if we posted a picture. According to her, this is what you're supposed to get if you order the kid's cone which says (okay for adults). Look for the the pathetic chocolate cone. It's easy to spot in the photos. 

Still love super duper... But the manager at this market location needs to be changed. We took the picture right outside without taking a lick. Is this that the product you are proud to serve for 3 bucks? I'd rather get 3 cones at McDonald's.
author: Steven Y.

description: Really amazing burger place in San Francisco. The quality is great, and the garlic cheese fries are unbelievable. Definitely recommend! Only giving four stars because there was a very long line, and it is a little pricy.
author: Beau H.

description:
First time in and was introduced to the place by the kind staff. The food was killer, not a fry left from me or my girlfriend. 

About 20 bucks for both of us, great price great food, great staff.
author: Brock M.

description: I think it was one of the best burgers I've ever had. It was my first time and the cashier was super duper friendly too! Great food, very crowded but we found seats. All in all a delicious burger spot. I will definitely be going back or checking out other locations.
author: Amber H.

description:
Just adding to the already positive reviews about this place... I love their beef burgers specially the mini burger as I love the serving size! They are so fresh and moist! I usually do not like beef, but this is the only place where I like the burgers, to the point that I find them much much better than in-n-out.

One suggestion - the salad size should be a little bigger and have something better than just lettuce tomato and onions... may be make with arugula or other options, basically make it substantial.
author: Parminder Nayyar C.

description: The patty was moist but the burger was really nothing special. I think the highlight of the meal was the milkshake.
author: Shanice C.

description: Truly fresh and delicious.    Loved my burger and the super friendly service.  If there were one of these next door to every McDonald's, McDonald's would go out of business.  I think I only paid $8 or $9 for a super tasty meal.   Loved it.  Will go back.
author: Scott H.

description: Favorite burger place in Cali, much better than In-N-Out. Garlic fries is a must have too.
author: Chloe Y.

description: I love this place. The burgers are great and worth the cost. I would still definitely suggest this place to you. The fries are also delicious. I will definitely return to Super Duper.
author: Will D.

description:
If you're hankering for a burger, the mini burger is big enough for someone like me. I needed something quick and I was starving. I didn't feel like going far to eat, so I stopped in here. I heard you can get alcohol mixed into a shake. I will have to try it sometime.

I've heard the chipolte chicken sandwich is good here which I'll have to try as well.

You definitely need lots of napkins at this place. It tends to drip a ton. 

Can't really say much more than that. They serve you quick if it's not super busy.
author: Amy J.

description: The burger really made my day!! I ate every bit. If you ever don't know what to eat, play it safe, treat yourself and eat a burger and fries. Their lunch combo is amazing. Well worth the money
author: Cade N.

description: Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside patties, fresh lettuce and tomato slices, rich cheese, crunchy bacon: simply yummy! A bit on the expensive side for a burger (10$ for the burger itself), but that's probably because I'm too used to burgers being the cheapest food available :P
author: Da W.

description:
Dare I say best burger in the city?

Yeahh, I think so. My friends always ask me if they compare to In N Out, and honestly, yes. They do. They're a different type of burger, so I won't pick sides, but my top 2 burgers are definitely In N Out and Super Duper. Just depends what you're craving.

Super Duper is quality. Niman ranch burgers (!!!) cooked to that medium, juicy goodness. And MAN are they juicy! The first time I went, my friend dripped sauce all over her pants. Worth it. The price is worth it too: $4.75 for a mini (one patty) and $6.75 for a Super (double patty). I think it's delicious with just the default free toppings, but if you want more, they have options like portobello mushrooms and organic eggs -- YUM. Even their Strauss cream milkshakes are delicious!

Being a San Franciscan, I give Super Duper definite props for their "slow food values." The fact that everything's compostable makes lazy ol' me very happy because all I gotta do is dump everything in the compost bin!

It's gonna take me a whoole lotta willpower to stop myself from having Super Duper every week.
author: Alyssa T.

description:
If you want to be full and satisfied, come here.

You might have to wait through a long line, but it goes by quicker than you'd expect. Do you like burgers? Garlic fries? Delicious milkshake? Even donuts? They have 'em here.

It can be a hard finding some seating. And the food is pretty greasy. But damn, it's good. Best for small groups (2-4 people). Party bigger than 4? I'd suggest taking the food to go and eating elsewhere.

This is all opinion, but it's better than Five-Guys. And a decent In-N-Out alternative.
author: Brian K.

description:
One of the best burgers in the city.  Always a stop when friends are in town to try.

Lots of great things on the menu. Go for the garlic fires and an burger.  Chicken is also very good!!  Try to go before or after lunch time, line can be long.  So must mean it's good!!!
author: Jeffrey D.

description: It's my second time in SF and my second visit to Super Duper. If I recall correctly, last time I had a mini cheeseburger with a fried egg, which was excellent. This time I ordered a double cheeseburger (Super Duper with cheese) with everything in it, and it's weird, but it was TOO tasty and flavorful. I almost couldn't finish it, and believe me, I'm addicted to burgers. My guess is that there was too much cheese in it. The fries are OK.
author: Lucas C.

description:
Got a kind message from the manager explaining the ingredients are organic and all-natural and that makes it hard to compare to say In-N-Out.

Taking their time to address a concern shows a great business. I'm happily bumping them to 4 (original review 3.5) for having some of the best customer service I've seen in "fast food" both in-store and apparently now, outside!

Great burgers, great people.
author: Doug R.

description:
Trust me, it lives up to its name. 

I love this place, the burgers are super juicy and delicious. Those who don't like to see any pink in their meat, stay away, but the burgers are cooked to perfection. 

The fries are also great, especially the garlic fries with cheese on top. 

Definitely try one of their shakes. Sure, they might be a little bit on the pricier side, but if you've never had a chocolate AND fresh strawberry shake, now is the time. 

Not only that, but you can order it spike with soju. EVEN BETTER. 

Beware, after you eat, there is no getting the super duper burger smell off of your hands. It permeates it and you'll be smelling it all day as you type along on your computer.

The soft serve is also amazing, but I would say go for the kiddie cone, because the one for big kids (or adults as many people would say) is practically bigger than your head, and I felt like i had just had enough calories to feed a small family by the time I had finished my meal.
author: Annie S.

description: You can't go wrong with   The lines do move along pretty quickly here.  The  is worth the wait but I must admit it's still not the best burger in NY!  Sometimes it feels too greasy.  This location is pretty convenient since you can take it to go and go munch on the promenade if you dare take a little walk.  Stay away from their It tastes horrible!  Medicinal almost.  I had it once and never again.
author: John Z.

description: The burgers are literally dripping with grease.  I felt nauseous afterwards.  Perhaps it's known for that, but it was a bit much for me.  The flavor was good, just too messy/greasy.
author: Branden B.

description: This was on of the best burgers I have ever had hands down! The line was out the door when we arrived which is always a good sign at a place you've never been to before. The atmosphere was super relaxed and the customer service was also amazing! We ordered the mini's which were more than enough and a  spiked milkshake which I did not know was possible and was a perfect complement if you want a buzz and do not like beer. I highly recommend this place you love burgers and if you love pickles!! Because the you cannot forget about their homemade pickles
author: Selina M.

description:
I saw how big these burgers were and they were massive so we decided to come here since we were so hungry.  This was also the first place we went to eat when we arrived at SF.  Good thing we walked because it looks terrible to drive around this area.  

Garlic Fries: Stinky and delicious! It was more like toppings than actually melted on top of the fries but none the less it was delicious.  Could have used more garlic for me though.
The 3 sauces: I thought it was a lil expensive to buy the 3 sauces for $1.50 but I will admit that the mayo and chipotle were a hit with my mouth.
Chicken Sandwich with a bunch of crap on it: I felt a lot better eating this than the  burger so that was nice.  A little better than average since you can taste the freshness.
Mini burger: Just the right size for me.  
Spiked Cookies n Cream Shake: alcoholic milkshake!!! YES PLEASE!
author: Jackie N.

description: Tasty is good as I expect. I felt pate was similar to five guys and original source was similar to shake shack.
author: Goo F.

description: Delicious!! Amazing juicy burgers comparable to te tasty ness of in n out! So delicious delicious delicious. Fun atmosphere, amazing garlic fries, and great regular fries. Prices are reasonable. Single and double parties available. Lots of sauces to pick from as well. Toppings are not extra except for avocado and bacon. Definitely recommend eating at SuPer Duper! Truly was super duper !
author: Yekta P.

description: Hello deliciousness!! Garlic fries, ice cream, burgers & beer! Let the party continue!
author: Monika Y.

description:
I love super duper burgers but on my recent visit sept 27 Sunday to market street was pretty appalled by the behavior of one of the employee towards another customer. 

Lady in red tshirt (employee) messed up the order, no big deal. But instead of apologizing and moving on put up a show as if she was checking for the order. Told the customer the order was being prepared when she actually gave the order to another customer (who was a teenage kid). The kid who got the order was waiting for his friend to get her order. The lady (employee) called the kid back replaced his order with the right one, took the order from kid instead of tossing it out put it back on the tray where cook puts finished order and brought it out to the first customer. While she exchanged some comment in Spanish that caused another female employee to giggle.

The visibly irate customer must have really loved the burger from super duper, proceeded to eat on it. I would have just walked away. 

Generally they have very nice customer service hope it was just one employee who needs to be retrained in customer service and state hygiene laws.

I decided not to eat at the place for rest of my stay in SFO.
author: Som S.

description: I walked down to Super Duper Burgers for lunch while visiting SF. The restaurant was very busy during prime lunch hours (weekday). I ordered a chicken sandwich with chipotle aioli, garlic fries, and a milkshake. The chicken sandwich was tasty with the right amount of spiciness. All of the ingredient blended well together. The bread was soft. Super Duper Burger garlic fries were crispy and flavorful. I thought the milkshake was good but not great. Service was fast. I will try a burger next time since its SDB specialty. I give Super Duper Burgers a 3.5 rating on my first visit.
author: Dominic B.

description: I tried their mini burger and the garlic fries and oh my goodness they were delicious! The only problem is that the food is a bit greasy but other than that, I would totally recommend this place to those visiting San Francisco!!
author: Leng K.

description: I was really excited to try this place after reading the reviews. I made BF take me here for a "snack" after lunch. We shared a small burger with cheese, bacon, the works and avocado. I think it's just ok. Really not as fantabulous as I thought it would be. I'm from OC and honestly in n out burger is better or a Paul Marten burger is way better. At least now I know
author: Han D.

description:
I was only in San Fran for the weekend and this burger place was about a 5 minute walk from our hotel. Being a burger lover and after seeing mostly good reviews, I decided to have Super Duper for dinner my first night in town. What a disappointment.

The burger was dry and over-cooked and the "Super Duper" sauce they smother it in was way too bitter and garlic-y. I also ordered the garlic fries after reading that they were a "must have" and could not have been more let down. I was served cold fries drenched in oil. There was barely any garlic on my garlic fries and the cheese that it was stopped with was cold and soggy.

The restaurant was overcrowded and the tables aren't bussed properly. There are old food bits all over the tables. I had a difficult time seeing the appeal.

Honestly, this place is severely overpriced and disappointing. I wish I had just saved my money. A McDonald's cheeseburger would have probably been better quality.
author: Jen A.

description: Super Duper Burgers is amazing. Their burgers are on par with many restaurants' burgers that cost twice as much when figuring in tax and tip. Their beef is cooked medium by default and, while I'm usually a rare-burger sort of person, I gladly eat these burgers because they are sooooo good. The patties are juicy and tender, and vegetables seem fresh. The bacon is good bacon. Sauce is good. Overall, they are efficient, service-wise, so the burger comes out reasonably fast. Not as fast as, say, McDonald's, but unlike McDonald's, these burgers are totally worth the short wait.
author: Jimmy H.

description:
This place serves some amazing classic burgers!! Came here right after eating at Umami Burger because that place didn't fill me up haha :P

-I ordered the Mini Burger with everything on it (lettuce, tomato, red onions, super sauce, $4.75). I don't know why, but i asked for no cheese, and I definitely regretted it afterwards. SO DON'T FORGET THE CHEESE GUYS (+$0.75)! I got an extra topping of roasted portobello. For you mushroom lovers out there, this is a MUST GET item (+$1.00). 
The burger came out juicy and fabulous! They also toasted the buns so that it came out slightly crunchy, which I really liked. This burger is one of the best classic burgers that I have ever eaten, no lie!!

-I also ordered the french fries ($2.25). They came out extremely hot and fresh, so it was really crunchy and good. I definitely would have ordered the garlic fries instead ($2.75), but I had to volunteer after the meal, so I didn't want to kill anyone with my garlic-dragon breath. 

For the price and everything, I think that this place is definitely worth it!! 5 STARS! I can't wait to go again (: Oh, but just a warning. There is a little bit of a wait for the food. I went around 5:00pm on a friday so there wasn't really a wait in line to order, but they take a little bit longer to make the burger since they make it fresh.
author: Jackie T.

description:
Came for lunch. It seems like this place is always crowded so if you see a table, go for it. Service was friendly but so slow during lunch time. I think we waited around 20 minutes for our food.

I had the mini burger (4oz +cheese) and garlic fries (garlic, aged cheddar). The burger was juicy but not particularly incredible. The bun was hard and a bit stale. The fries were crispy and delicious, but the portions are small so I wouldn't recommend sharing. Delicious self-serve house pickles.

Overall, decent but not memorable.
author: Ashley K.

description: Had lunch here for the first time and it was pretty good! I was able to get my burger lettuce wrapped and the pattie was juicy and flavorful. My only complaint would be with the salads. I was originally going to order one, but everything you want added on is extra. Bacon and avocado are $1.00 each and chicken is $3.50! A $6.00 salad could quickly turn into $12 & up. Other than that, no complaints.
author: Brianna R.

description:
A solid burger joint. For Market street it's a moderately priced lunch spot. 

One of the many upsides is a great space with lots of seating and good beer on tap (Racer 5). 

I tried the blue cheese burger and another one with jalapenos and enjoyed both. 

Their fries were very good as well. All in all this is a pretty good place to eat. It's not the best burger place I've ever been to but considering the price you can't go wrong here if you don't want to pay $20 for a burger. I'd go here for lunch given that it is so close to my office.
author: Carlos A.

description: The garlic fries are great and the food here is fresh great staff very friendly gave 4 stars burgers could be bigger but overall very good I recommend this place if your not trying to spend to much SF is known for high prices but super duper is very reasonable.
author: Steven K.

description:
It's a freaking travesty, and indicative of the basic shortcoming of Yelp, that Super Duper Burger does not have five stars at all locations.

I've only had two hamburgers, outside of a steakhouse, that rival Super Duper Burger. One is at Gott's Roadside near Napa, the other is at The Onion Grill in Lombard, IL (sadly, closed). 

These burgers are so juicy and delicious, they don't even need condiments to be enjoyed, but the fresh lettuce, tomato and onion really balance the beef. 

Some uncultured plebeian had the audacity to call these burgers too "greasy." Honestly, Yelp needs to screen people to determine whether they even know what they are talking about before they can post a review. Burgers are not GREASY...Burgers are JUICY...And that's a good quality for burgers to have. To slight a magnificently juicy burger means that you have no idea what you are talking about and should just go back to reviewing salad spots. 

The other amazing thing here:  Milkshakes made with Strauss Family Creamery ice cream and milk. Just thinking about sucking down one of these shakes has me gulping in anticipation. 

Lastly, the pickle situation. This is the only flaw in an otherwise perfect burger experience. Burgers without pickles should just be called "ground-beef sandwiches." Burgers need pickles to survive. I love the fact that I can grab as many pickles as I please. But, the pickles are roughly cut, and most are too thick to easily fit on top of an already tottering burger. I have to either take the time to root through my pickle stock for thinly cut pickles to add, or I have to balance chunkier pickle pieces on the edge of my burger before taking a bite. While this solves the problem, it does make eating a bit awkward. Please provide us with thin-sliced pickles for our burgers!
author: Alex K.

description: Very flavorfull burgers and sauces. Fries and shakes were average, although the shakes can be spiked.
author: Boris F.

description: Sad to say the burger was a big disappointment. The party was way too thin and it had no flavor. All I could taste was the black pepper stayed into the meat. Also the buns a bit too dry for my taste. The garlic fries were good where it was crispy but the cheese overpowered the garlicky goodness.....not the best when your primary goal of eating these is to get this taste.
author: Chris S.

description: Yummy chicken patty.. delicious ice cream..
author: Kalaisri S.

description: First time here and I was pleased the place was very clean the upstairs seating is pretty cool good food worth a try
author: Sac M.

description:
Fantastic burger! Great toppings. I got the mini and garlic fries and a organic chocolate shake. Nothing about my experience or food was less than satisfactory!!

The delivery was quick, service was great, and the food was phenomenal!!!!!!!
author: David S.

description: I wish I took a picture of my mini burger meal but I was so hungry and forgot to take one haha. Honestly, this place is so good, I would even compare it to Shake Shack in NY. I think it is better than in-n-out by a hair. The meat was so juicy and it tasted so fresh. I would honestly drive back to SF to just eat at this place again!!
author: Tina N.

description:
Now this was a good burger, hands down. Cooked like I wanted it (well done) and still had the juices.

The ONLY reason it's not 5 stars is because I am a Texan and when I see a SUPER DUPER, the size better fit the bill.

Other than that, no negatives here besides the long wait at noon...totally my fault. I should've waited or went earlier.

No worries. I'll make sure there's a follow up. ;-)
author: Brian J.

description: Two minds about this place. Yes, it's good. Good burgers. Relaxed and hip. It's a sit in but also a take out, with an ambiance that's neither. Food is good, no worries there. But it's is a burger that's not mind-blowingly good. Just good. If your passing, then yes; go for it. But don't hunt it out. (Unless your a McDonald's fan, then this will totally blow your mind)
author: Patrick T.

description: Everything here is wonderful! This was my husbands and mines first time eating here. The food was delicious and quite filling. Their service was amazing. Plus they g
author: Amber H.

description:
Love the Garlic fries!!! Super indeed!!

I've tried this place 3 times and haven't been disappointed so far ! Tried the chicken sandwich and the mini burger. 

Mini Burger- Fresh buns and patties. Loved it

Chicken Sandwich- Even better. Fresh, Juicy!! Actually feels healthy!!! ( that's if a burger can be ever described as healthy ;0)

I hear their shakes are good. Haven't tried them though.
author: Insiya N.

description: Yea this place was pretty dang good. The burgers were super juicy and flavour was spot on. Price a little high but not really for the quality of stuff. Wish the burger was a little bigger but thats just because I wanted to keep eating. Perfect for grabbing some delish grub at a decent price. Quick service. You want a late night burger, drop by and enjoy a super duper burger.
author: Josh B.

description:
I love Super Duper burgers!

I've been here a few times (I prefer the Metreon location as it is a bit more consistent).
The mini burger is delicious, but if you prefer more meat, get the super duper with double patties.

The chicken burger is also top-notch and is a much larger portion that one would think and I actually prefer it over the beef burgers.

The fries are solid. 

Super Duper is one of the best burger joints in the SOMA area. It gets crowded for lunch and dinner as it has a constant stream of customers so be prepared to wait sometimes.
author: Jeffrey Q.

description:
A great burger joint in the Financial District downtown. After a long morning at a conference held at the Moscone Center, I walked around to find a place for lunch. I discovered super duper burger and decided to grab some food here on a whim.

I ordered the veggie burger that came with all the toppings (lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, etc). I also requested a side of garlic fries. I was really hungry, and this place did not disappoint. My burger was very flavorful and had great texture. The garlic fries were not overly garlicky, were nice and salty, and was topped with cheese and herbs. Plus, they provided unlimited homemade pickles that I took advantage of by the condiment bar. Lunch came out to be less than $10, which is very affordable. The portions are very generous, and they gave me so much food that I could not finish it all. 

All in all, my meal was very delicious.  However, it was particularly greasy (we're talking puddles of it forming at the bottom of my tray), so I docked off one star for that. 

I think I'll come here again. I would recommend this place to anyone with a healthy appetite! Definitely the best caloric value per dollar in town.
author: Victoria C.

description:
With so many casual made-to-order burger restaurants sprouting up all over the place, it's hard to disguinish between them all. This place takes a classic burger and elevates it just a notch with their all meat patty. It was bursting with that deep, rich, beefy flavor with tons of meat juice (yeah, I said meat juice) running all over the burger. My super duper burger was super duper juicy.

*Thumbs up*
As previously mentioned, it's all about the meat patty. It is similar to Shake Shack in NYC, but not quite there. But it's juicy and flavorful -- what I look for in a good burger. The other components were fine, from the lettuce, tomato, and sesame bun. The garlic and aged white cheddar fries was excellent and nicely executed. The fries were crispy on the outside, and the cheese just made the fries POP.

*Thumbs down*
I tried their organic vanilla soft serve cone, choco-dipped. It melted super duper fast and tasted kind of bland (if you can imagine that for a vanilla ice cream cone). I think it's a bit of a rip-off for $4. Heck, you can get an extra mini burger for that!
author: Dru C.

description:
I've come here twice now and both times I ordered to-go and both times my orders were wrong.... -___- I can understand if it was super busy, but both times I came at 11 am on a weekday right before the lunch rush and there was maybe 10 people in the place. 

TIP: DON'T ORDER ADD-ONS BECAUSE you'll most likely just be wasting your money - because it will not be in there (i.e. bacon, avocados, etc etc.)

Nothing is sadder than ordering bacon on your burger because you had a rough day, getting back to work for lunch and realizing it's not there. :( #TRUTH
author: Jessie D.

description:
It's one of the best burger around.The meat taste very fresh and is advertised on the menu as cook to a medium. Unfortunately at this location 4 times out of 5 it comes out well done. The manager should pay attention to what the cooks are doing. Hence the 3 stars but otherwise 4 stars.

The fries are like all the other frozen french fries... it would have been a great complement to these fantastic burgers if they would have had fresh cut fries. But since the invention of frozen fries most every restaurant use them and they all taste like cardboard no wonder why they had to create the garlic fries.
author: Ron D.

description:
I had the Super Burger with everything on it, which was pretty tasty but the Garlic Fries were what made the meal for me. Every burger joint should offer some type of non-standard fries imo, so I was really pleased with these awesome garlic fries. My girlfriend also had an organic soft serve cone which was delicious too. 

The staff was also really friendly and was pretty efficient as a whole considering how busy it was.
author: Daniel L.

description: Great burgers. Cool friendly atmosphere.  Definitely try the garlic fries and milkshakes.  Burgers taste super fresh on same level as In-N-Out or 5 guys. Well worth the price and only 10 minute wait.
author: Octavio O.

description:
The garlic fries are to die for...
Whatever you get here will be yummy. Sure wish they were in Oklahoma City.
author: Barbie L.

description: The burgers are juicy and the garlic fries are to die for,dont forget the dips,the seevice is fast...Great Burgers
author: John A.

description:
I love you super duper
And no, this review isn't a blooper
I'm totally serious, just like a storm trooper
because this place is seriously super

The burgers are juicy as juicy can be
And their garlic fries with what? Cheese!
This place rocks and I love it a lot
DId you know you can also get egg on it?  please stop....

OK, so I found one of my favorite burger joints....ever!  Super Duper burgers are amazing!  Juicy, delicious, and their garlic fries?!  Yo, I usually don't like garlic fries, but this place makes them great!  Great!  

OK not much else to say but go here!
author: Dennis K.

description: Good, solid burgers. Only drawback was that the wait was kind of long.
author: Wayne A.

description:
We had the late night munchies and went to Super Duper right before closing time. Everyone was so incredibly friendly, even though I'm certain they were all dying to get out of there.
The burgers and garlic fries were B-O-M-B!
author: Relz -.

description: Awesome burgers! Very tasty and reasonably priced. Beef is organic. Place looks clean and has plenty of seating. I work not too far from this place and go every once in a while. And let me tell you, I have never been disappointed! The staff is fast and friendly. There is some upstairs seating available. The place does get busy so pack some time. The fries are good and so are the shakes. I continue to come because the food is fresh, high quality and tasty! If you are near by, you should stop by!
author: Alexandra L.

description:
YUMMY BURGER ALERT

Yes, the burgers are good.  Chocolate shake is bomb also.  Kind of sad that the kids' size shake is like 1/10 the size of a regular shake, but it is what it is.  

The garlic fries are EXTREMELY garlicky.  Which IMO is a good thing.  But take that how you will.

I actually like the burgers here better than Umami burger, but that's just me.
author: Rachel S.

description:
That was one juicy burger! The mini 4oz was just perfect for me with everything on it plus jalapeno peppers. Next time, I'd ask for extra jalapenos. I really enjoyed this burger, as the first bite was just as enjoyable as the last. Patty was perfectly cooked. 

I LOVE pickles, and their homemade pickles are good, but I wouldnt want to say...take a whole jar home or anything. The pickles have a distinct flavor and has less of that vinegar kick.

Garlic fries were good, nothing to rave about. 

Tried a spiked Strawberry Shake, which was more like a strawberry milk smoothie. Although refreshing, I was disappointed since I was expecting something more malty. 

Would definitely come back for more burgers!
author: Anna S.

description:
At first I thought Super Duper was anything but. However, now that I've returned a few times, my opinion & waistline have grown. Before I gush out my love for the burgers and awesome garlic fries, there are few things you must know.  

This is a greasy spoon for sure. Don't even kid yourself about this one. The food is super greasy here, so just go if you're ok with a couple post-meal burps. Secondly, the line can get long especially at lunch hour during the week, so it's best to get it to go or have a dedicated swooper to grab a table if one becomes available.

Now for the good stuff. Super Duper delivers solid burgers quickly at a reasonable price in downtown. This is enough to bring me here occasionally. On top of that, they are great about getting orders right and you can add cheese, avocado, egg, and other things, all of which are fantastic. To top things off, they make great fries, I live getting the garlic fries, which are lightly sprinkled with cheese. They are the bomb! 

Super Duper is really just a solid place to get a good burger at a good price. I wouldn't go out of my way for it, but as long as I work in the neighborhood, I'll definitely be dropping by.
author: Nicolas H.

description: This place has pretty good burgers if you've craving one after shopping at the mall.  The shakes are really good too except my boyfriend found part of the plastic that seals the cap of a milk container to prevent tampering.  It must have fallen in their blender or something.  They were concerned when we told them about it and gave us our milkshake and half our meal for free.  They also stopped serving milk shakes for the rest of the day.
author: Jane H.

description: The burgers can be a bit overpriced but it's still amazingly delicious. I love the free pickles they give and nobody can say no to free foods. I say the milkshakes aren't worth it but of course that's just my opinion. They give more than enough icecream though.
author: Sul L.

description: Crazy line out the door had me very intrigued... Double burger with cheese and bacon had me impressed... Cheese fries with garlic had me sold... And the Cookies and cream milkshake had me thankful for the reviews on yelp so I stopped by. Certainly not a 5 star meal but for heap eats it delivers. Reminds me of Shake Shack. Def worth the try.
author: Clark L.

description:
I have a pretty high standard for burgers, but this one blew me away; it's the perfect fast food burger. The smell of burgers and fries and special sauce hits you right when you walk in, and it makes waiting for your burger so, so hard. They have good beer on tap and sodas in the fridge. The burger itself was amazing, like, seriously. Juicy meat, awesome sauce, delicious and high quality patties -- to die for. The fries were good too: the have garlic fries, which is always a big plus, and they don't feel so fatty, although they just put pure garlic on the fries, as opposed to the other spices other places often like to out on, so it takes some getting good used to. There's a good amount of space inside so it's not too hard to find a seat, even though it's usually packed.

I can't wait to go back.
author: Luke K.

description:
This place is a hidden jewel among the busy clutter of Market Street. 

I was initially reluctant to enter the establishment, however once I bit into my burger, I was amazed. The menu was brief but comprehensive. Due to how concise the selection was, the ordering process went fairly smooth. All the cashier had to do was ask me some short questions of how I wanted my food and all I had to do was say yes or no. Straight to the point is how I like it. 

The burger was superb! It was crispy on the outside and nice and juicy in the middle. I loved the texture of the burger and rich taste. The restaurant has a second story seating area, that, although very small, is fun to sit at in order to overlook the entire place. The soda that I had was extremely carbonated, which, I enjoyed so much! The carbonation in my sprite was much stronger than most other fountain machines. I really enjoyed that part so much. Mainly because I love the carbonated sensation. 

My experience was great overall and the food was extremely delicious! I am definitely returning to this jewel of a restaurant whenever I have the chance.
author: Mark S.

description: Awful. The food was inedible. The whole place stunk like pickles. Filthy and gross. Overpriced. Discourteous staff. There's no reason to eat here.
author: Elle W.

description:
Beware the snake, the siren's song.  The mixed metaphor of this and Danger Will Robinson.

Life is short you say.  I'm going to eat and wear and play and indulge to my eyeballs, my eternal soul be damned.

Hmm.

Maybe don't say that.

We live on a slippery slope, perhaps, with the no shortage of opportunities to keep our minds from more important things.  Simplicity is a thing of the past.  Think of how you feel when your mobile device fails you.  Scary, really.

I found a little simplicity last night, and I liked it a lot.  I've been meditating on it ever since.  Super Duper will save you from limbo, baby.

Tucked along the pee-soaked stretch of Market between Third Street and Yerba Buena Lane is this place I used to pass quickly, as I was more usually in a hurry from one place to another, rushing to get my gluttony on.  I never gave it a second look.  And I thought it had a silly name.  Me, all with the prideful airs.

I was so wrong.  Again.  Last night I had the good fortune to sample one of the tastiest burgers I've had in a very long time.  Just a double cheeseburger with some grilled peppers, fries, pickles (a ton of pickles) and a tasty pilsner.  That's all.  Nothing over the top, right?  Not so much.  I'll travel to SF for another at the hint of an invitation.  It was that good.  I don't care if I have to use my gadget legs to get down Market, strong go go gadget legs because my feet are all stuck to the pee.  

The staff were friendly, but not cloyingly so.  The decor is deliberately minimalist.  I liked it upstairs because you could look downstairs and see people eating happy simple food.

Trust me on all these things.  I think I've got this one properly sussed.
author: Markus N.

description:
I love how much the folks at Super Duper try to cram on each of their burgers. Want lettuce? Tomato? Onion? Jalapenos? Grilled onions? They're all standard! Paired with the fact that their regular burger has two patties (making it a half-pound beast), and you've got yourself a mondo burger.

And being a mondo burger, it's bound to be messy. All of the ingredients are great, but the fact that both the cashier and the menu warned me about it being a little sloppy means I had to load up on napkins. It makes for a good meal, but one more suitable for a knife and fork, if you could believe it.
author: Casey S.

description: Favorite Bay Area burger chain for a quick burger. Despite what the line may look like during lunch, it moves fast and food is ready never more than 5 minutes after you order. I've had regular and super burgers (8oz or 16oz) and both are delicious. Prices can get a little steep if you go all in - I always add the bacon, egg and cheese - but on par with other quality spots such as Roam or 4505.
author: Greg R.

description:
Good food? Yes. Overpriced? Yep.

You're getting good food here, this is one of the more satisfying restaurants we ate at for lunch, but it was a bit overpriced for burgers and fries. Even so, I'd probably stop by again but I wouldn't go out of my way.

Tip:  Try the fresh strawberry milkshake, it is delicious!
author: Zira C.

description: The garlic Parmesan fries were amazing. The burger was delicious. Everything tasted wonderful and I will definitely be visiting this place again when I have a big appetite.
author: Chiara L.

description:
Dont believe the hipster hype. 

 fries had that reheated texture and at best were poorly cooked.

tomato in my burger was clearly frozen at some point. 

Enjoyed my milkshake
author: David P.

description:
This was our first trip to SF for Valentine's Day weekend. We stayed at union square and just wanted something quick and local because  restaurants would be packed due to the holiday weekend.

Burgers: juicy and delicious. I got the mini which was perfect for me with everything on it plus bacon and cheese. My guy got the super burger which was great for a guy--it's a man's burger. The garlic fries were delish... A lot of garlic but a nice amount of cheese which was unexpected. The service was quick. It's also environmentally friendly as 100% of its materials are compostable. Oh the self serve spicy pickles are yummy with quite a kick!
author: Devin T.

description:
If I can rate a million I would, burger are SO bomb! I have yet to try it with egg but the strawberry smoothie is the way to go, If I could I would drink one everyday! Mini burger with garlic fries and a strawberry shake for your first time!!!!! 
  GO GO GO! Service is great, employees are so nice help you with anything you need and the environment and where it's at is busy but it nice and many seating! Get there early bc lines do get long!
author: Melanie P.

description:
I can kick myself for not discovering this place sooner.  I'm surprised I've never even heard anyone talk about this place before until my boyfriend's brother gave us a recommendation to this place.

The bf and I each got a mini burger with added cheese and a side of garlic fries. First bite, and omg, it was a burger from heaven. Completely orgasmic.  The bun was slight toasted, the patty was nice and juicy and the sauce just tied it all together. I might be able to even say I like this place more than Umami Burger for half the price! 

Definitely one of my favorite burger places now.
author: Harriet W.

description: These were definitely good burgers but with gourmet burger places cropping up all over the place calling yourself Super Duper kind of obligates you to stand above the rest. Well, it's better than many but as good as plenty of others. If you're looking for a good gourmet burger then you'll be happy.
author: Anthony Nalli ..

description: Yummy! They serve organic meat here. My burger was delicious! Great place to take a break and eat a quick meal when hanging out with my girlfriends in SF.
author: Claire O.

description: Tasty good burgers! Super Duper was yummy, but a little greasy. Garlic fries were perfectly cooked and delicious. The menu is not very large, but they got something for everyone, including veggy burgers and alcoholic drinks. It was really busy even at off time and there's not enough sitting. Customers bus their own tables and are not cleaned in between customers. Staff was friendly. Will definitely go back!
author: Teresa C.

description:
Good little spot- friendly customer service that was quick and food came out shortly after ordering.
I ordered the chicken sandwich with normal fries and was very happy with it. Chicken Sandwich was on good bread and the  chipotle aoli gave it nice flavor. Fries were good as well and good ketchup I believe may be homemade all in all everything was very good but nothing out of this world to get the 5th star. Would highly recommend for a quick bite in SOMA.
author: Ben S.

description:
Heard some good things about this burger joint so I thought I'd give it a try.

Got here at 6pm on a Wednesday and there was no line. That's always the best feeling when you're starving and you know you're gonna get your food without any competition.

Cashier was awesome. Never been here so she made some great recommendations on food. You get a little buzzer when you order so there isn't that whole mob crowding the pick-up area. Seating was plentiful because it was empty but right after I ordered, there was a line to the door. 

Food was very fresh and burger was a perfect size, no food comas that night. Garlic fries weren't overwhelmingly garlic as they can be but still, a piece of gum was needed after the meal.

It's not a cheapy mcdouble from McD's but it is overall a quality place and I would eat here again.
author: Eric B.

description: My partner got The Mini burger with blue cheese and bacon and chipotle aioli was juicy and hit the spot, just the right amount. I got the Chicken Burger with Thousand Island dressing.  It was really good, they over did it on the sauce, way too much for my taste but I can see why people love it. It was inexpensive so that's a big plus. Minus points,  no ranch, no bbq sauce,  no hot sauce, for a place that has been open for 5 years that's not right lol : -) . Service was ok too, helpful and accurate.
author: Carlos S.

description: The burgers were sooo greasy. Kinda pricey, $7 for a mini burger?? Pass. The garlic fries were good tho, they were crispy and airy. Overall I wouldn't come back.
author: Tracy N.

description: Back for Oracle Openworld and back again! New location this year, less crowded than near the Moscone Center which is nice. Back as a vegetarian this year, and while I miss the beef burger the veggie burger was really good! Friendly employees too. Might need some garlic fries before I leave...
author: Amanda T.

description:
I LOVED IT HERE!!!

It was my first time with my girlfriend and we got in just before the dinner rush. They were friendly when I told them it was my first time there and helped me through the order. It was a bit loud, but that was because we came in RIGHT before the dinner rush and the fact it's on Market. 

Food quality was amazing, the bacon was not too crisp but not too soft. The patty was nice and juicy. Everything was cooked to perfection for me.

Definitely recommending to all my friends and colleagues.
author: Steven T.

description:
Customizable juicy burgers and garlic fries!  serves beer on tap and has complimentary sour pickles ! 

Great combination!
author: David M.

description: We had a great experience when eating here. The atmosphere is fun and the food was great. I did not particularly like the lemonade (made with brown sugar) but that is probably just a matter of taste,
author: Doug H.

description: Burgers were good, salad is way over priced... 6 bucks for a regular garden salad is ridiculous, and on top of that they couldn't even get my dressing correct...
author: Henry C.

description:
There burgers are better than most high end restaurants.
This location is the best one, with the fastest service and great staff. 
Super D. Burgers has also turned me into a pickle fan.
author: Frank H.

description:
Why can't there be a Super Duper Burger in New York? 

Solid burger and fries. Yes, some people may say that SDB is just like Shake Shack but there is just something about SDB that leaves me with another craving for more. Quick service, juicy burgers, delicious fries. I will definitely go back the next time I am ever in SF again.
author: Risca P.

description:
Got the Super Duper burger (2 patties!) with "everything on it" (which entitles lettuce, tomato, and red onions) and added cheese for $.50 more, which totaled to $7

(+) pretty bomb burger! The sauce hit the spot, the bun was nicely toasted, and the veggies made me feel like I'm eating a good (and not overly unhealthy) burger
(+) unlimited pickles! Just grab a tray and go for the jar of pickles
(+) garlic fries were good but a lot smaller than expected so don't expect to be full by ordering this by itself; it's a good size to go with a burger though!

I'll definitely be back for the burger if I'm ever craving it when I'm walking around Downtown. And I want to try their soft-serve ice cream! They DIP it in chocolate!
author: Sandy T.

description: Absolutely the best double cheese burger in SF. I had it medium rare and you could taste the quality beef. The fries were good. 5 Guys beat them on the fries with the quantity they provide. Homemade complimentary pickles are a plus. Plenty of help to handle the huge crowd. I think they are a bit stingy on the shakes.
author: Steve G.

description: The garlic fries were awesome. The 8 and 4oz burgers were also awesome. I can feel the fat around me.
author: Vinson H.

description: Usually good but once in a while, the cheese isn't fully melted on the burgers. When you ask them to fully melt the cheese, they can get sassy and argue the cheese is already fully melted, even though it is clearly not.
author: Yanni L.

description: I was not expecting this place to be so good. The only reason I wanted to come was because i thought the name was funny. But it's AMAZING. It takes a lot for me to want to rate a burger of all things. This burger was definitely worth it. Garlic fries were a bit too garlicky for my taste, but I'll definitely be back for the burgers!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Walked by this place and decided to stop by for a bite one evening.  I love the simple menu.  Made it easy for me to go with a Super Duper Burger w/Cheese ($7) and Fries ($2).
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zjlwTVZOyCU8OzzUPEavQQ?select=WoaLFa78kj9uBT-cP-B2fw

The Burger was very tasty.....juicy, Cheesy, and the Lettuce/Tomato/Onions all went well together well with the toasted Bun....yum!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zjlwTVZOyCU8OzzUPEavQQ?select=d2ZekXvNQ7Hrl6K0baMmEw

The Fries were OK, not great.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zjlwTVZOyCU8OzzUPEavQQ?select=e_lkeYkjEfBf9neGFMq_YQ

Overall, it was a pretty good Burger joint...would definitely come back.

Return Factor - 90%
author: J D.

description: Visited from Colorado and what a happy accident it was to stumble upon this conscious burger extravaganza. A wonderful atmosphere, timely and friendly staff all come together with grace and environmental awareness! I had the garlic fries and a Veggie burger, both were the best I've ever eaten. No lie. HIGHLY recommend this place. Don't pass up on the free homemade pickles!
author: Adrian H.

description:
Some of y'all are being too entitled and anal about this place. Let me set you guys straight: their burgers are FANTASTIC, and their service is SUPERB! The ingredients are taste so fresh (especially the tomato- it melts right into your mouth!) and the patties are sooo juicy. The garlic fries are also amazingly good! They also sell some breakfast items here, as well as dessert like soft-served ice cream. Definitely my favorite burger joint in all of SF. The only downside that I can think of is that it gets extremely packed during lunch time to the point where the line is out the door.

ily super duper burgers
author: Tiffany Mae C.

description: The bomb. Unbelievable garlic fries and chicken sandwich. Pickles fabulous. Top it off with delicious ice cream cone. Can't understand why other Restaraunts can't bang food out like this. I give it a 5.
author: S S.

description: Came here with my brother and sister because we heard all these great things about this place. When we got here we found a table in less then a few minutes. My brother waited in the huge line that was almost out the door. My sister and I both got the regular hamburgers with garlic fries and my brother got their bacon burger with regular fries. We also had a side of pickles (I love pickles!). The fries and pickles were okay. But our burgers were ridiculously TOO salty. I swear our blood pressures were out the roof because of how salty it was! We'll probably just stick to In-N-Out burgers.
author: Lisa L.

description: Burger was good but my garlic fries were very cold.  I try to get a fresh batch but the woman said they are served cold because the suave and cheese that the fries are tossed in are cold.... So I sort of believed her that I was wrong.  My two other friends received their order and the fries are piping hot!  Wtf?!?
author: Brian W.

description: It's a win for me every time here. Don't pass on the garlic fries you won't regret it! The burgers are fresh, filling, and cooked perfectly. Service is always friendly, place is always packed, but finding a seat isn't too bad with the fast turnover rate.
author: Briget P.

description:
The short of it:
- awesome burger shakes and fries place
- simple menu, but good food!
- prices are reasonable
- open pretty late during the week
- Favs: garlic fries, mini burger with lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, cheese, and super sauce

The long of it:
I had to check this place out on a recent trip to SF. It was rated pretty highly on Yelp and so of course I haD to try it. The menu itself is pretty simple, choose the size of the burger, choose your toppings, they also have a veggie burger or chicken sandwich for those who don't eat beef. The "mini" is not mini at all, it's just like a regular sized burger (4 oz). You can get a combo with a drink and fries. I substituted my fries for the garlic fries and they were amazing. The garlic fries were extra garlicky with cheese and parsley on top. Fries were perfectly fried as well! For dessert you can get a milk shake or a chocolate dipped ice cream cone. They are known for their homemade pickles. I only thought they were ok, it had a little spice to it that's just not my taste. Overall, I liked this place a lot!
author: Kristin A.

description:
This place has amaaaaaazing garlic fries, and the pickles are homemade. 

The burger is better than that I've had at In-n-Out, Shake Shack, Bare Burger, etc.

and lol. Looking at John M's other reviews, I can't tell if he's a troll or just super defensive about his ability to eat.
author: Jess P.

description:
I went there based on someone's recommendation as one of the best place for burgers. I wasn't impressed at all. The patty had no seasoning and no salt.
The garlic fries which were recommended as well were just ok.
author: C A.

description: It really is super duper. Burgers are really tasty and although it is usually busy and a little loud, it's worth it to stop by. Got some really cost effective meal options and have some ways to really class up your burger, but the cost can reflect it. Great spot for a meal!
author: Kyle M.

description:
I ate here for the first time about 6 months. When I was in the Bay Area again, I took two trains just to get here. It was worth it. 

I am a Texas Girl and thought I understood a mouthwatering burger. Nope, Super Duper is the new standard.
author: Sandra R.

description:
Very occasionally, I crave red meat (supposed to be good to eat when you're in a bad mood) and a burger hits the spot.  Have been here several times since they opened in various states of sobriety and inebriation (Chestnut Street location mainly) and the burgers will suffice when In N'Out isn't nearby.

The mini 4 oz is a standard serving of meat and enough to fill the craving and only $5!!  They encourage medium prep style, which I"m warming up to.  I also like that jalapeno peppers are free and a great flavor enhancer.

The fries are ok, but not worth the calories in my opinion.  Tried a shake once, but I'm a bit lost on the costs and again not worth the calories.

Location is well run and the staff keeps things moving and tidy.
author: Amy Z.

description: One of my favorite places to go for a burger when the night is still young. Excellent meat quality - and the options, oh my! House made pickles hit the spot, and it doesn't hurt to have beer (and wine!) on tap to keep service moving quickly. Try the hand-dipped Straus soft serve, if you're looking for a sweet treat to end the meal!
author: James K.

description: Oh wow, this is a burger to remember. Juicy, flavorful, huge. Just delicious. We got it without the secret sauce but they said it was some kind of mayo with spices or something added? The fries were okay, nothing super special but good. The chicken salad was awesome. I added grilled onions too. The chicken itself was huge and the caesar dressing was great. I wish we had one of these back home.
author: Ashley P.

description:
A SF native had recently recommended Super Duper Burgers to me so I was pretty determined to try it when I made my most recent trip to the city.  

My bf and I walked here after Tartine and split a Super Duper burger, added a soft drink and split the garlic fries. We ordered at the counter and the total was under $15. 

Hmm...if I had to compare Super Duper to In'n'Out then I'd choose In'n'Out. Super Duper burgers are good and tasty BUT so damn messy and GREASY. My god! My bf unwrapped some of the paper off the bun and I had to pick up some napkins to wipe the grease off the bun. I further unwrapped the paper and saw a pile of grease and juice at the bottom of the wrappings It was so unappetizing. Needless to say, I only had one bite. It was a delicious bite, but I'd rather my burger NOT come with a side of future high cholesterol spike. 

The fries were really great! They weren't too thin or too thick. They were fried perfectly and I LOVED all the garlic bits they added. They weren't kidding when they said these were garlic fries; the garlic is really all up in there! 

Bottom line: All in all, Super Duper Burgers was ok. It wasn't too expensive and really filled us up before our next meal. We were glad to try it but I don't know if I'll return if I'm back in the city. This ain't no Tartine! 

Yelp 2015 Challenge: 8/100
author: Sandy L.

description: We stopped here on our first night in town since it was right next to our hotel.  I was starving and everything smelled wonderful.  We each ordered a large burger with bacon and one order of the garlic fries.  They smelled sooooo garlicky which at first was great but we couldn't eat more than a few fries each and no more than half the burger as all of it was very oily.  Kinda felt nauseous after eating half of the burger so we called it quits and tossed the rest of the food.  Overall slightly disappointed in the greasiness.
author: Nicole D.

description:
Super duper burger is the embodiment of Ronald McDonald's older brother that managed to get a college degree from a private school and regurgitated the meaning of the classic American burger.
