I ordered the super duper burger with garlic fries and a chocolate milk shake.   You figured if your order has the name of the restaurant, it should be a decent burger??? Right??? WRONG!! It tasted like a bland Big Mac with more cheese and bacon with a side of disappointment.  However, the garlic fries were the real star of my order and the chocolate shake tasted like a chocolate shake.  
I tried my friends vegetarian burger and it was way more flavorful than my "super duper burger".  

If you do come here to eat just don't order any meat.  Vegetarian is the way to go.  Garlic Fries, vegetarian burger and a shake is your safest bet on investing in the super duper franchise.  

Overall, not bad but a little disappointing that the "super duper burger" tastes super duper bad.


P.s. The spivey pickles are really good worth the try if you're not a big pickle fan
author: Victor E.

description: My friend just introduced me to Super Duper...and I found it to be perfectly proportioned. My meat was cooked perfectly just a hair under medium and the Super Duper sauce was an excellent compliment to every bite. It's really just a chipotle mayo of sorts. I ordered the mini with the works subbing grilled onions for raw and I slid just a few pickles between the burger. Each bite was super savory and delicious. Paired it with the garlic fries and oh god, I was hooked. The fries are thick cut and tossed in a mix of parmesan, fresh garlic, and parsley then topped with mozzarella. The garlic is definitely fresh and not pre-minced because at certain points, you could definitely feel the slight burn from the garlic.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Has a great experience here. Food is amazing. Service is great. Mervin helped me and my friends and he went above and beyond to give great service. How much you paying these guys? Lol keep up the good work. You officially have a customer for life!
author: Mike H.

description: Always tasty and filling.  Burgers are amazing.  Fries are deliciously garlicy.  Add-ons quickly, well, add up, but it's worth it.
author: Ted R.

description: I'm from Sacramento so we decided to try one of SF's best rated burgers while we were in town. OMG it was worth the annoyance of finding a place to park and walking up the street a couple of blocks here. I will defiantly be coming back next time we're in SF.
author: Gabriel H.

description:
Super Duper is a far cry from the best burger I've ever had. Nonetheless, it's decent for a quick bite, though when I went they were pretty busy, and it took awhile to get my food.

The super duper burger + cheese was nice and juicy but a little too greasy for my taste. The garlic fries were good as well, but I felt there was too much cheese.

Again, not a terrific burger, but it gets the job done.
author: Kelly R.

description: Quality burgers, cooked perfectly. Lots of adds available like jalapeño, eggs etc. Will definitely be back before I leave San Fran.
author: Colin B.

description: Best burgers!!! Super good quality meat. A crust of flavor on each patty, good timely service. Good fries that are soft and crunchy. Low carb options, as well as vegetarian options. Homemade pickles. No complaints
author: Monica C.

description:
The first time I came here during my lunch hour, the line was down the block. Neither my friend nor I cared enough to endure the line so we said, "Paaaaass" and went to Del Taco instead. 

Last week, my co-worker and I came here and while it was still crazy busy, we were able to grab our order and sit by the Contemporary Jewish Museum instead. We split a Super Burger and regular fries. Real creative, I know, but neither of us were super hungry and it turned out to be more than enough food. The burger was well-cooked, juicy and tasty and the fries were crisp and starchy goodness, but I really didn't see what all the hype was about. Maybe my burger palate just isn't refined enough. :/
author: Josephine L.

description: Burgers and fries are really great and well cooked. They are juicy with fresh veggies. If you want to eat excellent burgers you have to go to Super Duper!
author: Damian S.

description:
Can remember the first time I stepped in here and had one of these. It was akin to my first taste of a double-double from In-n-Out the first time I visited California before moving here. It's one of those places you immediately associate with the word "best" in its field of food, and come to mind whenever you think to suggest a spot to a buddy or a visiting vagabond.
I love burgers, and always have a go-to burger joint in every city I live in. While there's been some phenomenal burgers from fancier joints that demand a higher $$, the genius in the Super  Burger here is that it's real simple and sticks to fundamentals. Starts with juicy, fatty ground beef, cooked to a perfect medium, and then double stacked. The condiments are simple: lettuce, tomato, onions, and sauce. The burger is not afraid to be greasy, and the bread shows it. The result, especially when coupled with the complimentary and complementary spicy pickles they make, is an extremely satisfying and lingering guilty pleasure. 
Their garlic fries, milk shake, all deserve mentions as well.
author: Ben H.

description: I tried the super burger and vanilla shake. I have to say it tastes good! But a bit pricey...
author: Jia W.

description: Got a burger and the garlic fries here.  The burger was tasty but the garlic fries were the item that really stood out to me - AMAZING!  They were covered in cheese and garlic and just oh so good.  I'd highly recommend them but only if you're a huge fan of garlic as it was really intense.  It actually had a bit of a spice to it because the garlic was so strong and even though I brushed my teeth like crazy, the garlic stuck with me for like 3 days.
author: Kristen M.

description:
Skimmed the reviews, and decided to go with mini with bacon and everything except onions & a side of regular fries. My friends got the garlic fries...so I ended up "helping them." I don't think it gave me deathly garlic breath, so I'll get it next time. Good texture, not like the limp stuff from N & Out, if you know what I mean...

Burger was ok. Two meat patties does seem too much...and I shouldn't have read all those reviews about service, got my darn hopes up. I shant elaborate since I was here for burger and conversation anyway.

Only got two lil pickle cuts, because I was in the restaurant industry before, and you'd never touch a pickle the same way again, if you really knew the amount of sodium you're getting. I still love pickles though, so :/ There's has a little kick to it, and while I thought it wasn't that salty, my friends thought the opposite.

One of my friends is vegetarian, so she got the veggie patty, and wasn't horribly impressed, but her expectations weren't high either, so keep em' low, if ya go.

It was a Sunday, and we beat the crowd, so I'd suggest around 11am.
author: Carol L.

description: The burgers are a good size. Probably can eat 2 if you're really hungry. It's also very good, simple and to the point.  Affordable and the aura of the restaurant is welcoming. Knocked off one star because the seating isn't the greatest at this location
author: Gianina D.

description: Omg thinking about this place just makes my tummy rumble lol.. Super duper burger is the best burger place ever!! And there pickles soo good xD a must try place if your out in the city, so worth the long wait.
author: Marcy L.

description: Tried this place twice.  Very greasy and bland.  It tasted like the cooking of college frat dropouts who slapped together kitchen junk and gave it a fancy name. For years, I was a Nation's Hamburger fan until recently when they changed their burger patty.  It tasted like McDs quarter pounder and had no flavor.  I just  make my own now or when push comes to shove, BK or INnOUT at best.
author: Marc F.

description:
Burgers are good, shakes are good, and service is good.  

You will for a fact get a huge burger and I highly recommend adding the egg.  I think the fries are just okay, but it's still pretty good.  There's a decent amount of seating but when you come around during lunch or dinner hours, it may be a bit more challenging to grab a seat.  Price can get fairly up there if you choose to purchase a lot of add ons on your burger, sides, or a beverage.  Definitely worth a try!
author: Bernie C.

description: This place serves well put together, tasty burgers. I dunno how people are comparing this place to in n out and 5 guys. Both of those places are way cheaper than this place and its pretty obvious that the bar is set way higher here in terms of quality. I love how the meat in the burgers come with a nice slightly crispy char on the outside and they are juicy on the inside. You can also add certain toppings at no extra cost, I got mine with pickles and grilled onions. One thing that is annoying though is they charge you for dipping sauces.... and what shmuck is going to pay $1.50 for that shit? I havent tried it for that reason but it would be nice if they'd provide sauces other than ketchup to dip your fries in.
author: Sheena N.

description:
I kept hearing that Super Duper had one of the best burgers in the city. Despite it having a few stores, it's not quite your chain McDonalds which still makes your burger a little more special. I came here for lunch and ordered the Super Burger and the Garlic fries. The beef patty of the Super Burger had a nice grill taste but other than that it didn't have much flavor. The patty was not salted enough if even at all so the taste was quite bland. But I managed to remedy that problem with a salt packet. As for the Garlic fries with cheddar, they were so good! The minced garlic just makes the fries taste so much better and enhances the flavor by many folds. I would come back just to get the fries!  Another plus is they have a jar of pickles for you at the drinks and condiments counter. 

This location is a bit packed during lunch so you might want to come a bit early to avoid the lunch rush.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Just now getting to this review but the event happened this New Years Eve and has forever stained my memory of this restaurant. The service was horrible. Got scolded by "Michael," the bus boy, because I moved a dirty tray from an empty table to the railing and he comes running over asking me what the heck is a matter with me. I apologized, thinking he was the customer of the tray and wasnt finished eating but he rudely told me he was an employee (not that you could tell from the black shirt and jeans he was wearing) and that I shouldve called him over to clear the table. News flash - you can clear the tray from the divider just as easily. As I replied to his rudeness, he told me I didn't need to get an attitude with him. HA. Absolutely horrible - I hope by now the owner has seen his lack of customer service skills and he's been fired, but regardless I wont be going back.
author: Lauren H.

description: A nice surprise for me. A tad more upscale in and out burger. Very good and not messy
author: Brad M.

description:
Want a burger but not too fast-foody and not gourmet? Super duper is the place to go.

We ordered the mini burger with cheese (everything on it!) and a chicken sandwich with bacon for variety. Of course I got the garlic fries and 3 dipping sauces. To top it off, an oreo cookie milkshake!!!

The total was about $20...not bad at all. They gave us a buzzer and we went off to get our waters on the side and some of those homemade pickles. The pickles were ok...

In less than a minute, our buzzer went off. (Wait, what??) It was for our milkshake! Ohhhh boy was that shake delicious. It was almost gone by the time we got our food. Everything was ready for us to eat in about 15 minutes. The burger was very juicy as a lot of people had already mentioned. It was a good combination of sauce, meat, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions and...jalapeños!!

The chicken sandwich was also pretty good, but the SO preferred the burger over the chicken. Garlic fries are a must! They are so garlicky and topped with parmesan and the best part--crispy! Yummm. Next time I'll get bacon on my burger. Maybe even a fried egg.
author: Stine H.

description: My favorite fast food burger, and the Parmesan garlic fries are tasty. For dessert, the chocolate dipped Strauss creamery soft serve cone. I know, you're welcome.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
The food was really good. I got a mini burger with everything on it and grilled onions and it had great flavor and the fries were good. My husband had the super burger with everything but added an egg and oh man it was good. 

I dropped one star because the worker was rude and she made us feel rushed and not very welcomed but I didn't let that ruin our experience.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Seriously, 
This place is amazing! Customer service was pretty good, and the chicken burger was a good size, and a party in my mouth :D 
They have a jar of these yummy, spicy pickles that are self serve which add a good crunch and kick on the side. 
How can I forget the GARLIC FRIES....
They are to die for.
author: Monica J.

description:
Fast and tasty!
Just a simple great burger, not for low calories searchers but definitely good for burger lovers that looks for quality.
author: Dor S.

description: Holy Cow! The most best burger joint around . I'm so sad we don't have one in the valley! Came here twice in one day lol. Another weekend came both days. My boyfriend and I are regulars ( when we are in the area) ! So much flavor in the burger no condiments needed ! Fries are Delish, beers are great! Tried the white shark I think , something like that, but it was so good and they let you taste test. Yum. Also the service is friendly !!! Love it!!!!
author: Tracie G.

description: Came for breakfast so I didn't have a chance to get a burger, but good breakfast sandwiches and great, fresh, fried donuts. Food was overall really good. Had a fresh strawberry milkshake, because I'm weird and have to try one regardless of time or mood when a place offers them, and it was fantastic. Really fresh. What I liked more than the food was the value and vibe. Everything was reasonably priced and the space felt really cool yet comfortable. Staff was very attentive and friendly. Would love to see this place grow and make it to South Florida so I can enjoy more often.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Insanity. The burgers here are some of my favorites!

- super juicy
- flavorful
- pink center
- CHEESY (add jack cheese!!!)
- eggy (add an egg!)
- omgggggg

One day I hope to still be hungry enough after my meal to order a milkshake because they look to die for!  It's hard for me to walk by here without salivating.
author: Samantha S.

description:
Service: Self serve.

Food: I mean it is good but not as good as I thought it would be. 
Bun: a bit too dense for my taste
Egg: I thought it would more fried? It seemed more like a sunny side up
Meat: Meat was good! :)
Pickles: free! There pickles were pretty good! 

Garlic Fries: OMG! SO GOOD! MUST HAVE! It's very garlic-y and fresh! The price is a bit higher though for the portion, but it is sf?
author: Jessica H.

description: One of the best spots for a burger in the Financial District. Their Super Duper burgers had never let me down. Make sure you get their garlic fries with three dips - the stuff is unforgettable,  The staff is friendly and cool as well as the place its self. It has an outside seating where you can enjoy your burger and a pint of cold beer,
author: George B.

description: A little over priced but worth it! Garlic Fries are the incredible spotlight at these locations! And the house made pickles are hit and miss! Sometimes you get the ones that aren't ready, and the ones that are good are incredible! I just get everything on my burger is probably why I think its overpriced lol. But everytime im in the city i make that first stop at SDB!
author: Aaron J.

description: Super Duper Burgers changed my life. All it took was a mini combo w/ a malted chocolate shake. Best Valentine's Day ever.
author: Susy C.

description: I ordered the mini burger and garlic potato fry...very delicious(^^) compare to IN-OUT burger and The Habit, I like this more! Unfortunately it's the local burger only in San Francisco. Hope  it can open in Southern California as well...
author: Enenmarumaru C.

description:
Egggggggggggggggggggggggggggg. Ngnggggg.

Shibe drool while think of burger with such egg. Plz. For luv of all doge. Eat burger with egg. Shib canut handle. Explod with happi when shib think of egg with burger. wow. such wow.

DISCLAIM: Shibe still think in and outt iz still many such best burger 4 price. Super dupe iz such close runner up tho.

Super dupe burger iz okay by self. Much flavorefull. Many season. Two paw up.

But when add egg, shib explod. Such simpo. Just add egg. Egg egg egg.

Creamy egg + testy meet + homemade picko. Wow. So amaze. Who care if grease can clog most sewer pipe? Still much tasty.

Morale of story: if burger have egg, for luv of doge plz eat.

Garlic fry meh, milk shake hit or and missing. Highlight is egg. Remember egg always.

Egg egg egg. Eeeeeeeeggghgggh
author: Doge S.

description: Being from new York and eating shake shack. I feel I found their competition. These guys take it to the next level. These burgers are bigger and juicer and offer more toppings. Their garlic fries are awesome. If you really like garlic than get these because they have that kick. Go place to go while at sf.
author: Antonio A.

description:
I came in for a Super Burger with cheese and bacon last night and the burger was delicious and the burger looked great.

I didn't expect it to be so good because I had a burger at the Super Duper at the Mission Street location a few weeks ago and that burger was too raw.  

This burger I had yesterday was fully cooked and delicious and I will go to this location from now on!
author: Gangsta G.

description: Phenomenal burgers. I was expecting an In-N-Out type of place, but this is miles ahead! Someone mentioned Shake Shack; that's a perfect comparison for those of you familiar with the New York chain.
author: I G.

description:
Call me silly, but I kind of expected my $5.75 Super Cookies & Cream shake to actually have some cookies IN it, not just scantily flirting with a dime-sized section of surface area on the top. I suppose I didn't see where they had posted that if I actually want my shake to have cookies IN it, that it would cost an additional $5 dollars and perhaps my firstborn child, if not another year of my life. Yes, I think they actually MADE THE ICE CREAM WHILE I STOOD THERE! That's all I can figure for the amount of time it took to get a 12-oz shake (what's so Super sized about that? Not that I need the calories- it's about expectations, given the price) with  NO COOKIES IN THE VICINITY OF THE ACTUAL MIDDLE OF THE SHAKE.

Of course I should have known. I should have listened to the wincing, suit-clad young man I passed on my way to Super Duper, who was grumpily following his friend down the side walk and, loosening his tie in the 80 degree heat (yes, we're having a "heat wave"), as he grumbled "I hate San Francisco!"

At $6 bucks a pop for a cookieless Cookies & Cream shake, young man, I couldn't agree more.
author: Bethany P.

description: Garlic fries and burger were both yummy but the portions were TINY. I thought the super duper burger was a mini until I saw an actual mini. The Oreo milkshake we got was superb though. I'd probably return if I was in the area, but probably wouldn't travel there just to get a burger.
author: Ivana H.

description:
Reminded me of Five Guys right off the bat. However, I would say that Super Duper's burger meat was of better quality. It was definitely juicier and more flavorful than my previous experiences at Five Guys (not that FG is bad, they just seemed to be on the drier side). 

My family usually likes a bit of spice to go with their meals, and so we had jalapenos added to our burgers. This... might have been a mistake, as they turned out to be VERY spicy! It could have been a fluke or perhaps a habanero snuck in there, but it was quite hot, so be warned. Otherwise, the burgers were good overall. 

Fries were crispy and hot. The pickles were bread-and-butter style, so sweeter rather than that dill tang that I prefer. They were still pretty good, though.

I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to eat at Super Duper again, but they definitely rank up there with other customizable burger joints.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
A mini burger here is a quarter pounder.

This was around the corner from the Westin where we stayed.  I got a case of the late night munchies and after eating all the "California, it's good for you" food I was going into a serious grease withdrawal.  Thank God I found this place in the nick of time.  The food was made to order and the "mini" burger was afull quarter pound of beef.  French fries looked scrumptious and the milk shakes, while not hand dipped, were made to order as well.  

Overall a good deal for the money and finally I had some real food with some taste to it.
author: CK A.

description: Why don't they have one of these down in S. CA?  This was one tasty burger and oh so juicy.  However, I think for the price, In 'n Out might be a better value.  But in terms of taste, I do prefer Super Duper Burgers (over $7 for a burger including a fried egg).  Their garlic fries were also SO good!  They will even cut the burger for you bc they prob know that two people can share one burger.  I like their jar of sliced pickles, too - yummy.  There was a small wait to order and then about a 10-minute wait for the food, so I wouldn't quite call this place "fast food."
author: Caroline K.

description:
Is Super Duper better than In n Out?

To many, the answer is yes. For me, I'm just not quite ready to go there...yet.

After spending a couple of weeks in the middle of the Indian Ocean I was craving something truly American and heart clogging greasy. A burger for sure was at the very top of my list and Super Duper was squarely on my list.

First the pros.

Quality beef, and they cook it to medium without even having to ask. The patty is melt in your mouth wonderful. The toasted sesame bun perfectly fits over the burger and has a slight crispy crunch as you bite down on this delicious heaven sent hamburger.

House made pickles. Yep, they have those too! I'm not an expert in the science of pickles, but these to me anyway had me doing my happy dance.

Beer and wine served here. The goody two shoes at In n Out shun happy drinks in favor of empty calorie soda drinks and shakes.

Now for the cons.

The price, sadly for a fast food outlet this place is expensive. Roughly twice the price for a comparable order at In n Out. Super Duper is Super Expensive.

The special sauce. Eh, it's fine but for me I prefer good old fashioned thousand island. Oh oh, I just spilled the beans on In n Outs secret sauce recipe.

Bottom line. It's good, very good and better than than that crappy Five Guys but still behind In n Out.
author: V B.

description:
I'm super duper ok with the five pounds this burger just made me gain. Oh.my.burger.goodness this was good. It's perfectly cooked, juicy, flavorful and the toppings are perfect. They douse the bun with butter and a secret sauce and the tomatoes and lettuce are the perfect touch. Do your self a favor and just order it as-is and don't change a thing. They have this burger down to a science. I choose my fatty calorie consumption wisely and I gobbled this burger up in about 2 minutes. 

At first I was confused about the difference between the mini and large option for the burger, but I went for the mini. I was worried it would be a slider, but it was a hefty four ounce burger. Unless you have a huge appetite, the mini will be just the right amount of food. 

I got the burger to go and made the mistake of not realizing they have lids for the ketchup by the counter. Make sure you ask them for a lid if you're taking it to go. Enjoy!
author: Lindsey D.

description:
If you are hesitant to eat beef on a regular basis because it is not produced humanely, look no further to satisfy your (unfortunately inevitable) bacon cheeseburger craving.  

This place is INSANELY delicious.  I try to stay away from animal products (in New York most places don't tell you where their meat comes from) but when I saw that they use Niman Ranch beef my mouth began watering and I found myself ordering a bacon cheeseburger with LTO, super sauce, and jalepenos.  IT. WAS. AMAZING.  THEN THEN THEN I ate some of the garlic fries (plenty of fresh garlic and just enough melted cheese on top) and pickles.  I nearly died/went to heaven.  Last but definitely not least, they serve alcohol!  I would have liked to try one of their shakes but I literally could no fit any more food in my stomach after the burger and 1/2 an order of garlic fries.  Safe to say Super Duper SF is the best burger joint of its kind on the planet.
author: Kate R.

description: it was my first stop in San Francisco and my friend told me its one of the best burgers in SF so of course we must try it, for me I always prefer to try the plain burgers to see the difference between each meat and the real taste of it and this one has nothing special its nice but i feel that I tried it before like in Five Guys maybe or something else, the fries was good though but cold and have no idea why, the important thing would I come back? yes but only when you don't have other choice to eat, I would try other places maybe to see if this was the best in SF or not.
author: Mishari A.

description: I've been wanting to try Super Duper since we moved to SF from London almost a year ago. Went for lunch today and wow - I'm going to go out on a limb and say this was probably the best burger I've had in the U.S. so far (& we've eaten a LOT of burgers). The only reason I've given a four and not a five is that the garlic fries were pretty cold and, even worse, my bf went back to ask for fresh ones and we were given more cold fries. What's that about? We couldn't be bothered complaining again. They may have been nice hot, but no-one really wants cold fries do they? Anyway, I'll give this place another chance as the burger was so good.
author: Fi M.

description:
I was really craving fast food and was considering heading to McDonalds (my guilty pleasure) when it occurred to me that I should give Super Duper Burgers a try. Once I walked inside I immediately knew I made the right decision. I was impressed by the setup and the menu. 

I ordered a fresh strawberries shake, which wasn't too thick and was very delicious. To eat, I ordered a super burger which was about $6, had two patties, and was rather huge. It was a struggle to eat all of it!  I should have ordered the mini burger -- the name is deceiving since it's actually the size of a normal size burger. 

The great thing about their burgers is that you can customize them with various toppings. For example, jalapeños, grilled onions, an egg, etc.

This is a really great alternative to other fast food places in the area. The food isn't greasy and since they claim that their food is organic it gives you the illusion of eating semi-healthy. 

Even if you are not a big fan of fast food, I recommend that you check it out. The burgers are really good and affordable. (I've had $15 gourmet burgers that weren't as good as the one I had at Super Duper Burgers.) Also, the staff is rather friendly. The only downside, you don't get your food as fast as you do at other fast food places.
author: Abena O.

description: Excellent burgers! The fries were ok. Nothing special. Even with the long line it didn't take long to get our food. Any place that has Tangerine Wheat beer on tap is a winner in my eyes.
author: Marco B.

description:
And so I have declared my favourite burger joint in SF
And yes I've tried many burger places but Super Duper is the best 
Pros :  
1. The menu is simple with just few to choose from but options to add and subtract items as per your preference .
I usually have the mini or double with grilled onions and add on bacon and cheese. Gotta be my favourite .
2. The burger patties unlike many other places are not dry, extremely juicy and full of flavour
3. The bacon is crispy and the Bun is super soft 
4. Buy the garlic fries with the burger . It's topped with Parmesan cheese and makes the perfect accompaniment with the burger . I have always regretted skipping the fries when I'm trying to control my junk cravings.
5. The milkshakes are great too but the burgers are definitely the highlight of this place.

Cons : so far I haven't found any and I must Have been to this place at least 7 times since I moved to SF 2 months back
author: Nupur S.

description: Good food (burgers, fries, salads, etc...).  The service was fast and when I asked for a lettuce wrapped burger rather then bread they said no problem.  Finally they have great shakes!
author: Richard L.

description: Super Duper is consistently epic and amazing with the quality of each item on their menu! Furthermore their service is top notch. I'm truly grateful to Zamir for recommending an egg on my fries! I've always enjoyed it on my burger, but now I've got an amazing combo! Thank you Super Duper for making me have super duper day!
author: Jimmy Y.

description:
Walking by I was pleasantly surprised to see they had a breakfast options starting at 8 am. 

The menu is pretty limited; yogurt parfait, homemade donuts, Four Barrel coffee, and a breakfast sandwich. I went with the breakfast sandwich (which is $3) and paid the extra dollar for bacon. 

When I got to work and opened the wrapper it resembled an Egg Mcmuffin but put the McMuffin to shame once I tasted it. It's a toasted English muffin with a pan fried egg which is wrapped around an oozing center of cheddar cheese. The amount of bacon was generous and it was crispy and thick cut with no excess fat. Even though it features cage free eggs and organic ingredients I have a sneaking suspicion it does not qualify as "health food", if it did I would probably be here every morning.
author: Kerry K.

description: Didn't have the burgers but I did have the soft serve. Yum. They give pretty good sized portions. Even though the line was kind of long I didn't wait that long. So they were pretty efficient. Bonus! I would probably go here again if I want a quick fix of soft serve. But you have to keep in mind that there is only chocolate, vanilla, or a combo. So there aren't many choices. That's why I gave this place a 4 stars instead of 5.
author: Kris C.

description:
Will only speak for the super burger and garlic fries that I recently had. Burger was decent with the right balance of bread and meat but garlic fries did not meet my expectations. I guess I was not expecting that much of garlic. 

I would probably come back if I was working in the neighborhood.
author: Gokhan T.

description: Some of the best burgers you will ever have! Gotta get the chicken burger, its off the hook. Garlic fries are amazing. Everything about this place gets a A PLUS
author: Oliver G.

description:
Great burgers, but for $10!

Busy location, did not find the "experience"mto compliment the price!
author: S L.

description: Favorite spot for hamburgers, garlic fries, & a milkshake! I'm drooling just trying to type this  oh and I can't leave the home made pickles out, they are super duper tasty with a kick! Best part is you can get as many as you want. I highly recommend this place for a quick lunch If your hungry for a juicy burger!
author: Jazveline D.

description: Best burgers I've ever had in my life. Nice and juicy, cooked medium just how I like it. Got a triple patty and garlic fries and loved it.
author: London C.

description:
So... I was pleasantly surprised by this burger. I ordered a medium-rare burger, just the way I like it. The meat was delicious, greasy, and dripping. AMAZING!

No, it's not the best burger in the city, but it is SOLID. My favorite is still 4505 meats, but for a quick convenient fix when 4505 meats isn't set up, THIS is where I'd go.

It actually reminded me of Shake Shack... except, yes, I'm going to say it: WAY BETTER! The only thing Shake Shack does better is use more cheese.

I also had their soft serve which is awesome! Except for a few bucks less I would be just as amazed by a McD's soft serve.

Fries... eh. I think it depends on who makes them, but they're just okay.

Also.. of course, get their BEEF patty burger. If only they could make their patty bigger! Dripping meaty goodness, how can I say no to you?!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
Whew! This place was a lifesaver on the way back to my hotel tonight. Mere from from the W, I decided to run in and grab something to bring back to my room. I'm actually not a burger person so I ordered their chicken sandwich and fries. I got back to my room thinking it would be a mediocre meal, but it was fantastic!

The chicken had a wonderful aioli sauce with a bit of a kick and came with lettuce and tomato which was super fresh despite the hour. I added some cheese as well which was a good move! The fries were crispy and delicious and overall everything was really tasty and fresh.

The service was amazing. The ugh I interacted with a the cash was so pleasant I actually wanted to hang out with him. The guy dropping off our food was really lovely as well. This whole place just has such a positive and welcoming environment!
author: Andrea B.

description:
Never realized how blessed I am to be surrounded by good burger places. Coming from San Diego - I was hoping to have a good burger here. After walking for about a mile from our hotel to get here, I had a good vibe when walking through the door. The menu is simple and easy to order from. They'll give you a glass cup to fill your drink and have fountains to fill that cup with. At the fountains they have lemons and "homemade pickles" both of which were ok.

Once I had gotten my meal I was extremely excited to eat. The burger was pretty decent - (the reason my review gives 3 stars is because of the fries.) I ordered garlic fries with my burger and I think they forgot to give fries. The garlic was so overwhelming that it had burned my mouth. It's my fault for not sticking with regular fries but nonetheless it was that bad to where I had to review.

It's a good place to stop at if you want a burger.

Ordered a super burger with cheese and bacon and garlic fries. Good to try but I won't find myself here again
author: Derek C.

description:
Super duper burger!!! My favorite place to go to when I am craving a nice juicy cheese burger during my lunch hour. What makes this place so awesome? You can add a nice juicy fried egg to your burger. 

My usual choice of burger is a mini burger, with a fried egg, grilled onions, tomato, lettuce, with their super duper sauce.

For all your vegetarians out there, I must add that Super Duper Burger, makes one of the BEST veggie burgers.

So yeah, I'll be back.
author: Quyenna T.

description: Always awesome.  Late night hunger leads us to one of favorite places.  Awesome fries too.
author: Travis B.

description:
We ate here for '2nd dinner' since someone was still hungry after a vegan dinner and burgers looked awesome.

What really pulled me in was that the exterior and general decor (fonts and materials) reminded me of the Shake Shack in NY. Although they weren't the same type of burger, Super Duper holds up alright on their own.

They serve hefty burgers with 'meat crispies' from their frying techniques. I loved the fresh pickles too! Good for snacking. If you're a pickle snacker.  The bun might be "artisan", but I found it a little dry, and bigger than my preferred bun-to-meat ratio.  The fries were decent, but the garlic fries really looked stunning.
author: Lydia N.

description:
Working in downtown San Francisco, I can definitely assure you that this place is pretty packed during the weekdays during lunch time since everyone's Mom and Pops come here to have lunch. Especially since it's located conveniently near the financial district.

Aside from the possible long queue, the wait time for them to prepare the burger is actually not that long of a wait. Maybe 10-15 minutes? 

The actual burger itself is a relatively good portion . Not too monstrously large or too small that it's not worth the wait. It's always cooked the way I like it, which is medium-rare. The fries are cooked pretty well too! They're not prepared too well-done, unless you specifically ask for so. The garlic fries are soooo delicious. The only downside is they're garlic fries. So, be prepared to go selectively mute for the next couple of hours. 

Overall, pretty good somewhat fast food joint! Good enough for me to revisit every time I get a burger craving within the area! Highly recommend!
author: Jessica X.

description: If you want a really solid burger in a short amount of time, this is a good spot. Service was friendly and quick as well.
author: Sam B.

description:
AMAZING garlic fries. They never skimp on the garlic. I come here solely for that reason. 

Burgers are all right, a little too juicy and messy for my taste, but I still crave them once in a while.
author: Angela L.

description:
A high quality $7-9 burger with fresh ingredients. Size was satisfactory. Of course it could always be a little bigger (not a "what she said" joke). Resisted the garlic fries. Wasn't quite in the mood to spend $3 for them, but they looked/smelled delicious. Fast service. 

Note to self for next time- try the homemade pickles and butch up for the garlic fries.
author: Max R.

description:
I don't know what it is, but they can never seem to get orders right. Below are a list of common frustrations:

1. Order a chicken sandwich with bacon and cheese added on. Both these items are missing.
2. Coworker makes a large order and brings back to office. An entire burger is missing and we have to walk back to collect missing burger.
3. Order a mini burger with cheese. Cheese is missing.

I've actually never had an order that was done correctly. I don't think the customer should have to pick through the burger before leaving to make sure it was made correctly. If they could make orders correctly, I'd give 5 stars! The food is phenom.
author: Justine M.

description:
You literally cannot go wrong with Super Duper.

This location is much bigger than the one at the Metreon, which more seating, but a less convenient layout. The cashiers at every single location are always cheery and helpful, and every burger is cooked perfectly.

I ordered a mini meal, and the burger was great, but I wished that I had gotten garlic fries. Their garlic fries are the best. Get them. You won't regret it. The regular fries are nothing special, but the garlic fries are a treat.

Their lemonade, made with brown sugar, is also always excellent, and they don't load it down with ice, which is wonderful!

Super Duper is always the best.
author: Christina S.

description:
Super Duper Burgers was recommended to me while I was visiting San Francisco. I consider myself to be a burger connoisseur, and am generally pretty judgmental when it comes to burgers, but was very satisfied with this meal.

I ordered a Super Duper cheeseburger with bacon and grilled onions. While I don't remember enough about it to explain in full detail, I do remember it being flavorful and thoroughly enjoying it. One thing to note is that lettuce, tomato and sauce come on the burger by default. I did not expect this and was a bit disappointed, as I like to enjoy the flavor of the meat without toppings masking it, but ended up enjoying it anyway. The garlic fries were also good, though my order didn't seem to have too much cheese/garlic on it.

Overall, a Super Duper Burgers offers a satisfying burger worth checking out if you're in the area.
author: Nikos M.

description: Love love dig their Parmesan garlic fries and soft serve. Haven't tried one of their burgers yet,  but enjoyed the others enough to grant it 5 stars
author: Alexander T.

description:
I realllly enjoyed my burger here. Don't be deceived, what they call a "mini 4 oz burger" is actually the size of a regular burger, thus making what they name their "regular 8 oz burger" equivalent to a double burger, since it has 2 patties. I don't know about you, but I don't regularly have double pattied burgers hahah. 

On to the food: the build-your-own burger format is super fun and yields excellent results no matter the combination! Every ingredient is winning, so combining them can only result in more win! The base price for just the hamburger is $4.75, which is super cheap, so you don't feel guilty adding on all the good extra stuff like cheese, grilled portabello mushrooms, avocados, and even a fried egg if you're feeling fancy. The meat and toppings are all very fresh. Perfect textured fries and a delicious shake will round off your meal without leaving you with a "food coma" feeling. 

loved my experience here! Glad they've got a few locations all around the city.
author: Tuwie N.

description:
I am by no means a vegetarian. I feel it's important to preface with this because I find that, most of the time, when one of my vegetarian friends tells us meat eaters that this one vegetarian burger tastes just like the real thing, we default to smiling nervously and backing away slowly. It's not that we don't believe you, it's just that we have this strong suspicion that you may have forgotten by now what meat is actually supposed to taste like. In fact, if that tofu-veggie patty is anything to judge by, we're sure of it. And while there's nothing at all wrong with that, we're going to have to politely decline your invitation to your weekend vegetarian barbecue.

That's why, when I say that the veggie burger here is amazeballs, my fellow meat-eaters are not allowed to grimace and tell me they're just going to stick with the grass-fed beef, thanks.

This veggie burger tastes nothing like real meat. Seriously, not a thing. But it's thick and hearty and made of black beans -- which is about as inoffensive as substitute ingredients get -- and it makes a damn good burger. Like, a DAMN good burger. It's just as tasty and filling as its meaty counterpart, while making no claims of tasting like anything but a black bean patty full of delicious spices. So if you've been dragged in here by your friends but you've had beef the last three nights in a row and you can't take it anymore, try the veggie burger.

Trust me, I'm an omnivore.
author: Kelly V.

description: Burgers are bland and overpriced.  2 star--1 for really great service, and 2nd star for the fries.
author: Susan T.

description: Super friendly staff and great tasting burger. Portion size is a little small for the price but it's enough to fill you up. The ambiance, location and taste make up for the price. I recommend trying their shakes and garlic fries as well.
author: Luis O.

description:
Absolutely delicious! Super Duper is the best place to go if you want a burger and fries when you're downtown. The burger was fantastic and the garlic fries were absolutely divine. I usually share my fries but I wouldn't want to share these! Get your own! The combination of flavors is just perfect. The cheese and the garlic together was so perfect that it doesn't even need ketchup. The burger was cooked just right and everything was so fresh. The meat was tender and juicy. 

My picky friend even loved his food and he's got very high standards. He's a burger connoisseur. He recently dubbed Umami burger the best in the Bay but he said Super Duper was right up there by his standards. What a compliment! He also said his cookies and cream shake was fantastic too. 

If you're ever in the area, come to Super Duper! It's the absolute best burger and fries you'll find if you're looking for a quick meal. It's a little pricey but the price reflects the quality of what you're getting.
author: Nancy C.

description:
I came here on a Friday evening with a co-worker for a (relaxed) work dinner. I ordered a Super Burger with the regular fixins (lettuce, tomatoes, red onion) plus two extra charge additions - Bacon ($1.00) and Cheese ($0.70). IT WAS DELICIOUS!!!! I wish I had taken a picture but unfortunately, I was so engrossed and hungry, I forgot...

I had also ordered garlic fries which comes with shaved cheese and coriander/parsley. These were also AMAZING!!!

When you go up to order, you'll receive a "beeper" type notifier (like at Cheesecake Factory). If you order a drink, they'll give you a reusable or disposable cup, depending in what you order (alcoholic vs. water). There's a soda fountain set up on the left of the order counter. Next to the drink dispenser, there's ketchup and mustard pump stations. There is also an awesome jar of spicy pickles!! When your food is ready, items will be placed on top of what seemed to be a lunch tray (with a parchment paper-like sheet between the food and tray). I believe you can order "special" condiments; we did not.

The inside seating by the windows were a little cramped. The upstairs alcove and back area looked to be a similar setup. My companion and I had to raise our voices slightly while we conversed but, the sound wasn't blaring. I saw a good mixture of different people - businessmen and women, tourists, locals, etc.

Overall, I would absolutely come back and recommend this place to friends and family!!
author: Lenerd J.

description:
Wifey and I have been eying Super Duper Burgers ever since they started building out the location a couple years ago.  We love us some burgers, so you'd think Super Duper would be high on our list of priorities.  Well, life happened and the next thing you know it's 2 years later when we're trying the place.

This place gets packed during lunch on a weekday.   But we were able to score a table, since the food comes out quickly and the table turnover is pretty quick.

I ordered the Super Combo, with cheddar cheese, and a lemonade.  Wifey ordered a Mini Super with cheddar cheese and jalapeno peppers, along with an order of garlic fries. We also ordered a trio of sauces (Super sauce, homemade mayo, chipotle).

The burgers were great quality and great tasting, as advertised.  I was full off of just the burger, but there were still fries to be had! There was nothing special about the regular fries, but the garlic fries were delicious with hints of garlic and parmesan cheese.  The dipping sauces were all misses, but luckily ketchup is always a winner for me.  The "fresh lemonade with brown sugar" was interesting, refreshing, and tasty as the brown sugar gave it a nice distinct flavor.

4 thumbs up for Super Duper Burgers!
author: Nadeem A.

description: Time to break out my east-coast burger snobbery. I've been lucky enough to frequent Shake Shack many times while living in Washington D.C. It remains my gold standard for burgers, fries, and shakes. Super Duper Burgers, while tasty, just isn't in the same class. The burger just lacks the taste that I find in places like Shake Shack or Good Stuff. Same with the fries (though I did appreciate the spices they put on them). Outside of the food, it is a cool spot right in the business district (I'm sure they do plenty well at lunch). Prices are decent for a psuedo-fast-food burger joint and the interior has some decent seating. I just don't think this place is worth a trip specifically to eat there.
author: Eric W.

description: Good!very delicious,Like  pickled pickles!Staff attitude is very good, clean also actively.
author: Dolly T.

description:
This place is good. I arrived around 4pm and walked straight to the counter to order. The place looks nice; it has a bit of a warehouse vibe in a cool way. The menu is simple enough for most people who just want to stop for a burger. However, it does come out a bit expensive; it IS sf after all.

The food:
Super burger ($7) with cheese ($1) and bacon ($1.50)
-I was debating on whether to get the mini or super. I would stick with the Mini in the future. The super is basically a double double, but it was just too much meat (in a gross and overwhelming way). The burger was juicy and delicious nonetheless.

Garlic fries ($3.25?) + 3 dips ($1.50)
-I could definitely live without this in the future. It was fine. I would have preferred more garlic, but I always do. I'm also not a big fries fan. The cheese on top was generous though. The three dips were also pretty excessive since the free ketchup is already very delicious. I didn't end up making much of a dent in the dips, but it was a good try. 

Pickles (FREE)
-Their pickles are put in jars and it is self-serve. They were awesome.

My meal came to about $17 with tip. It was decent. Not memorable enough to want to return.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Easily one of the best burgers I've had the pleasure of eating. A full meal with fries and a drink ends up a little on the pricey side, but not totally unreasonable. Their restaurants are clean and efficient, and service is always good. Every time I visit SF, I always make time to swing by for a burger.
author: Ho L.

description: Watch out Five Guys! This place is the real deal. Fresh, cooked to order. it was crazy busy but fast. the burgers are huge so you may want to consider down sizing when ordering.
author: Dennis M.

description: Fav. burger place in the city! Always get the super burger with cheese and bacon. The staff is very friendly even during the busiest hour. They also always offer you a cup of water while you waiting. Feels good after a decent amount of walking during lunch time.
author: Edwin Z.

description:
I wish I could see this place on the east coast.

The burger I had was simple and delicious, especially when it wasn't cooked to a well done state that i'm used to from some places.

P.S. Has anyone mentioned the garlic fries?!
author: Mark M.

description:
I am reviewing a carry-out order from Super Duper.

There was a long line. The line moved very quickly.

The cashier was very friendly. She quickly took my order. She was also detailed in insuring that the order was correct. I ordered a Super Burger plus bacon and cheese with tomato, lettuce, and their special sauce.

A sign stated that the food was prepared to order and to expect a ten minute wait.
This is pretty much the amount of time it took. If anything, it was a little quicker than this.

The burger was very good. The super is their standard burger. It is made with 8 oz of Niman Ranch beef. It is a double.

You can select from numerous toppings:
lettuce
tomato
red onions
super sauce
jalapeno peppers
grilled onions
pickles.

For a buck each, you can add any of these:
avocado
one organic egg
grilled peppers
roasted portobello
cambozola blue

If I was eating in, I would've paid the greenback and added an egg. But I didn't think it would hold up on the walk home. I will try it next time.

The burger was cooked medium. The bun was a sesame bun. It is one of those buns that is more like two tops than a top and a bottom. All of the condiments were fresh.  Quality meat + quality condiments + a good bun = pretty darn good burger - If I had a complaint, I think it could have used some additional sauce. 

http://tinyurl.com/89jab5k

I also ordered fries. These were skinny fries. They were pretty good.

The ambiance is stream-lined, modern, and functional. There are two levels of seating.

The food was all neatly packed in a bag with an easy to carry handle.

Without a drink, the total came to just over $11. So, it is not a cheap burger and fries. But I think it was definitely worth it. While it will not take over the #1 spot for San Francisco's burgers. I think Super Duper makes it into the top 15, maybe even the top 10.
author: Mark D.

description: Nice veggie burgers. I usually don't like the veggie burger but it's one of the best. My friend had the regular burger and he liked it as well.
author: Diamond J.

description: My employer gave everyone some vouchers to use for lunch there. I had the chicken sandwich with cheese and fries. Oh my goodness, I was impressed by how delicious and flavorful the sandwich was! And the fries!! I can see why the line was snaking outside of the restaurant!
author: Cyn N.

description: Awesome burgers. Found it on yelp and have it a try. Of your in the area stop in. The line was long and the table situation was not great but it's because they have amazing burgers!!!
author: Andrew A.

description:
I can't remember the last time the taste of a meal was so mismatched with it's appearance.  When our super duper burgers with egg arrived at our table, I was certain that I was going to experience a hamburgasm.  Instead it was like a half-arse lap dance.  As soon as you take the first bite, the egg leaks and coats the whole burger (and your hands) with yolk.  Usually I dig runny egg yolk but in this case it just made a mess of things.  The beef was just ok.  At most premium burger joints, the quality of the beef really stands out.  It didn't at Super Duper.  We also ordered the garlic fries and they were fine.  Not bad but not that special.  

I honestly think In N Out trumps this place.
author: Jimmy H.

description: Pretty crowded for a Thursday night, but the line went fast and we only waited about 15 minutes to get our order. Order the super burger (2 patties; 4oz each) if you're feeling really hungry, but if not, just go for the 'mini' burger which is actually still a decent-sized burger. They even have combo deals that come with fries and a drink for btwn $8-10. The burger may look small at first, but it was definitely filling especially with a side of garlic fries. And try their shakes & homemade pickles on the side! The shake was soo so rich & creamy! My friend and I split the chocolate with fresh strawberries super shake since it was a bit pricey, but we could barely finish it between the two of us. Downside is it's a bit greasy and messy to eat, but it was still a very delicious and filling meal to have after a day of walking around SF.
author: Kim D.

description: Excellent burger, generously portioned, nice soft bun and a seat outside enjoying the circus like atmosphere of Market street. Very busy for a Sunday afternoon. Was looking for a beer, but did not notice the taps, as they are on the other side of the cashier and not listed on the overhead menu. Fries were  a rather cool temperature, never a good sign to me. Make fries hot, it's not that tough. I will know the drill, if I go again, which I probably will. Good potential and location.
author: Michael C.

description:
AWESOME!!!!

   Wow!!! The best Burger Joint in S.F.? Maybe! The best so far??? YES!!!. 
Great food!!! Loved the burger I had - double with bacon and cheese, and the fries were awesome too - fresh cut with the skin still on. Even the soda was great - served in a real glass instead of that paper/waxy cup. They have Mexican Cokes too - LOVE!!!

   The line was long but they had it covered with 3 cashiers and I was up front quickly. My food didn't take too long either. I was in and out in 35 minutes and was never rushing. 

   Such a great experience. Made me feel like I had the day off for a lil bit. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
author: Brian K.

description:
Super duper is right! I love this burger joint.

If your looking for a burger joint then I'd say you don't have to search anymore. 

The menu is very simple and affordable. They offer awesome tasty burgers and for those who don't do meat they offer salads and vegetarian options.

I like coming here, because the food is great and the service is always friendly and fast.

To give you foodies an idea of how cheap SDB is. I ordered 3 mini burgers, 2 drinks, 1 salad, side of fries + tax  $31.50, which is not bad.

It's a 2 super thumbs up for Super Duper Burgers!!!
author: V W.

description:
I went here for the first time with my kids just a couple of days ago. We took BART from the East Bay. SDB is less than two blocks from the Montgomery Station. 

We got to SDB early in the evening. The wait wasn't too bad, but the line started getting long just after we ordered. Don't expect to waltz right up to the register during the dinner hour. 

Our service was very good. The young lady who took our orders was pleasant, patient, and efficient. She didn't roll her eyes when my kids placed their picky orders. 

We got burgers, fries, and vanilla shakes. The burgers and fries were pretty good, and the shakes were awesome. You could tell they were made with actual ice cream. 

The seating at SDB is fairly tight. Small tables are arranged in narrow rows along two walls. We had to go upstairs to find seating. 

Also, because this place does a lot of business and the employees are kept on their toes, trash piles up quickly. Be prepared to clean off your table before you put your food down.
author: James G.

description: Love burger concepts!  Thought Super Duper was a great find.  Well branded...good service....and the food for SF was quite reasonably priced.  The burger was tasty, nothing fancy, but solid flavor.  Would highly recommend.
author: Don C.

description: Best burgers, fries, and shakes in SF. The price is a little steep for a burger joint, but it's well worth the cost.
author: Ken A.

description: I finally got to come here during lunch time this past Tuesday.   The line was out the door but it took less than ten minutes to place my order.  I ordered the garlic fries and the cheeseburger.  The garlic fries were sprinkled with aged cheese and lots of garlic (tasted better than the garlic fries sold during Oakland As games).  I got a side of their home made pickles which were also delectable.  The burger was great but I wish it was bigger.  I was under the assumption it was going to be a massive burger.  I left feeling satisfied but wanting more.  I'll definitely be back soon!!
author: Christopher C.

description: Expensive and oily.. They know how to make even lettuce unhealthy. The servings were small too. The french fried with garlic I ordered, were cold. Overall.. bad
author: Jainu J.

description: Great food! Quick service!! And of course can't forget the bottle coke....perfection!
author: Az M.

description: Hands down the best burger I've ever eaten in my life, I always look forward to dining here.
author: Ricky B.

description: For a quick burger and fries, this place rocks.  You know when a place knows how to execute and Super Duper can execute on delivering burgers fast with high quality.  It's a bit hectic here for the lunch time crowd, but they must serve a bunch of burgers during the mid day lunch crowd.  I had a double burger and it was really good and juicy on a great bun.  Definitely, the place when you need a quick lunch in SF.
author: Gary W.

description:
Really solid burger. Juicy, flavorful and delicious. The fries were good and I was pleased with the sauce options as well. The shake was par, if not subpar. I was expecting more from the shake arena, but everything else delivered.

Don't care that their everything is organic, but if you do, this is the burger place for you.
author: Trent M.

description: After several hours of travel to get into San Francisco, I was super hungry and wanted something delicious and simple.  Once I got settled into my hotel, I pulled out my phone and looked at the Yelp app and found that Super Duper Burgers was located right around the corner.  When I walked in, there was a long line that moved pretty fast with the majority of people ordering their food to-go.  The menu is pretty simple and they had a few specials available.  I got the cheeseburger and fries, which as simple and boring as it sounds, turned out to be a great choice.  This was quite possibly the best burger and fries that I had in a long time, and it kicked off a great stay in San Francisco.
author: Erika E.

description:
Heard the buzz about this place so decided to give it a try...

My initial impressions were not favorable.  The long lines of people; the warehouse-like acoustics; the weathered concrete floors.. the place has all the warmth of a bus station at rush hour.

I ordered at the counter and got one of those coaster things that vibrates when it is time to pick up my order.   As I waited, I eyed the few remaining tables.  Should I grab a table before my food is ready?  But that might be cutting in front of someone who was before me.  What's the proper etiquette here?  As I pondered that, someone who came in after me grabbed the last remaining table.   Lesson learned.

Thankfully, by the time my food was ready, another table opened up.   My frustrations and irritations evaporated when I took the first bite of my burger.   Wonderful!  Cooked just as I had ordered it, hot, fresh, and tasty.  The fries were equally delicious.   A fresh lemonade completed the meal, which hit the spot.

Altogether I spent about $10 for a meal that would have cost me less than $5 at Burger King or In-N-Out.   But there is really no comparison in terms of taste.   They boast here about all the natural and organic ingredients, and it definitely makes a difference.    And you get to eat a fast food meal with less guilt.

Avoid peak times for a more pleasant dining experience.
author: Gene C.

description:
One of the better burger chains in the Bay Area, they have about 5 locations I know about with juicy burgers that you must get with a fried egg.

The burgers aren't huge, so you might need to throw in fries or a shake, but getting the bacon or egg (or better yet, both) on top is a must. It's about $9/10 with toppings. I get the pepperjack cheese too for the spicy kick.

Clean, good service, very quality!
author: Chuck N.

description:
Perhaps my disappointment comes from having too high of expectations. The reviews were great...the experience was fine, but the burger was so greasy it soaked through the bun, and was dripping with grease. Our garlic fries were also soggy, because they weren't fried properly and also drenched in grease. Needless to say my wife and I won't be going back anytime soon.

If you're looking for an awesome burger, I suggest you go to magnolia, Ricky Bobby's, or Rosemunde's for Burger Tuesday.
author: Brian O.

description:
Decently good burgers that make you feel like you're eating somewhat healthy. Great for vegetarians (came here with my pescatarian roommate) and a fairly cheap meal.

A lot like Shake Shack without the frozen custards and the restaurant interiors are even similar. Not sure if they were going for the whole west-coast-version-of-Shake-Shack look but that's what it seemed to me.

Food comes on the same type of tray that Shake Shack uses too with the same buzzer system to go pick up your food. Almost all the Super Duper locations I've been to or seen have outdoor seating which is nice if the San Francisco weather permits. Fries aren't anything too special but I like that they have a nice self-serve pickle assortment and lemons for your water!
author: Junes S.

description:
Totally delicious! Really nice ingredients, excellent service, and cool unique touches like garlic fries and housemade pickles. The burger was incredibly juicy and had a lovely color to it. The sear provided a bit of crunchiness to the patty which was really nice, and it was nicely seasoned, as were the grilled onions. Sadly I forgot to grab pickles on my way out - I kinda wish they'd just give you some so you wouldn't miss out like I did. 8.80 got me a mini cheeseburger and an order of garlic fries - a dollar less and this would easily be a 5 star. Then again, considering you'd spend as much if not more at a Burger King or McDonald's, Super Duper is well worth the price and absolutely worth a try.

EDIT: After a couple months of working downtown, I'm adding a star because of Super Duper's consistently incredible food (that veggie burger for real tho), and especially compared to everything else on Market, it's well priced.
author: Ellie M.

description: I went today and as I was chewing the fried I found a piece of rubber shaped as a hook almost an inch long, I found it as I was chewing in my mouth and wouldn't have turned out good I almost swallowed but coughed it back up. Hmm not safe.
author: Imani T.

description: Super juicy and yummy burgers. The garlic fries are amazing. Must try!!
author: Monique E.

description: Absolutely amazing. I'm a burger enthusiast and I can easily say these burgers are in the highest level of competition. Also make sure you get garlic fries for total satisfaction.
author: Togayhan T.

description:
Two tries, come on now. It's not even cause the food is terrible, its actually pretty average.

First strike, writing in your own tip after and overcharging me, quite ballsy. I'm not even mad about the actual amount of extra tip your cashier gave herself for taking my order, its the principle!

Second strike, guess I should of known better than to try again. How they managed to skip my order when everything is electronically documented is very strange, but I patiently waited a good fifteen minutes for them to get my simple order of Mini Burger and fries to me. Should of said something sooner, before the throng of people who came in way after me got their order before me. Derp.

The food itself, its Niman ranch burgers which are great and all but the patty alone doesn't make a burger spectacular. Even adding their "everything on it" which is standard fare didn't lend much to it. Fries are greasy, a bit more salty than the usual, but not soggy.

And I thought I had low expectations. Super Duper, you got me good twice, bravo.
author: Steven C.

description:
This place is definitely one of the most complete experiences I've ever had at a burger joint where all three components (burger, fries, pickles) were on point.

Jiminy Crickets, their garlic fries are some of the best I've ever had. Actual chunks of yummy garlic all over the place.

Their burger is indeed pretty super duper. Fresh, perfectly cooked and heavy as a brick.

The pickles! I could have eaten a whole jar of their pickles alone. Snappy, with a nice little kick to it. Excellent.

I pray at the altar of Super Duper.
author: Alvin C.

description:
Hands down my go-to burger joint in the city, aside from In-N-Out. There are more and more locations opening throughout the city. I know of 3: 2 in the Downtown district and 1 in the Marina district. I've only eaten at the Downtown location near SF MOMA. The workers were very friendly and helpful each time. I would not suggest coming here during the peak of lunch because the seats are usually filled, despite have two floors. 

The overall feel is the typical do-it-yourself style that is becoming more common nowadays; self-serve drinks, utensils, condiments, clearing tables, etc. Speaking of condiments, I believe they have fresh, jarred pickles available for the all the pickle lovers out there! Sadly I don't share that love for pickles so I cannot provide my feedback on their pickles. I can, however, say their burgers and garlic fries are a must try. Freshly ground meat grilled to perfection? Yes pleease! The burgers, alone, are packed with taste, but there are a plethora of add-ons for those who yearn for more. The prices are more expensive than In-N-Out, but definitely worth the money. 

I can't wait to go grab another on of these buns of goodness.
author: Joanna J.

description:
"Awesome place" cockroaches in a jar of cucumbers.
Went to kitchen to show chef cockroach and what I saw there... A bunch of Mexican guys who did not care about cleanness
It was real dirt everywhere!!!
Never be back
Eat your cockroaches yourself
author: Marianna P.

description: Surprised that i really enjoyed the veggie burger. Had it with cheese, but actually liked the patty. Plus spiked milkshakes, so automatic points there!
author: Kris C.

description: We stopped by for a late lunch (230pm o a Saturday afternoon) and found a table outside right away. We had never tried their burgers before so we kept it simple and got the single patty burger with bacon and cheese. The burgers were surprisingly big and very flavorful. We also tried the garlic fries. They were soooo good!! Great price, convenient location, and really good food.
author: Heather A.

description: I am sorry but they are like shake shack but on the west coast, from the font style to the service to the food it just screams shake shack all over it.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Amazing burgers! Everything was great.... I had a chocolate shake too that was delicious. Next time I go I will definitely get the fried egg along with the grilled onions and avocado. I had the 4 oz and it was perfect for me.
author: Krystal P.

description: want a "healthy" burger? Don't go any further. Burgers looked hand made- delish.  Normally eating gluten free I couldn't pass up this artisan bun. They are insanely good. Homemade pickles- extra sour. Sorry I didn't catch the garlic Parmesan fries- after already ordering some came by and was tempted to grab one. Don't pass on the lemonade sweetened with brown sugar. Also happy they use glass cups and not disposable!
author: Peggy O.

description:
Juicy/Tasty burgers... 

the place can get crowded at times. Their pricing is decent and the wait time is not that bad.
author: Kalyan C.

description: Too good. Burgers are super slappin !!!!!!!!!!!!! Try a ice cream cone it's the real stuff
author: Josh M.

description:
This place is great for a quick burger.  I'd suggest coming here NOT at peak lunch hours.  Just before 11:30am or slightly after 1:15pm typically works best.  Otherwise, you're going to be looking at a line outside of the door, and you may be forced to settle for something less than a Super Duper Burger.

I've been here about 3 times.  I've tried ordering most things, and I'd recommend the following:

1) Order the single burger.  The double is good, but it's just a lot of meat.  You also want to save room for fries.

2) Order the burger medium rare!  I've gotten it medium and well done and it's absolutely not that great.  The key is getting it medium rare, trust me.

3) Do not fall for the garlic fries.  The garlic is overbearing, and it will also make your breath smell terrible for the remainder of your work day.  Just get the normal fries and dip them in ketchup.  Also, get a few of the tasty pickles to eat alongside your fries.

Anyhow, that's what I've found to be a foolproof way to approach Super Duper Burger.  Love this spot.
author: Andrew H.

description:
The organic soft serve is yummy.
The service and sensibility of the staff have MUCH to be desired.

I thought the retro aesthetic was hip and happening in an interesting but kind of minimalist way.  Note to self:  jars of homemade pickles can be edible and decorative.  

I give them a lot of credit for uhhm....testicular fortitude in making the wooden steer that dominates one wall kind of anatomically correct.  As fate would have it, that's where I ended up sitting, but it was not intentional in any way.

Bollocks, you say, right?  

I had a hankering for their aggressively advertised chocolate-vanilla swirl organic soft serve.  I'd eaten linner already and I just wanted something tasty to shovel into my relentless maw.  It had been like, 30 minutes since the Cadet had eaten, so of course he was hungry.  

I ordered the aforementioned signature soft serve and was informed by a crew member that while the vanilla machine was fully operational as was the one that dispensed chocolate, the swirly machine was broken.  

"Can you like, alternate chocolate and vanilla and kind of replicate it?"

Her distress was evident as a second crew member joined her for moral support.  The answer was, "That's not our company policy."

"Okay," I countered, evenly, "since you can't deliver what I'm asking for, I'd like the vanilla, sprinkled with malt, at no additional charge."  They actually list MALT on the paper and posted menus  - ADD .50.  In my head, I hear Mr. T's voice saying, "I pity the fool who has to do MALT inventory every night before closing!"  

I imagine the Super Duper Concerned GM having an all-hands meeting.  "We have a problem... somebody has been pilfering kilos of malt.  Addiction is nothing to laugh at - it's a disease, and it's out of love and concern that I need to know who's been snorting fat rails of malt in the back, threatening the financial solvency of this corporation."

I digress.

The first crew member tossed her dark tresses over her shoulder, haughtily dismissing my request with both her gesture and her tone.  "Well, I'd have to speak to my Manager about that."

I glanced back at the restless queue forming up behind me and gave her my, best "Honey Badger Ain't Goin' Nowhere" look.   

This is America.  I am an Ameri-CAN, and I will not be denied my maltstitutional rights, gosh dangit!  

A third crew member swivel-necked just to see if punches were going to be thrown.  The tension was palpable, like, Crimson Tide crazy-tension, cigar chomping, mutiny in the making!  The Cadet hadn't even ordered yet and I was standing my ground - as if there was any other option.  Also, instead of being Denzel, sweating and bloodied in a submarine, I was on terra firma with the Blue Angels booming in formation overhead.  

But still.  I pity the fool who doesn't have the common sense or the authority to sprinkle a teaspoon of frickin' malt on some soft serve.  That was my voice, just in a really sarcastic tone, and yes - I managed (barely) to keep it as an inner dialogue.

Just then, a FOURTH crew member appeared as this Malt Crisis escalated and said, "Well, I... guess I could put some vanilla and some chocolate soft serve together in a cup if you don't mind.  Would that be okay?"  

International Malt Crisis:  Avoided!  Clear thinking FOURTH crew member nominated for Nobel Peace Prize...

"Sure," I said.  "Thank you, and I'd like the cone too - and go ahead and charge me for the malt.  I'd still like that, please."  

Magically, the swirly machine was fixed and I was utterly delighted to receive both flavors of my Straus soft serve on a cone, with malt, as requested.  They did not charge me for the malt.  

The Cadet said his Chicken Sammich was good, though it didn't look like much to me. I smelled it, though and it had the exact aroma of yet another chicken sandwich I would never order.  His "fresh" lemonade made with brown sugar was conspicuously acidic and absent any pulp, but my palate was shot with such an odd combination.  

He went back for a plain vanilla cone without any incident.  

Happy Fleet Week!
author: Kim D.

description:
Most delicious Burgers and homemade pickles!
Only downside is that you have to sometimes wait in a long line and its quite noisy.
author: S M.

description:
One word: LEGIT

Ordered a double patty cheeseburger combo with fries and a soda. The patties were thick and juicy. Juices dripping down like how the Carl's Jr commercials portray. Got all the condiments. The fries were okay reminded me of a thicker version of In and Out. Always walked by this place and see people packed. Oh also was intrigued by the Castro location because I remember one drunken night from Lime, stumbling across it and sayinnn MMMM burgers. lol

Ambiance was chill and laid back. They play lots of hit r & b and old school feel good songs, so that was a plus for me. Lots of seating. Fast pace. Workers cleaning up the tables constantly too. Great overall upkeep.

This hit the spot. I will definitely be back. I just thought it was too daamn windy outside for a soft serve.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I'll be honest. I'm a little obsessed with this place.

Where else can you get deliciously juicy burgers where the restaurant also believes in sustainability? I haven't looked it up, but it can't be many more places.

I typically get the mini burger combo - 1/3 lb patty, fries, and a drink. Definitely enough food for one person, but if you're a little adventurous, you can also add an egg and jalapenos to the burger. I'm a fan of ordering the standard meal just to get a sense of the place. Now that I've had it, I haven't ventured far from this order every time I go here.

Other options: garlic fries, veggie burgers, chicken burger, soft serve, BEER, and milkshakes.

I love coming here after work to catch up with friends.
author: Alice H.

description:
so
freaking
good
i made the cardinal sin of ordering the chicken sandwich
(i've been trying to watch what i eat before hawaii, sue me)
but ended up eating most of everyone else's burgers and double bacon cheeseburgers
seriously, so good
don't even think of comparing it to shake shack's 
although their sign is a smidge TOO similar looking
but what does plagiarism matter when their burger is THAT good
plagiarism schmagiarism
author: Clara L.

description:
This burger spot has a fun name, that's why I wanted to try it out. 
Today I finally had the opportunity for this - on a Friday afternoon, the place was medium-busy, meaning that I had to wait in line for a few short minutes.
Nevertheless, the line moved rather quickly and the woman who took my order was friendly and tried to start a conversation about where I am from and such.

I ordered the meal combo (mini burger with cheese, fries and a fountain drink) and paid around 11$. Until my burger was ready, it took around five minutes which is totally acceptable.
The place offers free pickles, which ich pretty cool and I must say, the unsweetened ice tea was not bitter (unlike in many places), a plus point for that.

The burger itself was quite small (dah, I ordered the mini burger), yet it had a great taste and I somehow thought the bun was better than others I did have in the past. The fries were well-seasoned and tasty. All in all it was a good lunch but not over the top. In my opinion, the price is rather high for the amount of food you can get, especially if you take an extra such as cheese or bacon.

Nevertheless, I would come back to eat there, definitely. There are just so many other places that seem on the same level as Super Duper Burgers and so many that are better.
author: Vera H.

description:
*Breakfast Review*

I found the breakfast sandwich to be a decadent delight of greasy, meaty, buttery goodness. Yeah, I wouldn't eat one every day, but they sling a nice breakfast sandwich. I even went back for a second one.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Alright, I think I've found a burger joint to frequent in the city! By no means the best burger I've had, Super Duper nevertheless serves up a solid and affordable burger.

Being confined at home due to a broken leg, my dad ordered take-out, bringing me a super burger with everything but pickles, plus bacon, egg, and avocado for a total of $9.50, and a side of tasty $2.75 garlic fries to share. And, considering the burger was still good despite having cooled down by the time it arrived, I image it's much tastier fresh. Sadly, the bun is still your standard sesame bun (I am forever a fan of unique buns, like brioche).

If memory serves me correctly, these guys serve up a tastier burger than Pearl's does. But then again, Pearl's offers up far more variety, both in the types of burgers, and the meat options available. But, I digress - a solid 3.5 stars for these folks!
author: Johnny W.

description:
Holy moly hamburger heaven!

Great burger

Great fries

And they serve cold beer in a glass.

Staff are happy smiling and friendly.

What more do you need? WHAT MORE DO YOU NEED?
author: stu c.

description:
