My friend and I were headed to a free movie screening and needed a quick bite to eat beforehand. She and I desperately plugged away at our SmartPhones, scouring the internet for the answer to our burning question... "Is Super Duper's veggie burger also vegan?"

I'll admit, I hate being the annoying vegan girl who plays 20 Questions with the server, so I always try to do some research beforehand. My friend Cat is a bit more brazen than I am, so she just sauntered up to the counter and asked. 

Two people at the register were clueless, but a pretty, peppy girl piped up "I can make you an awesome vegan burger!" 

She told me that she is also a vegan, so she knew her stuff. She suggested the veggie patty on a ciabatta roll with the works: lettuce, tomato, cucumbers, and hummus, plus added avocado and grilled mushrooms. It sounded fantastic, and it was! The ciabatta bread was yummy beyond belief. I'm not normally into mushies, but these fungi were top-notch. 

The house-made pickles are also fabulous. 

Thank you, Kayla! You are a gift from the vegan heavens.
author: Brandi W.

description:
I have been here more times than I would like to admit.. 

It's become a problem. It's definitely not doing the waistline any good nor my wallet.

But I just can't resist the burgers and garlic fries.. And the milkshakes.

Trust. It won't disappoint.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Every time I come to San Francisco Super Duper Burgers is my first meal as soon as I get off the plane. The long 6 hour flight usually has me in need of great pick me up. The burgers are awesome, cooked medium and juicy. I usually get the mini burger with cheese. I have tried the Super Burger on occasion and it is mega. You must and I repeat must get the garlic fries with your order. Regular fries are good too but when in the Bay Area garlic is KING. 

Next time I must finally try their shakes. I usually wash down my meal with a coke or one of the beers they have on tap. 

In closing Super Duper Burgers is an awesome place and I wish they had an East Coast location. Nothing would even come close to the Super Duper experience.
author: Jay N.

description: The burger I had here was small, greasy, and overall disappointing. Definitely overpriced when you consider the price per oz. The burger was dripping way too much, half of my tray was covered in grease juice from the burger. Not a "super" burger and not "super-duper."
author: Steven V.

description:
The downfall of America is the lack of picky-burger-eaters...

I was so looking forward to this place. My dad had raved about it for weeks on end while I was traveling, and I couldn't wait to try the supposedly delicious soft serve and burgers. 

Burgers are my favorite food of all time. soft serve is my favorite dessert of all time, so when I heard about this place, I thought well, there goes my wallet. Sadly/gladly my wallet is still intact due to me not loving this place.

I walk in, and the decor is just what I expected it to be. I ordered a vanilla soft serve shakes ( I think, cant even remember it's so forgettable) and a regular burger. 

Now, I had just spent a few weeks in New york (way better food than SF), eating delicious burger after burger. So I guess my expectations were super high, but I'm sure I wouldn't like this place anyhow. I bite in. Tears begin to fall down my face....OK a bit melodramatic, but the burger was tasteless. The ingredients were fresh, but I dont care! I'm looking for a great patty, and they dont know how to make one. I overloaded it with pickles and mustard for taste and it still tasted like nothing. The fries were aight. 

A place loaded with yuppies.
author: Ariana V.

description:
If I was on death row, I think I might just pick Super Duper for my last meal. The burgers are Oh so juicy and delicious. Tried the garlic fries which were good too. The "homemade" pecan pie was good but did not live up to my high expectations based on the other stuff I have eaten here. 

They get extra points for being organic and not serving soda. They have beer, wine, shakes and freshly squeezed lemonade. The employees are always friendly as well.  All adds up to a 5 star experience.
author: Sunil R.

description:
For a fancier-than-fast-food-but-still-fast-food chain, this is about as good as it gets. Service was quick, cashiers were friendly (and took the time to ask about my day!), place was clean. More importantly, their mini burgers are so filling and so good! The meat was juicy, bun was toasted well and it was gone before I realized! Fries were cooked very well too, not too soft but not overly crunchy. Definitely five star for a quick bite!

Note to first-timers: I would say their mini burger is actually the equivalent of a regular sized burger. The super has double the meat, but the mini is filling on its own (especially if you get additions). 

Also, if you're at this location in the FiDi, go downstairs!! There is so much more seating down there, but it seems like the bottom level gets hidden.
author: Jenny Y.

description: Was looking for a place to meet my SF transplant friend from LA and he recommended this place. Was walking distance from the Hilton where I was hanging out with some TNT peeps so I hit the street. It's centrally located on Market. Bunch of outdoor seats and opens up into a large 2-story loft space. Line was long... waited about 10 minutes for my friend to show. Was able to get a spot though in no time. I ordered the super burger. 2 patties, cheddar cheese, onions and lettuce. Not sure if I had bacon... hard to believe someone could forget that huh lol. All on a sesame bun. Side order of fries which my friend said were kind of dry, tasteless. I was hungry and couldn't tell. Ordered a Race IPA. Burger was pretty tasty. Decor somewhat industrial. Street parking if you're lucky.
author: James B.

description: Enjoyed my recent visit here. They serve up a quality juicy burger in reasonable wait time. The homemade spicy pickles are a nice touch to these delicious bites.
author: Michael T.

description: Food poisoning from poorly prepped soft serve last night. Thanks, Super Duper!
author: Diane N.

description:
As a self-proclaimed french fry connoisseur, I must say, Super Duper Burger knows how to make some awesome french fries--golden, delicious thick cut french fries.  Both their regular fries and garlic fries are delightfully crunchy and full of potato-y goodness, although I do think the garlic fries could be a tad bit more garlicky.  Even when they're slightly cooled, the fries still have a nice crunch to them, which a lot of places can't say they can do.  4.5 stars for the fries (-0.5 only because there needs to be more garlic and my bias against thick cut fries haha)!

The burgers are okay, but not mindblowing.  I ordered the mini burger combo with everything on it, and while I enjoyed it, it's nothing incredible.  Also, if you're fearful of grease, I wouldn't suggest the burger because Super Duper burgers are nice and greasy.  Not for the kind of meal for a typical health nut.

Great place to stop by if you're in Union Square for a shopping spree.  I might not be coming back here for a burger, but I just might for some of those fries!
author: Jackie H.

description:
I went there for a froyo cone. This sketchy establishment took my copy of the receipt when passing me my cone, and I didn't really think twice about it. Turns out, they ended up adding a tip to my credit card charge that I never added (I'm sorry, but I don't tip for a carry-out soft-serve cone).

Underhanded and unacceptable business practices.
author: D C.

description:
Love this place! Dog friendly outdoor seating. Home made pickles. Endless drink refills. Great burgers. Awesome dipped cones. Fast service.

We've had both the burgers and grilled chicken. Garlic fries could be a bit more garlicky like those at AT& T Park. Whatever you do, don't miss out on treating yourself to a big swirl cone. 

I've only eaten here after 7pm and have never encountered a line.
author: Kim W.

description:
Super Duper has become my favorite go to burger joint. The burgers are cooked to perfection, the fries are made just how I like them and the milkshakes are so damn yummy! 

The 5 stars goes out to the impeccable customer service that I experienced at my last visit on 1/29/14.

My girlfriend and I were starving when we met up after work to head home so we decided to indulge in a burger. We headed to Super Duper and waited in line. As we waited we excitedly talked about our work day before we knew it was our turn to order. 
Giselle happened to be the employee taking our order. Not only was she warm, friendly and smiling she apologized for interrupting our conversation to take our order. She was so sweet and so accommodating that I had to let her and her manager Nancy know how great she made our experience. As I ate I couldn't help but notice that she and her colleague Tiegran (not sure if I spelled his name correctly - apologies if I didn't) continued to give every patron the same awesome experience. 

In a time when customer service, especially at a chain burger joint, is fading it was such a breathe of fresh air to have this experience! So thanks Giselle, Nancy and Tiergan!!
author: Lisette C.

description:
Very delicious burger joint. The garlic fries is also very satisfying. It might look like it is full of garlic at first but a big portion of the white stuff on top is actually cheese. It doesn't have a very strong garlic taste to it when you eat it but you can definitely feel it afterwards.

The place could be a little crowded during peak hours but that's how you know the food is good (In N' Out always has crazy drive-thru lines).
author: John H.

description: I had a chicken sandwich and it tasted very good. The sandwich was made kind of sloppy but other than that I liked the food. I will go there another time to eat.
author: Philip C.

description: Got some burgers while waiting for showtime at Castro theatre. Great burgers and super crunchy fries. But super oily even for burgers. And the price is above what you expect for fast food burgers.
author: Jemusu L.

description:
This establishment is suffering from delusions of grandeur. But it probably wouldn't  survive in this dog-eat-dog world of burger joints with it's real name: Ok Burger. 

It is ok.

All of a sudden, everybody thinks they are all that at making burgers. Stop it ok. Just stop it. It is hamburger. They should go back to being a dime a dozen. Maybe then I wouldn't have to pull out my American Express card only to find out they do not accept that.

I did accept the $4.00 wine. For a sauvignon blanc it was quite tasty and crisp. It did hit the spot. And it went well with my chicken breast sandwich which was overcooked (but who wants undercooked chicken?) (but it doesn't have to have all the juices smashed out of it with the spatula while it is grilling either, now does it?) but still tasty. And the cheese was nice and melty. 

Even Lesly S. who wanted to come here after her musical experience only ate half of her mini burger with avocado. We both picked at her fries.

I didn't leave unhappy. I left feeling this was A-Ok.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Overall this place is great if you're looking for a cheap bite of food that tastes pretty darn good. I got a fully loaded mini (4oz) burger and an order of garlic fries for about $9. 

However, I gave this place three stars for a couple of reasons. One, they say their burgers come out medium, but mine was definitely well done. I ordered to-go so I didn't notice until I got home. And this POed me because both my friends burgers were medium. Also, when I ordered I specifically stated what toppings I wanted, and which I didn't. But when I got the burger, it was wrong. While they did fix it, one of the employees gave me a hard time about it. If one of the employees hadn't intervened I don't know if they would have fixed it.

So, food is tasty but the mistakes bugged me.
author: Cori N.

description: I wish they had this chain in San Diego! Like other reviewers mentioned they are similar to  smash burger but not as good! This place was really delicious and the mini is the perfect amount of food. We are so used to everything being super size that a burger that is called mini is actually just the right size for an adult who is hungry! Give it a try when you are craving a burger!
author: Rachel V.

description:
I was a little disappointed by the veggie burger after reading some of the prior reviews.

When I checked this place out, the line was out the door from the GDC convention going on down the street.  They managed to work the line down pretty quickly, and to show they cared, they brought a small amount of fries and homemade chipotle dipping sauce to everyone in line as we waited, nice work Super Duper.

I got the veggie burger and added grilled onion and avocado ($1) and cheese ($.50).  Including a soda, I'm paying about $11 for a burger fries and soda, which is pretty pricey.  I thought all the ingredients tasted really fresh, but I had a serious problem with the sesame seed bun.  Way too many sesame seeds, so much so that it overpowered every other flavor and made the bites akwardly crunchy.  I thought the veggie patty was decent, but had almost no real flavor.

I'm hoping that the beef patties have more flavor, so I'm hesitant to give them a lower rating.  All in all, good service and fresh ingredients aren't enough to make up for a patty lacking in flavor.
author: Dave S.

description:
This place is good. I like their burgers - their egg addition is a popular choice. Many people compare this to Five Guys or In-n-out, but I think they are all very different (in a good way). 

I especially love their strawberry shake which is probably the best I've had from a burger place and well worth the price.

The employees are nice and the service is fast. All around, a great place and two thumbs up. I've yet to have a bad experience, although sometimes the burgers are a tad bit too dry(compared to their normal juicy goodness), but it doesn't stop me from coming back!

A must try if you're in the area!!!
author: Tyler V.

description:
yup maybe their burger is good and soft serve is even better... but when i ordered dipped soft serve, you took my money, i waited, and you told me the chocolate dipping machine is not working, so i asked for my money back, is it really OK for you to throw 3 quarters on my hand? you were going to throw them right on the desk in front of me, i had my palm up, so you threw them in my hand. that was NOT OKAY. is it my problem that your dipping machine isn't working?

the blond pony tail lady that was working this past Saturday night, maybe you should think of a career change.
author: Bonnie Y.

description:
Being a vegetarian, good burger places are hard to come by! That's why when I ended up here on a Friday after an evening of drinking, I wasn't too excited by the prospect of yet another mundane veggie burger. Couldn't have been more wrong!

Ambiance: Very casual set-up. Lots of tables here and there inside and upstairs as well with some outside. You order in line and then pick up your order when it's ready. 

Food: I went with the obvious choice, a vegetarian burger with avocado (extra $1). My friends mentioned that the vegetarian burger was delicious and they nailed it! The burger was crisp, on a delicious toasted bun and the avocado pulled the burger together. Most times I need ketchup or hot sauce with my burgers. This one didn't need anything! I think the burger had corn inside as well, giving it a better texture than most garden patties you will find in a veggie burger. I tried some fries as well-- nothing that blew me away but a good addition to your meal. The restaurant also has a selection of house pickles that you can add to your burgers. I'm usually not a huge fan of pickles but they were delicious when paired with my burger! 

Drinks: I was going to go with a soda but a friend recommended a spiked milkshake. I wasn't sure how much I'd enjoy that but the final product was fantastic! I went with a vanilla spiked milkshake. Still your regular rich and sweet milkshake with a slight aftertaste of alcohol. Totally worth every sip of those sinful calories. 

Verdict: Definitely worth a visit! Yes, it is a little pricier than other fast-food joints but the quality and taste both trump the price. By miles.
author: Anu P.

description:
Small burger for the price, but it was filling enough, and tasty. The garlic parm fries were great, not THE crispiest but far from soggy.

I love the fact that this place seems (at least for a casual take-out) focused on an Eco-friendly setup. Food is served on reuseable aluminium trays (in disposable but recyclable wrapping, of course), they use glasses instead of paper cups, and all their condiment tubs, napkins, etc are earth-friendly (as much as disposable stuff can be) too.

The guy behind the counter was really friendly and helpful, and the food came out reasonably fast (though not so fast that I worried they'd microwaved the burger or something... I'm looking at you, McDonalds).

It wasn't the most amazing burger of my life, but I'll most likely be back.
author: Laura N.

description:
A well-deserved 5-stars goes to Super Duper for their phenomenal Veggie Burger 

This may be among my top alltime burgers! 

Homemade patty w/ rice, carrots, corn, peppers (I think I also saw sesame seeds). Super texture! Got it w/ avocado & cheese & they were creamy & melty & added to the burger's deliciousness - nothing overpowered 

And.....NO meaty residue!!! Not sure where they fry those babies up - I was watching their huge meaty grill as I was waiting on my order, but my burger was pristine & that's worth all kinds of bonus luv! 

Cucumbers, tomatoes, lettuce & their sauce completed this little piece of veggie comfort-food heaven 

Garlic Fries are of the shoestring variety & were soft yet crispy & that garlic was FRESH! No pickled stuff like you'll find at other places....this still had crunch. They were outstanding! 

Chocolate shake was thick & chocolaty & was the perfect topper for this meal 

Walked in & line was out the door - from that point to getting my food? 15 min.....completely worth the wait!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I think I should have broken my paleo for one exception and had a cheeseburger. This place must make a bomb burger because the salad was less than satisfactory all around.  

Their salad comes in a very very basic form then you pay to add the good stuff, (mushrooms, avocado, etc).  $10 salad, no biggie, I've done worse.  It just didn't taste good. My taste buds may have been having an off day but I left kinda cranky and went to buy a kind bar to fill the void in my stomach. 

The staff seemed kind enough and there were tons of tables and seating - next time- spring for the burger.
author: Stephanie D.

description: like in and out but as great and with homemade pickles to boot. Try out the age cheese garlic fries...nomables!
author: Robert H.

description:
Decent burger place that fills a much-needed void for greasy diner food near the office. The lunchtime rush is unbearable but if you visit for dinner the line is completely manageable and you won't have to carve out an hour just to queue for a burger. The veggie burger is super tasty with just the right ratio of bun-to-patty and not too crumbly or beany. Those with digestive issues of any sort should maybe hesitate before ordering it though because it's quite fibrous, or maybe just greasy - I'll let you decide which - and has a laxative effect.

Most things here are very reasonably priced - $5.50 for the veggie burger, and even if you add the quite frankly obligatory cheese, avocado and egg it adds up to only $8. The exception for fair pricing is the ice cream - I came here with a hankering for soft serve so was ready to pay any price, but $3.25 for a mediocre vanilla cone is egregious.
author: Kat F.

description: Here lies the greasiest and one of the most delicious burgers in SF.  Seriously, get the 'mini' (4oz) burger here.  I did not, I got the 'super' which is 2x the mini.  That was a bit much.  Couple that with a shake and some super crispy fries and it's the happiest place on the north side of Market St.
author: David S.

description:
Over priced? Check

Tiny patties? Check

Greasy soggy Bun? Check

Average flavor? Check 

Good Garlic Fries? Check 

In and out is better in every way, they are making hundreds of burgers an hour and manage not to have a greasy bun that makes everything hard to eat. Is it good? it's ok and I hate overpriced ok food.
author: Charles W.

description:
I really like the burgers here.  Very juicy and flavorful.  If you add an organic fried egg on top however it can get very messy and easily become one of those burgers you finish eating, and lick your fingers in between bites, without putting it down to eat a fry or sip your drink.

The complete meal: a regular burger with everything on it, plus an organic fried egg + garlic fries + a cookies and cream milkshake = super duper full!
author: Erich D.

description: Good veggie burger and shakes. The grilled onions and jalapeños add a nice texture. Been here a few times, with good food however this last time, both my friend and my burgers were over cooked & dry.
author: Beni D.

description:
dont be fooled by the SUPER long line cuz the service is actually surprisingly SUPER fast. har har har

great juicy burger & yummy garlic fries for a low price.

classy fast food at its finest.
author: Renalen C.

description:
Another good contrast. At the high end, John's Grill was a great contrast to the disappointing Hayes Street Grill. At the low end (well, by SF standards of pricing!), Super Duper Burgers is a good contrast to disappointing Little Griddle.

I had thought of ordering the veggie burger but the "special sauce" was mayonnaise, which I loathe. Got chicken burger, with cheese and avocado and no mayonnaise (they can call it chipotle aioli or anything else, it's still mayonnaise!) Also shared order of fries with my sister. A pre-check of the menu showed they don't serve tea so I brought my own. Got a shake (the double chocolate) for after.

Often burgers, especially chicken, are dry and rely on mayonnaise to make them less so. I was glad that the chicken burger was moist and had good flavor. Pickles were fabulous, I'm normally not a big pickle fan but I ate two dishes of them! I wish, however, that they had a side salad available. 

BTW, young man at counter, stop apologizing! I asked for paper menu as I could not read board, and he apologized. Dude, it's not your fault I'm near-sighted! I asked several questions and he apologized with each answer. I finally told him that I don't know who told him to keep apologizing, so far as I was concerned, he was doing his job answering questions and no need to apologize. And then he apologized again!

Shake - not Ben and Jerry's to be sure, better not to know what was in it, not that cream is exactly health food. But how can a double chocolate shake not taste good?

Maybe not super duper but good. Worth coming to for a quick burger meal. There's a Starbucks' on the corner if you need to bring your own tea.
author: Carol S.

description: I wanted a burger so I went here and I'm so glad I did.  Got the mini with cheese and bacon and brought it back to my hotel room.  I basically inhaled it.  Their special sauce is very special and their bacon is thick and delicious.  Buy a burger here.  You won't regret it.
author: Steven H.

description:
I am not a huge fan of burgers, but after eating here, I have had a change of heart. 

I ordered the mini (one patty) cheese burger with everything plus grilled onions. 
Absolutely delicious and the best part was how fresh and juicy the meat was. A lot of burgers I have eaten in the past were dry and why I have not been a big fan.

Came here on a Sat afternoon and did not have to wait at all. They have seating inside and outside. We sat outside and enjoyed our food.

Friendly and fast staff too. Will definitely come back.
author: Kat M.

description:
Why did I go?
I've walked past these so many times, it was time to finally try one out since they have a bunch of locations now.

What did I order?
Mini Burger - these burgers are a little bigger than In-n-out, I think it's a 4oz patty.  They use good beef and it's got lots of flavor. I ordered it with all the standard toppings and it did not disappoint.
Fries - cooked well, nice crispness on the outside and a fluffy inside.
Pickles - lightly briney, not overly sour and really great spices in their pickling mix.  The flavoring is on the light side compared to the intensity of the vlasic and the more common grocery store brands.

Was it worth it?
I got the mini combo and it was like 10 bucks, pretty average I'd say.  I think it's worth paying more to try the milkshakes, garlic fries and premium toppings.

Cool spot?
So I thought it was inside the Metreon but the door is actually outside on Market.  Don't walk the perimeter looking for it like I did :p Once you get inside though it's quite spacious which is a good thing since there are like a million people.  The tables are kind of oddly proportioned, I sat at one of the high tables and there was just enough room for my friend and I to get our trays back to back.

Gonna go back?
If there isn't a super long line I'd eat here again, but next time I'm not getting everything plain though.  I didn't think the burger on it's own was that good, but with garlic fries and a fried egg it would be way better!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Their burgers taste the way meat should - flavorful and juicy. Fries are good, the extra charge for three dipping sauces is small and totally worth it! The pickles are homemade, sometimes with a stronger vinegar kick. 
Service is quick and place is clean.
author: Oxana M.

description: Tasty burgers.  Love the house made pickles that you can help yourself to.  A great place to grab a quick bite!
author: Kathryn C.

description: Very delicious burger, cashier was welcoming and very nice. I will definitely be back whenever I am in the city. Great pickles too! Water quality is also very good, napkins are also very available and are not in short supply either. Bathrooms are very clean, chairs are comfortable and doors are wide enough for anyone to enter. Atmosphere is great too.
author: Keith H.

description: A delicious burger and a real treat. The mini is more than enough. I actually have also done it protein style and it was enough. I added an egg to mine and it was so delicious perfect addition to my burger. The fries aren't anything crazy but it's fun to share. The burger and secret sauce are a great Friday lunch treat when you want to splurge!
author: Priya S.

description: Totally satisfying,  whether it's the burger,  the fries or just a salad.  Beef or chicken,  it doesn't matter.  It just tastes good. The garlic fries are a definite must but don't eat it if you're expecting to be social afterwards. I love In-and -Out but somehow Super Duper makes me feel healthier and happier (maybe it's the thought that I had an organic egg on top of my burger and that spread to the meat!)
author: Damien L.

description: Awesome burgers! I got the fully loaded super burger and it was all I hoped it would be! Great place to grab a burger!
author: Bradley G.

description:
Super Duper Yummy!  We were a party of 7 and everyone but myself ordered a cheeseburger.  I took a bite of everyone's unique cheese burgers and they were all good!  French fries and pickles were also very good.  The meat tasted fresh and looked like something I would make and have my husband BBQ on the grill.  The vege burger was also quite tasty, especially with some Tabasco sauce.

This place is also in a great location, you can walk off some of those calories while you shop.  The only downfall... parking!  Any ideas as to where I can park for less than $28 for a mini van?!
author: Erlinda R.

description: A beautiful burger.... I had been craving a good flavorful burger and searched Yelp for reviews and went to Super Duper.  I ordered the mini burger with cheese, (they had three different cheeses from which to chose), french fries and the three dips: super sauce, house made mayo and chipotle. The chipotle was my favorite sauce because it was rich and spicy.  The burger bun was toasted and the patty was flavorful without any additional condiments!  I was surprised to see the thin slices of red onion after a few bites and was pleased with the dark green color of the frilly lettuce.  With toppings such as grilled onions and portobello mushrooms on the menu, I look forward future visits to experiment with different combinations of ingredients
author: Tania L.

description: This burger place is good. The service is good and it did not have a lot of seating inside. The burger and fries are good.
author: Nick S.

description:
Went to Super Duper on Market not too far from Montgomery Bart station.  It was about 11am so not busy or crowded.

Ordered the chicken w/ chipotle aioli sauce $6.50.  It took maybe 10 min to get my food, they call out your name to pick up food.

Help yourself to ketchup & mustard & the homemade pickles.

I thought the sandwich was ok, chicken a bit dry.  Adding ketchup & mustard plus eating the pickles helped.

Got water from the fountain w/ ice & slice of lemon.

I want to try the Chocolate & Fresh Strawberries Super Shake $5.75 or the Straus Organic Soft Serve Cones $2.75-$4 depending on the size & if you want dipped or not.

Veggie burger w/ hummus $5.5
Portobello Sandwich $5.50
Hamburgers Mini (4oz) $4.5; Super (8oz) $6.5
French Fries $2; Garlic Fries $2.75; 3 dips $1
Salad $5.50 - add ons $1-$3

Visa taken.

Bathrooms in the back.  Women's - just one sink/toilet.

There's some tables upstairs, & outdoor seating.  I ate facing the window.
author: Ann L.

description:
This isn't a your regular fast food joint like McDonalds or Burger King. It has the similar burger atmosphere and aesthetic as In-N-Out and Shake Shack, but a little pricier. The menu includes everything from breakfast items to fully customizing a burger depending on your hunger. A few items that stood out to me are the option of adding an organic egg and/or avocados, and their 3 select beers on tap. 

Simply put, their burger was delicious. I ordered the mini burger which included a juicy-crumbly patty, lettuce, tomato, onions, cheese, and secret sauce. The fries were solid as well. But one really unique aspect of Super Duper Burgers is they make their own pickles. If you love housemade pickles they are included with no extra cost in unlimited amounts.
author: J. T.

description: This place does not disappoint! At first I thought it was going to be touristy and lame, but these burgers are honestly pretty good and are worth the money. Every time I've went the tables were mostly full, too. Just get the super burger with bacon and cheese. That's all you need!
author: Alex S.

description: I've been to their location in San Jose and enjoyed their burgers...a tad greasy at times...this location serves the burgers near perfect, but they leave their doors open on a freezing day
author: Ericha F.

description: The garlic fries were delicious and the burger was definitely above average. The biggest are of improvement would be in cleanliness. Tables weren't wiped down between customers and the drink/condiment are didn't seem as sanitary as I would like. Great experience overall though
author: Melissa E.

description:
Should of known it was 2 good to be true. They gave me a super duper raw mini burger today and I swear I almost threw up in my mouth. I took it back for a full refund. That's too bad they ruined a foodie's taste buds!

The manager was so embarrassed he couldn't even say anything but I'm sorry. Please check your burgers before you eat them. Check out my pictures. (In my chef Gordan Ramsey voice) it's bloody raw!
author: Sophie P.

description:
Great Burgers!
Order with eggs on top of the meat and it Will get very tasty! 
One of the best in san Francisco.
author: Patrik J.

description:
I'm into it.

Tasty burgers that almost feel healthy because all their ingredients are fresh and organic! 

Advice:
1. Don't be deceived, the mini burger is actually not so mini and it the size of an average regular burger (think bigmac bun diameter) and is plenty satisfying.
2. Order your burger medium rare, that's what everyone else says, I did it and it was perfect.
3. Skip the sauces and order the garlic fries.
4. The egg was ok and not necessary, but if you get it, prepare for it to yolk all over your hand upon your first bite.
5. The milkshakes are thick, probably made of the same stuff the soft serve is. It is good but definitely big enough to be a sharing size. I liked the chocolate but wished they had strawberry shakes! 
6. Come back another day for the hand dipped soft serve!
author: Nicole L.

description: The burgers are so juicy and fresh. The garlic fries are to die for! And ice cream is not too bad. Waiting time is really fast.
author: Marian P.

description: There are three tiers of burger joints. Fast food, gourmet  and luxe. By price, you have certain expectations. This is a solid, great gourmet burger joint. Its not a cheap burger but it's what u want a gourmet burger to be - juicy meat that u can taste is fresh and the bun is nice. The rest of add-one is nice or easy to create but if the meat or bun is not up to snuff, who cares - but super duper burger lives up to their name - so while they offer a slew of options, the base foundation is excellent and it's appropriately priced - they are also fast used to lunch hour workers. I believe they are a mini chain - well worth a visit.
author: Joe B.

description:
This is a great go-to lunch spot. It serves almost any need you might have when dining with someone whose food preferences you don't know.

The burgers are quite good, and the toppings give you enough options to customize without being overwhelming. Unlike most mass produced burger joints the patty is not overcooked, and any place that serves its food with an egg option gets an extra star in my book. Get the mini - I'm a pretty big eater and I don't think there's much reason to get the super.

For the vegetarians out there, they have veggie burgers, what I've been told is a great portabello sandwich, and of course, salads.

Price point is extremely reasonable. You can eat for $5 if necessary (unheard of in downtown SF) and unless you're getting beers or milkshakes (another plus for Super Duper!) no one's going to break the $10 mark. Also, you order at the counter which makes paying together or splitting the lunch bill very easy.

I was very pleasantly surprised by the fresh brown sugar lemonade the last time I went.

It's true, you may have to compromise a bit on finding a table or dealing with some lunchtime rush, but need I say more than I went there three times last week?
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I've heard a lot about how good this place is. I finally got to try it today. I was super hungry but I wasn't able to finish the mini burger. The beef doesn't taste good. Shake shack is a lot better on the meat. I eventually finished the patties and threw away the meat. 

FYI. Mini burger is already a full size of burger and my coworkers laugh at it and said what size of their regular burger is like?
author: Ashley C.

description:
There was a lot of hype about this place and staying at the Westin around the corner, I decided to try it. Gluten free option was a lettuce wrap which was good but the burger I didn't find like it was amazingly great with its So called super sauce. It was an average good burger in my books.
The strawberry smoothie however and the fries were fabulous!!!!! Highly recommend both :)
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
I love a good cheeseburger, but Super Duper also offers a delectable chicken sandwich on their menu that shouldn't be passed up. That, a side order of fries and a strawberry chocolate milkshake and you've got yourself a power lunch. Granted, it requires a power nap afterwards but hey, that's just how it goes sometimes. 

This particular spot just opened up around the corner from Yelp HQ about a month ago and I love the fact that they make boozy shakes and have soft serve cones available as well. So even if you don't love burgers (chicken, beef or veggie), come by and get yourself a sweet treat.
author: Abby S.

description:
Best burger I've ever had, and I've had plenty. 

The patties are so darn juicy, and you can really taste the roasted sesame seeds on the buns.

Can't wait to return and try getting an organic egg on top and one of their Straus shakes. 

Open a location in Berkeley please!
author: A H.

description:
I like hamburgers but I don't love them. The slightly smaller size is perfect for me, but it's certainly bigger than its name: mini. The fries were terrific too. But I was really looking forward to the pickles and didn't like them at all. I can't put my finger on what the flavor is, but it's not straight forward dill or sour pickle. I wish they had a variety.

Great people watching sitting on Market Street!
author: Claire T.

description:
Sometimes you just want to sink your teeth into a juicy, bacon cheeseburger...

So I ordered a combo with garlic fries to go. I get back to my desk and my juicy, mouthwatering bacon cheeseburger was a chicken sandwich!?!?! Yea...I don't exactly like chicken and I've already committed myself to having a bacon cheeseburger. 

Naturally I called the restaurant. No answer. Huh. A couple fries later I'm hangry and decided to call again. I was lucky enough to have the GM, Randy, answer the line. He gave me his cell number and told me to call him directly when I'm ready for my replacement sandwich. 

Not only did I get a replacement sandwich a month later when I was finally ready for a burger but he also gave me an entire meal! Smooth transaction and everything was tasty! 

Thanks, Randy!
author: Kat D.

description:
Yummy Burger. Great bun. Fresh green lettuce and juicy red tomatoes. You rarely see that in fast food places. Great burger. 

Garlic fries- didn't love. Not crispy. Pretty bland. Cheese seems like good idea but needs to be melted on. Pretty much a fail to me. 

Vanilla cone dipped in chocolate...yum!!! Just wish they all were dipped all the way. Left a lot of ice cream dripping through. super messy. Would LOVE to see a white chocolate dipping option!!! 

Mini shakes are so cute and great option when you don't want a full shake.
author: Keri V.

description:
Burgers took forever and they are more expensive than In N Out. But I was surprised how good the burgers were and how big they were. I would say it's on par if not better than In N Out.

Would definitely go back. Service can use a little work but I didn't notice. Too busy munchin down my burger.
author: Justin L.

description: My husband and I absolutely loved these burgers! It's not even the toppings, it's the quality of meat that makes it so great. Freshness you can taste, truly. Super juicy, but not greasy. Next time we're in San Fran, we'll have to try the highly acclaimed garlic fries. Definitely worth the money for the quality of the burger.
author: Shayne H.

description:
You don't need to read another review of the burger here. It's good, not amazing, but good. Tastes better after a few drinks. 

So, I will tell you about the breakfast sandwich which has saved my life on a few mornings. I'm old enough that I don't like fast food breakfast anymore and am always running late, so stopping by The Grove or Il Cane Rosso for a fancy breakfast sandwich isn't possible, so instead, I come here.

For $3 I can get a scrambled egg breakfast sandwich on english muffin as God intended. And all is well afterwards.
author: Maria D.

description: Above average burgers for above average price. I like how they offer a mini burger because the portion is satisfying enough without forcing you to unbutton your pants. Fries here are really crispy and taste fresh, and the vanilla malt shake was delicious as well. My only complaint about the burger is that it's a little on the dry side for me, even with the super sauce I had them add to it. Next time, I want to add a fried egg to my burger as well as try their chocolate-dipped ice cream cone.
author: Celia K.

description:
PLEASE, BRING BACK THE OLD PICKLES RECIPE!
March 22 pickles were so diluted I did not get a beer, which I usually drink along with burger, garlic fries and cucumbers! :)
Overall, love you guys!
author: Meder M.

description: The vegetarian burger is good. Price is reasonable & service is quick. The place is conveniently on market street.the seating arrangement is huge but gets crowdy. The garlic fries are nice :) too oily though.
author: Madhusmita P.

description:
What a shame!  I've always seen these massive lines at lunch time for this place.  Went in around 11:30 ish and no line.

I got a Mini w/ Bacon, fries and soda.  My order took longer than it should have... it was probably the bacon because my 3 friends who ordered after me, each separately, all got their non-bacon burgers way before me.  The burger looked good, looked really good.  But the bread was too thick, the meat didnt have and depth of flavor and relied on the ketchup and bacon for flavor.  The fries are skinny and decent.  

Their shakes looked awesome and according to the little 6 year old sitting at the other table, he said it was better than ice cream!   So maybe next time I will come in for a shake but a shake only.  They do "spike" it with vodka for an extra $1.50

I noticed the long ass line as we were getting ready to leave and the cluster f*@# at the soda/ketchup/napkin/pickle station.  

I don't think I'd eat a burger here.  Just not my favorite.
author: Erika G.

description:
Awesome place! I have nothing negative to say about it. Long line to order but it moved fast. Food was ready about 5 minutes after ordering, and one of the better burgers I've ever had for under  $10! Also, it was really nice to be able to drink a soda from a glass at a "fast food" joint. 
I'm a fan, I'll definitely be back there again and again! 
p.s. really great garlic fries too!
author: Ed G.

description:
Someone told me they liked Super Duper burger more than In-N-Out.  I don't eat burgers, but I hear enough ooohs and aaahs about In-N-Out to get that it's a high praise.  

Unfortunately, no one offered any tips on their veggie burgers, which is what I ordered.  Fortunately, the veggie burger turned out great.  

I wasn't expecting the portion to be small though. After finishing the burger in several bites, I regretted not getting fries to go with it.  

The lemonade was big and tart.  Can't imagine anyone who isn't pregnant wanting to finish that whole cup.
author: Candice B.

description:
Probably the best value burger on Market Street. Nieman Ranch Beef freshly cooked to a delectable state makes this well worth the stop if you want a burger. I still prefer In-N-Out but this place has a slightly classier, upscale feel to it even though it is still a quick serve restaurant.

The garlic fries are also quite good though they are topped with Parmesan cheese (which is unique though I personally didn't care for it).
author: Victor W.

description:
$5 or more for a mini burger. But it's San Francisco and this is what businesses have to do.

Mini was not mini. Mini was a medium-small burger with lots of delicious filling.
The burger was tasty and the meat was juicy. I was so hungry I don't remember the rest of it but it was good enough that I just devoured the whole thing. You will not be disappointed. Next time I'm coming in here to try the shakes!
author: Elina L.

description:
A very comfortable 3.5 stars for Super Duper's second location (its original in the Castro), which is open, airy, industrial and drowned in a ton of natural light. Rounded up because they grill up a fatty, delicious burger. It was super juicy, so wonderfully aromatically beefy and fresh off the flat grill, and delicious between the soft artisan bun, toasted ever-so-lightly, and smeared with their signature SD sauce (a mayo mixture of some sort that does NOT contain Thousand Island (I know, right?) 2. On top of that, their soft serve ice cream is worth a try. It's organic, made in house, and came chock full of that churned-with-fresh-milk-on-the-spot taste. My only regret is that I didn't get it chocolate dipped, for decadence - next time!

Their portobello mushroom sandwich is decent, but passable. The mushroom was battered with a panko-like crust and crunchy at the edges and tasty enough, but the sandwich itself was a bit dry and missing some kind of delicious aioli spread (I'm obsessed with aioli on . . . like, everything). The fries are also tasty - skinny, just as I prefer them, but nothing special in the end. 

The regular super burger size is really hefty, and the mini (quarter pounder) actually suffices very, very nicely for a satisfying lunch, especially if you're planning on getting sides or leaving room for dessert. Prices are just right for the FiDi and for a super delicious, quality burger that'll fill you up, especially if you walk in with a burger-hankering.

Also, the pickles are fresh and made in-house. Yum!
author: Betty W.

description:
It may just be unconscious backlash to all the healthy eating in San Francisco, but I love burgers. Really love burgers. Sometimes all the health-conscious noshing I do gets to me, and I just have to bite into a big one.

And I've found my new go-to burger place to do this! I was completely skeptical of a chain called Super Duper Burgers, but now I'm SOLD. I've had lots of good burgers, but Super Duper Burger's simple concoction was quite possibly the most tender, well-cooked creation I've had outside of non-gourmet restaurants. The garlic fries were the perfect complement.

All this, with great service despite the incredibly long lines and business of the place over lunch. The line moved quickly, the guy at the cashier was chatty and greeted us with a non-harried smile, and our food was ready in less than five minutes. I look forward to being back and trying the other, hopefully equally "super duper" locations.
author: Denise B.

description: If you are looking for a great burger and fries, you have to stop in to super duper. Fresh food and its fast.
author: Elisa P.

description: The Mini burger was amazing. The meat itself is full of flavor.....The chicken sandwich was ok. But I would definitely go there again for the mini flavor.
author: Ankeen T.

description: Fantastic! I loved the mini burger. Just enough for me. The regular burgers are two parties. I love the pickles at the condiments bar!
author: Bill C.

description:
I'm sorry but for what this place offers (great burgers and beer I actually WANT to drink for only 4-bucks...aka Racer 5 IPA)... 

...the location (a part of downtown where I find myself choosing between sit-down, slow, tourist filled, unremarkable dining and fast food)...

...and the price ($8.50 gets you a DOUBLE patty which is kind a steal for 16 ounces of organic beef)...

...it deserves 5 stars. (we actually swung by the one in the Castro later that same night on our way to Booty Call Wednesdays at Qbar, but that's a different story)

I can see myself heading her before every Metreon or Galleria movie on weekends and grabbing in a pound of awesome organic burger for the cost of a small bland pop corn and a sugar-filled medium coke.

A couple of notes:

(1) I am a true carnivore, but I can't lie, their portobello mushroom sandwich is amazing. and it's equally amazing on top of a burger.

(2) yelpers who went to the soft opening night...those were NOT the 8 oz burgers so (a) stop complaining, you get a lot more for $6.50 and the mini burgers are the smaller (and cheaper) ones, (b) it was a free burger, I'm shocked you would complain about "quantity" with so much quality between the buns.

(3) a huge four dollar glass of Racer 5? um, Please Sir, can I have another?!?!?

(4) the melted Cambozola is to die for.

(5) as for the pickles (*someone commented on them being "different"), well they were awesome in my book and we totally attacked one of the open jars (contemplated offering them a $20 for the whole thing). They are homemade and the make them with pickles. I guess if you have grown up eating store-bought chemical-infused pickles, they might taste a little different.

(6) didn't try the bacon yet....but I inevitably drift to the dark side of the hamburger force on that one.

Seriously though, considering my options downtown and the fact that I'm a huge movie buff, i will be coming here a LOT this summer, probably using the "drive-by, friend-jumps-out, circle-down-to-2nd-then up-3rd or hide-in-an-alley" routine with a friend.
author: Mike V.

description:
Kinda overly greasy. Not a whole lot of burger places in the area, so I go there in a pinch, but it's usually  not my recommendation.

They do have beer which is kinda nice, and the complete package, but I've never had a super duper burger and felt great about it.
author: Christophe C.

description: Could have it every day! The burgers are so juicy and tasty!!! Goes well with the garlic fries
author: Vinh N.

description:
A coworker of mine in San Francisco, who happens to be my fast food buddy, has been raving about this place ever since it recently opened.  His tastebuds didn't disappoint.   It's good to see they got rid of the redundant Seller's Market and changed it up with something fatty.

I'm giving this place a solid 3.5, and i'm feeling generous thus the round-up.

The bad:  Lunch time line.  We bolted out of the office around 11:50am and made it to the line at 12:00pm.  It was already at the door when we arrived.  I'm used to lunch lines in New York, but not San Francisco.  Total wait time ended up being about 10-15 minutes.

The good:  The food.  The menu is pretty intense with the toppings you can add.  which makes it a pretty messy burger.  I went with the 8oz with super sauce, cheese, and a fried egg.  it comes separted, so you have to do the juggling act of putting it together.  

The burger is some of the best hamburger meat i've ever had.  JUICY!  Really Juicy!  The fried egg, oh yeah, damn good add on.  The bun could be a bit better.  It was the biggest disappointment.  Just seemed bland.  Regardless, the burger was pretty solid.  A good addition to the Market St, lunch scene.
author: Kyle W.

description:
Super Duper = Super Messy

First thing first, their regular burger is two patties, and their mini burger is one patty. Now that we've got that out of the way, I can properly review this place.

Every other Friday (pay day) my coworkers and I order our lunches from here.

Now something personal about myself, my greatest fear in life is dry chicken. But, my suggestion for all newbies is the Chicken sandwich. Why? Because it's amazing. Not dry, and the sauces are amazing, don't forget the bacon. Please.

The regular burger is good too, I always add an egg, which makes it ridiculously messy, but super yum.

I love the garlic fries, but with how filling everything is, I can never finish them.

Their shakes are great too, but I'm always torn between getting a milk shake or a Mexican coke. I mean come on... it's a Mexican coke.
author: Mindy T.

description: Okay, so after eating burger lounge and in n out a few more times.. I can go ahead and crown Super Duper Burgers as my favorite burger restaurant. I can't wait to get back to San Fran.. Oh how I miss you lol
author: Askia F.

description:
To me Super Duper is a step up above In and Out. You get a good quality burger but the patty is more substantial and greater quality (niman ranch burgers), but you do however pay a little more.

There is nothing fast about this food at all in both quality and speed. The wait for a burger can vary from 5 to 15 minutes. At least you know that your burger is nice and fresh. Their fries are thick cut with some tasty seasoning and are worth getting with your burger. 

They offer milkshakes and cookies here but usually after eating a super duper burger and fries, I probably wouldn't have enough room to comfortably fit anything else.
author: David C.

description:
A coworker recommended this place for a nice lunch. Not really into burgers, I declined and went elsewhere. My coworker brought Super Duper in for her personal lunch last week. The aroma filled the employee break-room, and it smelled heavenly!
I told her how awesome it smelled and she offered me a taste! It was absolutely amazing!

I went to Super Duper after worked and ordered a burger with garlic fries. The place is designed nice but was crazy busy. I waited and about 15 minutes later, I received my meal. I loved every bit of it! The price is great and the food is awesome. I definitely will go back soon, but give myself a little more time for the wait. 

Great Place!
author: Brandon J.

description:
The hype is real!  Run, don't walk, down Market to this place which I can only describe as hamburger heaven.  Cashier staff are great and don't bat an eye if you customize (I hate mayo).  Service is remarkably fast, even in the peak of lunch rush.  And when you bite into your burger for the first time, there is really nothing more to say.  Garlic fries as a side are highly recommended.  Check out the pickles, too.  BTW, if all burger places switched to real Cheddar cheese like SD has, the world would be a better place.

I have nothing left to tell you but SUPER DUPER SUPER DUPER.
author: Erik A.

description:
Visited this place twice now, once in November 2013 and the most recent was July 2014.  There are two levels for seating in this location, I usually end up seating at the top floor since its always busy (everywhere else is packed).  

The burgers are delicious, but my favorite are the Garlic Fries (with aged cheddar).  A must try when you visit.
author: Joyce K.

description: We were lucky enough to snag a table on the street level because we had a stroller with us. If not i probably would've suggested going to the one one yerba buena instead. The burgers were good, fries were good, and the oreo shake was good as well.
author: Johnny C.

description: Best burger I have had in a long long long time! Juicy and flavorful, didn't even need to add anything to the burger, that's when you know its a good burger! Pickles were okay, garlic fries were okay, but it may have been because the burger was so delicious I didn't care about the sides. Definitely a go to burger spot!
author: Nancy G.

description: Stopped here & ordered a burger, a chicken sandwich with avocado and aoli sauce, and fries on the side. While my friend's was hella greasy, my chicken sandwich was cooked and prepared to perfection...and it was huge. The fries and pickles were pretty good too. Staff were also very helpful and friendly. I guess the burger may have been a bad one, but I really liked this place.
author: Ashley O.

description:
So there is no question that San Francisco is engaged in a war on fast food. Jack in the Box on 1st Street and Del Taco on Market being two of the latest casualties. So Super Duper Burger represents the kind of *approved* fast food by the likes of mayor Ed Lee or supervisor John Avalos. All their favorite buzzwords are here: Organic, artisan, locally sourced, free range, sustainably farmed, compostable...

So besides feeling like you've walked into a Portlandia parody skit (even the name "Super Duper" has a retro, hipster, self-defeating tone about it), is it any good? Well, it's OK. Personally though, I'd rather have Jack in the Box and Del Taco back.
author: Mike B.

description: My friend and I came on a Friday night at around 8 pm. Boy, was it crowded! Well I wasn't very surprised considering it is dinnertime for people. Anyways, my friend and I ordered two super duper burgers and one order of garlic fries. After ordering, we had to wait awhile for the seats since there were a lot of people. Anyways, when our food came, the portions did not look too big for the price. The total was pretty expensive $$!!! The burgers were quite good if I must say. I was actually full from just the burger and the garlic fries were quite yummy. Overall experience, I would give it a 3-4!
author: Michelle C.

description: I'm in San Francisco for work and got a few different burger recommendations. Boy am I glad I stopped by Super Duper Burger on my walk from the office to my hotel! The vibe, ascetics and menu remind me a lot of Shake Shack in NYC. The burger was simple, but perfect. The patty had a lot of flavor and was juicy while the bun was toasted and just the right size for a perfectly even bread to meat ratio. And the garlic fries! Oh the garlic fries! If you like garlic, these are so for you. I've had garlic fries at other restaurants and they are always too oily. But even after a five minute walk back to my hotel, the fries were still crispy--an impressive feat after tossing them in oil and topping them with cheese. I hear their soft serve and shakes are quite good, so I'll definitely be back next time I'm in SF!
author: Sydney L.

description: I have been here many time but this time was horrible. My husband and I got the greasiest burgers of all time. We tried to blot them and that didn't help.
author: Maria D.

description:
Disapointed!
Restaurant and staff nice but there it stops.

Double burger was ok but bread to dry.

Single or smal burger was really boring, taste only bread and dry bread.

I did plan to visit the place for a few times during my seven days kn SF but after first visit it was enough.

My burger place is stil shake shack in NY.
author: Patrik D.

description: I bought the chicken burger with no cheese is really tasted great, I love there house made pickles they are simply awesome and the service was pretty quick. I would love to go back again and again!!!
author: Shyam N.

description: Had just arrived in San Fran and we were starving! This place more than hit the spot. Delicious burgers for a great price. Husband and daughter split a milkshake that was a big hit with her. Garlic fries were delicious!
author: Natalie D.

description:
The burgers are good.

The pickles are delish.

The choco-dipped vanilla cones are SO GOOD I CAN'T BEGIN TO EXPLAIN HOW DELICIOUS THEY ARE.  Mind you, I don't even have a sweet tooth.  I am not a huge fan of ice cream, and chocolate is alright to me, but MY GOD, THIS WAS WONDROUS.  IT BLEW MY MIND. 

Please. 

EAT THE CHOCO-DIPPED VANILLA CONE.  

Oh, and kid-size is plenty large. :)
author: Vivian C.

description: Stop here on the way go home from camping event. The menu is super huge with a lot of variety. I ordered super duper with jalapeño. So good. I love it.
author: Sofia B.

description: Love these burgers.  The service is fast and the guys behind the counter are usually pretty friendly.  Always feel like you get a lot for a fair price from these guys.  I've recommended it to my friends and no one has been disappointed yet.
author: Scott N.

description:
1 Year later and my craze over this place is over...but the food here is still pretty good.
I had an early lunch here today and ordered the chicken sandwich with cheese and bacon. I asked for light grilled onions and light on the chipotle aioli sauce which was completely ignored, it seemed they gave me double! Otherwise the sandwich was still good and filling. 
Would still recommend to try if in the downtown area but open to trying other burger places in the area also.
author: Miss H K.

description:
OMG. BEST BURGERS IN TOWN! Their bugers are super juicy and delicious! 

When I went, the line was short, but after I ordered the line got really long. The waiting time to for your food is pretty fast. 

The overall environment is pretty hipster and casual. There's outdoor, indoor and seating upstairs as well. You seat, get your own napkins (however much you need) condiments and drinks on the side by yourself. 

I ordered the Super Burger (8 OZ. 2 patties) with bacon/ alvacado and Garlic Fries. I think next time I'll order the Mini Burger (4 oz. 1 patty) since the Super Burger was pretty darn big and hard to eat. I did finish the gigantic burger because it was so DAM GOOD, but next time I think I would order the Mini Burger with a Rosted Portobello.

The only cons are that the burgers were really oily. My hands got super oily from eating, even when I used a ton napkins wrapped around the burger.  Also, the Garlic Fries were meh. I thought that the proportion was pretty small for the size. It was nothing too special.

But, overall I'd come back again :)
author: Ruhjeenuh Z.

description: The Super Burger is the 2 beef patties burger but where is the namesake Super Duper Burger? It must be the amazing Veggie Burger! This is the best vegan burger I ever had and probably ever will.
author: ND W.

description: The burgers are good and my husband enjoys their chicken sandwich. Don't leave without ordering their garlic fries and chocolate dipped vanilla ice cream cone!
author: H K.

description:
I tried these burgers and thought they were great!

The Cheeseburger was very good - the meat was full of flavor and juicy.  The nice amount of cheese made this even better.  The next time I'm there, I'm sure a Double Cheeseburger would be incredible to order.  While I thought the fries were just okay, I was really surprised by the Soft Serve - I'm usually not a fan, but they use real milk and other natural ingredients and the flavor really comes through...I'm sure these would help make great milkshakes.

Cool atmosphere too!

I'm so glad they opened a new location here...I'll be a frequent customer!
author: Ken G.

description: Not slap-yo-mamma kinda' good but pretty good burger. I like that they give you the option to put add ons such as a fried egg or mushrooms and the price is decent for a double patty burger.
author: Aina L.

description:
Yaay a new place to eat downtown!  Finally great prices + great food = Super Duper.  I had the veggie burger, fries, and choco dipped soft serve cone.  The veggie burger with hummus was delicious and the fries were extra crispy!  They also have this chipotle aoli dipping sauce which goes great with their fries.  
Their kid sized soft serve was more than enough and delicious!  Not to mention their homemade pickles were off the hook!    
I want to buy a whole jar!  Definitely making this a regular lunch spot and trying their garlic fries next time!
author: Janelle D.

description: $4.45 for a terrible breakfast sandwich is crazy,  very tiny, 1/4 stick of bacon, 1/4 cheese and an egg similar to mcdonalds egg mcmuffin.  No wonder theres no lines in the am.
author: Steve F.

description: Don't order the wine, they literally give you half of the amount of the cleaner and friendlier Super Dupers downtown. They turn out food quickly but all of the tables are always dirty in the evening. Also the girl that works the counter on Wednesdays obviously hates her job and life. If I can help it, I'll never come back to this one!
author: Brandy B.

description:
Heard about Super Duper on Refinery29 (http://www.refinery29.com/super-duper-burger-opens-downtown).  After reading about how this place only serves 100% natural free range chicken and super conscious with food values, I wanted to try it and coincidentally stumbled upon it after happy hour today.  

Ordered the Portabello Sandwich with the mayo-aioli sauce on the side.  The mushroom was breaded, but still juicy and flavorful - yum!  My friends loved the mini burgers too.  Definitely get the garlic fries - delicious!  :)
author: Christine A.

description:
This place reminded me of shake shack in NYC. The sign definitely didn't help either. I loved how the cheese melted on the burger making it stringy. The garlic fries are really good too. I was expecting garlic powder but it was actual garlic! Only con was that the fries were a bit greasy for my taste. I got the super duper burger, so it was a double patty. My god, the meat was juicy and oozing with flavor. Compared to shake shack this place is cheaper and the food is just as good. 

Don't skip out out on the garlic fries!!
author: Virginia Y.

description:
Superb dapper? Ok, not witty. 

There are more than enough reviews to vouch for Super Duper Burger, but I figure why not? Location? Great! Adjacent to the bar/lounge Local Edition, it's an ideal pit stop to satisfy some drunk hunger pangs. I ordered the mini which is actually a standard size burger, with cheese, caramelized onions, and everything on it and it was bomb. Less than 6 bucks I'll take this over in and out and five guy's any day. I didn't try the fries..will do next time.  Does the job when you're craving something red and meaty.
author: Alesia T.

description:
Delicious, but slightly disappointed at the fact that I paid for avocado and it was missing. I'm sorry, but if it takes 5 minutes to cook my burger, don't you think you'd get it right the first time? 

If you're going to charge above average for a burger, you better meet expectations.
author: Clarissa M.

description:
Burger was pretty good and the free pickles are a plus, but the fries were soooo greasy!!

I got a mini combo (burger, garlic fries and drink).  Around $12, not bad for the city and the burger was a decent price, but again....the fries were so greasy. It was the kind of greasy food that continues to affect you even the day after..

Might go back for a burger and free (unlimited) pickles, but never again for fries!
author: Jane L.

description: Awesome place to get a great burger and fries! Def go with the garlic fries as they are pretty tasty as well! #goodmuthafuckinburger
author: Rodney C.

description: I came here ages ago and maybe I was having an off day because even when I two-starred SD I still said the burger was juicy.  And that still stands true.  A Super Burger (i.e., double burger) with cheese and bacon is all a man needs in life to be happy.  Very clean, crisp fries (take note In-N-Out) with some pretty good dipping sauces, especially the Chipotle ketchup. My wife said this rivals, maybe even surpasses, Five Guys.  This is a verbal gold star I would never expect to hear her say, so that's saying a ton.  The service is great, too.  Very friendly cashiers, and very respectable managerial staff.  I saw them handling a ridiculous, aggressive guest with class and care for the surrounding guests.  And, of course, it's organic.  The cherry on top, or the fried egg in this case.  Mad love for Super Duper.  I'll be coming back frequently now.
author: Nick J.

description:
3.5 stars for the food, an extra bump up for the SPIKED SHAKES. 

my regular order: mini burger (4 oz), no cheese, with everything. might make it a combo for $8, which includes a drink and fries. then i go ape shit with the free pickles.

one time i had a spiked shake AND a homemade ice cream cone here. it tasted oh-so-right eating it, and quite another feeling an hour afterwards. my fault entirely.

yeah, it's greasy. wtf do you expect? but at least the veggie burger was above average as well, albeit a smidge pricey for what it is. i will stick to taqueria cancun's veggie burrito as my mainstay lunch option, tyvm.

overall, this area needs more fast and affordable lunch options and i welcome the addition.

tip: take a late lunch if you can. barely any line after the 1pm rush. 

thanks super duper!
author: Vanessa D.

description:
Too good to keep up standards.

Super Duper, when it first opened, was awesome because it was ridiculously good, clean, and price-worthy. I even have heard that they offered free ice-cream to customer who was have an argument over money with a friend while in a restaurant. The friendship sadly ended but the ice-cream remains a testament to SuperDuper's effort.

Nowadays, probably because of their quick expansion to the Marina and Downtown, lack of management skills (I have anecdotal evidence of this), and lack of staffing, I'm getting "warm" hamburgers and burnt buns, attitude from the employees when I complain, and a place that looks dirtier and dirtier every time I come back.

My story:
With my "for here" order, upon being given a compostable plastic cup (a one time disposable), I had to ask to get a glass glass (c'mon, guys, I am not being extra picky here -- this IS 2012 and San Francisco's Castro). But... that's not the main part of the story: when I complained about the "warm" hamburger, the employee suggested that I write a review on yelp because, like verbatim, "the only way to get the management to listen is to write on yelp."

I had hoped SuperDuper would grow into an accomplished hamburger place that San Franciscans could proudly claim as theirs. I'm sad to say that it looks like this place will turn into a sad hamburger place unless they clean up their act. And, no, I am not projecting on Valentine's Day.

UPDATE: 2/11/2013
I think they are pulling through their growing pains and are getting better and better. But nothing compared to the quality and freshness of the food and the conscientiousness in the service they provided to their customers when they first opened in the Castro three years ago.

BTW Organic free range chicken with Heinz mayo is completely defeating the M.O. of your place. Can you upgrade your guys' condiments?
author: Michael S.

description:
If you're looking for a delicious bacon cheeseburger and don't mind it greasy, this place is as good as it gets. 

Garlic fries were nothing special but the burger more than makes up for it.
author: Richard C.

description:
I received the MOST FACEBOOK COMMENTS EVER for my "mini-burger w/ cheese & egg." photo. I probably gave Super Duper an additional 28 customers that day. With that said...

This...is...the...most...delicious...burger...in...SF (That is not In & Out). 

After 1 year of opening in the Castro, their 2nd downtown location opened their doors to new corporate lunch-time crowd. AND WE THANK YOU! I had exhausted every other burger option in the area and was super excited to have SUPER DUPER join in. MMMM...eggs...on...my...burger. Can we say Food Coma? If you're looking for a healthier option, the chicken sandwich was pretty bomb too!

This place was was worth the hype...(see my Super Duper Castro review to understand what I mean) =D

Highlights: 
- Mini-Burger w/ cheddar cheese & egg
- Chicken Sandwich w/ swiss cheese.
- Vanilla/Chocolate Swirl Soft-Serve (If you're not stuffed yet)
author: Lisa T.

description: "Me I'm super fly. Super duper fly" is all I can think of when I hear the name. Super Duper is really good. Juicy burgers, fresh sweet pickle sides, homemade sauces, crispy thin garlic fries topped with cheese, and a soda fountain! My only regret was that I didn't get a chance to taste the shakes or ice cream.
author: Theresa D.

description:
I love the soft serve ice cream here.  Give me a nice chocolate vanilla swirl on a cone any day & I'm a happy camper.  I usually take it over to Yerba Buena Gardens & enjoy it on the grass.  It's Straus organic ice cream, too!

I haven't eaten the burgers at this particular location but you usually cannot go wrong at Super Duper.
author: Erin S.

description: The garlic fries are worth ALL the hype. My only warning is that they're pretty darn garlic-y so unless you're a big garlic fan like me, you may or may not enjoy it as much. Regardless, my goodness, I forgot about my burger when I started on the fries. Speaking of which, the mini burger was pretty good - not the best I've ever had, a bit smaller than I expected. Actually a lot smaller. Got cheese and grilled onions with it but didn't taste much of either. Next time I might just get two orders of fries. Yum...
author: Alison C.

description:
Overrated...the meat always tastes really over cooked and you need to wring out the burger before eating because it is really greasy.

Total bummer because I love a good hamburger and Super Duper is right around the corner from my work but alas I can't bare the thought of eating another poor excuse for a burger.

Skip this hot mess of a burger joint!!!
author: Cat A.

description:
Super Duper is a great burger place comparable to In-N-Out but a little better in my opinion. Not only do you have a few more options than a place like In-N-Out but you also have beer and vegetarian options. The staff is always friendly even when there's a line out the door which shows their professionalism and makes me want to come back. 

I've been here a few times and every time I've felt full and content with just a regular cheeseburger and some fries. The fries are nothing amazing, pretty standard but good at the same time. The garlic fries are good but mostly just the regular fries piled with garlic. The burgers are made fresh and have always been consistent when I've been. I like how they give you free pickles at the ketchup counter...it just shows they aren't stingy and any time I get something free without asking at a restaurant I give them an extra point in my imaginary book. 

The veggie burgers are just as good as the hamburgers, in a different way of course but juicy and comparable. Some places have dry gross veggie patties but not this place. 

If you feel like getting a fast, cheap, filling meal this place is for you. It beats any McDonald's or Burger King that's for sure. You can also have a nice beer from the tap or a chocolate dipped ice cream cone.
author: Ashley M.

description:
I think god accidentally dropped this from his secret stash of food. I don't know if it was because I have not eaten all day, or what, but this was the best burger I think I've ever eaten. It beats hall of flame, InNout, hell... It even beats all the burgers I ate during the burger brawl here few months ago.

I had the super burger which has two patties, and I added the bacon and the cheese for an additional cost (yeah that part sucks.) I also ordered some garlic cheese fries which might I add was AMAZING as well. The burger came out relatively smaller than I has expected. I was expecting something like the size of fuddruckers, but I got this small burger. 

This burger is Manny Pacquiao guys, small but packs a BIG punch. Go try it, WOW.
author: Wells Y.

description:
Soft serve?! Homemade pickles?! Egg in your burger?! Garlic fries?! I don't care, I loved this place and I will definitely be back. 

Love love love the entire atmosphere of the place and how they serve everything too! Even though I got the food to go, I would love to sit down and dine in. 

I also love how they give you the option of mini burger and kid size soft serve/frozen yogurt! (I'm a huge fan of half portions and small size stuffs since I just like to sample everything.) I got the mini burger with everything PLUS an egg! Talk about more protein! And their soft serve is absolutely DELICIOUS. It's thick and creamy unlike the ones you get at McDonald's or something... (I can't think of a better comparison.) And their pickles are delicious. I was just munching away on them while I was waiting for my food.

The burger though... I love how they cook all of their burgers medium rare. Best way to eat your beef! The taste however is just decent. I must agree, I have had better burgers. I'm not saying it's terrible, because it definitely is not, but it's not exactly something that will knock your socks off. And as for the garlic fries, it was decent. Not that super super good, but definitely not bad either.

Other than that, the pickles are a MUST as well as the soft serve! The inner child was dancing all night even after I finished my cone. Now I want to go get one...
author: Bonny C.

description: Expected more. Looks like they are ripping off shake shack but not as good. Copying never works. Had a double burger and fries.
author: Chris X.

description: I tried Super Duper Burger for the first time today. It was extremely busy, busier than expected with it being the 4th of July. I got the mini burger and garlic fries for 10 dollars. They have a mini combo which would be the same price (and you would get a drink) but it only includes the normal fries. I don't think that price is ridiculous seeing as it's much better quality than your normal fast food joint. There were no available tables inside so I had to sit outside. It was a beautiful day so I didn't mind but I can see why people would be upset over that. The burger was delicious, I love that you can add grilled onions for no extra charge. I was sadly a little disappointed in the garlic fries. The amount of cheese was almost overwhelming and definitely took away from the garlic taste. When I come back next time I'll ask for light cheese :) I love my garlic too much to take away from it! Overall, great experience. Friendly staff and a clean and modern establishment.
author: Brittany G.

description:
PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE OPEN A SUPER DUPER IN ORANGE COUNTY!!!

I've found my favorite burger ever in life! 

Everything (taste, portion, price, location, wait time, seating) was PERFECT.
author: Erika R.

description:
Super Duper Burger is super duper indeed. Dare I say, even better than in-n-out? Or is that utter blasphemy? ahah The interior is nice, clean, and urban looking and although it seemed to be packed my friends and I still found a table to sit comfortably at. But enough talk, on with the food.

-I ordered the Super Duper burger which is half a lb of meat (i asked mine to be cooked med. rare but they usually cook it medium as a default) and i added bacon and a fried egg for an extra $2.50. I also got grilled onions, jalepenos, onions, tomato, lettuce, super sauce and whatever else is included in that "everything" list. It was so delicious. 

-Garlic fries with month aged cheddar cheese? I don't even like cheese and this shizz was AMAZINGGG

-Strawberry super shake made wiht real strawberries? I literally felt like i was sitting amidst a strawberry field. IT WAS SO WORTH HOWEVER MUCH I SPENT ON IT

-Also the homemade pickles. They're very sour, a little spicy, and pretty sweet. They're not for everyone but I loved them

The reason why I'm docking a star is that everything in general was on the salty side. I was very very thirsty afterwards, so much that I forked over almost 5 dollars at the AMC for a bottle of water while I was waiting to see Man of Steel because I was that thirsty.
author: Jackie L.

description: I'm in town visiting from Dallas Tx. So I decided to give super duper a try. Unfortunately the over hyped burger joint fell short. The garlic fries had a lot of flavor but were cold. The burger was fresh and delicious. I've had better burgers before hands down. I think this place is just about average.
author: Jose G.

description: A pretty good burger that will cost you a fortune. But way better deal than most burger places. The lemonade was good.
author: Will D.

description: The burgers were huge but they were delicious. The pickles weren't great, and I wouldn't get the garlic fries unless you REALLY love garlic. They're pretty ripe. Not a whole lot of choice on the menu, just about five things.
author: Caroline C.

description: THIS WAS A MUST GO TO! The burgers were very yummy and moist! Their fries and side sauces are to die for and I AM A FOODIE! Also their homemade pickles were interestingly good and spicy after being soaked in a hot vinegar. Honestly one of the best burger places I've EVER been to (and I travel a lot).
author: Ryan N.

description:
I'm not a big fan of Super Duper. The prices are definitely a buck or two higher per item than I'd like given the quality and quantity of the ingredients. The fries especially are rather lacking in... number of fries.
