The burgers are definitely good, but they're not great. I'd put them above an average In-N-Out burger, but that's not saying much given the big price differential.

I'd recommend going early or late for lunch, as the lines go out the door.

If you're looking to satisfy a big beef craving... look elsewhere.
author: Bill H.

description:
We had to stop by here when we were passing by.  When we got there, the line was not that long.  By the time we ordered, the line became so long.  However,  with 3 cashiers, the line seemed to move very fast though.

We got the two sets of burger combo with garlic fries.  The burgers were juicy and very tasty.   my hubby loved the everything.  We also liked the pickles that they keep at the condiments tables.   However,  to me, both burgers and garlic fries were a bit too oily side.  While I was eating the burger, when I hold my burger tilted, a lot of oil came out.  Don't get me wrong.  The food was really good and we will come back but it would have been much better if the burger was a bit less oily.

Food: 4 stars
Service: 4 stars
Atmosphere: 4 stars
Overall experience: 4 stars
author: Jeannie L.

description:
I found this joint on while searching for a good burger in the Union Square area. So my gf and I take a walk down to Market St. and find this place. It looks like your average burger spot. We order and decide upon a couple burgers, fries, and lemonade. 

Lemme tell you a little something about this burger. BOMB. Clearly the freshest of ingredients with a fresh bun and AT A LOW PRICE. 

I would highly highly recommend this place for a great burger at a low price.
author: Aaron G.

description:
One of my favorite burger joints in SF. If you want the super duper experience, I recommend ordering a super burger with roasted portobello mushroom, bacon, and cheese on top. You will not be disappointed.

Despite their burgers having almost the same width as In n out burgers, Super Duper burgers are juicier and they're also finger-licking good. Their fries are a little overpriced for what you get, but you can't have a burger without 'em!

Great dining experience. I definitely get a hipster vibe whenever I walk in, maybe it's because of the studio lights and music. There's a small area for condiments (pickles, lemon slices, ketchup) and seating is always available for smaller groups of 2-4. If you're visiting SF for the first time and you are looking for a quick bite, this is the place to go.
author: Gordon Z.

description:
It is a pain to find parking at this location and it's ALWAYS packed, so seating is a bit difficult as well. Last time I was in there, it was a pretty hot day and plenty of people were stopping in just for the soft serve ice cream cones. 

Overall, though, I think it's worth it. I got a mini combo (1 patty with fries and a drink). One patty was enough for me, since I like a lot of toppings on my burgers... maybe too many since the girl at the counter kind of gave me the side eye :P Patty was perfectly cooked. 

I quite enjoyed the fries, even though I am not too much a fan of fries and the iced tea was yummy too! 

Probably the messiest burger I've ever had, but that is probably because I overdid the toppings, as usual! But the bun held up, which is a rare find for me at burger joints. Nothing worse than a soggy bun!
author: Nausheen H.

description:
ehh.. It was good, definitely not shake shack standards as others mentioned.. Although I am inspired to make my own homemade pickles now!

Anyway, to start they got both our orders wrong.. My boyfriend went twice to get his fixed. The first time was they put cheese on his burger (he's lactose).. Second time was omitting the bacon.

My order didn't have all the toppings. I guess when I said "everything, but hold the red onions" that means hold everything. oh well.. the egg was nicely cooked and still runny and the extra mushrooms that I ordered tasted good.

It was a greasy mess since we opted for no buns. I liked that they put the salad on the side with special sauce. 

If the orders were not messed up, I would have added a star.
author: Anne T.

description:
What does being vegan have to do with growing out your hair? Everything.

A few years i grew my hair out - it was legitimately long - shoulder length.
However - being a dude - and not being well versed in the arts of long hair management i got annoyed with how much it was getting in the way, and about 2 months into it, changed it into a (sort of) mohawk, and later shaved it all off and kept it that way for a solid year.

A few months ago, after reading The China Study (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_China_Study_%28book%29) I decided to become Vegan (for the purposes of this story). Not being well versed in the arts of cooking delicious vegan food, two weeks into it I decided that I cant give up eating things that used to have eyes, especially burgers, at least not until i learn how to make tastier things that can be made without stuff that had a mom (like the sushirrito vegan rolls).

And i decided that if im going to eat meat - it had better be really good and worth it.

Super Duper's super burger w/ cheese is great. One was not enough. If you're a burger connoisseur that's almost all you need to know. 

Pickles - which are home made at sd, and are available in the jars in the condiment islands are also top notch, crispy, sour, and a bit salty - come in quarter slices. Fries are not too shabby either.

SD claim to source their beef from Niman Ranch, that's definitely a step in the right direction and is reflected in the flavor, but there are more impressive beef purveyors than Niman (especially after Bill Niman's departure http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2009/02/21/MNHM15ME01.DTL).

Having said all that - i look forward to trying the portabella sandwich and other selections, like the chicken sandwich..
author: Oleg H.

description:
I had heard about SDB from my son, who used to live out here in CA, but had not checked the Yelpers input until after I went. I thought that the only way t truly experience the place would be with the full size (2 patties) burger and added the bacon, but not the cheese, and "everything" (lettuce, red onion, tomato). I had to try the garlic fries, and gave in to a strawberry shake when I found out that they do their own strawberries from scratch.
When my buzzer coaster went off and I went to get my order, I knew I was in for a treat. The smell coming off of the garlic fries was amazing and the burger looked great. I got some pickles - which were homemade. 
The burger was as great as it looked. The lettuce was crisp, the bacon maybe a tad undercooked for my taste, but the meat was the hero of the show. It was a coarse grind, not overly compressed, and medium rare, as requested. The garlic fries were GARLIC fries. Some Yelpers have complained, but I loved the fresh garlic flavor that permeated the fries. It was not a huge portion (like 5-guys), but with all the extra on top, it was perfect. Whatever garlic they had leftover must have been in the pickles. They were a really good homemade garlic dill, maybe not as much snap as the ones we make at home, but for a burger joint, they were pretty darn good. The strawberry milkshake was a super dessert, and as promised, the strawberries were "real." 
Definitely a place to go for a quick-and-delicious.
Total for a VERY filling meal = $18.49.
author: David R.

description:
Arrived around 1pm, and my friends and I were debating leaving because the line was almost out the door. I'm glad we ended up decided to wait, because the line went by quickly and we were even able to find a place to sit down. The super burger was a classicly good burger, the garlic fries complemented it really well. 

If I had to compare, this place reminded me of a west coast version of Shake Shack!
author: Sarah L.

description: This place is great. My second visit here to try the portobello mushroom burger and the spiked cookies & cream milk shake. We just beat the afternoon rush at 5:20pm and the place is packed this Friday. The spiked milk shake was extra refreshing with the vodka shot in it. The portobello mushroom burger was good enough to eat without ketchup although I do recommend their chipotle aioli on it as a rule. They still offer the free pickles and the service is very efficient from order to pick up. I saw the chocolate hand dipped ice cream cones and I've already made a mental bookmark to come back to try that next week. The only reason they don't grab 5 stars is because I always ending up spending more than I want to here but other than that this is a good 4-4.5 stars.
author: Norris T.

description: Everyone in SF raves about these burgers so I had pretty big expectations going in- and they were not only met, but exceeded!!!! The burger was seasoned and cooked perfectly, juicy and delicious. The garlic fries were freaking great. The pickles on the condiment bar are mind-blowing. Such a great meal and I can't believe it was so inexpensive! My little side note is that their regular burger comes with two 4oz patties which ended up being a bit too much for me so I think next time I'll go for the mini which I believe comes with just one patty. Really really tasty and wonderful! Oh, and the staff was awesome!
author: Rachel M.

description: Cholesterol overload!  The burgers are very juicy and flavorful, but a tad bit oily.  I would come here on the fatty days.  Don't get me wrong, I'm a burger fan.  But I wouldn't eat this everyday like how I would eat burgers at other places.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I didn't understand the hype about these burgers, after all a  burger is a burger.....boy was I wrong, I don't know what they put in their burgers to make them delicious but they are amazing and worth lining up for!
author: Elzabeth G.

description:
Burger was okay. The bun was fine, but not my thing. The meat was sort of average. 

Pricing was what you'd expect for their target demographic, but I was still sort of sad with the lack of food. 

Milkshake was way too small for the cost. Malt would be worth it if I had double the volume. 

Plain fries were okay, but nothing special. 

No real reason to come back.
author: Elwin M.

description: Last night, my husband and I ordered 2 mini burgers and garlic fries to go. The mini burgers have 4 oz patties, so if you don't have a big appetite, they are big enough for an adult to eat. The burgers were really well done, crispy on the outside and juicy inside. We got ours topped with cheddar cheese, grilled onions, lettuce, and tomatoes. We asked for the sauce on the side, but they forgot it. They have homemade pickles, but they are sweet pickles, not the salty tangy type that go well with burgers. By far, the best part of the meal was the garlic fries. Even after a trip back to our hotel room, they were SUPER crispy and the garlic flavor was powerful. How do they infuse so much garlic flavor into their fries without them getting soggy? I will definitely be back for some more of those fries!!
author: Terri D.

description:
It seems to be a pretty busy place, or at least it was when my friends and I got there. My cashier was super friendly. He said he had just moved to SF from North Carolina [?] maybe it was North Dakota, not sure. Anyway, he totally brightened my time there. I was pleasantly surprised to find that my friends [who had another cashier] also had a really, really nice cashier. So customer service: A++

I got a super burger with the lettuce, tomato, jalapeno peppers, grilled onions, and pickles. I couldn`t really taste the latter three ingredients, so I looked and there was only like one or two of each. Also, the patties were a tad on the greasy side. The garlic fries, however, were amazing. Fresh garlic on top, mmm. 

They also make their own pickles, which were okay. I really wanted to try the organic ice cream too, but I was trying to be good, so I didn`t. On the other hand, I`m likely to come back someday, so I can wait (:
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Seriously I am tourist & I politely told the cashier I was new and She just looked at me. So as a regular customer walking in and seeing the menu I order a cheese burger combo and a strawberry shake. Tell me why when my buzzer went on and I go pick up my food my strawberry shake is in a glass and my food was to go !?! I didn't mind so I took it upstairs. As I took a bite I noticed my burger was med- rare & so I go back down and I talk to the "manager" and I made it seemed like I was an idiot of not knowing they make their burgers med/rare. So I told him I was already upset. He didn't care what so ever. NO GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE ! & I never write reviews but this really upset me as a tourist.
author: Aline P.

description:
I was looking for a good burger up near the financial district while the office one day and came across Super Duper Burgers.  Trying to avoid a huge rush I waited until around 1:30 before going there.  I was really surprised to still find a line that was queued up all the way to the door (and this place is pretty deep).  Luckily, I decided to just stick it out because the line moved very quickly given how many people were in front of me.  

I ordered a combo deal that they had going and upgraded to the garlic fries.  They have some great choices of additional free toppings and if you like spicy, the jalepenos they have here go great with the burger.  After I ordered I grabbed some of the complimentary pickles that they offer (which were pretty freaking good) and grabbed a seat at the little counter by the kitchen that they have setup which works great if its busy and you're on your own.  The burger was pretty good but I think the garlic fries stole the show.  If I hadn't gotten the jalepenos on the burger, I think I might have been a little disappointed with it.  Definitely get some of the additional toppings to give it some character.  

The mini burger (single patty) is a little small but if you're just doing a quick lunch and don't want to be in a total food coma all day then this is a pretty good option.  All in all, it was a well cooked burger with some great extra toppings, delicious garlic fries, and the free pickles are a great added bonus.
author: Matt J.

description:
Awesome! Thats all i can say. Try it out and you might become addicted to these great burgers. Every time we come to San Fran, we absolutely have to eat here. Its like we crave it, when we know we are close.
 In& out does not even come close to this. Seriously give it try!
author: Adrian Z.

description:
Garlic fries were limp and not very good.  The burger was mediocre at best.  Nice touch having the pickles available near the ketchup.

Overall, could do much better with a burger elsewhere.
author: Melody J.

description: We were really looking forward to this after reading the reviews and were totally let down. To start we placed our order and made our preferences for toppings which were completely disregarded. To add to that, he buns were not special, really only Burger King level of quality. The meat patties were good quality beef, so they couldn't mess that part up. The pickles were gross and wilted, not crisp. I wish I would have tried this place in its prime, or maybe another location, but to say that the execution here is off is an understatement. There are better burgers in town. But the milk shake was pretty good.
author: Deno R.

description: This place is super hip and super delicious. I love the second story seating. The food is delicious and reasonably priced!
author: Austin F.

description:
Situation
- Lunch with co-workers
- Ordered a chicken sandwich (since I don't eat beef)

The Good
- The chicken sandwich was just okay
- The staff is helpful

The Bad
- Small portion size for the chicken sandwich
- Long wait time to get food

Overall
- Not a good spot if you want a chicken sandwich
author: Dipesh G.

description: Very good burgers and even surprised their veggie burger was really good and great garlic fries and soft serve.  Family SF trip was a hit with the kiddo with this little stop.
author: Chelle P.

description: I love this place, have eaten here several times for late night snack and breakfast. I get the veggie burger, which seems to be a homemade patty made with oats and veggies. I hold the hummus though, which I feel doesn't go well on the burger. A combo with fries and a drink is about $9 or $10, which isn't too bad in SF. I've also tried the breakfast egg and cheese sandwich, which is a cheap quick meal if you are in the area and need some breakfast.
author: Sara R.

description: Nicest, hardest working staff for a food joint! Everyone was super attentive even though they were very busy 15 minutes before close. Great experience over all.
author: Ryan D.

description: Best burgers in the city. Fries also quite good and shakes are 1st class. Probably the best value in the city for quality food.
author: J D.

description: Good food. Couldn't find anything better in SF searching through all the yelp reviews. Family friendly.
author: Narjes M.

description: What can I say that would explain how delicious this burger is?  So fresh tasting!  I mean com'on they make their own freakin' pickles!
author: Bill M.

description: The Garlic fries were on hit! A definetley must get for you garlic lovers who can't make it to Girloy. The burger was good also l, one star off due to it being 10 times greasy then any other super duper location I ever been too. I still will be back if the mission closes earlier for me, but damm drain those suckers a bit!
author: Jojo C.

description:
I'm so happy to see a non-fast food burger place open up downtown where we can have lunch during the work day! 

The moment I saw the faux ice cream cone outside advertising organic soft serve, I was SOLD. I knew I HAD to come in and check it out. 

The line during the lunch hour is very long and admittedly, doesn't move too fast. And everything is made to order (which is appreciated) because it's freshfreshfresh, so once you place your order, it's another 10mins or so before you get your food. 

We ended up ordering a burger, fries, dipping sauces, AND the chocolate dipped cone (MY FAVE!). For lunchtime fare, the 4oz burger is plenty (esp. if you are going to eat fries AND an ice cream cone), but they are a bit greasy. Fresh, but greasy. The fries are, dare I say, similar to that of in-n-out but crispier mmm! The dipping sauces were not impressive, I think they should just be offered as standard burger/fries accoutrements and not a separate order. 

My favorite part is that they have really done their due diligence in making the dessert part of your meal a logistical dream! You wait in line and place your order WITH your dessert. But they'll give you the option to serve you the food first, then you can come back and pick up your soft serve/dipped cone after you've finished eating. Genius! I love their strauss organic soft serve and LOVELOVELOVE that they offer chocolate dipped cones so I am completely sold. Don't ever take the soft serve away!

Welcome to the neighborhood; I'll be back for sure!
author: Stella C.

description:
If you want a good burger that comes without "secret" substances/ingredients that subpar fast-food dining offers, then this place is worth a try!

I've come here on a few occasions, and so far I found the following to be quite delicious:
-Veggie burger w/ hummus & cucumbers, + avocado
-Chicken sandwich with chipotle aioli + avocado
-Garlic/french fries

Given the location, lunchtime can get pretty busy in terms of finding where to sit after you order. Regardless if it's busy or not, the wait is usually about 10 or so minutes for your food.
author: Loriel L.

description: The food is amazing !!! The atmosphere there is great too the only thing I didn't like was that there wasn't enough seating to accommodate every one coming for their good food. Other than that it was great
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Really good burgers! The patties are juicy and they're a decent size. I ordered a mini burger because I knew I wouldn't be able to eat the 2 patties in their Super Duper burger. I added cheese and an egg to my mini, and it was incredible! The egg on top of the patty was definitely the highlight for me. I loved the combination of runny yolk and medium patty. 

Not sure if I can say that I would choose this over In N Out (which is always my standard of burger comparisons), but it comes close.
author: Anna N.

description:
SO, I finally came in here after hearing all the hype about it.

Line: long but moved pretty fast. Menu is not too long so you make up your mind pretty fast. Debated mini burger (1 patty) vs SUPER burger (2 patties).. since the mini one sounded like it'd be too small.. but it actually made me full. anyway, more on the food later.

Venue: place is self-serve and even with all the traffic in this place, they manage to keep it clean & orderly. LOVE IT. also looks hella industrial in here and lots of seating. +1 for serving wine + alchy in here!

FOOOOOOOOOD~
Burger: $4.50 + 0.50 for cheese. relatively cheaper than i thought considering this place is downtown and super popular.. it LOOKS kinda small but it will fill you up (or it did for me at least.. lol) the ingredients are fresh and super flavorful.

Pickles: FREE and self-serve. home-made and sooooo bomb. you must get a full tray of these. i don't like the grocery store pickles (too sour), but they got the right formula here in regards to taste, acidity, and texture.

Fries: normal ones are gooooooood. prob one of the better fries i've had. very potato-ey, have good flavor and crispy. didn't make my fingers that greasy. the garlic fries are HELLA BOMB, and garlicky, just like i like 'em! it's like they fry it in garlic oil, pop of flavor all up in yo mouth.

Lol.
author: Emily C.

description:
With my co-workers raving about it all the time, I thought it would be a lot more impressive than what I expected. 

The restaurant is definitely popular, with a huge line out the door during lunch hour. My co-workers and I were lucky enough to make it to Super Duper just before the madness hit. 

Food: I ordered a mini burger (which is essentially the same size as a regular burger, only 1 patty) and added on everything except for peppers (cheese was an additional fifty cents) and a chocolate milkshake with fresh strawberries blended into it. The food was decent for the price; it's about $6 for the burger and about $5 for the milkshake. The burger was nothing too special, and I personally think it was a little bit on the dry side. The shake however, was really yummy; I like how they use Straus milk for their shakes, and it was not thick at all--definitely drinkable from a straw. I could really taste the fresh strawberries in the shake, and it wasn't too sweet as most milkshakes are. Nice balance with the burger, and the shake came in a pretty large cup. 

One unique thing that I really enjoyed about this place was the fact that Super Duper makes its own pickles; you can add as many pickles as you like by the beverage fountain. Being the pickle fanatic that I am, I scooped out a good amount, and the pickles complemented my food nicely. 

Service and ambiance: Service was quick, which I appreciated. By the time I ordered, I only had to wait 7 minutes or so to get my food. It gets pretty loud there since there is a lot of people, and sometimes it can be hard to find a seat. 

Overall, it was a nice place to grab lunch with my co-workers during our break, but I don't think I would come here on my own or with friends if I don't have to. I feel like there are definitely other places to try in the Bay Area and Super Duper didn't impress me to the point where I would come back again and again.
author: Andrea X.

description: Super Fucking Duper!  Yes mam.  They are that good and the staff is exceptionally proficient and nice.  I love the burgers, but the chicken sandwiches make me keep coming back.  Throw some bacon on that bitch and booty!
author: Chris F.

description: Pretty amazing, great burger amazing garlic fries and ice cream swirl to top it off at the end. Good quick food for touring the city.
author: Kristine T.

description: I love Super Duper. Fresh ingredients. Great prices. This particular offers breakfast sandwiches. YUM.
author: Melissa S.

description: Stopped here with a buddy before the auto show a couple of weeks ago. Pretty busy, but the food came quickly. I ordered the chicken sandwich and we split an order a fries...everything was tasty and made how we asked, so no complaints on my end. Maybe I'll come back for a burger sometime, although I generally try to avoid red meat.
author: Michael K.

description: Super Duper is easily one of the best burgers in the entire Bay Area.  My only complaint about this place is their pickles, but it's still not enough to take a star away.  Thank you for existing, Super Duper.  You rock my world.
author: Kristen F.

description: The bacon cheese burger is actually Super Duper. Fun atmosphere also. I plan on getting some ice cream for dessert!  Cool place, I'll be back.
author: John A.

description:
Seriously, this place should be called SUPER DUPER DELICIOUS!

Went here today for the first time w/ my brother and I was blown away.  At first it was a bit daunting because the line hit almost to the front door (it was so long), but i figured if these people in front of me are willing to wait, then there must be something to it.  Here is why I loved this place:

1.  The Manager of the place (who was adorable), walked up and down the line passing out menus and ensured everyone that it was only a 7 minute wait to get to the front of the line.  HE WAS RIGHT!  Don't be fooled by the long lines people.

2.  The food was not only SUPER good, but it was super affordable.  For a 4 oz burger it was going for about $4.50.  And come on, in downtown SF, who can say they have had a SUPER DUPER yummy burger for less than $15?!  The size was perfect.  It was just enough burger to fill me up.

3.  The offered garlic parmesan fries.  Another all time favorite of mine.

4.  Best for last - whatever that special sauce or spread was, it was yummy!   NOM NOM NOM!  :)

Seriously, you can not go wrong with this place.  EVERYONE TRY IT ASAP!
author: Marylouise R.

description: I went to this Super Duper Burger tonight with my family and had the best experience with one of their employees! My 6 year old daughter went to get an ice cream cone and was standing in line (she was the 4th person in line) when an employee who was working the floor approached her and took her to the front of the line and helped her pay and got her the cone himself! It touched me so much to see someone go out of his way to help a little kid! His name was Mike and he is an example of the type of people we need more of in this world! Thank you again, Mike!
author: Melinda G.

description: Definitely like the customizable burger menu.  Did two mini burgers and tried to add different toppings on both.  Don't forget to add on the egg!  Milkshake was pretty good too.  Maybe the best burger in SF???
author: Derk S.

description:
+ really juicy burgers
+ veggie burger is AWESOME (get it with avocado)
+ they have fried egg as an extra topping!!
+ all the pickles you can eat!
+ milk shakes
author: Sherry L.

description: Food was delicious, recommend the garlic fries and the super burger.  Soft serve was nice at the end of the meal!
author: Joseph K.

description: This is a really good choice if you're looking for a good burger and some unique fries. I got the garlic fries with the the cheddar cheese.  They say the cheese is cured for 6 months. This may have been my favorite part of the meal.  They may have gone a little heavy on the garlic but they were very good. Next time I may have them got light on that. The burger was juicy and cooked medium. Very tasty and highly recommended.
author: April S.

description: Kind of pricy. Better than In-N-Out, worse than Split Bread, all of which are not as good as Shake Shack or Five Guys. The burger was dry. The cookies and cream shake was watery.
author: Assaf G.

description: This review is NOT for the food. The food is great. Customer service at the cash register from the blonde on a Sunday afternoon during Bay to Breakers however was terrible. When I asked if they had a wheat beer, she said no and didn't recommend anything. Not only did she not realize that Hefeweissen is a wheat beer, she treated customers like idiots. I have worked in the food industry and customer service is your job. It is a shame that a good place like this has employed someone like her.
author: Brandy H.

description: Cheaper, yummier, and faster than Shackshack burger and fancier than In n out. I really liked it! Shake was good and mini burger was good enough one meal with fries. Good place.
author: So Young P.

description:
Full disclaimer, I'm a REAL burger fanatic.  Imo, it always comes down to the meat being fresh not frozen hockey put..  

Now, what I like about Super is that the meat seems fresh, definitely not a hockey put.  However, its really oily, which I don't mind, hey more fat for building testosterone :)  The toppings are fresh and the sauce does make the burger complete.  The interesting thing is that the sauce is very similar to a Big Mac sauce (aka Thousand Island).   The fries are pretty much identical to In-N-Out, which I'm not a fan of.  From a price point, there meal deal for a Super Duper (two patty burger) burger, small drink, and fries at $10 is really good, especially for being in Union Square.   

Overall, its a decent burger, not great, not bad and really close to work which makes it convenient; also its hands down better than Bistro Burger (for all of you that work in the Financial District).  Now if you want the best burger ever, you got to go to Val's in Hayward.  The burgers are just amazing, not far behind would be The Counter in Santana Row (everything is custom order, but the meat is perfectly cooked and served up to 1lb).

Note:  Super Duper get super busy by noon, so get there by 11:30 am.
author: Mike M.

description:
I'll just get right to it: The quality of the ingredients is what this place is about.  Don't let anyone tell you it's like In-N-Out - it's far better.  The portobello mushrooms are a tasty touch.

I would definitely go back, however, there are a few atmospherics that prevent it from getting 4 or 5 stars:

- The line.  It's long.  (The free mini-fry sample was a nice antidote)
- Waiting to have your name called at the counter.
- Getting a table (no tables are within earshot of the counter, making holding a table a little tricky).
- Table arrangement is awkward.
- On behalf of my friend: there's no ranch.

Bonus: The tray liner art is rad.
author: Cliff C.

description:
A burger place thats like a cross between St. John's and In-N-Out. Or like Habit burger I guess. :P

Came here around noon and the place was packed! The location was pretty big but it was just so darn packed! Then again, it was located near union square on a nice sunny day so what do you expect? lol. Anyways, since I don't eat beef, I got the chicken sandwich with aoili in it with the free extras like pickles, grilled onions and lettuce. I also got a side of fries too since I just love fries. 

The sandwich/burgers came out in about 10 minutes and we started chowing down. My sandwich was BOMB.COM! It was super fresh and it felt like I was in a Carl's Jr. commercial eating one of their burgers because of how messy my sandwich was! The fries were a nice touch to the meal too. They were still steaming hot and crispy from the friers and tasted so good with my sandwich.

I really wish they had one of these where I lived. I'm tired of being dragged to In-N-Out and getting the grilled cheese sandwich since that's the only thing I can get T_T. But since they don't I guess I can visit the city more often! :P

PS: they have soft serve ice cream and coke in glass bottle here too! weeeeeeee! Along with vegetarian sandwiches!
author: Anna H.

description: I thought the burgers were great. I got it to go, and it was still delicious, so I bet it's even better if you eat in. It did take quite a long time, but it was still worth it and delicious. I love the pickles that you can take on the side - adds a lot of character and taste. Not overly salty like 5 guys. Doesn't get much better at that price!
author: Alex K.

description: A friend of ours recommended this burger joint to us so we decided to make it our last meal in San Fransisco. We ordered the Mini Burger (single beef patty) combo (comes with fries and a drink) with extra bacon, and their Super Burger (double beef patties) with extra cheese (two slices). Atmosphere was good, service was friendly and quick. There were no empty tables when we finished ordering but the turnaround was pretty quick; most people seemed to eat really fast and leave quickly. You can pretty much choose your own drinks after you ordered as they will give you an empty cup and you'll have to fill it up at the drink station (soft drinks, water, ice tea). So burgers were good but not as great as burgers we had in other places such as New York. The Super burger was oily so it was messy to eat. Mini burger was good; the bacon made it good! Homemade pickles had a lot of zing! If you've ever tasted Katz delicatessen's pickles than think of these as double the sourness! Other than that; it was good but not great. Wish it was more memorable since it was our last meal in SF after all!
author: Fransiska A.

description: All the ingredients were fresh and everything was delicious! The garlic fries are soooooo good! Make sure you have gum after! Haha
author: Jenn R.

description:
I am ruined.

I used to think In-n-Out had good hamburgers. I used to think the Holy Grill had good fries.

I don't think I can ever love another burger now that I've come here.

The only thing not awesome about this place is that they don't serve their soft serve ice cream in waffle cones. I have deducted .001 stars for that.

These people that are whining and deducting stars because they're a couple bucks more than a McDonald's burger should be forced for a year to eat the chicken paste they make Chicken McNuggets out of. Their lack of taste deserves nothing more.

Seriously, these are good f'ing burgers. The Four Cheese burger is to die for if you like cheese. And, yeah, the garlic fries are awesome, awesome, awesome.
author: Jim T.

description: This place always have long lines and crowded. I had the mini burger meal. It was tasty. Better than The Habit Burger. But In and Out is still my favorite burger joint.
author: Jingle A.

description: Wow. The hype is real. Best burger I have ever had. Got the "super" with everything and it's no joke. Sorry in n out...but this burger is first rate! The meat was fresh and cooked just right. The fixings were fresh and crisp. This is how a burger should be. Got a burger from 4505 a day ago and that wasn't even close to super duper. Definitely a place to go if you are a burger fan!
author: Phil O.

description: I wasn't hungry but the smell of this place just made me come in. Great burgers and pickles!
author: Lauren F.

description: late night burgers fries and shakes- too goo.  Chicken was perfectly seasoned and juicy.  shakes were not too sweet and the chocolate was so good!  Salad was blah but I'm an idiot for ordering salad at a burger joint.
author: Jones D.

description:
This burger hits the spot. Soft bun, good tasty juicy organic burger. Right up there with Burger Lounge of SoCal and Shake Shack in NYC in the newer upscale burger segment market. 

Love the "just right" mini combo. All the fixins and bonus pickles at the condiment counter. Garlic fries were nice but nothing spectacular. 

Quick and efficient service. You can't go wrong popping in here when you've got some burger cravings.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Been walking by this place for a couple of days now.  The wife thought it was a West Coast Shake Shack due to the lettering.  But it's just SUPER DUPER BURGER.  

I grabbed a 4oz burger with cheese and the works (Grilled onions on that, please!).  The burger was medium and the super sauce was just perfect.  The ratio of bun to burger was a little much, so I left the top off.  I also upgraded the fries to the garlic fries with a little shredded cheddar.  Not too garlicky though.  Needed more of a kick.  

Self serve home made pickles at the drink/condiment counter!  The burger wrapper was kitschy and fun to look at.  

Guess it's more of an A-OK experience than SUPER DUPER....
author: Caesar R.

description: Seriously FUCK this place -- Food poisoning is not cool, especially on my first meal in San Francisco. Reported to the health department, BEWARE if you eat here.
author: Kurt N.

description: My favorite burgers in the area! I love the fries with the dipping sauces and shakes too.
author: boo d.

description:
Never knew about this place, so glad I found out.  Much props Yelpers, really!!!!

Every year, my boyfriend gives something up one food/cuisine for the new year.  Last year it was fast food and french fries. (This year is pasta/italian =( grrrrrr!!!!) Ahhhh idk how he does it but he does.  So yesterday, being it was the 1st of the new year he wanted to ring in the new year by indulging in what he gave up.  I didn't particularly choose this place because of its fries though.  I figured if he wanted fries, we would have to eat burgers for dinner and that is what we did!  

The burger that I had was only a 4 oz but a really meaty and filling 4 oz.  I've been to other burger places where a 4 oz patty is just not enough to fill me.  Not exactly sure what made it filling this time but it was a pretty tasty, juicy burger!  I added and egg and cheese to make it a winner and it was!  My boyfriend had the double patty one and he enjoyed it.  Though he did complain his was greasy then again he added bacon soooo maybe that's what made it greasy.

I topped off the dinner with a "kid-sized" chocolate dipped organic vanilla ice cream.  Yuuuum!  Yes, I'm lactose intolerant but that did not stop me!!!! Haha overall, hands down one of the burger joints that I will definitely be coming back to.  Minus the dessert, we got away with paying less than $20 for dinner.  Considering that we spend a bit more usually especially for dinner, my wallet is getting fatter already =)


I WILL BE BACK SOON!!!!!!!!!!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description: This burger was the best burger I have ever tasted. Period. Friendly staff, quick moving line, awesome garlic fries and a delectable vanilla milkshake. Mmmmhm. I want to go back to San Francisco just to eat here.
author: M. J.

description: Holy cow this burger plowed into number one spot on my list of best burgers! The quality of the meat is super duper amazing! Everything tastes fresh!  Good pricing for what you get! Fills you right up without feeling too stuffed. ( I ordered the mini)  I'd definitely return here! The staff is very friendly. Very clean place and kind of has a European style look with the second floor seating, neat condiment stations too..
author: Martha E.

description:
Yum!! I got the mini burger, added cheese and bacon, and put all the free toppings on them! The jalapenos definitely gave it a kick. You have to add it...brings it to another level. Everything just kind of melts in your mouth when you're eating...messy don't care.

Got the garlic fries as well and they are VERY generous with the cheese and garlic. LOVED IT. A great complement to the burger.

I love that this is a chain...means more places to hunt this down!
author: Kelly T.

description:
I actually found out about the free burger happy hour a few hours before the promotion this afternoon after I was dismissed from jury duty. After a quick Yogen Fruz fix at Four Embarcadero, I walked to Super Duper thinking that a line would form around the block like the iPhone lines. Luckily it wasn't that extensive but only up to the right side of CVS/pharmacy. The wait was probably about 15-20 minutes but it was worth it.

The free burger was about the size of the frozen chicken breast sandwiches at Costco but the comparison is in no way related to the quality of the burger. I was with a friend and when we ordered the burger with the works and cheese, it took about 5 minutes before two wrapped burgers plopped onto the silver tray. At first glance, it seemed like the tray was very lonely, missing fries and a beverages but we opted not to get fries for $2 and soda for $2. From eyeing other tables, the fries look promising. Soda, well...high fructose corn syrup can only get stuff your system (bleh). 

The ambiance of the cafe/dark Jamba Juice-esque interior is spacious but on a peak lunch hour, seating may get competitive. I wanted to sit upstairs just to get a better view of the place but didn't. 

The other parts of the menu included Straus soft serve, smoothies, and other stuff too. Check the pictures for the menu boards! There is also Honest Tea and other soft drinks that are grab-and-go.
author: Dominic T.

description:
Meh. I ordered a super burger with everything on it plus jalapeños. The jalapeños didn't add any flavor and the burger was too oily. Also the special sauce didn't have much taste. The burger didn't taste especially good, something like what a burger would taste like off of a BBQ grill in my backyard. Plus the burger and fries with no drink were over $10.

The saving grace: garlic fries were pretty good though and I had a sip of my friends vanilla shake which was delicious.
author: Wilson T.

description: Strictly for the garlic fries:  rich, subtle, salty, fried, cheesy goodness.  Add in the extras and its more worth than a burger although after eating 1.5 orders it starts to get to you in a good/bad way, hehe.  Worth trying.
author: Rob C.

description:
We shared a chicken sandwich and fries here (for $10) The chicken was moist and pretty good, if not a little lacking in flavor (the chipotle aioli just wasn't strong enough. The fries were just okay.

We agree with most of the other reviews, the homemade pickles are awesome! They're spicy, salty, sweet and really made us wish that they were sandwich sliced so that we could add them to our sandwich as well.

We use 2 stars for an average place in order to have more leeway for the better food out there so this 3 star review means we'd be happy to return to Super Duper.
author: Amy D.

description:
Why doesnt LA have this yet? One more reason to love a road trip to the Bay. 
First off, and pretty much the only thing that matters...THE BURGER HOLY SHIT. I am writing this review 3-4 months later, and I can still savor the flavor of the juiciest burger I've ever had the pleasure to put in my mouth. Yeah I said that. Not too many things in this world are super duper, but this sure as hell is. 
Okay, yeah secondly BEER at a care free, walk up order and chill kind of joint. Nothing pretentious about it. Burgers, fries, and beers. Or if for some odd reason you can't have a beer, have a delicious dipped ice cream cone. I'm keeping this short and sweet just like the restaurant. Go eat here or you will be mad at yourself for a very long time.
author: Mike b.

description:
Delicious burgers and chicken sandwiches. I came in here alone one time because it looked so much like shake shack (my favorite burger joint in DC). Super delicious, juicy burger with fantastic tasting toppings, and the bun was superb and superlative.

I also came with my gf and got the chicken sandwich (with bacon, natch) and the garlic fries. The bun was ciabatta and a bit overtoasted, but the contents were wonderful - spicy and chewy with the bacon. It was a real melange of flavors and textures. The fries were great - the garlic flavor was very evident - but they could have been crispier (they were a bit soft if I'm honest.)

You must. Get. The pickles. They're free and they are probably the best pickles I've ever had. Slightly sweet, with a great vinegary bite and tang, and the perfect texture with just the crunch you are looking for in a pickle.

I'm simultaneously glad and afraid that this place is so close to my work.
author: Ankit G.

description:
Been here a few times before but never gotten to review this place yet.

For now i can only talk about their shakes and they're pretty damn good. A friend got the Chocolate and Fresh strawberry shake, and i got the cookies and cream shake. Both were really good what is even even better is to drink both at the same time. 

The chocolate and fresh strawberry shake tasted like a chocolate covered strawberry basically without the effort of chewing and getting your fingers dirty.
author: Darnell L.

description:
That burger was amazing! Had the Mini, no cheese, bacon, garlic fries and house white. 

And the staff was very pleasant, helpful, fun and def made the experience. 

Garlic fries are a bit overly greasy to the point they're soggy. That said, I still ate 98% of them ;)
author: Kim J.

description:
We used to walk past this place everyday and I was always hopeful of stopping in. Finally the wife relented and I got my wish.

I love burgers. Not every day or all the time but sometimes you just want a good juicy burger. Thankfully this was the day.

It's on Market Street near enough the main thoroughfare.
Walk in and it's cavernous with seating upstairs as well.

It's a pretty straightforward menu.
Burger with a runny egg thank you. A runny egg is just a great addition to a burger.

The patty was melt in the mouth with the ingredients you expect in a burger. Delicious. As good as anticipated.

The garlic fries were piping hot and also a perfect complement to the burger.

Till the next time...
author: Nick L.

description:
This place has great burgers!!  Not to greasy and not to dry.  Peeeerfect. 

The only complaint is that they usually have a long line and they should get some better beers on tap but that's about it. 

Other than that their service is great and they are pretty quick at making your food. 

Love this place. Only super duper will satisfy a super duper craving :)
author: Spencer L.

description: Very close to my hotel so that was good. The lemonade was terrible and the burger was just blah. Ambience was nice customer service was adequate.
author: William R.

description:
I had the mini combo here. The burger came wrapped in cute paper and came on a metal tray.  The burger was pretty good, but the super sauce wasn't that super. The meat was tender and well cooked but a bit oily. The fries were thin and pretty good. 
What's unique about this place is the pickles. They are in jars on the counter, where the condiments were. They were nice, not too salty and had a clean taste. 
Still don't know how a shake can be more expensive than the burger, but want to go back to try them and the ice cream!
author: Kristy K.

description: Best burger of my life. Just the right amount of greasiness and gooey cheese, nice and moist burger (not dry!) Mmm
author: Jennea N.

description: Not particularly "Super Duper," in my opinion.  Nor is it terrible.  But you can get a much more honest and reasonably-sized hamburger in SF for roughly half the price of this place.  Burger Bistro is far better, but they were unfortunately closed so I thought I'd give "Super Duper" a try ... live and learn.  It doesn't surprise me that so many out of towners rave about this place, but we locals should (and do) know better.
author: Tom N.

description: Ok. Heard all the hype... Finally tasted a burger... It's a hype no more... Probably the best burger I've had yet... Juicy and yummy... Should have had the mini burger though so I'd have space for fries... Til next time!!!
author: Connie L.

description:
Yelp, you did again! You lead me to this amazing establishment. It had been a while since I had been in the neighborhood and wanted to try a new eatery and Super Duper was the talk of the town. Or city. 

Wanted to keep it a little low-cal, so my friend and I had the Chicken chipotle aioli burger + cheese + tomatoes lettuce.  AMAZING, but a little drippy cause of the aioli sauce. Pickles were sweet but had chili peppers in the pickle jars, perfect kick to add to the not so spicy chipotle sauce. 

Fast and friendly service, ample seating. Will def have to come back on an "off" day to try their beef burgers and fries.
author: Lisandra M.

description: Love the Veg burger here...its's light and delicious!! You can have it with a side of regular or garlic fries. Also, try the Vanilla shake...highly recommended!!
author: Shivani K.

description: I absolutely love Super Duper. I've been to the one on Chestnut a few times, and I've been to this one a few times with some co-workers.  I went here for dinner last week with a friend, and have gotten my order down to a science:  Mini Burger with bacon, avocado, super sauce, and grilled onions.  I also had a side of fries to go with my burger.  I can't tell you how amazing their food is.  My friend also got a mini burger and got a Cookies & Cream shake and had it spiked.  It was delicious!  The line here wasn't too bad, although it's known to be notoriously bad during lunchtime.  It does get somewhat messy, but nothing like what I've experienced at Five Guys.  There isn't always a place to sit, but we were able to find a spot in the corner.  The one thing that makes this Super Duper different from its other spot on Chestnut is the crowd.  There are a ton of random bums sitting at the tables and chairs outside, and they are there without having ordered anything.  They take up almost the entire area, and are begging for change and food right when you walk out.  It takes away from the overall appearance of the restaurant.  Overall, I will definitely be back here, even if it means a lunchtime food coma :)
author: Lisa I.

description: Ostentatious. That's how one would describe a place named "Super Duper" prior to giving it a try. And being that I'm the biggest Burgernazi I know, I demand only the best in my burgers. Super Duper Burgers delivered... umm... super-duper-ly. This isn't a place where you get a done-up gourmet burger with some farty cheese and girly vegetables. This is a direct shot at a classic burger, and they nailed it. They nailed it so hard. They super duper nailed the shit out of it. The patty could have used just a tiny bit of more seasoning, but I can't sing enough praises about their burger overall. As a bonus, though I don't condone ordering a chicken sandwich/burger at a burger joint, one person did just that and even that was damn good. Not quite super duper, but definitely good.
author: Andy O.

description:
The burgers are surprisingly good.

I had walked past this place a handful of times, and never thought twice about it. It always had a "chain" look to me; I knew they had a few locations. So, I thought the food would be "chain" quality. Man, was I wrong. Burgers are perfectly cooked--perfect combination of cheese, toppings, and meat (bacon is amazing too). I always tell myself to get the mini, but I always end up saying "Super" at the register (my stomach knows what it wants). Doesn't hit the highest echelon of "best burgers" (e.g., Father's Office in Los Angeles), but it's still very good.

Fries are great and always hot/crispy. Shakes are amazing. Owner/Manager/Guy in charge? always remembers my name despite the fact that I've only been here four or five times and there is a line out the door when I am. 

2 qualms:

1. I had breakfast once here and it was teetering on terrible. My egg sandwich was downright salty. I almost always eat everything on my plate--couldn't get halfway through it. They do serve Four Barrel coffee however, which is tasty.

2. As amazing as the shakes are, they are ridiculously expensive ($4.50-6 for a shake?). Suddenly your meal becomes a $18 affair. Even in SF, that's a wee bit ridiculous.
author: Dustin M.

description: The burger here were addicting! One bite and you cannot stop!! Loved the fresh pickles as well!
author: Ashton S.

description: Good burgers, good egg sandwiches for breakfast; solid high end junk food offering (in the best possible way).
author: Tasha D.

description:
I'm vegetarian and yes I did walk into a gourmet burger joint not to throw away my beliefs of abstaining from consuming any animal product but because I was hungry and noticed exceptional ratings.

I expected no more than my usual fare of deep fried potatoes or the like of which my belly and my colon would later regret, but I did notice a veg burger that most places just defrost from frozen.  Normally, I wouldn't dare try as I have dozen of these faux cow patties stuffed in my freezer, but the beer I just drank said it's late and it's this disc or nothing.  So, about 10 minutes later I unwrap it along with the extra Portobello mushroom with it. Boy, was I wrong! The combination of it, home made pickles and light seasoned crispy fries was very satisfying! I must've had about 6 pieces of the lightly dill and crunchy pickles. The burger was moist and not gluten filled fake meat like many others but moist and tasty. It's one of two veg burgers that I would travel for.-the other at Rave Burger in San Mateo.

I'll remember to be Super Duper hungry next time I'm in the area. They also have about 6 beers on draft too!
author: Coy T.

description:
This rating is based purely on a customer service issue. Food was good but I will not be talking about that. Notice the Market St location.

I came here on July 23rd at 1030pm. Closing is at 11pm. At 1055pm we were approached by an extremely rude young man that was asking us to "hurry up" because he wanted to leave. He badgered us a few times until one of the girls in our group became extremely very irritated. She raised her voice to get her point across, and the young man said "just don't yell at me" in a very condescending way. He tried playing the victim. There were 6 of us that all were eating still and he said that "we had been there long enough already." This experience was horrible and left us all feeling verbally abused and unwelcome. He totally ruined our experience. I wrote to the Super Duper website issuing my complaint. I have now written 4 emails without a response. I am getting very angry as well are the people that were in my group. We want this issue to be resolved and the young man to be disciplined. He told all the other customers in the restaurant the same thing as he told us. This is an extremely poor representation of customer service in a customer service industry. The burgers are good too, but what a horrible place. 
This happened at the Downtown Market location.
author: Toby F.

description: If your going to have a small burger place then this is how you should do it. Sustainably grown meats fresh organic veggies and all at a great price. I have payed as much or more for a burger that came from mcfarms and now that I choose not to, finding a place like this is refreshing. Try your best to find places that buy meat from responsible growers. If you choose to eat meat do your best to be as responsible as possible even in this rat race world, you should be as involved in what you put in your body as you can. Letting animals live a good life before slaughter and table makes for better food. Good job Super Duper Burgers.
author: James E.

description:
After ordering a double patty burger and garlic fries, I can see why people love meat. The secret to Super Duper's addictiveness is not its organic ingredients, but the grease. The grease is like nicotine sending chemicals to the brain telling you want more and providing you with endorphins. With that said, the burger and fries were probably the most greasy items I have ever eaten. My buns, burger wrapping, and fries container were soaked in grease. I was actually scared of the fat solidifying in my veins. Aside from my fear, their burgers are juicy and tasty. 

Also, their malt shakes are delicious. They are thick, creamy, and remind me of childhood. Especially when I suck my straw too hard such that I get a brain-freeze. 

If I were to come back to this place, it would only be for their shakes though. After all, I am scared of grease overload. However, my dining companions will frequent to feed their greasy burger addictions...
author: Mabel Y.

description: I've been here twice when visiting San Francisco.  This second time was very disappointing.  I waited in the crazy long line and paid $24 for two burgers, one frie, and one milkshake.  I took it back to home with me and when the bf and I went to eat our burgers we realized they were wrong, and cold, and things like lettuce and the bun that should be a little crisp were soggy.  But it was a bummer because we were already home and they were not done correctly.  There are better burger places around that are not so expensive!
author: Rachel R.

description: Loved the taste of burger and highly recommend the bacon and egg topping.  And the organic beef makes it a no-gullt experience.   Also appreciated how the cooked it exactly to order - medium rare.   Really good experience.
author: Paul G.

description:
My first time at this place was a nice surprise. This place is freaking amazing and the concept of ordering is genius. It's like upscale fast food (has the speed but the food is better than most full service burger restaurants).

The burgers are so juicy and GOOD. Soooo delicious. I have never had a better burger. You can get an egg on your burger, which I love. The pickles are yummy. The garlic cheese fries were good but will do major damage to your breath. 

They also make some mean strawberry shakes. YUM. And I don't usually like shakes.
author: YoungEm T.

description: Word on the streets is .. this is the Shake Shack of SF. Is it close? No. Two totally different burgers and experience. Is it a good burger overall? Absolutely. But don't fail to add the organic egg on top. the bacon. the cheese. the works. and their own pickled "pickles" overall this is a damn good burger. So enough of these comparisons to Shake Shack! There are a plenty of them in SF which takes away from its uniqueness. But that just means that one is easily accessible. Always packed. Long lines but service is quick. Menu is easy. Pricing is a bit on a high side especially if you add all the extra fixins. Also shoutout to their sound system. Whoever is manning the music plays ONLY the hits. Don't forget to get their garlic fries. I just remember shopping around Union Square and not having  soul stand remotely near me because of my breath. Just the way I love it.
author: Yuki H.

description: Garlic fries were off the chain but my BF burped 3 hours later and it smelled like them
author: Maggie G.

description: I went for breakfast at 8:09a, the girl said they open at 8:15..... The sign on the window says opens at 8:00a. Seeing this inconsistency makes me want to avoid going for breakfast before work, as there's a chance it's not going to be open on time.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Came back for their chicken sandwich. The sandwich is a really flat sandwich and their chicken seems like it was pounded. It was an okay sandwich but I think I'm going to stick to my vegetarian sandwich. 

I sat by the bar/waiting area this time and their production line was really mesmerizing. Easy way to pass time while waiting for your buzzer :)
author: Betty S.

description:
I guess Super Duper is horning in on In-N-Out territory - the cheap straightforward hamburger.  On that front, I think they're doing a pretty good job.  I like the burgers here more than In-N-Out.  Yeah, they are twice the price but in reality that just means they're just a few dollars more.  What you get for that is a good greasy burger.  It's ground beef is kinda loosely put together into a patty then fried.  Not sure what kind of meat they use but with that first bit burger juice just gushed out of the bottom requiring 4 paper towels to mop up, just to put it into context. Still, it's a good burger.  Pace yourself though because you'll feel it later.  And while you're there don't forget to order the fries.  Very good skinny fries.  I also liked the butter pickles they have on the counter (we certainly helped ourselves). 

Be sure to be here before noon.  When we came at 11:45 we got to stroll right up to the front.  However, by 12:15 the lines was out the door onto the sidewalk.
author: Jean K.

description: The burger was great! Nice crispy bacon, toasty bun. The garlic French fries had such potential, but mine were drowning in oil and cheese so it became a soggy mess and I couldn't eat the ones on the bottom. Good flavor, too much oil. Chocolate malt had the malted sprinkled on top, not mixed in. I know they use organic ice cream but it just tasted strange. I would come back again for the burger and ask they go light on the oil with the fries.
author: Akilah L.

description:
This was my first time at Super Duper Burgers.  The line was long which would indicate that the food was worth waiting for.  

My burger was a bit under-cooked for my liking but not worth asking it to be redone.  I also did not get my grilled onions.  Besides that the burger was very tasty and juicy.  The self serve homemade pickles were a nice touch.

I don't usually eat fries but people in line recommended them.  They were very good but I should have ordered the garlic fries.  Rookie mistake.
author: Don M.

description:
What I Ate
- Super Duper Burger w/bacon and special sauce
- garlic fries

Would I Go Again?
Let me begin with the negatives, and then I will work my way to the three-, almost four-star rating.  
1. The garlic fries were SO bland!  There was hardly any cheese, and I think the only reason I could taste a hint of garlic is because I knew they were garlic fries.  They weren't good.
2. The massive double patty dominated the bacon and special sauce.  I think the bacon and special sauce were very good, but I think I would've needed more of both to compete with the double patty.  I just couldn't taste either very much.

Now on to the positives.  For a fast-food burger, I think that was the juiciest and most flavorful beef patty I've had.  It was greasy, no doubt about it, but it was delicious meat.  The bun was also very good--good bread and toasted very well.

When I go again, I think I will (1) order the mini burger (maybe 2) to even out the ratio of patty-to-bacon-to-special sauce and (2) not order fries.  With that order, I am confident I will have a quick, inexpensive, and satisfying burger.
author: Ben M.

description: I've always appreciated people with a strong work ethic and I noticed it tonight when I stopped in for a burger before going home. I decided to take a seat right next to the pick up counter where the orders are received and just observed the bustling restraunt and people picking up their orders while I ate my food. I noticed the two expeditors were extremely efficient and asked them for their names. Sam and Jose were very good at what they did and took pride in making sure orders were proper while keeping a smile. Solid efficient workers are few and far between. Excellent food, excellent service, and great attitudes. I'll be back again. Super Duper!
author: Kyle R.

description:
VERY yummy, VERY juicy home made quality burger joint here.  I even spotted some tourists here!  Wished they had turkey burger on their menu here though.  You wait in line and order at the counter.  They are very quick , and clean, and above all, the one thing I noticed was that the register people are super attentive and nice!  They make the burgers to order here, so this is great quality burgers here.  If you are around here, definitely come check it out!

Their mini burger is still pretty big btw...
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Oh, I go nuts for Super Duper!

If you are looking for a really good burger or just a cool place to hang out and receive a great service from the staff, then, do yourself a favor and stop by Super Duper on Market Street. 

I don't crave a burger every day, however, when I do Super Duper is the place to go. Burgers are really Juicy; I love the Super sauce (goes great with the burger and with fries); they have a small but great selection of beers to pair with your grub. My favorite thing on the menu are the garlic fries with aged Parmesan cheese..

Those fries are to die!. I do love the service here, everyone is super friendly, the call you by your name, and an hour later they still remember your name and make sure everything is going well during your visit. I have been to the one in the Mission, and I do think servers and cooks are friendlier here. You would never receive this type of service and smiles if you go to another fast food place or burger joint around here.
One thing I have noticed is that this is a great place for people watch. And, ladies, if you are single, this is a great place to meet guys (always cute guys in here), or at least to see them from far  :)

If I ever move to the East Coast again, I would truly miss this place. Organic ingredients, friendly staff (many, many smiles), nice environment..and the best garlic fries on earth :)
author: Elizabeth D.

description: This is a pretty good burger. The lines are a little long though... that's pretty much the only drawback. Great location to hang out with friends and catch a quick bite to eat before heading out for the night.
author: Bobby L.

description: Pretty good burgers and fries. It also have great service and very clean environment. A nice place to go for seasonable priced meal
author: Tom K.

description:
Wow I am super impressed with the veggie burger here! I am a full-time vegetarian, and this was one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had! It was flavorful and was not greasy at all. I would definitely come back again! 

This place reminds me of Shake Shack in NYC (but better)!
author: Thy D.

description:
I've got here a few times for their dipped ice cream cones and they are great.  The chocolate sauce they dip the ice cream in has a little hint of salty flavor which adds a great flavor and makes it different than most other places.  The ice cream they use is organic and very tasty too.

The burgers are good and fresh and I'l have to try their fries and onion rings.  If there was one thing I wasn't crazy about was their pickles, but that won't keep me from going back.  The people who work here are also friendly and they do a good job of keeping the place clean, which given the location I'm sure can be a challenge.  The prices are also pretty reasonable given the freshness of their ingredients and it's location.  

One of my favorite things about this place is the outdoor seating on Market St.  It's a great place to be able to eat with your dog and watch all the people and activity on Market.  If you're looking for a clean, quick, and tasty option on Market St this place is great.
author: Scott L.

description:
yum@yumyum.com 
Mini Burger with CHEESE AND BACON will not disappoint.
Will be back (everyday??)

The dudes that work at the counter are also awesome.
Top notch experience.
author: Elena T.

description:
4 Stars FOUR sures. Meat that you want to eat. Buns that make you run. Super sauce that comes with the DUPER boss. 

I only got a burger due to a low-budget. The mini burger is a similar size as any burger from In-n-out or McD's. But the taste is like SUPER DUPER for about 5 dollars.

The interior has upstairs and downstairs. The line get really long during lunch hour, so if you are in line when that happens......yea....the lines are the kryptonite. 

Warning: eating this burger will not make you into Superman or Superwoman, but either way you are pretty super for coming to this place.
author: Paul K.

description:
On vaca here and was walking around union square area and noticed this place. My first impression was that for such a busy area there seemed to be a limited amount of seating. There is an outdoor section a bar section and an upstairs section so they seem to have made the most of their limited space. 
The prices seem to be reasonable for this part of town, as opposed yo the wallet rape that ive been experiencing at other places in the area. I got a mini burger combo for $8.50 that consists of a burger, fries, and a drink. You can add cheese for an extra 50 cents. Talk about cheesy. 
The burger is mouth watering grease dripping belch enhancing (at least that's what the guy seated next to me blamed it on) delicioso.   All bodily functions aside, prepare to make a mess bc the burger is that good!  They serve it in a wrapper that does almost no good in containing the yummy goodness. The fries are a nice touch on the side and you can even get them with garlic and a variety of sauces that will surely have you licking your lips. 
All in all a great time provided you can secure some seating and that you're prepared for the splash zone, otherwise known as the distance from your body to the food. 
The
author: Jeff L.

description: Simply the best kept secret this place is amazing everything on the menu this amazing and it's a local produce than other fast food places out there it's more organic than a Burger King and McDonald's
author: Christopher L.

description:
I don't know how people can rave about this place too much. Have they not had In 'n Out or Shake Shack? Shoot, I'd rather have McDonald's. 

The burgers are dry, greasy, and salty, and their fries aren't memorable. 

I guess I would come here for the milkshakes, which are pretty decent.
author: Amy N.

description: Really Super duper burgers !! Highlight is garlic french fries. A little bit expensive but worth every bite.
author: Saurabh T.

description: Oh there we go again! Just another version of the heavy greasy American food.. There's no concept for me to say something nice about it whatsoever and They have an organized line for sure and a messy seating area.. I ordered the house special combo at the high price.. I did taste more grease and I felt sick for a week   Needless to say I don't have any temptations to come back.
author: Pedro D.

description:
Hella short. First time there and I actually didn't order a burger!  ordered a chicken sandwich $6.50 + french fries $2 + soda $2 for a total of $11. Kind of expensive, but I didn't really care.

The chicken sandwich was good, not filling, and will probably stick with a burger next time. The fries were hella good and they have this amazing red sauce you can dip it in. 

The place is big & clean, staff is friendly, outside seating, blah blah blah. I will be back for more.
author: Arnold N.

description: Great place! Not super Greasy either! Garlic fries are awesome. Definitely check it out!
author: John R.

description: Delicious food, the staff was great and the few beers on tap were solid. They will give you a combo whether you want one or not so be sure to check. The kids size milkshake is decent size with the regular size being about 16 oz. The garlic fries are GARLICKY. The seating is limited at lunch time but not too bad. The line moved very quick and we got our food quickly as well.
author: Brandon E.

description: honestly was super duper. wish they had more options for toppings at a less steep add on price, but i'm def gonna go back. quality ingredients. amazing burger. loved it.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: This place is very messy both the crowd and the burger. The guy who was cleaning the table use one dirtiest towel  for the whole place and didn't even rinse or wash in between. The burger was okay nothing to brag about, garlic fried was decent.
author: jose m.

description:
Definitely exceeds my expectations for fast-food burger restaurant. Especially love the garlic fries and the cheese is such a heavenly touch. I have on occasion driven up to SF from San Jose just to eat here for lunch.

If there is one thing I will make a plea for - please help the newly opened location in San Jose as they are ruining the Super Duper brand! I was so excited when a Super Duper opened near me in San Jose but was disappointed that their fries were soggy and cheese melted as if it had been sitting under a heat lamp.
author: Bailey R.

description:
SUPER DUPER quick, appetizing and friendly service.

If you want a quick fix after you've pampered yourself enough from shopping, why not indulge in good food that will get you satiated?

This burger joint wasn't so hard to find. Tired of the old quick fixes such as Denny's and Mel's, me and my shopping date also known as the girlfriend stopped by this place. Afraid that we might have a hard time getting seats, we rushed inside to quickly look for a spot. Surprisingly, this place is spacious! There's a good amount of people, but you'll never have to suffer from waiting to get a seat. People come and go, fast food type of scenario. Eat, and dip. 

We ordered the garlic fries, and some mini burgers with an extra egg. Mind you their sauces are off the hook, plus you can't say no to their organic beef, and egg! ALL ORGANIC EVERYTHING WHY NOT! 

Plus the cheese was really good, it lingers in your mouth for days! Definitely touched up my burger cravings!! I even had to scrape off the cheese from my Gf's tray. HAH. It's that good. 

Ahhhh, this place was definitely SUPER DUPER. Will come back for some milkshakes next time. YES!
author: Ferricci R.

description:
I visited this location 3 times during a two-week trip to San Francisco. I have tried both the Super Burger and the Mini Burger, both times with a portion of (heavenly) garlic fries. They were some of the best burgers I've had - fresh, juicy and very flavorful. 

If you're a burger fan, you'll want to try out these super duper burgers!
author: Stef L.

description:
A zillion of these guys are popping up all over the place!  There are 2 within walking distance of the Marriot by the Metreon.

It was really clean inside, I think it may have been a grand opening or something.  The staff's customer service was beyond my expectation!  They brought our food to us (even though it's a fast food joint).  Then noticed we didn't have napkins, so came back with napkins.

Then, we asked about the sauce.  We confused the names of the sauces and we accidentally ordered the wrong kind.  So they just gave us the right one at no extra charge.  (we didn't even have to ask for it)

Then, the owner came out and gave us coupons for free soft serve!


Bottom line:
The burger was good - Just made of good quality ingredients.  And the service was excellent.  The ambiance was clean and comfortable.
author: Christina C.

description: We were just looking for a quick lunch spot so we tried this place.  Free range and organic everything.   My wife had what she described as the best veggie burger ever.  I had the double cheese burger and it was lights out.  The fries and pickles were awesome too.  I just didn't live the buns but bread is bad for me anyway.   Staff was very friendly and helpful.   I will go back.
author: Shane C.

description: Really solid veggie burger, with good toppings (make sure to add the avocado, and you can probably add an egg if you want to). One of the first veggie burgers I had in sf around four years ago, I'm really glad to see they've maintained their high standards. Their truffle fries are also totally worth it. Can't wait to come back
author: Amaresh S.

description:
Lots of bang for my no buck since I was handed vittles here on a silver platter literally at a Yelp Elite event. 2nd one I've gotten into, what what.

Blue cheese burgers obviously get my loving, and I had already liked the Castro location one, so thumbs up for another burger joint close to the museum areas. Not sure that the burger beats out what you've had elsewhere, but pretty darn good. 

Beers on tap were a nice selection. Somehow I can't remember what any of them where?.
author: Kevin L.

description: More like mediocre burger. The meat was too gristley, my pet peeve where burgers are concerned. Pickles were too vinegary and had me coughing, although once on the burger they were edible. The garlic on the garlic fries was too raw and spicy. I wasn't too impressed, although service was good and quick.
author: Stacy G.

description:
*Review for portobello sandwich*

I was surprised! They bread/deep fry the portobello...at first I thought i had been given the wrong thing. This is def an original take on a protobello sandwich. It was very moist and delicious, such a creative way to present it.

Unfortunately, they were extreeeeeemely skimpy on toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, secret sauce) there was just a tiny bit of each. Next time i'd love to see them pile on some more toppings and this would be an excellent veg burger!!
author: Kristal N.

description: Lives up to the name. Had a super burger and an order of garlic fries. Dangerously good. Priced well and service was quick. What can I say? Perhaps another trip is in order to sample the shakes (with malt!) or other classics burger shop fare. This place is a gem.
author: Anna F.

description: Um it doesn't get greasier than this. And doesn't get better LOL. Although you can order the regular with just one patty and it's more than enough. The 2 patties I ordered were a bit much. Their garlic fries are also very good! One of the better burgers I've ever had.
author: Vol T.

description:
Finalllllllllly I got to try Super Duper! So glad (and yet not so glad) that this new location is right in my neighborhood. I don't eat much red meat but when I crave a burger, I crave A BURGER! Haha...and their burgers are SUPER DUPER! Ok so I had the Mini burger w/Cheese & Bacon. Got fries, a soda, & the dipping sauces just coz I had to try everything. Came out to $12. Not bad. I was super duper content after. 

It was empty and off peak lunch hours when I went so the wait wasn't too bad. The burger was amazing, the bacon was even better..crispy and peaking out, and the bun was perfect  :D I'm not a mayo person so I only liked one of the dipping sauces (I think its their house one)..It's not a MUST order I have to say, I'd skip on it next time. This place is pretty spacious and everything is made to order. I want to try a milkshake or soft serve next time since I looove Strauss. Weeee~ Thank you Super Duper!
author: Natassia S.

description: The name just says it all, super duper burgers. came in on Saturday and order their super burger combo wasn't sure what to expect but once i took the first bite my taste buds went nuts. Meat was cooked to perfection and it came with just the right amount of toppings, nothing to messy and the fries were delicious. Will have to come back next time I'm in town.
author: Carlos L.

description: Bomb.com worth the walk we took from our hotel room! 7 blocks thank you yelpers... (:
author: Adi A.

description:
Their menu has a lot more to offer than burgers. But oh, how they do burgers.  It's like a bovine ballet in a ballerina bun. Shakes. Garlic (sweet potato) Fries. Goodness. 

Not cheap. Worth it.
author: Jordan P.

description:
The burgers and chicken sandwich taste amazing! The bun on the burger was so full of taste and the burger was delicious. I definitely would eat here again! The reason for the one less star is because my parents whom I went with both ordered extra bacon (2$) and neither of them got it! 

Overall If your near this place and like meat you should eat here!! Fast service and friendly workers!
author: Nicole R.

description:
Now I only had the garlic fries, so i guess my review isn't based on the place as a whole. But the fries were very yummy and fairly priced. Next time i go i will try the burger.
