Now the customer service was on point! The cashier stuck up conversation (even amidst the large crowd of hungry people) and even offered me a nice hefty size glass for water while i waited. I  loved the overall energy of this place and i would most definitely go back and try more.
author: JuJu B.

description:
One word = Amazing.
The juiciest burger I have tasted.

Even better than Shake Shack (Ahem...germommah =)

order the garlic fries and super duper burger!
author: Mary Ann V.

description: Super Duper Burgers = Super Duper Good. I was gonna take a picture of the food but I ate it.
author: Kyle G.

description: My boyfriend and I were in SF this past weekend. He was online looking for a CVS and came across this place. The name caught his attention so we went over and tried it. This place is AMAZING! OMG I loved the burger and fries! Make sure you try the Chocolate shake! it was amazing. We got the fries and also got all three dips. I was just in love and amazed at how great this place is. I live in LA and I wish there was a super duper burger out here! Will deff. be going back to this place when I am back in SF. This place is a must if you are out in SF!
author: Rosalinda L.

description:
Got the super burger. The Ground beef was definitely very fresh and tasted that way. However, I felt like the 1/4lb burgers shrunk quite a bit. Did not feel like I was eating half a pound of meat ;p But maybe because I usually eat a lot more. Other than the burger being very fresh and the patties were a little crispy (which I liked), do not feel like there is anything special about this place.

Will have to try other things on their menu or maybe it was just an off day?
author: Sean L.

description:
Reasons why I love this place:

-High-quality delicious niman ranch burgers without the shmancy atmosphere
-All you can eat crunchy dill pickles!
-Garlic fries (comes w/aged cheddar)
-Straus organic soft serve in vanilla, chocolate, or both. (tip: you can order it and get it later, after you're done w/your meal!)
-Friendly service
-Open late
-Reasonably priced

This has become my go-to place for a casual meal. Can't wait to go back!
author: Marian C.

description:
My friend Jimmy has been raving about this place so finally, we tried it for a New Year lunch. Yep, my first meal for 2013!

The place is so neat and has second level seating. The burgers are delicious, I'm always a plain jane but I regret that I didn't go a little risky after I tried my boyfriend's burger. It was delicious. Mine despite how plain (bun, meat and jack cheese) was still delicious and juicy!

And those homemade pickles, really good! Nom nom nom
author: Lora M.

description:
Pros
- Really great burgers (they look small but I can get by with the 4oz burger)
- Garlic fries
- Pretty affordable

Cons
- Seating can get limited
- Lines can get long

This is a great place to grab a burger if you're near Market between Montgomery and Powell! I heard the milkshakes are great but I've never tried it out.
author: Andrew S.

description:
I really really wanted to like this place, but I couldn't. Place was just alright for me. I will say the place looks nice and their garlic fries are pretty tastey, but the place isn't memorable. Their burgers were good, but super oily. I know I can go to another place for a burger just as good for a cheaper price too.

I would def. check this out once, but to not make this place your frequent spot. There are a lot better in San Francisco.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
SUPER DUPER BURGERS
I've been on this weird burger hunting craze for the last couple months, trying numerous burger joints that are unique and popularized on Triple D, so it was with great interest that I tried Super Duper Burgers (after seeing a friend post a picture on Facebook)... but it is with some disappointment that SDB is somewhat overhyped. Located on Market Street, this burger joint is huge! SDB pretty much offers only the Super Burger, which includes two patties, and a wide variety of toppings, including the basics. You can also ADD cheese, bacon, and sunny-side egg (for $1.50). The burger was honestly not that tasty in my opinion, but was of good size. On the other hand, the homemade pickles were excellent, as they were super tangy and complimented the burger well with more taste. We also ordered the garlic fries with 6-month aged cheddar cheese. This was excellent, as these garlic fries were quite unique. So overall, was Super Duper Burgers good? It was OK, but if I'm basing everything on one burger, I would still choose In-N-Out, even though SDB offers a more unique experience for an ordinary burger. On to the next burger joint!
author: Stanley C.

description:
Believe it or not- Super Duper has my favorite veggie burger- don't get me wrong- the beef burger is very good- but I crave for this veggie burger. I totally love the texture and the hummus dressing. This veggie burger just tastes better! Highly recommended for meatless Mondays- or just for whenever!!!

The staff is totally friendly, too. An enjoyable burger joint to visit- again and again and again!!!
author: Charissa N.

description: Best Burgers in Town!!! (better than In-n-out....not cheeper though)
author: Horace B.

description: The burger was alright, but the garlic fries were very disappointing. They were cold! When I go back I'll order regular fries and request that they be hot. If you go there and order garlic fries, tell them you want them Hot!!!
author: Anthony W.

description: Best 5 dollar burger I have ever had. Being under the influence may have swayed my opinion at the time but looking back a couple days later, it was so good it was worth waiting a review about.
author: Kevin R.

description: Have been here for lunch and dinner a couple times and always enjoy my meal. I always get the super burger, definitely a better size than the small one. Meat quality and taste is great, always cooked medium which is perfect. I also get the grilled onions and bacon as an addition to mine. The pickles are also great and free!
author: Josue V.

description: Mini cheeseburger and garlic cheese fries are bomb. Definitely recommend them!
author: Nikki S.

description: Super Duper is the best quality burgers in the city! Not to mention those milkshakes. I always get extra super sauce on the side to dip fries. Good quality and quantity for your money, I never get burgers anywhere else anymore.
author: Liz F.

description: Had the super duper combo - the burger was nice and juicy and had fresh veggies. French fries were amazing and chocolate shake was great. Went during lunch with a long line BUT it went fast and didn't take long for food (less than 10 min in super extreme volume, which was amazing). Young guy behind the counter (blonde, didn't get name) was very upbeat and very very nice - amazing customer service experience!
author: Lisa N.

description: Great Burgers! Fast service too! The burgers are very juicy and the fries are cooked perfectly. This place just keeps you coming back for more. They also have great ice cream cones and the cookies are good too. Just try to get there before noon otherwise the lines are extremely long! I suggest ordering over the phone.
author: Annette R.

description: The burgers are whack and the pickles are not that great... but it's nearby and convenient. Got the bacon donut as well, but that was even more bizarre!
author: Diana L.

description: The homemade pickles are like I have never had.  Light on the vinegar and salt but without the cucumber after taste.   They are perfect!    For the first timer get the mini burger, which is a quarter pound burger, it will be big enough.  The fries were good and unique.   It will probably be the cheapest good food you could find in San Francisco.
author: Robert S.

description: Very good burger.. very good.. from LA, was about to eat mall food.. nope.. go to super duper burger, trust worth it
author: Tyrone J.

description: My wife thought it was a bit greasy. I thought it was fantastic. Fries good. Pretty quick even though alot of tourists invaded. Id go again.
author: tony z.

description: After having a breakfast sandwich here, I can never go back to the other, pricier options around here.  Super Duper consistently gets my order right, is affordable, and most importantly, has the best breakfast sandwiches in the area!  It doesn't hurt that the people working there are always friendly and seem happy to be there.  I can't speak for the meat, but the veggie burgers are also delicious :)
author: Jake H.

description: We were excited about checking this place out during our vacation. We visited the Market St location. It was just ok. It is hard for all the burger places to really stand out. Super Burgers does not stand out. We tried the Super Burger and two Mini Burgers. My daughter's Mini was supposed to be plain, just cheese and bacon, but came with everything. My Super was made wrong as well. They fixed the mistake but when you are a burger place with limited toppings, it shouldn't be too hard to get it right. We ordered the plain fries with the three dip sauces and that was a total waste. The sauces seemed to be chipotle, mayo and what my daughter called 'onions and banana.' I agreed but I had the sauce flavor as 'strawberries and pickles.' I search high and low for a good burger in places I travel to, but I can say SDB is a place that I will skip the next time I am in SanFran. The place had a fun vibe but the food was just average. The music the place played was the best part!
author: Chris S.

description:
I finally ventured to this UnionSq/SOMA mecca of grounded moo.
After hanging out in the line (it moves quickly), 
I ordered/ate the Cheesy Super Burger with a side-order of their garlic fries. 

The patty was rich and on the juicy/greasy side; 
but hey what fatty-ground piles of beef ain't? 
I wonder if they add pork back-fat to the mixture. 
I enjoyed it and was ready to order another after pounding this one down. 

The garlic fries were just great...very delicious.
I also could have ordered another round of this.

I got an ice tea with the order. 
It was good...nothing special.

I got moo-grease-spots on my dress shirt, but surprisingly the tie was spared.
[the sleeves got hit...]
author: Derek N.

description: home of the good burgers. as pricey as this little baby gets - its worth every cent. Their burger looks so simple but it tastes so good. It may not be a burger you want to get everyday if you are broke like me but once in a while, its good to treat the belly. i like my cheeseburger with all the toppings. i THINK they make their own pickles. words cant describe how delish these pickles are. i wanted to take a jar home. Pickles and burgers. now thats the good life
author: Kristina L.

description: So good!! Fresh homemade pickles. The burger was to die for and loved the added jalapeños.
author: Morgan T.

description: I'm a fan. The meat is very juicy and everything taste real fresh. Out of the three sauces, the chipotle sauce is my favorite. Furthermore, garlic fries were on hit. By the way, the folks at this location were so helpful. My friend and I came in and even before ordering we had to ask where we could watch the Niners game and I want to say at least two or three of the workers were helping us think where to go. We did end up going to where they suggested (Jillian's) so all in all a good experience. Good food, good folks.
author: DeanAnthony R.

description:
Food: 4
Decor: 3
Service: 2

Came here for dinner Sunday around 8pm.

1. Super burger with everything, grilled onions instead of red onions, 7
~Pretty good, although I felt something was missing. I'll probably get it with cheese and bacon next time. The homemade pickles were excellent.

2. Garlic fries, 3
~Pretty good. Fries were reasonably crisp and not soggy.

Service is self-serve, and you bus your own trays. Staff was friendly though.
author: David L.

description: Awesome burgers. One of the best I ever had. When you are in SF you definitely have to try them :) staff is friendly. Garlic fries are just delicious, but a little bit fatty though.
author: Radoslaw D.

description: A bit too greasy for me. It was gross to see the pool of oil at the bottom of my burger. The meat is seasoned well and is a decent burger. Burger seems to be similar to shakeshack but definitely not shake shack.
author: Al L.

description:
Omg.

Supertastic!

Got a burger, with cheese and fried egg. So juicy and delicious. 

Also tasted the chicken sandwich and it was yum.

Was stuffed.

Couldn't find the napkins, well blended near the soda machine.
author: qirk z.

description: Meh. Extremely dry burger. Dry bun that tasted more like a potato chip. Veggies were non-inspiring.  Fries tasted like over cooked oil sticks.  Finally, not sure what the other locations are like, but this place has a terrible set up.  +1 star because I came in hungry and left filled for under $25, which isn't easy in this town.
author: mario k.

description: These garlic fries ... taste like droplets of heaven! Soooo GOOD! Burgers are very juicy and tasty. Amazing service, but come earlier to avoid the lunch rush or else you'll be spending a while in line
author: Xin W.

description:
My friends and I were drinking at Local Edition on Friday and I was getting buzzed from not having eaten anything prior to happy hour. I put out some suggestions on places to go eat. Of course, no one really cares what type of food they want to get. We gradually end up outside. I open the Yelp app on my iPhone and use Monocle to see what's nearby. I point out Super Duper and everyone's down for burgers (we were all curious since it's a burger joint with 4 stars and almost 600 reviews.

We walk in and I get the Chipotle vibe. Clean, modern, simple interior with an upstairs balcony. My friend and I run upstairs to grab a table while the others order.

I got the mini-combo -- I couldn't believe I only spent ~$10.50 on a burger + garlic fries+ fountain drink. There was an added charge for the garlic fries since the combo comes with just regular fries. I spent LESS on my MEAL than on the DRINK I got at a BAR! Oh the oddities of life. 

I think they've got the efficiency thing down -- 1 line, 3 registers where you order and they give you a buzzer. When the order is ready, you go pick it up on the other side of the counter. Clear your own table when you're finished eating.

The burger is delicious! All natural beef and fresh ingredients. I have a deep appreciation for delicious garlic fries, let alone regular fries! YUM! I guess I have to come back to try the soft serve...I see an a lot of highlights for the word "soft serve."

Keep up the super duper job Super Duper!
author: Katherine S.

description:
Uhhhh free pickles???
Anywhere that has free pickles is destined for greatness. I dip mine in mustard, try it or don't. 

Get anything, honestly. Everything and any combination of stuff you want on your burger will be delishhhhh.
author: Gabs T.

description:
Veggie burger is delicious and super filling and - most important - doesn't FALL APART like many veggie burgers do (especially ones made of beets!!!!). They'll give you grilled onions if you ask, which is awesome. The garlic fries literally have like three cloves of shredded garlic on them so just be aware of that..you have to REALLY like garlic to enjoy those fries (which I do.. I ate clumps and clumps of garlic ever so happily).

Also they stay open fairly late, we stumbled in around 11 PM on a Thursday night. This is really close to Local Edition, a great bar that doesn't serve food, so the two are a lovely pair :)
author: Sonya Z.

description: Pretty good burgers on the small side but makes up with tasty crisp freshness but with a greasy feeling after. The garlic fries with cheese are great!
author: Billy C.

description: Amazing chicken sandwich! They have great milkshakes and burgers, too. All organic , free range/grass fed, amazing quality food.
author: Leo Y.

description:
I work in the area and this is my go-to spot if I'm having a rough day or need some comfort food! 

The burgers are delicious and the fries are great too. The chocolate milk shake is hands down the best shake I've had. And they make their own pickles which you have unlimited access to! It's amazing. 

The only reason I take off one star is cause the line is usually out the door so you have to come really early and the tables are never clean. I find myself wiping down the tables with wet wipes before sitting down to eat ever. And they are seriously way too close to one another. You will definitely be sitting way too close to the people next to you so it can be a bit uncomfortable.
author: Dusty N.

description:
The burgers here are soooo good. So are the garlic fries. They had more cheese on them than garlic but I guess the garlic was infused in the fries because the next day, the strong taste of garlic was still on my tongue no matter how many times I brushed and rinsed away.

Service was quite nice. Cashier tried to make small talk, which is always better than having a robot cashier.

The interior is very unique too so it was a nice place to hang out.
author: Kat L.

description: I had the Super Burger with bacon and cheese plus sunny side eggs. Yum! The burger was good, very juicy and succulent. Add a runny, gooey delicious organic egg, the juiciness just jumped to the nth degree! The garlic fries were good as well. Price was moderate; I guess normal to the city. If I were craving for a burger in the city, Super Duper is definitely on the list.
author: Paul V.

description:
First of all - just know that no burger will ever beat In'n'Out for me. That's just the way it's gonna be. That said, this place makes a very, very worthy burger, and gets many brownie points for its convenience (both of location and service).

As busy and packed as the Union Square area is, there are pathetically few options for a tasty bite. Enter Super Duper. This is what a downtown SF burger joint should be. Extra juicy burger with fixins' galore and solid fries. Sizing is a bit counterintuitive -- I get very full off of a mini (single patty), but the boyfriend sizes up and goes for the regular (double patty). Give me some of those jalapenos and deliciously/weirdly sweet house pickles and I'm all set. Super Duper has my approval.
author: Julie D.

description:
THE BEST BURGER I'VE HAD IN CALI!!!

#1: Shake Shack - NYC
#2: Super Duper - SF

*Only difference, IMO, the potato bun at SS melts in your mouth like butter.

BTW, must must must upgrade to garlic fries!
author: Alex T.

description: Super Duper is indeed, super duper! Their burgers are so juicy and their fries must have crack in them because I can never stop eating them. Getting their combo is the way to go!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Gotta give it to the crew here, they are awesome! I work right next door and go pretty frequently, although I mostly go for breakfast. Their breakfast sandwich is really good- classic english muffin, egg, cheese, avocado, maybe bacon and affordable! They also have four barrel coffee which I like.

I love the staff. They recognize me and are super nice and on occasion even hook it up with a free donut! I will be going back many times.
author: Ted L.

description: Me, the Mr. and 13 famished 11yo BOYS on our way to the movies, grabbing dinner. One extremely patient counter clerk, one highly efficient kitchen, veggie burgers for the non meat crew, tasty burgers and a reasonable price??! Super Duper was in fact Super! We used this store because we thought the one closer to the movies would be more crowded, it was only a 3 minute stroll from this location to AMC, very easy. Fast food that doesn't taste fast...
author: Sydney P.

description: Usually I don't like to eat burgers at all, Super Duper is the only place I love to eat burgers, inner part of burger patty is nice and juicy and outer is crispy love it
author: Omkar P.

description:
If you're in Downtown and you haven't been to Super Duper or haven't heard of it, something might be wrong with you. It was one of the places I've heard of when I first worked in the city. 

Pretty decent burgers and shakes. They do remind me of In-N-Out and Five Guys in terms of how you order. One patty (Mini) or two (Super), add your condiments, choose your onions, and wait just a minute or two longer than your usual fast food joint. Be prepared to make a mess especially with their medium-well burgers loaded with the super sauce. Their super sauce does remind me of In-N-Out but not as overwhelming. It's pretty subtle in my opinion, but it does bring out the sweet taste of meat rather than an add-on flavor. Their patties are pretty thick, so if you're eating it at a late time and wants to add on an order of fries, maybe stick with the Mini. I do love their garlic fries but I'm just too scared of garlic breath! I usually just stick with the regular fries, a bit too salty for my taste. The texture is pretty good though, not too airy, not too dried up. It's a bit too oily for my fingers, but just right for my taste. Burgers and fries being too healthy/lacking oil just don't work. 

If you're not feeling a burger today, you can still try their shakes. I've tried their spiked chocolate shake. It's very milky and creamy with just a tingle of vodka flavors. Shakes are good, but spiked shakes are even better :)

Overall, their food is a 3.5. 0.5 more just for friendly cashiers.
author: Connie C.

description:
Overall a pretty good burger. The single patty may be a little small for one person but if you note that it's less than $5, you shouldn't be too surprised. 

The patty was pretty flavorful, on the salty side but I like it that way. It looks like a handmade patty rather than those uniformed frozen ones- tho I don't think it is actually handmade.  The special sauce is ok, nothing special.  I appreciate all the extras that you can add for free (grilled onions, jalapeno etc) and $1.50 for an organic egg.  It's a little expensive but I thought it really enhanced the flavor of the burger. 

The fries are pretty good, crunchy.  The shake was actually very delicious, I tried the cookies and cream one.  Would definitely get that again. 

Their homemade pickles are pretty good and are at the condiments table that is free for all. There is a line during lunch rush but the staff is very efficient and the line moves quickly. I had an annoyingly crazy order with all these special requests and the girl taking my order was super nice and accommodating.  Would come here again.
author: Krystal C.

description: Quick, easy & yummy! Everything is organic & recyclable Seat yourself. Great place for young kids because it's loud. There are a few seats outside to sit as as well.
author: monya b.

description:
I freaking love this place.  The burgers are DAMN JUICY.  You know when you bite into this burger that you're probably clogging all sorts of arteries ... but because it tastes so good, you just don't really care.  At least the meat is au naturel Niman Ranch beef.  And it's actually a pretty thin patty, which I enjoy.  The super sauce pairs really well with this greasy burger.  YUM.  Get it on the side so you can dip your fries in it too!

And can we talk about the homemade pickles for a second??  OMYLORD they're good.  They're a little spicy too.  Love it. 

i tried being healthy once ... got the salad with the patty.  Don't do it.  It was torture knowing how much better a burger would have tasted.
author: Dina H.

description:
Super Duper Burgers did not live up to its name for me.

I was excited because I love burgers and needed one to cure my hangover. I get to the register and meet this unpleasant girl who you could tell really hated her job. Excitement level dropped, crashed, and burned. Whatever...I brushed off my shoulders because I had 99 problems but a bitch wasn't one. 

I ordered the Mini Burger (which is not mini at all). The only thing that stood out to me was the 4 oz patty. It was cooked medium, still pink, and "done well" (get it?). Everything else was simply average. The garlic fries were tasty but nothing to rave about. I shared a chocolate shake which was also average.

Super Duper left me a bit disappointed and wanting more. Maybe it was all the hype around it that set me up for failure.
author: David P.

description: I was passing by and decided to give it a try. I got the mini combo which includes the mini super duper cheese burger, a drink and fries. It was good but I wasn't too impressed. It's just like a regular burger. I also had pretty high expectations after reading reviews and hearing so many people talk about it. I prefer In n Out or Whiz Burger in the Mission so not sure if I'll be going back. I will say shoutout to the guy taking the orders. So cute and so happy!! Thinking about it, I might just go back lol
author: Marlo M.

description:
B has been raving about Super Duper burgers for a while now, going on about how they crush their patties to grill the maximum surface area...?

I don't know the mechanics of it, but the Super Duper burger lives up to its name. There's nothing fancy or boutique or pretentious about it, it's just a really, really, really good burger. The patty is cooked perfectly, seasoned well, and oozes the right amount of deliciousness. The garlic cheese fries are a must - shavings of aged cheddar?! and they do not skimp. 

REALLy good burger. Really.
author: Julia C.

description: My family and I went here twice while on vacation. We also came one night for shakes. Each time everything was great. My son said it was the best burger he ever had. We have Five Guys where we are from, and we all liked it better than that. Great super sauce- good on the burgers and the fries.  Love the home made pickles too. Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu.
author: Paul M.

description:
If you're ever in San Francisco and you're looking for a burger joint, Super Duper Burgers is definitely the spot for you. The service is quick and the food is amazing. The burgers are great and so are the fries. I recommend trying the cookies and creme shake they have there; it doesn't taste like any other cookies and creme shake I've ever had before, it's THAT good. It's almost like they blend cake into it or something, it's delicious. The only problem is that, since it's in such a busy part of town, it's always super busy and there aren't many places to sit. It can seat a lot of people, but I wouldn't count on there being many spots for big groups. There's a second story/balcony like level with more seats, a few tables on the ground floor and a few tables outside as well. This might not be too ideal because it can get pretty cold in SF, but it's still really nice. The seating looks mostly like it's made for 2-4 people. The music is really cute, too. They also sell storemade pickles! Which is cool. I love Super Duper burger.

(One thing to note, though; there's always a super long wait to get into the bathroom.)
author: Jasmine R.

description: Everything is great!! I've been to Super Duper several times and it never seems to disappoint. Standouts include the garlic fries, milkshakes, and the toppings you can add to the delicious burgers. I love adding either the fried egg or avocado to mine. It can be busy during lunchtime so expect a line. It is definitely worth the wait.
author: Amanda S.

description:
The burger itself was pretty good- veggies were fresh, meat was seasoned well, and the sauce was delish. 

But the 2 problems that I had were the oiliness of the burger itself and also the dryness of the patties. I got the super burger so it had 2 patties instead of one--they were well done and with two thick patties together like that at that cooked state made everything taste hella dry. It would have been WAY better if they either made the patty thickness much smaller or just made the patties a medium rare-medium. And also if they bothered to pat down the meat and the buns, the whole thing wouldn't be drenched in oil like it was when I got it. 

Also the sauce, the one thing that I think makes this burger actually stand out from other regular burgers, was so hidden; I could barely taste it most of the time, but when I did, the burger tasted super yummy even with the dry patties. Overall if they just tweaked a couple of things with the sauce proportions and the cook on the meat, and even more simple things like removing excess oil, I would have easily given them one more star. However it's just not quite good enough to be better than even an In-n-Out double double given the difference in price and quality.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Loved Super Duper! It has a great atmosphere, good prices, and they use meat raised by responsible farming standards. Oh, and all their packaging, straws, etc. are made from plants and are biodegradable, which is always great.

I got the veggie burger (the hummus was awesome). My husband got a regular burger and said it easily trumps In-N-Out. (That's a huge compliment coming from him--a big In-N-Out fan.)

I only have one word of advice: don't order the garlic fries unless you REALLY love garlic. I'm just a medium garlic fan, so I do wish I had gotten the plain fries. Even still, the aged cheddar was awesome, and the fries themselves were crispy and perfect.

I love Super Duper burger and will probably never find another fast food burger joint to take it's place!
author: Samantha D.

description:
We stumbled into this place not expecting much and I ordered a mini-burger with bacon and a side of garlic fries.

Wow, the food was great!  

The burgers were good.. juicy and seasoned well.  The garlic fries were extremely garlicy (is that a word?) and the cheese was sharp, which is right up my alley taste wise.

The biggest surprise though, was their pickles.  After the 3rd time I said, 'These are really good pickles!', my friend pointed out they make their own pickles at the store.

The food was great, the service was friendly, now I just wish they had one in monterey county.

On a side note, while my garlic fries were great, my friend got some with a lot of garlic, so much it made his eyes cry.  I had a taste and it was easily two or three times more garlic than mine.  My taste buds were screwed up for the rest of the night but I don't mind because I love garlic.  So don't order the garlic fries unless you really love garlic!
author: eddy r.

description:
Super Duper Burgers were def super duper! 

It's similar to the counter where you customize your burgers except you have limited choices. It's more of a walk in, order, and sit type of restaurant. The burgers comes in two sizes, "super duper burger 8 oz" or the "mimi 4 oz" burger. Don't let the names fool you because they're both pretty normal sizes. I got the 8 oz super duper burger & it was as big as any burger you would get. My burger was just a regular burger with guacamole and a sunny side egg. The egg is very fragile so when you hold onto the burger, the yolk will come melting out. Don't worry though, the messier the food, the better it is! 
 
The only thing I didn't really like about the burgers was that it was a bit salty for me. Otherwise, it was really good. The side pickles are amazing (if you like it salty). Their organic soft serve ice cream is a must. it's guilt free & it completes your meal.

Pros: Good burgers, quick, easy, and affordable.
Cons: Limited outside seating, could be too salty.
author: Uyen L.

description: I've been stopping by here on my way home and grabbing a mini-burger as a snack before dinner a lot recently.  Best cheap burger option in the neighborhood.  And fast.
author: Matt C.

description: this place by far has one of the better burgers.   To sit down is kind of a hassle sometimes its to packed. But on other hand burgers were great lots of flavor and the fries were on point.  And service was amazing.
author: Sebastian P.

description: Pretty good. Great ingredients and toppings but I prefer a thicker patty.
author: Barrett P.

description: Pretty much one of the best burgers but the cashier girl wasn't to friendly but the burger made up for it!!!!!!
author: Javier M.

description:
It's awesome how much value you get at this place. $4.50 for a "mini burger" that isn't miniature at all. With that said, it's quite difficult for me to have to give this place 3 stars, even though the bang for the buck you get here is pretty high.

At regular lunch hours, the line is staggering. However once you place your order you'l get your food pretty quickly. We might have waited around 15-20 minutes to get our food.

Although the beef and bun were delicious, I was disappointed that they ran out of portobello mushroom. I opted instead for the regular sliced mushroom, but the damage was already done. How could you not have your advertised mushroom at the middle of the lunch hour? 

In addition, the garlic fries were decent. Not as garlicy as I had hoped - I always want MORE garlic. It seems like Super Duper makes a lot of money from fries as each tray only contains a small amount. 

This place has self-serve pickles, and for that, I salute you.
author: Jason T.

description:
Delicious!

Cool vibe!  Cool staff!  Great location!
author: John L.

description: OMG this place is amazing, I only wish they had it back home in Dallas, randomly stumbled upon it while in SF traveling with a friend, Thank God cause I'm the meat lover & he's a vegetarian, & we both came out happy ha ha;-) You can pile on tons of stuff on your burger & it's oh so delicious & frssh, sweet potato fries were amazing as well, check this place out for a nice casual dining experience:-)
author: Lady G.

description: Seriously a must if you're in the mood for a proper burger! I added avocado and egg... WOW!! Plus the garlic fries
author: Ludwig M.

description:
Went here today, and YUM! Best burger I have had in a long time! Super juicy! I did not want to get to the last bite, because it was so delicious!!  I did get it lettuce wrapped, and no bread, and I could have seriously ate two of them!!

But, I splurged on the fresh cut fries with three dipping sauces ... fantastic! Hubby got the garlic fries, and ate them all before he even ate his burger! LOL

We are leaving the area soon, and I will have to go back before we move!!
author: Julee E.

description:
Checked out this place for a late night burger before catching Bart home... AMAZING! Between the high quality meat used in their burger (WARNING GRAB NAPKINS!!) to their fantastic customer service. Massive shout out to Aiden at the register who made my first experience an amazing one (give him a raise!) he gave great recommendations on what to eat, add to my burger and drink then checked up on us at our table half way through. The pickles they serve were fabulous and have a great bite at the end, munch on a bowl of them! Overall 5 star place an I can't wait to come back!

Ps.... Add an egg to your burger... YUMMM!
author: Michelle W.

description:
I had to write an update because I feel the quality has gone up since the last time I reviewed these guys.

Lately, I've been getting the Super Burger with Everything on it, Bacon, Cheese, Grilled Onions, and Jalapeños.

It is awesome!  

They've also improved the fries.  They are crunchier from the double oil dip.  

Sometimes the beef is under seasoned, but that happens from time to time in any restaurant.  It's also extremely greasy, so expect a pool of meat juice to collect in your wrapper throughout the eating process.

The Cookies and Cream Super Shake is awesome too!  Bits of oreos and that sweet cold yumminess cannot disappoint.

The homemade pickles are delicious.  I wish I knew what they used so I can make it at home.

If you're craving a quick, under $10 burger, why would you go anywhere else?
author: John M.

description: My daughter said we needed to go to this San Fran burger joint. They have many locations. Waited in line 10 min, placed order and waited another 10 min for food. Super Duper burger with everything was tasty but very messy, very greasy. Garlic fries also were surprisingly good but also very greasy.
author: R. S.

description:
This place, was awesome.

1.Mini Burger Combo (1 patty with cheddar cheese, fries, fountain drink)
-Fantastic! I don't know what they did but the burgers had crispy edges but still juicy on the inside. It was really fresh and so delicious! Perfect size too - not overwhelming like some burgers can be but not at all small.

2. Garlic Fries
-I ordered them but didn't receive them. Only got plain fries. Reason why they lost 1 star! Could've gone back up to fix the order but the line was way too long to even care anymore. lol.

3. Homemade Pickles 
-I'm a huge fan of pickles and their homemade ones were delicious. It was sweet and spicy at the same time. It kind of reminded me of having some Asian nuances to it.

4. Staff was friendly at the counter and you put away your own trash and trays.

Definitely need/want to go back!
author: Kat O.

description:
Truly a healthy option for burgers. There are several locations around town. To answer your questions, the burgers are meat. I had a burger with two patties, and they are juicy, not dry, on toasted buns, and home made spicy pickles. 
It's a burger join, fires, shakes, etc just use organic products to make them. 
Stop in you can have a juicy burger and feel good about it.
author: Ahmad B.

description:
This place is so good, I went back a second time before I left San Francisco (on vacation). The mini burger, medium with everything plus cheese (which I had both times) is possibly the best burger I've ever tasted. I don't get the In-N-Out Burger love, sorry Californians! This place is so much better! Tried both the regular fries and garlic fries. They were ok, but the burgers are the stand out. My boyfriend also had the chicken sandwich and said it was the tastiest he's ever eaten.

This was the best place we ate in the US. I wish we had this in Australia.
author: Amelia J.

description:
The only thing that keeps this from 5 Stars is the wait, the pickles (gross!), and them messing up the wifeys burger then delivering a lesser one.

Food- 4 Stars
Very Very good cheeseburgers. I got the double with an egg and some other goodies. I was not disappointed, it was good, juicy, tasty, etc.

Wifey's burger was fubar'd (completely wrong). When she took it back they quickly replaced it, but her's was not as correctly done as mine (a bit over cooked and dry). 

Fries were good and the dipping sauces are so worth it.

Atmosphere- 3 Stars
Cool inside, but the line kind makes half or more of the seats a bit awkward.

Value- 3 Stars. Nothing great, but a decent deal for some awesome burgers and fries.
author: Alexi A.

description: The food is ok but nothing spectacular. Ordering is a slow process. The chicken is a bit dry but at least it's organic. Burgers are pretty good. Fries are average. The prices are a little on the expensive side if you add toppings.
author: John G.

description: Had a mini burger and my friend had a chicken sandwich. Mini burger was just right size for me. My friend said her chicken sandwich was awesome! Great! Not very expensive! One more thing, their house pickles is really good! I would recommend it!
author: Joy L.

description: My second visit here this week while visiting SF  The burgers are excellent.  Meat is fresh and scooped onto the grill. I tried the organic egg over easy with chambozola blue cheese. An excellent choice
author: P S.

description:
We stumbled upon this place on the way to the theatre.  Located in the drab financial district with accompanying drab storefront.  There was'nt much else to choose from at this time in the area, but we had to eat, so.....

WOW!  We had the chipolte chicken sandwich, the double burger, and single burger
and everything - everything - was perfect; the bread and all that was between the buns was wonderful.  Our son has room for a soft serve cone and even that was a step above.

Happy staff.

Give them a try.
author: Rick C.

description: Expensive but a must try burger joint in the city. The shakes and garlic fries are something you have to order. Burgers are somewhat small but taste great. This spot may have the best garlic fries. service is great but seating can be hard if you come during peak hours.
author: Ryan G.

description: Homemade Pickles that's all I got to say. Best place that I have been for my time here in SF. Love there Garlic fries but be awarded that if your going out afterwards to bring gum and to eat the fries with chipotle sauce.
author: Rosa A. F.

description: I just don't get how the reviews are so high. Thoroughly disappointed for the third time. The fries are pretty bland and the burgers are way too greasy.
author: Aakash P.

description: Great burger! Pommes Frittes is magnificient. Only cons are that it is little too expensive and it is very hard to find a seat in restaurant. Embracing the food getting system where you can sit and wait for your item to start blank so that you know when your food is ready to pick up.
author: Marko Ć.

description: Very nice burger and garlic fries. Also tried the soft ice cream which was great too. I think this place is generous so u can have enough with a mini burger and kids cone
author: Omar M.

description: Had the Garlic Fries and the Super Duper Burger with Cheese. Both were beyond awesome! The garlic fries were topped with some aged cheese and they were still not super greasy. For the really really small price of the burger, the quality was just too good. The patty was super super juicy and flavorful. Though very basic (bun, patty, lettuce, tomato, grilled onions & cheese) I would definitely say this is one of the best burgers I have ever had! The only reason I took a star out was for their slippery stairs. Me and my husband, both almost tumbled down. They really need to fix those.
author: S A.

description:
I feel a little ill right now, not in a bad food way, in a "wow, that was so good I refused to stop even though I knew I should" way.

Their shakes are magical, their super duper burgers are exactly that. I want it every day.

I have trouble sentence right now, too full.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Ah, Super Duper, bless you for being open on Sundays.  You rescued me and my workmates from many hungry afternoons that would otherwise have been filled with microwave burritos and sadness.

It's true that I am a little fatter now, because of you. But then I could never say "no" to your delicious sauce-slathered burger patties.  I work in China Basin now, and although we will never be together again, I wish you the best.

To those of you still in reach of this place: walk inside.  Order a Super Burger from the friendly tattooed hipster behind the register.  Insist that the bun be filled with all their finest free toppings, plus avocado and an organic fried egg.  Apply pickles and ketchup.

Then stuff it in your mouth like a champion and reflect on how good life really is.
author: Christopher J.

description:
I love their burgers!  
And best yet, their organic vanilla soft serve.  They're so delicious!!!  I just wish there were more locations in the South Bay where I work.
Also, their prices are more reasonable than some of the comparable "trendy burger joints".
author: Harper L.

description:
S o to be honest, I didn't think there was anything special here on my first try
U nderappreciated it apparently, cause I found myself returning time and time again
P erfect explanation why:  The burgers are amazing
E asily could mistake this as fast food quality, but it's definitely better than that
R eigns superior in its niche somewhere between fast food and gourmet burger status

D efinitely start with the Mini Burger your first go-round -- it truly is a regular size
U nlike normal fast food, Super Duper's patties are very juicy and flavorful
P lus you get a expansive selection of toppings to choose from
E very now and then, I pick up an order of Garlic Fries (they really load on the garlic)
R emember to grab all the complimentary pickles you can -- they're awesome!
author: Anthony N.

description: My kids thought it was one of the best.  It was yummy, a little salty.  French fries were good.  Not enough seatings, pickles on the side was great.  Price just ok for the size.  We still hope they come to our town... (OC, California)
author: Mio F.

description:
Had the opportunity to eat lunch here Saturday...I love neighborhood burger joints, so was looking forward to it.

The choices were pretty extensive, but all burger choices centered around the super duper and the mini.  Being a self-respecting slob, I wouldn't be caught dead with the mini, so ordered the super duper w/swiss and bacon for myself, and swiss for the wife.  First oops...no swiss cheese.  Had to go to cheddar.  Ok, no big deal...also ordered garlic fries.

So my bad for not reading the fine print (which I'm not sure exists)...the mini is NOT a slider kinda burger...rather, it's a four ounce patty...and the super duper is two of them (it's says more than a bit when a "mini" now means "standard size" in America).  Sooooo, we both ended up with an extra patty that we didn't want.  Luckily, this was in SF, so a person of the street got some extra protein that day.

Second oops...garlic fries does NOT mean put some garlic salt on fries, guys!  That's just sad.  And wrong.

So overall, not a bad place (certainly great for sidewalk people watching....always entertaining in SF), but if you're a burger snob, there are likely far better places in the area.  Stay tuned, because next time I'm up there, I'm going to explore exactly that.
author: Bill O.

description:
Not bad Yelp Elite event here. Solid burgers, really good portobello - however the buns were the big let down! Fries were good, though, especially garlic fries.

PROS:
- Burgers juicy, ok toppings (there was one with portobello, one with blue cheese though I couldn't really taste it).
- Portobello burger was great! The portobello had a real nice breading and the edges had a good crisp to it.
- Loved the garlic fries! Lots of flavor, good crunch but not too hard. The fries were a little thin for my liking but that is a personal preference - they were perfect for my friend.
- The milkshake shots we got upon entering were AWESOME!
- Desserts pretty good - vanilla soft serve on a sugar cone with chocolate coating, mini sundaes (the toppings were a little artificial but not bad for free samplers).

CONS:
- The buns on the burgers were really bad! They were clearly cheap, stale, and slathered with butter and toasted slightly to try to cover up their cheapness.
- The chicken patty was pretty bad too. Overcooked, hard, not too much flavor.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Just WOW.

Amazing burgers!
I went there twice and tried the Super Burger it was amazing. The Garlic fries are great too you have to try them there.
author: Zaid A.

description: A must try if you are in the San Francisco. I am visiting from the DC area and I must say my experience was great! The staff was equally great and gave me tips on best places to visit with my son while we are here. We will definitely be visiting again before going home!!
author: AJ T.

description:
Two words: Garlic Fries. The end.

Really though, their fries are delicious! They're also very generous with how much they top their fries. I could almost say that I could order one set of garlic fries and a set of regular fries to disperse between the two but I be lying to myself. 

You can also help yourself to their very own pickles! Burger was also very good. Add a portobello mushroom
author: Debbie T.

description:
3.5

I was originally going to give them 4 but after carefully consideration a 3.5 is more reasonable. The food they serve is everything you would find at like in-n-out or any fast food burger joint but they fancy it up by having nice cheeses and beer. I didn't particularly like the chicken burger. The chicken was a bit dry and the raw onions were very overpowering. The other burgers were good. I liked it except how the bun was a sponge that soaked up all the grease. I wouldn't mind coming here for the burgers but not for the fries. The fries were a dry mess! The soft serve ice cream was delicious. Super shake was good since its free but I wouldn't pay for them.

The place has plenty of seating and very spacious. Like another reviewer said it has a very industrial feel to it. There is a small upstairs seating area in addition to large downstairs seating. 

With the super shakes and the beer on tap I would say this is a quick burger joint for adults where the prize is getting buzzed. 

I would definitely like to come here and give them a try and review their customer service.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Outstanding value, great burgers, friendly service, good price

The burgers are good, and compare well with In and Out in my opinion.   Good quality meat, grilled perfectly, and seemingly not over salted so you can savor the natural flavors.   Garlic fries were pretty good too and had a nice garlicky and cheesy flavor.  I think the buns are pretty tasty as well.  While a bit pricey, compared to the other choices in this area, I think this is an attractive bargain.  Nice service and the staff keep the place clean and presentable.
author: Bad News S.

description:
Last night was my first time at Super Duper Burger, and it was delicious!
 - Burger: I had a mini burger with cheese and bacon, and it really hit the spot. Warning: it *is* greasy.
 - Fries: they aren't anything special, but they are tasty. I wouldn't say the three dips are worth $1.50, though.
 - Wine: their house white wine is good, and would probably please a lot of palettes. It was chardonnay when I went, and I hate oak-y chardonnay, so I was very happy when it didn't have a strong oak flavor.
author: Krista J.

description: Yummy burgers. The fries are better here than the Castro location. If you haven't had a chance to try Super Duper's succulent burgers, do so now!
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Heard about this place from a friend, and decided to check it out with some people before a Giants game. This place is definitely an upgrade from the typical fast food burger, and I personally prefer it to In-n-Out. I'm going to rank the 3 things I ate here in the order of preference:

1: The burger is extremely flavorful and juicy, albeit a bit greasy and messy. I got the Super Duper burger which has the double patty and is extremely filling. The ingredients were fresh, and the bun was really good too. 

2. The home-made pickles were my second favorite item served here. They are not briny, but have a nice balance between sweet and tart. The best thing about these are that they are free and AYCE!

3. The garlic fries were my third favorite item, but not because they were bad. They were extremely crispy and had a great garlic flavor. Personally I prefer my garlic fries to be fat and a bit soggy like at AT&T park, but that's just me. The fries also come with cheese which was nice. These get placed third mainly because I could've eaten those pickles all day and the burger was Super Duper filling. 

Overall this place is amazing and it has a great location in the city for the next time the burger craving hits me. Next time I might try to get the mini-burger and try to enjoy the fries a bit more. Also, the shakes here look GOOD and I might need to try one.
author: Josh Y.

description:
I was a little disappointed in the food I ordered. The burger was half raw and when I mentioned it to someone working there they said that's how they always make them. 

I also thought the garlic/cheese fries would be a lot more garlicky than they were.  :-(
author: Chylene K.

description:
Had two meals here.  One dinner, and one breakfast on our trip to SF.  The burgers were very good.  I really thought mine was nicely done, with cheese and bacon.  The garlic fries were also pretty great.  They definitely weren't shy with the garlic :)

The breakfast sandwiches were on the smaller side of things.  But still, not bad.

Prices were average to slightly higher than average.  But nothing outrageous.
author: Brian P.

description: Very good meat. Probably the best one I've had in a hamburger in a long time.. Not impressed with the garlic/cheese fries, too much garlic and the fries were mushy
author: Marco P.

description: Get the Super Duper burger. It was delicious. Fast service. I will definitely be coming back
author: Luis C.

description: Super Duper used to be my go-to burger joint in Union Square, but after today, I may need to go elsewhere. First, I learned that mayonnaise and ranch are no longer considered condiment, but have been upgraded to "sides." My friend and I individually ordered them to accompany our fries and we were charged $0.50 for the condiments. Oh you fancy huh? Second, I found a puddle of blood next to my burger. Not the most appetizing sight. Believe me, I knew I was eating the flesh of a cow, but I didn't need it to be that "fresh." Also, I am very sure that the blood is not from my patty because I had cut into my burger and the center looked well done. Sigh, am I going to have to turn vegetarian now?
author: Lily T.

description: Tasty burger but it stays like a lump in your stomach for hours after eating it. Great toppings and the jalapeños are nice and spicy but the double patty is just too much burger.
author: Alex A.

description:
For a person stumbling off a plane to SF from snowy Buffalo, SF feels downright balmy. And when the temperature rises, it seems, things start to happen in the body of a red-blooded American. The sense organs register mistakenly that it's almost summer, triggering the brain to stop craving warm soup and start craving -- you guessed it -- burgers and ice cream. Memories of Fourth of July picnics and Labor Day barbeques surface in the vision centers of the mind, making one salivate in remembrance of burgers past. Ancient evolutionary processes take over and begin to operate the limbs. 

Thus, I have only vague memories of checking into my hotel and going out to forage for food, and first finding myself blinking under the bright lights of Super Duper.

What happened next, though, I remember vividly. I spotted a twistie cone on the menu, and demanded chocolate and vanilla swirl. Both flavors together! It's summer! Let's do this! I also ordered a veggie burger.

Within minutes, I had my pre-summer bounty and was shuffling back off to my room with my, uh, kill. I finished the delicious, rich soft-serve ice cream on the way, shivering in the late-evening drizzle that was now cooling my body temperature and reminding me that it was still winter in SF, and this summer hallucination was now mostly in my mind. As I ascended to my room, my prefrontal cortex had kicked back in, just in time for me to register that I was now eating THE BEST VEGGIE BURGER OF MY LIFE. The bun was fresh and chewy, the patty just salty and savory enough, the vegetables fresh and crisp, and and the hummus and avocado on top brought it all together. I must have sat there with the empty wrapper in silence at the W for a full minute, just trying to comprehend what had happened to me. 

The next day, it was forty degrees and drizzly, with a whipping rain that soaked into my boots. I didn't care. Super Burger had given me a vision of summer that I will carry with me forever. Or at least until I find a tastier veggie burger and a more delicious organic soft-serve than theirs. At this point, I don't know if it'll ever happen ....
author: Ryan W.

description:
While in San Francisco and only able to select eateries within a certain radius, I quickly learned the value and skill of making menus work for me and my gluten sensitivities.

Thankfully, making Super Duper's menu work in my favour was pretty easy with their super Salad menu. Grilled chicken salad with avocado and Portobello (for those of you playing at home: mushroom)? Deal. 

The way my Australian self sees it is Super Duper is akin to our Grill'd. Freshly made burgers, salads and fries at a reasonable price with a fast food feeling. 

An ok experience for a quick lunch with colleagues but not one I'd be rushing back to recreate.
author: Lani P.

description: If you want a fast simple lunch, this is a great stop. Simple burger and fries. The chivken breast is a easy choice for deliciousness.  They have garlic fries, which are miss named, they should be parmesan fries. They only use fresh inheritance,  and lets all admitt it on occassion you just need a cheese burger and fries. Simple straight to the point and consistantly nom.
author: Richard M.

description: The staff here is friendly, and the burgers are amazing. My favorite is to order a cheddar cheese burger with garlic fries, and have a oreo smoothie while waiting for the burgers to cook. Usually I'm so full I can't finish!
author: Xiao C.

description:
Spotted this little gem while trying to find the children's museum and was certain I would never find it again but then I did!

Came here for a late lunch with my nephew. We both had the mini burger, he had a strawberry shake and we split the garlic fries. Let me tell you little man devoured almost the entire burger and half the order of fries! If he does that you know it is good. 

The burgers were well put together and the garlic fries weren't overly garlicky. Just right. One thing I like about their burgers is that they weren't greasy or heavy but very flavorful. Had a little sip of his shake and it was jam packed with strawberries which is always a welcomed surprised.
author: Carly C.

description: Would go back in a heartbeat. Love the nice side free homemade pickles! I like how their jalapenos, grilled onions are free toppings. I got the mini burger - med rare w/ the mentioned above andddd got portabella mushrooms as well. I love their milk shakes! I got the cookies and cream one w/ a side of garlic fries.
author: Jenna L.

description:
A decent burger is not rocket science, but a great one is alchemy. Somewhere in the middle of that is Super Duper. It's a solid burger with a good griddle crust on a quality beef patty. They're decently priced too, but their menu is engineered quite well for the upsell. Just two bucks more to double the size of my burger? 8oz is totally doable! Add fries or just get the meal? Sure. $10? I guess that's standard. Exclamation point!

Everything I've had here has been done right and with excellent ingredients, yet not so cheech as to be too clean, tasteless and expensive as to keep this might thing out of the hands of the populous. And thank goodness I don't have to walk all the way to 6th for some Pearl's... which reminds me, did they arrest that crazy kitchen knife swinging dude? And what ever happened to the guy that caught on fire in that porn store on 6th? These are questions that may arise in my mind waiting in this super duper line.
author: Roy M.

description: I wasn't exposed to good organic joints till about two years ago. When I first heard the name of the place it sounded pretty funny. Visited the city with a good friend and found myself in the most delicious burger place of my whole life. I have yet to find a restaurant better than this. This is what burgers should taste like
author: Jose M.

description:
Pretty darn good burgers and shakes. A little pricier than expected, but they have quick service. It has a good vibe and awesome interior design.
Definitely worth a try.
author: Cade S.

description: I don't eat meat anymore, and struggle finding a good burger joint with tasty veggie burgers! This place hit it! Veggie burger so good, make you want to slap yo momma!!! Yum frickin yum!!! And the garlic fries... Perfect with a light dusting of cheese! Plus! They use some organic ingredients!!! Even their icecream cone was organic! Just wonderful! Will be eating here again tomorrow!!!!
author: Tanya M.

description: Very solid burger though med rare should be the standard. Very fine fries m chocolate shake. Quick too and cute decor.
author: Rick N.

description: The line was long at lunch. The burger was made well, but I was not strategic when I tried eating it. Gets messy fast. Pretty good burger, but not mind blowing. Portobello mushroom and cheddar was really good though, would recommend.
author: Sameer A.

description:
I'm so glad this was so close to the Westin on 3rd.  I went here twice on my last trip to SF.

These are awesome burgers. Looks like an upscale burger franchise. Nice modern setting, etc.  They're smaller than the average burger but it hits the spot.  I'd actually feel more guilty if it was regular size.  The burgers themselves are pretty juicy.  Just an awesome burger.  There aren't too many variations, just a "mini" and Super burger (about same size just another patty).  Watch out for the homemade pickles, they are really sour.

There's few burger joins that do burgers AND fries well.  Most have awesome burgers but have lame fries.  This place is one of the few that does both really well.  The fries were really good.  They probably do the two-fry technique because they were crispy on outside and soft in middle.  Definitely not the pre-packaged fries.  I got the garlic fries with the three dipping sauces (mayo-based).  Good stuff
author: Denver M.

description:
A million apologies to this location, I recently wrote a review for Super Duper meant for this location, and posted it to the new one on Mission. Since I have been to the one on Mission, I'll leave it, as the review fits it as well. 

One thing I'll add before pasting the original review, is that this location is my FAVORITE location of all the Super Dupers. They have the best employees by far. And as long as that line can get, they get us in and out fast.

Still, here is a copy of the review meant for this location:

Why go all the way to Fisherman's Wharf for In-and-Out when this is ten times better and still reasonably priced? I crave their chicken sandwiches and garlic fries. In fact I'm drooling all over my keyboard at 2:30 AM as I type this.

My friend and I treat this place like a bar. 4.50 for a beer- it's probably the cheapest place in that area for one. They've only got a few selections but they are GREAT selections-- Scrimshaw Pilsner, Racer 5 IPA, Great White, and Lagunitas, I believe. Hit me!

There is the occasional bum. However unlike any other establishment I've been in, they tend to get the winners. These are some of the most aggressive, most out-of-it homeless people I have ever seen. And I'm sure I see at least one every time I go in. And each time one of their gallant and courageous male workers swoops in and gets them out before they do any damage. Swoon!

In sum; great food, great beer, dreamy employees.
author: Raquel R.

description:
Pros:
Fast service
good location
Food was on the +side of average 

Cons:
Burger/fries were A little too greasy for my liking as both my burger and fries were dripping grease. 
price was a little high for what you get in terms of value.
I asked for Sause during my order and had to ask again when my food was ready. I had to wait a couple minutes to get noticed and The person I asked made it seem like I was bothering him.


For $20 I got two hamburgers and one French fry. For that price  you can get a sit down meal in some restaurants
author: Josh O.

description:
So it was Burger Bar or Super Duper and i'm glad we tried Super Duper instead. You can walk by it easily on Market. It has outdoor seating although not sure if you want to eat there and be bothered my passer-bys on Market if you know what I mean. 

Anyways..love the decor. Stainless steel with natural wood which i'm seeing quite often. Seating inside and 2nd floor. No elevator in sight. 1 person bathroom for men and women. No diaper changing pad, but hopefully that'll change. They have highchairs although we didn't know until after. They're hidden by the bathrooms.

My husband and I both got the super burger ( 2 patties ) with the fixin's which is FREE, except for the cheese and bacon. Burger was awsome. Seasoned very well. Ordered garlic fries which came with 3 types of aioli dips and a soft serve.  No lemonade but ice tea is available for free refills. Homemade pickles are a must! 

We didn't get to try the shake, or the portobello burger, but next time. They serve beer as well! We're definitely coming back. Not too soon though cause I don't think I can eat like this every weekend, although the hubby can ;-) 

Beware...the burger is GREASY! So hold your burger carefully with a handful of napkins ;-)
author: Carolyn S.

description:
I love a good burger and Super Duper does not disappoint!! Everything is as fresh as can be. The staff is friendly, happy and fast!!

My favorite thing Super Duper has to offer is the HOMEMADE PICKLES!!! They rock!! Strong on the vinegar.
author: Ben M.

description:
Best tasting burger? Check. I came here on a recommendation from a coworker and was satisfied. This place definitely puts quality over...well, size?

A friend and I split a Super Duper Burger, and the tiny size of our order kind of put us off. However, one bite in and we were sold on the juicy flavor. Fries are tiny but crispy and tasty. I spent the rest of the day at work trying to cover up my delicious burger breath.

What really sold me was the customer service. The line moved quickly, but the cashier still had time to look at me and my friend, ask us all the right questions (Cheese? Do you ladies want the burger cut in half for you? Glass of water?) and we were seated in no time. I love it!

One star off for the size. If I had a little more money I would have definitely had the burger to myself....or maybe two. Mmm, I've got to come back.
author: Alexandra M.

description: Super duper with cheese and bacon no tomato. Yes. Cooked medium, the burger is juicy and big enough to fill you up alone. Compliment it with a shake and some garlic fries if you need something extra. One star off for the grease.
author: Dan Z.

description: 5 stars becuase it was awesome. Its just a good burger and fry place so it deserves it. They do what they do well! Yum
author: L L.

description: Can't go wrong with a burger from Super Duper. Make sure you grab some garlic fries too!
author: Mike P.

description: My favorite burger place! This restaurant is no doubt my go-to burger joint whenever I'm craving a super juicy burger! Their burgers are amazing, so juicy and tasty! Very well made. They have pretty good fries too, but I usually opt for the cheesy garlic fries they have, so good! I also find that all of their restaurant have cool rustic, modern decor and super friendly staff! Definitely a great to go, on a fun outing with friends or a midnight craving! Great place!
author: Aaron H.

description: This is my favorite fast food burger place. Super Duper (haha...) high quality, has beer, AND has an awesome cookies and cream milk shake. You order, grab a table and wait for your food to come out. Service is fast, but this place gets PACKED.
author: Christine C.

description:
Damn good burgers. Damn good garlic fries.

I've only taken food to go here, and frankly the seating doesn't seem all that inviting. Place is usually packed. Expect a line of 8-10 people at most any time. 

My one complaint would be that the cashier will tell you that your shake will be done soonest, and will hand you one of those light-up coasters so you know when your order is ready. But they don't bother to light up your coaster for the shake. So it just sits behind the counter melting. And everyone is too busy to pass them out. Three visits so far, and always the same. 

Three and a half stars, but I'm rounding up to four, because maybe you won't order a shake.
author: TJ P.

description:
Holy cow, the food here is amazing. My favorite combination is the kid's dipped cone (good for the wait), a Super Duper with everything on it plus grilled onions and the amazing garlic fries. Grass fed, free range, local -- here's to fast food with a conscience.

FYI, if this one is closed, there's another Super Duper about a block away in the Metreon that holds slightly later hours.
author: M S.

description:
Hello
It's an awesome burger place their ambience is really nice for a fast food or burger joint.

There chicken sandwich is the by far the best I had and their garlic fries are very crispy and garlic flavor is aromatic and it's sure to tickle your taste buds.

Their veggie patty burger is also really good ,recommend for veggie lovers also they have options for them also.

Their organic ice cream is really creamy and chocolate will just indulge you into it and you will not realize and just get lost in the creamy and choclaty flavor.
author: Simranjeet S.

description:
Burger size - Great sized burger (ordered a double with bacon and cheese)

Burger taste - The first bite was great, but then every bite after that didn't have much flavor. One thing to note is that I ordered a medium-rare burger and when I received it, there was a lot of grease. That isn't a bad thing for me, but I wasn't used to having so much grease on my bun.

Overall it's an OK burger IMO - nothing special.
author: Alfonzo J.

description:
While waiting for a bus in San Francisco for almost 45 minutes, we got hungrier and hungrier. So we decided to go back to market street to grab a bite, not knowing that at 9pm almost everything is closed out on that part of the city. 

Wandering around and looking for food we came across Super Duper. At that moment we had the choice of eating at McDonald or trying out this new place with the weird name. The choice was clear.

The menu at this place is very small. They only have one type of burger and a chicken sandwich, salads and some sides. I don't know if we were too hungry by then and could have eaten rocks and found it delicious, but the food was very good. 

Oh, and I almost forgot about the garlic fries.. mmhhh 5 stars for the garlic fries and why don't all food places in the world offer garlic fries?? Now I wonder if there is a Super Duper in Las Vegas. I have to go and find out. NOW.
author: Shokouh H.

description:
My cousin brought me here and I really liked it. Burgers are made perfectly and the fries are really good. I love how they have home-made pickles and when they run out, they still have jars lined up at the top of their shelves that can be cracked open and eaten. 

This place always seem busy and doesn't look like there's enough places to sit when it's super busy.
author: Christina L.

description:
Between Gotts and Bistro Burger, Super Duper is definitely one of my top 3 favorite burger joints in the City. The difference with Super Duper is the grease and juices they leave on the burger that makes the burger even that more tasty. 

The location is great and the staff is really friendly. One plus to Super Duper is that they serve alcohol and can even spike your milkshake with vodka which isn't half bad. The fries are always on point and their pickles are homemade. I really dig the natural and organic layout of this Super Duper which directly ties into their mission and message. The crowd is a mix of everybody but mainly shoppers from Westfield Mall and workers from the area. Do not go there during lunch hours on the weekdays because the line gets ridiculously long. I recommend the Super Duper burger with Blue Cheese.
author: Javier G.

description:
Pros:
The burger does live up to its name: it was very juicy, loaded with toppings, and pleasantly surprised me by staying intact as I devoured it, stopped only by interludes of their crispy anything-but-regular fries.

Cons: 
While I was warned that it would be messy, it was neither the juice nor the toppings that kept even me, a man of many napkins, struggling for reinforcements. The continuous ooze of liquid shine onto my hands definitely gave me pause as I finished the last bites amidst my nearly translucent tray.

The burger is definitely good, but it's greasy to to the point that I wouldn't regularly make the tradeoff.
author: David H.

description:
I was really torn between giving this place 3 or 4 stars.. and here's why. I came here for the Yelp Elite event, and got to sample lots of stuff. I thought all the combinations of sauces and toppings in each burger (chicken sandwich/fried portabello/philly/blue cheese burger) were all spot on and tasty.  I had a slight preference for the blue cheese burger, because they threw in a really fat hunk of cheese right over the meat and it was so so delicious (see my picture).  The fries were crunchy, which is my style of fry, so I was all over those too.

A few things I didn't like: 
the buns on the burger were OK- and the pickles were just gross. They tasted like really tart vinegar.. I'm not sure. This is a bummer because pickles should be the bomb.  Also, as much as the food was tasty, I found burger portions to be a bit small for $6.50 a pop..

Here's the point though- unless you treck over to In N Out, there really isn't much competition around- so I'll probably come back here or go to the Castro location if I'm craving some tasty American comfort fare.

What also sealed the deal: They serve Racer 5 on tap!! Very friendly staff and the decor is awesome. Modern meets industrial but very simple. High ceilings and very spacious. 

Too bad I don't work nearby! (Or maybe that's a good thing..)
author: Roxane W.

description:
I was in the area and wanted to grab a pretty late lunch. I've heard good things about this place, so my expectations are somewhat high. I came in and it was semi busy on a Wednesday afternoon. The service here is actually pretty good, everyone is extremely nice and helpful, especially the people taking your order. They sell beer in a glass, which is a definite plus. I had the super burger with cheese with a side of garlic fries. The reason why this place gets 3 stars is because the food wasn't good at all. I've decided to write my food review based mostly on Gordon Ramsay lines:

The Burger: It was so oily, America tried to invade it. There was so much grease to it, I couldn't get a good grip on my burger. The beef was so raw, I can still hear it's heartbeat. They say it's cooked medium, but it was definitely medium rare. It was also very warm, like it was heated up by lights and not a grill. I was not impressed.

The Garlic fries: The last time I saw this much grease, it was a John Travolta movie marathon. I could see the garlic, but I couldn't taste it. From all the rave reviews from fellow yelpers and elites, I didn't understand where it was coming from. 

The only saving grace are the beer and the service. The beer is good, on tap, and served in a glass. Every item that they use are sustainable, compostable, and recyclable. That's a good thing, because I had to use an entire forest's worth of napkins from the grease! Once you're finished with your food, you clear it out on the condiment station.

There's decent amount of seating inside and upstairs and outside. I sat at the stools and was surprised that my tray would fit and that I would be able to eat it comfortably.
author: Phan H.

description: Well! I like the burgers, they are busy in prime time but fast also, yet quality not compromised, will go again, highly recommended.
author: Amarjit G.

description:
I like it.  First time I had my burger with egg on top, which was my new discovery.

Fresh garlic bites with the garlic fries, that was a tasty tried. 

I hadn't had a chance to try the organic ice-cream.  Sure will be my next attempt. 

As a causal simple lunch or fill up with your burger's craves, this is one of the place to go.
author: Veronica N.

description:
1. Better burgers than In & Out! (Call me crazy.)

2. Garlic Fries --hit or miss. More of miss than hit. Normally, more cheese, less garlic :(
author: Winn D.

description: This place was packed, but i only waited about 10 minutes to order and eat. The burger tasted great, and the garlic fries were strong but mouth watering. As good as the name suggests!
author: Alex H.

description:
Been to other Super Dupers before and they're ok. This one really grossed me out. The homeless like to come in when it's busy and dip their hands into the pickle jars. The mouthes of the pickle jars are small but some manager to reach in and fish them out with their bare hands. I understand you want to give users the ability to grab pickles for the side, but on Market in downtown SF, anything free within reach is fair game for homeless. 

I would not recommend eating the pickles.
author: D M.

description: Worst mistake coming here. Waited all week while on a trip here from the east coast to try super duper. I ordered a burger with nothing but cheese and extra sauce. I got a burger with extra vegetables and no sauce. Unfortunately, it was a takeout order. So I got back to my hotel and opened the bag to find a burger not at all what I ordered. I would never go here again.
author: Alana C.

description: Oh hell yeah!   Wonderful burger, just gimme more grease!
author: Greg D.

description: Sooooooo delicious and the service was awesome. It was rush lunch hour and these people were managing to crank out the orders in stellar time. The workers all appear happy and they were so sweet. The place runs like a well oiled machine and the food was impeccable. I had a veggie burger and garlic parmesian fries. Yummy!!!
author: Tali L.

description: Hands down best fresh organic burger in SF! I had the mushroom jack burger with garlic fries. I couldn't finish my burger and really wanted to because every bite was delicious!!!
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description:
Pros: Tasty burgers 
          Spiked shakes
          Garlic fries
          Homemade pickles

Cons: Lousy salad
author: Sway M.

description:
This review is for the Mission/One Market location near the Embarcadero. Since this is a chain, I feel that leaving a review for this location is relevant and appropriate. Visited this location last Sunday evening at 6pm and ordered a double cheeseburger and fries. I picked up my food at the counter and brought it back to my table. I noticed that there was no cheese in the burger and immediately brought it back to the counter. The gentlemen in a yellow shirt with an orange colored pattern looked at it and acknowledged the mistake and said he would take care of it. I walked back to my table and started eating the French fries and noticed that they weren't hot (I shouldn't have been too surprised since I noticed a bit earlier that they were sitting on top of a counter near the fryer for longer than they should have. This is all about timing, why have the fries ready before the burger is cooked and prepared?). They were closer to white than golden brown in color. I decided to not say anything about the fries. My burger was brought back to me a short while later and all the worker did was stuff 2 slices of cold cheese inside. How could this be considered OK? Needless to say this pretty much ruined the entire burger. The cheese made the middle of the burger barely lukewarm and to make matters worse, the bun was also cold and barely toasted.

     I knew it was getting close to closing time so I decided to just let it go. Another reason I was hesitant to bring it up was the aforementioned person at the front of the kitchen wasn't exactly apologetic about the whole incident. I really felt like he was being fairly dismissive about the mistake (that being said, I know it wasn't his fault for the initial mistake). Wouldn't normal protocol have been to at least redo the meat patties and cheese vs stuffing 2 slices of cold cheese inside and re wrapping the burger?
