So essentially, I paid $11.15 for warm fries and a borderline cold burger. I can't recall this happening to me at any other place that I've ordered a burger/fries before. I'll accept some blame for not speaking up initially but this scenario should never have played out the way it did.

    I e-mailed Superduper via their website the following day and never got a response.  I'm preparing myself for whatever excuse is coming for why my message was never replied to.
author: Scott F.

description: UMM YUMMM! I really liked their burger and fries. Good, greasy food. What more could you ask for from a burger? The fries where good too, big and salty. Good prices too. Would defiantly go back.
author: Nikki H.

description: Excellent burgers! Cooked to order and the perfect size! The flavor comes from the quality and is definitely one of the best burgers in the area! They have free, unlimited, house-made pickles in self-service jars too, really can't get much better than that! Their shakes are good and their garlic fries are the bomb! I gave this place a 4 because, although their burgers are quite good they don't seem to stand out a whole lot from other burger joints (based purely on the burgers alone) other than in size; burgers are simple dishes in themselves so there's nothing wrong in the no-frills approach here. Do yourself a favor and try Super Duper!
author: Cye H.

description:
LOVE!!!!!

This place has made it on my official "to do" food list when the hubby and I come to San Francisco. It's also the kind of place that I always tell people about when they ask me where we went when we go to the city. It's that good :-)
I will admit that I haven't had more than 3 items on their menu, but really that's because I CRAVE those 3 things for weeks before we come here lol. First there is their Super Duper Burger with bacon. The meat is flavorful and perfectly cooked, the bun is soft while still standing up to the juicy meat, plenty of cheese, and the bacon is abundant. As it should be ;-) Second is their garlic fries. Not too thick, not too thin and plenty of garlic. Lastly, their homemade pickles. Not exactly a "menu" item because you don't have to order them. You basically just get to help yourself to them. Packed full of flavor and quite zesty, once you get started on them you won't be able to stop!
So, if Super Duper is not on your Bay Area "to do" list already, add it!!! 

P. S If you see what seems like a long line when you approach don't let it deter you from getting your hands on some fantastic food!!! It moves quick and the food is more than worth it ;-)
author: Erica Z.

description: I had the super burger and garlic fries after bar hopping and it was delicious. I personally like better the mini burger (one beef patty) but the two patties was pretty good as well, the garlic fries won't be good for a date night but definitely good with the burger.
author: Patricia D.

description:
BIG fan of this place. There's a ton of good $20 burgers in the city (Spruce and Nopa to name a few), but when you're looking to save a couple of bucks, and STILL have a quality burger, look no further than Super Duper. (Oh In-N-Out, if only you were in a real part of the city).

Burgers can be personalized to your liking, patties are always cooked to a perfect medium, and yes, the garlic fries ARE delicious. Also, do not be fooled by the 'mini' burger, it's more than enough, unless you're starving of course. Finally, the service every time I've gone has been friendly and genuine, regardless of whether they're busy or not. What more can I say about this place? Oh yeah, free pickles.
author: Stan A.

description: this place was all right. i set my expectations a bit too high from all the hype everyone has been saying about it. i got a mini burger and man was it mini and the garlic fries that had cheese on it. it was all right. the meat on the burger is fresh. i can understand that part. special sauce was eh.. overall it was cool. i dont think id come back again or go out of my way but if im with someone sure. i have to admit i was expecting some flavor.
author: Jen D.

description: Went there for my breakfast. I got the bacon and cheese sandwich. Super cheap, fit the bill. The coffee is a little too bitter for my palette. Very quick and friendly staff.
author: Marcela M.

description: Came here based on reviews but left disappointed. Very greasy, and not the best quality meat. You'll be wearing this burger for a while, it sticks to your ribs, you can feel it and smell it after it's gone. It's a big messy pile of greasy mess, I had to use a fork and knife. Garlic fries were ok. Overall, average at best.
author: Yowza A.

description:
OMG!  I think I found a replacement in SF for my favorite burger joint Shake Shack in NYC.  The Super Duper burgers are meaty and grilled to perfection with a carmelized crust.  It's especially tasty with some jalapenos.  The soft serve vanilla/chocolate swirl cone was a nice treat!  

This is not your typical fast food joint because the quality of the food is high and prices are very reasonable.  I'll got the 'mini' burger but will have to try the 'super' double patty burger with fried egg next time.

My new favorite indulgence!
author: Lis A.

description:
First of all - this place is amazing. I am a long time yelp lurker and I created an account just to review Super Duper Burgers.

Quick friendly service, fresh and organic ingredients that you can tell are actually fresh and organic not just advertised as such. Their homemade pickles are to die for and while I didn't try their milkshakes this time, I definitely will next time. And they'll spike them for you :)

Their burgers were a little on the rare-medium rare side when I didn't specify which is great for me but I can see that this would be a turn off for others - make sure you specify well done if you expect your burgers that way.

I will definitely be returning next time I'm craving a burger!!
author: Erin N.

description: This place is pretty good. The only thing I really don't like is the fact that the burgers were covered in grease. The staff was really nice, the meat was juicy, the garlic fries were amazing, and the combo deal cost only $10 for everything. For that price and a burger it definitely deserves a 4 stars.
author: Jacob H.

description:
Super Duper?  I'd call it super average.

It's $10 for a double patty burger and despite the pictures, the standard model only comes with lettuce, tomato, onions and "super sauce" (fries and beverage included).  Cheese is an extra .50 and most other extras are $1 a pop.  The burger is a little bigger than a McDonald's sort of thing and though made of better ingredients, I find the pricing a bit iffy.  Yeah, it's not the pink slime but at the same time part of why I'm eating a burger is for the flavor.

It was ok.  It can't touch In-N-Out but over all, it was fine.  Meaty, not so greasy, but fine.  A decent, quick and easy seat yourself deal on market.  Great if you don't want to violently express your agoraphobia when seeing a movie at the Metreon soon after.
author: Steven R.

description: This place reminds me a lot of Shake Shack only the burgers are a bit juicier. There's a fresh feel to the whole place even if it's still a fast food joint. Remember that they use organic ingredients! That has to count for something. GO!
author: Luis C.

description:
I kinda love this place. I came here on two occasions and it was filled to the brim both times. I've had the Super Duper Burger which is a double patty hamburger. The Niman Ranch beef is cooked to the point where the juice and grease just flows out. The bread, the most important part of any sandwich or burger, is great too. I don't know where they get it.

I've also had their chicken sandwich. I was surprised at how good it is. Big too! For a burger joint I didn't expect the quality of the chicken sandwich to be as good as their burgers. The garlic fries are a good accompaniment with the rest of the food. It might seem like a splurge to get the same sized fries with some cheese and garlic but you won't regret it. I had one of their chocolate strawberry shakes. I found the consistency to be more like chocolate milk although I found the appearance of fresh strawberries a nice touch.

Watching the team behind the counter work their magic is a thing of beauty. You can really tell that they want to make your experience a good one. If you ask them for anything or call them on their errors they will try to fix it quickly. Yeah they could be a little friendlier at the cash register, but who would be super friendly with a long ass line going all the way to the entrance. The decor is different and contemporary.
author: Michael H.

description: Really juicy burgers. Lines can get pretty long.
author: Sundeep R.

description:
My God that was a greasy burger.

It's not like they didn't warn me. Their menu boasts: "Our burgers are cooked medium and are very juicy. Could be messy business!"

As I took a bite of the burger (which smelled and looked delicious by the way), a truckload of greasy-juicy-oily burger fluid started oozing all over the place. A mess indeed. It was overwhelming.

Its not that the burger wasn't delicious. Of course it was, as would any food item dipped in grease. However, the burger left me stinking of oil the entire day and I can't  honestly give more than three stars to that.

The fries and shakes are great though, so don't skimp on these guys.

-----

Distinguishing factor: Grease
author: Nick A.

description: By far "The best chicken sandwich" ever had,  garlic fries are yummy. Must visit.
author: Kranti V.

description:
Whoa dudes. That's a good burger. So good that I'm never going to In 'n' out ever again.

I have been ordering my burgers without cheese lately and it super paid off when I did it here. You know it's a good burger when you cut some fat. It's so good that I think I would eat one of their giant burgers too. 

I can't remember what the bread tasted like. Probably so delicious that I was KO'd from happiness.
author: Margaret S.

description: Came here for a super burger with cheese and bacon I was actually surprised how small the burger was compared to other burger joints in the city. I had a side of garlic fries they tasted ok not the best. I think I won't be coming often because its just not my type of place when it comes to burgers.
author: Peter C.

description: They aren't kidding around with the garlic on the garlic fries! I wasn't starving so I went with the standard single patty burger. It was quite tasty and sufficient with the side of fries. Customizing your ingredients is a little expensive, but it is San Francisco...
author: Ben A.

description:
A delicious, fresh burger for a late lunch after a day of walking around union square shopping. I ordered just the mini burger (4 oz patty), which was just the perfect size for myself who normally finds burgers overwhelming in size. If you have a heartier appetite I'd recommend getting the 8oz double patty or get two minis! 

While I didn't order the fries, they did look quite good on the other patrons tables. My burger came freshly cooked, with the patty still juicy but had a great crust from the flat top. The sesame bun held the lettuce, tomatoes and onions in while soaking up the mayo and super sauce. Can safely say this was the best "fast food" burger I've ever had!

Now despite the fact I enjoyed this burger throughly I had to take 1 star off for an unexpected allergic reaction. I'm not entirely positive if it was the burger, but I started getting super itchy welts on my face and body after my midday lunch :( I do wish they labelled or gave more detailed ingredient listings on their site or in the store. Can't say I'm 100% sure it was the burger but I got the reaction literally an hour from eating only this so I suspect it was.

Update: Props to Randy the Manager for sending me a msg concerning the allergy. Always appreciate when business owners reach out professionally :)
author: Shiori M.

description: Organic burgers... with organic milk shake and ice cream. It couldn't get any better! Bring along the entire family for some quality burger munching!
author: Anwar H.

description: Best burgers I've had in a while....maybe ever! If you're in SF you must try this burger joint, you won't be disappointed!
author: Hungry Penguins ..

description:
In the august traditions of Umami burger and Father's office comes Super Duper Burgers.

They've combined a little bit of the hipster, a little bit of the Chipotle style attitude, "love us, we're organic" with slightly higher than you'd hope prices.

The burger itself - I got the mini burger - (cuz who the heck eats a half pound burger in the middle of the day?) - was pretty tasty, and was cooked medium, as burgers should be cooked.  I got it 'with everything' and also with cheese, which is tragically an extra cost.

The garlic fries, as has been mentioned ad nauseum (but does NOT cause nausea, quite the opposite!), were very tasty.  Topped with fresh garlic the steaming hot fries definitely made things memorable.

And the soda's soda.  But the hamburger bun was soft and just right.  The meat was tender and tasty.  And aside from the egregious line (seems to be the case with everything in SF), the burger was downright delicious.

Highly recommended, and if the price was just a buck lower, it'd get 5 stars.
author: Ravi M.

description: Hands down a very YUMMY burger, it was was cooked to perfection,  lots of flavor and the garlic fries had the perfect amount of garlic.
author: Ro R.

description: Great burger place. West coasters might try to tell you to find an In-and-Out while you're on this side of the country. Ignore that advice (it's not as good as 5 Guys) and go here. The burger itself was perfectly cooked. The buns were delicious. The strawberry shake was classic. I could've gotten it "spiked", but alcohol and milk never sounds good to me. The one star deduction was for the weirdly anis-flavored pickles (ewww!) and garlic fries. Although they were delicious, they were the garlickiest thing I've ever eaten. Two days and several meals and teeth brushing later, I still could taste the garlic. Great location, vibe, prices, and food.
author: Jack H.

description:
They were crowded yesterday evening, but they were working quick. It might have helped that I ordered a mini burger...

Their burger reminds me that I don't need to drown my burger in mustard to consume. Good times!
author: Anisha G.

description:
Thankfully I had actually just purchased an amazing burger at Split Bread. (mmmm) On my way back to work I ordered 4 milkshakes for my staff and 2 garlic fries. I figured it wouldn't take long...I was wrong. 

My shakes came out in 5 minutes but it took another 15 minutes to get my fries. One of the kids working could tell I was getting pretty angry so she made someone make them I guess. When they came out she informed me that I should ask them to get them if it's taking long? Well why didn't they just give me my to-go order at the same time? My buzzer buzzed but they asked me to wait for the fries, so I did. 

I have eaten here several times. They got rid of my favorite burger and the staff is always rude and standing behind the counter having conversations. Food is mediocre. Burgers are small and the garlic fries were too small and mushy for the price. Good choco shakes though.

There's Mel's Diner and Split Bread a hop skip and a jump away. I would suggest trying these options before this one.
author: Tiffany F.

description:
Alright, I think I'm biased because I went for the first time last night for the Yelp Elite party. Who is going to give a bad review to free burgers and free booze? Ain't nobody gon' do that. No no. It was great to try 5 different burgers for free 99 and wash it all down with beer and some fine fine tempernillo spanish wine. 

I ate: cheeseburger, cheeseburger with white cheese and grilled onions, fried portobello, chicken, and bleu cheese. 

I think in order my faves were: regular cheeseburger, portobello, bleu cheese, chicken, and whatever the last one was. 

the garlic fries are also pretty good, but a bit dry. It's nothing like gorden biersh. 

I also enjoyed the milkshake shots with soju. I'm pretty sure those aren't on the menu but I enjoyed them even if they gave me indigestion. 

in n out is still my number one, but super duper- i'll be back.
author: Nicole K.

description:
Fries stayed crispy even to-go! 

Honestly, I'm torn between a 3 and 4 star rating.  Why?  A mini combo, the perfect amount of food, cost $8 (pre-tax).  For some reason, that just sounds (and sort of is) a tad bit on the expensive side for not that much food.  Here's where me, the hypocrite comes out.  I believe in paying for good food, regardless of the portion - because I would rather finish the food than waste (and not cross the "i'm too full to do anything for the next 2 hours" line). 

Overall, decent burger, juicy and perfectly sized.  While the portion of fries was perfect, the fatty in me wished there was a little bit more. 

Super clean location.  Still wish there was a 3.5 star option!
author: Lisa L.

description:
Damn.

They should rename this place to Super Fuggin' Duper.

I frankly wasn't feeling like hamburgers the night I tried Super Duper. I had already started on my dinner, but I tagged along with my gf who was just getting off of work. i figured I might as well try it.

Good thing. I busted out the second stomach for this one. Juicy, not overcooked, and the SAUCE. I wasn't expecting it to be that good. After being underwhelmed by Pearl's, I'm so happy I finally got a chance to try Super Duper. It's probably good that I don't work nearby this place - I wouldn't be able to restrain myself. :)
author: Alan W.

description:
This place kind of reminds me of Burger Lounge in SD. Really hokey. Nothing super special about anything.

But... then again I was super drunk when I ate here. So... there is that.
author: Jerm J.

description:
Love this Place. 
I think its affordable. Great Taste and Quality (though I wish it all was organic, i'd pay a little more).

Please let me say that the ice cream twist cone is the BEST...I have never had soft serve taste so good! & it is organic.

I would be a big fan if the offered a nice side salad to help balance the juicy burger.
so good! go here!
author: J'me L.

description:
God these feel gross in my hands, but they feel so amazing in my mouth.  That's...not suggestive at all, but still, these are really, really good burgers.

I really like the pickles too!

Recommended:
Burgers and fries.  What the hell else were you expecting?
author: Norman S.

description:
My pickle addiction keeps me coming back. I don't like the super sauce (they should just call it "seasoned mayo"--every time I go in there a tourist is grilling some poor cashier about it) but the burger is a delight. Loose-packed, fresh, great toppings, beer to go with it if you want and those pickles they are just fantastic. I like to eat like half a jar on every visit. They are big jars. 

The cashiers, kitchen staff, managers, everyone at this location? Really nice. I do not imagine it's an easy job but they are always smiling and having fun. And sometimes texting on the phone or whatever, but they are kids. Working in a burger joint. I cut'em some slack.  

The fries could be better to match the kinda upscale burger. Nice burger like this, I prefer a thinner cut fry. Something more delicate. Fancier. Urbane. Sophisticated. Can I get truffle oil on these?

Bacon! I like to add bacon because they have really good bacon here. It costs $1.00 and it's worth the price.
author: Phil D.

description:
I stopped by this Super Duper location, after my first trip to the one in the Castro, to try the ice cream that everyone raves about. I ordered a junior vanilla ice cream come and have it chocolate dipped.

It was the perfect size, I think a regular sized one would have been too much. The ice cream was really good, nice and creamy and the chocolate was delicious. 

One night I stopped here for a bite to eat after class, I decided to get the veggie burger with avocado. It was also pretty tasty, the patty was made of lentils and black beans and was not dry at all. (This seems to be an issue with veggie burgers generally).

The burgers at this location are also amazing, consistent, and fresh. I usually order the single burger with bacon and cheese. I have also had the fries with three dips, chipotle, house made mayo, and super duper special sauce. My favorite being the chipotle.
author: Stephanie T.

description: This was my first stop as I was visiting from New York. I ate here 3 times during my two days stay. Delicious, simple burgers and fries. Friendly staff.
author: Sid S.

description:
My friend was craving burgers and I remembered another friend recommending this place. Decided to check it out. Ordered a cheeseburger and garlic fries. The burger and fries were okay but I couldn't get over how OILY my burger was. I'm pretty sure my hand was soaked in oil after I was done with the burger. 

Although the food was good don't think I'll be coming back just because the food is too oily.
author: Sean W.

description:
Best. Burger. Ever. 

I've been trying to eat healthy lately, but decided to splurge and have a burger here while celebrating a going away party with a friend. The inner fatty inside of me rejoiced with glee as the perfectly cooked juicy burger melted in my mouth. It was unquestionably the best burger I've ever tasted. The fries were good too-crispy and golden brown, served with any number of dipping sauces (I chose the chipotle sauce, which was also delicious on the burger.)

Customer service was great, the line moved fast, and the employee's were extra friendly.

If you're in the city and want a burger, go here. You won't regret it.
author: Jared C.

description: This place is fucking awesome! no words can express how mouth watering delicious everything is. From the burgers to the garlic fries and even the pickles. I believe they make their own homemade pickles too haha! This place is my favorite burger joint so far and i haven't came across anything better then Super Duper! two words for y'all: mouth orgasmic! :D
author: Crissann B.

description: Loved this place. A friend took my husband, my niece, and I here last year while we were up in San Francisco visiting. Best burgers and the garlic fries, there are no words to describe the greatness that is the garlic fries.  Definitly go! So good!
author: Kristen J.

description: I prefer In N Out's burgers, so I actually come here for the veggie burger (no joke!), strawberry shake, and garlic fries!! If you order alla that, it'll run you more than $15 with tax, so I recommend sharing the sides with friends and sharing the calories :) The veggie burger tastes a little bit like a falafel sandwich.. it comes with cucumbers and hummus. The strawberry shake tastes soo fresh and the garlic fries are great. Solid 4 stars for me!
author: Crystal L.

description: Very good food : super burger, super fries, super pickles, super beer ! And not so expensive. But the restaurant itself isn't such a comfy place, looks really like a fast food.
author: Jean-Baptiste D.

description: Great burger!! Totally missed the garlic fries. They may need a little more options for beer. Just have two brands, but it is all right.
author: Armando A.

description:
I had every intention of getting Sushirrito and then I walked by this joint.  As soon as I saw they had a veggie burger available, I was sold. The burgers are small, but delightful. The garlic fries could use a little work. They didn't have as much pizzazz as I would have liked. I appreciated that there was drink refills and that they had an endless supply of house made pickles. I'm a sucker for a good pickle, but aren't we all?

Overall, it's a little pricey for the portioning, but it's good eatin'. Also, their menu isn't limited to solely burgers, they have a variety of foods including soft serve. It's worth the experience if ya ask me.
author: Brenda L.

description: For anyone that has ever been to a Potbelly, it's a Potbelly but with hamburgers. Good food. Everything's organic. We had a cheeseburger and a chicken sandwich. Both were good. Didn't try the milkshake but they looked yummy.
author: Donna P.

description: The burgers were okay.. I guess I was looking for a larger tastier burger because of the price. We were a little let down when we received our food.
author: J B.

description: I have only tried one burger each time I have gone to Super Duper, a vegetarian burger and my gosh its sooo good! I am scared to try their other burgers in fear of them not being as good. They have homemade pickles which were great and their fries and aioli were perf.
author: Naimah M.

description: Good hamburgers, gets pretty busy around lunch time. The chicken sandwich is also surprisingly good. Also the cheesy fries...good!
author: Michael S.

description: Great burgers.  The garlic fries are amazing. The staff is always friendly.  Four stars are only due to the price.....but you get what you  pay for!
author: PETER S.

description: Probably one of the best burgers I had. Their tangerine wheat beer was also fantastic. We got the super burger and could barely finish. The bread is also worth noting. We split some garlic fries which was a great choice. Cool interior design and the cashier was great too; made comfortable chit chat while finishing the transaction.
author: Anthony R.

description:
For the tribunal of cavewomen:

Not too hard to Paleo this place out, but you'll need to keep it simple. The burger is grilled up in its own fat but the fries, and presumably egg, bacon and onion, get Canola oil. They have (amazing delicious) mayo but not Aioli, so that's out too. If you're there for a really simple lettuce double burger, giddy up. I think their ridonkulous sauce is paleo, but double check that one. Otherwise get ye home.
author: Matt L.

description:
I usually go this place on the weekends because it is hard finding something open on Sunday if you are working in the financial district and hate Chipotle. I had gone here a few times and they are pretty consistent with their food as well as their service... It is always clean in there and food usually comes up in a timely manner. I just keep it simple and get a mini burger and fries. Will say however that the lemonade sweetened with brown sugar is orgasmic when mixed with a good vodka. 

I think thst the only critique that I have is that when I go in there, I feel like I'm surrounded by hipsters, but that is going to happen when going to any place in San Francisco.
author: Tiffany M.

description: I have yet to discover another burger joint where you have the option to have your shakes spiked. Shocking, isn't it? I decided to have a chocolate and fresh strawberry sans the alcohol with an order of garlic fries. Craving immediately fulfilled. On a later visit, a friend and I split a Super Burger with everything on it, plus cheese and bacon. Geebus Cripes, it was good. Again added a side of garlic fries and the meal was complete. If I'm feeling up to it, maybe next time I'll spike that shake. Heck, I'll top my burger with a free range fried egg too. Sounds like a pheNOMenal idea.
author: Rhia R.

description:
Assuming all the claims of hormone-free grass fed meat and organic ingredients are true, Super Duper is the apex of non-gourmet burger joints. 

Consistently yummy, friendly staff, and fairly quick turnaround. Unless you're ready to drop $10+ on a gourmet burger, this is the best around.
author: Randy N.

description:
I think Super Duper burgers are the best in San Francisco. Incredible flavor. Really, really good.

I prefer the single patty (Mini) to the double. I really like the plain fries. They're thick and brown like Five Guys. 

The service and atmosphere are fun. In the evenings, you'll get served a lot faster at the one in the Financial District at 98 Mission than the ones on Market Street.
author: Steve R.

description:
Even though I steer clear of meat  these days, I absolutely crave burgers from Super Duper.
The burgers around LA just don't satisfy my taste buds needs!
Came here with my bf a whole year ago for the first time, it was our first meal, and on our last day we made this the last meal of our trip to San Francisco! I can still taste the amazingness of this place, the organic beef, perfectly fried and seasoned garlic fries! And the ice cream! Wish there was one in SoCal!
author: Jessica B.

description: Simply one of the best burgers ever! Make sure to get the garlic fries! We were there just before the lunch rush. Service was excellent and friendly. The place was cute and clean.
author: Catherine S.

description: I was starving after a long flight from the east coast and was craving a burger. I got the mini cheeseburger with everything and the garlic fries. the burger was a juicy mess, but tasted "ok". you'll need napkins.  the garlic fries were awesome but halfway down they were soggy and gross. it wasnt bad, but was far from the best burger I've ever had.  not enough to make me crave to go back.
author: Shawn W.

description: Best burgers that keep you coming back for more. Super duper is my husband and my favourite Friday night date spot. We get excited at the prospect of ordering their delicious milkshakes with their perfectly sized burgers and of course the garlic fries! Yum.
author: N J.

description:
I'm writing this review hungry and the memory of their garlic parmesan fries is currently making my mouth water. My kitchen is stocked with the likes of 100 Calorie Cheez-Its and Target brand yogurt so writing this review is making me more angry than anything. What am I gonna eat?!?!

Went here as my last meal of a weekend trip to SF. There are so many nice restaurants in town, but the GF and I were just in the mood for something quick and bad for you. This was a great option. I loved my burger. Loved the free pickle spears. And of course, these were the best fries I've ever had at a counter service joint.

I wanna be there now!
author: Joe T.

description: One of my favorite lunch spots around work. Burgers are juicy and delicious. Chicken sandwich is the bomb too. Authentic San Francisco hospitality, very friendly staff especially Mervin who makes an incredible shake. Will continue to recommend this place to coworkers and clients.
author: Jack H.

description: Highly addicting! I love the size of the mini burgers just the perfect amount to get you full and not feel guilty or you over eaten. Should be accompanied by an order of garlic fries. The staff here is also very friendly and the line goes by quick. Upstairs and outdoor seating for more space. If I could I would eat here everyday but it's only on cheat meal day :(
author: Ngoc P.

description: The burgers were juicy, the cheese was real and the bacon was not overcooked. On my way out I was offered a free ice cream. I'll take a burger experience like that any day.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
With a couple of locations popping up in and around the bay area, burger purveyor Super Duper is making quite a reputation for itself- and it's a mighty good one as it was recently listed on SF grubs top 50 burgers in San Fran list.

Burgers are made with 100% all natural Niman ranch beef, ground fresh daily and flat top cooked to create a great sear that locks in juiciness.

I tried the Super Burger with 2- 4 oz patties and cheese ($7). The bun came nicely toasted and had enough weight to hold the whole burger together without turning into a mushy mess. Toppings included onion, tomato, lettuce, cheese and special sauce. Each bite revealed ample juiciness- not the run down the arms type, but juicy none-the-less. The 2 cheese slices and sauce added to the burgers richness but didn't weigh it down. It was a burger you could easily get your mouth around and didn't fall apart due to excessive toppings bulging in all directions - everything just seemed to be in the right proportions. It was simply fantastic!

I really found Super Duper to be very Shake Shack-esqe and it rivals some of the best burgers I've ever had, and for that, I put Super Duper on my bucket list as my top fast food style burger in the city thus far.

Read my other burger reviews at aburgeraday.com
author: Alex Z.

description: I have been here quite a few times and my experience tends to be quite inconsistent.  Sometime the staff is great and very friendly, other times they tend to be bothered by the customers.  Today, the girl was friendly, but apparently didn't listen to my order at all.  I paid way too much money for just some meat on bread, when I asked for "everything on it".  Such a shame.. this place has great potential.
author: Jeffrey R.

description:
Super Duper is my go-to lunch spot for a delicious burger and fries!  Yes, the line can get long but the employees work quickly and if you plan ahead and go early, you can skip the line all together.  I usually order the 4 oz "mini" burger and a side of fries, which is the perfect amount of food for lunch.  The burgers are juicy and flavorful.  Definitely a step up from your typical fast food joint.  The fries are also really good - just the right amount of salt & crisp.  I've never had the veggie burger but my opinionated & picky vegetarian coworker gives it his seal of approval, so they must be good :P

They have Racer 5 on tap, which makes them pretty cool in my book, and they serve delicious milkshakes to top off your meal.

Added bonus (for people who like pickles... not me): All the pickles you want!
author: Liz H.

description: I finally found a cheap place to eat when in the heart of the city! Seriously, I always have a difficult time looking for restaurants that don't have the exorbitant prices that come with the SF dining experience. The best part? It's in very close proximity to the Metreon and open late, which is perfect for late movie goers like myself! Their burgers and fries are pretty good, but their milkshakes are the true winner at Super Duper burgers - if you're not up for a regular sized one, you could always ask for a kid's size. They always seem pretty busy, so the tables aren't always clean, but if you happen to flag down an employee, they will be more than happy to clean it for you! The best part? The prices, of course!
author: Joyce E.

description: Amazing place. Fast and friendly service and their burgers were delicious! Definitely recommend eating here
author: Morgan T.

description:
Holy mother of all chickens, do yourself a favor and get an egg on your burger. 

Thank me later by giving me UFC's and compliments...
author: Monelle A.

description: Super duper good! environment was nice right in downtown, Nothing so amazing about the food i rather much prefer in n out! but I would recommend this place if you are in San Fran ! would definitely come back!
author: Diana R.

description:
Probably more of a 3.5 stars for me. But let's round up to be nice.

The meat in the burgers here were the star of the show. Juicy. Flavorful. Delicious! I would come back just for that yummy burger patty. 

The rest of the burger was good, though I wouldn't say it was amazing. I ordered a Mini Burger (the name is misleading!) and put everything on it. Definite plus for being able to add jalapenos at no extra cost! The first thing I noticed when I got my meal was that the bun was slightly burned. No biggie, but I would have preferred it to not be so charred.

Another plus  - unlimited pickles! Being the fanatic that I am, I went back to the condiment bar to load up on pickles for seconds. And thirds. 

I also ordered a chocolate shake at the end of my meal. I'm not sure why, seeing as I don't really like shakes, or chocolate flavored things for that matter. But I still finished it! Nothing to write home about, though. 

Overall, the food gets 3 stars. But free jalapenos and pickles, and just cause I like the feel of the place bumps it up just a bit.
author: Sally T.

description: Very tasty burgers (even for a vegetarian!). The one thing that disappointed was the fries...too thin and not crispy enough. Ambiance was nice though and plenty of seating (including outside). Pretty good pricing for this part of town too and their ice cream cones are delish!
author: Semuteh F.

description: Burgers were really good, fries a little cold, lemonade alright, but for some reason I will come back because it has a lot of potential! Next time I will try the milkshake for sure and their dipped cone ice cream!
author: Benjamin F. P.

description:
Fries: amazing!
Burgers: Delish!
Location: Good until tourists start taking up the good seats.

I was introduced to Super Duper Burger through my carnivorous boyfriend. He needed some fried red meat and I needed some salt and potatoes. Super Duper did not disappoint.
author: Nneka O.

description: Came here after spending the day in nearby Ft. Mason park, it seemed popular as the place was packed. I ordered a chicken sandwich and a beer which was awesome because buying a beer includes free fries. We waited for about 15 minutes enjoying our beers when we asked if the orders were coming soon. The manager was very respectful and did everything in his power to make it right, informing us that somehow the orders never popped up for them to cook. The manager offered me whatever i wanted on my sandwich and a refill on my beer. The garlic fries i got for free with my beer were the best fries I have ever had, and the chicken sandwich was above average as well. I wish I didn't live in colorado because i would be back all the time! Great food and great service, i'd definately recommend it.
author: Daniel R.

description: Best veggie burger on the planet, and great pickles. They do seem to mess up my orders, tho. It's always something -- forgot avocado, missing hummous, gave me a bag when I asked for none. They need to work on filling orders right -- then they'll definitely grab 5 stars.
author: Alec F.

description: I am addicted to this place. Most people get the mini burger - it's the perfect size and it's juicy and delicious. You can add cheese and / or bacon if desired. Oh, and the homemade pickles are amazing. Really friendly and efficient staff. And did I mention that there's beer?
author: Kristina O.

description:
Super Duper makes a good burger. In my book they're slightly better then In-N-Out. Comparing it to In-N-Out burger seems to be a heavily debated topic though. They got my order right but got everyone else in my party their order wrong.

Don't come here if you don't like long lines or if you appreciate sitting down.
author: Yoni D.

description:
Super Duper Burgers is a great place to grab a burger downtown. Order their garlic fries and a milkshake if you're feeling extravagant! Last time I was here, the manager gave me a free cookie because he made a mistake in my order... so got some points in my book! No complaints.

I've never eaten in the restaurant, but it's a great place to pick up some burgers and go.
author: Erica W.

description: Pretty good burgers.  There's alot of seating.   Fast service.   Good french fries.  Friendly staff.
author: Andi M.

description:
Came here after debating with a good friend about where we should eat & he suggested this place.
He said it was good!
& Yes ! It was my first time and it was juicy and delicious!
The patty was juicy and not dry just the way it should be for all burgers.
My friend also ordered Garlic Fries & DAM!!! 
It was good ~~ but a bit oily but that's okay. it was yummy. hehe.
Good place to eat lunch, brunch with a friend and catch up on life.

 no 5 stars cause the tables were dirty and the staff didn't really clean it well. ( ew )

Overall, My first experience eating Super Duper Burger was good and delicious~
Totally would go back .
author: Anney T.

description:
Great burgers at a standard price. Love how you can add jalapeños. Makes it better than In-N-Out. The Super Duper sauce gets really messy though, so you might want to ask for it on the side. 

The regular fries are ok, nothing special.

The strawberry shake is delicious.

Spacious interior with upstairs seating. It's a fast food place after all though, so not great for post meal loitering/chatting.
author: An Y.

description:
I like visiting the Super Duper near Union Square and the newer location in the Metreon. This is definitely one of the more affordable places to ear in Union Square, especially in the evening and I think the new Metreon location will help minimize the lunch time lines at the Union Square Super Duper (hopefully?? those lines get long at lunch!)

The Veggie Burger and garlic fries are awesome.  I have also had a dipped cone which was good. Don't pass up the pickles! I  must admit, I used to be scared of them because they look kinda gross sitting out by the napkins but they taste great.

My only frustration is that the combo specials cost more money if you order them with a veggie patty instead of beef and it is not stated anywhere. I think they need to make that more clear. Or better yet, just make them the same  price.
author: Leuwam T.

description: One thing I couldn't get over about San Fran is the rudeness of almost all people in any restaurant I went to. The lady taking my order was putting on chapstick as she talked to me.....luckily she wasn't the one making my food. Other than the weird service the place itself was very nice and the burger was delicious!!
author: Jose R.

description:
Best burger joint I've ever been to.

1. Food: again -- best burgers ever; i've had the regular super duper burgers, to the veggie burger -- equally as scrumptious. My fiance and I come to super duper every time we visit San Francisco. It's that good. 

2. Cost -- big bang for your buck.. 

3. Service -- consistently fast, friendly, efficient.

4. Location -- this is San Francisco -- good location over all. gotta walk, but it doesn't hurt if you're eating burgers!

highly recommended go-to burger spot in San Francisco
author: Chris B.

description: Was up in San Francisco about a week ago and really  wanted a burger. I found this place and decided to try it out. It was pretty late but they said they would be open till 12 and it was only 11:15 or so. Anyway, right after we began to eat a few of their employees started yelling "we closed,I've been here all day and wanna go home" and this was like 30 min before they were supposed to close. The food was good, not great but better than fast food but pretty expensive. It's restaurant pricing for good food and more relaxed atmosphere. Would have a better grade but for their employees.
author: Jake F.

description:
Best burgers for your buck. Worst service (at this location). The guy at the counter --who seemed to be an authority figure or at least acted that way -- didn't even look at me, asked, "what do ya want?", and flounced away after literally dropping the my receipt and pen. 

Apathy is tolerable in the service industry but flagrant rudeness and disrespect towards a costumer is not. I didn't tip and I NEVER don't tip. Where this sense of entitlement comes from is beyond me since all he did was bring my meal from the hard working kitchen staff (Respect. I sat by the counter and watched them work their a#$es off) to the counter and call out a number. 

Sure. I get it. You have a lot of Powell street volume including annoying tourists & bridge and tunnel folks up for shopping jaunts. Still what makes you different than McDonald's? Nothing but some tattoos, skinny jeans, and a bad attitude. At least the Micky D's takes pride in their work. 

The kicker is when I saw another counter employee yelled a number, looked around, murmured "guess they don't want their food.", and threw the tray down. Something's off at this location because the Castro one doesn't have these problems. Super lame!

As for the food, one of the best, quality burgers in SF and the fries are tops. If you can brave the snark go grab on at Market or opt to hit Castro.
author: Quentin J.

description:
After a night of watching KDer go through 4 different pairs of the same sized boots, mixing and matching left and rights, rights to rights and lefts to lefts to find the perfect fit, my thought process of finding a suitable piece of rope and appropriate fixture to hang myself from was interrupted by the growling of my belly.  Peer pressuring her to check out, we decided that it was a burger type of night.  At first I thought about taking her to Fish and Farm for the Chez proclaimed best burger, which by the way, it is not, however, we decided to just stay nearby and go to Super Duper.  

I thought Super Duper was going to be one of those gourmet burger joints in similar vein to Umami and Fish and Farm.  Imagine my surprise when I saw that it was more similar to In-an-Out.  Recently, gourmet burger restaurants are popping up left and right in San Francisco, marginalizing the "fast food" burger genre.  However, sometimes I am just in a fast food burger type of mood.  I ordered the Super Burger with grilled onions and an organic egg.  KJeh ordered a mini burger.  Super Duper does not have 10 type of burger variations; they have a very simple menu.  Two burgers to be exact - simplicity at its finest.  It was way past dinner time, however, was still packed - a testament to their burgers.  My burger arrived and was very neat in presentation.  Biting into it, I was amazed.  It was delicious.  It did not have the gourmet flavours of a $20 burger that include every condiment under the sun and more.  What Super Duper gave you was a very flavorful meat patty.  The essence of a burger is its patty and everything else is an afterthought.  I gurgled in bliss as the juices of the grilled onions dribbled from the sides of my mouth.  The mix of the onion juice with the egg yolk created the perfect marinade for the patty.  The fries were delicious and reminded me of the extra crispy in-and-out fries.  KJeh was very happy with her product, disclaiming that I had flamed the fuck on in terms of my recent yelp picks.

Super Duper is your no frills hamburger.  Sometimes you just need to say fuck truffle oil, fuck goat cheese, fuck that kobe cured beef shit!  Strip away law, we are nothing  more than heathens...never forget that.  Act accordingly my friend.  As of now, my rankings in fast-food-esque burger is: 1.crown burger 2.super duper 3.in-an-out 4.five guys...wadDUUUP
author: Brian V.

description: Juicy, but messy Niman Ranch burgers. Good bun. Good fries. Good prices. Burger craving satisfied.
author: Derrick V.

description: Excellent flavor on the burger especially liked the blue cheese and bacon I added on the mini. Garlic fries are also a must try but be prepared for it to come out your pores. So strong but so good.
author: Nate D.

description: Amazing food. Amazing service. Awesome location. Great decoration of the place. Def will come here again and hopefully they add more closer to the east bay.
author: Kristine D.

description: I feel like this is SF's version of Fat burger in LA. Super Duper's Garlic fries are THE BOMB! It's so hard to not order a side of garlic fries with my mini burger. Speaking of mini burgers, I always get full off eating a mini burger. It doesn't seem like a lot, but it is a perfect size. This location is clean and the food comes out in a timely matter. Will definitely whenever I crave garlic fries.
author: Jenn C.

description: I ordered the mini combo with avocado to go.  The burger was delicious! The fries were all right.  The place was pretty packed..10 minute wait. Not too bad.  The cashiers were friendly.  The store needed more seating areas and more employee to focus on cleanliness throughout the store.
author: Mimi L.

description: Buns were too greasy but burgers were good in general. I like how they make pickles and how they are served! Great place to get burgers and fries.
author: Evan L.

description:
I've been back to try the chicken sandwich and the portobello sandwich, both were SUPER DUPER YUMMY!!! They really got it right with those two items. Yes, this is a burger joint, but I have to give them props for making sure that their other menu items aren't just there to pretend they have variety. They actually do! 

Even though I don't eat burgers very often, I think I'll be here quite often for the chicken or portobello sandwich!
author: Jen D.

description:
This is a great business model.  I can see the owners brains working...let's create something kind of like In N Out, but with an expanded menu, and Taylor's Refresher, with less wine options, and make it way more accessible to everyone instead of having to drive down to Daly City, Fisherman's Wharf, the Ferry Building or Napa.  

That is exactly what this place is. It is definitely more upscale than In N Out burger, but not much.  It has the same vibe as Taylor's Refresher with clean industrial decor, friendly tattooed staff, and a clear view of the grill to you can see how your food is made.  The price is just right, and they offer a lot more options for your burgers, or chicken sandwiches.  The meat was juicy and full of flavor, and the bun held up to everything too.  The fries were much better than In N Out burgers, cripsy and light, without overwhelming the main event....the burger itself.  

One of the things that really appealed to me was that while the long was very long, one of the servers came by with samples of the fries and chiptole sauce (which i personally thought was gross) but it was a great way to try something before actually making your order.  I've heard they pass out samples of milkshakes too, and that is way beyond anything I've  ever seen at a place similar to Super Duper.  

Just be warned, the line is long.
author: Adam E.

description:
Ate here about a month or so ago when they first opened and can't believe I forgot to review this place.

Anyway, ordered a cheese burger (jack cheese) with bacon.  Burger was good although it didn't blow me away.  I remember thinking as I ate it that I didn't think it compared to Pearl's, size or flavor-wise.  For some reason, the garlic fries were the worst I've ever had.  Not sure if they sprinkle (more like smother) each with parmesan or if they mistakenly gave me parmesan fries, but I got tons of parmesan and no garlic.  Weird.  I guess I should have asked if they made a mistake, but somehow I just didn't.  The pickle jars made me happy although I didn't like the flavor of my pickle.

I'm definitely a carnivore, but have heard some really good things about their veggie burger so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt (maybe they were having an off day) and up them a star.
author: Roy N.

description: Good burgers. Greasy but good. Decent garlic fries. Plump and juicy burgers. This store completely rapes in n out in terms of fries, burgers, and variety. You should also get the dip for the fries as well.
author: Big Gucci 3.

description: Taste so good you can tell the cow had a happy life. Get a chocolate shake too! You won't regret it.
author: Melanie N.

description: Great veggie burgers with hummus and avocado!!!!  Fast service with a smile and budget friendly also.
author: Monica G.

description: Best burgers in town that are made with real meat. I give them one star since we attempted to do take out order in which they refused because they were "too busy".
author: isenia r.

description:
I flew in to San Francisco with an empty stomach and I was excited to eat at a good restaurant. I yelped for places around me and found Super Duper. What a great call. I got a mini combo with lettuce, tomatoes, grilled onions, special sauce, and a grilled egg. It legit was delicious. 

They also have ah-mazing homemade pickles. They're salty and sweet. My mouth literally waters just thinking about them. 

Definitely recommend this place.
author: Susan W.

description: I found out super Duper Burgers while running errands in the city. like their homemade pickles. Burgers are delicious, and garlic fries is delis. So glad that they opened another location at food court in Valley Fair mall.
author: Duke N.

description: This is upscale fast food done well.  I was out on the town and planned on just getting a burger to hold my hunger until dinner.  That was the plan at least until I saw they had garlic fries.  Do yourself a favor and get the garlic fries.  Not only were they some of the best fast food fries I've had, they have the added bonus of giving you protection from vampires for the remainder of your day.  The burger while not perfect, rival those of places like in-n-out.  There are free pickles by the condiments, and did I mention they serve beer?  Highly recommended for the garlic fries alone.
author: Alex K.

description:
Super duper place. HA. I appreciate places like this. It's not about the size of the burger, but more about the quality. It was enough to fill me up, even with a side of fries. It's like how they say it, "Fast food burgers, slow food values." They use natural beef, some organic products, and the best ingredients they can possibly use for their burgers. 

Thank you Super Duper, for existing.
author: Charisma Y.

description:
Working in Union Square over the summer, I was turned off by all of the vegan yuppies who would walk around with their salads and environmentally friendly lunches. So I decided to stick it to them by frequenting an upcoming gourmet burger chain that specialized in serving foods from sustainable sources of agriculture. 

Great move, right?

I've come to think of this place as the Five Guys of Union Square, they give you good portions, let you put whatever you want in it, and you can always count on seeing a few cross-dressers inside.

Taste-wise, this place is a no brainer. The meat is good and it's not overly greasy and filling. They pride themselves in offering "veggie diet" beef, which sounds good but makes you wonder, what the hell is "non veggie diet" beef? The inside looks kind of like a Chipotle since its got your standard metal chairs and strange homeless-esque artwork everywhere. 

I would say that this place is a little on the expensive side, but you can't really hold that against them. It is in the middle of downtown SF and most of the working people who go there won't have a problem dropping $10+ for a quick lunch. So if you ever find yourself needing a break from aggressive shopping or overwhelming work, come to Super Duper and enjoy some gourmet salads and burgers while sipping over-priced beer.
author: Nick N.

description:
Very conveniently located on Market between the Montgomery and Powell BART stations. I always passed by but never thought to actually go in (burgers aren't really my thing), so thank God my hunger got the best of me the other day while I was at the Chase bank across the street.

I ordered a Super Burger with cheese, bacon, and jalapeno sans tomato and onion for myself, and a Super Burger with everything plus cheese, bacon, and avocado and Garlic Fries for my manager (oh, the life of an intern). The food was ready in no time, and I couldn't wait to get back to the office to eat! I may have stolen some garlic fries on the way...

The Super Burger has TWO patties in it, and the burger is the perfect size for an extremely hungry Asian girl who conveniently forgets about her diet from time to time. The beef patties were very juicy and tasted very natural and unprocessed (ahem, McDonald's) - I was completely stoked to be eating such an amazing burger. They didn't put a lot of bacon in there, which would usually disappoint me but I was too focused on the burger itself to really care. The garlic fries were delightfully tangy and weren't overwhelming with flavour. The fries were cut thin and weren't soggy at all, which is most garlic fries' downfall. 

Even though I saw the oil on the wrapper after finishing the burger, I surprisingly didn't feel all gross and greasy (during and afterwards). But still, I would say Super Duper Burger is a once-every-3-months kind of deal, for when you're in the area and the person you're with hasn't tried it yet. By the way, everything came to about $23, which is pretty pricey for a burger, but in this case, totally worth it given the portions and the quality.
author: Katie M.

description: (See pic) Review #1104. The burger was okay but the milkshake was delicious! Too bad it was lunch time for me or I would have it spiked (added with rum)!!
author: T L.

description:
My partner and I went here on a whim....we are so glad we did!! The server we had was super friendly and helpful. We had a mini burger and a chicken sandwich with garlic fries to share. 
It took around 8 mins for the food to be done. The burger was juicy and sooooo tasty. We had it with everything on it except tomato. It was cooked medium and it was just right. 
The chicken sandwich was also really really good. The roll it was served in was delicious - more like an artisan roll rather than a standard bread bun, which was a really nice change. The chipotle aioli complimented it perfectly.
The garlic fries were also delicious. They were topped with fresh garlic and I think cilantro.
The decor was slightly industrial looking and has a really nice feel to it. 
All in all, great taste and value for money. Will definitely be visiting it again!!!!!!
author: Elle B.

description:
I got the cheeseburger with grilled onions, bacon, and avocado. I was really looking forward to this burger and really wanted to like the place, unfortunately, what I got was an oil-drenched burger that was inedible. I have never complained about a burger - so it took a lot for me to take it back after the first bite. After my complaint of how unreasonably oily the burger was to the point of picking it up that the oil dripped like a leaky facet.  I was offered to get the burger overdone (a burnt burger), which might have made it edible at which point was just too grossed out, and opted to accept the disappointment and proceeded to drink my $6 shake and free pickles. Yum. 

Skip this place, go to Pearl's - for the best burgers in SF.
author: Christian R.

description: This places vibe is amazing. Corey helped so much when it came to figuring out what to get. I would absolutely come back here!!
author: Jhaena O.

description:
I just ate two super duper burgers and I regret nothing.

The breakfast sandwiches are also delicious and I've been eyeing the home-made donuts as well. Definitely my go-to burger place downtown.
author: Andrew K.

description:
THE BEST Veggie Burger, ever! I'm not kidding. I have to keep myself away from this place because I would eat one every day, during every meal and that would just be bad. 

Quite frankly, I could care less about anything else on the menu; this dang thing is magical. 

I order minus the humus, with cheese and avocado. I couldn't tell you what else it comes with, but it is y-u-m-m-y!!! $10 bucks you can get a combo - Ha! Brilliant.

Completely and totally worth waiting in line for...and I hate waiting in line.
author: Gina G.

description:
Not only are the burgers delicious but the staff is excellent.  I left my wallet there and they found it cleaning up; I couldn't get it for 24 hours and two staff people called me to reassure me that it was there and ask if they should mail it if I  couldn't get there.  When I got it, everything was still in it.

cheers to Josh and Kim (I hope I have the names right) and all the other staff.  Also the burgers and milkshakes are amazing.
author: Bronwyn H.

description:
On the menu at Super Duper Burger, a warning is issued: the burgers here will be messy, because they're cooked at a juicy medium temperature.  This is Niman Ranch beef, so it can't be bad, right?

Well, I've had Niman Ranch beef cooked medium rare at other burger joints, and it was not greasy at all.  Either there is something wrong with their shipment, or they are using the wrong kind of cheese.  At any rate, this burger was pure grease, and it tasted like grease rather than fresh meat.

It made me feel sick to my stomach.  I couldn't even finish it.

The garlic fries are OK, but not good enough to redeem this place.  I had a shake here several weeks ago as well, and it was, well, a shake.

They do have Mexican Coke, though.  At the very least, this is a place you can get a delicious Mexican Coke in the financial district.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
So, I'm walking around downtown SF aimlessly, after having recovered from two days of hugging the toilet because of food poisoning. (My buddies thought I could find pearls by eating raw oysters, knowing I have always gotten sick eating oysters. I was a bit drunk so I was very easy to cajole.) 

I had walked through Yerba Buena park and checked out the annual Filipino Culture celebration. While the food stalls offered good looking food for reasonable prices, my stomach told me to move on. 

Finding nothing interesting, I gave up and was walking back towards the Ferry Building along Market street. And then I saw the light. Actually, I smelled the sight. It was super Duper -- a place I had been wanting to try. 

I walked in and looked at the menu. Knowing my stomach can handle only non-acidic and non-spicy food, I trained my eye on the Super Burger. I asked the lady if I should triple up on the beef patty, each weight about 4 ounces. She looked at my skinny frame and said you may want to stick to the two patty-Super Burger. OK. I don't want to temp fate. 

I saw the fries that were coming out from the kitchen -- they looked ordinary and skinny and the portions seemed small for $2. I wanted a beer but didn't want to walk home drunk and be arrested for DWW -- drunk while walking! 

So, I opted for a coke in a bottle -- which this joint calls Mexican coke; OK, it's like maybe 6 ounces. 

As I sat waiting for my burger, I'm thinking to myself why they call the bottled coke a "Mexican coke." Was it bottled in Tijuana, Mexico. 

Wait. When I was in TJ, everyone told me not to drink the water. Well, silly me. Since the weather was scorching hot, I got a bottled coke there and (stupid me) I drained it with ice. Well, ice, ice baby didn't go well with my stomach. Enough said.  Ewww! 

OK. My Super Burger was ready in 5 minutes. It looked very good; small for a $6.50 cheese burger.  (Anyone recall that line from Pulp Fiction!)  I should have paid an extra $2 for a third patty. Oh well, I wolfed it down. Damn, it was good and juicy. The meat was cooked perfectly and the buns were toasted nicely. 

I love chewing on ice. So, I drank my Mexican coke with ice (hopefully, made with SF tap water).  I love Mexico but I hope the ice was not imported from TJ; if so, I hope they used purified water.  I DON'T want to be hugging the toilet again tonight. 

I'm coming back here. Next time, I've got to see if I can eat three beef patties. No Mexican coke but I'll take a Corona!
author: Peace L.

description: I admit,  when I walked in the door,  my hopes weren't too high.  Don't get me wrong,  I'd heard good things about this place,  but I'm a vegetarian: perpetual fry-order and pariah of burger joints everywhere.  But when I got my food (which did take awhile -  thus the loss of a star)  I have to say my mind was blown.  All the veggie burger flavors melded together perfectly,  and I just felt incredibly happy,  albeit wishing I'd been spendthrift/gluttonous to have bought another one. Go at a less crowded time,  and it'll be perfect.
author: Cody W.

description: First time here and not impressed. Don't come here if you are in a hurry. They are super slow at expediting orders.
author: TJ K.

description: How do they make their burgers so tasty! I always top mine with and egg. When you come here don't forget your pickles. I just come here and get down and dirty. That's the only way to do it.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I really like this place. The regular burger no cheese was juicy and cooked medium-rare just the way I like it. The price wasn't too expensive and the garlic french fries were out of this world.

There is a pretty big line but it moves fast. Lots of seating and an upstairs area as well. The only thing against Super Duper is that their burgers are smallish compared to the monstrosities I am used to.
author: Dennis R.

description:
After a long day of school work and walking all over the city, my friend and I were in the mood for burgers. After checking Yelp, this place was the first to pop up and only two minutes away from where I was, so we decided to check it out.

What caught my eye were the prices!! So reasonable!! I decided to order a mini burger with cheese and everything on it, with regular fries and their "fresh lemonade with brown sugar". The total was like $10.50, which is pretty good for SF.

Customer service was great and friendly. Line wasn't long at all. Got my food within 5-7 minutes, and went to sit upstairs overlooking the restaurant. It's a pretty cool and laid-back place; nothing too special, only serves its purpose to sit customers. Would be awesome if they had TVs and happy hour specials on the beers, but that's just my dream lol.

On to the food:

--The bun was buttery, slightly toasted, with sesame seeds. I love my buns like this.

--The burger was the perfect size for me (mini burger = quarter pound).

--The toppings - cheese, onions, tomatoes, super sauce, etc. - were right on. Didn't spill out and it was the perfect amount.

--The fries were addicting - zesty with a slight crunch, my fav. My friend had garlic fries which were oh so yum. But I didn't want to risk garlic breath that day, but I will definitely get it next time.

--The lemonade was slightly sweet and a bit more tart, which I liked because it kept me from drinking the whole thing before I got my food. Kinda smart.

--My friend had a chocolate shake which he devoured. So I assumed it was tasty! 

--I think they make their own pickles? They tasted vinegary but had crunch. Very clean and natural. I didn't put them on my burger; I ate them on the side.

In conclusion, I was full, I was happy, and now I can't stop thinking about that burger. I think next time I'll get a shake, maybe a burger with avocado and egg, and some garlic fries. Looking forward to my next visit!
author: Ashley W.

description: Burgers are delicious with lots of add-ons from bacon avocado and even a fried egg. You also have to try their garlic fries.
author: Tyler F.

description:
I came here during lunch hour on a weekday.  This placed was packed.  The line was about half way to the door, but it moved quickly.  I think I only waited 10minutes and while waiting in line, they were giving out sample trays of french fries and their chipotle mayo.  The fries were nice and crispy and the sauce was yummy!

I ordered the mini (4oz patty) with lettuce, grilled onions, super sauce and added a fried egg.  I also got a vanilla shake.  The cashier that took my order was super friendly, my milkshake was ready within minutes and so was my burger. Can you say EFFICIENT? I expected a slight wait with all the people there, but they were super quick! My burger was delicious, loved the super sauce and fried egg.  The milkshake was AWESOME, it was thinner than usual, but still nice and creamy.  (I prefer my milkshakes on the thinner side anyway).  My burger and shake cost me a little over $11, a little bit pricey for fast food, but it was good.  I will be back to try the garlic fries!
author: Veronica N.

description: The double cheeseburger was good, especially the meat and cheese, maybe a little too big of a bun.  The garlic fries were good too.
author: Jason G.

description:
Don't be intimidated by the lines. They move fast. Super Duper is worth the wait.

Their burgers are made with the fattiest cut of ground beef known to man, but that's where all the flavor comes from. I like that they hand out french fry samples while you wait in line - their aioli dipping sauce is yum :) And their combo deals are actually quite affordable - $8 for a mini burger combo. And what they call "mini" (a 1/4 lb of meat) is actually a regular sized burger, so unless you want to eat half a cow's ass, a mini burger should do you just fine. Their chicken burgers are good too. Their self-serve pickles from a jar are sweet and sour at the same time.

Oooh! And they have dipped cones! When's the last time you had one of those? Too long, that's when! 

My only recommendation is that they hand out those little buzzer thingies so you know when your order is ready - it's hard to hear your name being called over all the noise.
author: Mariela D.

description: Yum!  Burgers are awesome here and the milkshake taste good.  Garlic fries to top them off.  The long line go by quick and is worth the wait.  You pay a lil more than you would at In n Out, but there's a reason for that....Supposedly the burgers are from grass fed cows and free-range chickens.  Whatever their niche, it was pretty damn tasty.
author: Anthony E.

description:
I'm kind of in love with Super Duper. It falls into this really great middle ground between a gourmet burger and a diner/fast food burger. 

You get all sorts of options as far as your toppings go, but then the burger itself is just so straight forward and delicious. A little greasy, very juicy, and not too pricey either. I tend to gravitate more towards diner type burgers and actively dislike some of the more fancy burger places like Father's Office. But I do appreciate having more topping options than In-n-out for example. They have caramelized onions! Probably my fav topping to put on a burger. 

The fries are delicious and you can grab as many pickles as your heart desires (I think I ate like 10 pickles with my burger the first time I came here). What more could you want?

It can be very crowded but the line moves quickly and the orders don't take too long to come out. I would rate this place more like 4.5 stars, but I'm feeling generous with my stars tonight.
author: Hannah S.

description: market street hussle...shuffle past transients...glimpse of del taco...towards super duper...modern and airy...open space burgers...short line wait...taking a super...$six.fifty pricing...plus $dollar for egg...perfect sunny side..maybe covered steamed cooked?...self-serve soda...self-serve pickles..tangy and more sweet....small portion fries $two... bite through double patties...bursting with juice!...perfect medium served...no questions asked...drip, drip 'n' drip...a good burger...needing better bun improvement...good meat nonetheless...$ten to $fifteen meal per person here...
author: Hen A.

description: Yummy! First time eating here, the atmosphere is great, super cute Cashier, and great foodies. The burgers are good, but I wouldn't pay so much for it, unless you put bacon on it XD. The shake is also only ok. BUT the garlic fries are to DIE for!!! OMG if there's anything go here and get the garlic fries with dip, the cheese is aged and the fries are perfectly crunchy golden! I will come back if I'm ever in SF for these fries!
author: Aaron W.

description:
The mini burgers are enough to fill you up! But if you're looking for a bit more order the larger burger with cheese. Yeah, with cheese! You won't regret it. Fries are delicious without ketchup on its own already, so I wouldn't even bother getting it. 

Lines are fair in terms of wait time to order and food comes out pretty fast. Check it out!
author: Amy C.

description:
My favorite fast food burger in the City, hands down. Everything I've gotten there has been fantastic. 

My usual: Super Burger with everything, add jalapenos, side of garlic fries.

YUUUMMMM
author: Omid F.

description:
food: 4/5
service: 5/5 (cashier)

I remember when this place opened up a few years ago and now it has gotten so popular. I would say this is the first place that introduced me to really good burgers, and the taste has been consistent every since. The beef they use for the patties are juicey and isn't densely packed. Their chicken burgers are also very good. All burgers here are on the pricier side (around $6), and also small. You might need a side order of fries to actually fill you up. The place is usually frequented by employees at the near by buildings for lunch or dinner. The boozey milkshakes are a no-go for me. It just tastes like milkshake gone bad. I would keep coming here for midday snacks whenever I'm in the area.
author: Cecile S.

description:
Seal the deal with a nice burger.
I luv this joint. I like the atmosphere, the menu choices, and the pickle selection.

I had a chicken sandwich and it was delish!

The fries were crispy perfection.
author: Jo M.

description: Yummy burgers! Yummier shakes! I got the super burger and it was pretty good! I've had a lot of burgers within the last six months or so and I would have to say that this one is a good contender for the top five that I've had in San Francisco. The shakes are pretty pricey, but they are darn good! Organic, too! I've been to Super Duper a few times and out of everything, the most memorable item would have to be the Vanilla shake I had. As for the service, it was a bit slow because the restaurant was crowded so it's excusable. I was extremely happy with the cashiers who took my order. The first time I ordered a combo, but I forgot to substitute the drink for a shake. I went back and the cashier happily changed it just making me pay the difference, even without a receipt. The store is clean and there we didn't have to wait for a table so we were all pretty happy campers. I'd recommend this place and I'll definitely go again.
author: Cesar S.

description:
I heard the line was long, so I went with coworkers early.  We got a table just fine at 11:45, and I learned their veggie burger is vegan if you get it without the mayo and lettuce-wrapped.  The person who took my order was friendly and the food came in a decent amount of time.

It's a good veggie burger (it was wrapped well, didn't fall apart), and their house-made pickles were tasty, although on the sweet side.
author: Jenni S.

description:
Grabbed some lunch here with my friends from San Diego on a beautiful Saturday in the city.

That's where the story stops being so happy... 

Long lines just to get up to order, once ordered food took forever.

When it came out, portions were very small.

My friends chicken sandwich that she ordered had onions, which she asked not be on there.  They took it back, gave it with no onions and no other toppings either.  Went back again, everything right except no bacon... we couldn't win.

And the real kicker is for all this greatness.... almost $60 bucks for the 4 of us getting just a sandwich, fries, and a soda...

Moral of the story, if you want to eat here, make sure to have somebody punch you in the face right as you walk in the door, that way it's a just way less painful dining experience!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Wednesday 9/28 i ordered the mini burger w/bacon and blue cheese, no red onions or mustard, small fries w/sauces. 

Three hours later after eating i was PUKING MY GUTS OUT IN MY TOILET!!!

I should have known better than to trust a place that doesn't take orders for pick up over the phone. It makes me think that they want to SEE each & every customer so they can decide who gets the GOOD burgers and who gets the PUKE burger w/spit in it.

I will NEVER eat here again after becoming VIOLENTLY ILL after eating the food from this place. 

You have been warned.
author: Calama T.

description:
Looks like we are finished Super Dupes. Getting rid of the Portabella Mushroom Sandwich is a deal breaker. The veggie burger is OK, but I'm not always looking for a hummus experience when in a burger mood. The Portabella Sandwich was moist and chewy and uncomplicated like any good relationship should be. 

But now that's over. I will be turning elsewhere to satisfy my needs. I may stop in for the occasional quickie french fry booty call fix, but even that may be too difficult with the memory of how things used to be.

Bring it back or beat it, Supes.
author: Cory W.

description:
The restaurant itself is aesthetically pleasing to look at. I love the lofty/high ceilings, the lights, the walls, the pickles along the walls, the taps.... everything. Ambiance seemed very so-cal/venice-y to me though, and I had wanted to see how SF would do it's own gourmet-burger-vibe. But really it wasn't that big of a deal.

Food:
I had a super burger + everything on it + jalapeno peppers & grilled onions + one organic egg. The meat was incredibly incredibly good, the peppers added a little tang that was perfect, the egg made it fantastic, the bun held up incredibly well - basically, it was amazinggggggggg... but too big. I was told that the mini burgers were small, and I was imagining a slider, but if I ever come again I am definitely getting the mini. 
Garlic fries: i'm a fan. I like how there's a lotta parmesan, and the fresh garlic made me happy.

I also had a sip of the chocolate milkshake, which seemed to be really good as well. Creamy, not over the top sweet. But I personally don't like milkshakes that much, so I don't know if I can judge that very well.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Been here over ten times over last year or so. Hands down best fast food ("Fast Casual") burger around. Legit fries, fresh ground beef, bun, and great house-made pickles. If you don't finish it with a chocolate covered Strauss soft serve......you should be ashamed.

PS:: Mom had a veggie burger here once...and not only did the cashier know the ingredients....it tasted amazing (Mom super picky when it comes to good veggie stuff and she loved it....I was impressed too!)
author: Giancarlo G.

description: The burgers almost live up to their name. They are kind of small compared to a lot of other places. But I'll be gosh darned, they are good. It's a tight squeeze if you're with more than a couple people but definitely worth a visit.
author: Matt C.

description:
Excellent Burger for an excellent price. Superfast service. Perfect place go a quick bite around Union Square. 

They have a simple menu and you cant go wrong with anything on it. Garlic fries are great side to the juicy burger. 

Next time I want to try the cones and the shakes. 

Thanks again guys for the great burger!
author: Evan C.

description:
The food here is excellent. Superb. Seriously the best burgers in town. But I've had strange interactions with the ringers. Here's how:
My first visit went like this--
Me: "I'd like the mini combo with cheese."
Ringer girl punches a million buttons on the keypad and finally says: "Okay, that will be $10.78"
Visit two-- "I'd like the mini combo with cheese."
Ringer guy punches a million buttons and says: "Okay, that will be $10.64"
Visit three--Me: " I'd like the mini combo with cheese"
Ringer guy hits one button and says:  "Okay that will be $10.30."
*swipes my card* 
Ringer guy: "Oh it appears that you don't have enough funds available."
Me: "Oh, okay let me just run across the street and deposit my paycheck."
*goes to Wells Fargo, comes back three minutes later, orders the exact same thing* 
Ringer guy punches a million buttons and says: "Okay that will be $10.45"
-_-
Epic ringer fail. But whatever. Their burgers kick ass.  :)
author: Virginia J.

description: Got the super duper--delicious.  Patties (the super duper comes with two patties) were succulent and done right.  I'm a fan!
author: C L.

description:
Although the burger looks delicious, it's sometimes nausea-inducingly greasy. This is hit-and-miss and I suspect it has to do with which particular chef happened to flip your patty.
