I went with my girlfriend once, and mine was fine, but she couldn't finish hers because of the disgusting amounts of oil that gushed out whenever she bit into it. I thought she was exaggerating, so I tried to finish it for her -- but I couldn't handle it either. Disgusting.

Like some of the other reviewers have commented, ordering your burger well-done may mitigate this somewhat -- but who wants a well-done burger? :)

The fries are nothing to write home about, and the Russian Roulette game you have to play when you order the burger brings this down to 2 stars for me.
author: Adrian P.

description: Their name says it all.  This place is awesome.  Cool concept, great burgers/bacon and tons of extras for you to add to your meal.  I hear the dipped cones are amazing too.
author: Brian S.

description:
I love this place!

The burgers are delicious. The fries are fabulous. The meat is all organic vegetarian feed. In fact, the whole menu comes from organic ingredients I believe. Jalapeños and grilled onions are free (this is a big plus for me). It's kept clean. The food comes quick. The staff is super duper friendly. Prices are reasonable, very reasonable when you consider that the meat and other ingredients are as natural as they are. A 4oz patty burger with fries and a drink is $8 and the same thing with an 8 oz patty is $10. The burgers come with their special sauce and are cooked medium (a little pink in the middle) so be forewarned that they are juicy and your hands (and possibly more if you aren't careful) will get wet; It's a good thing ;)

If you're looking for a tasty burger and fry then this is place is well worth checking out!
author: Vivian A.

description: I gave 3 stars to be neutral. We heard about Super Duper from a couple next to us and it sounded good.  Stopped by after a movie for a chocolate shake and a burger.   They were out of chocolate and suggested we go to the other store at the Metreon. So... We hiked on over to the Metreon store and when we arrived, it was closed!  We still wanted one of their hamburgers so we turned right around and hurried back to the Market street store. I guess Super Duper Burger was not to be tonight because the Market St. Store was now closed also.! :(   We were bummed and wonder why the counter dude sent us over to the other store so close to closing time!?!  Oh well, we're now sharing a Subway sandwich and a drink since they are right around the corner and open 24 hours. Perhaps next time we are in town we will have better luck!
author: S T.

description:
They have beer, have cute guy cashiers, have dipped cones (YAY!), and are right on Market--those are good things. 

But, just go to Pearl's. The burger wasn't bad, but it wasn't great (greasy, too much bun) and the string fries were overly salted. If I didn't know Pearl's wasn't that far wary,  I'd like this place more, but I know better. Just go to Pearl's.
author: MakeUp M.

description:
I've been hearing about this place and yesterday for lunch, my friends and I decided to check it out.  Lines are long, so expect to wait during lunch time.  NO parking, so unless you walk there you will need to take this TOGO.

I ordered a mini burger with blue cheese with jalapeno peppers and garlic fries.  I must say it was pretty tasty.  The bun they use is pretty good too.  $5 for a mini burger and $2.75 for the fries.  ( reasonable)  If you like pickles...well they're free! haha

Definitely will come back.
author: Sandy L.

description:
Everything here is DELICIOUS! I ordered a burger with a fried egg, garlic fries, and a chocolate shake. Every item was so yummy and refreshing. The shake was very chocolaty, and the fries were awesome. I am a fry fiend, and I was very sad that I only ordered one serving. The burger had simple ingredients, which you can see and taste.

THE BEST PART: FREE HOMEMADE PICKLES! I love pickles, and I can easily say that these were the best pickles I have ever had in my life. I was tempted to just grab a jar and head out. They are the perfect balance of acid, spicy, and sweet (not in a gross way either!).
author: Kerina J.

description:
Wow..so I have a lot of catching up to do with my reviews!!

I love this place! I first heard about this place by my boyfriend. One just opened in Mill Valley as well, It seems to have exploded!!

I had the veggie burger with cheese and it was sooooo good. The hamburger pattys remind me of sponge bob's crabby patty's. They are perfectly round and small. If your worried about portions...this place is for you. It's the perfect size to keep you satisfied. The french fries are ok but you probably shouldn't be eating those anyway. 

It's definitely a spot to go after you've been shopping for hours. The upstairs seating is cool, especially if you like to people watch. I would definitely go back. 

The workers there are hipsterish. Cool dude..snap..snap..
author: Denise C.

description:
I'm so excited that there's an affordable, tasty option to stop and eat at on Market Street in the Financial District area. I use to walk around not knowing where to eat except for the lame shopping mall food court or that horrendous pizza place Blondies on Powell.

I got the 4oz mini burger with cheddar and bacon and it was really awesome. I love when you have the option of a smaller burger and it was done perfectly. A lot of times burger places overcook the smaller burger and they're not as juicy. No problem with that here!

And the garlic fries were amazing. I didn't realize that they came with parmesan cheese on them too! My only mild complaint on them is that they were a bit too greasy.

I will be making regular trips here. My boyfriend even thought it was better than the beloved Burgermeister.
author: Tabitha L.

description:
Tasty burgers, in my opinion, though for the amount you get for the mini burger and the fries, it shouldn't cost about $8.68 for it.  My friends and I wanted to try this place out so we decided to do so on a Saturday afternoon before attending a concert.  I ordered the Mini Burger w/cheese and had everything on it, along with the fries w/3 dips.  Everything was good, but again, a bit overpriced, when comparing it to what you get from In-n-Out, for example.  

But then again, eating at a a place like this (we sat upstairs) is a much more relaxing experience overall and even though it was crowded most of the time while we were there, it isn't anywhere near the craziness you'd find at an In-n-Out ,so there are trade-offs.  If I stopped by here in the near future, I would love to try their shakes or soft serve ice cream!
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
I ate here today for the first time, I've walked past this place so many times but have been turned off from the line. 
I must say, very impressed, I've eaten a lot of burgers in my time and this would have to have been my favorite by far. 

I had the mini burger and added cheese and egg, this certainly was big enough. also had the cookie and cream milkshake. again best milkshake I've honestly ever had. 
besides the quality of the food, I was super impressed at the cleanliness of the place, I went in about 5.30 and was busy, yet the staff still manage to keep it clean.

STAFF: It was also very pleasant to be served by such a lovely friendly lady, not sure her name but she had a tattoo on her arm. wasn't a fake friendly I don't want to be here NEXT in line service, she was genuinely friendly. I noticed there seems to be good team work happening here too. the burger flippers were working hard to pump out all the burgers as fast as possible , all looking clean and hygienic wearing gloves, which is important to me especially if they are viewable while I'm eating.

If I had to say 1 bad thing about my experience it would that the egg yolk exploded and leaked down my arm, eww. lol. but thats no ones fault. also i'm confused about the sign that says, apple employees order on right. do they get special service. not sure I guess its not really my business.

very happy. so glad found my new burger place. wooooo.
author: Jimmy L.

description: The service is really super duper. Nice food and service. The location is also good. Highly recommended.
author: Charlie K.

description: Must have: super duper burger with egg! One of the best burgers places in San Francisco! Free all you can eat pickles!! The shakes are good also.
author: Allen L.

description: Yummy! Great vege burger with blue cheese and avocado. The chicken sandwich with aioli is so good, too. If you get the fries... Gt the three dipping sauces. Try the pickle mix! Yummmmmm!
author: Lyndsey C.

description: what can i say the name fits the food! super duper burgers!  juicy burgers, friendly  staff and clean! enjoy!!!!!
author: Vanessa P.

description:
The only thing that really stood out for me at Super Duper was the burger patty. It was extremely tender and prepared very well.

Everything else was just okay. The cheese was a little too mild, but I did like how it was nicely semi-melted on my burger. The fried egg on top was extremely salty, which definitely messed up the taste of my burger. 

Their homemade pickles were okay, but I wish they were much crispier. Soggy sweet pickles just aren't as good to me.

Fries weren't very good. Some of the fries in our batch were overcooked and the flavor just wasn't there. The garlic fries had barely any garlic flavor in them at all.

I would be willing to try Super Duper again, because the burger patty was really that good. However, I'm definitely making sure that they don't over-salt my fried egg again.
author: Roy C.

description:
I wanted to have a healthy lunch after chowing on Pizzeria Delfina last night but alas, it wasn't meant to be. With assurances that this would be a stellar burger, i busted out the mini burger combo with garlic fries and a side helping of way too effing crowded. 

Upon first chomp, i quickly realized that I've had better burgers from the drive through. Tragedy strikes, hopes flame out, another mediocre meal. Whataburger has got moves these people can't touch. And it's not like they're doing the Melbourne shuffle.

Anyhizzle, if you must go and have a burger, make sure that you're augmenting with a boozie milkshake. It will make your lackluster burger seem semi-acceptable.
author: Kelly S.

description:
I think this is the place I'm going to go if I'm craving Fatburger.  They cook the patty on a griddle so the meat has a little crust to it while the inside is cooked to medium for a little pink in the middle.  I got the Mini Burger, which was plenty for me.  It looks small but it's still 4 ounces of meat!!  Husband had the super burger, which is two 4-ounce patties with two slices of cheese.  Their fries are good and I loved helping myself to the unlimited homemade pickles sitting in jars next to the soda machine.  

Only bummer today was that I was too full to get the chocolate-dipped soft-serve cone that I also wanted.  I *guess* I'll have to go back again...heh heh.
author: Nina L.

description:
I bought a bunch of mini burgers and everyone loved it. The veggie burgers are really good too, even though I'm not vegetarian. I LOVE the garlic fries!

Word of warning tho, the mini burgers were so good I saved some for the next day. Burgers cooked medium rare does not taste good after a day. Don't make the same mistake I did, finish all your super duper burgers and DONT SAVE IT for later!
author: Song Z.

description:
Yes, I was super duped. But I don't think that's what the name was supposed to imply.

There are reasons why more restaurants aren't right on Market Street in downtown SF. Too many people. Too many tourists. Too many crazies. Now, imagine getting a burger and a beer with all these extras. 

Let me say that my burger was good. It was cooked well and was tasty. And the guy who took my order was, in addition to being cute, very personable and helpful. That's where the fun ended.

Super Duper on Market is loud. People shout. The music blares. The sounds of the city are right outside. The menu is a bit confusing, too. Let's see, I want a burger, so I look up at the menu board. First, if like most Western educated human beings you read left to right, you will come to the toppings for your burger prior to actually seeing what kind or what size of burger you can order. It's an odd arrangement. Oh, and "Everything On It" apparently doesn't actually mean everything. Weird, right?

The fries and dipping sauces were good, not great. I got the garlic fries and had to go back to the counter to request the dipping sauces I had paid for. Deny me peace and quiet but NEVER deny me dipping sauce!

All in all, it's better than McDonald's, I'm sure. I haven't had a McD burger in years, but I can imagine. My advice, though, is to save up your money from two potential visits to Super Duper and go to Marlowe or nopa for a burger instead. You'll get a better burger, a clean table, and actual service. Best of all, it won't be on Market Street.
author: Todd X.

description:
Go in ask for a mini burger to go with soda and garlic fries. Cashier says okay and asks if it was to go. I replied, yes it is. She hands me a glass cup. i asked her wasn't this for to go. She fixes it and charges me.

Few minutes later, another girl behind the counter yells out my name for an order of garlic fries to go. A bit confused, I head up there and it's my order but my burger's missing... Girl behind counter apologizes and goes grabs my burger. 

Head back to the office to eat. Take one bite... WTF! It's a veggie burger... I take a look at the receipt... it says veggie... great. The cashier redid my order wrong.

Super Duper? No, more like Super Lame. How many mistakes can they do?
author: Steven B.

description:
A couple months ago I found myself on Market Street on a warm and bright afternoon with a hankering for a soft serve cone. I satisfied my craving at McDonald's. I'm not a big fan of fast food these days, but there are a few items my appetite still has a soft spot for.

Today I found myself in the same predicament. Only this time, I was further up Market towards San Francisco Shopping Center. I wasn't going to turn back and walk a few blocks in the other direction for McDonald's. But I did eye a sign with a big 'ol soft serve cone on it. Not just any soft serve, but organic Straus Creamery soft serve.

I'm not super sold on the Straus Creamery brand, mind you. I've bought a $5 dollar quart of Straus Creamery organic milk to foam for my home-brewed lattes. The quality was at best marginal over other organic brands. It felt like drinking the emperor's new milk.

So here we are at Super Duper, and I see a kid walk out with a short dark chocolate soft serve cone. I look up at the menu, Vanilla, Chocolate, or both, $3.50 a pop. I order a twist and the guy behind the counter says they're out of chocolate. Lame. So I get the vanilla. The cone he spins up is at least taller than the kid's outside. That makes me feel a little better.

The texture is rich, as is the flavor. It reminded me of the creamy flavor you get from Mister Softee trucks in New York, it's not exactly the same taste as ice cream or other soft serve cones, but lighter, with a heavy dose of milk fat. The soft serve was definitely dense and rich. But is it really worth three times the cost of a soft serve cone from McDonald's?

I think not.
author: Tony L.

description:
All organic fast food? Yes, please! My brother's coworker suggested Burger Bar at Macy's but after pouring over Yelp reviews, I decided it was best for our wallets and time that we go to Super Duper instead. 

We ordered 2 mini burger combos with soda, and garlic fries for 8.00 each, totaling 20.00, 10.00 each and we don't have to leave a tip? I'll take it! It's worth it and you get your burger medium and it's juicy. Burgers come with super duper sauce (think thousand island), japalenos, onions, crispy lettuce, tomatoes, and pickles. Extras are fried egg, cheese, and avocado, 1.00 each.

Grass fed beef and all organic ingredients. My brother could tell the difference in the organic beef. Non diet sodas are made from real cane sugar, I believe. Get there before 12 on a weekend and there'll be no line and plenty of seats. I would come back again someday. Good for your wallet but not your waistline!
author: Ally W.

description: really nice! at the first time, the burger look small to me, compared with other burgers that I'd seen before. But this burger is thick enough for me at least.
author: Yunseok J.

description: The food is great priced and is tasty! They originally messed up my order, but they have great service and made it up to me with a smile! The manager (Randy?) was great and went above and beyond. Thank you!
author: Kiyong K.

description: After a holiday party, Super Duper was calling our name.  I had never been before but had read good reviews and was looking forward to it and was not disappointed.  It's set up like a lot of burger places now but there were a lot of choices so definitely be prepared when you get to the front of the line.  I got the double burger with all the fixins and fries.  Everything was really tasty and the pickles they had too were really good.  I'll definitely head back here since it's pretty close to our home.
author: Blake B.

description:
A good addition to the SOMA lunch scene. It will definitely be a go-to when it's the week before my period and all I want to do is eat an entire cow in between screaming at my coworkers. I also foresee it being a go-to when a coworker screams at me and I need to go cry into a spiked milkshake. 

The only reason I would tell someone to not go here is if he or she has a "pooping in the office" phobia. These menu items go right through you so you better be relaxed about that sort of thing, if you catch my meaning.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
To make it gluten free pass on the sauce and get a lettuce wrap. Great simple classic burger. 

Be warned it can get very crowded at lunch hour and this can some times affect the quality of the burger. On my second visit to this place my burger was over cooked.
author: Pilar M.

description: Solid all around.  I'm perplexed how they can even turn a profit with all the pickles I devour while I'm there.
author: Darin E.

description:
FOOD:
Super Duper w/ Chz = Yummy. Can taste the real meat. Otherwise kind of a simply good burger. 


SERVICE:
Order pickup at counter. Kind of a nice fast food burger joint.. 


ATMOSPHERE:
Kind of like a contemporary minimalistic cafe feel. Not too big. A balcony second floor. Small front door patio seating.

9.17
author: Angela L.

description: Very good! We were exhausted tourists looking for a burger and a salad. We upgraded to parmesan garlic fries and it was well worth it! Also being the stereotypical pregnant lady at the time the free pickles hit the spot. When we picked up our food they also offered us two milk shakes that were left and those were delicious as well!
author: SN G.

description:
Great place!!!
Really juicy meat with all the good stuffs.
But the best thing here is the PICKLE!!!
author: JK C.

description:
I love that I work a few blocks from this place. It's the perfect "let's meet for lunch!" restaurant when I have friends who are in town and want to meet up for lunch.  I also love and appreciate the fact that they offer a mini burger.  I can barely finish that 4 oz patty, let alone contemplate finishing an 8 oz one!  The boyfriend's also a big fan of the chicken burger, he said that unlike other places the chicken is juicy and delicious.

I haven't tried the shakes here yet, but I can attest that the fries are delicious!  I don't think you can really go wrong here though.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: fantastic burger! so fast! friendly staff. I could have sworn market street didn't have places like this! ordered the mini meal and burger was perfect.  highly recommended for a quick, reasonably priced lunch.
author: Roy N.

description: So the burger itself was good great flavor - the garlic fries were great and I LOVED the free pickles.  However, the burgers were just too damn greasy. I know, I know, it's a burger! Burgers are greasy! But seriously though, my hands were COVERED in grease.
author: Alison H.

description:
The first time I came here was about a year ago and I never wanted to come back because the meat was dry and the fries were soaked in oil. 

But then I went again with a friend on the spur of the moment this past weekend, I was about to order another burger! It was sooooo delicious. I got a super duper burger (of course, I couldn't have ordered another one because I could barely move after the first one). The meat was super juicy, the buns were nice and toasty and the garlic fries were so tasty that my mouth is drooling for them right now. Although they can lay off the oil/grease a little bit. I'm sooo craving this place right now, I might end up coming there for dinner tonight. A definite must-go if you're in the city. 

(I also think they're better than Umami's if you've ever been there. But then again, I've only had Umami's in LA, not the new location in SF.)
author: Sheri N.

description: Been here twice as the burgers are yummy and the garlic fries even more so.  Ordered the Super Duper last time and it was too much meat for me honestly, so I guess will stick with the Mini Burger from now on. I wish they did a half portion for the garlic fries - I end up gobbling down the whole thing because they are so good and I don't wanna bin them.
author: Manasi G.

description:
My go to order:  mini burger with cheese bacon and an egg, and garlic fries. The burger is served open faced so before you smush the second half of your bun on the perfectly fried egg, scoop the yolk on top of your garlic fries and let them soak in the yumminess. There are also some chillies in the pickle jars to spice up your burger with. 

There are two sizes: mini and super. The difference is an extra patty but I think a mini is enough to fill up even theist ravenous eater. 

Seriously, try this place out. 

P.s. two mini burgers with cheese, bacon, and egg, one garlic fries, and one soda = $19.80
author: Le T.

description:
When I strolled into Super Duper, I ate the best burger of my life. Not kidding. 

Super Duper at 721 Market is a very open, noisy loft. It's as if someone remodeled a barn with industrial materials and said "We're open for business!" I went at the peak of lunch so the line was 20 or so deep. Customers range from college students congregating over milkshakes to businessmen trying to avoid getting sauce on their ties. I ordered the regular 8 oz. hamburger with super sauce and added bleu cheese. My man and I split the garlic fries. I wanted a milkshake or at least an Arnold Palmer but had to refrain. 

The actual burger patty is the star of the show. I know they offer chicken, but please get the cow. Juice literally ran down my hands and forearms because I wasn't well prepared with Super Duper's rustic napkins. With each bite I couldn't believe this burger was real. I wanted to film it! It was hot, moist, "it-would-fall-apart-if-not-for-the-bun" tender, and quite simply perfect. The melted bleu cheese added a tangy creaminess and even more juice (which was absorbed by the sweet toasted bun). Oh, and our garlic fries were awesome, but that's really an afterthought.

But you know what they say about too much of a good thing...I suppose the only "con" is that Super Duper does its job so well, it's borderline overdoing it. I was also at fault because I didn't know when to stop for my own good. Those last few guilt-ridden bites were best left on the table. It's apparent I had waited too long for lunch.

I sat at a barstool next to the kitchen's glass wall to spy on *how* they make their burgers so juicy and I have three words: flat top griddle. I'll never put burger meat on another charcoal grill as long as I live. 

If a doctor tells me one day I need a heart stent, I'll know which burger put the nail in my cardiac coffin. :)
author: Miranda L.

description:
Barely 4 stars.

Came here for lunch on a Saturday.  This place reminds me of an upgraded Five Guys.  We got the mini (one patty), the super burger (two patties), the garlic fries, and the homemade lemonade with brown sugar.

The burger and garlic fries tasted fresh.  Even though they got my order wrong (gave me bell peppers instead of roasted portobello mushrooms) it was still good.  I liked the garlic fries the most because they were crispy and you get all the pickles you want, slightly spicy, sweet, and crunchy.  The lemonade with brown sugar was alright, nothing special.

I'd come back if I was in the area and wanted a burger.
author: Joycelyn L.

description:
Now if you are going to call yourself something as amazing as Super Duper, you're going to have to pull out all the stop. This means, WOW my mouth. It's takes a lot to shut me up (I talk a lot you see) but good food will have me quietly munching rather than gassing during a lunch break. Did Super Duper achieve this... almost.

Their chips are super skinny with the skins on which makes a huge difference from a lot of the processed crap that is often served up. The burger, tasty. Not blow me away awesome but I won't be complaining about it. I went for a mini. There was nothing mini about it! A huge patty with meaty juices flowing out the side. They have a lovely selection of dips but all were very creamy, it'd be nice to see some sort of salsa or relish to dip their sexy chips in.

So I hear this is a new place in town and they seem to have queues out the door waiting for the burgers, chips and ice cream. Is it worth it... maybe!
author: Lizzie S.

description:
The guys in my office kept mentioning Super Duper and I thought they were making a bad joke about how great this burger place is.  I finally realized it was an actual restaurant when a friend of mine dragged me out.  When we arrived at 6pm on a weeknight the restaurant was packed which I took as a good sign.

Being ambitious, I ordered the super burger (8oz of meat) with everything on it.  Together with my friend we split the garlic fries and a chocolate strawberry shake.  A few bites in I found that two patties was far too much.  I removed one and finished the sandwich as a regular burger.  It was fantastic.  My friend was very impressed with his burger.  The shake was good, although it was a little odd with the strawberry flavoring.  And who can turn down garlic drenched fries?

A few days later my office ordered Super Duper for lunch (I don't suggest making a large order since they don't mark the items and it can get seriously confusing).  This time I tried the veggie burger with avocado.  Wow, seriously amazing.  Probably one of the best veggie burgers I've had.

I'll definitely be returning.  The service was quick (they give you a buzzer so you know when your food is ready) and the food was priced well.
author: Michelle K.

description: Delicious burgers and nice workers. Only complaint I have is sometimes they make mistakes on the orders. It has happened two times already where they forgot to add bacon on my order.
author: Andres F.

description: Stopped by with a couple of my friends during new years eve. It was also our first time. Service was pretty fast. I ordered the super duper burger combo which came with the burger, french fries, and your own choice of soda. The burger came with two patties and cooked medium. Although it was filled with good flavors, it also seemed a little too greasy. After 3/4ths of the burger, the meat started to feel chewy. The fries were great. Next time, I want to try their straus organic soft serve vanilla choco-dipped ice cream cone.
author: Rowell S.

description:
I came here with my gf while we were looking for a place to eat dinner on new years eve. We were hungry after walking around marker, so we were down to eat anything. When we went in, we noticed the menu at the counter. For burgers you can get the mini which you can assume is a burger with one patty. However, since we were hungry, we went with the super burger with everything on it and got the garlic fries.

The wait was not so long compared to in n out. We got our food within 10 minutes of waiting. When we got our burgers, it looks the same size an an in n out burger. However, the burger is much juicier. When we peel away the wrapper, you can see the juice of the burger leaking out. The garlic fries are well done too. You can actually taste the garlic on them. In addition, they add cheese on top.

Justification for 4 stars: I gave this a four star is that the portion is small for that price. Granted that this business aim for organic, fresh, and eco-friendly which they certainly achieved. For a small burger, it offers a different taste compared to in n out or habit burgers that makes it distinguishable. Definitely recommend trying it if you are in the city.
author: David H.

description:
Came up to SF for a movie pre screen at the Metreon and was digustingly hungry! I figured if I walk down Market i'm bound to find something. Alas Super Duper plopped itself in front of me! It's like a healthier In-N-Out.

Pros
Clean
Quick lines
Biodegradable containers
Huge portions! 

Cons:
Umm... I can't think of any! :)

We got 2 chicken burgers. One with the special sauce and one with the chipotle sauce. Both sauces being pretty tasty! Other yelp reviewers were raving about their pickles. I decided to give it a whirl but found that I didn't ike it one bit. Oh well! Different strokes for different folks! We got our food to go as we wanted to get to the theater early to wait in line. Fast forward 20 mins and we're chomping down on our burgers and they were so yummy! I don't think either one of us talked to each other the entire time we were eating. Others waiting in line around us were gawking and stopping to ask where we got it from!! 

Next time I take a shopping trip to SF, I know i'll be stopping by Super Duper!
author: Michelle H.

description:
I always walk by this place on my way to work, but it never caught my eye because it used to be another cafe place. 

My friend Kelani T. introduced me to this place because we wanted a light dinner that's not too filling. I decided on the one patty burger no cheese and grilled mushrooms for extra $1. We got water and a side of garlic fries.

The burger was oily but that was expected. the grilled mushrooms looked TOO grilled and black. and i couldn't taste it. the burger lacked taste. it's made fresh though, i rather go to in n out for the same thing but cheaper!

their garlic fries didn't look good and was a really small serving for the price. i exptected bigger. and they sprinkled cheese on top which we did not like. we asked them to make another one w/o the parmesan cheese and they did. point for that! 

probably won't come back unless it was a last resort.
author: Alice Z.

description:
They had two options of beef either 8oz or 4oz which to them was called the mini, it was a actually a good size along with a drink and a side of fries could make a a pretty stuff meal. 

Super duper is known for their secret sauce called the super sauce yet I didn't taste anything super or maybe they put just a small teaspoon onto my 4oz that I wasn't able to taste it at all! The meat was juicy and medium raw medium cook. The fries were crispy yet it wasn't too thick or too thin which was good. 

I noticed several customers were ordering the fries with their 3 sides for $3 which came with house made mayo, super sauce and chipotle. Seems appealing maybe that would be a nice try on my next return. The organic shakes looked delicious too. These are two must items to try besides the housemade pies they have. 

Tip: if you just want something to line your belly then a 4oz is good otherwise get the 8oz or other types of meat like chicken that looks good too. 

Enjoy!
author: Linh D.

description: I got a Super with Fries.  The burger patties were PERFECT.  Crunch from the char, but still super juicy and seasoned right.  Mine had cheese, lettuce, tomato and super sauce.  Strange they did not ask what kind of cheese, maybe they only had one? Fries were crisp.  The place was hopping on Thursday at lunch.  I'll be back when I want a satisfying burger.
author: Daren C.

description:
Although the patties were a bit too greasy, they sported nice, deep char and a slight touch of pink when ordered medium/mid-rare. The patties aren't too tightly packed, a hallmark of pre-formed patties, and boasted a robust beefiness that showcased the higher quality of beef. 

The Strauss Soft Serve makes yet another appearance and has a rich, clean flavor - it's definitely worth a try!
author: Kevin N.

description:
I really thought my food was 5 stars good.  I had the portabello burger with fries and a REAL coke but the best part is the pickles.  I am easy to sell on anything if you give me a free pickle dinner.  Seriously. 

Also the line was insanely long when I went so they handed out rather large french fries samples.  Yes you can buy my endorsement with delicious skinny fries.
author: Cork C.

description:
Delish Delish!
Loved the sauce they put on the bun. Not sure what the sauce is exactly but I do know my mouth is salivating as Im writing this review so I know Super Duper did something right, am I right?
author: Natasha I.

description:
So this place is an OK place but being that it's the only good burger place in the area, it's fantastic. I personally have only had the "mini" burger. I believe that is a quarter pound burger.  The super burger seems to just be two patties. That's way too much for me. I was watching them make the burger because it sucks when you see someone kill them by squeezing any bit of flavor out of them with the flipper. These guys start with a round ball of meat lined on the grill and then play whack-a-mole and flatten them and then flip once. Pretty good imo. They also have shakes. The chocolate strawberry is pretty good and I think even contains real strawberries.  This is becoming a regular spot ... crap need to find a gym now for real. 

The line moves decently fast but don't expect to be in and out in like 10 minutes.
author: Greg G.

description:
Pretty good for a fast food burger joint. This chain is like in between In-n-Out and Umami Burger. 

Juicy thick patties. 
Tons of topping options and garlic fries were legit. 
Quick service and clean tables. 
Around $10 / burger. 

I'm sold. Next to Umami, this is probably my favorite burger joint in town.
author: Lily S.

description: Garbage. I hope it was a mistake or something yesterday, a slip of the cook's hand, but that burger I had yesterday was a mouthful of salt hiding a block of grease. I could not taste the meat at all, and the sunny side up egg just left a mess on the tray. Good service, but good god was it awful.
author: FJ v.

description: I know I am too old to be speaking this way, but OMG, the garlic fries here are great!!! The chicken burger/sandwich is great too!!! My fiancé and I went here after the 2015 Chinese New Years Parade. The female cashier working that night was really friendly and made us feel welcomed. It was really crowded inside and I did not want to stand up, especially being that I just stood up for several hours during the parade. A seat came avail at the counter top area and I grabbed it. lol, was going to make my fiancé stand but a worker on break, I assume, gave us a seat.  Born and raised in SF and did not know about this place until that day. We are so going back real soon.
author: J M.

description:
Randomly looked up a Burger place near my work on yelp and found this little Gem. 

I was worried at first cause it was super busy when I got there but to my suprise service was super fast. They had people buzzing around cleaning and taking turns with orders so that everything kept moving at a good pace. 

The Burgers here are awesome! First of all whoever said they are greasy, thats flavor hon. It was so good. They grind the meat each day and you can tell. One of the best parts is the regualr burger is a double and you have to get a mini fi you want only one patty. 

I also love that they have fresh made pickles sitting at the country to take as you please. The only downside is they are sweet pickles. No dill.
author: Jessica A.

description:
A great burger can really hit the spot for me almost any day. I've had a couple great ones in this city at some random spots, but haven't had them be very consistent at any of those places. At least at Super Duper it is consistently delicious, whether it's the mini burger or super burger.

I really don't understand how anyone could say these burgers have no flavor. If you honestly believe they are "flavorless" then you have no tastebuds left and shouldn't be reviewing restaurants. Excellent meat from Niman Ranch, cooked medium, with fresh crunchy veggies, "secret sauce" and a soft tasty bun (+cheese and bacon if you have an extra few bucks).. All that equals a TASTY burger. I'd also like to know how many of those "it's flavorless" people smoke cigarrettes. Or Meth.

I haven't been to the Castro location, but this one is pretty roomy, as it has plenty of seating (usually) downstairs, and a few more tables upstairs and outside. I enjoy the decor, especially the large cutout of a cow in puzzle-style natural wood pieces, with very different grain patterns and finishes.

Chicken sandwich was okay but not fantastic, the chicken I got was slightly tough and dry. The garlic fries are also just okay, as the fries themselves are thin-cut and cooked well done (perfect) but the garlic was too light, and parmesan too heavy.

Strangely I still haven't had the ice cream, as I'm usually in the area for work so I just get meals and skip the dessert. However that's next on my list, as I've heard great things.

Lines can get very long during peak times, but I personally think it's worth the wait. Plus the staff will give out free fries while you wait. So far my favorite burger in SF!
author: Chris G.

description:
4.5 stars-desu!

This place, is in fact, super duper! Went here for lunch and got the Super Combo with the double patty and fries. Juicy beef and I dont know what they're doing, but it's pretty amazing. 

Fries are also pretty amazing. With the combo, they give you 3 different sauces or whatever. Aioli. All of them were very good, and honestly are good on the burger itself :P. 

The place is pretty packed every time I've seen it, but the wait is worth it!
author: Dustin H.

description: Good place it you just need a flavorful, filling burger.
author: Margaret R.

description:
I love Super Duper! It's always clean and efficient. Food is consistently good and I always leave satisfied. 

Not super greasy and heavy. A little pricey for a burger combo that does not meet my In-N-Out standards. 

Nonetheless, it's good food.
author: Lydia L.

description:
Like many recent reviewers, I got in on the Free Burger promotion, and I was quite happy with the result. Their burger is not as massive as some places - which was nice, as I could actually eat it without having to imitate Jaws - but the quality certainly makes up for it. The burger was juicy, flavorful, well-dressed (lettuce, red onion, cheese, tomato), and came on a tasty and slightly-toothy bun, more like a classic Kaiser roll than the standard supermarket or fast-food bun.

The space has an industrial feel to it, with concrete flooring and aluminum tables and chairs. I appreciated that the soda fountain was self-serve, so presumably refills are included (which at $2 for a soda, they certainly should be). The condiment bar is mostly limited to ketchup and mustard, but they do have complimentary pickle spears, both dill and (slightly) spicy. The burger runs about $7 and fries are +$2, so it won't be a common destination for me, but it's not too bad for the area. Given the quality, when I'm craving a burger, this is likely going to be a go-to place.
author: Bill B.

description:
Wow!
This place rocked.  I got the recommendation from my salesman at Hannspree.  I ordered the double burger with the works, the garlic fries and a shake.  Great, great taste.  When I come back I do plan on having another meal here.
Great job, Super Duper
author: Christy M.

description: Disappointed with the burger today. Bun was stale and completely disappointed with my usual super duper experience. Probably will not return to this location.
author: Elizabeth N.

description: Our first night in San Francisco, starving, we stumbled upon Super Duper Burgers, looked up the Yelp reviews and decided to check it out for ourselves. The line was semi-long but out the door by the time we were done ordering, signaling this was THE place to eat at (and that we have impeccable timing). Their menu setup is very much like most pizza joints... a few "specials' and the rest being a base burger that you are charged per item for. The list of toppings, though is pretty great and has the best of the best (in my mind). I was easily able to order my signature burger... bleu cheese, bacon, and avocado. Most drinks (except the lemonade sweetened with brown sugar) are self-service and there are jars of truly incredibly house-made pickles to snack on while you wait. Our burger were well-seasoned, perfectly medium to medium rare and served on sturdy, delicious buns. The pricing was fairly reasonable for that neighborhood and we ended up going back again the next day for lunch and the food was even better than the night before.
author: Deborah K.

description: We walked to this restaurant from the hotel room and we hit the line just right - the line was short.  The burger I had here was good; I personally didn't care for the garlic fries.  To me, this wasn't an over the top burger place.
author: Edward G.

description:
I came in here when I had a brutal hangover after a night of barhopping in SF. The counter guy asked if I wanted a beer with my combo and I admitted that I was not feeling fantastic. He replied that he could personally vouch for the fact that these burgers were a great hangover remedy. He was not wrong.

This location was big with tons of seating and really friendly staff. But the most important part: the burger! Really tasty and juicy. Don't forget to get extra napkins.
author: Courtney B.

description:
Came after reading about it in a food blog. Had to try it!

Seating
Lots, upstairs and down. Nice tables and chairs too.

Decor
Modern. Nice, neat menus up top.

Service
Cashiers were nice. They call your name when your food is ready, but I do wish this was better organized. Ended up waiting for my food longer than others who ordered before me, and got it soon after... cold. Wish they took a little more time to make sure the food was warm when served.

Food
Mini Burger w/ Cheese- Yum! Juicy meat with melted cheese and soft buns. Just wish it wasn't so cold from sitting out there.. -_- Comparable to In N Out, but tastes/looks a little more gourmet. 
Garlic Fries- Typical, but good! 
Cookies- They were calling out to me next to the cashier, so I had to get one! ($0.80). It was alright. Maybe since it was closer to the end of the day and it wasn't as fresh, but it def looked better than it actually was. Not their specialty, so it was okay.

Price
Burger w/ cheese is $5 + other items you want. Fries are $2.75. Cookie was $0.80.

Simple but tasty meal. Still upset it was cold, but wasn't worth the fight. Def willing to come by again for a 2nd chance. I want to try their milkshakes!
author: Candice H.

description:
Here's what I love about Super Duper:

You won't be plagued by the huge variety of choice -- there's only a few options and this simplicity is much needed.

You can get a regular burger that they call a mini burger! YEAH! I'm eating a mini burger ;)

Service is pretty fast. You can get the ice cream cone in line and then pick it up after you're done enjoying your burger.

Not sure why there is cheese mixed in the garlic fries so I opted for regular, but everything else is dandy.
author: Adele Z.

description:
I walked into this place not believing the hype. I've never been much of a burger eater, but when someone tells me about a fantastic burger joint, its a must for me. Upon walking in, I loved the really cool vibe. The employees there are pretty awesome& easy on the eyes (well, most). I took a moment to look at the menu& I absolutely loved that everything was organic & the meat was all free-range. I'm very health conscious of all the crap I consume so I was blown away. AND!! Best part... They make their own pickles. Its so awesome. They have this top shelf in the joint where the pickles just ferment in jars. How cool is that?! They even have organic soft serve ice cream. *SHUT UP, NO WAY!* The place gets pretty busy, but everyone gets in & out pretty quickly. Please hit this place up. You will not regret it! 

P.S. The garlic fries are a MUST-have. Seriously.
author: Cat M.

description:
The Super Duper name doesn't match the so-so food.

My friends and I tried some 1/4 lb mini burgers. I was expecting a nice juicy, cheesy patty with an "artisanal bun" like they advertise. But of course, I'm hugely disappointed with an overcooked patty that's lost all of its juice and flavor, a very typical bun that can be found at any supermarket, and plastic-y tasting cheese. I really don't know why this place gets a line and hype - it was almost just as bad as any McD's burger. At least the prices weren't that bad.

The $4.75 milkshake somewhat saved the meal - it tasted really good. But how hard is it to screw up a milkshake? And the fries were forgettable.

Gott's at the Ferry Building and Pearl's burgers triumph over this place in taste and service.
author: Jeffrey Y.

description:
HOLY. MOLY. I'm an In-N-Out faithful, but I'd cheat on a Double Double any day for a Super Duper Burger! This place makes really GREAT burgers and the fries are SOOOOOO good!
Got my order To-Go, but I ate two bites of a Super Duper Burger with everything+bacon and cheese, fell in love, waited an hour later to meet up with some friends and finished it off in Union Square. I fell in love twice that afternoon! The fries hold up pretty well after an hour, but I highly suggest eating everything fresh!
Keep doing what you're doing!
author: Jerald B.

description:
I was in San Francisco looking for a place to get a burger. I took out my phone opened my Yelp app and searched "burger" from my current location (Downtown SF). The first place that caught my eye was Super Duper. It wasn't exactly what I had in mind (looking for more of a sit-down/diner type of place) when I got there but, the food was really good, nonetheless.

I ordered a bacon cheeseburger with avocado, which is my standard for first time visits at new hamburger joints, and I was definitely pleased. The meat was just how I like it (medium-well) and their super sauce is to die for. I also ordered the garlic fries, which were AMAZING and topped with aged cheddar. Even though I was satisfied with the food, the price is a bit on the expensive side considering the size of the burgers, and if you're planning on sharing fries...I would suggest ordering your own.

Another thing I liked about this place is the layout. It's pretty neat. There are a few tables upstairs that overlook part of the kitchen and cashier area. I wanted to score one of those tables, but they were all occupied when my order was ready. Overall, I enjoyed my experience here and plan on returning when I'm in the area.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
I really enjoyed not only the burger, but the fries and dips and their milkshakes. Prices are reasonable and right and the ordering service was awesome. Booze is available.

Be prepared to wait a bit but bring your appetite and have at!
author: Megan G.

description: My current addiction.  I'm a big cheeseburger guy.  These aren't the best burgers I've ever had in my life (that distinction belongs to Kuma's Korner in Chicago), but these are consistently the best cheeseburgers in SF and the service is always so damn cheery in the most sincere way.
author: Michael G.

description:
*On our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks.* 

We came here first thing at the beginning of the year on a lunch break and have been back a few times since. For a non-beef eater this place doesn't have a ton of options. And the soft serve seriously sucks. But they have beer on tap, delicious fries, and they are open late.
author: Melissa N.

description:
This place might be duper, but it is anything but super. 

Burgers: Small patties that weren't very juicy. Also, there was an off bun to meat ratio. The previous poster, Stephanie, clearly isn't a burger connoisseur because burgers are supposed to be greasy!!

Fries: Dry. Dry. Dry. It was like eating cardboard.

When this place opens to the public I'll go and try the milkshake or the dipped cone, but I'm not adding this burger joint to my lunch rotation.
author: Lara O.

description:
I guess the big draw for Super Duper is that their food is organic, local, responsibly sourced, etc.  They have a wide variety of protein for their burgers including free range chicken, Niman Ranch beef, veggie burgers, and portobello mushrooms.  I didn't try a burger this time, but I'm curious to try their portabello mushroom next time.   The $10 combo for burger, fries, a drink (you can can substitute a milkshake for the drink) seems like a great deal.   I do like that they make their own pickles as I'm a huge fan of pickles.  

Since I was between meals, I opted for the organic soft serve dipped ice cream.  Frankly I didn't really care that the soft serve was organic, as it's ice cream so how healthy is it really? Turned out it really wasn't anything special, and I felt like I could have had something similar in taste at Fosters (but I guess Fosters would not be so high brow as to have organic soft serve).  The chocolate shell was a bit too thick and waxy, so I peeled half of it off because it didn't taste like anything. 

As I finish up this review, I realize that I probably won't be back to Super Duper as there are so many food options in the Union Square area that I'd rather try.  Perhaps I'd go back for the pickles...
author: Sirinda S.

description: The reviews were right! This place is awesome! The burgers are juicy and well seasoned and the toppings are fresh and tasty. The garlic fries are to die for and they serve beer too! This is a great place to grab a quick burger with friends. Dare I say better than in-n-out?? Next time i'm in SF I'll be back!
author: Joanne B.

description:
Who doesn't love Super Duper Burger? If you said, "Me!" then you obviously don't have a soul. 

The Chicken Sandwich is amazing, it has the best sauce, and they make it fresh and fast. The Chocolate Milk Shakes are also really good. We sat upstairs which got a little bit warm, but we were glad to have a table considering it was 7pm on a Friday and everyone seemed to be there. 

If you are looking for a good sized, tasty meal in a cute and trendy place - Super Duper Burger will fit the bill.
author: Katie K.

description: I would give this place a 3 but meh, i've experienced better. The burgers here are really good but what brings it down is the cost. Every time I come here I spend more than I should just to even get fries, not to mention a drink! Place can be crowded as well and the burgers tend to be small. Worth a try but that's about it.
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
Coworkers and I made the trek over here because all the guys in the office were raving about the amazing burgers.

Just average burgers .. don't know what the hype is all about, although I will say the meat is fresh and high quality. Long lines so try to beat the rush before noon!
author: Mia N.

description:
I love this place. I've only ever had the veggie burger and the fries, but both are delicious, and I know others who swear by the burgers. Their house made pickles are pretty awesome, too. 

Bonus: It's definitely one of the cheapest, freshest eats in the area. 

The Verdict: I'm pretty much here on a regular basis. The food quality is consistently good, and the staff is friendly.
author: Cara S.

description:
Forget other fast food joints like In N Out, McD, Carl's Jr and the rest. Go here for a proper burger that's super cheap. Been here 3x, loved it every times. No drive-through, but if you're in the neighborhood it's worth the visit. 

Single Patty w/ everything plus jalapeños and grilled onions -- yumm! My husband and friends have also loved taking sips from my double chocolate and chips shake. Pickles are pretty salty, but they go well with the hamburger. 

Don't think I'll ever get the soju shot in my shake, but the option is there of you're interested.
author: Michelle D.

description: Well, I tried their ice cream - lovely, organic, creamy and YUM good!!  I ordered it half chocolate, half vanilla and they gave a whopping pretty serving of it all swirled up on a cone - quite a big serving for a little girl like me (maybe I'll get the kids size next time), but I LIKED it a LOT!!  I'll be back for more...hmmmm, maybe later tonight!  :)  Happy 4th of July weekend!
author: Maile N.

description: I went to this place with my family, while my mom was ordering I found a table where these girls were just leaving, a couple walked up at the same time, I was waiting for the table before they even seen it. I guess a man who worked there saw and came up to me and said "why are you sitting down if you don't even have food!?" Keep in mind I'm a 21 year old woman and this man was African American and much bigger and taller then me. I said my mom is getting our food right now and he rolled his eyes at me and was extremely rude. He started to look for a table for the couple and I asked him why are you being so rude if you work here and I'm a customer and he started screaming at me and cursing and getting in my face acting like he is going to beat me up! It was so scary and embarrassing I would never ever come back to this place in my life!!!!!
author: Alyssa M.

description:
It's a pretty good burger joint. The garlic fries was quite a treat - nice golden fries with  layers of garlic garnished on top. The burger was so-so. I think it is about the same quality as In-n-Out but a few dollars pricier. A decent meal overall but just a tad pricey for a burger joint.

Pro:
Good Garlic Fries, Decent Burger. Friendly Staff, Clean, etc...

Cons:
A tad too pricey for the food.
author: Longwen C.

description: Great burger, quality ingredients, nice staff.  Had standard dbl super duper brgr with full fixings, great meat salt content, beautiful clear fat meat drippings indicative of high quality meat.  Would give it five stars but deducted a star for union square location full of san fran's finest hobos, transients, and vegrants. You San Fran tax paying citizens let these people run wild - put them in their place!
author: Matthew B.

description: Wow those garlic fries are the best I have ever had. Also the chicken sand which is sooooo good. It has a a nice spice to it and is really tender. The burger had the perfect flavor. I did not try the egg but next time that will be a must. The pickles were perfect even my husband liked them and he does not eat pickles. Prices are very reasonable about $10.00 a person. Minus 1 star for messing up my order. I asked for a well done burger but it was pink. I need my meat well so I let them know and they fixed it and apologized for the mistake, I wish I had a Super Duper in Sunnyvale.
author: April B.

description:
One of those moments when I judged the place by its name. I mean really now... Super Duper... My boyfriend and I entered, ordered, waited, and devoured... And... I absolutely enjoyed it! I got a regular Super Duper burger and from this day on I cannot stop but crave their burger. I'm just waiting for another trip to San Francisco just to go eat here again.

Besides their burgers, the atmosphere in here is pretty hectic -- hella customers, pretty big (there's a second floor if you wanna eat upstairs and watch those down under), and the service is pretty snappy, so that was a plus, especially when we went there at what seemed to be a very busy hour (Saturday around 3-4pm). The place and the burger itself is old-fashioned, which is probably the biggest reason why I love it here. I love me some old-fashioned burgers =)

Definitely coming back and telling my friends to drop in on this place if they crave burgers in San Francisco.
author: Jorgess M.

description:
I was super excited when I realized this place opened up close to work. I dragged my co-worker out there after watching How I Met Your Mother's "best burger" episode. I was craving for a good, juicy, delicious burger. 

Yum! Loved it. It's so simple and delicious. Fresh tasting burger... with an option of mini or super. I went for a mini (4oz patty vs. 8oz patty) so I could indulge in fries without as much guilt. 

Those garlic fries are delish. The regular fries are just fine too, the three sauces were ok. I'd pick the garlic fries over regular fries any day. The garlic fries get extra points from me since it is sprinkled in cheese. mMm... 

And I LOVE pickles... so for the simple fact that there's jars and jars of pickles for you to grab as many as you want. SCORE!!! 

Oh and the line was long, but we still got a table. There's even seats upstairs. Awesome. 

Shall be back for sure. Cheap and easy burger in the FiDi. Yes please!!!
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Incredible spot when you're graving a big greasy burger and fries. The ketchup and mustard were amazing, and the unlimited pickle supply was off the charts. I've never been to a place where you  can have unlimited pickles.

The wait was short, and the Market St. location has plenty of seating. Great lunch spot, makes you want to hit the gym afterwards though.
author: Jason M.

description: Wasn't very impressed.  I prefer Barney's.  And the swarm of fruit flies on the pickles really ruined my appetite.
author: Denise C.

description:
I had heard great things about this place, but I think that led to some high expectations...which it didn't meat/meet. 

I ordered a mini burger + garlic fries + drink combo that cost about $10-11. Don't let the name fool you! The mini burger is just a normal, filling burger (the super burger has 2 patties) and will definitely surprise you in its size. However, I guess since it cost around In n Out prices, I was expecting something more of that quality. 

I was really disappointed at my fries as well. I love garlic fries, but I barely got any garlic or seasoning on my order, despite it costing at least $1 more than normal fries.

Regardless, this place will fill you up and satisfy your burger cravings any time of the day. Just be prepared to wait in line for 10-15 minutes if you come during prime lunch/dinner hour! It will also be hard to find a seat.
author: Jenny M.

description:
I like to think I'm an expert on burgers because it's my goto staple food.  Horrible, I know.  But when my coworker told me about this place I knew I had to check it out. 

For a fast food looking place, the burgers tasted like a dish from a gourmet restaurant! Tender beef, crispy fries and the pickle bar! Omg yummmmmm.  

Not bad on the price.  $8 mini burger (single pattie) combo ( fries and drink).   I wanted to try their dipped come but maybe leave that for next time!! Yumm!
author: Noey A.

description: Overall, the food here is great for the price! Staff is usually very friendly and efficient. Super Burger and the Chicken Sandwich here are excellent. Great sandwiches. Wait time is about average for the kind of food you are ordering. As for the environment, this location has a nice modern vibe. I will continue to get grub here. Thumbs up!
author: Jim Z.

description:
The first time I ate super duper i stained my nicest, Citizens of humanity khakis with drippings from the patty. 
Those stains were totally worth it.

Eaten there about 10 times since. Super Duper's hamburgers are so good, I will not eat a hamburger anywhere else, period.

I've never had a hamburger as good as super duper's. I can't even think of another in its league.

Its so good you don't even need cheese or all the extras.

For the best burger of your life, just order this:
miniburger (no cheese)
regular toppings & sauce
plus grilled onions & fresh onions
Extra Toasted.

that'll run you only about $4.50, super duper CAN'T BE BEAT.

trust me, I grew up in restaurants. burgers don't get juicier, tastier or better than this.

If you love gross, fat burgers, soggy and full of cheese and mayonaise, its nothing like that. 
its better.

Delicious, thick, real-vanillaie milkshakes too.
author: Grilled O.

description: This place has great burgers and their fries are to die for. My only issue is that it's packed during lunch. I mean I've gone there at various times between 11:30 and 1:30 and the line is virtually out the door. So if you're looking for something quick, this isn't the right place for you. But if you can stand to wait 10-20 minutes then stop by.
author: Ricardo M.

description:
I liked this place so much that I ate here twice over my 5-day San Francisco vacation.  Granted it was convenient as it was around the block from my hotel, but it wasn't the convenience that drew me here!

The burgers are big, juicy and customizable.  Pick your size, your sauce and your toppings and enjoy.  The garlic fries are also delicious, and I always appreciate a place with complimentary pickles.  If I had to compare it to a burger joint from my hometown San Diego, I'd say it about the same as Burger Lounge, including the modern clean interior of the restaurant.

Can't wait to come back to San Francisco and eat here again.
author: Kristiana A.

description: After some mid day drinking on a lazy Sunday, it was time to get some grub  to sop up the alcohol. I had heard this had just opened and it was on the way back so we stopped in. Burgers, fries, shakes and salads. Pretty straightforward fare.  I was pretty hungry so I went with a triple patty, bacon and cheese while splitting a garlic fries with a friend. They do the old skool flat top grilling here which keeps the juices (and the grease) trapped in. Pretty tasty.The fries were good but on the small side and the added bonus are the house pickles to cut the richness of the burger. I guess it's on the pricey side for a burger but then we are on the border of Union Square/Fidi. Space is long and narrow with a small upstairs to overlook the room. Solid, quick, tasty burger
author: Kim N.

description:
The cheeseburger is delectably good BUT quite oily. Towards the end of my meal, there was a puddle of oil dripping from the wrapper. Thirty minutes after my burger, I could still taste the oil from my burger... Although I have to admit while eating it, I did enjoy the flavor and quality of the meat. It wasn't over-cooked and just the perfect size for me.

I would definitely consider coming back if I'm ever in the city, but I prefer in-n-out. Especially because they seem to add a little too much salt on their fries. 

Tip: The line is SUPER long during lunch hours. The service is fast but come early if you want a seat.
author: Donna M.

description:
After hearing all the rave reviews on Yelp, I ventured to try Super Duper before a movie date.  After walking down Market, my date noticed that the "Del Taco" sign stood out more than the Super Duper sign.

I liked the open area and high ceilings of Super Duper with the choice of outdoor or indoor seating.  On an attempt to be more health conscious, we decided to order two mini burgers (4 oz.) with cheese and everything on it except pickles.  Luckily, they placed the pickles as a condiment on the refreshment stand instead of having it as a standard choice.

If you're not a carnivore or feel like being healthy, you can opt for the veggie burger, portabello mushroom sandwich, or a chicken burger.  I was really excited to try the burger by itself with all of their included toppings (lettuce, tomato, grilled onion, super sauce, and jalapenos.  I liked the kick that the jalapenos added even though they didn't carry that much heat.  Unfortunately, the burger patty itself was a little dry and bland in flavor.  If I had known and read the reviews more thoroughly, I would have definitely ordered a medium rare and no special sauce.  The sauce made the burger really messy and drippy.

The garlic fries were amazing though!  Definitely order those and skip the trip of special sauces (they wasn't anything spectacular about them and they came in minuscule sizes).  

Super Duper is definitely a great place to have lunch if you're shopping in the area.
author: Carli F.

description:
For burger joint they make a fine tasty burger, but I'd like to take a pass on the side of condescension. I get that they're all over the burger version of "make a better mousetrap" but that on its own doesn't merit the superiority tax that they heap on top of your order.  $7 for a cheeseburger is simply too high, and being asked, "would you like fries with that?" It really deflates the hipster image.

Also, I'd like to take a moment to strongly advise against ordering their shakes.  Soft serve does not make for a good milkshake, and the difference in taste is completely transparent.  It's $4.75 for plain vanilla/chocolate, and $5.50 for their "premium" flavors  If I'm paying ice-cream parlor prices I expect parlor-size and parlor-quality.
author: Chris A.

description:
This is part 1 in my Burger Quest to find the best burger in San Francisco.

I feel like this place is like a Sellers market but without the greens. The layout reminds me of that kind of place, and I think they nailed the quasi-soma Market Street decor. I was really hungry when I came here and we ordered a couple burgers, fries and the triple dip set.

I ordered my burger and they didn't ask me how well I'd like it done (I understand they cook everything medium which is fine by me). I added bacon and cheese to mine and set out to get my grub on.

The consistency of meat pissed me off. I believe they grind everything daily and I had a few complaints. One, I got a bone shard in my burger which I guess is understandable, but it sucked. Two, the consistency is very coarse in parts of the burger and very fine in others which gave a largely inconsistent eating experience.

All of the toppings are exceptional, with the notable exception of the spiced pickles. They're really good, but they're not what I want out of a pickle with a burger. My ideal pickle is the monstrosity they provide you at Rosemunde's, which is pretty much the best thing ever. I found these to be a bit sweet. There really wasn't anything wrong with them, I just felt they didn't go well with the burger which was a surprise.

The fries were delicious, and I liked all the sauces, although some variation in consistency would be nice.

The staff is extremely helpful which helps make this 3.5* restaurant a 4* experience.

TL;DR: Good but not fantastic. Some details overlooked. Great, helpful staff.
author: Joshua G.

description:
I knew Super Duper had to be good when some random drunk dude came up to us to provide his unsolicited tirade about the revelation that was the burger, as if cows were placed on this earth so that we may have the joy that is the Super Duper burger.

I however, was stone cold sober, and had no intention of getting into an altercation with a drunk dude over how I think In-N-Out is still the king of the fast food burger. However, I do think this place is at least as good as Shake Shack, and definitely wins in the juicy drippy category. The garlic fries are solid and will leave you unkissable for days, and they serve hands down the best veggie burger anywhere. I'm also diggin' on the freshness of their soft serve (vanilla beats chocolate here by a mile). And lets face it, its about as gluttonous as the golden arches, with its mini burger being 1/4lb and its regular being 1/2lb, no one is leaving here hungry, that's for sure.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
3/5 duper super

first. there is something about this downtown location that i do not like. maybe it's the increased frequency of tourists, the larger loft space. i dunno. something is just off, definitely prefer the castro location.

but it is mighty good. i recently swapped down to the single patty, since i realized that's really the amount i'd want to eat, and not the monster 1/2lb one. i love the pickles, and i think overall it's just a better burger than many others out there.
author: Alvin D.

description:
These burgers are pretty dang good. Hot, greasy, fried, and flavorful. The buns hold up really well to the juicy patties and condiments while still being fresh and light. Your choice of toppings are pretty run of the mill, but are more than adequate in freshness and quantity. Their special sauce, or whatever it's called, isn't groundbreaking in any way, but it tastes pretty good.

The staff is efficient and while they're not necessarily friendly or even memorable, they're not bad either. I've yet to have an unpleasant experience. In fact, the last time I was there, they called my name and a guy named John who was in line behind me beat me to the counter. Mistaking my name for his, he lifted the bun on my burger to see if it was what he ordered. Before I could finish saying I'm not eating that, the girl behind the counter was already on her way back to get a new one made for me.

The fries are a disappointment, though. I'd go 4 stars if they were better. They're not horrible, they're average really. But they almost seem like an afterthought. And the portion size is not generous at all. It's as if they're a cheap garnish for the burgers, which wouldn't be a problem if you didn't have to actually pay separately for them.
author: Don W.

description:
My friend and I went at 1:45ish on her lunch break, and this place was still poppin. Inside is narrow but deeep and there is an upstairs seating area in the back, in addition to some tables near the front and outside. I think the setup nicely allows for containment of as much of the long line as possible, before it snakes out into the street, disrupting foot traffic and entangling tourists. But it is a pain to weave through said line to get your food, unlimited pickles, condiments, etc.

PROS:
-Mini burger is basically a normal burger. It tasted very fresh, MEATY, and filling.

-Fries are skinny and crispy, my favorite style.

-They give you your shakes first, so you can pacify your growling stomach during what feels like an eternity before your foods come out.

CONS:
-We both got the garlic fries and were disappointed at the lack of garlic. Do they use garlic powder? Or was it parmesan? Regardless, I was hoping for big chunks of garlic because I am Korean and stereotype, and I was disappointed.

-I got the chocolate strawberry shake, but I could not taste the strawberries at ALL. It made me wish I saved the extra $$ and put it towards adding malt to a regular choco shake.

-The ordering system can be a bit confusing for nubs like me. They list the toppings in 2 columns: FREE and add'l charge. There is also underlined in quotes: "everything on it", so I asked for my burger with "everything on it", thinking it would include everything under the FREE column, like the grilled onions and peppers. Nope. Only referred to the underlined toppings. Tricky tricky! Next time I come, I'm gonna have a mouthful to say.
author: Leah C.

description: It took 30 mins to get a burger, and the staff did not even seem apologetic. Apparently they lost a few tickets in the middle so a bunch of folks got their food even though they ordered way after me.
author: Sahir S.

description:
I was in downtown SF for a quick trip, and super duper had huge yelp reviews, so why not? Dear me, I am rather upset I went here, because I CAN NEVER HAVE A BURGER THIS GOOD EVER AGAIN.

I ordered the standard burger (2 1/4 patties), and served on fresh bread, and I added the egg. The egg was done perfectly, flowing molten yolk lava all over the bread, thereby increasing the awesome to +11. ON a side note, I could have done the smaller 1/4 and been just as happy.

I also ordered the garlic fries, and contrary to the usual ballpark garlic overdose, they nailed the right amount.

They also MAKE THEIR OWN PICKLES. Dammit man, I am now really upset I live in Seattle - we need this place!
author: dave m.

description:
If it weren't for the price I would give this place 4 stars.

The food is actually really good because everything their is organic and nothing seems to be frozen. I had the cheeseburger and a shake, and when my next paycheck comes in I will come back to this place. Someone wrote that this place is similar to in n'out, but they are completely wrong. The burgers are much bigger and juicier (unfortunately they are also greasier). The vanilla shake was pretty good, not too thick that you can't drink it through the straw and not too thin that it's like melted ice cream. 

If you are in the area with some extra cash, you should come try this place.
author: Shawn T.

description: Pretty good burger, and it's not common for these chains to use medium as the default for cooking.  The vanilla-chocolate shake was spectacular in consistency and taste. But the fries were really subpar -- tough, oddly overcooked, not on the same level as, say, Five Guys.
author: Will P.

description:
Holy crap delicious.

My friend waited on the curb in his car while I popped inside to order 2 super dupers to go. They came out piping hot, right amount of grease, and my taste buds wept in delight as the saltiness of the cheese and meat hit right on target. 

Considering that it's organic, it's a very reasonable price. I would definitely return and try the fries next time.
author: Melody L.

description:
Super Duper? YES IT IS!!! 

I got the "mini" burger. It was not mini to me it was just normal size ;) and it. was. AWESOME! For toppings I got just the cheese/grilled onions/special sauce. Wowza was it outstanding. I was a very happy lady ;) 

I also got a cookies and cream malt. Sweet Jesus. it was GREAT! I have a thing for cookies and cream malts... and the fact that Super Duper is right next to my work is all bad... I'm gonna need to buy myself a bigger belt :P LOL
author: maria K.

description:
Fourth Super.

This one wasn't so good: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superman_4

This one might have been the best: Super Duper on Market.

Previously: http://www.yelp.com/biz/super-duper-burgers-san-francisco-2#hrid:1DWYMTniZ8UPoxJPvvkVqA

Last item to try was the grilled chicken sandwich.

Might have been so good because it's 100% natural and free range. Or because they gave me a side of hummus. Or the company was super. Or the industrial space.

This is one sequel no one regrets.
author: Jason B.

description: YUM! Chicken burger with chipotle aioli was amazing. Fries and garlic fries great as well. My boyfriend loved his burger!
author: Lindsay L.

description:
YUMMMMMM!!!!!

This is seriously one of my favorite burger joints. The burgers are all super fresh and totally delicious. The mini burgers are plenty of food for me, plus, you have to get the garlic fries and the cookie shake (they actually put a chocolate chip cookie in a blender with Strauss Organic Milk and Ice Cream). OMG.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Let me tell you what I ordered.

- 4 patties, medium rare
- Bacon
- Cheese
- Wrapped in lettuce
- Hold the Secret Sauce
- Jalapenos, onions, tomato
- Fried egg on top

Best meal ever, exactly what a human needs. If you think I'm crazy, read Gary Taubes' Why We Get Fat: And What To Do About It. It's the truth that wants to be set free.

===
Auxiliary info:

1) The burger was cooked very well; juicy on the inside. The egg was oozy, just the way I like it :D
2) Reasonably priced! The basic, 8 oz 2 patty burger is only $6.50.
3) Reasonably fast service. They were super duper busy (ha.) so keep that in mind.
4) Good selection of beer and root beer
5) Fantastic shakes and ice cream (reported by my coworkers)
6) Lightly industrial, modern, high ceiling atmosphere. Very conducive to burger eating. Not the ideal place for a date.

Fantastic location and generally awesome everything -- I'll come here again, yeah!
author: Ayumi Y.

description: This place is uh-mazing. Their pickles are homemade. Its a bit expensive compared to in-n-out, though.
author: Trisha L.

description:
Not bad, but Pearl's is better.

For Union Square, this is definitely an affordable eatery. I ordered a mini burger, which is only $4.50, and garlic fries for $2.75. The mini is a perfect size to eat with fries. I was full without feeling like an overstuffed sausage afterwards. The meat was tasty enough, though not as flavorful as Pearl's Deluxe.

However, my patty was waaay undercooked in the middle. I like my burgers rare, but I was pulling off raw chunks of ground beef from center of my sandwich. Not appetizing at all.

The fries were good. They were made of real, whole potato (not that starchy filler that McDs uses) and tossed with powdered parmesan cheese and garlic.

For lunch under $10 in an area populated with expensive restaurants, Super Duper is worth a try. Just remember to ask for your burger medium to make sure you get something edible.
author: Kel S.

description:
I came by here after a short dinner because I was still relatively hungry.  I grabbed a Mini Combo.  The burger itself was great (or super duper, even).  The fries were a-okay as well, but the shakes were definitely not super duper.  It felt watered down and not as thick as other places serving burgers and shakes.  

I'd probably go back for the burger, but not for the other stuff they have.
author: Ren L.

description:
Solid burger place in SF.

It's new, trendy, and has a line out the door during prime hours.

I ordered the super burger (2 patties). I eat a lot and it was a little too much for me. If I would have been super (duper) hungry it would have been just fine. The burger was greasy, which is good! I think I should have gotten it medium rare though.

Fries were good too. The Vanilla shake, however, was my favorite thing. Tasted noticeably wonderful. Get it! I forgot to get malt in it, so I'll have to do that next time.

Anyways, good burger place. Try it!
author: Niko D.

description: I don't get it. Another smash burger, it's griddled, gooey, good, yes. Does it belong on the eater 38? No. It's a dime a dozen place. Great, their food comes from organic sources, but it doesn't justify such lofty praise in my mind. It's completely fine. I wouldn't go outta my way for it though.
author: I W.

description:
I feel a bit self conscious reviewing a burger place after having only a salad there, but then again, it's a burger place serving salads, so that's not my bad.

And yeah, not the best salad I've had, but the chicken was legit and so I don't doubt all their other meaty products are great as well.  Some day I will come back for a burger and milkshake :)
author: Richa A.

description:
Walk in -  the place is clean and smells delish!

I was making errands so couldn't try the burgers. It was a lovely day out so I decide I'll try one of their organic shakes !

Kinda pricey - 5.75 but with tax, brings it to nearly $7 for a milkshake?? $7 could be a meal! 

Got the chocolate strawberry milkshake - made with Straus organic milk and bits of strawberry. It was actually really good - not to sweet and not too milky! All served in a biodegradable to go cup for my speedy enjoyment haha.

Must come back to try their Niman ranch natural ground beef burgers - 2oz for roughly $6.25
author: Tiffany N.

description:
4 oz. Mini cheeseburger with french fries.
