& I regret not getting the Cookies N Cream milkshake (upon reading Ruggy J.'s rave review)
+Wasn't feeling particularly hungry but was due for a meal today & I found the mini cheeseburger to be:
~ The PERFECT size; portioned just enough to satisfy your taste buds without slipping into a coma. Juicy, tender & flavorful. 
~The sauce in the burger was brilliant (chipotle?) and complimented burger. 
~ Fries were nice and soft--slightly crispy at the end as well. Since my order was to go, there was a small collection of oil but there were still appreciable. 

*The 4 oz. will give you enough room for the "Super Duper" experience (cheeseburger + fries + shake), I feel. *

Seriously though, I am getting a Cookies N Cream on my next visit--of all the times to not live by the YOLO motto, I chose to do so on my first Super Duper experience, more like Super Duper fail. They also offer a "spiked" version? Schwing!

Move over, Bullshead of West Portal, I am SO making the Bart ride commute to Powell St. for my future cheeseburger cravings!
author: Kat L.

description:
I'm an avid Serious Eats reader, and I had read about Super Duper in their "A Hamburger Today" section earlier.  Link here: http://aht.seriouseats.com/archives/2011/06/super-duper-burger-review-san-francisco-ca.html

So of course I wanted to try Super Duper and see what the real deal was.  I ordered a mini cheese burger with "everything" on it plus grilled onions.  The burger was meh.  It wasn't bad but it wasn't stellar.  It just wasn't something I would be super duper excited to try again.  The "mini" portion (which is a single patty) had too high of a bun to meat ration.  My dinning buddies said that the regular (two patty) burgers had just the right amount of bun to meat.

The fries needed more seasoning or a lot of ketchup to make up for it.  Their house made lemonade was kind of disappointing and a little too sweet.  Their hand dipped ice cream cone was also a huge disappointment.  They serve them in the little styrofoam cones instead of nice little sugar cones.  It was also frozen yogurt that was too watery or something because it was not creamy at all.  None of us enjoyed it.

Overall, I'd probably still eat here occasionally if I was passing by and hungry.
author: H. L.

description:
Super Duper Delicious! 

I'm not going to lie, I waited in line close to 1 hour, but it was WELL WORTH THE WAIT. 
The mini was a good sized burger, fries and chipotle sauce on the side were amazing. I took a slice of the pecan pie deliciousness, oh my, it was super duper good.
author: Yasmin A.

description: I love super duper, this location is much bigger than the other market street location, but the burgers were delicious.
author: Ameer N.

description:
This was an exceptionally well made burger with great flavor minus the fast food taste. They make their own pickles there so if you are a pickle fan this is the spot to hit up! My oreo cookie shake was amazing. I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone traveling to San Francisco!

Lines are typically long but move pretty fast. There is seating downstairs and upstairs even though it was packed in there we were able to find a seat quickly.
author: Dami G.

description:
Want to be hipster?

Want to save the earth?

Willing to pay extra?

Now you can find a hamburger joint of the Chipotle aux slow food movement variety.

Was nice to find a burger that was done medium rare though.
author: Daniel K.

description: So many burger joints so I check this place out with a friend of mines. The food was so good their quality of their burgers are so juicy, and their garlic fries are the bomb! Their service is well organized and maintained without any necessary hang ups on wrong orders. Great dive in spot to eat if you craving burgers.
author: Ahrmon R.

description:
This is my new go to spot (sorry Pearls, I still love you).

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
The Food
:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
While there isn't as big a selection of burger add ons like at places like Pearls, the extras you can add to make your meal complete are a little more varied. THEY HAVE RACER 5 IPA ON TAP HERE as well as vodka spiked milkshakes and a small selection of wine. They have their own selection of pickles which are a bit too sweet for my taste but are a damned good free addition. 

DIPPED CONES, I REPEAT, CHOCOLATE DIPPED CONES.

The garlic fries are one of the best out there (aside from The Crosby's in Santa Ana, CA), as the garlic isn't overpowering and is instead what seems to be infused into the frying oil *makes a world of difference.

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
The Price
:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
This place is a little cheaper than Pearls without sacrificing quality(only comparing to Pearls because these are the only two spots i'd go to regularly in the city for a decent burger).

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
Everything Else
:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
The ambience and branding are not to be overlooked, but how could they be!? With a central location on market, I hope you're not planning on driving here as parking isn't near impossible, it IS impossible.
author: Ed D.

description:
Our office building was invited over to try this place out before it opens later this week. The remodeled space is very open and inviting with retro touches.

The staff did a great job under the pressure of so many customers at one time. The line went quickly and we had no real trouble getting our orders although the veggie burgers did take longer than the regular ones.

Everyone enjoyed their burgers and the fries were tasty too. None of the food was greasy - huge plus. I'm excited to try out the full menu when this location opens to the public, especially the shakes!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Friendly, quick, greasy, salty, home cooked ... Been here a few times and these guys deserve 3 or 4 Star rating for friendly service and good quality food. The burgers are not as flavorful as expected, so that's what has me leaning towards 3 Stars.

So, WHY, you're wondering, why why why does this Review only show 2 (two) Stars?

Because of the BS treatment I received on my visit today:

I ordered a Mini-Burger "with Cheese". The menu board for the Mini-Burger CLEARLY states "CHEESE  $0.50". I asked what type of cheese I could choose and she listed a few, including "Blue". So I chose the Blue Cheese.

After finishing my meal and cleaning up my trash, I notice that my receipt lists Cam Blue or something, price ... $1.50.  WTF?  ... WTF?

So I took the receipt to the same checkout girl and she said that Blue cheese is $1.50... "where does it say that?", I asked, ... she couldn't find it on the menu board (and I said ... "Isn't Blue Cheese a type of Cheese which is clearly stated as costing a $0.50 when added to the Mini-Burger")?

Instead of apologizing, she takes off in a huff to bring someone over (manager?). This manager points out the special blue cheese option on the menu board as $1.50 (about 3 or 4 menu boards to the LEFT of the Mini-Burger board). I asked if she could see that this was rather confusing, since, well, Cheese is Cheese and Cheese is listed at price $0.50 -- it does NOT say "Cheese (except Blue) $0.50".

Without saying a word of explanation, nor apology, she runs off to a storage room or something, and gets me $1.50 in cash (I left $0.50 as an extra tip for their *trouble*). But still ... no *apology*?

For a restaurant that obviously stresses and trains their employees in friendly service, their handling of this (minor) situation is confounding. Sure; they didn't fight me *much* on getting me the instant refund, but, what, ya can't say "Sorry; you're right, actually, we ought to fix that menu to say 'except Blue' -- great idea!". Nope, didn't go that way.

This treatment indicates to me that service here isn't *really* friendly and attentive, nope ... it is just BS drone training ... Like those checkers at Safeway that offer to help take your groceries out to the car, yet don't give a sh*t if you're waiting in a checkout line for 30 minutes or if they ring up multiple items on your order wrong with no apology...

BTW: The blue cheese on the mini-burger? Barely noticed it was there. Actually pulled the bun off a couple times to check. Ah... just a hint of flavor and no texture. Certainly not worth $1.50, and certainly not worth the "BS" treatment.
author: T G.

description:
Highlights:
1. Garlic fries. Homemade pickles, and the most juicy, just right medium(-meat) burger!
2. Get the mini-burger, if you are normal to small appetite
3. Good price for the quality
author: Ngoc N.

description:
Summary: Great fast food burgers, a bit of a wait.

Came at 1 PM for lunch. Tried a mini burger and portobello burger. Mini burger was great - was cooked medium w/ good crust on the patty. Portobello mushroom was breaded and fried so it also had a great crust. Free unlimited pickles were a nice touch.

Wait was about 30 min from arrival to getting food, mostly due to line. Owner (?) was nice enough to give some fries and dipping sauce to people waiting in line.

Would come back again, especially if wait dies down.
author: Gary Y.

description: I love the mini burger combo. This place is great for Gluten-Free folks, because they don't make onion rings so the fries are gluten-free, and you can get a burger in a lettuce wrap. Everything is fresh and delicious, great quality ingredients, awesome home-made pickles. I wish they would offer gluten-free buns like Roam and Burgermeister do (but you can't eat the fries at those places), but still very satisfying.
author: JD M.

description: This is one of my favorite burger places. The architecture of this spot is pretty cool. Their hamburger patties are mediumly cooked to perfection. Their garlic fries are a must have and to die for. I suggest to avoid this place during the peak of lunch hours because its hard to find a seat to enjoy their delicious burgers
author: Sara Y.

description:
Food:
I ordered the super burger combo with cheese and it came with fries and soda. The burger was juicy and cooked just the way I liked it. The fries had the right amount of crispiness. The homemade pickles were great! I couldn't get enough.

My complaint was the cheese, it tasted like kraft square cheese.

Service:
Friendly staff, fast service.


I was craving for a burger and this place hits the spot!
author: Angela S.

description: Lived up to the hype of the long lines I've seen formed for weeks here.  For me, it was the perfect burger.  I think I've not had a perfectly constructed hamburger like this one in a long time.  No mess, no soggy bun.  Lettuce, tomato, onion all high quality.  The beef-to-bun proportion was perfect (I got the "mini" 1/4 lb. single patty).  Cooked perfectly to my liking, medium-rare.  Simply seasoned, burger not too salty.  Fries were excellent, maybe a little more salt than necessary, but not a problem.  Fair price for the quality.  Worth checking out, though come at off hours if you are in a rush.
author: Marc S.

description:
Whenever a new restaurant opens nearby the office you can count on it being crowded.  Super Duper opened recently and I've walked right on by a few times because of the length of the lines.  However, long lines are often a very positive indicator . . . there IS a reason why.  

Today I waited it out, and was not disappointed.  The grilled chicken sandwich with chipotle aoili + cheese was a winner.  I'll be back to try out the burgers and salads for sure.

As this place is right on Market Street, I suspect it is always going to be busy during lunch hour.  Oh well . . . so it goes in the big city.
author: Joel E.

description: Artisanal mediocrity at it's finest. Just a burger joint with a full compliment of yuppy BS. Didn't try the organic soft-serve (jebus), but the fries are good. Oh well. I suppose it's better than the Lightening Foods that it replaced... sigh...
author: John H.

description:
Despite my experience at the other location, I wanted to give this place a try.  Disappointed again.  You wait to be helped behind the "yellow line" like you would at the bank for an available teller.

I tried the Super Burger with bacon and cheese, with a side of garlic fries.  It was a huge burger, but I got a taste of the meat on it's own. and it seemed terribly under-seasoned and dry.   The standard "everything" toppings of lettuce, onion, tomato and super sauce didn't help much.

The garlic fries seemed topped with garlic powder and didn't have much to show for it.  I tried the 3 dips and didn't care for them much, but the Chipotle Mayo would be my favorite.  

It seems to be quite crowded, but that may be there's not much burger joints around that I can think of.  The quick turn-over helps.  Outdoor seating seems OK, and this part of Market Street isn't too bad.
author: Michael M.

description: Awesome Burgers... with great tasting meat that is so flavorful you can't help yourself but to just slam them down as quick as possible
author: Ronald B.

description: Such an awesome place.. fresh food, friendly staff, great prices what more could you ask for from a burger joint
author: Michael M.

description:
I found my new favorite burger spot in San Francisco. This was the second time I tried their burgers. The first time I tried them was at their Chestnut location. Both burgers were consistently delicious. I ordered the Super Duper with everything on it which includes jalapeno peppers, grilled onions, lettuce, tomatoes, red onions and super sauce. I can tell the mixture was fantastic!! 
Also, you have to try the homemade pickles they have next to the ketchup dispensers. They are the best!!!
A quick tip, the Super Duper comes with two meat patties. If you want to save room for some awesome fries and their great shakes, I would go with a Mini and order the fries and dessert. It is worth it.
author: Daniel D.

description:
Long wait, awesome burger and fantastic milk shake

The burgers are somewhat similar to In n' Out, but they aren't as close as some people have suggested.

The milk shake is not as thick as other places, but I think that's a good thing. 

The pickles are great!

Price seems slightly too high overall. The long line and the price is the only thing from making this a 5 star review for me.
author: Captain B.

description:
This might be the best burger I've had in the Bay.  So good!  Me, my brother and nephew stumbled across this place after a night in the city.  

The decor is very modern and welcoming.  Metallic surfaces and warm lighting.  There's a sitting area in the front as well as an upstairs room.  

On to the burgers...  juicy and tasty!  I had the Super Combo which comes with a double cheeseburger, fries and drink for around $10.  That's a bit pricier than your average burger stand, but I think it's worth it.  The patties are perfectly seasoned and cooked just right - medium, so they have a nice juiciness.  They toast their buns which are also a step up from your average bun.  The produce is fresh and premium quality - no shredded rabbit-food lettuce here.  Little details like these help Super Duper rise from other burger places.

The fries are also very good!  They're shoestring cut and cooked to a perfect crisp.  If you've ever been to In-N-Out you know how their fries can sometimes be a bit soggy.  Not here - they're always fresh and crispy.  I recommend upgrading to the garlic fries too.  Mmmm!  

The whole meal was a good portion and we left feeling nice and stuffed.  It was alot of food but I never felt like I was forcing myself to finish anything.  Maybe cause every bite was so good!  I'll be back for sure!

SNACKEROO.COM
author: Ardy M.

description: I think the burgers are fine and the garlic fries are Amazing. The staff is always super nice. But....When I added an egg to my burger the nice young man specifically asked me if I wanted over easy or over hard. Over Easy Please! The egg I got was revolting even if I liked Over hard. Rubbery and a super strange brown color. I even ripped a whole in it thinking there was not even a yolk. Gross! I had taken it back to the office and could not go back. Unfortunately.
author: Susan M.

description: Good Burger and fast service , great if you are in a hurry and its fresh. also they have organic yogurt ohh yummo!!!
author: P C.

description:
Super Duper means super duper long lines to get a burger.  I feel that all my thoughts echo what everyone else has to say:

SUPER GREASY
SUPER HEAVY
SUPER food coma

My friend who is on a burger diet took me here for a filling lunch.  We were tempted to wait in line b/c a 40 minute line must mean that its a good burger, right?  It is.  The gold standard is IN n OUT where you barely wait in line, the food is much cheaper and the burger is cleaner.  I know that Niman Ranch is better quality than what INO uses but for some reason it filled my paper burger holder with grease.  This grease reminded me of pepperoni grease where you dab the pizza with a napkin.  I wish I did that to my burger.  It slid down my throat...in a good way?

One word of advice: Their special sauce wasn't anything special.  I would say their Chipotle sauce is much better and you should ask to swap it out for the sauce in the burger.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Had dinner at Super Duper tonight for the 1st time. 
overall cute place and good food
a couple things to note:
1.) burgers seem a bit small but they actually fill you up
2.) garlic fries are good for people who do not like really oily greasy garlic fries
3.) price was okay not great but it is dt sf---  spent $17 for 2 burgers (one mini one regular, 1 order of fries and 1 drink)
4.) nice place, love the pickles and the different options. I would want to go back and try the chicken burger
author: Nicole S.

description: Super hipster burger store located in Union Square. Ordered a mini burger and garlic fries and was stuffed by the end of the meal-at a reasonable price too! The garlic fries reminded me of truffle fries, and were sprinkled with parmesan as well! The meat on the burgers were really juicy and tender which I wasn't expecting given how cheap the meal was! Some people like to compare this place to In-n-Out-sorry but as SoCal girl, my heart will always be for In-n-Out!
author: Trissie L.

description: We got the super burger, it was not great! I like In-N- Out better! The beef was very oily and heavy. I didnt like this place at all. If you want a good burger in SF.... try Bistro burger/The burger bar or Burger Miester.
author: Nia Q.

description:
Super Duper Burger... delicious!!! Probably one of the best burger joints in the FiDi!

I got the Super Duper Burger of course which comes with two patties with everything on it - add cheese, with a side of fries, and the burger alone was just enough to get me full. Got the food to-go and it was still delicious as I ate the dripping burger at my desk.

As the line can get long around lunchtime, I decided to go around 11a.m. and there was no line! I know for most 11a.m. could be quite early for lunch, however it beats waiting like 20 - 30 minutes in line for a burger. Time it took me to walk there, order, and get back was about 15 minutes.

All around great experience for to-go food as the fries were still crispy and was not too salty.

Repeat purchase for sure!!!
author: Vic F.

description: Awesome.  Great burger.  No, really, really great burger.  And right in the middle of SF.  What a great experience.
author: Chris C.

description: From the nice design, hip atmosphere, and to the delicious burgers this place is great. Although I'm not a big fan of garlic, the garlic fries are delicious!
author: Alex E.

description:
SLOWWwwwwwww.... Garden Burgers are good, as are the pickles, but you'll get a stomach ache if you eat more than 2(seriously, don't do it), and I'm pretty certain it's not vegan(the bun).  Hummus takes away from the burnt taste, which is really heavy on onions.  If you are a vegetarian these are decent, solid 3-to-4 stars. 

I'm docking them a star for having a terrible ordering process(2.5 stars), and bad customer rapport.  If you go in with friends, order at once, or you'll be late getting back to work.  Also, the management will make you *try to make you feel stupid for hanging near the counter while their employee takes forever to punch in 4 numbers, because it's a piece of paper with oil all over it. 

*To the Asian manager guy, with a bad attitude.  I was the next order up jackass,  and the counter is huge.  I'm sorry you don't like people who have places to be, but I wasn't being rude, nor was I in anyone's way.  Even if you say please, you aren't very good at making me believe you care, and I saw my veggie burger sitting there for a while.
author: Dj P.

description: I got me some Super Duper and I am Super Duper Happy! I got the 1 patty with cheese and bacon. The burger was so juicy and cooked medium well. It had so much flavor, I want another. I also got the garlic fries, love the cheese on top, it was better than Gordon Biersch's garlic fries! To end my meal I got the kid's dipped vanilla soft serve, the perfect ending. The kid's size was pretty big, I can only imagine the regular size is probably huge!
author: Karen T.

description:
Ordered "protein style burger w/ grilled onions and no sauce"

Got it with buns (i.e. not protein style), sent back.
Got 2nd attempt with some sauce, sent back.
Got 3rd attempt with red onions, not grilled.

Geez, is it seriously that hard.  And they tried to make it up to me by offering me fries.  Somehow my lack of bread didn't clue them into my non-desire for carbs.

I am curious if the cashier messed up (he seemed to understand the words coming out of my mouth) or the lack of the Hispanic cooks in reading the order.  

After the 3rd attempt, I just ate it as I got tired of waiting.  Burger was eh.  

So, I bet you are wondering why the second star?  They were playing Depeche Mode and that made me happy.
author: reza n.

description: I gaze at your photo and the memories it brings me. I will return to hit it again.
author: Nikki N.

description:
What did I want?  A burger and fries.
When did I want it? Now.  (Technically yesterday, but whatever.)

SuperDuper feels like an old-school burger joint with a modern twist.  Stainless steel decor, Shake Shack-y lettering on the outside, and good ol' burgers inside.  I came here with a friend yesterday and we gorged on cheeseburgers, fries, and garlic fries.  I'll come back to try the shakes and burger with egg on top.  Egggggs yummmm.

Burgers are cooked medium and placed on a lovely bun that's crisped up nicely.  They put lettuce, tomato, onion, and "super sauce" on it for you, then it's up to you to get the pickles, ketchup, and mustard.  (other toppings also available for a price)  The pickles were hot!  Yummy.  Probably "homemade".  

Here's a sign of how good the garlic fries were...  I had to stop and buy a pack of gum at CVS on the way out of the place because my breath was so horrendous.
author: Laura B.

description: Solid burger. They come default medium which is just prefect. The garlic fries were banging but could be almost overwhelming for some. Cookies and cream shake for dessert and you are set. Would definitely come back.
author: Ikka S.

description:
All the men in the office kept raving about how good this burger was, so the means girls and I decided to walk over and give this place a shot.  

Got there when it opened and beat the lunch rush.  My meal turned out to be $15 because I added so many toppings to it. Ordered the mini burger with bacon/avo/mushroom, garlic fries and added 3 dipping sauce for a dollar!

The fries tasted like cafeteria fries, not fresh, not hot, not crunchy - just soggy.  They had them premade and packed on the shelf. 

The burger was decent, but I didn't get the OMG this is the best burger I had in my life.  After sharing my experience with manly men of the office, they told me I had to give this place another shot.  

This time they said , "lose all the toppings and get a regular burger, no fries. you will def get a different experience"

With that said,. I will be back and just order a plain burger, so I can taste how fresh and meaty it is!
author: Chanel L.

description:
Just another burger place you think, right?  No, Super Duper isn't where you go for any old burgers.  It's where you go if you want your socks blown off, your taste buds tantilized, a milk shake to ruin your waistline and enough garlic on your fries to drive away the strongest vampire!  

We ordered burgers, fries, pickles, shakes, ice cream, you name it.  I tried the portobello burger and was completely blown away by the crispy breaded cap inside.  It was far from what I was expecting, that's for sure.  Along with the garlic fries, chocolate strawberry super shake, and double flavoured ice cream cone, I came out probably 10 pounds heavier and hell of a lot happier!

The pickles deserve a whole paragraph in and of themselves.  Jars of pickles on the counter, help yourself to as many as you want!  I munched away on a few, added a few bites to my burger.  They're crunchy and dilly with a touch of sweetness.  I've had some amazing pickles in the past, and while these aren't the best, they're up there on the scales of being "wow!"  

This place is busy.  When we came in there were three tables available.  Right after we ordered, there were none!  Fortunately we were able to snag a table not long after we ordered.  Inside seating, plus outside and upstairs, there's a lot of tables but also lots of people, especially during the work week.

To round out the atmosphere, there were some great 80s songs playing through the speakers.  Not loud enough to overpower conversations, but enough so you could reminisce and enjoy the tunes while having some great and awesome food.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Ordered the mini hamburger and garlic fries. I'd give the garlic fries 4 stars, and 3.5 stars for the burgers.

The burgers were juicy but a little bland. Maybe I should've gotten the special sauce. They're called "mini burgers" but it's a normal size burger. The garlic fries were pretty good. 

Heard the shakes are good, I'll give that a try next time.

Overall, it's a good lunch spot in FiDi.
author: j s.

description: VERY SALTY. I couldn't enjoy it, it was so salty. Even aside from that it was nothing special, definitely not worth what they charge. Never returning.
author: Bob G.

description: This place has got to be my new favorite burger spot!  What more can I say..... the burger is awesome, the garlic fries are fabulous and I looooooooooooooooooove the chocolate shake with fresh strawberries... it's to die for!!!
author: AJ A.

description:
We had a very enjoyable dinner from here. The cashier was very friendly, and, although given a 15 minute promise time, we got our order in about 5. Always better to under-promise and over-deliver! 

I had a delicious bacon cheeseburger. In its foil wrapper, it was sitting in a pile of grease. It was completely messy, and I felt a little guilty after eating it, but wow, it was yummy. Good portions for the price, too.
author: Anthony P.

description:
I will keep this simple. Great french fries and absolutely mouth-watering chicken sandwich/burger.

There is a line sometimes, but it usually goes by very quickly. The place is basically a fast food restaurant, but with better, higher quality ingredients.

Lemonade was not very good at all.
author: Landon E.

description: Burger was ok enough but nothing super duper. Their idea of medium is pretty rare. The fries were crispy but also very tough and barely warm.
author: Steven B.

description:
Same great food from the first location. Get the mini burger- same size as a quarter pounder and you feel less food coma-ish after. SD sauce makes the burger so be sure to get some. 

Limited outdoor seating which is unfortunate on warm days, but if you are willing to walk 5 minutes to Yerba Buena park, take your burgers there!
author: Seema M.

description:
In the quest to find the perfect burger in San Francisco, Super Duper is on my list. But it's not here because of their beef burger, which resembles something my dog would have smelled and turned away from. It's on the list for their non-beef options. 

The chicken is solid and the portabella is definitely a welcome change of pace from typical burger joint fare. Garlic fries and alcoholic shakes round out a very solid menu. Unfortunately, the seating and overall rude, crowded feel of the place leave a good bit to be desired.
author: Richard B.

description:
I'm not a big fan of burgers at all, but being that we were in San Francisco, the bf really wanted to try a burger joint while we were there.

We ordered the super burger with cheese, bacon, lettuce, onions, super sauce, and an organic egg. Seriously the BEST burger I've ever had in my life and this is coming from a person who literally eats burgers as a last resort. My bf kept raving about how he really wanted to try a burger with an egg and I honestly think the egg made all the difference. It made it so much more juicy and tasty.

We also tried the garlic fries. These were amazing! It had that strong garlic taste (which I loveeee) and the parmesan cheese sprinkled on top made it that much more tasty!
author: Jessica V.

description:
Tasty juicy burgers.

I like the mini. It's just my size!

Let's talk about the garlic fries. I don't know if it's really garlic or powder but they are salty delicious and I don't care. 

I will be back for a milkshake.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I enjoyed  a delightful little lunch here with some coworkers. As we walked in we were immediately met by a long line but to their credit, this place is quite adept at getting you in and out and fighting the crowds.

The menu boasts a fairly large array of items and I was debating a burger or a salad when I came across the best of both worlds: a salad with a burger patty on top. So, I ordered it and added some avocado and off we went. 

Our orders came out sort of messed up. People's dishes were missing things we had asked (and paid) for. To their defense, they were very, very busy and also to their credit, the fixed all the problems with no hesitation at all.

My salad was great. I loved the Caesar dressing (which is good because it's the only dressing they serve), the meat was perfectly cooked to the medium rare I requested and flavored very well, and the veggies were fresh and crunchy, just like I was crazing!

All in all, for the super cheap prices they charge, I was beyond impressed with this place!
author: Kay T.

description: Super Duper is super duper amazing! My best friend treated me out here for my birthday, and right when I walked in I could smell all of that heavenly goodness and I just got so excited to order my food! Friendly workers, delicious food, great music, and the location is perfect! It's right next to the parking garage and AMC! Definitely coming back again!
author: Freddo C.

description: Loved this place! Great, organic food! Nice and helpful people. The burgers really are super duper!! And I love burgers!
author: Stacy B.

description:
They are not as good as pearls but the location is awesome. As I'm not a big fan of Bistro burger, I'm happy to find a new burger joint near all the shopping in Union Square. 

There's no wait service, you order at the counter and pick it up when it's ready. However I found our cashier to be a bit rude and impatient...but it does not ruin my mood to test out their burger. 

The meat is well seasoned, cooked medium and pair perfectly with a fried egg. The burger itself is 4.5 stars consider the price. 
French fries are pretty good as well with the perfect amount of salt. 

So why not the five stars? 

I wish there are more selections on their menu such as sweet potatoe fries and if their staff can actually pretend like they are happy to have customers.
author: Maggie C.

description: Service is very friendly, but a little awkward because they fill orders randomly so a friend might finish their burger by the time you get yours. That said - the burgers are *surprisingly* delicious (better than Yeah! Burger) and the barely-out-of-cucumber homemade pickle spears are tasty. Amount of cheesegarlic on the garlic fries can vary quite a bit - ours hardly had any, and the restaurant was out of katsup :( I think the shakes are also delicious, but I can't be personally sure as my boyfriend drank almost all of ours. Be warned - it's no use trying to save calories here!
author: Kristin L.

description:
Super Duper Burger's name says it all.

As out of towners, we wound up eating at Super Duper Burger twice because we liked it so much, and didn't want to take a chance at a new restaurant. Homemade pickles, perfect burgers, and spiked shakes.

De-lic-ious.
author: Jessica O.

description:
Finally there's a good, affordable place to fill up my belly before I shop. I came here with a friend and I ordered a chicken burger while she had the garlic fries. The chicken burger comes with aioli sauce and the bread was just perfect! It was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The chicken was tender and moist. My burger cost about $6.75 but the size is definitely decent considering its location. 

I must come back to try their milkshakes that everyone keeps talking about!
author: Connie C.

description:
Free pickles?! what is there not to love? 

I love their fries and burgers. Their juicy juicy burgers with the oil just dripping from it! I've even tried the veggie burger which was delicious.

I'm a big french fries fan and their fries with their dips. Trust me...so good!

Also the name is uber cute? Super Duper? Reminds me of Good Burger the movie.

Also alcoholic milk shakes? Get your drank and food on.
author: Dorris W.

description:
I think these burgers are the best in town. I love Pearl's, but this place beats them since the bun is somewhat crispy. 

I love how they are gearing more towards the organic and hormone free items too. We need more of that.

I will definitely be back!
author: Kissy F.

description:
Just had a free burger today as part of Super Duper's Free Burger Day (which only actually lasted 1/24th of the day from 1PM-2PM).  Also got some fries and a side of pickles from the condiment bar.

The burger was juicy and tasty and the fries nicely crisp.  The burger was the perfect size - not too big, not too small.  I don't know if the free burgers are a special promo size, but I was pretty hungry when I got in line and was initially a little disappointed when I got my tray of food.  As is always my downfall though, my eyes were bigger than my appetite - after polishing off my burger and friends, I was delightfully satisfied yet not over-stuffed.  Quality, not quantity.

Hope to come back and try some other things on the menu, like a milkshake or dipped cone.  Prices up on the board looked pretty reasonable too.  Another plus.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: Not sure if it's just this location but for some reason, the burger wasn't as good here as the one in the original location.  Tasted burnt.  But what hasn't changed is the crispy garlic fries and the free pickles - I could just eat those all day.
author: F. P.

description: One of my current favorites. Garlic fry heaven--that title hasn't changed. I finally had an actual burger from here and it was excellent. I like that they are a sustainable food joint. Good service, great food. Seating is limited but it clears out pretty fast. Super Duper really is super duper. Keep it up!
author: Idk A.

description:
i really love this place. 
the burgers are super tasty and the cookies n cream shake is super good. 
what i don't like though, is that they don't accept american express. 
i planned on eating here but didn't end up doing so because they didn't accept my card. granted there are a bajillion banks nearby. i just didn't bother going back. 
until a couple weeks later, and Super Duper did not disappoint. 
nomnomnom.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
I found this place from Yelp reviews and I think this place was great. It's walking distance from Union Square, and that's the main reason I chose this place. I went on a Wednesday night so it wasn't too busy, but I get the feeling that there would be nowhere to sit on a weekend. I had the super burger, which is 2 4-oz. patties, and the patties looked like they were made in-house so that was a plus for me. Their list of fixins' was great, the only thing missing was bacon, and possibly some blue cheese or garlic.

I think the ambience is great, there's a small upstairs seating area that seems like a loft for an apartment that overlooks most of the restaurant, which I thought was cool. The clientele seems a little hipster which is a negative in my book, but it's San Francisco, so you can't help that. The staff seemed very friendly, so that's always good.

Oh yeah, when they take your order, they ask for your name. Since there was another "Dan," I tried to think of a name that would stand out. I could only think of "Prometheus," but the ticket only allows so many letters (and she misspelled it, I blame our school system for not delving deep enough into Greek mythology), so next time, I'll go with a shorter name.
author: Dan F.

description:
would love to give this place 5 stars but they screwed up my order (flaky cashier) so i didnt get to enjoy jalapenos, super sauce, pickles, or grilled onions on my burger in addition to the cheese and bacon that i did get. this was especially heartbreaking because this was my first meal off of a 3-week cleanse where i could basically eat nothing.  I WAS SO MAD!!! but too hungry to go bitch to the cashier about it esp when there was another enormous line forming. 

what i did have though was pretty good and im excited for my next time back where i will ensure that the order is perfect.  the patty is pretty juicy but the bun really sets it apart.  i dont know what it is but it is soft, buttery, and deliciousness.  was also really impressed by the fries, almost mcdonalds like in its cruchiness.  i got the three dipping sauces and the mayo was just mayo but the chipotle and super sauce really do have a kick.  so glad this opened up in union square so i can get my burger fix on the weekends (provided the cashier gets the order right from now on!)
author: Cathy L.

description: I ordered a Super Cheeseburger with everything on it (tomatoes, onions, super sauce), and found the burger way too greasy. The beef tasted a bit undercooked as well. Overall, the burger was better than what you find in low-end fast-food joints, but that isn't saying much. The garlic fries had way too much garlic on them, which is a shame because they would have tasted excellent with just a bit less garlic. Perhaps my single experience was just bad, but this place isn't as great as I was expecting.
author: Aiman F.

description: Not the best but far from the worst they have decent prices , good atmosphere , fun and friendly staff come and give them a try
author: Tony S.

description:
Whoever told me this place is similar to Shake Shack in NY, obviously has not been to Shake Shack.  But my bad for even believing such a rumor!  Shake Shack expectations aside, I wasn't blown away by the burger.  There was definitely a lot of meat to the burger but the proportions were just off to me.  There was practically no lettuce in my burger and I had the tiniest slice of tomato.  As a whole, the burger was literally drowning in its own grease.  WAAAY too greasy for me.  I think I used over 6 towels to soak up the dripping oil.  And they forgot the egg on BOTH burgers! The egg was supposed to be the icing on the cake! So disappointing. 

What I would come back for are the garlic fries and Strauss soft serve! Glad to have at least ended my meal well.
author: Helen V.

description:
Reviewing Super Duper is a funny thing. I've definitely had far better burgers for less, but nothing near this location. 

Super Duper reminds me most of Five Guys in their burger construction. Think big patties on relatively small buns with tons of topping options. Their fries aren't terrible, but I never feel like they are quite worth their cost. Some friends are fans of the shakes (which you can get spiked?!), but I haven't tried them. 

Decent chicken burgers and even the veggie patty is fairly well done and tasty. If you're in the area and need a good burger (particularly late at night), Super Duper is a reliable, if uninspiring, choice.
author: Scott T.

description:
I won't be going back. I went here for lunch with my brother during the work-week. The line was literally out the door. There were three registers but only two people taking orders. It's barely possible to go here when you only have an hour for lunch (I work 2 blocks away).  An employee walked the line offering samples of garlic fries, which was cool. 

We got a hamburger, a cheeseburger, regular fries, a cookies & cream milkshake, and a vanilla milkshake. The fries were pretty good, the cookies & cream milkshake was good. My brother said the vanilla milkshake was not good and he'd had better. 

My hamburger was outrageously greasy. I had to wipe my fingers after every bite. The cheeseburger was the same way. Also, the burger was weirdly formed, and kind of thin. Despite it being Niman Ranch meat, the burger tasted like what I remember McDonald's burgers tasting like.  I wound up getting violently ill that afternoon, and when I mentioned it to my brother he confirmed the same happened to him.  I'm not going to try this place again. 

The hamburgers at Bistro Burger, Burgermeister and Burger Bar are five thousand times better and don't make me sick.
author: Green Y.

description: Holy mother of cheeseburgers, this place is good. I'm sitting here struggling to finish everything I ordered. I got the super duper combo with a chocolate shake. The burger was super (no pun intended) juicy. It didn't even need the super sauce they put on it. It had enough flavor on it's own. The fries were fresh and unsalted, not that it helps much. The shake was perfectly malted goodness. And the staff was funny and helpful. I left feeling kind of like the cow they used for my burger, but so satisfied. I am a big In and Out fan and this is one of the only places I can honestly say compares in quality and tastiness. Grab lots of napkins and bask in the caloric glow.
author: Alie C.

description: I have to give them back a star. The burgers are still a terrible pile of greasy mess. However, the chipotle chicken sandwiches are amazing!
author: Robert H.

description:
I loved this place when I ate carbs.  I still love this place while I'm on my low carb diet, too!  Their Super Burger is amazing.  Of course, I can only eat burgers that have at least two patties in them.  The bun to meat ratio is on point and you get an ample amount of toppings without feeling like there's too much in the mix.  If you're in the mood for garlic fries, don't plan a date afterwards.  Those things are potent! They also have house made pickles.  They have the right amount of salt and a lot of spice!

I like how the food platters are metal tins and that all of their food packaging is compostable.  Also, the staff is really nice.  Never grouchy!

Their salads are pretty good, too.  You can get their Super Salad with mushrooms, chicken, or beef patties!!  If you're filling boozy, they have wine and spiked milkshakes.  If you're in a hurry during lunch time, I suggest coming back in a few hours.  That line can go out the door.
author: Lisa X.

description: Line moves super quickly.  Had a lunch with a friend and got in and out quickly. Burger was juicy and tasty and for its price, it can't be beat for the FIDI.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Their name says it all! Super Duper burgers!! Nice grass fed beef makes for a tasty burger! Topped with the house sauce, cheese and bacon this was a burger worth the money!! Choices are a 4oz or 8oz burger, equal to a 1/4 pounder or 1/2 pounder. Get the garlic fries with it for a great meal that will leave you more than satisfied! 

Only thing I didn't like was that they charge a 3% fee/tax to help pay for employees health coverage. I disagree with this. Why doesn't the company just take a slightly less profit instead of charging it's patrons on top of the money they were already willing to spend there.
author: Suzi L.

description:
For some reason it doesn't *feel* the same as the other Super Duper in the Castro. Same food, same drinks, same decor, but different vibe, probably from being downtown. It's a mini-chain, but being in this section of town makes it feel less neighborhoody.

I meet my friend here after work sometimes if we're doing stuff nearby, usually sharing the garlic fries and 3 dipping sauces. The homemade pickles will be the end of us.
author: Phuong M.

description: The mini (4 oz) burger was enough for me so then I could enjoy all my yummerlicious garlic fries.  Ok, I'm always iffy about g.fries - but these were just right!  The fries themselves were good, and the garlic flavor didn't overpower the flavor of everything else I ate.  I added cheese and bacon to my burger - making the meal one worth intaking calories for!
author: Maricris D.

description: Pretty good.. not sure if they're super duper.  I think I was expecting a little bit more.  The burger itself was pretty greasy, and it wasn't really tasty.  I do like the decor/presentation of the food itself, which was modern and fun.  I wouldn't mind coming here again, but not sure if I'd necessarily go out of my way.
author: Mel G.

description: Got the Chicken Sandwich and French Fries. The fries were fine, but the chicken sandwich was sooo damn good, especially for something ready that fast. The awesome spicy dill pickles on the side made it.
author: Jay B.

description:
Me and my buddy walked in after 10 pm. Everything else was pretty much closed by then. I got a chicken burger (w/ cheese & bacon) + soda and paid somewhere around $10.
The burger was absolutely delicious. I am certainly craving one right now.
Totally worth it!
author: G B.

description:
Surprisingly, I was not a big fan of the burgers...
I got the smaller of the two burgers and it turned out to be really really greasy. I unwrapped the little grease ball and oil was just oozing out and left a sad puddle on my tray. Not really into that. 

but what was I a fan of, you ask? 

Garlic fries and spiked shakes! I'm definitely going back and just getting those two things. The garlic fries weren't too garlicy, just perfect! And the actual fries came out hot and crispy. I split the fresh strawberry and chocolate shake with my friend thinking it would be enough just to taste- but lo and behold, those skinny glasses hold a lot more than I expected :) not only did I get more than I was gearing myself up for, but validated spending $8 on a shake. The shake was smooth and the fresh strawberries were the perfect compliment to the chocolate. Not overly alcoholic or strong but enough to know it's there and to really enjoy the meal.
author: Christine A.

description:
i cant wait to go again. i'm eating a hamburger with garlic fries and they are both so good and flavorful that it definitely a special taste specific to this restaurant. Their garlic fries are actually the best i have ever had. The fries are not thick so even more flavorful! 

The burgers come in single or double patties. I also got their Fresh Lemonade with brown sugar. Delicious.

Finally, I saw on their menu that they sell milkshakes including SPIKED ones! never had a spiked milkshake so def have to try it at least once. 

Highly recommended.
author: Shayenne G.

description: Great place to grab a juicy, yet healthy burger.  Friendly staff, plenty of seating (they have additional seating on their second floor), and they sell beer & wine.  Fresh ingredients.  The beverage cups are glasses (actual glasses!), which is neat and unusual for most "quick" sit-down eateries nowadays.  The fries are almost similar to In-n-Out's - fresh but you have to eat them right away (don't save them for later.)
author: Jessee A.

description:
The burger is very juicy. Dripping meat juice all over the place as I bite into it. Literally, the tray was soaked when I am done eating and I have to use like 6 napkins and wash my greasy hands after.

It is a great burger though. Good fries too. Long lines at lunch.
author: July N.

description:
Their burger and fries are SUPER DUPER!  

I had their vegetarian burger.  I ditched the humus and added swiss cheese and grilled onions.  First off, the burger is so full of veggies - I could see them!  The patty was firm enough so that it didn't fall apart.  Their buns were exceptionally soft (which there was a whole grain option).  

I also got the garlic fries. These were equally super duper.  I ordered the dips - the mayo was really good, but I think the fries were best on their own.  

We had a bit of a wait.  The order line goes quickly, but it took about 15 minutes to get our food.  I think this normally would be acceptable (especially because of the food), but I was eating with someone who had a plane to catch.

I would go back to SF just for their burger and those insanely good garlic fries.
author: Linda S.

description: It was good but not OMG good.  The place was very busy thanks to location and positive Yelp reviews.   I think Smash Burger may be the best burger out there!
author: Doug D.

description: Just okay. If I had to rank burgers in a fast food setting it would be In n Out, Five Guys, Most fast food hamburgers, then Super Duper. The flavor just wasn't anything special. It pretty much tasted like a burger I could make at home and those are nothing special. The tables were also dirty when we ate inside. The guy came on and wiped down the table and there were still big ass crumbs on it, it was like that for every table so obviously no fucks given. We got super burgers which comes with two patties and the meat is fresh but not flavorful. The ingredients were standard. We also got garlic fries which saved the meal. Those were very tasty and had Parmesan cheese on the top which was nice and went well. Not the best burger I've had and was a little disappointing considering all the good things we've heard about this spot. We did get soft serve cones after the meal and that was actually very good. It's homemade and organic but whatever, it tasted good so I don't care about that stuff. Overall an average burger spot but not one that I would go out of my way craving for.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Here is a pretty decent burger joint. They keep it pretty simple but it is done really well. The service is really nice and give french fries when there is a long wait. 

Food:
Burger- Very tasty and cooked perfectly but super greasy. 
Garlic Fries- GOOD
author: Elliot T.

description: Best burgers in Town! We stayed at the palace hotel about 2 blocks over and saw this place and went by like 3 times. Super duper friendly and super duper burgers! Get the garlic fries!!!!!!!
author: Carlos M.

description:
I've eaten A LOT of burgers from A LOT of places and I can't figure out what's so great about Super Duper. I got the mini cheeseburger with jalapeño peppers and grilled onions, no tomato. It honestly just tasted like an ordinary burger to me. My favorite part was probably just the jalapeno peppers and the pickles that have me coming back for more. Similar to Donna M.'s review, I also thought the burger was way too greasy for me. Don't get me wrong, I love greasy food but if the grease is the only thing I taste... no thanks. I keep trying to think back to this past Saturday to see what was memorable about the burger to me and there isn't much. The patty was just okay. I mistakenly got the regular fries instead of upgrading to the garlic fries and they're just ok. The regular fries don't have much flavor and isn't crispy enough for me. The garlic fries though, AWESOME. I'm used to getting the Gordon Biersch garlic fries that can be soggy sometimes but the garlic fries were 100% crispy. The homemade pickles are delicious and don't taste too vinegar-y. 

I'd probably return to Super Duper but I don't think I'll "crave" it. I'd probably even opt for trying something else on the menu. Nonetheless, there's a going to be one in the food court at Valley Fair so I'll try it again then.
author: Tammy N.

description:
Good burgers! I had a nice and juicy super burger with bacon. It's not that big but the quality meat tastes great! The fries and dipped cones aren't bad but the meat is where this place shines.

Note: "everything" doesn't include jalapenos or pickles, so order it with everything AND jalapenos and pickles.

5 for the meat, 4 for the rest.
author: Eric R.

description:
Heard about Super Duper, read about Super Duper and finally got to taste Super Duper. The line was super duper long, but no worries as it goes by pretty fast. You even get fries while you're waiting with one of their special sauces. 

Since I was going to indulge in garlic fries and a chocolate malt shake I decided I should stick with a mini bacon burger. When I got my burger I thought it was a mistake, it seemed rather big for a mini. No mistake, it was a mini burger. It was filled with all the fixings, bacon, freshly cooked pattie between a toasted sesame seed bun. I liked the plain fries better than the garlic fries. I thought it would have fresh minced garlic on it, but it was a powder which could have been mistaken for cheese. It didn't taste like garlic, so I felt a little cheated. I did like the 3 dips I ordered with the fries. The free pickles were a nice touch . . . just wish it wasn't a self serve thing. The chocolate malt shake was unbelievable, wish it came in a mini size though. I'll probably skip the fries all together next time since I was pretty satisfied with my mini bacon burger and shake.
author: Adelina W.

description:
After eating here I realized that there was feelings being satisfied but not wanting to make a journey here to get my grub on.

This place offers up decent burgers for the city. It's similar quality to In-N-Out burger but with a different taste. They offer up nice choices of chicken burgers which was pretty good. I actually preferred the Chicken Burger over the Hamburger...which usually does not happen. 

As for their fries...they are okay as well. Nothing too bad to say other than nothing was really outstanding or "wow, this is good!".

The atmosphere is pretty cool for a burger joint. It was clean and had a nice vibe going for it. 

All in all, if your in the area and hungry for a burger, I would stop by and give it a try. But if your craving a juicy high quality burger, I would look else where.
author: Nick C.

description: I'm a bit of a burger snob. I am a regular at the Counter, Umami burger, and In n Out when its convenient, but visiting from LA and trying Super Duper Burgers, I was very impressed! My girlfriend and I got the mini burgers which was more than enough compared to the double patty burgers. The meat was juicy- dripping on the sleek metal table and cool decor surrounding the place every bite I took. We got an order of regular fries and garlic fries and although the fries were just fries, the garlic made it amazing! So fresh! I also loved the homemade pickles they had available in jars. Everything here seemed so fresh and I didn't leave feeling bloated like I sometimes do after eating burgers. Only wished parking was easier.. We must have driven around for a good thirty minutes before surrendering to a parking structure nearby. Wish they had one of these in Southern California!
author: Adam Z.

description: I was not too impressed with this place. First off, the cashier gave me the incorrect change. Second, I asked for regular fries, and they gave me garlic fries... Third, I found it to be too crowed and loud to my satisfaction. I give it three stars!
author: Troy H.

description:
Talk about pigging out........

Burgers are fresh and a tad on the greasy side. Fries and 3 sauce dip is a nice change. I got the egg once and I didnt think it was all that. Best burgers in town as far as im concerned. Gott's is a great joint but you pay a big Ferry Building premium and IMHO is not quite as good as Super Duper.
author: Huy T.

description:
Finally made it to Super Duper! The line was super duper long. The wait to go was super duper long. The burger was super duper greasy. The meat in the burger was super duper chewy. The garlic fries were super duper good. The free homemade pickles were super duper!

I don't think I would come here for lunch when I'm working.  One hour is just not enough time and its not good to go back to work smelling like garlic and greasy burgers.  But I must go back to try the milkshakes...
author: Gina S.

description:
My friend brought me here a month ago and I had their combo with burger, drink and fries. Very good quality of beef patty with really yummy fries. Too bad we were at work so we couldn't wash our patties down with the preferred beverages. It is a very good environment to enjoy with anyone and we sat by the window so we could check out the street travelers instead of looking at each other (we are two big dudes, yikes !) 

Will come back again soon !
author: Wai C.

description:
3 1/2 stars. Due to the crazy lines and the lady messing up my order, along with only 1 bathroom for each gender, i'll stay at 3 stars.

The lady who took my order was speaking "super duper" fast. Sounds great if they get the order right but I knew something was up. I simply ordered two orders of the super duper burger (2 patties). Trying to avoid confusion, I told them what I wanted in it as opposed to what I didn't want in it. You would think that would be easy but it wasn't.

First off, I never asked for cheese for my g/f's order. I have no clue why the heck the girl decided to charge an extra 50 cents when these burgers don't come with cheese unless you ask (trying to upsale). She can eat cheese so whatever. I cannot and my order was beyond jacked up. It had the sauce which I didn't want. Basically everything was screwed up. The menu also didn't specify that the garlic fries had cheese on them. Now i'm a bit of a picky eater; i'll admit that. But you should list what comes in your food b/c some people are allergic to certain foods.

I will give it to the white guy (not sure if he was just a worker or owner) who corrected my order real fast and was polite about it, so I can't be mad at him. They brought out another set of garlic fries minus the cheese. It was way too greasy but I think that's b/c they just wanted to rush the order b/c it was wrong. I can overlook that.

The burger itself was pretty meaty but nothing special. Sort of reminds me of 5 guys and fries, which isn't a bad thing. Overall, the food itself was pretty decent but all other factors considered, it's not the best place to eat. It's right in a "touristy" area and seats are limited. In addition, they don't have enough trash cans and the only two they do have are placed awkwardly by the napkins, which are hard to grab (you'll know what i'm talking about when if and when you go there).

Overall, it's decent food but not really worth the hassle in my opinion.
author: James K.

description: Like wow!  In New York City, it's Shake Shack.  In LA, it's In and Out.  And in San Francisco, you've got to love Super Duper Burgers!  I listened to the other reviewers and went at an off time, around 5:30 pm so the line was not long at all.  Ordered the Mini Combo - burger, added cheddar cheese, and comes with a drink.  Then I opted to add the three sauces (forget what it's called - but it's sauces for your burger and fries that you can order on the side).  The burger was pretty awesome.  Juicy, tasty, flavorful.  And they have homemade pickles on the side that you can help yourself to.  Not sure how sanitary since everyone helps themselves and I have issues with self serve stuff - you never know if someone is sticking their grubby hands in the jar.  In any event, I still braved it and ate the pickles!  So good - almost pickles at a Jewish deli good, but not quite.  The burger was great though!  I think next time I will have to try it with a little more fixins - like mushrooms, onions, jalapenos, etc. etc.
author: Lora H.

description:
Super Duper Burger is quite nice and juicy.  Well cooked and seasoned throughout.   

Fries are small and not as well made, but don't let that detract you from ordering a burger.  Definitely basic fare, but they get the basics down; and are definitely better than the Counter.
author: Victor P.

description:
Burgers are too legit to quit:
-Good sesame seed bun to meat ratio
-Juicy blend w/ cheese, tomato, onions, house sauce
-Meat's not spectacular (it's ground beef, it's not supposed to taste all wowzers), but cooked just right
-Bottom half of the burger is super greasy, need to pat that thing down w/ a few industrial napkins
-You won't leave hungry
-Extremely cost friendly..$7.60 total for a 1/2 lb. burger w/ cheese

Overall, I prefer this place over Five Guys.  Better tasting/quality burgers and roughly the same price.  Five Guys has better fries, but who goes to a burger joint just for the fries...not to mention the soft serve malts here are a big hit.  Burger Bistro probably has better ingredients, but both are toe-to-toe in taste.  Bottom line - if you're looking to spend less than $10, Super Duper won't disappoint.  This is a great place to satisfy any burger craving and worth multiple visits.
author: Jeff S.

description: I was excited to check out Super Duper, complete with a mild hangover so I knew it'd hit the spot.  I had been to the other location down near the Castro but it seemed like a lot of folks and friends like this location better so I gave it a shot.  I have to say it was a good burger but it didn't really wow me.  I know I'm a bit of a burger snob, but I still prefer Pearls' myself.  The space is nice and spacious though and service was pretty quick and friendly!
author: Gene X.

description:
One of the *BEST* burgers I've had in a long time. Not like the greasy, cheddar mayo on brioche bun blended complex taste extravaganza at Bar Tartine kind. Like, a simple, all-American, good ole fashioned *SOLID* burger - made with the best ingredient: Niman Ranch Beef. On a splendid bun. With everything (hold the red onions). I can still taste the deliciousness. That tender, juicy beef. Melted cheddar cheese. MMMMMmmmm!

Also, the Garlic Fries and 3 dipping sauces. Yum.

Ooooh! And the Lemonade with Brown Sugar :)
author: Sally M.

description:
I haven't been in SF for a few months, so I haven't been keeping up with new restaurants. So when a co-worker went on and on about a new place called super duper burger, I thought she was kinda nutty and talking about some random hole in the wall.

Turns out it's a cute hipster-esque place with over 200 reviews already. I listened to others and got a mini cheeseburger with lettuce, tomato, and sauce plus a side of garlic fries, and a couple of their homemade pickles. I was a little worried about the "mini" cuz this girl can eat, but it was enough food. Everything was made well and was tasty, filling for $8. 

Two things threw me off, though. The guy at the front of the line had been waiting a long time, so the manager came by and told one of his employees to open another register. She came but started chatting to her co-worker at the other register, so the customer left in disgust. I'm not sure how long he was waiting, but it looks like the service was pretty bad.

Also, one of the girls at the counter was stretching, I'm guessing her back was sore from standing all day. She bent over and touched her hands on the floor several times. Then she noticed that the pecan pie display was disorganized, so she proceeded to re-arrange all the slices of pie with her hands. That had just touched the floor. Several times. Last words of advice: Don't eat the pie.
author: Priscilla H.

description:
Would recommend this place.
Had a veggie burger.  Need to go bk for the reg burger
author: Ying S.

description: Food is good, but not great. I went here on a Sunday afternoon. It was not busy and somehow they lost my order. After about 15 minutes of waiting I inquired and they realized their mistake. They were very apologetic, but I still ended up waiting another 15 minutes for my burgers. All and all a quick take out lunch ended up lasting 35 minutes before I even walked out the door with food in hand.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I had the mini cheese burger and it was delish! Everything tasted fesh and the fries are killer, I'll definitely come back...


Try the homemade pickles they're great!!!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
The entire concept reminded me a lot at Five-Guys-Burger but the organic style. I really like the entire organic focus, etc. 
it is located downtown close to all the action and shopping. The service was really good, nice, friendly and super fast. Unfortunately the food didn't really impress me. I went for a classic burger with cheese and bacon and some fries. The burger was soaked in oil and fat falling apart. The bread was wet from the oil and fat of the burger and the fries didn't have any taste at all. Of course you can add ketchup and mustard, but shouldn't the burger have a taste without it? I will not eat there again.
author: Markus S.

description:
This place is right next to my office building, I can smell the air of fried food wafting through the open windows into my office space.  It smells soo good, but I resist as much as I can.
But I gave in a month ago,  and went in to try their usual fare- burger, garlic fries and choc milkshake. Really good deal for the price!!
I have gone back to get their chocolate milkshakes, two days in row, it was that good!! 
Staff are friendly!!
author: Sravanthi D.

description: Super Duper is one of my favorite burger joints to visit when I go into SF. In my opinion is that their Super Burger is the best which is best paired with garlic fries and a chocolate shake. Super  Duper burgers have a unique and really good taste that you will not find anywhere else. Its a must visit and I really hope they open more locations soon.
author: Sapphire C.

description:
I am pretty convinced on their claim that their beef is vegetable fed and ground fresh daily, because I can taste the quality of the meat. There is also a nice crust on the patty itself, which can only be accomplished on a hot flat grill. 

I really like that they have a "mini" option which, along with a side of fries, is the perfect sized meal to satisfy my belly.

Even tho their milkshakes tasted fine, I'm not a huge fan of them because I prefer the thicker icecream based shakes. However, these softserve based shakes are probably better for your waistline. But heck, when I want a milkshake, I want it luscious. 

Overall I am happy with the taste and value of the food. I will probably be coming back for my burger fix since there seems to always be a seductive whiff of delicious beef coming from some secret vent on Market Street.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
This place is between work and the gym for me. I have had and have enjoyed everything from Burger King, White Castle, Whataburger, to Pearls to Ruths Chris.

This did not fall into any of those categories. Here is why. The bun was day old and sliced incorrectly anyway. Sesame seeds were on top, but were flavorless.

The meat was a bit rough texture and was cheap and greasy, but without the wonderful taste of the grease. It tasted kind of oily because of the oh so lame mayo aoli sauce. Give it some character...don't be shy. 

The fries were limp and weak. Too thin for my taste, but still too soggy and well....boring

No american cheese or any other kind of processed cheese food product. This is essential to any burger experience. I took three bites. One from the other side of the burger (just in case) in hope of getting some value from my $11 I just spent. No luck. Stay away. Not hard to screw up a milkshake, but just try that.
author: Luis M.

description:
Been here twice since it opened. It's a good place to grab some burgers. Burgers taste a little different than any other place I've eaten. It's totally a fatty burger. Gotten the mini burger with cheese and bacon the first time, and gotten the special the second time.

Wait time is not bad, it's more like line up, pay for your stuff, and then grab a table and wait for your food. Not bad, there is a self serve soda machine, plus all the different condiments you would want on a burger. Would recommend the homemade pickles. 

The cookies and cream shake was good. It's not oreos, but its still good. 

This isn't your McDonalds, nor your In-and-Out burgers, but this is on a higher scale of burgers.
author: Jason H.

description:
I've been wanting to try Super Duper ever since they opened in the Castro but I didn't ever get to try it there. When I found out they opened Downtown, I knew I had to try it. I was surprised to see a second establishment open so quickly in the city. I don't know the history of Super Duper? Does anyone know about it?

Anyways, I love the structure of the building, I think this place sort of reminds of The Counter. The menu is easy to read, and the customer service there was great. The staff was friendly and helpful when I was contemplating between a mini burger and super. 

I chose the Mini Bacon Cheese Burger w/fries and a drink. YUM!! It was delicious. The burger was a perfect size for me. It filled me without feeling like crap afterwards. I think this is a good spot to grab something to eat without an overload of options. 

I'm a fan! =)
author: Sarina I.

description:
We tried Super Duper based on a recommendation from a cashier at the Levi Store in Union Square.  I ordered the Super Duper burger with everything but jalepenos and my wife got the mini burger (one patty) with lettuce.  We also tried the garlic fries, a chocolate shake with fresh strawberries, and a cookies and cream shake.  

Burgers: My wife loved her burger.  I didn't think it was very big, but she said it was just right for her.  My burger was good, but GREASY.  Maybe the grilled onions contributed, but the bottom of the bun was completely soaked when I got it.  My hands were coated and it had fallen apart by the time I was done.  However, I had no misconceptions that I was about to eat something healthy, and it was really very good.  A little less grease/mess and I give it 4 stars.

Fries: We've only been in the Bay Area a couple of months so I don't have anything to compare it to, but they seemed fresh (as fries go) and they tasted good.  Thinner cut, crispy type fries.

Shakes:  These are drink-through-a-straw type shakes, NOT use a spoon type shakes which is what I expected when I saw the phrase "fresh strawberries" alongside the chocolate shake.  Whatever.  It still tasted good.  I liked the cookies and cream better.
author: J Russel L.

description:
My brother and I decided to eat here for dinner one night and boy was this place packed. 

I ordered the small hamburger and the beef patty was cooked medium well (to my liking) with lettuce, tomatoes, avocado and onions. So delicious! I also ordered their strawberry chocolate shake; if you love sweets this is the shake for you; in my case it was to over bearing for my taste buds...way to sweet.

The fries didn't really satisfy me. It taste similar to Burger King fries. In n' Out fries taste better. This is the only downfall of this place...the fries! 

If I ever go back, I'll try their ice-cream. Looked like people were enjoying their ice-cream on a cone. I was pretty tempted to get one but my belly was to full.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Very good experience!  The Garlic fries are a must have!  And the swirl shake was awesome!  :)
author: Jack R.

description: This is totally the place to go to if you're craving for really tasty burgers, the real stuff, not the overly processed rubbery stuff. And you can choose from a nice list of toppings to add to make the perfect burger. The fries n shakes are yummy too.
author: Cindy L.

description: Straight up fast food burger. Does the trick. Nothing fancy mostly greasy but better then a McDonald's! Ehh to this place
author: Leya r.

description: Very good burgers at the high prices you expect in downtown San Francisco.  The place is trendy and the food quality is above reproach - fresh and tasty.  Service is fast enough.  Not faaast.  But not terribly slow considering how busy the place is during the lunch rush.
author: John P.

description:
Super Duper is actually pretty Super Duper!

Penetrating the SF Market, Super Duper is giving In-N-Out a run for their money [it's their fault for not opening up a central location in down town SF (wharf doesn't count, that's so toursit), what about the people who actually live and work in SF???] But Super Duper stepped it up and gave us an awesome alternative.

I find that the mini burger is actually pretty filling if you get fries with it.  They offer veggie burgers and for us meat lovers, a burger burger =) 

Downtown workers on lunch, rush to get here if you have a 30 min, if you have an hour, you're safe.  It's about the same on wait time as In-N-Out, but you'll be satisfied.
author: Edrian D.

description:
Last week I brought my parents here because they'd heard me raving about this place and wanted to give it a try... so we went. 

Curtis, you are a rockstar and definitely saved the day! I hope you're a manager, and if not you should be. 

That said, the service was... aside from Curtis, in a word, abominable. We ordered three burgers - one mini with cheese, two supers with cheese - one with bacon. It's not like their menu is so complicated that this should have even happened. But it did. They screwed up our order, BIG TIME. When our food was called my dad and I excitedly went up to the counter, he took the fries and I carried the burgers. When I got to the table I noticed that only the mini had cheese, and there was no bacon anywhere. So, I flagged a hostess down and explained the situation - with receipt in hand to prove that I wasn't looking for free cheese. She was very sympathetic and picked up the burgers saying that she would have them cook up some bacon and add cheese. As she walked away I realized what she was intending to do. 

I caught up to her at the pass, and asked politely if she would be having fresh burgers cooked off for us for a correct order. Hand on the Bible, I swear to you she said, yes. A few moments later, our burgers were delivered. However, fresh, beautiful, melty cheese laden burger were not what was before us. Greasy, lukewarm (at BEST), reserved burgers again greeted our hungry eyes. 

Picking up the tray I brought it back again to the pass. A young man stepped up and greeted me. I explained to him the original dilemma, and then told him about the unbelievable audacity the woman who brought us the burgers had, to reserve not only another wrong order, but cold food. Having worked in the industry I know there are shortcuts - but this was NEVER one of them, and I've worked in some shady places. Even there we had standards. Curtis was gracious and understanding, walking back to my table to retake the order. He invited me to watch the burgers being made, and I took him up on the offer, not to be a snob or to be rude but to make sure that the great things I had said to my parents about SD weren't going to be challenged. I watched the failed order go into the composting bin, and was delighted as a tray of three correctly made burgers came out to me literally moments later. 

I don't know what was going on that night, but if it hadn't been for this young man's outstanding patience, and GREAT attitude, I think he would have lost three patrons that night. 

Bonus points for the desserts on the house for the complications!
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
08/04/2011

Sorry I have to change my rating,  I have to give them a three :( I took my family here after a movie and nothing was good.  I dont know if it was just a bad night but not even the ice cream made me smile a little bit.  The burger was bland.  The fries were too salty and the ice cream tasted blah.  How sad I thought I would have a new burger place.






07/29/2011
I walk pass this place everyday on the waty to work and the office keeps saying it's delicious!!!!

So, today was a perfect way to celebrate this very long week!  

I had a mini burger (4oz) instead of (8oz) with jalepenos, cheese, lettuce, super sauce, and onions.  I almost got bacon but I think I knew I was going to have the organic soft serve.

Overall, the burger was pretty tasty but I think the bun was kind of old!  Everything else for the most part was fresh!  But, if a bun is yuck it sometimes ruins the whole burger.  I also ordered garlic fries, some of them were burnt but I would only order the garlic when I go back . 


The only reason I gave it four stars was becasue of the delicious soft serve cone, I'd probably give it 5 if it was just the ice cream!  I got a mix of vanilla and chocolate and it tasted like a jello pudding snack pack that just kept giving  mmmmmmmmmmmmm.  I will be back for the ice cream and a burger when I'm in the mood.
author: Grace T.

description: The first time I ate at Super Duper, I thought I was in hamburger heaven.  The best is that you can have a fried egg on top, and my favorite is their garlic fries.  First trip was the one in the Castro, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, 6th, etc...on Market.  Organic, open late, and a great find for a burger.  Perfect sized meal for any time of day.
author: Jin B.

description: Stopped here when we were walking down the street wondering what to eat.  The line was fast, the food delivery was fast and the burgers and fries were really good!  Loved the house made pickles too!  They even have a sauce, much like Utah fry sauce, that they put on their burgers.  They thought it was weird when we asked for some to put on our fries.  Yeah, in Utah we know what is good on a french fry.
author: Andrew S.

description:
This place would definitely be on my list of favorite burgers in SF, if they made  the following tweaks:

* I thought the bun was a great choice. Just wished it wasn't soggy (See below).

* The patty itself was juicy, fluffy, and very delicious. Something needs to be done during the assembly process though so that the bottom bun isn't so soggy by the time I get to take the first bite.

* Not impressed with their special sauce. I'd rather not have the hint of chipotle flavor in it. Just simpler ketchup and mayo "secret" sauce would've be fine with me.

* The fries aren't my favorite. Maybe they decided a greasy fry wouldn't be accepted by the often snobby SF denizen. But if you're going out for a burger in the first place, notions of healthiness shouldn't be part of your deliciousness checklist. (I'm betting it's this same group of people that pressured the City to take away my hookah lounges). While the fries were undeniably crispy, they weren't the tastiest. Just a little bit of grease would've gone a long way here. (See In-N-Out for a french fry that is tasty but still doesn't make you feel so bad for eating).

Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to try this place again or recommend it to my friends. However, it's just barely on the outside looking in as far as my favorite SF burgers go. If it could make those tweaks, I think it would truly be a super duper burger joint.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
