This place is very conveniently located in Market St in San Francisco if you're looking for a quick bite to eat. Service is fairly quick, and the place is really clean and industrial-looking. 

The best thing to try by far is their garlic fries, SO delicious! If you get a double-burger, it is a pretty large portion. However, the burgers are really greasy, more so than usual, and weren't that great. You can definitely find the same portions, a cheaper price and less grease somewhere else.
author: Sheena S.

description:
I love my meat.  And I've never been a fan of fungi masquerading as burger patty... BUT this one was different.  Helps that it was fried but the portobello mushroom was delicious and my favorite of the 3 I tried.  

My Rankings: 
1. portobello 
2. grilled jalapenos 
3. regular 
(didn't get to try the blue cheese)

The garlic fries and regular fries were both awesome!  On the thinner side, but not too thin.  Crunchy, warm, and full of garlic-y goodness.

The house-made pickles were crunchy and super sour.  Yummy until I coughed on one - then it just burned.  But I'd still give it a thumbs up for all you pickle lovers!

The milk shake shots (strawberry and chocolate) were fun but had liqueur... so obviously I had to get a real milk shake after I left Super Duper.  

Cool joint!
author: Anh D.

description:
I wish I could give Super Duper a truly super duper review, but I just can't!  They were duper, but not super, how about that?  

For approx. $13++, I got a mini-sized burger (4 oz.), side of garlic fries, and a Double Chocolate Chip milkshake.  At any other place, that $13 would have gotten me a REGULAR-sized burger and everything else on my list, but I guess since they use all-natural niman ranch beef, they get to charge me $1 per oz. of beef, plus tax.  Hence the $5 MINI-burger. Then, their garlic fries are just regular fries with garlic powder and chopped parsley sprinkled on top.  Super Duper, please go check out the garlic fries at Gott's, then come back and super-size, and superize, your own garlic fries.  Because yours just pales in comparison, both in portion size and in flavor.  

But, their Double Chocolate Chip milkshake is awesome!  Unfortunately, it's also rather spendy at $5.75, plus tax.  I think I'll just go to my local Safeway and buy some Dreyer's Double Fudge Brownie ice cream.  They have that 2 for $6 special going on now for all Dreyer's ice cream.  I bet I can make 20 milkshakes from the 2 cartons I buy.
author: Meg P.

description:
Perhaps I'm being a little harsh in my review, but the food really didn't meet my expectations. People have told me how great it was and recommended I try it. And tonight I finally did... and I think I will be sticking with Bistro Burger if I'm looking for a nice burger.

The burger was good, but not great. They didn't ask me how I wanted it cooked... I asked for a bacon "Super Burger" but no cheese... it came with cheese. It's one thing when cheese is the standard and it's extra effort for them to select a "no cheese" option, but at Super Duper, cheese is an add-on, so it's even more bewildering that they still managed to get that part wrong.

They did get it right the second time (so that puts them ahead of a certain  Nation's Giant Hamburgers in Orinda) but it wasn't cooked that well. I think it was medium or even a touch below. I didn't specify anything, maybe they were just in a rush to get it to me after making the mistake the first time around. It was juicy... a bit too juicy and greasy, and the bun wasn't especially impressive (Bistro Burger has excellent buns, and I think they're more whole wheat, and have a lot more fiber than other places.)

The garlic fries would have been better if they didn't put cheese on it. Nowhere on the menu did it mention that garlic fries came with cheese. I could have asked for that without cheese but I didn't want to deal with more confusion and I thought it wouldn't make a difference... it did. 

The ice cream was the best part, and I'd consider coming back for just the ice cream.

But overall, this place fails to be more than an adequate burger joint. I don't get why it has better reviews than Bistro Burger on here.
author: Jesse R.

description:
Usually I completely ignore burger joints, being a vegetarian and all, but the promise of milkshakes and ice cream drew me in (I didn't say I was a particularly healthy vegetarian). 

But Happy Day! There are not one but two vegetarian burger options here. A vegetarian burger with hummus and a portobello mushroom burger. Argh! Internal debate! By the time I reached the cash register I decided to forgo the milkshakes and ice cream. Instead, I ordered the portobello mushroom to go. 

While waiting, I grabbed a little paper plate thing by the pick up counter and filled up on some house made pickles. Noms! Someone wrote about fries while you wait? Sadly I didn't see any of that at lunch today. 

They tell you to expect a ten minute wait for your fresh order. That rule doesn't really apply to vegetarians since our food cooks up quicker. My portobello burger was ready in about 5 and I was enjoying it in Union Square another 5 minutes later. The burger was quite filling but I think it was because of the thick bun. The meat, if you will, was lightly breaded, fried and pretty thin. Not a really meaty portobello. Overall it was a ok but could have used a touch more sauce. 

It's no Shake Shack portobello (YUM YUM YUM) sandwich but at $6 I guess it was about right. I'll try the vegetarian burger another time and see about that ice cream...
author: Kim K.

description: The best burgers I've try so far in San Francisco. The price is related to the food. The burgers are the perfect size for me, the fries are delicious and the sauce the use in them it's simply amazing. It is a nice place to stay. They are fast but the quality is really really good.
author: Andreina R.

description:
For what it is, it is very good. Great place to grab a quick burger, fries, and a drink. Although from what I'm reading, I wish I would have gotten a shake and cookies. I'll have to come back!

I ordered the regular burger (w/cheese) and fries and it was all very tasty!
author: Art A.

description: I had the chicken sandwich. The chipotle aioli on it was spicy and tasty. It was an inexpensive altogether. I'll be back at some point because it's cheap eats.
author: Avery A.

description:
The bun was a no bueno for me. Too thick and dry for my liking. Automatic burger fail. 

However, the meat was moist and flavorful. The prices were reasonable. And they gave us a sample of fries while we waited in line! Employees were also Super Duper nice! 

Overall, 3 stars. Not quite sure what the long lines are all about.

P.S. They also have chocolate dipped ice cream cones. If I'm coming back, it'll definitely only be for one of those bad boys.
author: Vivian D.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. I support what they're doing, and respect the high quality ingredients, but goddamn, all I could taste was salt!  And I normally LIKE stuff saltier than most do, so this isn't me wussing out on my daily sodium intake.

The burger was disappointing, the garlic fries fared marginally better at "eh." Maybe I'm just spoiled from previously living so close to Holy Grill.
author: Dani A. C.

description:
I wanted to find out what all the hype was about this burger joint, so I decided to try their burger and fries since I was on my quest to satisfy my cravings before Lent. First impression: Dark, dreary and small. It almost felt like I was in a club minus the strobe lights and d.j. (at least how I remember how clubs were back in the day). I think they had music playing, but I can't remember because I was too focused on the size and layout of the place. There's outdoor seating, and when you enter, there's seating on your right  and so is the line and more seating in the back with bar seating facing the open kitchen. It just seemed weird to me. Condiment station is on the left and bottled drinks in an open refrigerator is on the left too. There's seating upstairs, but from my standpoint, it didn't look like a big space. I don't know, the layout just didn't work for me. So on to the food.

I knew I wanted a burger even though they had some healthier eats. You can order a Super Duper (two patties) or a mini burger. I opted for the mini since I wanted fries. You can have your burger with everything (lettuce, tomato, onions, and sauce) anything else on it is extra ($1) and your burger is grilled medium. The fries are only one size and you can order regular or garlic. I ordered the regular fries ($2). So I put in my order to go and waited about 10 min.(?) which is what the sign at the front of the line indicated it would take for orders to be ready. There was already a number of people waiting. I don't know, the layout of the place really bugged me because people, including me, waiting for our orders were blocking the area where the refrigerated drinks were. 

So anyway, my order was ready and hopped on BART and headed  home. The burger, juicy, but not juicy like a medium grilled burger should. It was very tasty with enough seasoning and sauce. The mini burger is a 4 oz. patty and I was already wishing I got the Super Duper (8 oz. = 2 patties). The fries were...eh. I don't know, but when I think about burger joints, I would their fries would be up there like their burgers. These fries were thin-cut (not shoe-string though) and not super crispy. I like my fries to be medium to thick and fried crispy, like Belgian fries or preferrably, crinkle cut. I don't know, but I wasn't impressed with the fries. Burger was good, but not outstanding. Seriously, don't know what the hype was about this place. In my opinion, Pearl's Deluxe Burgers are better and you get more bang for your buck. 
Overall, Super Duper was super o.k.
author: Neni E.

description: Totally disappointed after all the great reviews. I love burgers but thought this was just a basic fast-food style hamburger. Wasn't crazy about fries either. I'm sure we will try it again but ehhh
author: PK R.

description:
Atmosphere: Adorable.
Service: Charming.
Burger, Fries, and Soft Serve: Scrumptious.

Location: BART-able and right near some fantastic shopping. This is also an ideal spot for lunch if you are stuck at a conference nearby.

The "Mini Burger" is a quarter pound of goodness, I topped mine with bleu cheese (+$1), fried organic egg (+$1), grilled onions (free) and super duper sauce (free yummy aioli). The bun was toasty and the whole thing was super yum.

The fries were good, if not, to die. And the Straus's soft serve (chocolate dipped, of course) was a creamy delight. I especially liked being able to order the kiddie size.

Pricier than fast food, but considerably more delicious and with wine and beer to boot! I'll definitely be back.
author: Sarah T.

description: This is a great place for a trusty burger and tasty homemade pickles.  Most of the time there is a lot of seating, but during normal mealtime hours, it can get pretty busy.  I find that the fries are really, really good when they're good, but there are times when they're a bust.  I think there is less of a chance of this happening when you go when it's busy.
author: Erica D.

description: Burger joints really only have to do two things well, make delicious burgers and fries. Making good milkshakes is a bonus. This place has this trifecta and also has house-made pickles, great beer and wine to boot!.
author: Dani D.

description: I've been coming to super duper for years now.  It's my favorite burger place in the city.  But the quality and taste is not the same anymore.  The last two times I have been here, they were out of burgers here and the other location didn't have lettuce or tomato.  Today they were out of tomato and they didn't tell us.  So I bite into the burger and I notice it was missing tomato??  I ask, they say sorry we are out of tomato.  Ok, when were you going to tell me this?  That wasn't the only problem.  The burger was over cooked, dry and barely had any sauce on it.  I was very disappointed.  All of my experiences here and at the location by the metreon have been awful.  The sign on the menu say the burgers can be messy business.  I like that they are messy and juicy, but that is not what I get here :( these locations don't live up to the quality that other super dupers offer.  I will stick to where I know it's good.
author: Angelina C.

description:
I had such high hopes for this new burger place on Market. but I was let down. My friend who treated me to lunch sums it up well,"It's like a gourmet In and Out." I amnot okay waiting 30mins for food that tastes like gourmet fast food. Lame.

The fries were just eh. I was expecting sweet potato fries. What gourmet burger place in SF doesn't have sweet potato fries!

The veggie burger was crispy, which I loved, but it wasn't all that tasty.
You had to pay a $1 for sauce. WTF? I was severely disappointed by the milkshakes too. Chocolate, chocolate strawberry, cookies and cream? That's it...really? (can't remember if they had vanilla) Doesn't stand a chance against a sea salt caramel milkshake from Roam on Union Street. Man I love that place.

They have homemade pickles if you're into that though!

Overall, it was just A-Ok, so 3 stars it gets!
author: Cassy R.

description:
Every time I try a new burger restaurant in the US, I'm treated to surprisingly original businesses like Super Duper.

Sure, it's still fries and burgers and milk shakes and all that, but the look of the restaurant and the fresh ingredients meant I enjoyed hanging out while my dinner was being prepared, and when I bit into it, I was in burger heaven.

If you're nervous about eating medium rare ground beef, be warned that this is standard cooking for their burgers.  I wasn't used to it myself, but the softness, and moistness of a medium rare patty won me over.

Try the garlic fries too, they're awesome!
author: Matt B.

description:
Okay so since my last review I've had the chicken sandwich and I sprang for the chipotle aioli. Did I need the aioli? No. But it was delicious and my sandwich was the greatest chicken sandwich ever. 

This week I tried the vegetarian burger with hummus. So good -- this place actually does vegetarian burgers right. The patty stayed together and was delicious, even with minimal toppings (I'm talking about just lettuce, tomato, jalapeno peppers, the hummus and a bit of mayo).
author: Shauna S.

description:
The first time I tried Super Duper was at Senator Mark Leno's Young Women's Conference. Super Duper provided lunch for the participants and the adult chaperones (aka: me). I loved how tasty the burger was. It was nice & juicy. They ran out of the cheeseburger, so I had a regular hamburger & I fell in love.

I checked them out on Yelp & went to their site on Market St. Parking sucks around here, but go figure - you're in downtown. I had their cheeseburger, fries & their soft serve cone. Service was quick, decor was nice & clean & food was still delicious. 

It's a bit pricey for a burger joint, but they are using organic products. I'll definitely be back when I'm in the city. 

Yum!
author: Michelle F.

description:
Ordered the Super Burger combo with every toppings n egg. The egg popped and it gets reallllllllllllllllllllllyyyyyyyy messy, but it was fun.  The breads looked small in size but the whole burger is actually enough to fill your stomach, along with the fries! I'd like to try the garlic fries & organic ice cream next time....

Delicious burger with 2 big patties/ Fries were okay/ Affordable~

Avoid looooooong line during lunch time in business days~
author: Leilani B.

description:
Good juicy burgers! Clean place. It doesn't feel like the poor quality fast food chains.
They have a nice small heated terrace on Market for sunny days.
I'll go back!
author: Franck M.

description: Clean and cool environment! Love what they stand for..sustainable and trendy. Simple menu made it easy to choose but customer service SUCKED. Burger was juicy, normally don't do medium rare but it wasn't bad. Fries were a little soggy but well seasoned.
author: Cameo D.

description:
The burgers are...super duper (oh...now i get it).  They use Niman Ranch beef, so that means the meat melts in your mouth. Giggity. The toppings are tasty, but only the basic ingredients (lettuce, tomato, onion) are free. You'll have to pay a buck per extra ingredient. With bacon, mushrooms, and other stuff, I almost ended up with a $10 burger without any fries or drink yet. It's worth it though.

They don't get 5 stars from me because for a burger joint, they're really pompous over there. I could probably understand that stupid people ask stupid questions all the time over there, but like everyone else in the service industry, you grit your teeth and look "pleasant" while answering.

Just make sure you give the menu a once-over before you fall in line.
author: Arturo F.

description:
Came for: weekday dinner
Will come back for: reasonably priced non-supersized items

The burgers were flavorful and I liked the portion size.  But the patty was rather greasy  (yes, even for a burger).  The fries were good.  The milkshake tasted like melted soft-serve and rather underwhelming.
Good set-up (order and pick-up food at counter), with plenty of seating, including an upstairs and a bar/counter.
Friendly service.  Variety-filled menu.  Homemade pickles are really good! (pretty fresh and not too vinegar-y or salty.)

Hamburger Mini (4oz) $4.50
Hamburger Mini w/ Cheese (4oz): $5.00
Fries: $2.00
Vanilla Shake: $4.75

The above order for two came out to ~$8.50/person.  Not bad.

Take-Away: A good option, especially when seeking a casual and filling eat around Union Square.
author: Carol K.

description: So, I'm all about this place. It's like a much better five guys without the huge menu of options you don't know how to combine. Plus they have lots of veggie options and items for people not asking "where's the beef?" I got the smaller burger size and added bacon and avocado. It was still pretty big and oh so good. Plus the cashier had a random case of donuts and gave me one for free. Who doesn't want a free donut with their burger???
author: Channa P.

description: Only stopped in for a shake. Delicious. Very crowded even after 9pm on thursday night.
author: Lane S.

description:
Pretty good burger, fries and shake.  It's definitely on the expensive side (not exorbitantly, but you're not getting out of here under $15 if you order what I did).  Very oily too, even if a lot of it is from the fat of the beef.  The patties are cooked well (I don't mean well-done, but enough while still leaving a bit of pink), but I found them to be a bit crumbly.  Not sure if this is due to the rending of all the fat or inadequate patty-shaping.  It's season just under well-enough, but I guess getting everything on it (sans cheese) was good enough for me.

The garlic fries were also oily, like they didn't drain them long enough after coming out of the fryer.  The minced garlic was good, though I'd have preferred it to be mixed throughout rather than dumped in a pile on top.

The shake was probably the star of the show here, even if it's meant to accompany the burger.  It's sort of like that supporting actor/actress who steals the light from the high-paid, overrated star.  Cold and creamy, my (vanilla) shake was hard to beat.

Overall, an okay place to eat.
author: Geoff Y.

description: Maybe it's because I was there at the right time, but I experienced no wait in line and it wasn't hard to find a seat. My burger and garlic fries were tasty and fresh. The food came out fast. The employees seemed nice/professional. The name of the joint is catchy and they are environmentally sound. I really didn't find anything wrong with this place so this spot gets a high rating. I would definitely recommend coming here. I'm surprised there's not more reviews because this is a gem in downtown SF.
author: Marlon T.

description:
My co-worker told me they had chocolate dipped ice cream cones, and I had to come with her right away. I haven't had one since the longest time ever, and it just sounded so good on the rare sunny days in the city.

I liked how they had two sizes -- a kid's size and the regular size. Although the ice cream was "organic", it seemed to still come out of the normal soft serve machine. It was pretty pricey too, considering the ice cream was about $3.50 for the kid's size, and $4.50 for the regular size.

The ice cream itself didn't take any different from any other commercialized ice cream brands. The chocolate was just okay, and actually melted quite fast.

Wouldn't necessarily come here again -- I rather go to Dairy Queen for the same thing but cheaper!
author: Evelyn S.

description: One of the juiciest burgers! Just plain delicious! Not a huge fan of the garlic fries here. However the burgers make up for it ;)
author: Kimia R.

description: Great quality and amazing taste for what you pay! Great lunch spot for those in the financial district. Expect a line, but it moves pretty fast. Great traditional burger, with the option of gourmet toppings and sides. I'm a fan!
author: Bridget B.

description:
I heard about this place from my co-workers and decided to check it out one day at lunch. It was delicious! The meat was unbelievably juicy and tasty. Everything worked well together with the flavor of the meat along with the veggies and the bun.

The price is right, however, the line during lunch can be ridiculous as I have attempted to go to this place again during lunch time.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Ahhhh I love a good burger!

I've been on the hunt for a good burger for... always! This place satisfied my meat and cheese craving better than a lot of places I've been to lately.

I had the half burger with avocados and cheese added and a side of fries. (Also, their milkshake come spiked- if you want some mid-afternoon fun)

The fries were flavorful, a tad salty. Thicker skin than most, so it offered a chewier texture.

The burger. Oh the burger. The buns were toasted- warm to the touch and happily crunching at the pressure of your teeth- went together so well with the melted cheese and thick medium rare patty. Avocados added a subtle richness to the meat, drawing out the flavor of the juices from the leaky hot patty out so well I almost want another one right about now. Adding japapenos adds that extra punch to your burger, woo!

I'm not a fan of pickles, but seeing their jars and jars of free pickles, I caved in and ate a couple.
author: Chia L.

description:
Mmmm, I work down the street from here and my experiences have been pretty good.

Pros: Friendly staff! Smiles everywhere and patient. I mean they yell out your name 20 times if need be! Your malt will be malty but your name WILL get screamed out several times before they let it get warm. :)

Prices! For this area, you can not beat an 8 dollar burger deal with drink and soda. This is for the mini deal, for the larger burger you pay a lil more.

Self serve ketchup and mustard and pickles are a plus!

Plenty of seating including some outdoors.

CONES! OMG! If you need something sweet after devouring their tasty burgers have one! Not cheap but so good looking!

SAVORY burgers! Its all about the food, you know you want a juicy burger otherwise you will go down a lil further to Del Taco right? You WILL get a juicy burger!

Cons: Outdoor seating is SMALL and CRAMPED so be warned! The tables have this sliding effect to them too. I spilled soda on my purse by not even moving. My glass just sorta did a gansta slide... :(

No phone ordering. Come on folks. Can you let us order over the phone? Most of us only have an hour lunch and we would rather eat your tasty meal than wait in line forever. :(
author: Gina H.

description:
#1 Super Duper greasy. #2 If you're going to get dessert, the kid's cone is plenty of soft serve after a burger. I suggest the vanilla chocolate swirl WITHOUT the chocolate dip. #3 French Fries are YUMMY, don't share, get your own order. #4 Don't forget that 8oz equals 1/2 pound (for some reason when the size of the patty is displayed in ounces your brain doesn't register how much meat that really is). Next time I go, I'm getting the 4oz burger.

The first thing we noticed when our burgers arrived was that our buns were drenched in grease and then when we started to eat our hands were dripping with grease. If they can improve on grease draining I'd give another star. Other than the grease, the burger was good. (I used the word 'grease' in every sentence in this paragraph, that's how much there was)

French fries, order them, don't leave your burger lonely.
author: Becca L.

description: Yummy burger and reasonable price. Garlic fries are to die 4.   Worth coming back every time.
author: Ornin H.

description: Chicken sandwich was juicy and fries were perfectly salted! The unlimited homemade pickles were tangy and hit the spot on a warm day! Definitely will be a repeat customer
author: Ryan W.

description: I usually like my burgers medium rare but they didn't ask me how I wanted it. It didn't matter though. The bacon cheeseburger I ordered was juicy and oh so tasty. I also ordered garlic fries. They are ok, but this is being compared to garlic fries from AT&T park. The only downside is the line out of the door. It's well worth the wait getting lunch here if you have time to spare.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Stumbled across this winner on the way back to the hotel. Great way to end our San Fran trip. Sitting upstairs in the loft was fun. The burger was very tasty. You could tell they used high quality ingredients. The lemonade sweetened with brown sugar was an extra little treat. By the way, the garlic fries are a must have!
author: Sven G.

description:
So delicious. The mini burgers are pretty fulfilling on their own. But if you have room you HAVE to try their garlic fries. I don't know what makes it different from other garlic fries, but I almost always get a craving for them. I used to go here on my lunch breaks when I worked downtown. Now, I will willingly make the trip from San Jose to San Francisco just to eat there. Another plus is that everything is organic and the packaging used for their food is eco friendly.

It does get REALLY packed during lunch time. The line is usually out the door, but they are really good with getting the food out quick and having it still be quality made.
author: Gail M.

description:
I am the most un-American, American. I'm not proud of this, but it's just how it goes. I don't really like baseball or basketball. I don't ever really eat hot dogs or hamburgers. I like to have dessert first and main course last. 

I stopped by Super Duper today on the way to work because it's on the way and I was starving. They have great fries and the burgers are excellent! Order yourself a combo and a dipped cone. Eat the cone while you wait for your piece of Americana.  Man, their dip cones are good!  $16.
author: Corey V.

description: OMG! I forgot how great these burgers are and CHEEP!!! It's like the more wholesome, less fast food In n Out. The burgers sauce is phenomenal, the meat is cooked perfectly medium, crunchy and fresh bread, and as many pickles as you can eat! I spent $11 for a cheeseburger and a glass of wine! Deal Deal Deal. delicious, fast, reliable, a must!
author: Kayleen R.

description: Love the food!!! No complaints here but the only thing they need is to have diaper changing tables in their bathroom for people who have infants and toddlers.
author: Emma R.

description: Not bad when one wants to ignore healthy. I got the veggie burger and fries. It was okay. The next time I'm in town and in the mood for fast food, I may go here.
author: Erick W.

description: This was the best Burger I've ever had! I had a fried egg on mine with everything on it. So amazing! Everyone must try. The line was long but so worth the wait and our food was ready pretty fast!
author: Lacey G.

description: It looks like Shake Shack.  Smells like Shake Shack. Feels like Shake Shack (but with free pickles), but wah, it tastes like a grease bomb.  Even the garlic fries are dripping wet.  Where is all the wonderful taste that I can smell in the restaurant but not taste at all in my cheeseburger?
author: Holly B.

description:
The last two shakes I had seemed to be single chocolate.  Shortly thereafter, I had chocolate shakes from The Melt and from Ice Cream Bar, which were both much more chocolatey, esp. Ice Cream Bar's. Or perhaps Super Duper's double chocolate is having the same problem as double-roll toilet paper (less paper/less chocolate).  

It was definitely chocolate, I expect something called Double Chocolate (and having a premium price over just plain chocolate) to be really, really chocolatey.

They did have the chips, so I don't think it was a mistaken order, just not that chocolatey.

(Full disclosure: This was from several months ago and I just realized that I never replaced my previous review of the other Market Street location with this one.)
author: Charles B.

description:
It seems like a lot of restaurateurs these days believe that buying Niman Ranch beef is some kind of magic get-out-of-jail-free card that frees them of all further flavor-related responsibility and Super Duper is no exception. While their food is leaps and bounds above your average McDLT, that's arguably not a particularly lofty aspiration. 

Super Duper's beef is lean, and as such, flavorless--serving more as a delivery agent for sauce and cheese than anything else. They charged me a dollar for avocado, and that dollar got me less than a tablespoon's worth smeared over a quarter of my bun. 

The fries are just flat out unbelievably bad, though I do have to commend their cooks on finding a way to make thinly cut potatoes come out from under the heat lamps at once both limp AND crunchily raw in the middle.

A little bit of salt and pepper might have had me back again someday, but if they're not going to put any effort into this at all, I'd just assume go to Mel's or some other nightmare place with fewer pretentious startup dorks  talking about Mongo shards and typography.
author: Nicholas J.

description: Simply delicious! How about a round of applause, standing ovation? Lol, but the burgers here are medium well and super juicy. Good food, good service, and reasonable prices. I love this place so much that I took my mom here for lunch one day, knowing she is somewhat of a picky eater, and she LOVED the burger as well. Very happy!
author: Ms. Good K.

description:
Loooved this place! Not just burgers evidently. I got the chicken sandwich 
with chipotle aiol, and it was amazing. All the veggies were fresh and it dripped with delicious. The food was fast and the staff was friendly. I have only visited this location  so i hope they are all this great.
author: Courtney H.

description: Always go for their shakes & Ice cream! Burgers are great, too.
author: Jamie K.

description: Best burgers ever! Must try their garlic fries and their homemade pickles.
author: Cindy L.

description: I'm vegan & was disappointed (& slightly confused) when they told me the buns are not vegan. Why offer a vegan veggie burger if you can't have the bun? It seems like such an easy fix, too. So I settled for a veggie burger wrapped in lettuce & a side of fries. Everything was great! I've been back since with the same great experience. The servers are usually pretty friendly, and were very helpful when I asked about vegan options. Even when the line is super long they move quickly. I went in once during the lunch rush with a line out the door. I was in & out with my food within 15 minutes. & a server even came up & down the line to hand out little servings of fries. The ice cream looks amazing, too. I really wish they would offer a vegan bun, though, especially when they have such a big vegan community surrounding them.
author: Jess H.

description: I was recommended to go there by many local foodies and although i am not a big bar food fan, i can't resist once in a while for a great burger. I guess super duper stands in between your burger chain like InNout and your upscale gourmet burger place. Not a lot of burger options, it is either simple or double patties and don't forget to add the cheese!!! Steak is great and all toppings are fresh. Overall taste is similar to in n out to me. I highly recommend their garlic fries and go with the 3 dips sauces to go with that. The good part is that it is still cheap while being much better than your basic fast food chain. Great, cheap, fast burger option in SF!!!
author: Arnaud S.

description: I went to this burger joint a couple weeks ago and had a very good experience. At the counter I was given a recommendation and a small back story of the company and I went with it. As I had been told the food was amazing! I loved the pickles especially. It gave the place a I'm at Grandmas house kinda feel...Ya know, while being in a very busy burger joint in downtown San Francisco!
author: Rachel A.

description: Pretty solid burger joint. Their veggie burger is really tasty, and their chicken sandwich is ok. Waited 20 minutes though this last time for the one chicken sandwich and fries and it wasn't as busy as it normally is.
author: Chelsea D.

description: I've warmed to this place since my initial review. Still not a 5-star joint... but the burgers are solid. Plus they gots pickleses.
author: Michael D.

description:
Burger was decent, but not the best I've had.  The patty was dry and overcooked, and the bun was a basic toasted white roll.  Would have preferred my patty a little less cooked and a bun with some more chew and flavor.  The veggies in the burger were all tasty and fresh.

We shared some fries with dipping sauces.  No complaints there--fries were crispy and perfectly salted.  My favorite was the chipotle mayo--not too spicy and had a very satisfying flavor.  Also had a small chocolate dipped soft serve cone that was amazing.  I caught several envious glances while I strolled back down Market.

But at the end, it's all about the burger, and I've had better.  I did come at an odd time (around 4 PM) and the staff seemed to still be working out their kinks, so maybe it'll be better next time.  Still leagues behind my all-time fave, Pearl's Deluxe, which is also moving into the SoMa/Market area.  Gotta step it up, Super Duper!
author: Matt Y.

description: Best Burger I ate during my entire stay in the US. Also loved the garlic-cheese fries!
author: Hannah M.

description:
Had a nice, fresh burger with grilled onions, portobello mushrooms and jack cheese (the winning combination--try it), and finally tried the pecan pie (it was practically like candy). Hurrah for consistency!

I think I like the OG location slightly better (I'm a fan of their graphic design and there's more of it to look at there), although this one is closer to Bart (and work, unfortunately).
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Yum! 

I like their bleu cheese burger, very nom a lishious! My favorite is their portebello burger which is deep fried and everything taste 100x better deep fried!

Their choco dipped frosties are a nice treat in the summertime :)
author: Amy S.

description: Ah yes,  this place is popping like nobody's business but seriously for a beginner in the land of 'Super Duper'  the burgers are gahrate (means great :)! ).  So many items so little time.  As I par-oozed their menu I spotted the offering of a combo,  but being the first Super Duper I've had the chance to try,  I had to play twenty questions with the one that took my order.  So to who took my order,  you are a trooper!  An honorable mention has to be the mushrooms in my double! Ummy Yummy drop on in!
author: Joy R.

description: Came here for lunch and got a super combo. Burger was pretty good, the patties were cooked medium-well, it was just about right. Garlic fries were pretty good too. I highly recommend this place if you're in the area.
author: Cesar N.

description:
I came to Super Duper during my lunch break. I was drawn by the massive crowd of people and super long line, so I ended up waiting ~15 minutes in line, and ~15 minutes for my order. The place is constantly packed.

Was it worth the wait? Kinda. I had a mini burger (4 oz patty) combo with fries and a fountain drink for 8 dollars. It was a very delicious burger and had fresh ingredients (they don't make it till you order it! so waiting 15 minutes is actually not bad) I wouldn't say it was so good that I would come back everyday and wait 30+ minutes though. I was contently full, though I wish they had a medium 6 oz burger. Fries are average.

Service was pretty good; nothing to complain about. The cooks have it pretty rough; you can watch them making your patties and they almost never get a break from all the orders.

WILL I come again: yes, though I still prefer In-n-Out because of the price and the wait
WHEN will I come again: When I have a longer lunch break
WHAT will I do differently: Order a milkshake; the cookies and creme one looked good. and I might upgrade to an 8oz burger because the Super Duper combo is only 2 dollars more. And also because I sometimes eat like a man.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: Oh I am a big fan of Super Duper Burgers. Their burgers are awesome, and I love their mini burgers and chicken sandwich as well. Fries are awesome as well, my friend had a milkshake with his burger, and he loved it. haha. I always try to eat here in SF
author: Prateek G.

description: Super salad was terrible, mushy, over priced, all bad. Super burger was good.  Customer service was great, very friendly, fast. Inexpensive, would go back for a quick cheap burger but salad sucks hobo balls.
author: Brian R.

description:
Super Duper amazing!!! I was in SF for a couple of days and ended up having these burgers three times while there. Juicy, filling, and amazing. The chocolate ice cream was a great dessert option, light which I prefer to other creamy options.

Would definitely go on my next visit.
author: K C.

description: Love the veggie burger .. Very tasty and worth trying !! 4 stars coz the  burger is very small for almost 8 bucks..
author: Nim T.

description: I had never eaten here, and I can honestly say that this was the best burger I have had in California in over 25 years. I had grilled onions and the egg added and it was cooked to perfection. They served it open faced with the egg on top and it was also perfect, white completely set and yolk runny. I also highly recommend their pickles. I added the garlic fries and they were also a home run. The only disappointment was my fault (I ordered a fountain drink and should have ordered the tea). Great place to go.
author: William T.

description: We enjoyed the food and the relatively clean environment if the resto. The staff were friendly and helpful. The garlic fries are delish - but fir the price that you oay for them, the serving should be increased to make it worth the money. The chicken burger features grilled chicken breast on ciabatta bun - and every bite was worth it!
author: Concepts E.

description: Nice space. Good options. Wish they had a better condiment selection. That'll make or break you. Sat at the counter an a totally nice dude gave me a nice sample of a choco-milkshake.
author: Andrew K.

description: Awesome burgers! Awesome milkshakes! Super Duper crowded, but for good reason, the food is outstanding.
author: Justin G.

description:
Solid meal, but kind of out of place. I love the reusable glasses, composting, and dyson hand dryers, but actually, a big jar of pickles out for the taking is not what I want in that stretch of market. Also, the pickles themselves are way too vinegary. 

It's not a good sign that the aesthetic comes first, both in this review and, seemingly, at the restaurant. It's a fairly stylish place, but the food is merely fine. It's amazing how as soon as your options are 4 or 8 oz, 6 oz seems like it'd be the perfect size. I'm not crazy about two patties instead of one larger one - it is definitely a skinny patty place, and more like fast food. The feeling of really sinking your teeth into the burger is lost, and, I think, the feature of having a cooked, charred on the outside, juicy on the inside patty. I DO love all the toppings, especially all the free ones (always good to have jalepenos as an easy option!). I didn't love that, despite going over my order a few times, I managed to get red onions instead of grilled onions. But I will give them that the fries are quite good - for skinny, fast food fries. They're about as good as a good batch of McDonald's, so take that as you will.
author: Lisa K.

description: Absolutely delicious, and the staff are very light-hearted and fun too.
author: Doug G.

description:
Not the best place to go for lunch cause it definitely gets busy. As in, when we were leaving at 12:45, the line was out the door. Not to mention it takes at least 10 minutes after ordering to get your food.

Now I understand the whole health craze, and the good beef and free range chicken, but honestly, the burgers were that special. My chicken burger was kinda bland. Same goes for D's Super Burger (2 patties), though no one was deny it was juicy. The garlic fries weren't bad, but there wasn't much garlic. I think they might just be fries with cheese powder on top, but that's just me.

I might go back and give it another go. But to try the shakes. Those looked super yummy!
author: Jessica H.

description: One of the best things ever when you're drunk and really hungry. Unfortunately I can't remember exactly what was good, but I knew everything I had was really good, especially the fries!
author: Jenny N.

description: Wow! Awesome burger.  Tastes fresh, rich and just a great old fashioned burger.  Fries also tasted fresh not frozen and definitely not greasy, which tells us that food doesn't have to be greasy and unhealthy to be great! Way to go! Definitely super duper taste!
author: Al C.

description: Good food and fast casual dining.  I go for the burger, fries and thick milk shakes.
author: Jennifer H.

description: So I was waiting for my order and I thought.....why is the floor up here so greasy?  Don't they mop the floor? Then we got our food.......WOW super greasy! Super delicious!  Super Duper! People with heart issues BEWARE! I RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.
author: Len B.

description: Thank God we don't have this place in Boston because it is super duper delicious and I would be super duper fat.  I had the organic veggie burger which was just the right amount of crispy on the outside.  The burger came with hummus and cucumber- I added jack cheese and avocado and recommend that you do too!  I also shared an order of the garlic fries which were amazing and came with crumbled cheddar, and I rounded out my fat-kid meal with a black and white malt milkshake.  Staff were friendly and efficient, food came out fast, and I left satisfied and with a full belly.  See you on my next visit to SF, SDB!
author: Amanda S.

description:
The burger and fries are delicious but nothing too special about them... I had the mini burger and garlic fries and got pretty full. I liked the fact that they put the pickles in a jar on the side so you can get as much pickles as your heart desires. 

However, finding a seat was relatively difficult since it was a little small and not ideal for big groups.
author: Kristian W.

description:
Super Duper is a good little burger.  Definitely not the best burger you can find, but really this place is competing with fast-food type burger, not burger-joint type burgers.  The quality is roughly equivalent in In-N-Out, maybe a bit better.  Very juicy and not over-cooked with good quality meat.

The sides do not live up to the burger.  Similar to In-N-Out, the fries are disappointing.  The shakes are kinda meh.  The prices are a bit steep.  

One big thing it has going for it is that for some unknown reason, it is definitely the best burger within a solid half-mile of its location, which also happens to be only a block from where I work.  This has made it a god-send for satisfying work-hour burger craving, and probably more than a little dangerous.
author: Lenza M.

description: Before going to the movie theater, my wife and I were looking for a quick place to eat. We were at the Metreon and next to it we found Super Duper Burgers. It was just what we needed, a quick bite to eat at a casual restaurant. We ordered 2 "super burgers with cheese" and shared an order of garlic fries. I was pleasantly surprised; the burger was so juicy that it melted in my mouth and the garlic fries were to die for. As I kept eating the burger, I kept looking at my wife wondering why we haven't tried this place before. I can't wait to go back there and next time I will try the chicken sandwich that everyone is talking about here. I definitely recommend this place for burger lovers, you won't be disappointed.
author: John L.

description:
So two stars based on Yelp says, "Meh. I've experienced better." Well sorry to say but Super Duper was super duper disappointing. Burger Joint and Buster's in North Beach are way better and cheaper. 

So a double cheeseburger at Super Duper is only two 1/4 pound patties put together like a double quarter pounder at McDonalds. I asked for mayonnaise and got their secret sauce instead. Once again, like McDonalds. 

They did have a good Cookie & Creams shake. It could have been a bit thicker.

Would I recommend this place, I fear not. I've been to far too many other burger joints that'sbetter than here. I have burger standards and Super Duper doesn't meet them.
author: William M.

description:
The burgers and fries here are still very good.

Unfortunately, these people have absolutely no clue how to handle the lunch rush. They need a much, much better system. 

Go anytime between 11:30AM and 1PM and you can pretty well expect them to screw up your order.

A real shame because the food quality is still good.

Go for a very early or very late lunch. Avoid at rush hour.
author: A P.

description:
Top three things I can say about Super Duper: 
1) The fries are competitive with some of the best I have ever had. 
2) Do not get a chicken burger in a burger place. You will be sad you made the wrong decision, and kick yourself for how obvious your wrong decision was. 
3) skip the shake, go right for the beer.

I went with two other strapping young men, both of whom got (double) "Super" burgers--it delights me to no end that a standard 1 patty is called a "mini"--and they were mumbling something about OHMmmmmMMMMm-dis-es-dah-besht-buhgrhr-evahhrr through their stuffed mouthes. I stole a few bites of a burger, it was brilliant.

The chicken burger with chipotle aoili was just eh. It wasn't awesome, it wasn't horrible. I think I was sad that my chicken patty was so thin when the boys were mocking me with their double-layer meat patties. Maybe I have meat-envy. Mine just didn't stack up.

The moment of bliss though, was when we realized our fries were done in different batches. One person had slightly more done fries than the other- we kept switching back and forth to see which one won. They both did- just different races.

The shake, however, little disappointing. I got the chocolate strawberry shake & it tasted... not fake... just forced? Is that a possible description. The taste wasn't right & the strawberries, if they were fresh, were pureed so finely that they were non-existant. There was no tell-tale sign to let me know fresh fruit was once there. The shake was pretty runny as well, not at all what I like my shakes to look/taste/feel like.

I'd absolutely go back & get the burger next time. I'd scrap the shake for a beer & I'd order a few satchels full of fries.
author: Tawnee K.

description: I went in very excited to try this place and finally taste what everyone has said was a really good burger. I ordered a mini combo and asked for a well done burger. The place isnt really all that cheap and the lines can be long and the wait for the food is kind of long. But I know if the food is good it can take some time i wasnt worried about the wait. Well when the food finally came and I bit into it, it was very pink. My friend who was with me ordered the same thing and hers was pink as well. Now I dont like making a big deal but I just didnt want to eat it like that especially if I paid what I did for it. I went back and explained to the man that I ordered it well done he apologized and said he would fix it. I will say they were very nice but they just couldnt get my order right, when he brought it a second time and I bit into it again it looked like they left it on the grill less time than last time. It was very disappointing.
author: Susie M.

description: I eat there all the time they have the five star service I always recommend my friends to eat there and the price is really wroth it
author: Joseph S.

description:
The cookies and cream shake is delicious, though it varies depending on who is making it. The first time I had the shake it was delicious and great, but the second time it was a bit less creamy and more liquidy. They make the shake out of the ingredients right there so be careful about your consistency here.

The super duper burger is not bad for $4, the ingredients aren't as good as other burger joints bug the patty and bread are top notch and it's significantly cheaper than other places I've been to. 

An excellent place in the neighborhood. 

The line is scary but it's quick.
author: Rohan D.

description: Just went to this place for the first time on Saturday with my daughter and absolutely loved it.  The burger was delicious but what really stood out was the crew, very helpful.  Their team is so San Francisco, diverse and friendly.  I was there around 5 PM and placed my order with a young Filipina.  She had a great smile and was happy to serve us.  Also enjoyed our experience with John, a tall gentleman that appeared to be the manager, who helped us when we ordered a milk shake as dessert.  He, like the young lady, were both outstanding.  Looking forward to our next visit there.
author: Tommy L.

description:
It's sadly amazing to see how new burger joints attract such ecstatic reviews in the official media and elsewhere.  Especially when the most adult of restaurants now often have burgers on the menu (and pizza and mac n cheese), but they do.

Fortunately, this is a burger joint that delivers.  This south side of Market location gets light only from the front, but makes little effort to deal with the deficit by using bright colors, or even bright lights---the space gets taller towards the rear, which is where orders are placed and cooked, and where a loft rises over the main floor.  It's very plain, open beam (and fire foam) construction with modernist furnishings and a simple chalkboard menu high on the rear wall.   There is some variety in the offerings, but not the number of different sizes when it comes to the burgers.  Chicken is also available, cheeses for the burgers though are limited, no swiss for example.  Brand name beef.  Pickles are home-style, in canning type jars.

And so, I can finally get to the burgers which are really quite some of the best I've had.  Nice burger flavor, no cutsey spice combinations butting in, and a solid sesame bun that more or less held its shape, and the burger, which tended to slide out the opposite side with each bite.   I had the jack and the partner had bleu cheese.  I felt that the bleu cheese here produced something of a petroleum flavor, but the jack more nicely complimented the meat.

I also had the soft serve, I love soft serve ice cream almost everywhere, except for the ice-milk versions at the big hamburger chains.   This soft serve seems to have real cream in it---and real chocolate as the flavors were rich and well developed, not merely a suggestion aided by coloration.   I'd make regular pilgrimages here just for the soft serve.


This place is a winner.   Good tasting, well made burgers;  fantastic soft serve ice cream, and a fresh, comfortable and modernist interior perfectly suitable for its high-urban setting.
author: Paul T.

description: Had the chicken sandwich with chipotle mayo and bacon, it was awesome. Although I went right after How Weird Street Faire and they were sold out of meat burgers AND veggie burgers!
author: Toni M.

description: Great burgers and fries and soft serves. Mmmmm! Go here instead of McDonald's.
author: Tracy Y.

description: My friend took me here to eat one time. We had burgers and garlic fries. I really liked their garlic fries, it's so good.
author: Serena Z.

description: I do love burgers. And this place has great burger but they are a little too casual for me. I'm a fan of going up to a counter, ordering, and then grabbing a seat to chow down for a burger BUT I am more of a fan of enjoying that burger with a beer at a restaurant. Great burgers, clean location, quick service. Everything was tasty.
author: Shanna T.

description: Really liked this place.  Perfect portion choices.  Burger was juicy.  Fries were excellent. Self serve pickles- yum.  Lemon for your drink- bonus.  Wish I had room for the organic soft-serve ice cream.  Oh well, next time.
author: Annie Y.

description: Super delicious burger! The burger is a bit on the smaller side if you're famished. I wasn't too impressed with the milkshake.
author: Olivia P.

description:
I am conservatively ranking this 4 stars. I want to give it 5, but it was a post-bar burger experience, so the beer may be affecting my rating (hard to say)

The burger was excellent. Probably one of the best I've had in the city. They've got beer on draught! Little bit pricey, but worth the $$
author: Aaron N.

description: Love Super Duper! It's amazing how many burger joints we have in the city now. I recommend the combo, garlic fries, shakes, and soft serve cones. All delicious and worth the wait.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Wow - after working within a one-block radius of at least two Super Duper locations for nearly a year, I finally made my long-awaited trip here earlier this week.  I got the cheeseburger with everything on it and it was incredible!  Sure, it was probably a little bit greasy (the only consistent compliant I hear about this place), but boy was it delicious.  I'll have to do a side-by-side with In N Out sometime to see if we have a new reigning best fast food burger champion.  I also got the garlic fries - they were okay.  Will definitely be back at some point soon!
author: Brian D.

description: My new default lunch place! Killer food and super friendly staff. I have tried the burgers and the fries, but I am actually addicted to the chicken sandwich on the ciabatta roll. It rocks, especially with jalapenos. I have even tried the salad - it was good, but a little small. I don't think many people order the salad at a burger joint.
author: James L.

description:
Homemade donuts are TO DIE FOR.  Staff is super friendly.  
A++ Would happily gain weight here again.
author: Keds S.

description:
Had lunch here this week after wanting to try it for a while. it was crowded so we had to wait in line but the service was smart and efficient: they handed us menus in line and the orders proceeded quickly. The staff at the casher also took a minute to ask about our day. 
There is luckily more seating than you can see from outside, so that is a perk. The food was good, I had the garlic fries and my opinion is that the taste was too strong. I felt like I could keep vampires away all day! Still, I enjoyed them - but not as much as the soft-serve! It was the best, so creamy and tasty. 
My friend had one of their mini-burgers, which are actually decent-sized, and said that all the ingredients tasted fresh! It is uncommon to find fast food places that actually serve fresh-tasting food, so that was a plus.
The service, as I said, was great: the staff also came upstairs to check the tables and ask if everything was alright. It really impressed me that they took the time even though the place was busy but they made it work!
author: Dodi G.

description: I've been here about 4 times over the past 6 months.  It has a nice vibe, but it's a little bit of a trek from my office and tough to squeeze for my lunch hour.  I don't mind though because it's a pretty solid burger....probably one the best downtown burgers (if not the best).  The fries are okay...nothing memorable.  The soft serve is pretty good, but hard to eat when coated with chocolate.  Maybe that's the point.  Sometimes messy is a good thing!!
author: Alvin J.

description: Great burgers as well as chicken sandwiches.  The Mission Street location around the corner always seems to be less crowded. Comparable to something like TrueBurger out of Oakland.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Super Duper is San Francisco's answer to greasy 50's burger and shake joints. Everything screams organic and handmade. No, really their soft-serve is organic and they make their pickles in-house. 

The soft-serve is the best I ever had, I know I will be fighting a daily mental battle with myself not to get a cone on my walk back from work everyday. I also tried their Portabello Sandwich. It was good, but not what I expected which is my fault because I should have asked what it's like.  It turned-out to be deep fried and I though it would be light and refreshing. 

This place is worth a try for the soft-serve alone. Another big plus, it's extremely reasonable priced for a restaurant in the FiDi.
author: Aleksandra B.

description: Great burger joint!  Get as many napkins as you can before sitting down.  You're gonna need em!  The pickles in the condiments counter are tasty, definitely try some!  Over all this is one great burger joint to try if you love burgers.
author: Eddie G.

description: Visiting a friend in San Francisco, she suggested super duper for lunch. I will never turn down a great burger. I ordered a super burger combo with grilled onions and garlic fries. My gf had a mini with avocado and a Oreo shake spiked. You could tell the burger was handmade and was good, next time I will probably add more of their sauce cause it was a little dry. The garlic fries were very good. The spiked shake was actually really strong and kind of killed e flavor of the shake, but I guess that's what you want when you ask for it spiked. Overall, a great experience with good burgers. Still can't beat In N Out in my opinion though.
author: Jason M.

description: Quite possibly the best burger I have had in my life. Well worth the $12 price point for the double combo with bacon and cheese. Fries are OKAY. Nothing major, but okay. I definitely had a dream about this place the night that I tried it. I'm gonna get fat here, guaranteed.
author: Trav M.

description: Wow! The best morning Donuts!!! LOVE THEM
author: Khadeejah S.

description: Had the super burger. Yummy. Toasted bun, two nice size patties, everything, including grilled onions and all the other toppings "everything". Really enjoyed the pickles that you can add yourself by the drinks. Ordered both the garlic w/ cheese fries and the plain fries. While the first bite of garlic w/ cheese fries were interesting, I would recommend sticking with the plain fries. The garlic and cheese were overpowering, and just too much w/ the burger. Overall, pleasant experience. Wait time for burgers was surprisingly longer than expected - but maybe that's a good thing and signals the food is fresh. :)
author: Wendy L.

description: I haven't been to this place except the Yelp event but that was awesome.  The burgers were amazing and unique.  The alcoholic shakes were tasty.  They really aren't that thick but I'm fine with that.  I don't like it when shakes are too thick to suck through a straw.  The fries were just ok.  The owner and wait staff was super nice too - although it was obviously not a typical night.  Definitely planning on going back to see how the food/service are now that the restaurant has actually opened.
author: barbara b.

description: My expectations were too high I think.  It is a decent burger, but I enjoyed the homemade pickles more.  Service was good, but there are much better burgers out there.
author: April M.

description: While visiting SF last week I stopped into Super Duper and grabbed a burger to go.  The burger was well made and delicious. I opted for the garlic fries which were some of the better garlic fries I have tried.  Personally I prefer tons of burger topping options and this place was pretty basic.  Still if I was craving a great burger I would stop in again.
author: Cori R.

description:
Disclaimer: I'm vegetarian, so I haven't tried all the non-vegetarian burgers. 

Can't say about the value, since I was lucky enough to be able to hit up the Yelp Elite event last night and got to try everything for free. However, there was lots about this place that will have me coming back. 

Their spiked cookies and cream milkshake shot was delicious and I haven't tasted anything like it! It even had tasty cookie crumbs at the bottom. Thumbs up for originality. 

The french fries were a delicious start to the snacking-- not too oily, the perfect amount of crisp and the perfect amount of salt. Definitely the best french fries I have tried in the city. For the garlic lovers out there, there are equally if not more delicious garlic fries too! For the vegetarian's out there--the Super Duper fries are cooked in canola oil. 

Then I tried the portobello burger. It had great texture, the portobello was juicy on the inside and crispy on the oustide. The toppings were in good proportion and overall the burger was great. (although my friend came to the correct conclusion that their buns could be a little tastier) 

Lastly, we tried the sundaes and ice cream cones. Their small ice cream cones are excellent--it isn't too much ice cream and a perfect proportion of sugar cone to ice cream. But the best part about the ice cream cone was the chocolate shell on top. So delicious!! 

Also the ambiance was good and the live music was a great addition rarely found in burger joints. Not sure if the live music is an everyday thing at Super Duper, but if it is I'll have another reason to keep going! 

Overall a great experience--thank you yelp, for the yelp elite event. I highly recommend this place to someone looking for a good burger joint for meat eaters and vegetarians alike.
author: Neeharika B.

description:
Heard so many things about this palce and it lived up to the hype. I got the Super Burger which is 2 8oz patties abd there's nothing worse than dry burgersbut this one was so juicey. The frys are nothing great but if you're gonna get a drink adding the combo is worth it. for the heavy soda drinkers the refill station is on our side of the counter. also I got the chocolate and fresh strawberries for around $5. It tasted some good and its not overly sweet. 
There is a small area for outdoor seating but I'd save that for people who think their too cool and don't know about Downtown homeless
author: Antonio C.

description: Best burger ever? I put in in the top 25 percent, In and Out and 5 Guys are just as good in terms of the flavor of the product. I think letting the association with organic and Niman Ranch  influence your ratings are like appreciating a wine based on its label,  it is still about taste.  To me organic beef is a bit of an oxymoron if you really are concerned about what you are putting in your body. As to the wait,I think they take as long as any other make to order burger joint.  All that said, as an out of towner it was a great place to have a good burger and a  leisurely outdoor lunch while enjoying the weather and people watching.
author: Gregg S.

description: Found the burgers just alright.  Meat was a bit tough/chewy (low quality?). Can't compare with In and Out nor Five Guys.  The burgers aren't "juicy", they're greasy as in thick greasy.
author: Steve Z.

description: Homemade pickles and juicy, delicious burgers with plenty of options makes this a great place for good food.  The Garlic Fries are perfect, the Super Burger I ordered was perfect even if greasy, and I left here very happy.  I've never heard of Super Duper Burgers before, but the name definitely fits.
author: Eric L.

description:
Best burger option for the downtown shopping area. Really similar to In-n-
out in size but a bit pricier.  Garlic fries are tasty!  Skip the dipping sauces.  As for the ice cream...chocolate dipped Straus is something you the pass the extra patty for!
author: MTBer I.

description: We were debating between a burger and Chipotle, and the burger won. I was my first time coming here, and I am always a bit leery trying a new place out when I'm hungry. We each ordered burgers, milkshakes, and fries to go. I snagged some homemade pickles everyone raves about. We get to the hotel room and dig in...oh.my.deliciousness. The burger had an amazing taste, the fries were delicious, and the milkshakes were so tasty. At first, I did not like the pickles, but I kept playing the "let me try one more" game, and I was won over. Thinking about giving this place a try? Do it!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
They just opened a week ago but they are SLOW! We had 2 people ahead of us and still had to wait about 10-15 min to order. It shouldn't take 5+ min to take one person's order. The guy waiting behind us left. 

Food is good but speed and service need to increase ASAP! During the 20 minutes we were eating, we saw about 5-8 more people leave because the lines were too slow.
author: Jane M.

description: A burger joint that sounds like a superhero. Actually, it kind of is.
author: Jen Y.

description:
Legit burger and tasty garlic fries.  Prices are slightly on the expensive side if you want to add some toppings to your burger, but not ridiculous.

Will return soon for a lunch-time burger craving.
author: Mike B.

description: This place will rock your burger-loving world. Fast service that doesn't compromise quality. These burgers are insanely delicious. Beer on tap only makes this place better.
author: Lee C.

description: This was the first place I ate at when arriving to SF and boy I'm glad I stopped by. The meat was so flavorful and cooked just right. My first bite made me want to order another burger:) ordered garlic fries as well and they were well prepared as well not to much garlic. Hope they open a location down in LA!!!!!!!
author: Miguel G.

description: One of the best (reasonably priced) burger in SF. The burger has a few options - I chose the more standard toppings to really evaluate the burgers essentials - bun and patties. But you can get portabella mushroom, eggs, guacamole, etc to your specifications. The burger is cooked perfectly, juicy and tasty. It's a good size, not too small and not overwhelming. Recommend the side of garlic fries and milkshake. Two locations within one block of each other - try the one on mission if its too busy on market.
author: Daniel K.

description:
Long lines, warm shakes and skimpy amount of fries. Cheaper than other burger joints in the area, yes.Good burger, yes. 

No i was not impressed, but I was happy to have a good burger.
author: Angela V.

description: Hooked! Burgers are excellent!! Flavor packed! Crack
author: Fred V.

description: Great burger, fries and milk shake!! Prices are decent it's like almost a high end in n out burger!!
author: RICHARD W.

description: Went to the Market Street location for their vanilla chocolate dipped ice cream cone. Not sure why it is even on the menu because each time they say that it's "too soft, and won't stick to the ice cream." This happened to me three times in a row.
author: Maria G.

description: The malt shakes were delicious. My burger was overcooked and dry. Excellent customer service. Can be a bit loud w/ the music.
author: Wanlan X.

description:
-__________________-

The moment I walk in this door, I put on my huge pig face on.  This place is what a great burger should taste like.  The only place that has a better one is a greasy ass place called the Longhorn Cafe in Texas.  

The ratio here is perfect for the 1/4.  And the beef is high quality Niman Ranch shit!

I must gripe as I did about Pearls.... wtf is up with the damn $5 shakes.  I mean its a freaking shake.  Paying $5 is an atrocity.  At least to their defense they proudly use Strauss milk, some high quality shit.... but still $5?  C'mon... that's robbery!

The homemade pickles here are great, they're like cucumbers and not as tart as the Vlasics in the jar.

The sauces for the fries here.... while a TOTAL rip off to pay extra for, are extra really really good.  The homemade mayo is hands down fav.  Give it a try if you want your money stolen.

I absolutely love this place.
author: Adrian E.

description: I wouldn't change a thing! This burger was juicy, messy, and filled me up:) plus they make their own pickles!
author: Monique Q.

description: I'm really disappointed with this location. Maybe I really should've combed thru each of my burgers? I had trust in the employees since the cashier repeated my order back to me 3 times to make sure. I ordered 2 super burgers medium well both with bacon & dressed with everything. I asked for one with roasted portobello & raw onions & the other with grilled onions. I paid extra for the bacon & portobello. I also got regular fries & garlic fries. So I get my number & buzzer. 2 mins later it buzzes. I wasn't even done filling my drink cup. Usually I have to wait at least 5 or 10 mins. I go to the pick up bar & the guy asks for number & hands a bag that was thrown together & over flowing. He then walks away I had to ask another person for a bigger bag.   An hour later, I finally get home after commuting with disgruntled Giants fans. I opened my bags. Garlic fries clumped together, regular fries sunk to the bottom of its bag and soggy. To be expected. Then the burgers, I got 2 identical over cooked bacon burgers with no dressing, no portobello or grilled onions. Not even their own sauce.  Took a bite ,it was so dry that ketchup can't even salvage. So disappointed! I just paid $25 for inedible meal. I was too tired to trek back downtown to complain. . I should've just gone to Burger house where $7 gets you a decent size bacon cheese burger with fresh dressings not $10 for a tiny burger with one strip of bacon & no dressing. What a rip off! Never again!
author: Lorly L.

description: Came here for lunch and tried their mini burger.  It was delicious!  Would definitely come back if I were in the area.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The burgers here are so good. I think it is kinda pricey. $8.50 for a burger and fries and a drink. Plus if you want cheese +$1 and bacon $1.50 (or something like that). It easily reaches about $25 for two people. I get the smaller burger and my fiancee the one with double meat. Oh and if you want dips for your fries (not just ketchup) an extra $1. Kinda pricey, but still really good. And I have only been there twice, but each time they have messed up our order. Also, sitting is pretty limited.
author: Lisa L.

description: I'm not certain why this place is rated so highly.  My burger was incredibly greasy, despite allegedly being made from high quality beef.  My guess is that, while they use Niman Ranch beef, the actual lean rating is pretty low.  If you like a good ol' greasy burger, you will probably like this place... I won't judge you. ;)
author: Michael M.

description: My past experiences at Super Duper have been amazing. However they have since taken away my favorite Portobello Sandwich!! I am very upset over this. I have no more reasons to come here except for maybe their homemade pickles.
author: Jeffrey C.

description: I was expecting something very good based on other reviews so I went there for a quick dinner and I have been quite disappointed. I had a double patty burger with cheese and the burger was terribly greasy (some call it juicy, I wouldn't call it like that). In addition, the burger was generally taste-less. The cheese was pretty mediocre. To me, this is in no way better that Five Guys and the price tag is quite higher. For that price, I would definitely but a couple of extra bucks and have an average burger in a pub.
author: Mounir L.

description: got a mini w/ cheese/bacon/everything. burger patty was flavorful and cooked right. i thought the pickles were okay. the garlic fries were extremely delicious!
author: Brian N.

description:
I wish I could give it like 4.5 stars.  My only complaint is my bun was just shy of being stale.  I worked in a bakery and the bun did not taste fresh.  it was on the chewy side.   The fires just like in and out burger.   The Burger itself was AWESOME.  Juicy and flavorful!  (gotta get grilled onions next time too...)

 I can't wait to go back and try one of every thing else!   

If you go to one of the big chains and spend the same ca$h on pre-fab-manu-mystery meat instead of going to Super Duper, I pity you and you future bowel movements.
author: Matthew K.

description: I have ADHD, so I am all over the place all the time. I ran into a sign at this place which I didn't care, but apparently the workers behind the counter including the manager started hysterically laughing . Come on, you make burgers, I should be laughing at you.
author: Ruslan F.

description: I was frustrated that when I ordered garlic fries- they came to me with cheese on top- I'm vegan- nowhere on the menu did it say there was cheese on the fries. When I asked if I could get the garlic fries without cheese- they told me there was dairy in the garlic topping. Disappointing. I realize this isn't the most veggie friendly option- but if something has dairy- it should be clearly marked on the menu- lots of people have allergies
author: Sky B.

description: The super duper burger was so delicious + juicy! The garlic fries with 3 sauces is to die for. The cashier was nice and we got our food fairly quick. The tables were practically full when we got there but cleared up when we finished ordering. I would definitely want to come back here.
author: Christina V.

description:
i was in the area and wanted to check this place out for lunch so my friend met me there..

there was line bc of all the lunch break rush.. the line didn't take long and they gave out some fries to everyone waiting in line. i ordered the mini burger with everything on it.. i'm glad i got the mini, it was basically the size of a reg burger so it was more than enough for me. i had the garlic fries and spiked malt cookies and cream shake.. the garlic fries were oh so yummy and super garlic-y just like the ones at the ballpark.. and to my surprise the shake was good too! who doesn't love to start drinking in the afternoon?! 

i wouldn't come back for the burgers, there wasn't anything special about them.. but i would come back for the garlic fries and try a diff shake..
author: Raquel T.

description:
I walk by here everyday to and from my health club. OK, wishful thinking that I work out that much. So every couple of days. OK once a week.

Anyway. this place rocks! Organic 100% grass fed beef cooked perfectly, 100% natural free range chicken, and malted (or not) organic milkshakes locally sourced from Straus Family Cremery (in Petaluma, they do good stuff).

Super nice to have another healthy option in the hood!
author: Becky S.

description: Cons: rude staff, chipolte aioli is gross, fries aren't fresh cut. Pros: variety of seating. This place is nothing special.
author: Sara S.

description:
Hands down, I love their burgers and their garlic fries! They are fast with getting your order placed and made! I went in during the lunch rush too! The only gripe I have (ok maybe two) is that the prices are going up quickly! This is when the number of stars go down....

Within the last month it went up a quarter! Ok I may sound cheap but compared to what I have gotten a regular mini burger for before, ($3.75), it is now $5 for a mini burger. That's one hell of a hike! Last month during the release of the new iphone, it was still $4.75 without tax for a mini burger. I clearly remember that day because I came in for a burger and commented on the price increase to the server who was pleasant and cordial. This leads to my second pet peeve. What kind of server tells their customer that their customer is wrong and that their price has not gone up for the last month and a half she has worked here. Well apparently the server did that today, who was standing in the middle and super adamant that their price did not go up. So another star lost for the way this server handled my comment today. Even if I end up being wrong (which I'm dam sure I wasn't!), the server could have been more pleasant and cordial like the previous server I encountered. 

Because I love their burgers, I will come back. Probably not as often... hopefully the next time I come back it won't be $6 for a mini burger! But to mend my shattered heart over the treatment I received today, my boyfriend joked that the price hike may be due to all of their compostable packaging. So one star gained back for being as environmentally friendly as possible.
author: Catherine L.

description:
I had my first lunch today at this restaurant and the amount of food and how it was cooked to my order was very enjoyable. The cute, young, Latin, male that assisted me with my order recommended the Combo #10. It was very enjoy and I gave my regards to the supervisor at the time and to the cute Latin gentleman that assisted me. 

This new restaurant is just located a block away from my work. Check it out.
author: Donald P.

description:
I compare all burger places to Gott's Roadside... and they are even above or below that bar.

Super Duper fell just below, so I have to rate them a 4star

Pluses:
Great value, for 8 bucks, you get the mini burger (which is still a quarter pounder) fries, and a soda.  Where else on Market can you get that?   The burger was well cooked, nice and juicy, the bun was fantastic, and the Super Sauce was a nice spread, not your usual 1000 island, but a unique twist. 
SUPER plus was fountain soda! And unlimited refills. You know this makes me happy!!
The burger also had onions, which I normally don't care for, and they were red onions, which I really dont care for, but these were sliced so thin, they were not over powering. 
Fries were good, and a decent size serving.

Negative:
I can't really say a whole lot of negative. It just wasnt OMG fantastic, it was really good.  People have commented on the housemade pickles, and I was excited to try these, but I found them to be just..meh.. i could have lived without them.

I will be back for sure, its close to work which is nice... I will not go during lunch rush though... check out that line! YIKES!

I want to try their shakes and malts as well... maybe they will earn that extra star.
author: David P.

description: super duper burgers please come to san diego and escondido california. i really enjoyed your burgers and fries. definitely try this place when you go to san francisco.
author: Paumela B.

description: Meh. I went here because someone told me it tasted like my favorite NY burger joint, Shake Shack. It was greasy and disappointing. I won't be going here again.
author: Sofia O.

description: I just have to say how much I love this place, after I wrote my review I got a note from the manager thanking me even! I have been back and have tried the chicken burger partnered with a fantastic chocolate shake.... this place is just great. And as a bonus-- there were full napkin holders!
