I look forward to my one lunch 'treat' out a month now.
author: Rachell M.

description: Best burgers and shakes, anywhere. I recommend the Super Duper with an egg, and a tuxedo malted shake. Worth every penny.
author: Johnny W.

description:
yes sirreee. great concept. beers and burgers!... im sold.  super juicy, super tasty, super duper. k that was corny but it's a great simple burger all around.  they took the chipotle's organic/grass feed concept and applied to burgers.  and you can def taste the difference. 

the menu is simple but all you really need to know is the burger - single or double.  everything else, the cones, the sundaes, the milkshakes, even the fries are very plain.  mickey ds beats them in all those depts. 

how does this compare to other chains? maybe it's the alcohol talking but i think it beats them all including in-n-outs and five guys.  i've never tried steak n shake so i can't compare.  but overall it's a great concept.

interesting fact: the guy that opened this was also the former ceo of pasta pomodoro
author: Win C.

description: I'm a vegetarian and the lack of tasty veggie burger options always disheartens me.. So I went in thinking it would be yet another burger bar....but these guys really know their sh*t! The burgers aren't ginormous so you actually get to enjoy the fries n shake you order :) and the veggie burger is divine BTW. The shakes are outstanding  as well. So yes I'm officially hooked.
author: Natasha I.

description: Stopped in here in a whim when w  needed a bite to eat - and we were not disappointed! So so so good. My little 4oz burger was just what I wanted and cooked to perfection. The garlic fries however - they were beyond amazing. Would love to come back!
author: Jessi L.

description: I'm not the biggest burger fan but I went to this place and was absolutelyyy shocked by how good it is! The service was fast, the burger was amazing and so were the fries. It's such a convenient location right around the corner from the mall and really a place I'd go back to. And they serve milkshakes spiked with Stoli! What more could you ask for?!
author: Amrit B.

description: So yummy and reasonably priced! I like the veggie burger and the mini burger with a fried egg on top. I also love the milkshakes.
author: Marie W.

description:
Burger, great!

Staff, rude!!

I called to order a burger to pickup so I don't have to stand around waiting for 10 minutes.

Response: "Sorry, we don't do that here -- CLICK!!!"

Sorry, that's just rude. Fine if you're not going to take phone orders. But get yourself an auto-attendant that says this for you so your staff doesn't have to rudely hangup on people.

Also, update your yelp page to reflect not doing take out!
author: Reef W.

description: Very good for fast food. Certainly isn't any healthier than McDonald's, but it sure does taste a whole lot better. Love that I can order an egg on my burger. Soft serve is also terrific.
author: Michael B.

description:
This place is solid.  I work a half a block away from it's new location on Market street.  I am always looking for a place to grab a burger on lunch, so when the work crew told me there was a place real close I was naturally intrigued.  I walked over and asked for a take out menu and then asked if they take call-ins.  Once they told me no, I said, I would never come back.  No call-in=dealbreaker.  This if of course was not the case.  

So, I got a bacon cheeseburger and it was really good.  Greasy!  It reminded me a lot of an in-and-out burger but bigger.  So, if you like in-and-out burger and are looking for something similar in the financial district this is the spot.  I am still unsure of why it is so difficult to find a good burger in the financial district, but this one comes up.  I only worry that the line will explode on weekdays and the no call-in formula will prevent me from ever eating there again.
author: Jonny G.

description: Talk about pricey and good!  Long wait (damn lunch crowd) but it was juicy and tasty, even with the 10 min walk back to the office.    Easy to order the Super Burger combo, but the regular fries are nothing special.  I should try the garlic fries next time!
author: Sonny W.

description: Love the simplicity! Not sure how healthy it is to eat here with the oily fries but I think their meet is organic. The burgers are just crazy awesome and juicy. Satiate any long day's hunger. Yum! Service is friendly. Place is a buzz with the hard working class :) Wish they had few outlets in Sunnyvale/Mtn View/Cupertino area
author: Sushant T.

description: When in San Francisco, when I'm in the mood for a good burger I go here. Not the cheapest burger but you get what you pay for.
author: Eric M.

description: Burgers were pretty tasty and not overly greasy.  The skinny cut fries were disappointing though.  Skinny cut fries are terrible.
author: Mike L.

description: Amazing and so fresh!!!! This is the best burger I've had in a long time and the hair fries to die for!
author: Lobna A.

description: It's hard to find a better burger/fry combo joint than this, an indulgence.
author: Erik J.

description: Absolutely love this place! Their veggie burger is #1 on my list along with their shakes. The line could be going out the door (especially during conferences) but these guys know how to handle it and serve you as fast as possible.
author: Jasleen K.

description: NOT GLUTEN-FREE, no gluten-free buns - should not be listed under gluten-free. Super Duper Burger on Market is a pricey burger joint with upscale food in a basic fast food setting. The meat is good, as are the garlic fries. The $4.75 shakes are tasty, but undersized. The service is fine, though there is no table service.
author: Dave J.

description: These burgers are pretty solid. We had a super 2 patty, everything on it, cheese and jalapenos combo. The patty is really juicy, almost like they pumped the burger with butter, the juice just dripped down my hands. It was pretty tasty. I thought it was a tad on the small side and the bread was a little dry but overall,  really good for a fast food burger. (Probably not as good or as cheap as In and Out for a fast food burger though.)  Ohh but they serve beer and wine.. Bonus!
author: Cori B.

description:
My favorite burger in the known universe and one of my favorite things to eat in SF.

I get: super burger w/ lettuce, tomato, super sauce, bacon, cheese, extra patty, jalapeños, grilled onions. It's dope. The meat tastes amazing and every other ingredient is fantastic as well. It's an umami bomb.
author: Anthony B.

description:
The Super Burger is one of the best burger we had during our stay in SF (and we had a lot). The Chicken is excellent too and the garlics fries are just amazing !! (if you don't have a hot date afterwards)

For this price, it's going to be difficult to find better in SF. I highly recommend it !!
author: Mat G.

description: The burger was big, juicy, and well cooked! Only problem was that it didn't really have enough seasoning. So you got a big meaty taste, but with a little more seasoning it would've been absolutely incredible. Other items to get... The shakes and the garlic fries. The cookies-n-cream shake was freshly made and had plenty of cookies in there! The garlic fries were very garlicky (which I like) and came with a side of chipotle sauce to dip in... awesome.
author: Aninda M.

description: Old fashioned greasy burgers and chocolate dipped soft serve cones. That's all I need.
author: George M.

description: Definitely better than 5 guys. My burger was cooked well and I liked the choice of free toppings. The mini plus fries was more than enough for me which made the meal pretty affordable. I also like that for $1 you can get all 3 of their dipping sauces for your fries: super sauce, homemade mayo, and chipotle. For me it's not exactly super, but it's pretty good.
author: Alice J.

description: Meh. Burger was good, and messy, but the bun is ordinary fast food type. The fries were okay, but only that, and half the basket were stubby inch long fries. Not acceptable. So a 3.5 star burger and 2.5 star fries averages out to 3.0.  Neighborhood is the dirtiest major American city I have ever been in, not as clean as NYC, or the Bronx, or Philly, Chicago or Baltimore, or even DC.  Vagrants everywhere, really gross, with urine smells, at 2 in the afternoon on a weekday.
author: David D.

description: Really good cheeseburger and fries at a reasonable price. After spending what seems like a fortune on food in San Francisco, this has been the best deal. Two people able to eat great burgers for $22 is a deal!
author: Murray K.

description: I have the same mixed feelings about this Super Duper as I do about the location in the Metreon. An okay burger, an industrial warehouse feel and look, and the same problem with really weak glassware. My coworker hit an empty glass on the table with her purse on accident and it fell over and broke. Maybe it's the cement-like floor and not the glassware, actually...
author: Melody L.

description: I came here with a buddy of mine for lunch and was not disappointed! The fires were absolutely fantastic. Get the chipotle sauce for it. The burger was nothing to laugh at either. These guys know how to handle their meat well enough to make me jealous of how I handle mine... The kicker though was the spiked milkshake. 4oz of rum for and extra $1.50!? I never thought a Burger joint would bring out the alcoholic in me!
author: Michael N.

description: We recently came to Super Duper burger with 42 people (high School students).  The staff was incredible- super helpful, patient, calm, and professional (and happy and friendly). the food was GREAT!!  These are the best burgers!
author: kelsey c.

description:
A coworker and I had been excited about Super Duper Burger opening since we first heard the news, so when she was finally free for lunch one day we went over. I had already been once before they officially opened, and did a review on the whole restaurant experience which you can read at burgeranddestroy.com. We had to grab our food and go because of a meeting, but even though it was fairly crowded inside the line moved quickly and we got our food fast.

I was feeling hungry, so I ordered the 8 ounce Super Duper Burger for $6.50. I added cheese for 50 cents and bacon for an extra dollar, so $8 total. Also grabbed a vanilla shake for an additional $4.75. Our food was handed to us quickly, and we headed back on our one block walk to the office. Once I dug into my bag, I found that my burger was in a foil wrapper, like it was wearing a space blanket. Their motto is "Fast food burgers, slow food values" and it's these touches that play into it. I'd never really think of it as "fast food" but it strikes a real good balance between the two.

The 8oz. Super Duper burger is actually 2 patties. I didn't even realize this at first because my burger suffered some serious patty-creep. But this is a pretty hefty burger, especially with the bacon. The bacon was pretty crispy, but had some chewier parts. I had to do the rip-bacon-and-stuff-it-back-into-the-burger maneuver, but only once. They do add bacon above and below the patties; it is kind of hard to see in this last picture, but bonus points for that. Much more obvious is the cheese that is all kinds of melted deliciousness.

Unfortunately the further I delved into my burger, the soggier my bun got. I've been experiencing this more than I ever have lately, and really am going to try my best to eat right after ordering, not bring it anywhere else. My co-worker didn't have this problem, so I'll see how it goes next time. But the last few bites were impassable, as the bun was beyond saving. With the large amount of bacon, this ended up being a very rich burger and relented to it, leaving a few bites left. The cause of my soggy woes were the juicy patties, which are cooked real nicely, and you can tell the meat is high quality. The consistency is very good, and it is never too tough even on the edges.

I really want to love this burger, but its not an all star for me. It is a very decent burger no-doubt, but it seemed a little off-balance. For the neighborhood though, it is the only way to go. The milkshake was real good, but on the smaller side for just shy of $5. The fries I had previously are also tasty, but I don't know how often I will specifically be craving a burger here. That's probably for the best, as falling in love with a burger a block away from my work could be a dangerous thing.

I will definitely be adding this in to my lunchtime rotation, and if anything changes I will be sure to update. You won't be making any mistakes coming here, but you probably wont be trying to have them name a burger after you either.

-Burger and Destroy
author: Mike M.

description:
Since I can't eat gluten, I was bummed to find out that they had run out of salad for dinner. I would have opted for a veggie burger wrapped in lettuce, but felt like eating something that I had not eaten in a while.

My personal "Dinner of Champions": organic Straus Creamery soft-serve cone, with a side of garlic fries. I got the kids-size cone too, of both chocolate and vanilla soft serve, and it was seriously not-kid sized. To be honest, I don't think I can go back to non-organic soft serve. There was something about it that made it way creamier than regular soft serve, less icy or whatever. Regardless, my empty stomach was pleased.

The garlic fries were okay, but next time I'll try out the milkshakes and sweet potato fries.
author: Helen I.

description: I figured out how to eat a non super oily Super Duper burger. Get the mini, eat two if you must.  But if you get it super size, it gets oily and the buns get greasy.  Not a good look for the bun. The mini Super Duper cheeseburger was delicious!
author: Wakako U.

description:
Eating my purchase as I type and YUM!  I ordered the portobello sandwich (it is breaded and fried) with avocado and jalapenos and it is delicious.  The place was packed and the line was down the street but totally worth the wait. They even gave everyone in line a small order of fries to snack on while waiting. Nice touch. 

 I haven't tried the burgers yet but judging by people's reaction while I waited, it's good. For those health conscience they have a 4oz burger instead of the standard 8oz.

I definitely welcome this new addition to the downtown lunch scene.
author: TJ E.

description:
I really like this place. It's clean and fresh and the burgers are so good! I ordered the mini burger with extra cheese and bacon, and the garlic fries and it was delicious! The garlic fries alone are worth 5 stars. 
Then I, personally, appreciate such small things like that you can choose to get a lemon slice to your coke or not.
author: Scarlet W.

description: Meat was really good but the fries and bun were just ok. Friend of mine said chocolate shake was awesome.
author: Mike Y.

description: Their portobello mushroom burger is the best thing that happened to me this weekend...and I had a super duper weekend!
author: Jen C.

description: This place is just OK. Don't get me wrong, the vibe here is great and it's easily accesible, location wise, but that's about it for the pros of this place. The prices are definitely on the steep side for the quality of burgers, fries and milkshakes. I got the regular combo and it set me back about $12, which isn't bad at all, except my burger and fries tasted like something at Carl's Jr. Really nothing special at all. There are much better burger joints in the city!
author: Kevin D.

description: my favorite burger joint from now on leap frogging in and out and a very nice place to hang out
author: Rommel S.

description: I work right next door. So I really enjoy coming here cause the food is so good. Even at its kinda high cost. But the last few times I've been in, the service is so poor. I feel that the cashiers aren't paying attention to your order, and once they get it wrong (no fries or no onions), its like you are inconveniencing them. Its very disappointing.  I know i will be back and its delicious, but I'll start going to a different location if the service doesn't return to how it used to be. It used to be very welcoming, efficient and attentive.
author: Ashley M.

description:
This is sort of a cumulative review.

I really want to like this place. They have awesome veggie burgers that make me believe that the meat eaters are missing something. They have garlic fries with finely chopped garlic and Parmesan on them that (while a bit saltier than what I normally eat) are so good and that I get cravings for. They stay open later than a lot of decent food places in the neighborhood. The place is clean and looks nice enough. It's not ear busting loud like some burger places are.  This would normally be a five star review from me.

However, I find myself still not really wanting to go there after the service I got there a while back. I ordered a shake and what I got was thin enough that at first I thought they'd given me a chocolate milk with a couple teaspoons of heavy cream added. It was as if no ice cream had been harmed in the making of that shake. It certainly wasn't worth the price when I could get a chocolate milk that tasted the same at the 7-11 next door for two bucks. I took two sips, found it kind of gross, and did something I normally didn't do: I very politely (and kind of meekly) told this kind of shorter white guy (who I think may have been a manager since he was not dressed the same as the other workers) that the shake tasted a bit much like a chocolate milk. His response was a flat kind of rude, "What do you want me to do?" I asked if he could please remake it because it was essentially a chocolate milk. He seemed really mad at me and gave me attitude and told me it would come out the same because that was the recipe. I'd had better shakes here, so either the other cashiers ignored the recipe and made them better than him or he was lying. Either way, I don't think it would've killed him to just say, "Sure I'll remake it" and add a little more ice cream. I work food service and that's what I would've done if someone had approached me the I way I approached him about it. Still trying to be polite and not wanting to be pushy but also not wanting to deal with this, I asked him to refund me. He made sure to glare and scoff at me as much as possible while he threw away the shake, loudly blame me for not liking it to another staff (who asked why he was throwing it away), and then glare at me some more while he did the refund.

Since then I haven't really wanted to come here... but the garlic fries are so freaking good that so long as I see that he's not there and the other (super friendly awesome staff are) I'll still get fries. I still come here a lot less than I used to and I'll probably never get a shake here again ever, lest the same thing happen. Since I'm normally the service I expect decent service so that experience kind of ruined this place for me.
author: A J.

description: Fantastic burger and amazing strawberry milkshake with real strawberries. Super crowded during lunch hour.
author: Anya F.

description: What can I say, I am a true burger and fries kinda gal! I was introduced to this place by a friend who raved about it. I had to try it for myself. I ordered a SUPER BURGER w/swiss cheese and bacon, garlic fries, and a cookies and cream shake! The burger was BOMBDIGITY, fries YUMMO, and shake just brought it all together. I thought the service was excellent. I can't wait to go back!
author: Dom and Marj V.

description: Decent food. Could have been the location/timing (Union Square dinner time), but the space was jam-packed, and pretty dirty. Took too long to get our food considering we ordered the staples: burgers and fries. I'd try again, but at a different branch.
author: Zach N.

description:
this place is effin awesome.  burgers are juicy, fries crispy, shakes creamy and lastly, the bill is just as palatable as the rest!

but if you try to take picture with the super duper sign, watch out for that wooden ledge.  i tripped over it and nearly face planted, saved only by plastering my grubby fingers all over the hand painted logo, which they had so kindly asked me to respect.

photo FAIL.
author: Josie M.

description:
This is my first time I have tried this place that just opened 2 weeks ago. Impressed to see on the menu that hamburgers are "ground daily all natural Niman Ranch Beef". The prices seemed reasonable for a premium burger place... $7 + tax for an 8oz.(2-4oz. Patties) Super Burger with Cheese. There was 5 people in front of me in the order line at 5pm, and with only one slow person ringing up orders behind the counter, it was about a 10 minute wait just to order my burger. Hopefully they get things moving along faster in the future. The decor here has that industrial look with natural wood and aluminum chairs and light fixtures. 

Now on to the Burgers... in one word..."outstanding".  Beef is very juicy, delicious and seasoned just right. The lettuce and tomatoes are fresh and brightly colored, and even the bun is better than most other burger places. Super Duper also serves Chicken Burgers, Fries, Garlic Fries, Milk Shakes, Chocolate Dipped Soft Ice Cream Cones, and salads. 

I highly recommend that every burger lover in SF give Super Duper a try.
author: Scott S.

description:
Their burgers and garlic fries are great. I love the fact that you can add an egg to your burger makes it that much better!

Food: It's traditional burgers and fries with some added bonuses. Order the burger with and egg and it gets really messy but so delicious! The garlic fries with aged cheddar was great. 

Price: For SF I'd say they're affordable. It's more than In-n-Out but not by much and its worth the price you pay.
author: Justin C.

description:
the meat was really good and tasty... but on the greasy side.  even tho i don't usually crave meat, the burger was pretty good!  i like that there is a second floor dining area albeit small as it may be.  

they serve beer for you beer drinkers.  they have pickles in a jar by the soda fountain (weird but cool i guess).

there wasn't anything special about the fries.
author: Hello.kitty.kat S.

description:
So I read a few mixed reviews, but a look at the menu won me over.  I tried the Mini Burger with Cheese and jalapenos (plus the lettuce, tomato, and sauce that normally comes with the burger), plus an order for garlic fries.  Both the burger and fries were really good.  Next time I go, the only change I would make would be to ask for the burger medium-well instead of medium (it was a little too pink for my taste).  Oh, and next time I'll try a milkshake or ice cream!  

The value for the money is pretty good for SF (I can't remember the last time my total for a meal was less than $10)!
author: Kristen S.

description: Awesome burgers! A little on the expensive side, but definitely worth the price. The milkshake was yummy as well.
author: Emily L.

description: OMG!  One of the best burgers that I have eaten in my life.  I was in SF on a business trip. One of the people that I met at the trade show told me about this place and that it was a "must try".  I stopped by for lunch. It was packed with people but it was worth the wait.  This is my burger spot whenever I am in the SF area.
author: James Y.

description: Made to order, fresh food. Try the lemonade with brown sugar, you won't be disappointed!
author: Christopher D.

description: I've only been to the other location so I was really excited to check this one out. From what I hear, the line is usually really long but coming here on a Sunday around 2pm, it wasn't long at all. We zipped right through. I like this one because it seems a little bigger. I tried their veggie burger. It was really good. I ate it up along with their ever so delicious garlic fries. Yum. Affordable. Great staff. Love.
author: Mel P.

description: Chicken Sandwich is moist and grilled perfectly.  Perfect place to grab a light meal or snack.
author: Suz L.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!! Amazing veggie bugler I was visiting 5 days and I managed to eat 4!!! You can tell that this place uses the freshest, quality ingredients!! Wish we had one in So Cal!!
author: Kristie B.

description: Cool little spot to get burgers. Just beware the regular burger is larger than you might think. I ordered the regular burger and it had 2 patties. Cooked medium. Very juicy and delicious!
author: Steve A.

description:
It gets really busy here at some times, but the line moves quick.  Seating can be a little difficult so get the order to go just in case.

Strongly recommend the chicken sandwich!
author: J E.

description:
wet, wet, wet, wet, wet, wet, wet.....wet. 

This by far is the best organic burgers you could get around town. With its minimal menu and its organic meats and ingredients, Super duper is the place to grab a nice burger while in the heart of downtown. 

I've tried both the burger and the chicken sandwich, which i have deeply fallen in love with. You just gotta grab it, full hand. take that nice juicy first bit, and sip that beer fresh off the tab to help get it down. HEAVEN. I love the place, and the whole decor, great customer service, you get your burger in about 10 mins!!!!! thanks amazing for fresh to order burgers. 

I'd recommend to start off the the original burger, simple burger tomato, onions, lettuce, pickles. after you've mastered your burger tasting abilities, i'd suggest to up the anty and try something new. egg, japlenons, grilled onions, etc. 

All i have to say is straight goods. did i also mention they served, orgainc soft serve! what a plus for a fatty meal to stuff your face, I mean what else could put a bigger smile on your face than having a delicious soft serve cone after a nice beer burger and fries. 

ps- garlic lovers, order the garlic fries. They we're a bit strong for my likings, but good overall. i know for a fact you garlic lovers would love these.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Burger: 1/5 - in and out is way better
garlic fries: 3.5/5, the french fry itself wasnt too good. 
soft serve icecream dipped in choco - 2/5, i like the cone
author: Cindy L.

description: I am getting hungry just writing about it!!!  The meat melts in your mouth - and it taste sooo good.  You can customize the order to your taste or level of experimentation (well done, medium, rare, less of this and more of that, etc.) and the ingredients are fresh.... including the french fries.  They also have vegetarian burger option.  We were lucky to grab the bar stool sitting area next to their totally see-through kitchen.  Nothing to hide... you see their entire operation right in front of your eye, but how they make the food so tasty is still a secret.  Energetic and friendly ppl.  The only down side... finding a place to sit can be a challenge, therefore not a great place for group of 5 or more.
author: Tesh S.

description: Loved the burger and the wait was tolerable. I didn't get why the garlic fries has more cheese than garlic though. Didn't like it that much. The burger ingredients were fresh. You can tell that they are.
author: Ira A.

description: We came here for dinner and the place was packed! For the price, I guess I can't really complain.  It was reasonable in relation to all of the other restaurants.  What is really dissatisfying about a burger joint is when you pay $12 and you see these sad little portions. However, quality over quantity seems to be the theme of the burgers.  I got the mini burger combo with a 4 oz patty. That was enough for me. Though the portion size was depressing, they did not skimp on flavor. Unfortunately, I cannot say the same for the fries. Their garlic fries can only be described as deep fried cardboard with a messy array of parmesan cheese and a microscopically small amount of garlic. So I might come back for the burger, but this probably won't remain on my places to re-visit if I do make another trip north.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Delicious burger patty on salad. Nice veggies and avocado. One of the few burger places with a decent Paleo menu.
author: Susan V.

description: When I want to indulge in a burger this is the place for me!  Quality meat, perfectly cooked, and delicious!  A burger coupled with their chocolate shake with strawberries is a wonderful indulgence.  Oh, and the homemade pickles are zesty with a nice amount of crunch.
author: Laurae P.

description: Love Super Duper, hate this location. Took 15 minutes to get my order and had to ask for a refund to get it. The burger was in pieces when I finally got it. Pigeons were walking around deep inside the restaurant and there was trash all over. Very disappointing.
author: Dan G.

description: i love new places in sf! Not sure if its totally new, but its clean! The place has an upstairs and a downstairs and wasn't that crowded when I went, since it was 11am. They have a lot of staff so the burgers are ready fast. Place tastes so fresh like a restaurant style in and out. Was really good I would compare it to a bigger version of shake shack. Yummy had the super duper burger and was surprised that for you jalapeno lovers those were free! Also free pickles cut up in a jar. Really good burger and they have these okay tasting garlic fries. So affordable and really near powell bart! I would go back.
author: Diane S.

description: I've had two burgers here now and they've both been fantastic.  And if you're gonna get fries, go for the garlic cheese ones.  Um....that's it, just get in there.
author: e w.

description: GOT DAYUM those burgers are Good!! The young ladies(staff) are very attentive and sincere too. Top Notch!
author: Jason B.

description: As far as a fast food burger joints go Super Duper is awesome. The food is  pretty damn tasty and very fresh. They manage to make it feel not-so fast food. Nice options to jazz up your burger, the fries were perfect. Great service, and a fun spunky atmosphere. They serve beer which is an added bonus in my book. Free endless pickle's!
author: Bul T.

description: VERY tasty burger. Especially after a few drinks. :) Great casual place to grab some sustenance during a night out. They even have beer and wine. Love!
author: Stacie M.

description: Thanks for the great event last night to the staff at Super Duper, you guys put on a real treat.  The vibe in this place was cool, but what do you expect in San Francisco right?  Seating was a bit tight as this place was full, I guess free food & booze will do that.  I sampled the portobello burger which was outstanding, also tried the cheeseburger w/ bleu cheese, also outstanding.  The IPA was good & hearty, forgot the name but it had the number '5' in it.  Didn't get to try the fries or ice cream, but honestly was pretty full and didn't want to be one of those famous yelpers who lose it every time a food tray goes by.  Ruggy, thanks again for the invite man, San Diego misses you but it looks like you are crushing in your new city.  I am up here for business all the time and this place is on the way back to my hotel, will definitely be stopping in for dinner in the near future.
author: Liam M.

description: Love there burgers and beer you wont be sorry if you eat here. get here before or after the lunch hour or you will wait as well as have a tuff time finding a seat.
author: Travis A.

description: i am always on a lookout for places to grab a quick bite. their burgers are the freshest i have had and their fries are killer! the burgers were seasoned and cooked well. the fries were crispy and full of flavor!  and what is not to like about FREE, tasty pickles!! it's definitely a place i will be coming back to when i get a chance to get to the city!!  give it a try!
author: Donald G.

description:
Here's the deal, the place is called Super Duper, it should be friggin' SUPER. My experience today makes me wonder if it should be called Just Fine Duper. But that doesn't really roll off the tongue. You know what else doesn't roll off the tongue, mediocre burgers and soggy buns. 

The Good-
The cleanly laid out menu makes ordering a cinch! There are some super fresh toppings, a special sauce and house made pickles that all add a bit of flair to the entire experience. The burgers are juicy, the portion size is hefty (go with the smaller if you aren't that hungry I barely finished the 8oz), and the fact that they are using good meat and have organic soft serve is pretty cool. 

The Bad-
The burger wasn't good, shall I continue? I didn't realize that an 8oz meant two 4oz patties. Not the worst thing, the worst thing was that they were cooked differently. One was well done and one was so bloody at one point it said, "I'm gonna mooooove right through ya, you're gonna be sorry in ten, nine, eight, seven." The fries are alright, nothing special and the yogurt is ok but I wasn't in love. 

I was tempted to go 2 with this one, but the staff saved 'em a star. They are what makes this place super. Really nice people, smiled the entire time I was there, one went so far as to do up my cone even after she closed her drawer for the night meaning she couldn't take my money. Everyone I interacted with (3 total) was really great. I just wish the food matched. 

Know Before You Go: Being newish they may need time to get from raw to well-done.
author: Corey D.

description: Good burgers, very tasty. The mini (4oz patty) is large enough for me, although I wish I could have eaten more coz it was so delicious. Add a fried egg or portobello mushroom! Gets crowded at lunch time.
author: Adrianna T.

description: For the burger's size, you get more than what you paid for! Also it's really juicy and the facilities are clean.
author: Glenn M.

description: We ate here yesterday. I had a super burger everything on it with fries on the side. The burger was so juicy,albeit a tad on the greasy side. I'm on the fence with their 'special' sauce tho. The fries were great too and again I don't know if the ketchup was heinz or was it in house.So the sauces were the ones that put me off. So when I come here next time i would know now NOT to have that special sauce on my burger if that's even possible. For pickle lovers which I am not, they keep homemade  pickles in a jar. As for how good they taste I have no idea. But they are free, so just try them and decide for yourself.Overall one of the juiciest, tender, lean beef I've  had in awhile. Also their soda fountain was not working yesterday when we came which was a bummer, but they had pitchers of water  which was cool.
author: joe p.

description: Did not disappoint. I had the super burger combo with garlic Fries. It was one of the best burgers I've had. It tasted really fresh, juicy, and homemade. It wasn't as big as I thought but it was still very filling. The garlic fries wasn't the best I've had but still pretty good and fresh. I would totally go back or recommend this place to friends and family.
author: ShihMing H.

description: Chicken sandwich, burger, fries, shake, even the veggie burger is perfectly amazing. Get your food to go n sit in Yerba Buena park. Don't forget the pickle
author: Amy W.

description: Love this place. I had gon'' a few times by myself and finally my wife went with me.  To this day she still talks about these burgers.  They're just all around good.  So are the garlic fries.  They have the best garlic fries I've ever had. They Also serve homemade pickles which are tasty.  As for the environment it is nice, only if you like a lot of noise and people.
author: Reginald D.

description: Worth the hype. I got the mini burger with, which was the perfect size for me. It was cooked perfectly and was so juicy and delicious. I loved that they had huge jars of homemade pickles on the condiment bar, I stocked up on those. The fries were good, not memorable, but maybe I should have added a dipping sauce. I love a simple, straightforward burger that is just done well and this is the spot. I just wish there was one in Oakland.
author: Naomi C.

description:
More like 3.5 stars but Super Duper hits the spot so I can't possibly give it a 3.

First, do yourself a favor and add an egg to your burger order. Don't matter if you gettin' chicken or beef, the fried egg is gonna kick it up a notch. Really, everything tastes better with a gooey egg dripping yolk on top. You try it on pizza and tell me I am wrong. But I digress. The 8-oz burger comes with two patties, that's a little weird but probably their way to efficiently move the huge line of hungry customers. Their medium-rare degree of doneness, apparently their default choice, is really medium. If you like to see some pink in the middle, I'd order rare (I tried both and was a happier camper with the rare burger). Oh, and don't let yourself tempted by their 3 dips for fries for an extra dollar, they're not worth it. Aioli isn't even one of the three. It's nice to make an attempt at originality but fighting the pervasiveness of aioli when it comes to french fries is a lost battle. At least in SF, it has pretty much become the de-facto standard dip for les frites.
author: Laurent P.

description: I've been to Super Duper many times before but this time it gets 1 star because of the service. I understand that it is the end of the night and I probably was the last person to order and granted it was a Saturday night my order was rather simple. I got an order of garlic fries with grilled onion and my friend had gotten the same thing (minus the grilled onions). My friend's order came out within a matter of seconds and I waited a good 10 minutes and my friend mentions to me, "You should check on your order I think the kitchen is closing." After a waitress overhears the conversation she frantically asks me, "Oh you're waiting for your order, what is it?" I tell her it's garlic fries with grilled onions and she brings me back just plain garlic fries. After neglecting my order, it's still delivered to me incorrectly but I begrudgingly take it because I'm just hungry at that point. Disappointed with the service and my experience overall.
author: Alan D.

description:
Super Duper Burger is AMAZING! I work too close to it and have tried literally everything on the menu. First things first FREE homemade pickles! OH SO GOOD! The pickles are self serve by the coke machine and let me just say I eat probably close to 10 each time I'm in there. The Burgers are great too. I always get the single patty because it is enough, the meat is perfect, the sauce is great, and I have never been let down with this burger. Add some Avocado and bacon with cheese for the best freaking burger ever! I've also tried the portobello burger which is great too! The chicken sandwiches are uber juicy and the bun that it comes on is so soft and also very delicious! The french fries are crispy shoe-string-esque and you can get plain fries which are great or garlic fries which are deadly in a good way. The super duper salad is great... with homemade Caesar dressing... lately I've been adding Chicken and avocado on mine which is SO GOOD! Wine is pretty good...I can't complain it tastes good and its cheap :) Last but certainly not least the ice cream....
some people care if it organic... others not so much, but I think everybody can agree that the cones are absolutely phenomenal! my personal favorite is the vanilla chocolate blend. Oh and shakes are great even better if you pay the extra dollar for a shot of vodka in it. (its good trust me). GO TO SUPER DUPER BURGER! ITS FUN... CHEAP AND IS ALWAYS A TASTY PLACE TO EAT!
author: Bridgett H.

description: Succulent juicy burgers with a righteous sauce! Ohh! And don't fuggidabout the cheese!!!
author: Frantascia P.

description: Beers good, fries great, Burgers rock !!!
author: Kevin T.

description: If you've tried shake shack in New York this place is as close as it gets. They have very good burgers, I think the best one in town. The burgers taste very fresh, the french fries are to die for. The shakes are ok and I think they're over priced and that's the reason why I knocked off one star. It cost almost $20 just for one meal containing a shake, garlic fries and a cheeseburger with portabello mushroom and a sunnyside up egg. This place is good just to go once in a while only because of the price. If prices were to go down I'd definitely go there more often.
author: Jingee M.

description:
Super Duper is arguably the best tasting burger I have found in San Francisco up to date in a lot of tries.  It is also by far the greasiest.  I'm talking about a 1/2 centimeter thick layer of grease covering my fast food sized burger tray.

The place is located along tourist central on Market Street near Powell BART, and the line around mealtime reaches to the entryway.  The place looks pretty hip and modern, and the line actually moves pretty quickly, thanks to a pretty simple menu.  Burgers are a little expensive, considering the 1/2 pound burger is really just two quarter-pound patties slopped together.  The bun is your standard sesame seed bun.  They offer a decent number of a customized toppings considering the number of people they serve.  Every topping came out of fresh and well-cooked, including the fried egg and avocado extras that I added.  Each ingredient is delicious -- nothing overseasoned or mushy.  The patties are made-for-quantity "all-natural" beef patties.  In my experience, most restaurants that cook the "all-natural" patties tend to be dry and overcooked.  Super Duper has managed to avoid this problem by drowning the cows in all-natural cooking oil.  It is delicious and awful at the same time, as the mixture of dry but still substantial and meaty ground beef and oil mix together in your mouth orgy.

The fries are good, slightly better than average, and not as oily as you'd think given the sopping wet burgers.

I will almost definitely go to Super Duper again given the slim pickings in San Francisco, but I will almost definitely feel guilty about it afterwards.
author: Jeff Y.

description: For a quick burger bite, this place was very good. Great veggie burger, bun and other ingredients were good. Boyfriend's burger was good. The fries were hot and crispy. Not very expensive. Only bad part is the drones of disgusting homeless people that hang around that area, which is not Super Duper's fault, but one of the dirtiest and craziest women I've ever seen walked right up to me and my boyfriend while we were eating outside and leaned over us asking for something. I didn't finish my food. I reccomend not sitting on the very outside
author: E F.

description: I ordered the mini cheese burger with all the complimentary toppings (red onions, lettuce, tomatoes, and their special sauce) and a side of pickles (also free). Don't be fooled by the "mini" distinction. It just refers to the number of beef patties it has--mini has one 4 oz. patty and the super has two 4 oz. patties. The beef patty was cooked perfectly and was very juicy. I like how they toasted the burger bun and it remained in tact up until the very last bite. I hate when burgers are so doctored up and oversized that it cannot conceivably fit into a normal sized mouth. I didn't come across this issue, my mini burger was the perfect size and was a neat burger. Not bad for $6!
author: Carrie W.

description:
I love the interior of this place, I felt like I was at some really cool, hip swanky place. Then again, I really don't get out much, but I still loved the interior. The graphic design/branding is superb.

I ordered the portabella sandwich, fries, and iced tea. At first I thought the prices were decent, until I realized how small the portions were. 

Minus one star because halfway through my meal I wanted to get the 3 dips for my fries, so I ordered them. Instead of returning to my table, I decided I was going to wait, I mean, how long can it take to fill three little paper dip cups? I waited patiently as people crowded me, until I realized those who ordered after me got their food before my dips! This was after 15 minutes of waiting. I went up to the counter and told them about the dips and the woman was very apologetic and quickly got my dips. 

Then I realized they forgot the avocado in my sandwich. I went to complain and the same woman who got my dips, was very apologetic. I felt bad but I felt like this place failed me twice. 

Even as I say this, I still really liked my food. I'll definitely come back!
author: K. E.

description: Best burgers in the city, hands down!  Big juicy burger made to order. House made pickles and great fries. The also have soft serve ice cream.
author: Kent C.

description:
flavorless meat in the burgers,
thin and mediocre fries...

can i at least haz mcdonalds plz?
author: David H.

description:
Super Duper is the whole package: fresh burgers, crispy fries, milkshakes from real ice cream, and excellent service.  

On the first trip I went with a mini burger, fries, and a chocolate shake.  Even though it was far less meat than I usually eat in a burger, it was delicious.  Everything just worked together.  Fries were on point and the milkshake, though not my favorite of all time, really pulled tied the meal together.

Second trip, I ordered the Super cheeseburger, fries, and a coke.  I still loved all the flavors going on with the burger, but the additional patty and cheese were a two-edged sword.  The sharpness of the cheddar made the sandwich pop even more than before, but it also added a LOT more grease.  It still tasted as great as before, but the whole assembly got much soggier.

This might be the best burger in the FiDi, so don't sell it short!  Until they open my beloved In-N-Out downtown, I'll be at Super Duper once a week.
author: P D.

description: The mini meal with cheese, bacon and jalapenos will give you a food baby named NOM.
author: Dora C.

description: Delicious! Like a slightly classier In n Out Burger, but around the same price point. I've eaten at both the downtown and Castro locations and both had great service and excellent food. My only complaint is the pickles. They are too big to actually put ON your burger. Add some sliced pickle options and it will be perfect!
author: leslie n.

description: Super Duper burger was just that, super duper. I really liked the atmosphere and design, and more importantly the food was great too. I've only been there once so far but it was worth the trip, and i will definitely be back. Tasty treats!
author: dr. L.

description:
very solid burger in union square or soma. definite line during the week at lunch time, but it'll take 15 mins from the door to getting your food. and it's worth it. get the "mini" which is actually a normal sized burger, or try the chicken sandwich with bacon and cheese....fries are great.

definitely try this place!
author: J S.

description:
I went to the Market location after months of passing by it on my morning commute. While drinking one evening after work at a nearby John Collins, everyone was starving. I threw out Super Duper since I wanted to avoid Osha (eaten there way too many a drunken nights). We were uber excited, and to our ultimate fail, came to an extremely LONG line of patrons who also had the same genius idea as us.

I ordered the mini-cheese burger, fries, and a choco milkshake. The wait wasn't too bad, and we found enough space upstairs in two tables to fit about 12 of us. The first bite of the burger was really tasty, and then the rest of it was just good. I think I'm too bias with my burgers because I still dream of Shake Shack in NYC. This place is definitely solid but not my favorite in the city... still searching for the ONE!

Customer service and decor is excellent though, and love the option of the mini burger. Thanks!
author: Jeanne C.

description: The super duper burger with cheese is awesome.  The meat is fresh and not frozen.  I thought the burger overall was much better than five guys.  Five guys blow.  Supposedly this place is run like shake shack in NYC.  Never been.  The dippe cone was just ok but expensive for $4.  The ice cream tasted "healthy".  I've had better soft serve at costco.  Go for the burgers and skip the ice cream.
author: Fatty A.

description: I think Super Duper has some of the best burgers in SF, especially for a chain. I've heard it described as an upscale/better version of In 'N Out and I think that perfectly sums it up. I like that they have a pretty simple menu and every time I've been it's consistently good. I like that they have beer on draft, and this location seems to run a lot faster than the one in the Castro.
author: Will A.

description: I don't usually give four stars on the first visit, but boy, was my burger great!  Niman Ranch beef for a big burger and only $6.50.  Ordered the garlic fries without cheese.  Yum.  Upscale decor for a burger joint.  Upstairs balcony with plenty of seating too.
author: Doctor G.

description: Not a bad burger, a little greasy but it is a cheeseburger after-all. Very flavorful burger, good fries & great pickles. Service? Well I guess its really not a service kind of place, so I won't let the guy at the register ruin a fine burger...
author: A. B.

description: Over rated heavily buttered burnt rolls. Snarky staff. I don't get the understand the queues. Perhaps a different location is better.
author: Geordie E.

description: Visited super duper for lunch again!  We beat the lunch crowd.  food is excellent, and the soft serve is so delightful, esp since we've had a heat wave lately.    Tip on the soft serve cone: order it when you order your food and then you can come up to the soft serve area and pick it up after you've eaten - saves you from waiting in the long line to get your dessert.
author: Bebe W.

description: Nom Nom Nom I love love love super duper burgers ... so yummy ...  thats all that needs to be said ... and also when you get the ice cream home to go people look envious as you walk it home :)
author: Anthony S.

description:
Loved my burger (4 oz with added cheese and portabello, yum), so juicy and delicious!
 
But what I liked best of all was the CUSTOMER SERVICE. Whoever that manager is, he rocks (tall, young guy with brown hair). They obviously understand the value of the customer. I had a friend order me a cone, and he messed up the order (swirl instead of chocolate dip) and when I went to pick it up I was so bummed, the manager swooped in and said it was no problem, even though the price was different (higher) and dipped that delicious cone for me! Made my day.

I like the simplicity of the menu, the delicious pickles, the environmentally conscious way they run the business and way they can move a line along. Not sure about the other locations (Castro and Marina), but this one, downtown, was a great experience. Def coming back.
author: Nicole K.

description: Chillin' in SF and wanted a burger.  Yelped the area and ended up at Super Duper.  My 6 year old inhaled a mini burger with cheese and everything on it with fries, hubby and I ordered a super burger (I could only eat 1/2).  Mmmmmmm the meat was delish and the fries... yummy, yummy.  But the best part of the meal was the chocolate milkshake!!!  My son said it was DIE-LICIOUS!!
author: Monica B.

description: Super Duper is amazing. I first came across this place on the way to a movie screening in the Castro. I have to say, I like this place more than I like In-N-Out! Their meat patties are so thick, juicy, and medium-rare amazing. The cheddar they use on their burgers is obviously high quality, and they have free house-made pickles that make my taste buds dance! Their garlic fries are a little sub-par (kind of limp, small and stringy), but everything else on their menu seems to be a hit. I hear their chicken sandwich is delicious too, but my red-meat addiction will keep me on those super burgers.
author: Michelle G.

description: Unfortunately, I came here after eating a fatty lunch so I wasn't able to try their burgers. But I did try their awesome home-made frozen yogurt hand-dipped in chocolate. I made the mistake of ordering a regular size, which is HUGE and couldn't finish it. ($5). I should have gone for the kid's size, which still would have been plenty enough for like $3.95. This ain't no Mcdonald's fro yo (although I love those too). These taste totally different. More of a ice-cream-like taste (emphasize the cream), than an artificial taste. Next time I'm in town, I'll have to get the burger. And of course the kid's size fro yo.
author: Andrew S.

description: Burger was good. Only complaint it the patties aren't very seasoned at all and bland everything else was good though. A bit pricey for why you receive and there is always a line
author: Tom L.

description:
We ordered a Veggieburger, Cheese burger, fries and a Chocolate and Strawberry Shake. The fries were not hot and neither were the burgers, they were just above room temperature, tepid. They looked like they were sitting under heat lamps for a while (heat lamps that didn't keep the food warm). 

The whole reason I'm posting this is because of their sign that says each item is prepared to order. No way is that true. We waited only 3-5 minutes for our food and when it arrived it looked, tasted and felt like it was prepared well before that. And there was no reason for this, the place wasn't even that busy. 

The shake was good, but the food was terrible and for $23 bucks it was a very expensive and disappointing meal.
author: Sean B.

description:
VERY YUM! I ordered a small super duper meal (1 patty) and it was fairly filling.
Definitely not your burger from McD or Burger King. It's really different because it tastes fresh!
Also i noticed that their straw is eco-friendly and they sell wine!
author: J P.

description: The brown sugar lemonade gooooooes lol
author: Chris H.

description: Another visit to Super Duper. Trying chicken sandwich. Yum!
author: Dhruba B.

description: I always get the chicken sandwich and it's consistently solid. I have yet tried their fries, burgers or shakes but tempted to every time I go. Sigh! The guilt!
author: teatzar s.

description: Like a fancier In and Out. The milkshakes and cookies are incredible.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This has been a favorite spot of mine to go to when in the city for lunch or dinner. It's pretty filling so it tends to be the last meal that I'll be having for the day. I'll admit that for me, it feels a bit on the pricier side so it's not all too friendly for a student's budget.

The atmosphere of the place is very nice although there aren't many table or chairs depending at the time you go. It easily fills up and the line can be long from time to time.

If you're going to go here, I'd recommend going all out and getting burgers + garlic fries + a milkshake if you can. I can't wait til next year to start trying the spiked milkshakes!

It's a fairly nice date spot too since it's in the heart of downtown and nearby plenty of places to shop and BART if you're planning on heading home soon after.
author: Jackie L.

description:
when it's crowded, it gets loud. but if you time your visit, you can avoid all that and even find a seat.

yes, their burgers squirt. each one has so much juice, that they're just waiting to explode in your mouth. add the creaminess of a thick shake and you have yourself a happy customer.

if you're going add a friend to the mix, i'd recommend regular fries as apposed to garlic (not that i've got to try - everyone always polishes off mine). there's something about the second fry that doesn't do it for me.

everything composts and they do ask that you be conservative but i need those napkins - it gets messy every time.

running joke in my circle is that i keep coming back for more -

of the three so far, this one is my favorite
author: marvin l.

description:
How can a place take top quality ingredients and do such horrible things with them?

I went with such high hopes...I ordered the cheeseburger, a side of fries and a coke. Eating the cheeseburger was one of the most harrowing experiences I have had in a long time. It comes wrapped in paper which is supposed to protect you, I guess... A few bites in and it oozed grease over both of my hands and most parts of my wrists. In trying to eat the rest of it I returned to the napkin dispenser three times and used close to a dozen napkins to clean myself. A trip to the bathroom afterwards was in order before leaving because I still felt I was not clean enough to reach into my pockets or touch things. 

OTHER BURGER ANNOYANCES:  Within a few bites everything basically collapsed, which only contributed to the very messy experience. The onions were too finely chopped and added no texture or taste. The meat patties were not well formed from the start. COLLAPSED. The tomato was basically mush. COLLAPSED. The buns were far from made of steel. COLLAPSED. All in all it was Culinary 9/11. The lettuce tried valliantly but in vain to hold the whole thing together. When it failed I felt so sorry for it. Sorry folks, you are not getting a burger here. What you are getting is a steaming load of something that looks much like it came from a soiled diaper. NOTE TO BURGER MEISTER: If I ever want my food in a predigested state I will ask for it that way. 

The fries on the other hand were perfectly cut, perfectly fried and perfectly salted. No ketchup or other condiments are necessary. And the homemade pickles are the real deal. These get 1/2 star each.

Overall, the experience is Pooper Scooper, not Super Duper.
author: Richard F.

description:
I really wonder about this restaurant, because all my friends recommend this restaurant. but when I went there, I'm little bit dissapointed. because it's not sooo good than I expected. I order big buger, but that buger is too oily. I have to choose mini buger. 
but buger taste is nice!
author: Jisun L.

description: I'd seen this place many times walking up and down Market on my lunch break and so I decided to give it a shot.  I ordered a super bacon cheeseburger, fried  and a chocolate milkshake.  The burger was tasty and juicy though the bacon wasn't as present as I would have liked. The fries were above average (better than In-n-Out, for sure) and the shake was cold and creamy.  It cost about $15 for the meal, not bad, but I'm sued to spending less than $10 on lunch.  I would definitely go back if I get a hankering for a tasty burger.
author: Benjamin S.

description:
Pretty fast burger joint that's a healthy version of McDonald's. More like 2.4 stars

FOOD:
Mini burger
$4.50
They lied about having the burger cooked medium. It was well done - just a gray-brown patty of disappointment. The bun was fine - sesame-topped and sufficiently soft. I ordered my burger with lettuce, tomato, and the super sauce. It could have used a little bit more lettuce. The slice of tomato was juicy enough. The sauce was meh, tasting mostly like a mayo with a tangy note. It was spread rather unevenly in my burger, which seems sloppy to me. I also don't like the resulting inconsistent bites.

French fries
$2.00
Thinly cut like McDonald's. Nice and crispy, served warm. Slightly salted. The peel of the potato could still be seen at some of the ends, should you ever question whether or not they use real potatoes.

AMBIANCE: Modern "raw materials" look with mostly concrete, wood, and metal for all interior decorating and furniture. Floors were dirty. I spotted many squished French fries, crumbs, and a Starbucks pastry bag littered on the concrete floor.

SERVICE: Could use more cleaning. The ordering is just like any fast food joint: ordering at the counter, pick up at a designated area, self-busing of trays.

VISIT DETAILS: Low-key Saturday night dinner
author: C L.

description: Maybe the best burger in town!  Soft cone shakes are good, too!
author: Michael W.

description: i ordered their mini burger and garlic fries w/ their lemonade... let's start off with their burger it too was greasy, dry and way too salty. also the price for the mini burger itself was almost 6 bucks. way too much for a mini burger too be honest. i also ordered their garlic fried, i almost died eating this.. way too salty and very very greasy... this place is way too hype and very pricey, i don't see myself coming unless for their dessert. i prefer five guys or in n out fair enough for my pocket... pricey for some organic food..
author: Donna S.

description: Came by for lunch today, had a mini burger, topped with everything plus jalapeño peppers and a side of garlic fries. Pretty tasty, juicy burger but not too seasoned. Garlic fries were crispy and hot, yum! Would def come again.
author: Betty J.

description:
I just moved from Chicago, and I have having a heck of a time finding a decent burger joint in San Francisco.  Super Duper burger advertises sustainable farmed vegetarian fed cows.  But what's the point when the the burgers are so dry and salty yet bland.  I've gone to the new location on Mission St at the Metreon and same thing.  I don't think In-and-Out burger is much better than say a Wendy's burger so I never understood the positive reputation that In-and-Out burger has in CA, but now I'm starting to understand.  It's because of places like Super Duper (sorry In-and-Out fans).  There is so much potential and expectations when you walk up to the register and order.  And then you take a bite and wonder why you didn't go to McDonald's instead.  Oh yeah, the advertisement but "green" cows.  I can't recommend this place at all for burgers.  

I also tried their soft serve, it's what you would expect.  However, it costs $3.25 and up.  Rather pricey when you can pay another dollar and get better tasting frozen dessert at Ghirardelli's'  or Haagen Dazs.  The homemade pickles also are way too sweet.

The positives:  French Fries.  They also have garlic fries if you're into that.  

I'm definitely willing to give their Chicken sandwich a shot someday.  However, AVOID coming here for burgers.  It's not good.  If only it was a Five Guys. . .we can always dream.
author: June P.

description: Gluten free and confused. Before eating here I called and asked if they had a gluten free bun option and they said they did and I was happy. Upon arriving and ordering I double check with the gal taking my order and she said that they didn't have a gluten free bun so I said I called and was told you did have one. She then said yes it's gluten friendly but she usually doesn't say it's gluten free because of cross-contamination that might happen in the kitchen. I ordered it anyways but I was skeptical. While I waited for my food I tried researching online/yelp to see if I could find any info on the bun but had no luck. I got my food had a few bites with the bun but was still worried and removed the bun. The burger was ok nothing amazing and the worry was a total buzz kill. I felt fine and didn't get sick from the few bites I did have of the bun but I won't go back its not worth the risk. Please note I have severe gluten allergies not Celiac disease and I will know within 20mins if I have consumed and will be severely ill for the next 48-72 hours.
author: Onna S.

description: Affordable Niman Ranch burgers!?  The option to get a not ginormous, 4oz patty!?!? A patty that's crispy on the outside and tender on the inside... Mmmmmm.  Only gripe is that the buns weren't toasted.
author: Charles C.

description:
heaven...i'm in heaven and i can eat all the pickles i ever wanted....!
..
sing it
the burgers are outstanding. 
the fries are perfect. 
don't get the garlic fries though, the extra cost for garlic powder isn't worth it and they're fine solo. (i've had both).

.but the burger..wow...yumm perfection. tastes and feels like it is fresh ground...how it crumbles in your hands.  they don't cut corners on the cheese either and the pickles, did i mention the serve yourself endless pickles?

heaven i'm in heaven and my stomach is full of yummy pickles
but if summer does arrive soon in SF, I will also try their organic milkshake
author: shanestar h.

description: The cheeseburger and fries were worth every calorie consumed. Nuff said!
author: Lynn C.

description: I've had better. Nothing special here except paying a healthcare SF tax.
author: Steven F.

description: Fantastic food.  Super burger with cheese and bacon plus a side of garlic fries.  It was 6 hours ago but I am still thinking about it.  Hit the tip jar with more than a dollar for these proper folks.
author: Pete S.

description:
Bloody burger, hair in fries and a rude manager named Ryan.  Super Burger got our order wrong twice and sent us out a bloody burger for our 10 year old to eat.  When we asked Ryan the manager to have our  burger cooked medium instead of rare he  was extremely rude, told us to wait in line to have our burger redone ( we had already waited 20 minutes) and gave us attitude for the restaurant's mistake.  
Would never recommend this place and will never go again!
author: m b.

description:
I finally got to try this place and it was so delicious!  I got here around 2:45 and the line was really short and moved quickly.  Their menu has a good amount of variety and their pickles are made there.  I got the mini burger (single pattie) with bacon and cheese and it was so good.  The pattie had a great beef taste and it was juicy and perfect.  The bacon was crispy and I liked that  it was not just a strip so when you bit into it the whole piece would come out too.  Overall, the burger was really delicious.  I also got fries and their lemonade.  The fries were pretty good, crispy and not too salty.  Their lemonade is made with brown sugar and i could really taste the brown sugar in the after taste.  The lemonade was not too sour and just tart enough.  In my excitement to try Super Duper, I forgot to add an egg on my burger! Next time. Also, my friend got a chocolate shake, it was a little pricy but really good.   

I will definitely come back and try other things on the menu.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Super Duper has good, old fashioned, no nonsense burgers complimented by great fries. Only problem is the difficulty in finding seating for parties larger than 4.
author: Callie R.

description: Mini burger is the right size for lunch.  This place is very popular, so avoid the peak traffic around noon.  Even at 1:10 pm, it still took me 10 min in line,  10 min for food.  Compared to typical fast food chain, Super Duper definitely has the edge.  I still want an In-n-Out in the area...
author: Steven M.

description: Super Duper is an ESTABLISHMENT.  The burger was juicy and succulent, the fries sturdy and salty, but the service...the service put it ABOVE and beyond.  The staff was personable, efficient, and genuine, something I hadn't really thought about until they asked me such a simple question: "How's your day been?"  I should have responded with, "Better, now that I've got one of your burgers."
author: Michael D.

description: Had high expectations from friends. Kind of disappointed. The menu on the wall said the burgers are cooked medium by default and mine was more well done. That's a big no no to me at a nice burger joint that only does burgers. Got the super duper burger that has 2 patties but they were squished super flat like in n out. Not too hard to cook that to medium in my opinion. It was tasty just wasn't amazeballs. Then the garlic fries...so many good reviews on it how was I not to try them? Much salty. Many raw. It was garlicky for sure. But in a bad way. It was like it wasn't cooked long enough and it still had its raw spiciness and was covered in unmelted cheese. Gotta say it wasn't my cup of tea. Much rather have gotten regular fries. House made pickles didn't blow my mind but were good. Basic. I'll probably give it another shot down the road before ruling this place out. But after this trip, it definitely hasn't knocked off my top contender of roam artisan burger.
author: Eugene H.

description: Burger was a bit dry. I had to use tons of ketchup. Shake was terrible and costed nearly as much as the burger (6.00). Tasted warm and flat. Go to In-N-Out if you want better food that cost a lot less.
author: James V.

description:
I had a meat fix so I went here to have my cravings satisfied. I had a super combo: a two patty burger with everything on it (I actually added another patty just for the hell of it), some fries and a fountain soda. I love how they asked if cooking my burger to medium would be okay. When do you hear that in a fast food restaurant? You won't get that in McDonalds!

So I absolutely enjoyed my burger: it is definitely on the sloppy side since the burger basically melts in your mouth, so maybe you should avoid wearing white if you are going to try this out. The fries, well, pretty underwhelmed with the fries. I'll probably stick with the burger in the future.

However, Super Duper does its job: a fast food burger that's a few steps above McDonalds
author: Kay A.

description: Lines are the only thing preventing this from a 4 star review! I do like the burgers here - a cut above average and are of the in and out thin patty type. Garlic fries are tasty and crisp - not the disgusting things served at AT&T park. Also....milkshakes! :)
author: Jennifer C.

description: Amazing burgers, fries and garlic fries with all dipping sauces, shakes, sundae with bacon!  I give fours stars because the burger is pretty greasy and when you are eating it, it just drips grease.
author: Sandra F.

description:
Im a burger fanatic and i have to say this is one GOOD burger!!! For $10.50 you get 2 4 oz patties with cheese, fries and a drink. you can sub your fries and drink for a lil extra charge to garlic fries. your fountain drink for a milkshake or even better a beer. Next time im in the city i will be back for another Juicy burger!!!
IF YOU WANT A GOOD BURGER THIS IS THE SPOT!!
author: melinda f.

description: Really good chicken sandwiches and delicious homemade pickles. Also appears to be a popular hangout for hipsters .
author: Catherine W.

description:
this place is surprisingly good - better than five guys!!!

the meat has seasoning and is so juicy and tasty!!!
author: Trader H.

description: Very good food & excellent service. The company should promote Stephen who works at this particular location, or at least give him a raise to reward his excellent customer service abilities.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: Solid burgers and fries. Open late. It's a solid combination. I'll have to come back to try their egg sandwich.
author: Sean P.

description: Picked up Super Duper for a quick lunch and was quite surprised. Really liked the fries and the veggie burger was great. Service was friendly too. Got it to go but next time I might stay in because it was a cute little shop.
author: Erin C.

description: Really good burgers at a good price came here on a Saturday and it was packed. Hate to come here during the weekdays. Good fast service. Very good place will b back soon.
author: George E.

description:
Finally stopped in here today and the line was about 15 people deep. it moves pretty fast but at the front of the line there's a sign that the wait will be about 10 minutes for you to get your food. It was closer to 15mins, but definitely not over that and for peak lunchtime hours on a weekday, what do you expect?

I thought the staff were fine, not overly friendly, but definitely asked 'how are you?', etc so wasn't the same poor vibe others got. There's plenty of seating, even at busy lunchtime, although sometimes you need to hover over people finishing up if you want a table outside on one of the few 80 degree days like today!

I thought the burger was great! Maybe not as much flavor as In n Outs meat, but still very good. I got the bigger 8oz burger as despite a fairly small size, I can eat quite a bit. This, along with fries, was probably a bit on the heavy side and with the good quality of the toppings, I think I could probably do a mini in the future (it's actually 2 separate burger patties if you get the 8oz). I had mine with bacon (they were very generous and it was thick and good quality), cheese, also generous, jalepenos (thick and fresh) and tomatoes (ripe) and lettuce (crisp and actually green - not that cheap iceburg stuff or limp leaves you get elsewhere). Together it was delish and the bun was good as well, I guess only thing to note is that even by the time I sat down to take my first bite, the paper holding it was wet so it's quite greasy.

The fries are great, I think I like them better than In n Outs, they have more flavor and are perfectly salted. It's quite the meal though and I don't even want to know how many calories let alone sodium -- I have down about 48 oz of water in about 2.5 hours since lunch and am still thirsty, but I guess that's how it goes!

Not sure this is my top burger spot, but it is really good and I'll definitely be taking my husband here to check it out. The location on market st is convenient although like I mentioned, can get quite crazy at lunchtime. Still, you can be in and out (sitting down to eat) in about 35-40 minutes.
author: Lauren M.

description: I like the vibe and decor of this place, but the burgers are okay....I just got the mini burger with garlic fries and the garlic fries were a little disappointing. I do want to give this place another shot though considering I love burgers so maybe next time I'll get their burger that comes with a fried egg on top. I'll let you guys know how that goes....
author: Diane L.

description: WOW, their homemade pickles are out of this world!! (and I don't even really like pickles) My bf and I loved their burgers and the location is right next to the shopping area in SF. Would love to go there again. (and Yes, it is comparable to 5 guys burger and the counter.
author: Alice S.

description:
I'm no "burger connoisseur", but I know what I like. This place makes quality burgers. The free burger was small, this is true, but it was a mini burger. Makes sense for a free giveaway. The fries were not so greasy that they stuck together or dripped oil, in fact the oil was so lite that I hardly had to wipe my hands on my napkin.

The veggies were fresh and crisp and just as much a part of the burger as the beef. The beef was juicy, giving it a classic burger drip, and even though I usually  like my burgers cooked well done, the meat was delicious. 

The prices are the best part. I hope this place doesn't fall into the same pattern that so many downtown businesses have. I do believe that a restaurant can have low prices without sacrificing quality. 

As someone who works nights, it is also nice to have a burger joint that stays open passed 5pm.
author: oscar m.

description: While waiting in line to order, I watched an employee jump ontop of both sides of the  soda and condiments  counter to get a jars of pickles and never once thought about hygene nor bothered to wipe it down.  Its his lucky day that I didnt take his picture standing on that counter with his shoes....
author: Lily L.

description: Pardon the Punctuation....If in San Francisco and you want to go into a food coma, mosey on over to Super Duper Burgers for a mouth watering comfort food indulgence. I had the Super Burger with cheddar, bacon and some garlic fries on the side. Of course the Straus creamery chocolate shake to wash them down. All I spent was $15 and this was a steal considering the quality of the products they serve. All of their beef is organic from Niman Ranch and cooked to perfection. Their burger is one of the top ten I've had in my life and is going to be a San Francisco must every time I'm in town.
author: Eddie Z.

description: Burgers were Freakin Awesome, price was good and the service was hella fast.  I would recommend this place to anyone
author: Franky C.

description:
I hadn't had a burger I liked in 17 years, until I tried Super Duper's double. Holy crap it's good. 

Fantastic milkshakes! I HIGHLY recommend the chocolate-strawberry, made with real strawberries.
The milkshakes are gluten-free (except for the cookie one), as well as their softserve Ice cream. (I had to contact both super duper and Straus who provides their softserve to find this out.)

Atmosphere: loud music, so prepare for that.
author: Lady A.

description: Yum yum yum.   Great burgers.  And I love their buns.  But, dude, don't go there in a hurry!!!  It took 20 min for them to get me a chicken sandwich last week; a weeknight around 8pm.  It was very annoying because I just popped in there and wanted to get out fast.
author: Sam O.

description: I have long been a fan of the Castro Super Duper and this one seems like the hip cousin. Same burgers and re-fill sodas, just in a jazzed up setting.  Of course at Third and Market you've got your collection of unsavory characters, but that just makes it a bit more interesting.
author: Robert M.

description: I'll be honest: we went there for the dipped cones. They're big and tasty, & remind me of my childhood and the beach.  In my defense, we had just eaten lunch, otherwise we would've had burgers too - they looked really good.
author: Julie M.

description: Awful service and overpriced, greasy hamburgers. Yuck.
author: Chris B.

description: Decent tasting burger, pretty quick service, and decent garlic fries. It is pricy for a burger joint in my opinion but it will do if you are craving a burger. One downside is that their lemonade was warm and not chilled to begin with, but it was still good once you add ice to it. If you have the time, go to chez maman for a burger, it's worth going to than this place.
author: Tam V.

description: Love the burgers here. I do think it's a little weird to have 2- 4oz. patties make up a super burger and 1 makes up a tiny one. Never been anywhere that does that. Of course, that doesn't change the fact that the burgers are yummy! The fries are okay. The soft serve is really great! Perfect for a warm day.
author: cyndi L.

description: I had their soft serve here, which is creamy and delish. Came for dinner the other night and it was really good. The fries were yummy and my veg burger was great! The perfect size. My dining partner loved his burger, but it was a little on the small side. Great place for a quick bite.
author: J E.

description: Their cookies n cream milkshake tastes ok . I think it's kinda cool how their portabella sandwich doesn't really taste like mushroom at all . However , it's a little too salty .
author: Eileen L.

description: This place is definitely super duper. Had the mini burger (just one patty) with cheese and bacon, fries, gherkin and home-made lemonade. The buns were great, slightly sweet and soft, perfect with the juicy burger and salty bacon. Tomato slices were fresh and added a nice taste to the burger. Service with a smile and def one of the tastiest burgers I've had!
author: Thais D.

description: I know this is a burger place and I did try a bite of my husbands burger and the bit I tasted was good. But .... my 4 stars are for the garlic fries and for the huge yummy chocolate dipped ice-cream cone.
author: Karen F.

description: I went here last week for a family trip here. It was the first time I ever went here. I ordered a veggie burger and it was delicious. I have to admit it was better than my mom's. The proportion was great too because it wasn't like a big fat burger but rather a small size which is good if people are concerned about watching what they eat. If I go to San Francisco again I would definitely go here again.
author: Tammy Y.
