description: If u wanna get sick or throw up go here yack. Got sick and threw up in union square and had a stomach ache for 3 hours. Super duper sick n trust me u need to do a super duper #2
author: Len A.

description: Update: the chicken sandwich is not bad but the veggie burger with avocados still rocks my world! Looking forward to the Marina location!
author: Sarah Z.

description: Burgers r good except for the thick buns. Do not get the the chocolate dipped soft serve ice creAm.  The guy gave me a mushed up ice cream stuck on a plastic cup saying that the chocolate is too hot so he can't dip it.  That totally defeats the purpose of what I paid for. I mean instead of being helpful he just didn't care.  They should not be serving or selling a product that they can't deliver.  The soft serve tasted like some nonfat icecream. Do not get their frozen yogurt. .
author: Young K.

description:
disappointing......

got portobello added to my burger. good but not great

liked that there were free pickles.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Basically an in-n-out in the city. Tastes the same, costs twice as much, and enough oil drips out of the burger that you can no doubt fill a soda can with it. I've never imagined it possible that food can be so damn greasy... as someone that cares deeply for my health, I will never set foot inside this chain again, ever.

Time: lunch
Food: super beef burger, french fries
Price: ~$10/person after tax. No tip.
author: Jack W.

description: Good if you want an extremely greasy burger. Probably a lot better if i had been drunk.
author: Sean C.

description:
Fast food, period.  Has a similar feeling to Danny Meyers' Shake Shack, but a much wider selection, for which I was grateful.  

My boyfriend and I each had a chicken sandwich- chicken was cooked perfectly, nice and moist.  We also shared a Caesar salad, but the dressing wasn't mixed in, which was disappointing.   

Still wonder what Cafe Dolci, (Vietnamese sandwich shop across the street, which we found is closed on weekends,) would have been like...
author: Gabriella K.

description: While I group this with In N Out and Five Guys, it's nearly impossible to compare the 3.  They each have their own separate flare and selling point, and where Super Duper excels is by sheer variety (and the option of a fried egg).  Having a pretty good selection of food, including chicken burgers, my cheeseburger with a fried egg was pretty damn good, though messy.  I think I ended up having more yolk on my hand than in my mouth :(  Believe it or not, the only reason that this didn't get a 5 star rating was because I was looking for more taste out of their secret sauce.  The dab that I was given tasted good, but was lost in the sea of egg yolk, juicy meat patty, and bacon.
author: Jeff N.

description: My new favorite burger place! be warned that eating the burgers can be quite a challenge cause it is really sloppy.
author: Terry S.

description:
Decent burgers.
Good ambience, the line moves fast, and even when it's crowded it's not hard to sit down.  
The food?  Had the 4 oz burger (sizeable for being called a "mini" burger) and fries.  Um, ok.  I'll leave it at that :)  Well, I guess to be more specific, I wish the meat was more juicy and the cheese less congealed.  And the fries more fried.
author: Cathy L.

description: High quality meat, great atmosphere, delicious pickles and one of the best vanilla milkshakes around! If you're in the mood for a good burger and a shake, this is the place to go.
author: Jessica L.

description: Been here a few times. It is really close to work. Lines are long during lunch time but the line goes pretty fast. I had both the mini burger and the super burger. The difference is an extra patty. I enjoy the mini one more. It holds together better. The double patty seem to make it a bit more oily and wet. Seating is a bit hard during lunch time.
author: Louis T.

description: Hella-good burgers. Went around lunchtime. So there was a line but all good becuz SuperDuper pass out some free fries for the wait. Definitely going back.
author: Willy L.

description:
This place should be called SUPER DUPER FAIL, its a Tuesday evening, around 6pm. We walk into this place, its moderately crowded with about 3 people in front of us. We walk up to the counter and lo and behold a trainee is working tonight... GREAT. It's cool to train people, but when you get my order wrong and overcharge me, that irks me a little bit, how hard is it to program a combo button into your little machine? So instead of charging me for 2 combo meals, you charge me for 3 combo meals, in my mind, I'm going, umm, this doesnt add up, 10+10 = 20, with substitutions we had, it was 10.75+10.75+1+tax would be roughly $25-26, how in the world did you charge me $34??? There goes my night. 

And on top of everything, you dont ask how I would like my burger cooked, you dont ask what toppings I would like. The burger comes out greasy like the fonz just combed through it, I felt like I was eating butter and oil the entire time. The garlic fries tasted like it came from the microwave dusted with some cheese. 

ZERO STARS, disappointed, ruined my night. DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE, GO TO A REAL BURGER JOINT, HELL, MAKE YOUR OWN BURGERS AT HOME INSTEAD!
author: Thomas J.

description: Great burger combo with choice of different house sauces for your fries.
author: David Z.

description: I came to this restaurant right after the airport, mini burgers are extremely delicious with fresh ingredients and juicy sauce. Don't miss the home made pickles.
author: Ghada A.

description: Cashier was a rude ass, but malt, fries and burger were ok...in that order. The burger actual wasn't anything too special.
author: Scott M.

description: A friend of mine ate here a few weeks ago and she suggested we grab lunch here.  I've walked by Super Duper a bunch of times since they opened, but I've kept saying I'll drop in another time.  The line was almost to the door, but it moved really fast!  So don't let the line deter you.  The staff seemed pretty nice and upbeat.  We each had a mini cheeseburger and shared an order of garlic fries.  I didn't add any of the optional toppings, maybe next time.  I was satisfied with my burger and walked away pleased.  It was filling and wasn't overcooked, which is a plus.  I like the interior of this location, definitely worth at least a try.
author: Cee D.

description: I'm all for Super Duper! I've been lucky in catching a bite when it's not too busy or just before the line starts to peek out the door. I feel that the burgers are a little more flavorful than most of your other typical fast food places, and exceptionally juicy as well. Don't forget to add one of Super Duper's signature sauces. Some advice, if your taking it to go expect to wait about 10 minutes.
author: AJ V.

description: Super Duper is astonishingly good value for the quality of the food and the care in preparation. The burger is juicy and well-seasoned, the bun and condiments offered are excellent. The fries are a bit disappointing, but that's not why you came here anyways. For $10 or so for the whole package, you would be hard-pressed to find this kind of value in San Francisco. It is also a bit noisy inside.
author: Dave B.

description: Meh.  There was nothing wrong with the food or the service, but it didn't live up to the hype either.  The burger was somewhat greasy.  The fries were good, but nothing special.
author: Kristal D.

description: After eating the "mini" cheeseburger here it's easy to see why we are the fattest country in the world.  Nothing mini about it!  The burgers are hella greasy so you may or may not like that.
author: Roger H.

description: Nice spot...menu is simple..burgers are juicy...price is moderate...after work is a nice relaxing vibe...next time I'll try and go during the day when the weather is nice...I'm sure the crowd will be a lot more lively.
author: Aaron B.

description: Pretty "meh" for me.  I really disliked my chicken burger.  It was pounded out pretty thin and the chipotle aioli tasted a bit funny.  The cheeseburger was okay as were the fries and chocolate shake.  I wasn't blown away and I probably won't be back.  The homemade pickles were pretty good, though.
author: Jordan F.

description: extremely expensive but superb burgers.  i am still not sure if i like the fried egg on top, but definitely adds a differentiating factor.  the garlic fries are pretty good - but very garlic-y
author: Amanda C.

description: OMG...I feel like Barney saying "Super Dee Duper!"...but it is true, this is a super duper place to get a fat a$$ burger. What I love is that this place is kind of bad for you but you feel kind of good going because its super hipster, they recycle all of the trash (so its not really trash right?). The menu is simple and I highly recommend getting the $10 lunch combo (double burger, fries and a drink). The burger is greasy but flavorful, the veggies are phresh and the fries are crispy, and sugar/salty. I can't really think of a better place to get a burger.
author: Sarah M.

description: Went here around 2pm and there was still a sizable line that shrunk pretty quickly.  Went for the mini burger and garlic fries.  Loved it.  The meat was seasoned incredibly well and it is certainly not a place where the condiments and toppings are asked to do the culinary heavy lifting.  Would definitely go back and would definitely recommend to customers.  Also, despite me being unable to realize that combos exist, the cashier was extremely cordial and friendly.
author: Robert I.

description: I LOVE this place!! The burgers are delicious, they make their own pickles, the soft-serve is amazing and they have racer 5 on tap! What else can you ask for?! The fries are not my favorite but who needs fries when you have pickles!!!! I have been here twice and loved both experiences. Today Super Duper impressed me even more when the person who called my name to give me my food remembered my name and came up to my table to ask me and my friend how the food was. Bonus points for remembering my name!
author: Marta W.

description: I rounded them up to three stars only because it was opening day and there is maybe some potential here.  However, the experience being what it was, I was sooo disappointed.  I waited for 20 minutes to get my small portion of dried out french fries and under-cooked "super" burger.  I'd wait another 5 minutes to know that my burger would be cooked.  Complimentary pickles and quality ingredients don't make up for the bad experience.  I'll repost if I go back and have a better outcome.  Back to Crocker Galleria I go...
author: Dennis H.

description: I had not a single complaint from my visit to Super Duper! First off, I loved the fresh pickles packed in house! With a hint of salt, I couldn't stop eating these suckers! The burger itself tasted great. Great sauce on the burger and everything tasted fresh. Watch out for the lunch crowd, it gets super duper packed! Great alternative to your regular fast food joints.
author: TJ B.

description: The meat is super duper. Not the most super duper I've ever had. Salad was just some iceberg and carrots with a not-good caesar dressing. Fries were nice and salty and crunchy. They have a nice composting and recycling program and the guys at the counter are cute.
author: K G.

description: This place totally deserves and average of 4 stars; the burgers really are super duper. They are moist and delicious :). AND the fries come with yummy dipping sauces - there are at least three kinds. Totally recommend stopping in here when you are in a rush and want fast food that doesn't taste like fast food.
author: Turi F.

description: This was a tasty burger! A super duper burger even. Really enjoyed it and maybe loved the garlic fries even more. Definitely worth a try!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Decent burgers but not great, and very greasy. The fries are okay but nothing special.
author: Jim T.

description: Burger was yummy!  Fries were ok, but not superb.  The service was fast, friendly, and I can't wait to go back and try the ice cream.  :)
author: Jo S.

description: Burgers are hella good... minus 1 star only because of portion size.. Well worth the wait and price...
author: Verlee V.

description: Yummo! Stopped in last night for dinner. Ordered the cookies and cream shake mixed hard, mini cheese burger, portobello sammie, and garlic fries. we devoured everything. fries were spot on. mini burger was the perfect portion for me (who didn't want to overdo it on the calories). milkshake was smooth and creamy and yes, you could definitely taste the booze. and the portobello was SO good with avocado added to it - gave it extra creaminess. yum. i'll be back.
author: laura f.

description: 3+ stars for Super Duper, haha.  It's a solid burger, and pretty reasonably priced for what you get.  It was a little heavy on the greasiness I suppose, but it was tasty.  I got it "with everything on it" and that was a good choice.  Eh, not much to say about this place other than, if you want a burger near Union Square this would be a great place to go.
author: David W.

description: I championed the deliciousness of Super Duper so much at my company that we ordered it for the whole office. They were subsequently quite rude to our poor office manager who had to order and pick it up, plus there were a whole bunch of mistakes and a few entirely missing orders. If you cannot accommodate an advance order of 15 burgers without great difficulty, please just say so and don't be passive-aggressive about it.
author: Connor Skye R.

description: Portobello burger loaded is scrumptious, fries are hand cut with skins still on and a perfect accompaniment. Homemade pickles are awesome. Highly recommend this eatery for a quick and  yummy lunch or dinner. Didn't try the ice cream but was told it's really good.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: Awesome burger! The meat was hot greasy goodness! And the bun was good too! Killer fries! Dillin pickles! Had a slight problem with the little bootch who took my order though. She didn't give me a receipt after I paid. Then I saw her give everyone else receipts after me. I went back and asked for my receipt, and she snapped back telling me I didn't need it. If I'm gonna be standing around for ten minutes waiting for my food, I want my receipt as proof of payment just in case they lose my order or something. And why the hale did she give everyone else their receipts but me? So, I demanded my receipt. She finally gave it to me...it was freakin just sitting there, one receipt, next to her register! Fuggin bootch.
author: Peter M.

description:
Long wait, few options and the options we did ask for were completely messed up.  I tried the burger and the chicken sandwich but not the milkshake.  The burger was slightly above average and the chicken sandwich was below average, rather boring and lacking flavor.

In Summary, if you want good burgers, go to Roam or The Counter.  If you want good burger value, go to In N Out or Fatburger.
author: Rob G.

description: Great garlic fries! Mine were so garlicy, just the way I like them. Burgers are good too, but mine was a little too greasy (maybe just that day?) for me to finish.
author: Puneet S.

description: The burgers taste like they were cooked at home! Yum... a mini is plenty, great with cheddar, everything on it and avocado. Try the homemade pickles, and a spiked strawberry chocolate milk shake! Go for garlic fries over regular and splurge on the dipping sauces (2 of 3 are worth it). Ate twice during my stay in SF.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Juicy, quality medium-rare meat, housemade pickles, AND you can put an egg on it?? The Strauss ice cream milkshakes is also the perfect dessert. Sorry in-n-out, I think I found a new fast food favorite.
author: RJ C.

description: Can you say juicy?  These guys know how to cook their burgers! You are able to customize your burger and add specialty items such as avocado at a nominal fee.  Their fries are crispy and delicious.  It is a bit pricey, however it's not often that you are able to find a quality burger, fries and shake.  This is a must try if you haven't yet.
author: Brett F.

description: The Castro location is a favorite dinner spot. This new location is super duper convenient for lunch for me (it's on the same block as my office). That is both awesome and worrisome.
author: Robert L.

description:
I had pretty high expectations for this place but was disappointed.

The veggie burgers are tiny, overcooked, dry and over priced.  The service is great but the food is below average, at best.  I'm going to reserve complete judgement until I try their fries and shakes.
author: Mack D.

description:
Super Duper salt lick. The burger was dry but somehow had more grease than a McDonald's kitchen. We kept having to go back for "napkins" and ketchup. Good quality meat but lacked the additives to make it worth eating. 

French fries were good.
author: Julia H.

description:
the 3 rules of super duper:

1. GET THE PICKLES. [if you're a fan of pickles] this place is it. pickles pickles pickles; they are delightful, delicious, and, of course, FREEEEE :D it's a good filler while you wait for your order, because they certainly do get busy around the lunchtime rush. even if you come at 3PM! they're still pretty full sometimes.

2. EXPECT a juicy, but greasy beeeeeef patties. this beef is the real deal! it'll dribble grease and juiciness all down your hands and arms and maybe even onto your clothes if you're as messy as i am ^_^ but it's definitely worth it. sooooo good. with bacon and cheeeeeeeese. yum yum yum. of course, it's not a good idea if you're looking to lose inches from your waistline, but hey, we all need our indulgences right??

3. if you think you'll have room [rarely happens] forgo the [average] fries and GET A SUPER SHAKE! :D share with a friend if you think you're about to burst. cookies and cream is sooooo delicious, you just might have to drink dessert first.  sure fries are good, but really nothing extraspectacular and you'll find that the creamy coldness of a shake is perfect to wash down that thick coating of cheese, bacon, and grease that's attached itself to the insides of your mouth and throat.

final thoughts: :) yum! this is a wonderful, juicy, filling treat every once in a short while. the burgers are irresistible and the shakes are a delightful complement. worth the money, no doubt! if torn between In-N-Out and Super Duper, i think Super Duper is the better choice! also, extra points for being VERY environmentally friendly!
author: Jane S.

description:
I like the fact that all their packaging/utensils are either compostable or reusable. That's really great for the environment and other places should do the same thing. Also, their veggie burgers are pretty good and the staff is generally friendly... 

BUT...

They keep screwing things up.

I've been to this location as well as the one in the Castro and at both locations I had problems with not getting what I ordered. One time, I ordered a veggie burger and got a regular (beef) burger instead. Good thing I noticed before I took a bite. They apologized and promptly replaced my burger but put cheese on it which was not what I ordered. Whatevs, this kind of stuff happens sometimes. 

Then, a week or so later, I get my burger, sit down on one of those tall chairs. It's missing part of a leg so I almost fall to my death (slight exaggeration). Then I proceed to take a bite and notice that the taste is off. I take the burger apart and, well, there is no veggie patty in there.... Uhm, what? 
I go back to the counter and someone from the kitchen walks toward me with the patty and hands it to me. I must have looked confused because an employee (supervisor?) talking to someone by the register noticed and asked me if something was wrong. I politely said "The patty's missing." She doesn't really react but the kitchen employee silently takes my tray and motions for me to sit down. 10 minutes later I get my burger with a side of "Sorry about that." So yeah... Mistakes happen but there's so many places to get veggie burgers these days I don't know if this place will be my first choice in the future.
author: Patrick W.

description: went here because I could not think of anything else. I think it was good. The garlic fries were garlic fries and the burger was tasty. Price can get steep!!! I took a star off because the lemonade was tart as hell!!! Ain't no amount of brown sugar gonna sweeten up that mess.
author: Ant B.

description: Lines are a bit too long for me, but the burgers are good - esp. with the fried egg!
author: Scott C.

description: This is my new Favorite burger place! Burger was juicy, well cooked and the fries are good too! I'm coming for more!
author: Christian P.

description: This restaurant is amazing! It is a very modern and well run restaurant.  The food is amazing and the people are very nice.  I recommend the chocolate shake it is superb.  It is definitely a good alternative over any fast food restaurant.
author: Matthew T.

description: This was close to a four - which is tough for a burger joint.  I give them credit for providing more options than a typical burger place, even an upscale one.  Lots of options for your burger construction.  I would say that Pearl's burger is tastier - but Super Duper is more user-friendly.  The garlic fries are very good, the shakes are good, but nothing to write home about and the salad that we had to go along with the burger was surprisingly good and actually a decent value at just under 6 bucks.  It was enough for 4 people to share as a side dish.  Unless you are really hungry, i suggest you go with the single patty burger.  It's plenty.  The one thing we thought was "weak" were the chocolate dipped soft serve ice cream cones.  Nice idea - but poor execution.  The chocolate shell didn't set well and ice cream came dripping through almost immediately.  Not even close to what you can get all day long at a normal Dairy Queen.  Kind of a shame when you figure that this is not exactly a new invention.  I hope they figure out how to fix this.  We gave it two tries on two separate days with exactly the same results.  But we'll be eating again here for sure.  We liked it overall.
author: Lewis C.

description: Was visiting SFO this w/e and tried this place for lunch between quick break at the conference. Clean/friendly atmosphere and quick service. I am vegetarian and the veggie burger was awesome! No frills place with limited choices (GREAT though) - get your burger and be happy!
author: Mandar P.

description: Really good garlic and parmesean fries. Really good burgers, too. The minis are enough. The regular burger is too big if you get fries, too. The place is quick and easy and they have good deals during the day... Yum.
author: christine c.

description: Only came here for their organic choco-dipped ice cream cone, but it was still super duper!  Yet to try their burgers, let alone their garlic fries, but I could see coming back.
author: Garett T.

description: The double-cheeseburger I got was tasty enough, but it was SOOO greasy I literally had to wipe my hands and mouth after every bite. The combo meal was $12 (included fries and a drink) -- not a criminal price but I could get the exact same meal that's as good or (IMO) better at In-N-Out for about half the price. Thus, overall, it's the very definition of three stars by the Yelp scale. It's "A-OK."
author: Ryan M.

description: So good, the burger is one of the best I've ever had and the cookies and cream milkshake is to die for. This place is definatly worth a try.
author: Angela B.

description: Disappointed! Line was long, but did go fast. Place was rather messy - tables dirty and cluttered with garbage. Not a ton of seating. Waited 10min for food. Ordered 4oz mini burger. GREASY! Kinda yuck. The hamburger bun was saturated. : / Smothered in their special sauce - 1,000 island type sauce. I ordered well-done and got more like medium. I hate seeing ANY red in my meat. I ate around it. Burger tasted alright, but not my favorite. Ordered garlic fries and they were promising until they get to the table and their the thin thin thin shoestring fries. Ugh. They don't hold heat well and by the time they reach your table they are already hard and taste old and not fresh. So overall disappointed. Kinda pricey here for the value you receive. I did order my teen a choc shake and she liked it. I also got a vanilla organic ice cream cone. It was good - soft serve is kinda the same wherever so anyways. When in SF I prolly won't be back rather will probably try somewhere else new. I will say that staff was very nice and professional. Very efficient in order taking. An hour after meal I def felt BLAH and bloated. Just can't handle all the grease! Oh well this place just isn't for me.
author: Heather M.

description: Yummy!  Great burgers and homemade pickles. But the absolute best part is the garlic cheese fries. Amazing!!!  Bring some mints. :)
author: Theresa B.

description: Tried their veggie burger and it tasted like a very dip fried crunchy falafel w/o much flavor.  I'll try their regular burger next time...
author: Stefano G.

description:
Pretty average burger joint. Been here twice now; got the bacon cheeseburger once and tried the chicken sandwich the second time. The burger was right on par with a fast-food style burger, although fairly greasy and made me sleepy after wards. The chicken wasn't to my liking, but I think it was personal taste for whatever spices they put on it more than anything. 

Everything else about this place is good, fries, shakes, beer, etc. I give it 3 stars only because it's just nothing special. If you're just looking for a quick burger & fries, this is a great place to stop by.
author: Luke S.

description: I LOVE their burgers, pickles and garlic fries. Wish I lived in SF for this very reason. GET THE GARLIC FRIES.
author: Evee B.

description: We happened by this place yesterday and innocently stood in line not knowing that it was their opening day. I got the mini burger which was more than sufficient for a lunch. The ice cream concoctions coming through the dining room all looked delish!
author: Tracy A.

description: the burgers were a'ight.  should just call this place a'ight burgers.
author: Michael L.

description: I was walking up Market and my stomach was growling. I was running through all my tried and true food spots when I saw a huge orange sign that said "SUPER DUPER burger" and I just went in. A burger? how could you go wrong? I walked into this place and was immediately greeted by the decor, which is industrial in a sense. I stood back and read over their large overhead menu. This place has basic diner fare (burgers, fries, shakes, soda, sandwiches), but it is not done in that weird you-know-it-was-frozen-and-they-just-microwaved-it way. I ordered the veggie burger, fries, and a fountain drink. It was about $10.00. The girl that rang me up was very helpful and courteous. I got an actual glass for my drink and my food was on a metal tray. The burger was very tasty for a veggie burger. The burger came with hummus, thin cut cucumbers, their sauce, and lettuce on a toasted bun. The serving of fries was huge and I didn't need any salt. The patty itself was not dry and actually had veggies in it. I am definitely going to go back to this place. I would recommend this place to parents with kids that only eat burgers and fries.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Ehh, it was alright.  The first time I tried to come in this place this lady at the door stopped me and asked if I had a ticket because it was a private event only and to come back some other time.  That is kinda annoying and really actually makes me NOT want to ever come back because I think there are about 1 gazillion better burger places in SF that would never have its doors wide open making it seem like its open only to really be open to those lucky few on some exclusive guestlist for an unmarked "private VIP only burger event."  

Anyway, that would have been the end for me except my friend really wanted to try this place.  There was a huge lunch line but we entertained ourselves by practicing flashcards for a test we are studying for.  (That's not added in to make me sound like a huge nerd but to show that we had enough time in line to be bored enough to suggest we take our flashcards out and quiz each other.)  We each got our own burger and shared some garlic fries and a chocolate strawberry shake.  I added grilled onions and cambozola cheese to mine.  I forget what my friend added but he had a double patty one and I went with the regular.  I like to eat my garlic fries with ranch (I like to eat a lot of things with ranch, you should know that about me).  When my friend asked if they had ranch, the person said they only had "Super Sauce, Homemade mayo, and Chipotle" sauce.  When my friend dared to ask if any of those were like ranch, the Super Duper person seemed quite offended.  Really I can understand her reaction because that is pretty outrageous and irritating that my friend would be allowed into this establishment only to insult the restaurant by assuming it might carry a common sauce like RANCH.  It's people like him that force places like this to do invite only eating in the first place. 

The burgers weren't actually that bad but I've had way better burgers before.  The garlic fries were pretty good but really could have used some (dare I say it, yes I do dare say it) RANCH.  I really liked the chocolate strawberry shake..they use real strawberries and the consistency was very nice.  It was light and flavorful.
author: Amber L.

description: After hearing all of the hype I decided to check it out. The burgers and fries tasted fine. The size of 4oz burger was perfect. My only real complaint is that the bun seemed stale. However I do like the selection of food & drinks, the friendly employees, and the general atmosphere of the place.
author: Michael G.

description:
I think this is the best burger in SF for $5!  I'm so disappointed to see all the other reviews that say the quality is inconsistent and grease spills out from their burger.

I've already gone twice and both times it was yummy!  I think of it as a meatier In n Out.  The meat is a bit fresher, juicier, and thicker, and the toppings just make it all even more juicier.  Their sauce is unique Chipotle sauce (kinda orangish like InNOut's too). I think I like In n Outs buns better, but all in all, I would come to Super Duper more than In N Out if I was craving a burger.

Their fries and garlic fries are so so compared to other decent places. Their soft serve is good, but $4 is kinda pricey...

Oh, and this SuperDuper was much better than the original one in the Castro near the Lookout Club.  The one in the Castro was so disappointing-- and had those little bits of rubbery pieces in the meat (fat?  ligaments?)

Here's the rundown: My fav burgers in SF:

Fish&Farm
Farmer Browns
Some Cafe at the corner right in front of the ChinaTown gate (I'll fill this in later)
Super Duper Union Square

And these aren't worth mentioning:
Super Duper at Castro
The Bar on King street near the Park
The other hamburger place at the Beacon
Marlowe (although they were voted really well.  I did get my burger medium rare, twice, so maybe that was the problem)
author: Cathy U.

description: I love this place. Their burgers are made from niman ranch cattle which always transforms anything they're served with into an aphrodisiac.
author: Dmitri S.

description: The burgers are really good as is the service. They also apparently use high quality ingredients. I would give them 5 stars if they didn't call their normal size burger a "mini" burger.  That's just socially irresponsible. One burger is not a "mini" portion, especially if you usually eat it with fries! I emailed them about this and never got a response.
author: Julia W.

description:
Went here for the first time on 10/13. Had the portobello sandwich ($5.50), fries ($2), and chocolate shake with malt ($4.75 + .50). Portobello was breaded and deep-fried, but still juicy and tasty inside. Fries were so skinny most of the pieces looked like the dregs from a regular order of fries. The chocolate shake with malt was tasty, but really, the price is ridiculous. With tax, my total bill was $13.83.

Anyway, I went back the next day because I had a craving for the portobello sandwich, and this time, I swear, it looked so much smaller, like a mini burger. What's going on? Are they skimping on portion sizes already?
author: Food L.

description: Being from L.A. and missing Fatburgers, this place filled a void. The burgers are great, the fries reminiscent of In n Out and the lemonade with brown sugar all hit the spot!
author: Greg J.

description: The mini burger with added avocado was juicy and tasted so good. The lemonade is made with brown sugar. It looks thick and dark. Good, not great. Get the fries with the 3 dipping sauces. Having beer available was appreciated. I wanted a soft serve ice cream cone, but was too full. Such a long line.
author: lisa j.

description: Large portions and free toppings make this place a winner. The burger is also just as juicy as they advertise, and the pickles are addicting. I just wish the meat had more seasoning, but once I added the chipotle sauce, I was in heaven.
author: Janet R.

description: This is my happy meal :)  The burger is super juicy (so need lots of napkins) and one of the best I've had. I am not a burger connoisseur but I have pretty high standards and this hits the spot.
author: JT T.

description: every flippin time i get food from this location, it's missing something or tastes like crap. today, paid for bacon on 2 sandwiches. no bacon on either. no sauce. the burger is just a patty with a bun. it's dry as f*. i hate this super duper burger, it's dirty, the staff is lousy and rude do not go to this location. I created a Yelp account for the sole purpose of writing this specific review, it's that bad.
author: Antoinette J.

description: Great burgers for a fair price. Worth the visit for sure and I will certainly be back in the future.
author: Darin B.

description: Delicious! It seems there burgers aren't normally cooked well-done, so be sure and ask for it well-done unless you like medium to medium rare hamburger patties.
author: Brandon L.

description:
This place is an embarrassment to San Francisco. Their burgers are dry even as they are raw in the middle. The wait time is as slow as spit and the folks at the food window are yelling out names while you try to eat which to me feels like I'm sitting in a barn. The ice cream is watery and sour, it doesn't do any good to use ice milk and sell it as ice cream because it's not cream.

This establishment is a waste of time and energy and is extremely overpriced. Two "ice milk cones" for almost 7$ is outrageous in this economy, or any economy. My kids now call this place " Pooper Scooper." it's that bad.

Don't waste a dime here, go to Mcdonalds!
author: kat l.

description:
My son and I go to San Francisco every 2-3 months and play tourist. We were walking from the mall to the Ferry Building. We saw this place and decided to stop. He got the 8oz burger, I got the chicken. My son added bacon and cheese, I ordered mine as is. With his combo and my water our bill was $20, a little steep for lunch but its fine. 
My sandwhich was decent, not the best not the worst. My son said his burger was one of the best he ever had. The fries are OK, not something I would crave. Next time I will try a burger for sure.
author: Andrea C.

description: reminds me of shake shack.  menu has got the burger, got the shakes, and even the wine offerings.  the super burger here is a nice size, the patties are cooked on the flat grill so they retain all their juices.  it's a messy burger with less tomato and lettuce compared to shake shack.  if you want a burger that is oily but juicy, then this is it.  the chocolate strawberry shake is not as good as the shake shack frozen custards
author: Rob C.

description: Tried this place on a weekend trip to the City. It was one of the best and juiciest burgers I've ever had. I ordered the regular (8 oz) burger with cheese. Simply delicious!!! The fries weren't that great, but average. I will definitely be back for the burgers though!
author: Mark S.

description: blue cheese+ burger +add on veggie patty! perfect combination with some garlic fries on the side. get it.... amazing flurry of assorted flavors packed into a single burger. terrible name for a restaurant, but the food makes up for it.
author: Jason W.

description:
Went in on a Sat after the gym (I know, burger after the gym--whatever) and it was EMPTY. After seeing the lines during the week at lunchtime I was excited to finally try this place without having to wait an hour.

The counter service was great, very friendly, but that's where it stops. My vanilla shake was brown and they said that there was a mix-up with the ice cream and that the chocolate was working it's way through. Tasted it and it was more chocolate than vanilla and they seemed to think that was good enough. I sent it back and five minutes later a counter person came to the table with cash for a refund and gave a "huh, sorry" shoulder shrug.

My burger came and was as expected but my girlfriends portobello mushroom burger came out and was deep-fried. Nothing on the menu suggested this. So that went back and was substituted for a chicken sandwich. 

The burger was pretty greasy (a pool of grease had formed on the tray by the time I was done) and the substituted chicken sandwich was pretty weak.

The space was nice and so were the staff for the most part. Just seems that they have a lot of learning to do to oil the machine. I'd give them a few months and I might try it again.
author: Brian H.

description:
Pattys are 4oz, so the 8oz burger is 2 patties, not 1.  Unfortunately they are only available well done, so they taste fairly dry (compared to the half pound medium rare patties you find at other local burger joints).  Also the cheese didn't taste like much.  The bun was so so. 

Overall I was a little disappointed given the buzz around this place and the long line.  I think the following spots in the same are have better burgers -

Custom Burger
Mo's
Pearls
Bistro Burger

Even Taylor's/Gotz and Barney's are better in my opinion.
author: John R.

description: Good solid burger, no complaints.  It was well cooked and the fries were good.   They had a combo special for burger, fries and a fountain for $8 and thought it was a good value.
author: John C.

description: This excels at what it sets out to do. The burger is delicious, I crave them. Teh fries were perfectly crispy and I love the dipping sauces. It's pricey, but worth it.
author: jac n.

description: do i dare say it? this place is legend.... wait for it dary!!! legendary!! the burger is so good. i tried a super duper classic wih bacon and some garlic fries and it was the best burgee i had in awhile. we got there where there was no line around 7pm, then got our order in like 10-15 mins. around 7:30 i got packed with a long ass line so i guess i got lucky. the soft serve ice cream looks so good too. worth it and i dont give out perfect scores but damn just damn.
author: Edward G.

description:
Very good food but I had a horrible service experience.  After ordering and paying for a burger and fries, I'm standing with the other folks waiting for the food... and continue to not hear my number.  Then I notice that people who arrived after me were receiving their orders; this is about 10 minutes after I had ordered.  So I ask one of the food runners to check and she tells me that they are too busy and somehow misplaced my order, but within 2 or so minutes, I received my food.  I think they should have offered a comp of some sort, because they misplaced my order.  So I'm very unimpressed with the service, and can't think of a reason to return for awhile, until they can get their service act together.
Incidentally I ordered their "huge" burger, which turned out to be 2 of the normal burgers stacked together.  If I knew it was going to be a double burger, I would have been fine; but I was expecting a single large burger and not 2 burgers combined.
And the 3 sauces served with the garlic fries aren't good, nor are the garlic fries anything special, so next time I'd just order fries, because I like fries with burgers.
Their pickles are good, but not as great as I'd hoped.  They may be homemade but they felt like supermarket Vlassics.  Almost tasteless, and no zing.  Pickles are supposed to have zing.
author: Michael S.

description: I love this place!  I crave burgers from here.  I would drive to SF just for these burgers. They are the good kind of greasy that let's you know they are done right. It's definitely worth the wait. Garlic fries are good here too.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: good stuff. the burger actually has flavor. you'd be surprised at how many burger joints there are that offer a million topping options seeming as though they might to morph into the best burger in life, however once you bite into your burger with bacon, cheese, mushrooms, grilled onions and "special sauce," you're left somehow still feeling underwhelmed. well it's because your burger tastes like nothing. cheese, mushrooms, onions and even bacon can't make cardboard taste good, right? a tasteless patty has the same effect. luckily the meat here is seasoned well and has a high fat content, making it juicy and flavorful. with garlic fries, this meal is one i'll enjoy many more times in my life to come.
author: Regina C.

description:
This is the first Super Duper I've been to in the city.  

It smelled good from the outside and I was pleasantly surprised by the fun and modern atmosphere inside.  

We got there after the major lunch hour crunch but still got stuck in a LONG LINE.  The line actually got in the way of the seating on the main floor by clogging up the flow of people trying to save their table and then run to the counter to pick up their food when their name was called.  It seemed very chaotic.

The cashiers were really friendly, but there were 3 of us and we picked up our food orders in 15 minute increments, so, by the time one of us was done with our meal the last person to get their meal was just starting.  

We all enjoyed our meals, no complaints there, just not too happy about the long wait.
author: Lesley H.

description:
I had heard of this establishment through friends at work who really like it, so went over today and tried it myself today at about 11:30AM.

Outside -- it smells like a burger joint and that was enticing.  Of course this is near 3rd and Market and one might have to step-over a sleeping drunk depending on the time of day...

Inside - nice layout, good seating.

There was a bit of a wait to order although I was at the head of the line -- appeared that they are still training order takers.

The menu is simple and easy to read.
I ordered a cheeseburger (single), fries, and a soda.
With an open kitchen, it was easy to see that they were making things freshly and quickly.  The ground beef definitely looked fresh.

The fries were a bit disappointing -- basic string fries and not a portion that I expected for $2.00.  At least they were warm and crisp.

The burger was great -- a bit pricey at $5.00 ($4.50 for the single burger, .50 for a slice of American cheese).  It was good though.

As with many places now, they overcharge for a soda -- $2 -- but they do use real glasses and I presume it's free refills (although I couldn't get anywhere near the soda machine for a refill -- too crowded).

The jars of pickles are a novelty, and are supposedly "home made".  I tried them and thought they were not only novel but good -- reminiscent of pickles I grew up with made by neighbors.  That said -- if you're only used to Kosher dills or other popular varieties then these might not be to your liking. 

I'd definitely go there again for the burger - maybe not the fries.
Total was $9.70 for lunch for one.
author: D Z.

description: ice cream (dipped, of course) + pickles were divine. the wife asked if I was pregnant
author: ed c.

description:
Not a big meat eater, but I may become one now.    Great taste with a variety of yummy custom add ons...My wife had the portobello burger of which I ate more than she would was willing to share...perfectly breaded and lightly fried.  My friend had the veggie burger said it was the best he ever had.  Fries were great, but I would get them extra crispy next time.  The shakes....mmmmmm, to die for, literally if you have too many of them.
Great, clean atmosphere and very friendly staff.  Waiting in line was worth it.  I will be here as much as my exercising allows me!  Hope they open up in Marin to offer a much better alternative to the to the other less quality "burger" places.
author: Don T.

description: Ate here last week and just the standard two patty burger. It's pretty tasty but pretty greasy which is probably why it tastes so good.  We also got the garlic fries.  They weren't overall powerful which I like, I don't want to feel like I'm eating a clove of garlic.  They also had cheese which I thought balanced it well but my wife didn't like it like I did.  Probably just one of those thing you either like or don't.  Staff was super friendly.  If I'm back in the area I would definitely be back.
author: Mike W.

description:
This place just opened up a few doors down, and it was immediately suggested we try it for lunch here at work.  The first day we tried to call, and they didn't answer the phone, we decided to postpone given the line that was out the door.

The second day they still weren't answering their phone, and we had to call the Castro location to get information regarding their menu.  Waited in line for food for 45 minutes, and two of our four burgers were wrong.  Plus the bacon was iffy, and they were QUITE stingy with the bleu cheese (not even a full dollop).

The burgers that were consumed were more or less flavorless, and the fries were cold and also tasteless.  About the only thing that anyone enjoyed from this restaurant was the milkshake.

Also, they claim that tax is included in the prices shown, but this is also untrue.  I even asked the cashier who confirmed, but the receipt and total revealed the truth.

So in short: ice cream products good, anything else on the menu wasn't worth the wait or the money.
author: Lindsay S.

description: Love this place. Food and drinks were delicious. Nice staff. They have high chairs and lots of paper towels so our 10-month old twins liked it, too.
author: Amy D.

description: By far the best burger I had in San Francisco. You have to get the Garlic fries(don't plan on kissing anyone for awhile). The service was great and ended up going back two more times that week. Don't forget about the ice cream!
author: Conrad J.

description: The portions are not that big, I got the super duper burger, it almost the same size as a double double. The meat is wider and larger, tastes organic, does not have too much toppings, and secret sauce is minimal. For the price portion is not that much, but quality is good. I got the garlic fries which are OK, not too garlicky and has a balance of garlic with cheese, not too overpowering which is good, has more of a subtle flavor. If you do not like it strong, the garlic fries are right or you, and has a nice crispy crunch, might be due to the double frying with two type of oils. The three dipping sauces are pretty good, also not too overpowering, and the house pickles though are surprising hella good. I would've grabbed more if I had known it was so good, before I left. Super delicious, you can like eat it alone. Not incredibly sour, and again overpowering like some pickles are, but has hints of sweetness and incredible juicy fresh flavor.
author: David L.

description: The food here is excellent across the board.  Cheeseburger, veggie burger, and ice cream are all great.  Haven't tried the fries yet.
author: Neil C.

description: It is a very good place to eat with friends but can get packed very quickly depending on the time of day. They have very friendly people taking your orders, which is rare in this city. The only problem I ever had was I received a burger once that was a little too raw for my taste. From then on, I order it well done and so far they seemed to listen. I would say it is worth checking out. Also, make sure you get the garlic fries. It is the best thing I ever tasted.
author: John B.

description:
i'm a fan! i wish there were more fast casual burger places in the city. like 5 guys! i came here with zero expectation and left a happy pappy. the super duper comes with 2 patties (1/2 lb) and the mini comes with a single patty (1/4 lb). cheese, bacon, avocado, and some other more exotic toppings are extra. fries could be be better. burger is a bit on the greezy side.

love the free pickles by the soda machine :)
author: B Y.

description:
expensive-yes!
bad service-yes!
awful taste-yes!

when we walked in around 10.30 pm the place was about to close. So, the cashiers already did some side work and where ready to go home. it took a while to order, cashier and the person who was helping her were just talking-joking about silly stuff. Hello, there is a line of 10 people behind me ready to order!

So, when i approached i said " i guess it takes a while to order" she gave me a dirty look. WWW

Our food was 
1. Oily greasy garlic fries. The smalest portion i've seen
2. Cheese burger with a piece of cold cheese (far from being melted, as it is on the pic)
3. the bun on my burger was just dry, hard and just not fresh.

thanks SuperD, will eat here...never
author: Ind E.

description: Thursday late a.m. I had an eye appointment w/ Lenscrafters and their eye department, and while waiting for things to be taken care of, I elected to stop by there on a recommendation of one of the staff at Lenscrafters. The place was only a block or so away, and was really busy with the "lunch" crowd. I thought for sure it would be a long wait, but was surprised at how efficient and quick everything was. The clerk who rang up the order was very patient and friendly, which added to the experience. I had the small regular cheese burger (w/ monterrey jack, and a few side items on top ala carte) and also ordered the garlic fries. The burger was so juicy and flavourful and I didn't need any condiments, which is amazing! I loved the garlic fries, and they were just the perfect amount, and none were wasted (like usual when ordering fries) and I loved their homemade mayo for dipping the fries in. The only thing that I wasn't crazy about was the "homemade pickles"--waaaay to sour and all's I tasted was vinegar. Other than that, this was a great place to eat for a quick great burger experience.
author: Timothy L.

description: Let me say it out loud....I LOVE SUPER DUPER!!!!!!  Super clean, great burgers (even the veggie burger), killer garlic fries and good beer at really fair prices, especially for San Fran.  I ate here 4 times during the first week of August. Over those four visits I was greeted by really friendly staff and helped through the simple menu, suggesting combos if it would save me money.  My tab for a burger with everything free on it ( lettuce, tomato, red onion and super sauce) plus a fried egg, garlic fries and a beer was about $14. I made the veggie burger a "hypocrite" by adding bacon to it. I'm not vegetarian but this was a pretty good veggie burger, even without the bacon. I loved Super Duper so much I wanted to buy some Super Duper merchandise to take home to my friends in Florida.  When I learned that they had none for sale I threatened to make Super Duper shirts to sell to them. The manager went upstairs and got a shirt for me that is meant for staff.  That was awesome. Super duper, don't change your focus away from a simple menu that is well executed. Better to do a few things really well than a lot of things poorly.  But I think  you could sell t-shirts or hats or some schwag, at least on your web site. Look out Inn-N-Out, there's a new burger chain (5 outlets) with a cult following and they are way better than you.
author: James B.

description: The garlic Parmesan fries are AMAZING and I love that there's a mini burger, which I got with cheese, grilled onions, jalapenos and bacon. Points off for charging for cheese and other toppings (e.g., avocado, bacon). The burger itself is very good, but it was so juicy (some would argue oily) that the bun was too soggy. The cookies and cream milkshake was pretty solid.
author: Caroleen Q.

description: The fries are very good. You might have to wait in line and have trouble finding a place to sit but don't let it stop you from choosing Super Duper.
author: Carey F.

description: this place is delicious, especially the burger with bacon cheese and egg
author: Alberto D.

description: Had the double meat and fries. I was super duper excited to take my first bite of this burger and was rewarded with meaty goodness. As i took a second and third the meat was greasy and the flavor was overwhelmed by it. Overall not bad but, after adding extras this was a 11 dollar burger. I might go again but, if i give 4 starts to in n out then this burger is only worth 2.
author: Ryan k.

description: get the mini burger- its all you need. pile it with homemade pickles and their brown sugar lemonade and your DAY IS MADE. thank jesus they opened SOMA.... oh and wait in the line if you have time- totally worth it!
author: Katie P.

description: The lines were long and it just wasn't worth it.  I ordered the mini burger w/everything including portabello mushroom and garlic fries.  The burger was too greasy for my taste.  The only shining star was the garlic fries which were yummy.  Even though I like the garlic fries it wasn't enough to make me go back for more.  In&Out is better.
author: SF g.

description: I went in there yesterday as I was trying to find a welcoming place to eat in. The atmosphere is pretty casual with trendy music and the workers are fast and awesome. I have to say that it was one of the best customer service I have ever had. The girl at the register was super duper nice and had a lovely smile. I wish I knew her name. I ordered the Super hamburger with cheese and egg and it was very tasty and fresh made right before being served. I wish they had a larger selection of beverages but it is no big deal since there are plenty of liquor store around.
author: Ibrahima Bocar Gabriel M.

description: There was a long wait but I've heard how good this place is forever so I wasn't shocked by that.  The lady came around and gave out fry samples while people waited which was nice.  It was almost 13 bucks for a medium drink, fries and a burger.  That's pretty steep.  The burger tasted good but there was so much oil that my bottom bun basically disintegrated into a nasty, doughy mush.  The fries were crispy which was good.  I think Flames on 2nd street was equally good if not better.  I don't get the obsession with this place. Something about it screems Chipotle...not sure if it's the artwork or what.  It was good not great. I won't go back probably.
author: Sarah B.

description: Pretty good. Good quality meat. Cafeteria style and they were busy, so the tables weren't very clean. Beware... The mini burger is NOT a slider and the larger burger is a double patty, which is not clear on the menu board. The guy who took my order  was a bit snarky, as he twice misunderstood my order and acted as if was my fault. (Then he dropped another customer's tray.)
author: Don m.

description: I've decided the chocolate strawberry shakes are one of the best things on earth. Chocolate ice cream and fresh strawberries. Yum.
author: Hayley S.

description: Loved it.  wish my burger was a little less greasy though.
author: Christin A.

description: Tasty burgers cooked to perfection. Reminds me a lot of Five Guys.
author: Lucas L.

description: Love the 4oz burger...perfect size...need to get more cashiers...staff seems startled.....need real pro's working there...
author: Liz D.

description: Yum! Prices were decent. I ordered the super cheese burger and a super chocolate strawberry shake. The burger was a little on the greasy side. And I wasn't sure what the difference between and a super and mini burger was = two patties vs one. So if you are a light eater get the mini. The fries looked good, but the shake hit the spot. The strawberries were blended really well and I could taste them with every sip. I would go back to this place again.
author: Kristina W.

description: they have super duper breakfast too (bacon egg and cheese for the win)!
author: Vince H.

description: These guys rock! Walked in at ten min after closing and they hooked me up with a monster burger and fries to die for! Love them!
author: S. K.

description: Great quality food, quick/friendly service and a good menu variety for those who don't want to eat just burgers.  The burgers and soft serve are delicious, but the fries are a MUST...
author: J K.

description:
yummy deep fried portobello burger. (but true burger's in oakland is slightly better)
come here with a friend so you can get a nice table and your pickles too

outdoor seating is the sleeper best spot in the house - the heat lamps are HOTT

yo, those lamps were HOT DEGREES. like 98 DEGREES
author: Lizzie O.

description: So I'm from Fresno Ca. and my Fiance is always saying how good super duper burger is compared to my In-N-Out burger. So hey I decided to give it a try. Well burger was pretty good the fries are over priced, but hey its San Francisco what do you expect. All was good up until I noticed this employee behind the counter and she was wiping her face with her hands, grabbing the trash can and moving it around. I figured she would wash her hands, but to my surprise she didn't she continued to make shakes hand out food. I was so disguised. On top of that she continued to scratch her head I mean come on now. So when I asked to speak to the manager to my disbelief the girl that was doing all these things was the MANAGER! I talked to her and informed her about the situation, but to be honest I felt like it went in one ear out the other.  My fiance and myself will never return to this place. I'll stick to my In-N-Out burger. So long Super Duper Burger.
author: Theresa R.

description: bottom line:  decent food, but a bit over-hyped.  i opted against my usual burger and went with the chicken sandwich.  it was a bit overcooked and blackened, but flavor was decent and the aioli was delectable. garlic fries are over-hyped as they're normal fries with some garlic shavings.
author: Aaron T.

description: This place wasn't bad. The prices are good and so is the food. I liked the super sauce but the chipolte sauce tasted a bit funky.
author: Graham K.

description:
So this review is only for their mini burger with cheese and all the regular toppings - no other extras.

For a mini its on the larger size.  For me, its just the right size for when you're sorta hungry but not quite enough for a full meal.  The place smells like garlic fries and its actually a pretty good smell as long as the smell doesnt leave with you - and let me tell you, I wish I had ordered some cuz the burger itself was just alright...  

The cashier who took my order was really nice.  It was my first time here and I got up there and ordered a cheeseburger.  I got asked if i wanted 2 patties and said no, so I guess if you say no you default to a mini (which i was ok with for that particular day but I wish they had a more inbetween size between a gigantor 2 patty thing or a mini...), then she asked if i wanted the regular toppings, i said yes (i liked that they give u a good amount of lettuce, onions, etc) and then she said the meat was done medium-something unless I specified it another way.  i dont do medium- anything for ground meat so I said well done please. so I guess that's the downfall for my dry burger. I'm sure the lean meat is the healthier way to go but I wish I could get a well done burger that isnt quite so... driftwood-like.  The taste of the sauce they used was ok but there wasn't very much in it.  I don't know if I'd go back.  I did appreciate that their menu had organic meat so maybe I will. I dunno.
author: S T.

description: NOT SO SUPER DUPER... Don't expect this downtown SF location at 721 Market  to take a phone order- even at times when any other Super Duper location will eagerly answer their phone and apologize for their slacker co-workers at 721 Market.  Today (a Thursday) around 6pm, super-nice 'Charlie' at the Castro location and equally helpful 'Ali' at the Chestnut location both assumed their downtown counterparts 'must be really busy' if they are not answering their phone.   I tried calling 4 times with no success - and so expected to get to 721 Market and see a big long line. Instead there were only 2 people total in line being helped by 2 cashiers-  at 2 out of 3 cash registers. At 6pm this place was not busy like it can be during downtown lunch hour.  I counted 21 empty tables-for-two and all counter stools empty and counted 6 people waiting for to-go orders- which meant the place was basically half empty=  NOT REALLY BUSY.  Waiting for your to-go order really gives you a chance to see how this place employees two classes of workers: those who hustle- and those who don't.  Two of the 20-something hipster staff up front had time to let their Chrome-bag-clad friends wander behind the counter and celebrate a birthday with them.   But none of the guys in the back doing the actual cooking had time to join in the birthday wishes.   My food was ready fast- which was not a surprise since there were so few customers there - and once you get your order in, the cooks in the back really hustle- even while the kids up front are too busy talking to friends to take a telephone order!
author: Chris R.

description: Very satisfying and tasty burger. All organic, well made, and delicious. So taken aback at how good it was. Juiciest burger I've ever had. Garlic fries were killer too. Nice, clean, modern place. We used urbanspoon maps to find what was close to us, pleasantly surprised!
author: Little Birdie Z.

description: Had I written this review when I first went in, it would be a five stars and they have been declining ever since. Today was the last straw. I order the same thing everytime and today they charged me two dollars more than what it should cost and in the end, I only got 1.50 back. The real problem: Inconsistency and it's all about them, not the customer. Sometimes they charge the right price, sometimes not. Sometimes they get your order right and sometimes not. Sometimes their veggie burgers are good and other times burnt to a crisp and don't even get me started on the fries! But don't complain, geez, they just can't be bothered and when you question them, you instantly become the devil. Their fries used to be good and now are stale and could be the worst ever. Maybe the garlic fries are better but I don't know why a burger joint can't make the same fries over and over again. McDonalds does it. Super Duper has such potential, yet they don't care a bit about the customer or providing a good, quality food experience time and time again. Maybe that's why they offer cheap booze to put in their shakes?? I used to see the same people in there, but they aren't going there anymore either.
author: Rachel M.

description: Love this place! The super sauce is super and there are a lot of options for toppings. Just don't order pickles because they are self serve. Then again, who doesn't like slipping their own pickle(s) in between some soft warm buns already filled with two burger patties?
author: Kristopher A.

description: Love this place! I go here regularly when I'm in the mood for a burger. So far I've tried the Portabello Mushroom Burger (really thick and tasty), Philly Burger (Meat, Peppers, Cheese), Garlic Fries (amazing), Regular fries and Milkshakes which are a MUST! Everything on the menu is fresh and the service has been great. Definitely a place worth checking out when youre in the city.
author: Fat L.

description: their Mini is huge. the burger is juicy. hands down the best tasting burger i have ever had. i only go to super duper for burger now.
author: Chon N.

description: got a mini burger with an egg and cheese. the egg went EVERYWHERE because it was so perfectly cooked, and aside from how incredibly messy it was to eat it, this burger was just amazing. good size, good ingredients, good taste, and the whole time it was dripping with meaty, eggy goodness. went with a vegetarian friend who said her veggie burger was the best thing she's ever had. she wasn't even grossed out watching me eat my burger because she was so focused on how good hers was. garlic fries were good too, love the touch of parmesan. will be back to try the milkshakes
author: Lia A.

description: juicy burgers, veggie burgers, light shakes, good fries at a decent price. what else can one ask for.
author: tureg u.
